item.title: Lead Software Development Engineer Quidsi, Amazon Subsidiary at Amazon (Jersey City, NJ)
item.description:
Quidsi Inc., is a subsidiary of Amazon and entrepreneurial parent company to Diapers.com, Soap.com, BeautyBar.com, Wag.com, Yoyo.com, Look.com, Afterschool.com, Casa.com and Vinemarket.com. We are a mom-centric retail technology company. We deliver delightful experiences, products, and expertise by offering a curated selection of products, lightning-fast delivery, incredible customer service, and an easy-to-navigate shopping experience.



Quidsi’s sites are host to millions of daily visitors and our warehouses are run by hundreds of autonomous Kiva robots. Our entire operation from our websites/apps, to our fulfillment centers and customer care center is focused on creating an enjoyable end-to-end customer experience. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright and driven people who are energized by what if (the meaning of Quidsi in Latin). If you'd like to help us build the place where people can find and buy anything online, come and innovate with us!



We are building a high caliber technology team consisting of the brightest minds who raise the bar and enjoy being vigorously challenged. The ideal candidate is passionate about design and architecture with an unwavering commitment to code quality.



The Senior Software Development Engineer is an idea generator who offers innovative solutions through a combination of creative thinking and deep understanding of the problem space. Projects will leverage Amazon’s technological capabilities and platforms to make Quidsi’s solutions compelling, unique and sustainable.



Responsibilities:

· Propose, prototype and evaluate multiple areas of optimization for our e-commerce applications and mobile-optimized sites

· Build high availability/ high reliability software on time

· Construct secure, scalable, and low-latency services and mobile applications

· Provide hands-on code contribution and shipping responsibility - libraries, API's, documentation

· Partner with Marketing, Merchandising and other business stakeholders to define functional solutions for business problems

· Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related field or corresponding experience equaling 4 year degree

· 5+ years experience in at least one of the following modern programming languages: Java, C#, C++, Python, Ruby, Scala, Groovy or any other modern non-scripting language

· Minimum of 2 years of web applications/services experience



· Building highly-available distributed systems on a cloud infrastructure (e.g. AWS)

· Delivering low-latency, consumer-internet-scale web services

· Experience working with, or an interest in Agile Methodologies, such as Extreme Programming (XP) and Scrum

· Strong OO skills, Computer Science fundamentals in data structures and algorithm design

· Training and mentoring the engineering community on complex technical issues

· Managing expectations, meeting firm deadlines and thriving in a dynamic work environment

· Problem solving and complexity analysis

· Strong verbal and written communication skills

· Maintaining a sense of humor



Quidsi Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer-Affirmative Action Employer Female/Minority/Disability/Vet



.tch1.qds.crp.

item.title: Software Development Manager at Amazon (Jersey City, NJ)
item.description:
Quidsi Inc., is a subsidiary of Amazon and entrepreneurial parent company to Diapers.com, Soap.com, BeautyBar.com, Wag.com, Yoyo.com, Look.com, Afterschool.com, Casa.com and Vinemarket.com. We are a mom-centric retail technology company. We deliver delightful experiences, products, and expertise by offering a curated selection of products, lightning-fast delivery, incredible customer service, and an easy-to-navigate shopping experience.



Quidsi’s sites are host to millions of daily visitors and our warehouses are run by hundreds of autonomous Kiva robots. Our entire operation from our websites/apps, to our fulfillment centers and customer care center is focused on creating an enjoyable end-to-end customer experience. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright and driven people who are energized by what if (the meaning of Quidsi in Latin). If you'd like to help us build the place where people can find and buy anything online, come and innovate with us!



We are seeking a technical lead to manage various projects related to Quidsi's 9 retail ecommerce sites and customer experience. You'll have technical ownership of a functional area and manage a small team of talented engineers. This includes a curated site experience as our products and sites become increasingly diverse, expedited shipping and a team who is empowered. Projects will leverage Amazon’s technological capabilities and platform to make Quidsi’s solutions compelling, unique, and sustainable.



This is truly unique career opportunity for a technology leader who likes to invent as well as dive deep. You'll be the hands-on leader of a team, overseeing a broad range of platform integrations, improvements and customer-facing features. You'll partner with business leadership to initiate and prioritize key projects and work beyond our organization to tap into Operations capabilities. You'll operate at all levels of the technology stack, supporting a broad set of clients and collaborating with a wide range of service providers (internal and external).



Responsibilities:

·Guide web development teams and be responsible for overall systems development life cycle

· Translate of complex functional and technical requirements into detailed project plans and schedules; manage the day-to-day activities of the engineering team by defining, implementing and maintaining a coherent, progressive development strategy for our product line

· Manage process and quality of service improvements, planning, project management of software deliverables within the team, and management of resources across teams

· Work closely with the architects to develop the best technical design and approach for product development

· Maintain current technical knowledge to support rapidly changing technology

· Possess architectural depth to steer teams toward highly performing systems

Communicate with effectively with your team and and with stakeholders at all levels of the company

· Apply analytical and program management skills to make decisions that result in significant business impact

· Create and execute appropriate quality plans, project plans, test strategies and processes for development activities in concert with business and project management effort

· Build an effective development organization by driving the recruiting and hiring of senior level engineers, developing and managing the group, and conducting performance reviews of team members

· Delivery of quality applications on-time and on-budget

· BS in Computer Science or related discipline

· Minimum 5-8 years of software development experience in Java or C++ and object oriented design

· Minimum 3-5 years leading, mentoring, and developing a team of technical talent



Proven results oriented person with a delivery focus and demonstrated ability to achieve stretch goals in a highly innovative and fast paced environment

· Demonstrated ability to make data-driven decisions and manage complex initiatives from conception to launch

· Experience building and operating highly available, highly scalable, high-volume systems

· Working experience with UNIX/Linux and service oriented architectures

· Experience leading remote development teams

· Excellent verbal and written communication skills

· Ability to work well with people and be both highly motivated and motivating

· Strong analytical skills with excellent problem solving abilities

· Strong technical vision



Quidsi Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer-Affirmative Action Employer Female/Minority/Disability/Vet

.tch1.qds.crp.

item.title: (Big) Data Engineer at KPN (The Hague, Netherlands)
item.description:
(Big) Data Engineer

Are you triggered by the idea of working in a dream team with other data engineers, scientists and architects delivering gamechanging (big) data & analytical solutions in a company which will ask and support you to perform and deliver impact beyond your expectations? Then we encourage you to read further.

Your job as a Data Engineer?
We are looking for an enthusiastic and creative data engineer who will help create a new chapter of Data Engineering within KPN. Together with your team, consisting of complementary skill sets across data science and engineering, you will have the opportunity to work on diverse and high impact business cases across KPN.

KPN is a data driven Telco organisation and has the ambition to lead in analytics. It is one of the most important subjects structurally discussed at Board level. KPN won this year's award for best Big Data vision at the global Information Technology conference in Las Vegas. The foundations have been laid to actively apply big data solutions to the enormous amount of rich data utilizing the tools and applications available today and exploring those of tomorrow. KPN has very highstandards with regards to privacy and security for our data and our customers. You will leverage these policies to safeguards the privacy.

As an experienced Data Engineer you will be responsible for:



  • Establishing a chapter of Data Engineering within KPN

  • ETL for analytics on Hadoop and Teradata Data Warehouse

  • Data handling and discovery for (big) data

  • Creation of analytical records to improve impact of our data scientist

  • Leverage and implement privacy and security policies

  • Create and maintain complex models

  • Give direction to the roadmap data based on value

item.title: Senior Software Engineer/Data Scientist at HERE, a Nokia company (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
About the Team


We are looking for a Software Engineer for our agile research and development team. The team is primary researching new ways to leverage insights from our location-aware big data assets into cutting edge enhancements of our existing products. The position is located in our Berlin office.


The tasks of the developer will include the following

  • Data mining, modeling, and research of big-data and map-data assets

  • Development of big-data and map-data driven prototypes and components of new and augmented products

item.title: Senior/Principal Software Data Engineer at Rally Health (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Be part of a fast growing company whose primary focus is to improve and advance health and health care using modern data technologies and end-user engagement.  Rally Health is a private company of 250 employees with a major financial backing from UnitedHealth Group (with the market cap of $112B and the net income of $10B).  We have partnered with several insurance companies including UHG and other large corporations for user acquisition, clinical data feeds, and monetization.   


In this role you will be enabling analytics, data science, and business intelligence by creating infrastructure and building data services around health risks, clinical and lifestyle recommendations, and population health management and reporting.


Our technologies:  Scala, Play, Hadoop (CDH), Kafka, Spark and Spark Streaming, MongoDB


Responsibilities:



  • Create and enhance data services including recommendations, health risks, and A/B testing

  • Maintain, enhance, and optimize the data pipeline

  • Instrument new data sources

  • Support reporting and business intelligence

item.title: Watson Data Scientist at AlchemyAPI, an IBM Watson Company (Denver, CO)
item.description:
Is every decision you make data-driven? Are you fueled -- not frightened -- by the advent of how data-laden our world has become? If you're turned on by the idea of harnessing some incredibly rich data assets fueled by AI enrichments, you should consider data science at IBM Watson with AlchemyAPI. We are sifting through some of the world's most interesting and diverse unstructured data sources, trying to tease out insights and trends in a meaningful way for a large cross section of our client base. If you have played with our AlchemyData News API and felt a creative spark around ways to exploit it, then we want to talk to you.


Statistics, machine learning, and data mining at scale are our bread and butter. Come help us figure out what the right questions are to ask -- and help us find the answers!

item.title: Data Engineer at Qadium (San Francisco, CA)
item.description: As a Qadium Data Engineer, you will be responsible for building data processing systems to extract meaning from the global network and machine data we collect. The software you build will scalably, quickly, and reliably extract information, then store it in ways that allow us to explore, enrich, and gain new insights from the data you've processed.  We are looking for independent, imaginative thinkers who can design scalable, reliable solutions to complex problems.

item.title: Software Developer at Caerus Associates (Arlington, VA)
item.description:
Caerus Associates is seeking a software developer to help design, build, test, implement, and monitor real-time data processing pipelines at USG customer sites. You will work with other developers as well as data scientists to scale and refine developed algorithms/data processing methods for speed and accuracy on large amounts of streaming data. Candidates should be able to work effectively independently, in distributed teams, and engage with clients. Our architecture is built around MongoDB, RabbitMQ, Redis, and Spark, with most of our code written in Python.


Qualified candidates must possess an active TS/SCI.


Must be a U.S. citizen.


Illustrative responsibilities



  • Deploy software solutions to end-users

  • Integrate real-time data feeds into processing pipelines

  • Rapid prototyping of user-facing applications

  • Assess and make/implement recommendations to improve existing architecture

  • Provide excellent customer service and client satisfaction

  • Interface directly with clients and coordinate work across company team, including documenting team progress and identifying risks/obstacles

  • Complete other tasks as assigned


Salary Range


$95,000 to $130,000, dependent upon experience

item.title: Data DevOps Engineer at Rally Health (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Be part of a fast growing company whose primary focus is to improve and advance health and health care using modern data technologies and end-user engagement.  Rally Health is a private company of 270 employees with a major financial backing from UnitedHealth Group (with the market cap of $112B and the net income of $10B).  We have partnered with several insurance companies including UHG and other large corporations for user acquisition, clinical data feeds, and monetization.   


In this role you will be enabling analytics, data science, and business intelligence by deploying and maintaining infrastructure and data services around health risks, clinical and lifestyle recommendations, and population health management and reporting.


Our technologies:  AWS, Scala, Play, Hadoop (CDH), Kafka, Spark and Spark Streaming, MongoDB, Vagrant, Jenkins, Chef

item.title: Java Developer at Gap Inc. (Erlanger, KY)
item.description:
Position Statement:  Provides the technical delivery role in the Application Delivery lifecycle from inception and solution delivery to production to production support, maintenance, and enhancement. The Software Engineer analyzes project requirements and solution design to assure that Material Handling systems are functionally appropriate, technically sound and well integrated in accordance with business user requirements, methods and standards throughout the project life cycle.



Responsibilities: 



  • Ability to design and review software for large complexity business problems or      interconnected medium complexity business problems within a project framework.

  • Ability to develop software for large complexity business problems within and across projects or within one or more systems. Lead external MHE providers in defining technical specifications and development efforts as  appropriate. Able to advise others on development of features or components.

  • Conducts development & design reviews.

  • Works with project teams, Operations, and Support teams to assure timely resolution to defects identified during the software development lifecycle.

  • Collaborates and partners with architects in recommending emerging technologies and      application solutions.

  • Able to apply best practices in the Material Handling Engineering field and have the ability to train others on these practices and standards.

  • Serves as application expert (SME) for Material Handling systems, and when defining options/alternative for proposals to meet new IT enabling opportunities.

  • Integrating Material Handling solutions in multi-channel fulfillment environments.

item.title: Global Head of Business Intelligence (m/f) - Munich, Germany at Westwing Home & Living (München, Deutschland)
item.description:
Westwing is one of the world’s fastest growing eCommerce companies: Backed by well-known investors with over EUR 179 mn. in funding, we are the leading Home & Living eCommerce company in the 15 countries we serve. Every day, we inspire more than 19 mn. members with stylish furniture and accessories from well-known brands they love. In 2014, we surpassed EUR 183 mn. in annual sales and continue to grow rapidly.


Our international team is the secret to our success. Westwing balances style expertise and creativity with a deeply data-driven business and tech mindset. We are proud to be working with inspiring colleagues who are smart, fun, ambitious and looking for the challenge to transform an industry.


To pursue our ambitious growth strategy, we are looking for a Global Head of Business Intelligence (m/f). In this position, you and your team are collecting, transforming, and analyzing data to drive business decisions across the company.


Your responsibilities will be:



  • Enabling Westwing to become the globally leading Home & Living eCommerce player by delivering the key business insights and driving strategic decisions

  • Building, integrating, and harvesting ‘Big Data’ for our company, thus enabling data-driven decisions across all aspects of our business

  • Working with leading-edge technologies and methodologies to unlock the power of our data on topics like personalization, recommendation engines, and many more

  • Being part of our global executive team, working together with leaders and teams across countries and functions

  • Leading (and growing) a world-class team reporting directly to the CMO

item.title: Software Development Engineer in Test, Data and Analytics at JW Player (New York, NY)
item.description:
Over half a billion videos are watched on a JW Player ever day.  The Data Team at JW Player is responsible for processing all of this data and making it available as meaningful metrics.  


We are looking for an experienced Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET) to join our rapidly growing Data team in our New York City headquarters. The right candidate will relish the opportunity to work with a small focused team to help implement new test processes, automation frameworks, set load/performance benchmarks, and put us on the path to a continuous integration environment.


In this role, you will:



  • Work closely with the Data Product and Engineering teams to define acceptance criteria and build detailed test plans

  • Work towards a goal of designing and implementing complete end-to-end testing of our big data systems including our RESTful Python API

  • Collaborate with the data team to understand how development changes affect ongoing automation efforts

  • Continuously look for areas to introduce and improve automated testing

  • Develop and maintain load and performance test frameworks for massive big data applications

  • Work as part of the data team using agile methodologies to help deliver quality product on schedule.

item.title: Software Engineer / UI Developer at TGS Management Company (Irvine, CA)
item.description:
We're searching for a talented programmer with a particular interest in writing software, creating and maintaining user interfaces, and interacting with data. The ability to write production ready code is an important part of the equation, but to be successful in an environment as complex as ours, you'll also have to demonstrate an ability to solve novel problems and learn new things at speed. 


You'll find this opportunity particularly appealing if you enjoy working with smart people in a collaborative environment, have general expertise in software / UI development, and are willing to dive into any kind of programming challenge. Possible areas of focus are likely to include:



  • Design, development, and maintenance of monitoring tools, including user interfaces, to analyze data from all aspects of our existing system(s).

  • Development and maintenance of complex software and systems, including identification of bottlenecks and optimization of performance.

  • Parsing, processing, and analyzing large financial data sets, including writing complex queries.

  • Building, adapting, and maintaining user-friendly interfaces.

item.title: Data Engineer at Namely (New York, NY)
item.description: Are you obsessed with data, tools and metrics? Have you used and can you build tools to perform data extraction, transformation and loading (ETL)? Are you interested in tools that gather, store, and analyze User Metrics and Product usage? Do you love Python? We are looking for a skilled Data Engineer to contribute ideas, innovation, solutions and code to our product.

item.title: Data Scientist (Palo Alto OR Seattle) at Coupang (Palo Alto, CA)
item.description:
Coupang - Data Scientist - Palo Alto or Seattle



What if you could set the standard of how e-commerce can and should be done around the world?



Now you can at Coupang!



We are Korea’s largest online retailer and our goal is to create the next-generation e-commerce model. According to Nikesh Arora, we are “one of the fastest-growing and most disruptive Internet companies in the world.” In just 4 years, we already have over 25M devoted users and over $2.5B in annual revenue. And we are just getting started!



We just closed a whopping $1 BILLION round of funding, and we are about to undergo hypergrowth! We have offices in Seoul, Shanghai, Palo Alto, Seattle, and Ontario, CA. We are looking to double our amazing team in the U.S.!



If you want to work in a fun, challenging environment while changing how the world thinks about e-commerce, then we want to hear from you!



About the role:



You’ll get to work with the best in the industry, with many of our team members coming from Amazon, eBay, PayPal, Facebookand more! You’ll work in a collaborative and open environment where we consider ourselves a family (Check out our Family Day!). And our agile environment will enable you to rapidly innovate with the most cutting edge technologies.



What you’ll do:


You’ll be faced with unique challenges to scale we aim to grow to more than 55M+ users in Korea alone. You’ll also get to push the envelope of what’s possible with mobile commerce (currently over 75% of our sales are done on mobile)!



Some specific things you’ll work on:



  • Build cutting-edge machine learning models to proactively provide strategic recommendations to business partners that can drive effective impact

  • Conduct in-depth data analyses to drive and deliver insights to help business partners make strategic decision

  • Partner with different functional teams, leveraging various tools to automate models and reports

  • Cares deeply about data quality and demonstrates this commitment by attention to quality of data and code generated

item.title: Senior Security Engineer at Clover Health (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
We are looking for a Senior Security Engineer to join our team. You'll be part of a team building applications and services to support our medical team, with opportunities to touch a wide range of technology. Securing our member data and exceeding industry compliance standards is a high priority, and we’re looking to add a security focus to our engineering team. You’ll work with the rest of the engineering team to establish security policies and best practices for our systems. We value moving fast, but we do so with a pragmatic approach that will allow us to sustain velocity over time.


Healthcare experience not required.

item.title: Sr. Software Engineer, Data at HookLogic, Inc. (New York, NY)
item.description:
HookLogic Engineers develop proprietary software platforms used by the world’s largest e-commerce retailers. Our engineering team consists of talented, team-oriented individuals who are empowered to take advantage of the latest cloud and distributed technologies to deliver reliable, high-throughput applications. Our core languages are Java and C# and we commonly utilize technologies and platforms such as RESTful services, jQuery, SQL Server, Hadoop, Hive, HBase, Storm, Spark, and AWS Services such as Kinesis, DynamoDB, Redshift, Lamda, and SQS. 


As a Data Engineer, you’ll employ your skills on a daily basis to design and build data processing and storage applications to handle millions of transactions per day. You will analyze business requirements and consult with the broader team to ensure successful processing, storage and reporting of our Big Data. You’ll have a wide variety of languages and technologies at your disposal that you can use to solve problems. Your work will directly shape and create our data architecture to ultimately deliver systems that stand up to unpredictable environments at massive scale.

item.title: Software Engineer - Intermediate Level at M3D LLC (Fulton, MD)
item.description:
Job Description





Here at M3D we value the creativity of our employees and promote free-thinking. We provide our programmers with flexible schedules, and have a large diversity of projects. 



Active Projects:



  • Graphics programing (User interface)

  • Data Processing

  • Control Systems

  • Production automation support software

item.title: Product Marketing Manager - Platform at New Relic (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
New Relic  



Product Marketing Manager - Platform



San Francisco, CA or Portland, OR  


Want to join a fast-paced, rapidly growing SaaS company that’s disrupting a multi-billion dollar industry? That’s what we’re doing here each day at New Relic. We are the leading software analytics company, delivering out of this world experiences to our customers through our SaaS-delivered Software Analytics Platform.


We thrive on providing products that help software developers, IT Operations, DevOps teams, and application owners drive better software application performance, customer experience and business outcomes.


We are looking for a world class Product Marketing Manager to join our Product Marketing team, leading outbound product marketing activities specifically for our multitenant SaaS platform - Insights, that underpins all our products. Insights includes a highly scalable cloud database, alerting, dashboards, and API gateways, all built on an supercluster capable of ingesting billions of events and querying trillions of events in less than a second. It’s an amazing set of technologies that needs a product marketer to crystallize its positioning and drive its market awareness.


In this role you will own product & competitive positioning, sales enablement, customer development, market analysis, product launches, and more for our New Relic Software Analytics Platform.  


The ideal candidate will have significant experience as a product marketing, product management, sales engineering, customer support and/or training professional at a software analytics, business intelligence, or monitoring company targeting technical and business buyers.  


Key Responsibilities



  • Develop positioning and messaging that resonates with our Software Analytics Platform’s audience: IT Operations, developers, security teams, and product owners

  • Enable the sales force by developing collateral and providing training

  • Develop marketing collateral: datasheets, eBooks, whitepapers, customer success stories, presentations, etc.

  • Perform market and competitive research and analysis

  • Plan and manage product launch activities

  • Work with product management and engineering to define product roadmap

  • Present at tradeshows and conferences


Requirements 



  • 6+ years working in product marketing, product management, sales engineering, customer support and/or training professional at cloud, Big Data, software monitoring and/or security companies

  • Experience positioning technical products to both technical and business buyers

  • Demonstrated ability to distill simple positioning from complex products

  • Technical depth and curiosity balanced with a strong business acumen

  • Familiarity with the Big Data, cloud and security infrastructure market landscapes, including Hadoop, databases, identity management, firewalls, cryptographic software and cloud infrastructure

  • Experience working effectively across marketing and sales organizations

  • Excellent oral and written communication skills


A little about us:


New Relic is a software analytics company that, on behalf of our customers, makes sense of billions of metrics about millions of applications, all in real time. Our comprehensive SaaS-based solution for web and mobile applications consolidates the performance monitoring data into a single, powerful interface. Our customers use New Relic every day to optimize millions of applications.


New Relic is a San Francisco Best Places to Work award winner, an Oregon “Top Workplace” award winner, named a leader in the Gartner’s 2013 & 2014 “Magic Quadrant” for APM companies, a Top 100 OnDemand Company, Best of SaaS (THINKStrategies), Top 100 Coolest Cloud Computing (CRN); 10 Cloud Management Companies to Watch (NetworkWorld) – the list of accolades goes on. More important than all of that: we provide challenging work, opportunities to learn, high quality teammates, a standard-setting product, and a company on the move.


Our office is in the tech-rich urban center of San Francisco, with easy commute access and a plethora of good eats. We provide competitive compensation, equity and big-company benefits (medical, dental, etc) -- all while maintaining the energy, agility, and fun of a start-up. We can help with relocation and are open to H1-B transfers.


New Relic is most decidedly an equal opportunity employer. We eagerly seek applicants of diverse background and hire without regard to race, color, gender, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, individuals with disabilities, age, sexual orientation, protected veterans, or any other characteristic protected by law. Note: Our stewardship of the data of many thousands of customers means that a criminal background check is required to join New Relic.  We will, nonetheless, consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records in accord with applicable law, including the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.


To get started, click on the link below. To fast track your application, let us know in your cover letter why this job, product, and/or company is of particular interest to you. We look forward to talking!



#LI-CV1


Apply Here


PI91802474

item.title: Data Engineer at Earnest Research (New York, NY)
item.description:
Passion for data: Data is what drives this group. Our Data Science team works very closely with various data sources. The ideal candidate should have a passion to mine data and derive insights. This position requires a highly motivated problem solver with strong analytical ability and attention to detail to enable the data analysts and data scientists.


Responsibilities


• Analyzing data to identify gaps and inconsistencies in data
• Perform extraction and transformation of unstructured data from various data sources
• Improving our platform with additional innovations and algorithms
• Working with the Data Analysis team to generate reports and analysis
• Ensuring data consistency and integrity within the data warehouse
• Exploring new opportunities to leverage new and existing data sets
• Providing support to our existing processes and tools
• Researching and assesses the viability of new processing and data storage technologies

item.title: Big Data Engineer at Hearst Corporation (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Data Services group is a team within the Hearst Corporate Technology organization tasked with developing Hearst’s enterprise­wide data pipeline and promoting next-level business decisions utilizing that Big Data. This involves establishing a company-­wide data resource by collecting Hearst’s diverse data resources at an audience level and making it available to product and business intelligence teams. 

As Big Data Engineer, you will be responsible for building and maintaining our Big Data initiatives for Hearst Data Warehouse platform. The ideal candidate is someone with a mix of Dev-Ops and Big Data skillsets, who offers innovative solutions through a combination of creative thinking and deep understanding of the problem space. He or she will help define and implement new processes on the Hearst Data Warehouse platform and work closely with Data Scientists to transform Big Data into model-­ready forms to support analytic projects. 


Key Responsibilities: 



  • Develop technology platform on AWS cloud that will support Big Data processing and analytics behind Hearst Data Warehouse platform 

  • Create data transformation processes and jobs for Hearst Data Warehouse platform, using most suitable applications and tools on top of Apache Hadoop 

  • Identify, analyze and resolve technical problems with Hearst Data Warehouse platform and related ecosystem 

  • Manage Big Data infrastructure for Hearst Data Warehouse production and development environments 

  • Experiment with emerging technologies related to Big Data initiatives for Hearst Data Warehouse platform 

  • Work closely with Data Engineering and Data Visualization teams to implement technical needs and expectations 

  • Schedule and coordinate monitor progress and completion of all jobs and take corrective action as needed

item.title: Data Engineer at Komodo Health (New York, NY)
item.description:
Komodo Health is focused on building a leading platform for expertly curated big data and analytics in healthcare and life sciences. Our cloud-based data integration platform brings together disparate data from all over the Healthcare and Life Sciences industry, the public domain, and proprietary sources. Through our real-time analytical applications, Komodo Health helps enterprise customers make better decisions that improve patient outcomes. We value our culture of encouraging growth, collaboration, and constructive debate as well as delivering innovative solutions that wow our customers.

We are looking for a Data Engineer to help build out our data infrastructure using the best tools available so that data can truly flow through scalability, reliability and automatically.

This is an opportunity to join a growing team of folks accomplished in diverse Machine Intelligence and Data Engineering disciplines; focused on using the best of what lies at the forefront of technology and data science to address answer complex, real-world problems in the Healthcare and Life Science space. Some of the tools we use are: AWS, Spark, Scala, Python, Postgres, Git, Airflow and Docker.

Responsibilities


  • Build out a large scale distributed data infrastructure using the latest technologies

  • Create pipelines that collect, connect, centralize, and curate data from various internal and external data sources

  • Implement tools that help extract, analyze, and visualize data faster

  • Develop tools to monitor, debug and analyze data pipelines

  • Evaluate new technologies for continuous improvements in Data Engineering

  • Produce high quality production ready code in an agile environment

  • Collaborate closely with the product team to build new features and infrastructure

  • Work with the data scientists to implement forecasting and prediction algorithms and models in the data infrastructure


Benefits



  • Competitive salary and equity compensation

  • Full Medical, Dental, and Vision benefits

  • 401k plan with employer match

  • Your choice of equipment set-up (computer, monitor, and accessories)

  • Flexible hours and unlimited vacation days policy

  • Opportunities to attend industry conferences and events

  • Awesome team and culture

  • Great office location(s) in SF/SOMA and NY/West SoHo

  • and more...

item.title: Data Analytics Engineer at Sharethrough (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Sharethrough is looking for engineers interested in building data products and infrastructure to power our business and provide insight to our customers.  You'll be taking the lead on the design and implementation of a data warehousing infrastructure used by our product, engineering and operational teams.


What You'll Be Doing:



  • Greenfield architecture and construction of a modern data warehouse

  • Working with new technologies such as Apache Spark and Amazon Redshift

  • Deriving insight from large quantities of data, starting with our 500GB/day performance pipeline

  • Collaborating with data science and business intelligence teams on visualization and data wrangling platforms such as Looker


Let’s talk if...



  • You’ve got experience with SQL, ETL, python/shell scripting, and MPP Data Warehousing

  • You’ve worked on or are interested in data integrity governance and semantic layer design

  • You possess an intense curiosity about data and a strong commitment to practical problem solving

item.title: Data Scientist at Spatially (Seattle, WA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Description & Responsibilities




  • Work with a motivated team in an innovative Spatial Analytics startup to build data Science, Analytics, and Machine Learning practice

  • You will advocate, evangelize and build data-fuelled products that help our customers gain true scientifically driven insights.

  • You’ll dig in and become an expert on our datasets.

  • You will provide insight into leading analytic practices, design and lead iterative learning and development cycles, and ultimately produce new and creative analytic solutions that will become part of our core deliverables.

  • You will work with cross-functional team members to identify and prioritize actionable, high-impact insights across a variety of core business areas.

  • You will lead applied analytics and science initiatives that are leveraged across the breadth of our solutions.. You will research, design, implement and validate cutting-edge algorithms to analyze diverse sources of data to achieve targeted outcomes.

  • As our data scientist, you will provide expertise on science & mathematical concepts for the broader applied analytics team and inspire the adoption of advanced analytics and data science across the entire breadth of our organization.



Qualifications




  • Masters or PhD in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Data Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics or related field.

  • 4+ years relevant experience with a proven track record of leveraging analytics and large amounts of data to drive significant business impact.

  • Expertise in machine learning, predictive analytics, statistical modeling, and data algorithms. Must have knowledge/experience in methodologies and algorithms including: Multivariate Regression, Logistic Regression, Support Vector Machines, Bagging, Boosting, Decision Trees, Lifetime Analysis, Clustering, Mathematical Optimization, Random Forest/Ensemble Learning, Deep Learning Algorithms and Stochastic Processes.

  • Strong algorithmic thinking and independent research ability.

  • Passion for learning and innovating new methodologies at the intersection of applied math/statistics/computer science.

  • Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills, including the ability to describe the logic and implications of a complex model to all types of business partners.

  • High-energy self-starter with a passion for your work, attention to detail, and a positive attitude.

  • Proficiency in at least one statistical analysis tool such as R, SAS, and/or Weka.

  • Strong SQL and deep understanding of Data-at-rest and data-at-transit & other lifecycle points of data

  • Experience with distributed computing, databases and query languages like Hadoop/YARN, Spark, Cassandra/NoSql Databases, Graph Databases, Hive/Pig and/or general map reduce computing.

  • Experience with RDBMS systems such-as Sql Server, Oracle, Postgres, MySql

  • Knowledge of common data structures and ability to write efficient code in at least one language is a plus (preferably Java, Scala, GO, Python).

  • Experience in Financial, Retail, Spatial Analytics, Mapping, Location Based Services & GIS and like data and/or industries a Strong Plus

item.title: Data Warehouse Engineer at Supplyframe (Pasadena, CA)
item.description:
At Suppyframe, our mission is to deliver the best information, tool, and technology to electronic industry professionals. Through our network of products, we help passionate engineer research, locate, and innovate products while share their creations with other like-minded engineers around the world.



The data warehouse engineer position supports every business line and functional organization within the company. As we expand our capabilities in the areas of data mining, machine learning, and Big Data analysis, this position will be key to help deliver value to our customers. The data warehouse engineer will have the opportunity to access data from both traditional (RDBMS) and non-traditional (Hadoop, steaming) sources while chartering a path to develop and integrate additional big data concepts. This position offers the opportunity to tackle complex problems while delivering real-world solutions.

item.title: Sr Big Data Engineer at CARD.com (Santa Monica, CA)
item.description:
Data and scientific insights are the basis of growth at CARD.com. To investing further in this core value, our Growth & Data Science team seeks an Experienced Data Engineer who can build and manage our data operations. These operations include developing measurement strategies, architecting our data warehouse, managing & implementing ETL pipelines, and finally building & deploying scalable analytics and machine learning services.


In this role you're expected to:



  • Be the authoritative source of the location and integrity of all the company’s data

  • Architect a fast-growing hybrid data warehouse with relational and distributed data

  • Develop, maintain and optimize ETL processes directly with our data partners

  • Implement cutting-edge data streaming technologies for real-time analytics

  • Provide query performance benchmark and optimization support to the product and technology teams

  • Develop measurement strategy and schema for new product features

  • Create new metrics and metadata to understand customer pain points and improve user experience

  • Maintain documentation, deployment scripts and flow diagrams for all data services in production

  • Assist team members in exploratory data analyses and machine learning

  • Be an integral part of a cross-functional team that includes Data Scientists (PhDs), Web Developers, Engineers and Digital Marketers

item.title: Quality Data Analyst at Wisconsin Hospital Association (Fitchburg, WI)
item.description: This position performs analysis of clinical, quality process and outcome measures associated with healthcare improvement projects.  Works with project staff to design and execute databases to maximize functionality and access to data and reports.  Work with Chief Quality Officer and Quality staff to develop various ad hoc reports.  Assist WHA members with understanding their data.  Develop processes to ensure the integrity of data and accuracy of reports.

item.title: Senior Data Engineer at Spatially (Seattle, WA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Description



  • Work with Product, Engineering, & Data Scientists to build & manage Data systems used across product & research portfolio

  • Own and manage data systems across multiple projects & platforms

  • Design, Build, and manage multiple Data pipelines and ETLs dealing with various forms of data

  • Work with engineering to build Data services, Sets, and streams

  • Design, manage, and enforce Data security & standards across all teams

  • Experience in Fast Paced Startup environments

  • Positive Attitude with proven delivery experience

  • BS computer science/related subject matter or equivalent experience

  • 6+ years experience with RDBMS systems such-as Sql Server, Oracle, Mysql, Postgres

  • 6+ Years experience with SQL development experiences with solid T-SQL/SQL skills and proven SQL optimization skills.

  • Ability to manage, monitor, and troubleshoot production level cloud/on-premise/hybrid deployments of Sql and/or nosql systems

  • Experience with both OLAP & OLTP workloads

  • Experience with designing and implementing ETL workflows

  • Strong passion to learn new technologies & methodologies

  • Experience with NoSql/Big Data Technologies and Querying methods including Hadoop/Mapreduce systems, Apache Stack, Column Family, Key-Value, Document, and Graph data systems

  • Knowledge in One or More languages such-as Java, C#, Scala, GO, Python, Javascript

This position will be filled in either Seattle, WA or Miami, FL.

item.title: Data & Reporting Analyst for Non-Profit - Raise the bar of Afterschool Programs at Boys & Girls Harbor (New York, NY)
item.description:
Interested in making a measurable difference in the lives of children?  Join the Boys & Girls Harbor team on its mission to empower children and their families to become full, productive participants in society through education, cultural enrichment, and social services.  Boys and Girls Harbor is a leader in arts-infused education offering programming in early education, afterschool programming and performing arts.


We are seeking a dynamic Data & Reporting Analyst to deliver data driven insights to enhance the quality of our programs and services.  In this role you will serve as a data analytics and business intelligence expert by deploying and maintaining infrastructure and data services around educational program recommendations and reporting. 


What You Will Do



  • Define and implement a new data strategy, data store, and tools to collect data for ongoing analysis

  • Interface with business users and technical teams to bridge the gap in terms of data needs and business logic understanding 

  • Develop internal and external business metrics and reports

  • Develop dashboards, visualizations and manage data requests related to key performance goals

  • Explore data and provide insights, working closely with program teams to identify opportunities to optimize revenue and growth potential

  • Be the champion for sharing data across the organization and actively present findings

item.title: Senior Software Engineer (any OOD) - Major Google Backed Venture at Flatiron (via Andiamo) (New York, NY)
item.description:
After witnessing several family members and friends battle cancer, Flatiron Health was founded in 2012 by Nat Turner and Zach Weinberg. Headquartered in New York City, our company is building a disruptive software platform that connects cancer centers across the country to help change the face of cancer.


In 2014, we raised $130MM in series B funding from Google Ventures, the second largest investment ever from Google Ventures, behind Uber.  


Our mission is to organize the world’s oncology information and make it useful for patients, physicians, life sciences and researchers. Our team is building a disruptive, oncology-specific software platform that will connect cancer centers across the country on a common technology infrastructure and address key healthcare challenges. Today, our proprietary cloud platform includes the industry-leading electronic medical record for oncology, a first-of-its-kind analytics tool, patient portal, and integrated billing management. Ultimately, our goal is to help cancer centers leverage real-world oncology data, at a scale and clinical depth never before seen, to transform how cancer care is delivered.


Our engineering team


Our engineering team builds and runs data processing pipelines, algorithmic and human-operated data curation tools, and customer-facing data analytics and visualization products. We build systems that clean, structure and understand clinical-level patient data as we build the largest, most comprehensive set of oncology data intelligence. We scale pipelines to handle the world's oncology data with creative engineering solutions to open-ended oncology data problems.


Our data


Our data pipeline takes in full clinical patient records and produces normalized, high-fidelity, queryable data that is ready to be mined for medical and operational insights. We’ve built a unified data set that is unparalleled in its depth and accuracy, and which gives our partners the capability to ask questions about data that weren't answerable until now.


Our culture


We work in a fast-paced, high-information-volume environment with complex domain challenges, which means context is key and there's always more to learn and soak up. We want to know oncology data cold — better than anyone else in the industry — and we believe doing so requires building a culture where we all like coming to work each day. In our culture, decisions are transparent and data-driven, and people are empowered to make waves.


Backend Software Engineer


Are you interested in building elegant and scalable systems to help our customers unleash the power of their data?


As a Backend Software Engineer you will:



  • Design and implement backend components: services, data stores, infrastructure, instrumentation, and deployment

  • Continuously ship new features for our cloud based infrastructure

  • Write simple, elegant, testable code

  • Drive improvements to our backend infrastructures


About you:



  • You hold a BS, MS, or PhD in computer science or related field

  • You have strong backend experience with languages like Python, C++ or Java

  • You have a good understanding of online relational databases like Postgresql, MySQL or MSSQL.

  • You are passionate about performance, reliability, and scalability of systems


Full Stack Software Engineer


Are you interested in using modern web technologies to help our customers unleash the power of their data?


As a Full Stack Software Engineer you will:



  • Design and implement intuitive web interfaces to make complex data accessible and useful

  • Continuously ship new features for our cloud applications, from the backend to the frontend

  • Write simple, elegant, testable code

  • Drive improvements to our backend and frontend infrastructure


About you:



  • You hold a BS or MS in computer science or related field

  • You have strong frontend web experience with JS, HTML, and CSS

  • You have strong backend experience with languages like Python, Ruby or Java, and SQL databases

  • You are passionate about empowering users and our mission to improve healthcare through technology


Bonus points if you…



  • Contribute to open source projects

  • Have developed apps using modern frontend frameworks like AngularJS / Ember.js

  • Have experience in user experience design or user experience research


Data Software Engineer


Do you want to synthesize data into knowledge?


As a Data Software Engineer you will:



  • Write useful and impactful software

  • Design and build our data infrastructure, and use it to develop extensible, robust data pipelines

  • Build tools and infrastructure for easy, accessible and flexible data analysis

  • Iteratively develop, operationalize and monitor machine-assisted and statistical solutions to problems


About you:



  • You hold a BS, MS, or PhD in computer science or engineering

  • You write clean, well-structured, production-quality code in Python, C++ or Java

  • You have built and deployed large-scale data processing pipelines

  • You seek simple approaches to complex problems

  • You are passionate about our mission to improve healthcare through technology


Bonus points if you…



  • Have a strong understanding of statistics

  • Have developed distributed data processing systems against large, heterogeneous data sets

  • Understand experimental design, and can build for collection, measurement and interpretation of results

item.title: Software Developers for Back- & Frontend at Maritime Data Systems GmbH (Hamburg, Deutschland)
item.description:
We are looking for young, highly motivated, smart developers from different parts of the world to join our team in Hamburg / Germany. You can join us,even if you have just finished university or if you want to do an internship or your master thesis in our company.



At the moment we offering several positions for Backoffice and Frontend developers.


  • Java Backend Developer


  • JS-Angular or Bootstrap Frontend Developer


  • Internship (Software Developer)
