item.title: Senior Software Engineer at DataRobot (Boston, MA)
item.description:
As a Senior Software Engineer, you will provide engineering support to customer-facing data science activities.  You will be integral to helping solve unique customer integration and data science challenges.  Examples of potential projects might include developing custom prediction and data handling scripts, assisting and training customers to interact with the DataRobot API, and improving customer experience by recommending improvements to the UI, API, software, architecture, and other aspects of the platform.


This position requires the ability to rapidly develop robust, well-tested, scalable, production quality code in Python and R.

item.title: Software Engineer (Full-stack) at Factual (Los Angeles, CA)
item.description:
Factual is looking for an engineer to build out front-end-heavy applications. You’ll be developing and rolling out reactive front ends, big data backends to support them, and everything in between. We’re doing Rails, Node.js, Angular, Bootstrap, Solr, Postgres on AWS.   This role is specifically for someone who wants to build interactive web apps (vs data science or backend infrastructure) but because of the scale of the data and query volume, absolutely requires serious CS chops. This position is in Factual’s Los Angeles headquarters.
 
Responsibilities



  • Work with product and back end engineering teams to develop tools for exploring and visualizing data for our data, ad tech, and mobile personalization products

  • Develop website demos to help illustrate how our products work

  • Develop internal reporting tools and other API support tools

  • Develop high stakes, high volume API features

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - Data Management at Rise Interactive (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
Rise Interactive | Careers | Senior Software Engineer - Data Management


Rise Interactive (http://www.riseinteractive.com), a rapidly growing full service interactive advertising agency, is looking to hire a Senior Software Engineer, focused on Data Management, into the Innovation team.  We are seeking a detail-oriented, highly motivated individual contributor that is excited about joining a new Innovation department and contributing professionally to an entrepreneurial company with an expanding Fortune 500 client base.


SUMMARY AND SCOPE


We’re looking for a Senior Software Engineer to help us build out our marketing and analytics platforms.  Our platform processes billions of records today – and we’re just getting started.  This role is not a research or analytical role.  Our goal is a developer who is extremely strong in data science rather than a data scientist with limited coding skills.  This is an individual contributor role that is expected to contribute to production solutions.  This position will develop the entire data pipeline from source to cube/data node.


Responsibilities:


We operate a cross-functional team that specializes when needed but aims to have everyone able to contribute.   Duties of the Senior Software Engineer include:



  • Implement and optimize data processing pipeline for terabytes of data

  • Design and build our data warehouse as well as real-time data reporting systems



  • Promote and nurture good team practices such as unit testing, code reviews, build/test automation, etc.

  • Proactively mentor and guide application developers to improve their quality and simplicity in design and code

  • Design, build and use tools to understand our product platform behavior and performance

  • Design and conduct experiments to test concepts, technologies, and algorithms

  • Implement analytics tools to maximize the value of collected data

  • Implement data tests in our data quality framework to ensure data is clean and accurate

  • Adhere to security policies and guidelines to ensure our data is protected and safe

  • Embrace and assist in evolving our Agile (Scrum) team processes and developer role responsibilities

item.title: Software Engineer / Data Acquisition Specialist at RedCurrent (Shibuya, Japan) (allows remote)
item.description: You will be part of a small, globally distributed development team building a world class event discovery and time management product.

item.title: Data Scientist for Global Health at Epidemico (Boston, MA)
item.description:
We seek a Data Scientist for our Boston-based public health informatics company. You would join a dynamic team of scientists, developers, and epidemiologists tackling global challenges across a wide range of population health topics, including infectious disease, disease ecology, healthcare, drug safety, and supply chain analysis. The Data Scientist will also contribute to products and research projects involving novel data sources for public health surveillance.


Applicants should have experience with data processing and analysis tools (e.g. Apache Spark or MapReduce) and scripting languages (e.g. Python, R, Scala), as well as machine learning and natural language processing. An ideal candidate would also have knowledge of statistics and some domain experience from a related field such as epidemiology, geography, ecology, medicine, or digital humanities. We seek experience across the software stack including databases, software architecture, web development, and open source collaboration. This position will focus on data engineering for our data science team, developing our distributed data processing stack.


This may be a customer-facing position; ability to work with enterprise clients and strong written and verbal communication are important.


We are a diverse, multi-national, multi-ethnic, gender-balanced, and family-friendly organization. Candidates from historically underrepresented backgrounds are strongly encouraged to apply. We will also consider junior candidates and recent graduates who don’t yet have all listed skills, but who are self-motivated with the ability to learn on the job.

item.title: Senior Front-End Engineer at Looker Data Sciences (Santa Cruz, CA)
item.description:
ABOUT LOOKER ENGINEERING


The engineering team at Looker is a tight-knit group of high-performers. We value simplicity in both our code and our user interfaces. We don’t believe in large teams; we opt for small groups that move fast, communicate clearly and achieve more.  We try to choose the right tool for the job, not one tool to solve all problems. We make a huge impact on product direction, we experiment, and we iterate rapidly. 


SENIOR FRONT END ENGINEER 


Looker is seeking experienced Front End Engineers to build out our data discovery platform. Looker is still a small team, so you’ll have the opportunity to work on many aspects of the product and shape the Front End architecture.  You should have extensive experience and a proven track record solving complex web engineering problems.

item.title: Senior Data Scientist at Booz Allen Hamilton (Springfield, VA)
item.description:
Key Role:
Conduct statistical analysis, modeling, and simulation for various federal clients that lead to actionable decisions affecting government operations. Use statistical methods on large data sets to characterize uncertainty through statistical methods. Leverage knowledge of large data analysis and perform research at graduate-level mathematics to ensure study results are properly interpreted and documented. Implement analytical approaches that will require knowledge of statistical programming languages, including SAS and R and traditional programming languages, including Java, C++, and others. Work closely with stakeholders and teammates from non-mathematical disciplines to ensure that operational strategies are considered in the context of applying statistical theory. Use statistical theory through modeling, simulation, and large data analysis to deliver lasting measurable improvements to organizations.

item.title: Sql Programmer at Spatially (Miami, FL)
item.description:
Description



  • Work with Product, Engineering, & Data Scientists to create efficient Sql Queries to build/QA needed Data Sets, and validate/verify/troubleshoot data set integrity & validity

  • Build reusable models and queries that assist in building data set driven projects that provide insights to customers, in form of reports and data visualization

  • Ramp up into Geo-Spatial querying techniques

  • Ability to handle multiple requests project related queries, and help identify common patterns and modularize those into common data queries.


Qualifications



  • Strong communication & Collaboration Skills

  • Experience in Fast Paced Startup environments

  • Positive Attitude with proven delivery experience

  • BS computer science/related subject matter or equivalent experience

  • 2+ years experience with RDBMS systems such-as Sql Server, Oracle, Mysql, Postgres

  • 2+ Years experience with SQL development experiences with solid T-SQL/SQL skills and proven SQL optimization skills.

  • Experience with both OLAP & OLTP workloads a strong plus

  • Experience with NoSql Technologies and Querying methods a Plus

  • Knowledge in One or More languages such-as Java, C#, Scala, GO, Python, Javascript a plus

  • Data Modeling experience a Plus

  • Experience in Financial, Retail, Spatial Analytics, Mapping, Location Based Services & GIS and like data and/or industries a Strong Plus

item.title: Senior Engineer at HERE-Chicago (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
HERE, a Nokia company, is a leader in navigation, mapping and location experiences. We combine highly accurate and fresh maps with cloud technology to enable rich, real-time location experiences in a broad range of connected devices – from smartphones and tablets to wearables and vehicles. To learn more about HERE, including our work in the areas of connected and autonomous driving, visit http://360.here.com



The Team:



The RCP group designs and builds hardware and software for capturing, processing, and extracting information from street-level imagery, 3D Lidar data, aerial and satellite imagery, as well as dense GPS probe data from smartphones and vehicles. These rich datasets are used to power next-gen 3D consumer maps, navigation and assisted driving systems, and more. HERE Maps, a division of Nokia, provides detailed road and navigation data for nearly 100 countries, and can be found in four out of five vehicle in-dash navigation systems. Licensees of HERE’s platform include Microsoft, Yahoo, Amazon, and Baidu. 



The Position:



Within RCP, the Data Operations Team manages the software processing pipeline for transforming petabytes of raw data into useable information.  The team is also responsible for data quality control, measuring and analyzing pipeline performance and addressing data issues that may be identified.  We are seeking a Senior Engineer to help us build tools to enable, expedite and enhance Data Operations Team’s QA and analytical efforts.  Example work for this team will be building and maintaining tools to improve the efficiency and efficacy of terrestrial and satellite data QA review.

item.title: Big Data DevOps Engineer at GoDataDriven (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
You are a engineer at heart with a pragmatic mentality and the responsibility of someone maintaining production systems. You easily switch between scripting and structured programming in typed languages. You understand failures modes in distributed systems. You are passionate about provisioning and automation. You take pride in assisting and educating data scientists and engineers with building data driven systems that don't wake anyone up at 3am on a Sunday (or any other day, for that matter).


As a Big Data Systems Engineer, you are responsible for setup, deployment and productionising of data intensive systems at the software infrastructure level as well as at the data level. You are experienced in engineering systems from the OS level up to distributed database technologies and cluster computing as well as maintaining data pipelines including transformation and pre-processing.

item.title: Big Data Engineer (SQL/Hadoop) at Avvo, Inc. (Seattle, WA)
item.description: Avvo is looking for a Data Engineer to join its BI/Data Warehouse team. This position will be responsible for building next generation Business Intelligence solutions using Big Data technologies such as Hadoop and Spark. You will be delivering actionable intelligence and present them through rich visualization. The ideal candidate will also have familiarity integrating SaaS platforms (like AdWords, Google Analytics, Sales Force, Exact Target etc.)

item.title: Mid-level Developer at Maritime Planning Associates (Newport, RI)
item.description: Maritime Planning Associates, a Veteran Owned Small Business, is seeking a Mid-level Developer to support the development of geospatially enabled decision aids and associated geospatial data and data management systems. This position will support programs either in the Newport, RI or Virginia Beach, VA regions. The successful candidate will be an independent, self-motivated programmer responsible for development and extension of code bases built primarily on Java programming. Successful candidate must have the ability to work efficiently, independently and meet hard deadlines.

item.title: Data Analyst / Report Developer at stratton (Port Melbourne, Australia)
item.description:
Do you live and breathe data, and are you excited about the possibility of using your skills to become a key member of a fast growing Australian company? If this sounds like you, then you want to work for us.


We need a senior data analyst who can help drive the next phase of growth for our business. In this role you will be responsible for planning, implementing and managing all aspects of our data-driven strategy. We have a suite of in-house developed software and access to large volumes of website data collected since the company's inception. You will closely work with all of our departments including software, marketing and sales with the view of upgrading our data reporting and analytic capabilities and advising on strategies for optimising growth within the organisation.


We are a business that defines itself through the smart and efficient use of technology. We may be a finance company, but we’re nothing like other finance companies; no stuffy old bankers, no bean-counters, and no corporate bureaucracy – just a dynamic, fast-growing business with a passion for the cutting edge. We’re successful because we disrupted our industry 12 years ago and continue to do so today - we do things differently, and our information technology team plays a critical role in our success.


Whether you have many years experience and are now looking for a new challenge or an intermediate data analyst ready to take the next step in your career, if you’re smart, driven, enjoy a challenge – and most importantly, love data – then we want to hear from you.

item.title: Data Engineer (m/f) at Project A Ventures (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
• You will be reponsible for continuing the development of data driven applications for one of our ventures. This includes a data warehouse (developed in-house, based on open-source technologies), a CRM system and integrations with other 3rd party systems

  • You will integrate, transform and index data from various data sources and develop meaningful data representations and visualisations

  • You will deal with the challenges of growing data amounts (performance, scaling, data quality)

  • You will work in an agile software development process in close collaboration with a product management team

item.title: Data Analyst at MillimanMAX (Cambridge, MA)
item.description:
We are looking for an individual who has the skills and drive to help our data scientists go faster by handling the responsibilities of profiling complex datasets, by identifying inefficiencies and rectifying them, by reconciling and mapping datasets, and by interacting with clients around data related subjects when the need presents itself. You will exist at the intersection of databases, software and modeling – you’re a generalist. You will have the unique opportunity to grow with the company from the ground up in a fun and challenging work environment. This role may also potentially serve as a bridge for candidates seeking training in data science and ultimately desiring a transition to a data science role. The analyst position will be a crash course in anything and everything related to the field.


Candidate profile:



  • This is an entry level role – we are looking for recent BS grads (CS, Math and Stats majors preferred)

  • Prior work with SQL, MATLAB or modeling not necessary but experience is a plus

  • You need to be a good detective, eager and willing to learn about a range of topics -- whatever is thrown your way.

  • ABOVE ALL: You need to be independent, resourceful and creative.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer, Data Services at Quantcast (Austin, TX)
item.description:
The Data Services team owns the data backbone of Quantcast’s advertising business. This means that we build systems that ingest, refine, and make available tens to hundreds of terabytes of data on a daily basis and serve up petabyte-scale datasets for use in Quantcast’s industry-leading audience targeting and automation systems.



We’re looking for a Senior/Principal-level Engineer to lead our efforts leveraging data warehousing to provide the company with a clean, consistent and comprehensive view of our business. Quantcast is a fundamentally data-driven company, and we view improved data insight as a critical component of the scaling and direction of the company as a whole.

We use Redshift, MapReduce, QFS, Java, Ruby, Python, and we’re open to new technologies.

Responsibilities:



  • Take ownership of the Data Warehouse function within Data Services team. This includes:

  • <span< span="">Own vision and engineering execution related to the data warehouse (prioritizing, scoping, planning, implementing, operating).

  • Establish and implement a flexible and maintainable data warehousing architecture for future growth.

  • Establish and enforce best practices for extracting, transforming and integrating new data sources (internal ones as well as cloud-hosted) swiftly and reliably.

  • Mentor engineers in improving and extending the data warehouse according to these standards, to support an increasing number of business functions.

item.title: Senior or Principal Data Engineer at BandPage (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
BandPage is seeking a senior data engineer who is passionate about music and eager to disrupt the music industry in a positive way.   We are on a mission to empower new and established musicians to build their fan bases, increase their revenue, and make a living at their craft.  BandPage is already used by over half a million musicians, including nearly all of the most popular artists.  Meanwhile, BandPage is integrated with most of the popular consumer music services, including Spotify, Rdio, Rhapsody, XBox Music, Vevo, etc.  Join us and help build the “operating system” for the music industry.


RESPONSIBILITIES


Data Discovery and ETL - Utilize the appropriate frameworks and tools to perform the ETL layer for disparate data sources. Consider proven methods of ETL and propose abstractions of those methods to aid in solving the ETL problems associated with data ingestion.


Data Storage Optimization - Constantly strive to optimize the data storage layer to fit the current and future needs of the applications it supports. This includes being aware of issues and making recommendations about scalability prior to, or in advance, of development of of an algorithmic solution.


Advanced Algorithms - Actively apply your knowledge of advanced algorithms, machine learning, and data models to unique problems in the domain of music. Adapt existing principles of logical inference and computer science to new problems in the company’s vertical.


Team Player - Participate in knowledge sharing activities including giving talks on topics in your area of expertise, contributing to the internal knowledge base via wiki or other, participate in code reviews, and support fellow team members in algorithm development including whiteboard sessions.

item.title: ETL / DWH Engineer at Picnic (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
ETL/DWH Engineer


Your challenge



  • Improve the daily lives of hundreds of thousands of grocery shoppers

  • Design, build, scale, and evolve our data warehouse and ETL processes

  • Enforce consistency and availability across operational and analytical data stores

  • Enhance data quality by improving business and technical operations

  • Keep up with the latest technologies and define our future technology stack

  • Be challenged every day by our extremely talented team

a10:author.a10:name: New York University - Division of Libraries

item.title: Data Services Specialist at New York University - Division of Libraries (New York, NY)
item.description:
The QDA & Survey Research Specialist will be working in a vibrant and collaborative environment on a team that supports all phases of the data lifecycle for quantitative, qualitative, and geospatial research. Data Services offers access to specialty software packages, software training and support, and consulting expertise for many aspects of numeric, qualitative, and spatial data for research, including data access, analysis, collection, data management, and preservation. The successful candidate will work closely with Division of Libraries professionals and faculty as well as with colleagues in NYU Information Technology Services (ITS) with respect to referrals, service development, technology, standards, resources and projects.


*Please note that this is a two year fixed term position with potential to renew.

item.title: Data scientist at Rijksoverheid (The Hague, Netherlands)
item.description:
Data scientist


Ministerie van Veiligheid en Justitie, Nederlands Forensisch Instituut


Functieomschrijving


Je beantwoordt met behulp van data-analyse vragen rond opsporing en bewijswaardering. Dit doe je bij het kennis- en expertisecentrum voor intelligente data-analyse (Kecida), onderdeel van het Nederlands Forensisch Instituut (NFI).


Kecida zet intelligente data-analyse in voor het oplossen van forensische vraagstukken. Ook richten we ons op onderzoek en ontwikkeling in kunstmatige intelligentie en helpen we de openbare orde en veiligheidsector met het inzichtelijk maken van grote hoeveelheden data.


Als big data engineer pas je data-analyse toe, zoals machine learning, tekstanalyse en netwerkanalyse. Je weet data in het juiste formaat te krijgen, zodat je ze snel in kunt zetten. Vervolgens gebruik je statistiek om inzicht in data te krijgen en machine learning voor het benutten van deze inzichten. Daarnaast houd je je bezig met onderzoek en ontwikkeling op het gebied van data-analyse en data science. Tot slot werk je aan consultancyprojecten voor een diverse groep opdrachtgevers binnen de openbare orde en veiligheidsector, zoals projecten over fraudeopsporing.

item.title: Senior Data Analyst - Data Conversions Manager at Fidelity (Cary, NC)
item.description:
The Workplace Investing Data conversion and Implementation team is looking for a Data Conversion Analyst in our Stock Plan Services (SPS) organization. SPS provides public companies with the expertise and convenience of a single provider to administer their equity compensation programs across a range of vehicles, including: Employee Stock Purchase Plans, Restricted Stock Awards/Units, Stock Option Plans, and Stock Appreciation Rights.


This position is a data-centric role that is looking for a detail-oriented Analyst to help manage multiple projects within our Data Conversions team. This role will be a client-facing position that interacts with multiple clients outside of the Fidelity organization, so a service-minded individual is a must! if you enjoy working with people and problem-solving this role could be a great fit. The candidate must be highly organized and should be able to move seamlessly between multiple implementations and ever-changing client requirements.


Primary Responsibilities



  • Organize and conduct data conversion project status meetings, including communicating status to internal project management, Fidelity business partners, outside vendors and clients

  • Maintain detailed project plan, issues and action items list throughout the implementation, while documenting requirements and addressing operation process issues to accomplish business objectives; and determining required changes and their impact

  • Provide input and suggestions into process improvements and discretionary projects

  • Build strong partnerships with client and third party vendors

  • Communicate project status and technology issues to sponsors stakeholders and senior management

  • Collaborate with each other WI management teams and business partners to share approaches, develop solutions, and improve capabilities to successfully deliver projects

item.title: Data Architect that loves mobile games? Join us! at Hothead Games (Vancouver, BC, Canada)
item.description:
Hothead Games is a 130-person game development studio focused on free-to-play for iOS and Android devices. Millions of people play our games and this generates large amounts of data. Efficient and effective storage, transformation, analysis and archival are all top priorities. We are seeking an ambitious individual to take a lead role in planning and executing on all aspects of our data-related technologies.

Have extensive experience with multiple databases? Passionate about creating software architectures that are robust and scalable? Want to work on the bleeding edge of Big Data?  Then you need to join our world-leading mobile game studio and help us wrangle hundreds of terabytes of data into understandable, actionable information.

We expect the successful candidate will be an experienced software engineer/architect that will formulate and execute the vision for our proprietary Big Data platform. Are you up for it?


Responsibilities:



  • Define requirements, create technical designs and assist with the implementation of internally-developed analytics systems

  • Oversee the daily operation of analytics data processing, automating the process wherever possible

  • Educate internal stakeholders on best practices for analytics-related processes in the company

  • Assist data analysts, game designers and others with advanced queries, sophisticated A/B tests and other complex data problems

  • Advise game teams on databases and other data-related aspects of game client and server software

  • Perform load and stress tests and analyze performance of running production systems in order to optimize database use and remove bottlenecks

  • Perform tests to sanity check accuracy of internal and 3rd party data

  • Assist the Director of Technology with supervision of the work of programmers on the Analytics Team

item.title: Data Services Engineer at Discovery Digital Networks (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Discovery Digital Networks, the premier publisher of digital-native programming for the Internet age, is looking for a Data Services Engineer with an affinity for working with data to support, evolve and expand our web and data infrastructure.


The candidate must be willing and able to function on a small team working with designers, front-end engineers and data scientists. This position will require knowledge of Python and PHP, and some familiarity with Javascript and MySQL. Experience with Amazon Web Services, Linux server administration and packages/frameworks like Flask, SQLAlchemy, React and Lumen is a plus. Successful candidates will typically have at least 3 years of experience. Ping pong skills also a plus!


We offer a competitive benefits package including medical, dental, vision, and a 401k matching plan, in addition to other perks.  Join our collaborative, fun, and creative work environment!


Some representative daily tasks include:



  • Maintaining and enhancing the ETL that feeds our data warehouse;

  • Building and supporting new and existing data tools and products;

  • Maintaining and developing both customer facing and internal web services;

  • Helping to improve the performance and reliability of the entire Discovery Digital Networks technology stack.


 Some possibilities for initial projects:



  • Updating data warehouse to include detailed geographic and demographic data;

  • Using machine learning algorithms to create tools to help producers create better content;

  • Creating dashboards to surface warehouse data to users.

item.description: This position’s responsibilities include designing and implementing automated tests and championing techniques to increase code testability and other ways to increase product quality.

item.title: Backend Services Software Engineer at Bedrock Analytics Corporation (Oakland, CA)
item.description:
Bedrock Analytics is looking for exceptional engineers with strong Java, Scala, and/or Python skills and a well-rounded background in computer science. You should have a proven track record of delivering robust, high-availability services and understand the ins and outs of scalable data processing and analytics. You can envision the way a system works end-to-end and how the services that compose it work together, and you enjoy creating new and effective software. You are interested in the different ways data can be organized, analyzed, and visualized to make effective use of the insights it contains.


You like working in an Agile best-practices environment. You understand the importance of testable, modular, efficient code, so that's what you write. Ideally, you will have been building cloud-based systems with a similar DevOps stack to ours – AWS, Chef, etc.


A few of the fun problems we're working on:



  • Predictive Insights and Recommendations

  • Data-Driven Stories

  • Microservice-based Analytics

item.title: Hacker (Node.js, NOSQL, Data Science) at Mobitrans.com (Dubai, United Arab Emirates)
item.description:
We are looking for exceptional functional developers to join our product research and development team. It's a full stack job that requires more than anything a passion for learning and experimenting with new technologies, creating prototypes and dealing with a few million data points every day. You will be working on any technology between Linux shell scripts, high performance Web servers and beautiful UIs.


We tweak our advertising and targeting algorithms multiple times a day and you should be able to reason about, program, discover and propose new ways of improving our result.


Our backend is supported by Node.js and Mongodb and our front-end is powered by JavaScript, TypeScript, LiveScript, AngularJS and React. You should be able to improve our architecture, bring new ideas and create POCs and lead the development of new projects.


You will be building ad servers for serving interactive mobile ads as well as realtime data analysis of the traffic; you will be tinkering with the algorithms and assisting product designers and data analysts by developing data visualization tools for UX and performance reports.

a10:author.a10:name: The Henry M. Jackson Foundation for the Advancement of Military Medicine Inc.

item.title: Data Warehouse Developer/Architect (210122) at The Henry M. Jackson Foundation for the Advancement of Military Medicine Inc. (Bethesda, MD)
item.description:
The Henry M. Jackson Foundation, for the Advancement of Military Medicine (HJF) is seeking a Data Warehouse Developer/Architect to support the Surgical Critical Care Initiative (SC2I) located at the Walter Reed National Military Medical Center (WRNMMC) in Bethesda, MD. HJF provides administrative and management support to SC2I.    


The Surgical Critical Care Initiative (SC2I) capitalizes on unprecedented advances in casualty research and clinical care by partnering Department of Defense efforts with civilian academic leaders to introduce paradigm-shifting approaches in care based on biomarker assessment into routine practice.


Responsibilities:



  1. Design/develop data warehouse applications and systems to support SC2i operations by incorporating data from Program data sources including laboratory and clinical applications and legacy data stores.

  2. Design/develop data integration strategies and methods to allow SC2i data warehouse applications and systems to interact (consume and feed as necessary) with external collaborator’s systems.

  3. Provide technical support to scrub, curate, and migrate legacy study data into Program data warehouse applications and systems.

  4. Participate in required program meetings at USUHS, WRNMMC, Naval Medical Research Center, and offsite collaborator locations.

  5. Performs other duties as needed.

item.title: Software Engineer In Data at Dataminr (New York, NY)
item.description: At Dataminr, we are looking for dedicated software engineers to help us sort, analyze and deliver relevant information from terabytes of unstructured data in the social media space. We strive for strong abstractions that allow for fast iteration, easy integration and short development cycles, allowing us to constantly learn from our data and empowering our clients to apply these insights toward product enhancements.

item.title: Platform Engineer at Likelihood (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
The Platform team at Likelihood is responsible for building a massively scalable system that ingests billions of data points, executes experiments and makes predictions, all in real-time. We're seeking talented Java engineers with expertise in data structures, algorithms, and distributed storage and processing frameworks to tackle one of the most challenging problems in ecommerce today. 


To store, analyze and serve user information at scale requires ideas and solutions in every area of computer science, including information retrieval, artificial intelligence, neutral language processing, distributed computing, large-scale system design, programming language design, networking, security, data compression, and machine learning, among others. Our engineers utilized advanced big data frameworks such as Hadoop and HBase, programming languages such as Java and Scala, and expertise in data structures, algorithms and software design, as well as extensive knowledge of Unix/Linux operating systems to engage in platform engineering activities.

SQL Server Database Developer

Due to exciting growth, we have an immediate need for SQL Server Database Developers to join our team on a cutting edge database projects. As an integral part of this group, you will be responsible for designing and developing databases and complex procedures. Bring your good ideas and appetite to learn new technology and join our team of bright and motivated data experts.


Conclusive Analytics provides Managed Analytics as a Service that enable our customers to grow revenue and increase profitability. Our experts integrate data, deploy the latest in decision science, management science, data science, predictive analytics, and visualization techniques enabling better, faster decisions to achieve improved and sustainable business results.

  • Build, edit, and review challenging and complex database procedures.

item.title: Big Data Architect/Engineer at OpenStax at Rice University (Houston, TX)
item.description:
The Big Data Architect/Engineer will work with the Machine Learning Research Scientist, contractors, and team developers to design and implement the second version of BigLearn, which provides personalization, recommendations, and performance prediction to students using OpenStax Tutor and CourseWare.


The Architect/Engineer will design big data solutions with heavy realtime usage in a secure manner, preserving privacy of student data.


The architect/engineer will design the data architecture and software components and application programming interfaces (APIs) to ingest learner interaction data, run an ever-expanding suite of cognitive science and machine learning algorithms on it in near-realtime and in batch processes, and return the recommendations and analytics produced by those algorithms to client learning platforms.


Apply to this job at Rice University using this link, and provide your application ID, cover letter, and resume here.

item.title: Software Developer, Geographical Informaiton Systems at OSIsoft (Philadelphia, PA)
item.description:
The Software Developer will be involved in design, implementation, documentation, testing and delivery of software products and services.  The Software Developer will also be involved in resolving technical support issues escalated to the team.  More specifically, this developer will be responsible for software products focused on integrating information managed by our PI System with Graphical Information Systems (GIS) created by other software vendors.  The developer will be engaged in research and implementation of software technologies, standards and paradigms used to exchange PI System data with geographical information systems to support the representation of physical assets on maps and location based analytics.

  • Contribute to the design and implementation of an integration architecture to support data exchange with GIS.

  • Collaborate with Product Managers to understand use cases and produce designs and implementations that meet those requirements.

  • Work with Team Leader and Development Lead to manage project tasks and activities. This includes status tracking and communication of project progress and issues.

  • Assist in all phases of the development cycle from design/research to documentation and testing.

  • Involvement in resolving technical support issues escalated to the engineering team.

item.title: Senior Data Scientist at Clutch Holdings LLC (Ambler, PA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Clutch is looking for an exceptional data scientist to synthesize and leverage our rich dataset of consumer and multi-channel transaction data to help our brands achieve their aggressive marketing goals.


This is a unique opportunity to join a new, multidisciplinary team of creative and passionate individuals determined to change and innovate how data is used to influence customer outcomes. We are focused on the company’s product strategy, and work on high-impact projects, utilizing a mix of open source and in-house tools and techniques to deliver insights.


We’re a lean, flat, and experimental team combining science and engineering to identify and inject high-value insights into our client brands' marketing strategies. The team works in quick iterations, using the techniques and algorithms best suited for solving the challenging problems of industries like high-fashion retail, QSR, Automotive, Pharmaceutical, and many other verticals.


What you’ll be doing:


You will advocate, evangelize, and build data-fueled products that help our brands maximize their customer strategies. You’ll dig in and become an expert on our datasets. You will provide insight into leading analytic practices, design and lead iterative learning and development cycles, and ultimately produce new and creative analytic solutions that will become part of our core deliverables.


You will work with cross-functional team members to identify and prioritize actionable, high-impact insights across a variety of core business areas. You will lead applied analytics initiatives that are leveraged across the breadth of our solutions. You will research, design, implement and validate cutting-edge algorithms to analyze diverse sources of data to achieve targeted outcomes.


As our data scientist, you will provide expertise on mathematical concepts for the broader technical and business team(s), and inspire the adoption of advanced analytics and data science across the entire breadth of our organization.

item.title: Messaging Migration Engineer at bluesource (Grapevine, TX)
item.description:
The Messaging Migration Engineer develops migration tools and reporting systems for bluesource’s Data Migrations team.  The team takes data from a variety of source email and IM archiving systems, including those developed by Symantec, EMC, HP, Microsoft, and pushes it into an alternative platform that our customers want to move to. Target platforms may include Cloud systems like EV.Cloud and Office 365. Often these systems do not have public APIs, and will require out-of-the-box problem solving and innovation. In this position you will have a critical role in the future of the migration processes, and designing automated toolsets that will enable us to deliver the work for customers more rapidly and accurately, while supporting the expansion and success of a fast growing team.


General Duties and Responsibilities:



  • Develop and maintain a data migration and reporting toolset to migrate data between a variety of data archiving platforms.

  • Gather and document requirements from the Data Migrations Manager and Data Migrations Analysts to extend and improve the data migration toolset.

  • Assist the Data Migrations team with project tasks as required, and to dogfood the toolset.

  • Manage time efficiently, work with minimal supervision

  • Document tools and train analysts to use them

item.title: Senior Engineering Manager, Inventory Quality at Quantcast (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Quantcast is a large scale, big data driven organization that lives and breathes data, processing well over a million transactions a second and 30+ petabytes a day. The Inventory Quality team ensures that the ads we display are shown on genuine inventory to real people. Quantcast modeling scientists and engineers leverage our large datasets, computational power and analytic tools to build high quality anti-fraud and brand safety products that support Quantcast’s position as a world class leader in online advertising.


We are looking for someone who has managed engineers and data scientists to manage the Inventory Quality team. As the Inventory Quality Manager you will lead Quantcast’s effort to continuously improve and refine our ability to stamp out fraud and meet our clients’ brand safety goals. As you expand the team you will drive the detection of ever changing fraudsters attempting to sell fake inventory.


Responsibilities




  • Manage a team of scientists and engineers to apply advanced data mining to detect and combat fraud




  • Work with several engineering and client facing teams to build comprehensive anti-fraud solutions




  • Maintain a robust brand safety product that ensures ads only appear on inventory with content desirable for each client




  • Recruit and retain excellent machine learning and software engineering talent

item.title: Software Engineer (ETL) at AnswerOn (Longmont, CO)
item.description:
Utilizing your arsenal of skills and talents, you will solve unique problems in the management of client data, by designing, implementing, maintaining and executing ETL processes for the management of client data. You will also provide data support for predictive modeling and statistical analysis of client data. We will expect you to have an enthusiasm for working in small groups in a high-energy bootstrap environment. Right candidate will be trained on all these processes. 
 
Responsibilities:



  • In this position you will be trained and responsible to create, maintain and execute custom data management (ETL) processes using;

  • Business Objects Data Services (BODS) in order to support analytical modeling and statistical analysis of client data.

  • Store and manage client data using SQL Server.

  • Create and manage data warehouses to support analysis of client data.

  • Prepare analytical modeling output for delivery to clients using BODS.

item.title: Engineering Systems Data Engineer at ARM Ltd (Cambridge, UK)
item.description:
The Engineering Systems Analytics group is responsible for ensuring that we have a solid understanding of both our engineering infrastructure, which we refer to as the engineering systems stack, and the engineering processes that run on top of it.


It strives to achieve this goal through a number of parallel activities:



  • By helping to refine our spark-based infrastructure that allows relevant data to be centrally collected, aggregated, and processed

  • By developing dashboards, reports and complex analysis and/or visualisations of the data that satisfy the business needs, both in terms of project reporting to help measure progress of the work, and in terms of infrastructure reporting to help understand the impact of this work on the estate

  • By working with engineering and IT functions to ensure sufficient relevant data is being captured to provide the best information in the above two categories


We are looking to augment the team with broad additional skills across the areas listed above.


You will be a software engineer with experience of Spark and R, or equivalents.


You will be equally at home working on the data processing pipeline, or performing an in depth analysis of the data it contains.


You will consider yourself a data scientist, keen to tackle the problems of extracting knowledge from data, and driven to understand the core ‘stories’ that data can tell, and to help drive efficiency and effectiveness improvements by providing the means to make data driven decisions.


This role be based from ARM's HQ in Cambridge, UK.

item.title: Database Programmer and Developer at University of Oxford (UK)
item.description:
NUFFIELD DEPARTMENT OF ORTHOPAEDICS, RHEUMATOLOGY AND MUSCULOSKELETAL SCIENCES


Database Programmer and Developer (119821)


Grade 7: Salary in the range of £30,434 to £31,342 per annum


We are seeking a Database Programmer and Developer within the Nuffield Department of Orthopaedics, Rheumatology and Musculoskeletal Sciences (NDORMS) located at the Botnar Research Centre, Oxford.


You will be responsible for maintaining, expanding and developing complex software used to support several research projects run by the Epidemiology Unit as well as assessing and improving the quality of the software through appropriate testing during the development process. Duties will also include writing readable code with good documentation and developing and maintaining the Epidemiology Unit website. You will also advise other members of the group on IT methodologies and procedures.


You will have a degree in computer science or equivalent technical qualification and will be proficient in developing and maintaining web applications for data capture written in PHP using HTML5/CSS/Javascript. You will also have expertise in developing and maintaining console and web applications as well as skills in testing both console and web applications. Sound knowledge of the relational database model, SQL, data management and MySQL is essential. Knowledge of working in a mixed computing environment involving Windows and Linux servers and experience of working with confidential data and related software (e.g. TrueCrypt) would be desirable.


This is a full-time fixed term appointment for one year.


The closing date for this position is 12 noon on Wednesday 30 September 2015. You will be required to upload a supporting statement and CV as part of your online application. Interviews will be held on 7 October 2015.


To apply for this role and for further details, including the job description and selection criteria, please click on the link below: 


https://www.recruit.ox.ac.uk/pls/hrisliverecruit/erq_jobspec_version_4.jobspec?p_id=119821
