item.title: Client Facing Python Developer at Continuum Analytics (New York, NY)
item.description:
We are looking for accomplished scientists and engineers interested in a customer-facing software consultancy that could lead to full time placement with a customer at the conclusion of a project.  Many of these roles allow for involvement with our core technologies as needed by the customer.  The more experienced candidate will have a strong technical background with 4+ years Python and C/C++ development experience and 2+ years experience with NumPy or the equivalent.


Depending on your skills, you will work on one of our core products or technologies, including our next-generation data management products which will push Python and its vectorized enhancements such as NumPy into general use in big data analytics. For the right person(s) with strong technical and customer-facing skills but less prior exposure to Python, C/C++, NumPy, and related, we may offer concentrated training and mentoring to fully prepare you for this role. 


Bonus skills & experience: Distributed databases, parallel computation, KDB+, GPU, UI, Gemstone, OLAP/MDX, LLVM.

item.title: Principal Data Architect at Smartsheet (Bellevue, WA)
item.description:
The Product Intelligence team is looking for a skilled data architect and principal engineer with prior experience designing data warehouse and business intelligence systems integrating transactional, analytical, and big data components. Together with the team, you will drive the data platform architecture to develop customer-facing product features and to meet the data needs of the organization. This is a highly visible senior role in a newly formed group where you will be instrumental in designing and building out the data platform, customer features and the team. The team comprises of data scientists and software engineers focused on enabling customers to perform actions and achieve insights currently not possible through Smartsheet's existing discrete features for tracking, sharing, managing, and automating work. Here are two short videos showing a Smartsheet overview and one of our innovative Product Intelligence features.



  • Smartsheet Overview Video

  • Graphical Exploration of Collaboration Across Your Organization


So if you like big data challenges and getting in on the ground floor of a new strategically important team within a fun and fast growing company, contact us. Responsibilities



  • Serve as technical lead and partner with members of the Product Intelligence team to design and implement a data platform that encompasses innovative intelligent product features and internal business intelligence

  • Develop and maintain technical vision and roadmaps based on the key performance indicators (KPIs)

  • Lead the development of capabilities in all facets from strategic to tactical implementation and from conception to post deployment

  • Help key users across the entire organization to understand and consume the data sets and platform for enhanced decision making and analytics

  • Advance the data architecture and platform and ensure adherence to key architectural tenets and best practices

  • Design and implement relational and dimensional models

  • Maintain master data models

  • Help build out the team and their practices and culture

item.title: Data Scientist at Aspen Technology (Bedford, MA)
item.description:
Overview:



 “Enabling every process plant to achieve Operations Excellence” is the AspenTech vision. Founded more than 30 years ago by the best and brightest engineers at MIT, we continue to imagine and invent new ways to bring efficiency to the process industry. Today, AspenTech is thriving with our relentless focus on innovation, collaboration, and execution combined with world-class experts who speak more than 10 languages and work in 30 different offices worldwide. This is a place where people are fiercely passionate about technology, a balanced life style and a desire to make a difference in the process industry.



 Our software tackles the most complex  process manufacturing challenges, creating value and improving profitability for our customers.  The industries that drive our economies and touch our lives are optimized by aspenONE software every day.  The world’s leading oil & gas, chemical, engineering & construction, pharmaceutical, food, beverage, and consumer packaged goods companies all rely on AspenTech to run their business (Dow Chemical, ExxonMobil, BASF, Shell, etc.). With integrated aspenONE software, process manufacturers can optimize their engineering, manufacturing, and supply chains.  AspenTech customers are better able to achieve operational excellence —  increasing capacity and improving margins, reducing costs, becoming more energy efficient, while ensuring safety, and shrinking their carbon footprint.



If you want a shot at greatness, as a member of the data science team, you will develop and investigate hypotheses, structure experiments and build mathematical models to understand data patterns and relationships and prescribe actions and options. We are looking for a sharp, disciplined, and highly quantitative individual who has a passion for playing with data, in all its forms including data mining, mathematical modeling and expert systems. We are building a unique technology platform dedicated to the real-time discovery and manipulation of data; this is your chance to be a critical part of that data research team.






Responsibilities:




  • Experience and track record in contributing in core development activities in a data analytics project

  • As a data scientist, you will create the analytics platforms and algorithms in software including warehousing, data engineering and management, statistics and machine learning, advanced computing, probabilistic modeling and visualization. 

  • As a data scientist, you will build and verify mathematical models and automated machine learning tools to analyze and optimize all aspects of our system, providing actionable insights in real time.

  • Thorough knowledge of SDLC and the ability to adhere to software development standards to release products on time; this includes processes such as issue tracking, source code control, coding conventions.

  • Collaborate with data mining engineers and development teams on data selection,preprocessing and formatting for analysis. You will also have the opportunity to help implement product-related tools, features and/or designs; success is measured in monetizing, retention, product usage and adoption.  

  • Help the organization shape new product directions as well as implement product vision within the context of the next generation of product architecture, while keeping the data science/analytics in mind.

item.title: Tech Lead - Data Science Team (m/f) at TrustYou GmbH (München, Deutschland)
item.description:
Software engineers at TrustYou constantly have to solve complex and interesting problems. We build products that ultimately benefit the travelers and we use user interface design, big data, machine learning, natural language processing and distributed computing to do so. TrustYou is looking for those rare, talented engineers who are not only excellent at their craft, but can also excite and lead fellow developers, and drive a product from its initial conception to successful completion.


Tech Leads at TrustYou hold full responsibility for an entire product or suite of features. They are expected to gather and prioritize requirements, think up features that are useful and fun to use, and drive the implementation from specification to QA, leading a team of smart engineers.


Our data scientists are expected to have knowledge in machine learning and natural language processing, and, most importantly, know how to apply it to create precise and useful products.


Theoretical knowledge isn’t everything - good skills in visualization and communication are key for data scientists. The most interesting analysis may be useless if you can’t convince anyone of your results!


TrustYou lives and breathes the world wide web, and you should share our passion for it. It shouldn’t be a problem for you to slap together a REST server to feed data into a visualization written in JavaScript.


Responsibilities



  • Ship products that clients love to use!

  • Take responsibility for planning, execution and success of complex projects

  • Manage and develop a team of data and software engineers.

  • Roll up your sleeves and code to get your project done.


Minimum qualifications



  • Degree in Computer Science, or closely related degree.

  • 6 years+ experience.

  • Knowledge of machine learning and/or natural language processing.

  • Experience with distributed systems.

  • Working knowledge of relational databases.

  • Excellent algorithms knowledge.

  • Fluent in English.


Preferred qualifications



  • Experience with Apache Hadoop, and other technologies from Hadoop ecosystem.

  • Experience implementing RESTful servers. We accept your background in a variety of languages (JavaScript, Python, Ruby, Java, etc.), but we only use JavaScript (NodeJS) or Python (Twisted, Tornado) and we will help you learn these technologies.

  • Good HTML, CSS & JavaScript knowledge.

  • NoSQL, especially distributed databases.

  • 2 years+ experience in hands-on technical leadership and people management.


Who we are


TrustYou is the standard for reputation in the travel industry. We search and analyze literally ALL hotel reviews on the web, and generate a summary for each hotel on the planet - what did guests like and dislike about this hotel? Try it out yourself by searching any hotel on our website or our mobile app!


Our data is powering over 100 hotel search engines around the globe. Additionally, we have built a social media monitoring and survey product for hoteliers, TrustYou Reputation Management. What are my guests complaining about? TrustYou is used by more than 10,000 hotels to answer that question and improve their services.


TrustYou is a startup with engineering excellence in its DNA. Our employees are experts in big data, machine learning, natural language processing, interactive JavaScript applications and web technologies. Our tech stack is varied and modern.


We work hard, but value a great working environment just as much. We offer perks and a comfortable office for creative work. Xbox breaks and office beers on Friday nights are part of our culture. Our visits to Oktoberfest and our developer getaway trips are legendary.


Job details


Team or role: Software Engineering


Job type: Full-time


Job location(s): Munich, Germany


How to get this job


We’d love to see a note about yourself along with your resume.


Write us at jobs@trustyou.com

item.title: NoSQL? Great! Come help expand our Big Data solution across our platform! at kCura (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
As an Elasticsearch Engineer at kCura, based in Chicago IL, you will leverage your knowledge in Elasticsearch to build Relativity Data Grid- a NoSQL data store that allows users to horizontally distribute large amounts of text and data. This is your opportunity to work on a next generation data store that will allow Relativity to handle massive amounts of data. If you have the desire to be continually challenged and work where boredom is an anomaly, then join our team and be part of a successful company experiencing rapid growth in the eDiscovery field.



Responsibilities:




  • Design and implementation of APIs and services to expose the data and abstract the tools

  • Experience with relational databases

  • Experience building intensive data driven applications

  • Elasticsearch experience

  • Real time data processing utilizing Elasticsearch technologies

  • Familiarity building Logstash/Elasticsearch/Kibana logging system

  • Scaling distributed data systems

  • Optimizing distributed application systems to maximize performance

  • Configure/optimize Elasticsearch clusters

  • Design, build, and test systems for scalability and stability while processing petabytes of data

  • Integrate Elasticsearch tools into the Relativity architecture

  • Actively participating in our SCRUM process

  • Troubleshooting issues by fixing defects and responding to client specific problems

  • May be required to handle technical support calls after hours about two times a year. If Client Services is working on a ticket and they are not able to solve an urgent issue, they will reach out to the level I developer to assist to get the issue resolved

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - Machine Learning at Quantcast (London, UK)
item.description:
Quantcast is an organization that lives and breathes data. Data is used in every aspect of our business, driving everything from our audience measurement service, to our real time bidding and ad personalization, and even corporate operations. We are looking for top-tier talent to design, implement, and operate large scale ML systems in a production environment. You’ll work within a machine learning group that is obsessed with improving the state of the art in performance advertising. You’ll take full ownership of the development and operation of ML systems that span dynamic ad personalization, predictive modeling, recommendations, bid optimization and pacing - all operating on a global scale. You’ll have the opportunity to work with our real-time systems that process over 2 million events per second, a distributed compute cluster that processes 30 petabytes of data per day, and a training pipeline that builds tens of thousands of models daily.


Opportunities



  • Make an impact. Quantcast performs world-class data modeling and engineering of realtime systems with a relatively small engineering team. Data science is the backbone of Quantcast; your impact will be much greater here than at a large company.

  • Thrive in a full Big Data ecosystem. Quantcast has invested heavily in its compute infrastructure and has vast amounts of data to aid in decisioning. Almost the entire platform has been built or extended in-house, to achieve our rigorous computational needs, with many systems returned to the open source community.

  • Make a name for yourself. We publicize our work through open-source projects, blog posts and papers, and we work with amazing advisors, like Trevor Hastie and Jerome Friedman.

  • Great timing. We are a fast growing pre-IPO technocracy.


Responsibilities



  • Design, build and operate large scale machine learning algorithms, systems, and supporting infrastructure

  • Develop techniques to efficiently extract meaning from petabytes of data

  • Improve existing advertising products and introduce new end-to-end products to delight our customers

  • Interface with other teams and leaders in Engineering, Product Management, and Business Operations

item.title: Data Scientist Residency at IDEO (New York, NY)
item.description:
Data Scientist Residency (IDEO New York)
 


What’s a Data Scientist Residency?


We’re seeking a Data Scientist to join IDEO New York’s office for a 3 month, full immersion residency starting in October 2015. During your residency, you’ll work closely with both our design teams on client-facing projects and with our internal groups to understand IDEO better. You’ll be helping us push our edges on how we use and interpret data, how we make data visualization interesting and playful, and how we gather and bring data into our design and strategies.


 So who do we think this is? You’re a cross between John Nash and Jackson Pollock, bringing a unique blend of science and artistry to your work. You laugh in the face of messy data sets and can transform them into a usable format without breaking a sweat. You know how to ask the right questions to turn your data into meaning, insight and actions. You not only know how to draw conclusions from data, but can transform  quantitative findings into impactful stories and illustrate ah-ha moments to a variety of audiences.



Once you're here...


Within our client-facing project teams, you will:



  • Work across diverse industries with multidisciplinary teams, including many types of designers whose specialties range from Interaction to Design Research to Environments

  • Advise on structuring and conducting quantitative and qualitative user research and lead teams through analysis of data

  • Coach teams on methods, timing and resource requirements of quantitative studies

  • Translate data into a visual language to make them accessible to designers and our clients

  • Clearly communicate insights to clients using storytelling techniques to generate empathy and instill confidence


Within our internal teams like Global Talent, you will:



  • Help us select data that will have the most value for learning more about ourselves

  • Advise on ways to collect and report on internal data that fits wells within the context of our unique culture

  • Review and analyze our data from many angles and recommends ways to apply the data

  • Sift through our existing data, supporting the discovery of previously hidden insights

item.title: Senior Modeling Scientist, Brand and Inventory Quality at Quantcast (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Quantcast is a large scale, data driven organization that lives and breathes data, processing well over a million transactions a second. The Brand and Inventory Quality teams build large scale pipelines that let us target online users across the web and mobile apps and ensure that the ads we display are shown on quality inventory to real people. Quantcast engineers leverage our large datasets, computational power and analytic tools to build high quality and diverse targeting products that support Quantcast’s position as a world class leader in online advertising.


We are looking for people with strong analytic and big data experience to expand our brand targeting and inventory quality capabilities. As a Senior Scientist you will investigate and model a variety of problems to identify the right users to target on the right inventory. You will collaborate with other engineers and work on a variety of large scale systems including our Mapreduce cluster and global realtime bidding system.


Responsibilities




  • Develop models and techniques to target online users at a large scale




  • Lead analytic projects through the full technical life cycle, from design and development through deployment and support




  • Work with cross-functional engineering and science teams to coordinate brand targeting and inventory quality projects with other performance advertising goals 




  • Work with product management and client services to gather project requirements and communicate project impacts

item.title: Sr. DBA at Rewards Network (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
The Senior Data and Database Administrator is a mission critical and highly visible role responsible for the management and operations of all Database environments supporting Rewards Network’s technology platform. This role will partner with the Agile software delivery team, Data Warehouse team and the Business Intelligence team to implement SQL database requirements (e.g. efficient data structures, mission critical performance, high volume scalability and capacity, future flexibility, big data and intelligence) in support of product and business initiatives. This role is architectural and operational in nature and requires a balance of skill and experience in both of these general areas. This senior technology role will set the standard for the overall data management lifecycle for the SQL Database management environment.




Essential Duties and Responsibilities



  • Partner with technology teams to architect, implement and manage the data management lifecycle and database environment

  • Architect, design, implement, administer and operate all SQL databases for the enterprise

  • Identify and resolve technology and operational issues specific to the SQL databases to ensure that all databases are operating at full performance and adhering to internal SLAs

  • Manage the SQL server database specific disaster recovery, archiving, backups and recovery processes

  • Develop and maintain standards, processes and procedures, and guidelines for managing the database environment using appropriate industry practices

  • Analyze and report the performance of database operations against the key database performance metrics established for the technology platform

  • Monitor and operate the database environment using standard monitoring tools/platforms and optimize the environment (e.g. IDERA Diagnostic Manager, IDERA SQL tools)

  • Design, develop and maintain applicable data integrations using the MS SQL integration toolset (SSIS) for exchange of data between databases and other operational/application systems

  • Support database requirements for technology teams comprised of Agile developers, application support staff, BI/ETL developers and AS/400 back-end system developers

  • Manage and operate the database environment for load, performance and capacity requirements

  • Support the Data Warehouse and Business Intelligence teams for their respective database requirements

item.title: Senior Software Engineer- Security Platform Owner at Amazon (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
The Security Intelligence team, part of Information Security at Amazon, owns the monitoring of and response to malicious activity on the Amazon network. We collect data from all parts of Amazon's massive, worldwide service-oriented architecture.



We are seeking Software Engineers to join a team in Information Security dedicated to enabling our organization to perform its most critical functions at Amazon’s scale. Our challenges are broad and deep -- we need to build flexible, secure, scalable, high-performance and robust software and services. We have all of the challenges you’d expect such as high scale, big data, and a need to never go down. In addition to these challenges we also have the security aspect. We protect customer data from adversaries that want it.



At Amazon, we obsess over our customers, and ensuring our customers’ trust is our first priority. To earn that trust in an environment as vast and varied as Amazon’s and an online world where threats grow ever more sophisticated requires building a world-class security team to tackle never-before-seen challenges at dizzying scales. You will not just be using cutting-edge technologies here in Amazon; you will be inventing them.

You have strong verbal and written communication skills, are self-driven and deliver high quality results in a fast-paced environment. You have strong computer science credentials, are passionate about Internet technology, are customer-obsessed and have a track record of building quality services. You know how to build and you dive deep into back-end services. You excel when working on complex and diverse systems. You can succinctly and accurately report your findings. Most importantly, you have a passion for learning and continuous improvement.


  • MINIMUM 8 years' Software Development experience

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field

  • Proficiency in at least one modern programming language such as Python, Java, or Scala

  • Experienced in big data technologies and/or distributed computing systems

  • Self-directed, ability to multi-task, sharp analytical abilities, excellent communication skills, capable of working effectively in a dynamic environment

  • Proven design skills and able to find creative scalable solutions to difficult problems

  • Strong knowledge of data structures, algorithms, internet security fundamentals and designing for performance, scalability and availability




  • Masters in Computer Science or Computer Engineering

  • Experience taking a leading role in building complex software systems

  • Knowledge of professional software engineering practices & best practices

  • Experience mentoring junior software engineers to improve their skills

  • Demonstration of project ownership including requirements, design, implementation, testing, and operational support

  • Experience with stream, batch and/or graph processing platform (e.g. Spark)

  • Experience with security technologies or products

  • Experience working in an agile environment

item.title: Data Scientist @ Cloud-Based Behavioral Analytics Software Company at RedOwl (Baltimore, MD)
item.description:
RedOwl’s Senior Data Scientists work on a diverse array of statistical challenges, supported by a top-notch engineering team, at a company that places an incredibly high value on analytics. Our current Senior Data Scientists are experts in a wide range of complementary statistical disciplines, including computational biology, natural language processing, machine learning, computational neuroscience, and economics.


RedOwl Senior Data Scientists play a variety of roles within the company. You will develop and implement new analytics within Reveal, assist in shaping the product roadmap, supervise teams of software engineers, and help clients use Reveal to mitigate their most pressing security threats. Senior Data Scientists are given a wide range of autonomy to passionately pursue their approach to problem solving through improving the software product.


Senior Data Scientists are expected to design and implement cutting-edge statistical methods for solving client problems. You will work with clients in order to understand their needs, workflows, and data sources. With this knowledge, Senior Data Scientists are involved in product and team leadership, helping oversee the development of Reveal to better meet both current and anticipated client needs.

item.title: Big Data Architect at Zalando SE (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
The opportunity


As a Big Data Architect at Zalando, you will be in charge of building, scaling and architecting one of the largest big data platforms in ecommerce. You will develop big data solutions, services, and messaging frameworks to help us continuously process our data faster and more effectively. You will challenge our status quo and help us define best practices for how we work. And you will have the freedom to launch your own open source projects, contribute to others’ projects, build internal community around your interests, and strengthen your personal brand—while receiving meaningful support at every step.


What we are looking for



  • A university degree in Computer Science,  Mathematics, Statistics or comparable subject, with an academic record of high achievement

  • Fluency in at least one programming language, such as Python, Java and/or Scala

  • Solid knowledge of data structures and applied machine learning techniques

  • Demonstrated experience working on time-critical, mass data-processing, parallel data-processing and database initiatives

  • Deep knowledge of Hadoop, Cassandra, Spark, MapReduce, Storm, Kafka, and/or other big data technologies and their capabilities

  • A passion for working with relational (e.g. PostgreSQL) and NoSQL (e.g. Cassandra, Redis) databases

  • Enthusiasm for microservices architectures and RESTful APIs

  • Peerless analytical and critical thinking skills

  • Creative thinkers who value accountability, goal-setting and focusing on solutions instead of problems

  • English language fluency


Your responsibilities



  • Prototype, design and build a mass data-processing and log data-processing architecture that will supplement to our existing analysis and DWH architecture

  • Align multiple teams to support new big data solutions

  • Help evaluate and push for the adoption of technologies that are best suited for specific projects

  • Share your knowledge via coaching, code reviews, articles and tech talks

  • Demonstrate excellent communication skills and act as a liaison between your team and others


What you can expect from us



  • Internal tech talks, skills-building courses and technical “People Leads” who help you achieve mastery

  • Personal branding support: From preparing conference talks and blog posts to industry networking Community: hack weeks, movie nights, +70 self-organized tech guilds and more



  • Competitive salary

  • 40% Zalando shopping discount and commuter discount

  • Relocation assistance for internationals


About Zalando


Zalando is Europe’s leading online fashion platform, doing business in 15 markets. Delivering first-class shopping experiences to our +15 million customers requires moving fast — with microservices, Agile processes & autonomous teams  —  and using cutting edge, open source technologies. We are passionate about what we do and have fun while doing it. And we are willing to experiment and make mistakes: It’s how we grow.


Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!


If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring processes, please contact recruiter Matthias Rempel at jobs@zalando.de.

item.title: Principal Software Engineer - Hadoop, Big Data at Fidelity (Durham, NC)
item.description:
Fidelity’s Strategic Investment Products and Data (SIPD) technology organization is seeking a highly technical and passionate Principal Software Big Data Developer. The candidate will be responsible for leading and executing several of our strategic data initiatives for enabling the next generation customer analytical platform using big data technologies. This job also requires strong oral and written communication, relationship management and conflict resolution skills. The ideal candidate will be an energetic and resourceful team-player and leader who can effectively work with our globally distributed technology team. If you are looking for an opportunity to delve into the Big Data world with a leading technology organization, then this role is for you!


SIPD supports Fidelity's Managed Accounts business which delivers advisory solutions for Fidelity clients through the PWIS sales channels and online self-service channels such as Fidelity.com. 


This position is located full time in Durham, NC.


Responsibilities:



  • Work across technology teams to understand and define system and technical requirements for EDW and Big Data

  • Work and transition seamlessly between relational, data warehouse and big data platforms

  • Lead a team in the design/development of data ingestion and data transformation for EDW and big data applications

  • Lead the development of data pipelines using Hadoop, NoSQL, In-Memory and Distributed search platforms

  • Primary point of contact for development team to the project manager, lead systems analyst and QA lead

  • Design and deliver complex architectures for customers

  • Participates in requirements gathering and scope estimation meetings

  • Responsible for Technical Systems Design (TSD) document delivery and reviewing all project artifacts including requirements (SRA) and functional specifications (SDS)

  • Manage development for content pipeline and processing systems for real-time and predictive analytics

  • Capable of advanced performance tuning of hadoop jobs (hive, pig, map reduce, etc.)

  • Rapidly prototype and validate big data applications

  • Mentor software engineers in code design and optimization

  • Perform on-call support responsibilities with rotational schedule

item.title: Principal Software Engineer - Hadoop, Big Data at Fidelity (Durham, NC)
item.description:
Fidelity’s Strategic Investment Products and Data (SIPD) technology organization is seeking a highly technical and passionate Principal Software Big Data Developer. The candidate will be responsible for leading and executing several of our strategic data initiatives for enabling the next generation customer analytical platform using big data technologies. This job also requires strong oral and written communication, relationship management and conflict resolution skills. The ideal candidate will be an energetic and resourceful team-player and leader who can effectively work with our globally distributed technology team. If you are looking for an opportunity to delve into the Big Data world with a leading technology organization, then this role is for you!



SIPD supports Fidelity's Managed Accounts business which delivers advisory solutions for Fidelity clients through the PWIS sales channels and online self-service channels such as Fidelity.com. 



This position is located full time in Durham, NC.


Responsibilities:



  • Work across technology teams to understand and define system and technical requirements for EDW and Big Data

  • Work and transition seamlessly between relational, data warehouse and big data platforms

  • Lead a team in the design/development of data ingestion and data transformation for EDW and big data applications

  • Lead the development of data pipelines using Hadoop, NoSQL, In-Memory and Distributed search platforms

  • Primary point of contact for development team to the project manager, lead systems analyst and QA lead

  • Design and deliver complex architectures for customers

  • Participates in requirements gathering and scope estimation meetings

  • Responsible for Technical Systems Design (TSD) document delivery and reviewing all project artifacts including requirements (SRA) and functional specifications (SDS)

  • Manage development for content pipeline and processing systems for real-time and predictive analytics

  • Capable of advanced performance tuning of hadoop jobs (hive, pig, map reduce, etc.)

  • Rapidly prototype and validate big data applications

  • Mentor software engineers in code design and optimization

Why Fidelity?

  • Access to top-tier technology platforms, tools and frameworks

  • Non-traditional benefits like our Concierge Service, Computer Equipment Purchase Assistance Program and profit sharing eligibility


Company Culture


At Fidelity, you can find it all here. We reward ambitious, passionate individuals with a work environment that fosters diversity, teamwork and collaboration as well as encourages innovative ideas and fresh thinking. We recognize the value that employees’ individual differences can contribute to the bright and strong future of our company.

item.title: Software Support Lead - Get shit done have fun doing it! at BitTitan (Kirkland, WA)
item.description:
We are currently seeking a Software Support Lead for our award winning Kirkland, WA office!


Responsibilities:



  • Provide email-only support

  • Answer questions regarding product capabilities

  • Recommend migration steps depending on the situation

  • Identify and resolve authentication issues

  • Analyze and diagnose migration performance issues

  • Implement diagnostics and troubleshooting tools

item.title: Senior Software Engineer, Ticketing Data at Flixster (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
For this position, we’re looking for a senior software engineer that will drive the expansion of our movie ticketing platform. Your work will power online ticket sales for major theater chains. Every ticket sale will happen via the components that you’ll build and operate. It takes a steady approach, a high standard for quality and reliability, and the willingness and ability to own a high volume, high visibility workflow.


Responsibilities



  • You own the data integration with our movie theater partners (APIs, data storage, throughput, performance, etc). Movie-goers around the country are depending on you!

  • You build it, you run it. You design and implement the operational capabilities to keep things humming (trending, alerting, admin tools for the content management team, etc.)

  • You champion high quality and best engineering practices

item.title: Software Engineer - Big Data Java Developer at Rubicon Project (Los Angeles, CA)
item.description:
Rubicon Project has engineered one of the largest real-time cloud and Big Data computing systems.  We are looking for great engineers to build high performance, high scale backend systems to take on trillions of transactions without breaking a sweat.


In this team, you will be working on Rubicon Project’s high performance real-time bidding platform. You will be working on big data solution using Java 8, Apache Spark, Hadoop, and Kafka and apply principles of Reactive Programming to build mission-critical systems at scale.

item.title: Forward Deployed Engineer at Jut, Inc. (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
We’ve built an incredibly powerful analytics platform and need to make sure users are tapping into this power to maximizes Jut’s impact in their organization.


This is a technical customer facing role where your coding, scripting and product expertise will be a key factor in customer success.

item.title: Help Desk/Junior Systems Engineer at Factual (Los Angeles, CA)
item.description:
Factual is looking for a Junior-level Help Desk/Systems Engineer to help handle the management and growth of our cloud and internal computing and network infrastructure.  We're a technical group of people working in a relaxed environment with various demanding infrastructure needs.  There's almost no 24/7 component to this job but there are a lot of machines and systems to keep configured and happy and we have a very high standard of careful, detail-oriented, responsive professionalism.


Responsibilities:



  • Maintain computing and networking infrastructure.

  • Share support burden for mostly technical internal staff

  • Repair and recover from hardware or software failures

  • Devops and automation of internal and production infrastructure

  • System/network monitoring & troubleshooting

  • Participate in on-call rotation duties

item.title: Research Engineer at Ditto Technologies (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
You...



  • Love building cutting-edge technology

  • Believe that forming premature theories upon insufficient data is a vice

  • Describe yourself as a self-starter, proactive, positive, creative, and flexible

  • Write clean and easy to read code

  • Are excited to work with a small and talented team of researchers and engineers

  • Are willing to commute to DITTO's office at 19 S Park St San Francisco, CA (blocks from the Caltrain)



Responsibilities



  • Be a part of research team and report directly to DITTO’s CSO, Dmitry Kornilov

  • Work on computer vision-based recommendation engine

  • Improve and advance company’s core technology — 3D virtual try-on for eyewear

  • Apply latest state-of-the-art deep learning techniques to improve facial features detection



Perks



  • You’ll be employee #14 or 15 at this location with real equity

  • Vacation, take it when you need it, no defined schedule

  • You pick your setup (computer/monitor/etc)

  • Endless snacks and drinks

  • Cookouts in South Park every third week when we finish a Milestone

item.title: Software Developer, SaaS at OSIsoft (San Leandro, CA)
item.description:
As a SaaS Developer, you will focus on creating highly-scalable, multi-tenant solutions with continuous integration and delivery. You should have an appreciation for distributed computing patterns and practices and how they can be leveraged to create robust solutions which can scale elastically with demand. You should be comfortable with the extreme agile methodologies required to evolve a modern SaaS solution.

Responsible for producing software programs including, but not limited to:



  • Architecting and designing software programs. 

  • Developing and coding software.

item.title: Data Analyst at BAE Systems (Portsmouth, UK)
item.description:
Would you like to be a part of the nation’s most complex and high profile marine projects? We currently have vacancies for Data Analysts to work across a number of Fleet Services projects, where you will be given unique exposure to programmes such as the Type 45 destroyers, the Type 26 frigates, and the Queen Elizabeth aircraft carriers.


As a Data Analyst, you will be analysing business data and investigating interesting insights and correlations. You will work to help us improve our diagnostic and prognostics capability for a range of equipment and services, through analysing this data.


This role will offer excellent opportunities to grow and develop a new team within the business, with the potential for excellent career progression. You will also have the chance to become one of the only defence industry experts, through developing specialist knowledge within a specific area of the business.


Your main responsibilities as a Data Analyst will involve: 


Analysing data from within the business, from vibration sensitivity on ships to HR and finance information


Using data to create predictions and turn this into business insight


Research and implement new tools and new data


Writing reports and presenting information


Creating insights, theoretical testing and metrics

item.title: Big Data Engineers at Betsson Group (Ta' Xbiex, Malta)
item.description:
Are you interested in working for the market leader in a fast-growing industry? Betsson Group is now looking for talented Big Data Engineers to join us in our Malta offices to build the next generation in data services.


Who are we?


Betsson Group offers online gaming products to customers and partners all over the world and we aim to deliver the best customer experience in the industry. We are a dynamic and creative company with over 1000 passionate employees and consultants of almost 40 different nationalities. Most of us work in the operational Head Office in Malta but we also have other offices around the world, for example in Stockholm, Kiev, Tallinn and Gibraltar. Betsson Group has its roots in Sweden and Betsson AB (Betsson Group’s holding company) is quoted on the Swedish Stock Exchange. The Mediterranean island of Malta offers a relaxed life-style, with more than 300 sunny days a year and the best diving experience in Europe.


Who are you?



  • You are an exceptional developer with an aptitude for new technologies who loves to push the boundaries to solve real business problems

  • You will have previous Big Data experience using the Hadoop ecosystem to solve large-scale problems.

  • You will have a good understanding of distributed systems and experience in using open source frameworks

  • You have agility to learn new technologies quickly.

  • You have the ability to develop and leverage key partnerships and communicate very effectively.

  • You display initiative, self-motivation, and effective time-management skills.


Description


Our Big Data development team is growing fast and we are looking for software engineers to help us use a variety of Big Data technologies to create exceptional personalised customer experiences and solve difficult business problems based on a robust, low latent platform of structured and semi-structured.

item.title: Sr. Software Engineer - Core Systems at Spatially (Seattle, WA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Description




  • Work as an integral member of highly motivated Product, Engineering, & Data Scientist teams to build plus manage scalable & Performance oriented software systems for an innovative Spatial Analytics Startup

  • Take part in establishing and driving best practices and engineering practices geared towards shipping products

  • Design, implement, and maintain software systems & infrastructure

  • Refactor and improve maintainability of the codebase.

  • Solve complex scalability, platform, and integration problems.

  • Learn new paradigms, languages, and libraries as you work.

  • Building, Managing, & Maintaining multiple application environments, including production

  • Manage systems and work in all aspects of the agile driven software development lifecycle



Qualifications




  • Strong communication & Collaboration Skills

  • Experience in Fast Paced Startup environments

  • Positive Attitude with proven delivery experience

  • Strong knowledge of OOP concepts, Functional & Reactive programming paradigms, design patterns, data structures & Algorithms

  • Strong passion to learn new technologies & methodologies

  • BS or MS computer science/related subject matter preferred or equivalent experience

  • 4+ years experience building & Shipping web scale and distributed systems

  • Strong knowledge in designing across all layers of complex software systems

  • 2+ Years experience with GO

  • 6+ Years building production systems and writing efficient code in multiple programing languages such as Java, Scala, GO, Python, Javascript, C++/C

  • 4+ Years experience with SOA/WOA based systems with strong understanding of HTTP, REST and like protocols, micro-services and system integration

  • Experience working in Polyglot code bases & systems

  • Knowledge of Scaling & distribution patterns

  • Experience & knowledge of concepts such-as Concurrency and Parallel paradigms, Asynchronous patterns, Threading & Processes, distributed components & systems

  • Experience with RDBMS systems such-as Sql Server, Oracle, Mysql, Postgres

  • Experience with SQL development experiences with solid T-SQL/SQL skills and proven SQL optimization skills.

  • Experience with NoSql/Big Data Technologies and Querying methods including Hadoop/Mapreduce systems, Apache Stack, Column Family, Key-Value, Document, and Graph data systems

  • Good Data Modeling experience

  • Experience with Search systems such-as Solr/Elasticsearch a plus

  • Experience building on top of or integrating with Analytics & machine-learning platforms is a plus

  • Experience with Node, and Front-end technologies such-as React/Angular, HTML & CSS is a plus

  • Experience in Financial, Retail, Spatial Analytics, Mapping, Location Based Services & GIS and like data and/or industries a Strong Plus



This position will be filled in either Seattle, WA or Miami, FL

item.title: Technology Lead - Big Data at Hotels.com (London, UK)
item.description:
Peoplefluent RMS 5
























The online travel market never stands still. The opportunity is huge and the competition is fierce. At Hotels.com, we're in the thick of it. We live and breathe travel. Our technology team is insanely passionate about using the best technology and processes to give our customers the best possible experience when finding hotels for their business or leisure travel needs. We want them to feel the same passion for travel that we do.


The Hotels.com team at Expedia Inc. is looking for an experienced, highly motivated, self-directed Software Technology Lead to join the Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) team.  In this role you will be responsible for the delivery of solutions on top of the big data platforms such as Hadoop & Teradata and will play a key role in a technology pivot, driving design & architecture solutions. This entails working with the delivery team and business partners to flesh out requirements, complete solution design, development and ultimate delivery to the end consumers.  We are also constantly looking for ways to improve our development methodologies and welcome fresh ideas and approaches.


Why build your career at Hotels.com?



  • You'll get to work with some spectacular people both from the technology team and wider business

  • You will get to work with massive data sets numbering literally billions of items and approaching a petabyte in total size and Opportunities to learn and apply the latest big data technologies on a fast growing Hadoop & Teradata platform.

  • We work hard to create a supportive, collaborative, and fulfilling place where you can progress your career

  • We have many of the best bits of a start-up but with the resources of the world's biggest travel company

  • We love open source and actively participate in the open source community

  • We do hackathons where you can branch out of your usual area to contribute something different and innovative

  • We host and speak at meet ups

  • We want everyone on our team to have the tools and resources to succeed in their career

  • We get to do all of this in a lovely, comfortable office in a nice, central part of London


Role Purpose


Provides technical leadership to our Data Engineering team, including design, development, troubleshooting, and debugging big data solutions & programs for enhancements and new products. 





Job Description


General Responsibilities:



  • Implementing high quality big data solutions, including design, development, and deployment of new business functionality for various facets of Hadoop / Java and wider Enterprise Data Warehouse ecosystem.

  • Drive evolution of standards & design patterns with industry best practices and new technology to enhance productivity, quality, and system performance.

  • Drive program & system architecture discussions to identify a suitable quality solution to the business requirement.

  • Work closely with product management to flesh out business requirements and articulate project technical requirements and deliver on requirements in an agile manner.

  • Deploy and maintain applications in production environments.

  • Communicate and document solutions and design decisions.

  • Ensure that features deployed have technical integrity and stability.

  • Improve platform by leveraging existing technology, building new technology, and/or helping evaluate 3rd party solutions.

item.title: Senior Front End Developer Pioneering Business Forecasts at Intensity (San Diego, CA)
item.description:
Intensity applies expertise in economics, data science, and machine learning to solve the most complex and challenging issues that organizations face in the competitive marketplace. We are seeking a senior level front-end developer to implement the technical design and development of web-based applications that deliver pioneering business forecasts and data visualizations. This position requires a can-do/will-do attitude, a love of coding, and a passion for solving challenging problems. The position is located in San Diego, California.



RESPONSIBILITIES/DUTIES:


Specific responsibilities and duties for the Senior Front End Developer include:



  • Implement the user interface technical design and development of enterprise-class, cloud-hosted, web applications

  • Write robust front-end code with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript frameworks and libraries

  • Develop rich, interactive data visualizations, including graphs, charts, and other dynamic features

  • Design and implement user authentication and security features

  • Collaborate with product managers, UI designers, and back-end developers to define functional requirements and translate them into technical requirements

  • Rapidly solve problems and fix bugs

  • Work with technology partners and vendors as required



QUALIFICATIONS


Qualifications for the Senior Front End Developer include:



  • Extensive experience building highly interactive web application interfaces

  • Deep expertise in HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript MVC frameworks and libraries

  • Expertise designing and developing rich, interactive data visualizations

  • Strong understanding of web standards, cross-browser compatibility, responsive design, Bootstrap, CSS frameworks (LESS, Sass), and AJAX

  • Excellent understanding of database development, including basic data structures and algorithms

  • Experience with Agile processes, test-driven development, continuous build, and integration tools

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills

  • Ability to work independently and collaboratively

  • Problem solver and technology enthusiast

  • Creativity, innovation, and resourcefulness

  • Bachelors and/or Masters degree from a top university



PREFERRED


Preferred experiences and capabilities for the Senior Front End Developer include:



  • Experience with JavaScript frameworks (AngularJS, ReactJS, KnockoutJS, Backbone, etc.)

  • Experience with data visualization toolsets (D3)

  • Working knowledge of Java or Python, Ruby on Rails and/or PHP

  • Strong object oriented design and programming skills

  • Experience with database development (SQL, MySQL, NoSQL)

  • Familiar with modern Internet/information/data security issues and technologies

  • Familiar with source code management tools (Git, Subversion)

  • Experience with graphic design software (Photoshop, Illustrator)



APPLICATION


To apply for this position, please send a cover letter and resume to Intensity via email at careers.IT@intensity.com.


Additional information is available at www.intensity.com.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Datto Inc (Norwalk, CT)
item.description: Datto is currently looking for passionate engineers to forge software for our internal and distributed systems and eager to implement new solutions.

item.title: Associate Developer at Finsight (Juneau, AK)

This opening is for an associate developer to participate in a range of projects spanning from


enterprise systems for fisheries management to data collection and research software using a wide


variety of technologies. This position requires strong time management skills to be successful on


multiple projects simultaneously. The ideal candidate will have demonstrable experience building


applications in either Java or C#. The successful candidate will report to a technical project manager


and will participate in 2-4 person teams, and be expected to engage on site with clients regularly.


Compensation for this full-time salaried position will depend on experience, and will include health


insurance benefits and paid vacation time. The job must be performed on site in Juneau, AK. Travel,


housing, and/or relocation support are negotiable. We are not able to offer H1 visa sponsorship for

item.title: Senior Engineering Manager - Machine Learning at Quantcast (London, UK)
item.description:
Quantcast is an organization that lives and breathes data. Data is used in every aspect of our business, driving everything from our audience measurement service, to our real time bidding and ad personalization, and even corporate operations. We are looking for a seasoned hands-on data science manager to join a growing team of scientists and engineers in London, focused on performance targeting and optimization. 

This team is responsible for building the online advertising prediction and control systems that power Quantcast. This means getting up-close and personal with cutting edge statistical models and machine learning techniques, as well as serving as mentor, manager, and joint architect for the systems and processes built by the team.  Not a purely theoretical position, this team is responsible for shipping production code to meet the demands of the business and a solid background in software engineering is desired. You’ll have the opportunity to work with our real-time systems that process over 2 million events per second, a distributed compute cluster that processes 30 petabytes of data per day, and a training pipeline that builds tens of thousands of models daily.

Opportunities



  • Make an impact. Quantcast performs world-class data modelling and engineering of realtime systems with a relatively small engineering team. Data science is the backbone of Quantcast; your impact will be much greater here than at a large company.

  • Thrive in a full Big Data ecosystem. Quantcast has invested heavily in its compute infrastructure and has vast amounts of data to aid in decisioning. Almost the entire platform has been built or extended in-house, to achieve our rigorous computational needs, with many systems returned to the open source community.

  • Make a name for yourself. We publicize our work through open-source projects, blog posts and papers and we work with amazing advisors, like Trevor Hastie, Jerome Friedman, and Michael Jordan.

  • Great timing. We are a fast growing pre-IPO technocracy.


Responsibilities



  • Manage several projects, including prediction and control systems that are designed to efficiently drive sales and engagements for our clients

  • Lead, don’t follow. Drive innovation and contribute to intellectual property. Identify and propose new systems and techniques that bring business value. Everybody codes and participates.

  • Hire and manage a growing team of 5 - 10+ engineers of all seniority levels

  • Advise other data science teams and projects in London and globally

  • Ensure that the team is focused on commercially relevant projects, that the pace of innovation is rigorous, and that we meet stringent design, performance and robustness quality standards

  • Interface with other teams and leaders in Engineering, Product Management, and Business Operations

item.title: Big Data Engineer: real-time video sharing at Grabyo (London, UK)
item.description:
If you like working with emerging tech in a start-up environment, then you'll fit right in. We build an innovative platform to power real-time social video sharing for clients like BSkyB, ITV, Channel 5, Wimbledon, NHL, Formula-e and many more.


Responsibilities



  • Be social and have fun. Office culture is important to us. We work in small teams to create and develop new products and features continuously.

  • Data Engineer – you love big data and have an in depth knowledge of how to navigate around it.

  • Taking ownership of the entirety of data on the platform – process multiple sources of social video data for real-time analytics and prediction / performance modelling.

  • Write modern code for a modern platform. Cloud programming (AWS). Big Data. NoSQL. MapReduce. API orientated. Scalability.

  • Problem solving. Complex problems, smart solutions.

  • Ownership. Your products.

  • Some examples of #whatwedo: java, rest, dynamodb (nosql), redshift (sql), kinesis (streaming), emr (hadoop), spark, elasticsearch, redis

item.title: Software Developer - Data Visuzalization and Analysis at Esri (Redlands, CA)
item.description:
Have you ever wanted to tell a simpler, yet impactful story with your analytic results? Combine your analysis expertise with your eye for design to create outstanding visual representations of data. Join the Analysis and Geoprocessing Team and help us build cutting-edge software and applications that enable ArcGIS users to ask questions, perform analysis, and effectively present their results.


Responsibilities:



  • Design, develop, and implement data visualization functionality to be used in conjunction with geospatial data across the ArcGIS platform

  • Enable ArcGIS users to better understand and communicate analysis results using interactive, informative, and attractive charts and graphs

item.title: Backend Engineer at Grammarly (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Summary


Grammarly is a bootstrapped, profitable company with millions of registered users. Grammarly’s automated proofreader helps the world’s 2 billion English speakers improve the quality of their writing.


We are looking for talented engineers who will have a big impact on our technical direction. You will join a company where risks and exploration are the norm. You will be part of a team that envisions, collaborates, designs, and develops highly scalable and highly available services to help writers around the world communicate more effectively.


As a Backend Engineer on the Grammarly Data Team, you will work on constructing the Grammarly analytical data pipeline using the coolest building blocks out there and effective creations of your own; build out our code metrics, log collection, and querying stack; and enable other teams building data pipelines for their services. Your ambition and skill will drive and impact our entire platform. If you want a big challenge, this is your next gig!


What You Will Accomplish



  • Build internal real-time analytical data acquire-attribute-aggregate pipeline using:


    • Spark & Spark Streaming, Reactive Streams

    • Cassandra

    • Kafka

    • Scala


  • Build a high-load, big-data, distributed, no-single-point-of-failure, horizontally-scalable, lambda-architecture app

  • Build extensible high-load APIs and client-side instrumentation tooling

  • Build querying and visualization layer on top of Looker, Tableau and custom web-app

  • Perform integration to loop the analytical insights back to Grammarly product

  • Relentlessly work to optimize performance and data processing

  • Help to improve our development cycle, including CI/CD, deployment, documentation, instrumentation, and monitoring processes

item.title: Big Data Developer - Contract at Hotels.com (London, UK)
item.description:
What we're looking for in you:



  •  Passion, creativity, deep expertise, openness, flexibility and drive. Practicality and common sense are important to us.

  •  Focus on moving the business forward. We don't just build software for its own sake (notwithstanding deep appreciation for the craft). We build it to help our customers find the right hotel, every time.

  •  A keen interest in the business, not just a given technical problem. We want you to understand the big picture and how your work fits into it.

  •  Get excited about big, hairy technical problems like we do.

  •  Participate in the Hotels.com technology community, the wider Hotels.com team, and the wider technology community around the world.


We live, eat, and breathe travel powered by technology. We work hard and play hard. We're never satisfied. We celebrate success and learn when we sometimes fall short.


Your job


Helping our business succeed through the power of data is a key priority across our business. In this role you'd be responsible for helping us achieve that by developing software to help us harness the power of the data available to us.



  •  Create and enhance RESTful web services

  •  Implement Hadoop jobs with Cascading, Hive, and raw Map Reduce as appropriate

  •  Read and write streams of messages from/to Kafka

  •  Read and write data from/to Cassandra

  •  Configure Oozie and Falcon jobs

  •  Contribute to open source projects

  •  Write automated tests

  •  Review your team member’s code

  •  Regularly refactor code to adapt to fast moving business requirements and evolving technical landscapes

item.title: Data Developer at Muzooka (Calgary, AB, Canada) (allows remote)
item.description:
In this role you will be responsible for modeling complex business problems, discovering insights and identifying opportunities through the use of statistical, algorithmic, mining and visualization techniques. In addition to advanced analytic skills, this role also requires working with development teams to integrate and prepare large, varied external datasets and sources and architecting specialized database and computing environments that aid in Muzooka's strategies. You will leverage developer skills to enhance and expand data sets to be utilized for product and data teams.


You will work closely with team stakeholders to turn data into critical information and knowledge into powerful insights unique to the platform’s value offering. You are a creative thinker and use data mining in innovative ways to solve problems with the information that is available.


You will need a combination of business focus, strong analytical and problem solving skills and programming knowledge to be able to quickly cycle hypothesis through the discovery phase of the project. Excellent written and communications skills to report back the findings in a clear, structured manner are required.    


You will work closely with the data team as well as designers and product managers to coordinate features on a daily basis.


Responsibilities:




  • Design specialized database for storage, retrieval and computation




  • Utilize various APIs to generate new data




  • Creating smart, periodic requests to external data sets to build out data pool




  • Implements enhancements and fixes to systems and data mechanisms as needed




  • Conducts data analysis and moderately complex algorithms




  • Works with Muzooka stakeholders to identify the business requirements and the expected outcome




  • Collaborate with team to select the relevant sources of information.




  • Document results and methodologies in a way that can be easily understood by business stakeholders




  • Presents and depicts the rationale of their findings in easy to understand terms for the business. Presents back results that contradict common belief, if needed.




  • Employs the appropriate algorithm to discover patterns.




  • Create complex queries and structured data sets to be utilized for short term and long term strategies




  • Qualifies where information can be stored or what information, external to the organization, may be used in support of business objectives.




  • Collaborates with management to ensure that the information used follows the compliance, access management, and control policies and that it meets the qualification and assurance requirements of the organization




  • Recommends ongoing improvements to methods and algorithms that lead to findings, including new information.




  • Demonstrates the following scientist qualities: clarity, accuracy, precision, relevance, depth, breadth, logic, significance, and fairness.

item.title: Senior Systems Engineer at Outbox AXS LLC (Los Angeles, CA)
item.description:
The Sr. Systems Engineer is responsible for helping to develop and support a stable, available and scalable infrastructure that powers AXS.com and a suite of products that include Advantage and Data Platform (Hadoop). The scope of the position is from the system to the application service level. In the spirit of Dev-ops this position requires working closely with the internal development and big data teams. We are looking for System Engineers familiar with large scale, high traffic 24/7 production environments built in data centers and in the cloud. The ideal candidate is someone with a deep understanding of infrastructure, systems and services and how they’re built, deployed, managed and interact at scale. 


Essential Duties



  • Oversees provisioning and configuration of new systems in the cloud or at the data center

  • Work with various internal teams on issue resolution and systems management

  • First-line responsibility for isolating application-level configuration, performance and database problems

  • Performs analysis and tuning of system performance

  • Works closely with internal development and big data teams on stage and production management and deployment

  • Maintain and grow a production environment in a way that makes the system increasingly performant, stable and maintainable

  • Participates in service capacity planning and demand forecasting, software performance analysis and system tuning

  • Responds to and resolves emergent service problems by debugging systems and services

  • Interfaces with development and operations teams to perform software and systems analysis, upgrades and new deployments

  • Management of system monitoring and performance monitoring frameworks, alerting, and security policies

  • Participate in on-call rotation

item.title: AngularJS / UI Developer at ScienceTRAX (Austin, TX)
item.description:
ScienceTRAX is looking for bright, energetic, entrepreneurial minded people who want to make a difference. Yes, we build software, but we build software that helps advance medical science. The challenge of applying technology to medicine is one that drives us and if it drives you, then this might be the right place for you.


We’re building data collection and analysis software to facilitate medical research.  Through the use of our web-based application, our customers collect patient information, send patient surveys, manage clinical trials and much more. Powerful data analytics is then used to find trends and correlations to turn the data into information that can then be used to improve patient care.


StudyTRAX prototyping is done using Balsamiq for Confluence.  As a developer, you will help develop and refine the prototypes and then implement them using AngulerJS. Being a small team, each developer makes a significant contribution to the product.  We are constantly evolving and updating our tools to keep up with the rapidly changing environment.


One big advantage to this job is that you will be working from home.  This allows for an extremely flexible working environment and it makes for a short commute :)

item.title: Senior Developer, API/Backend (Python) at National Geographic Society (Washington, DC)
item.description: The National Geographic Society is seeking a Senior API/Services Developer to lead the development of our APIs and web services that power thought-provoking content experiences and communities that inspire people to care about the planet.  Responsibilities include growing the Python expertise on the team as we build our next generation of APIs and web services, ensuring the success of these applications, and working with the rest of the team on the continued development of our technical landscape.  Scalability, availability, code quality, and accelerated delivery should be part of the daily process, in a highly collaborative agile project environment. No supervision  exercised.

item.title: Business Intelligence Analyst at Sainsbury's (London, UK)
item.description:
Sainsbury’s, one of the UK’s largest retailers is investing heavily in digital innovation - its aim being to build a centre of excellence where digital output is shaped using leading best practice frameworks and methodologies to produce the world class apps and services. The team is growing rapidly and looking for talented colleagues to help deliver ambitious and market leading services that live up to Sainsbury’s industry leading reputation.



We are looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst to work as part of the BI team, transforming our data and analytics capabilities. That means providing our colleagues with as little as three clicks and 30 seconds to access information, three minutes to insight and a real focus on driving actions to deliver value to the business.



As a BI Analyst, you’ll:



  • Assist the business with their questions/ challenges by building custom scripts, analysis, analytics and insight (using tools such as SAS, R, Python, Tableau, MS-SQL, D3)

  • Provide statistical analysis, build analytical models, handle data and reporting and deliver visualizations in the form of interactive dashboards

  • Work on multiple projects relating to BI and Analytics, working both cross functionally and independently

  • Show a genuine interest in new technologies and tools for analytics purposes, trying out new tools and approaches through hackathons, data drives and POCs

item.title: Software Engineer - Hotel Data Management at trivago GmbH (Düsseldorf, Deutschland)
item.description:
For our headquarters in Dusseldorf, Germany, we’re looking for an experienced developer to manage and further improve our core hotel data. We want someone to increase the amount and quality of metadata we have by analysing, investigating and interpreting data delivered by our partners and match these to our hotel data. If you have experience with fuzzy string matching, utilizing text retrieval, machine learning and other optimization techniques, and are confident tackling over 700,000 hotels worth of data then we want to hear from you!


Your tasks:



  • Evaluate partners’ datasets for potential inclusion into the trivago hotel search.

  • Develop and optimize intelligent algorithms to determine matching of entities in 31 languages.

  • Leverage big data and machine learning techniques to improve our automated matching process.

  • Improve the overall quality of our hotel information by developing systems that reduce the risk of duplicate data. We encourage thinking outside the box!

  • Experiment with our cutting edge technologies to investigate and correct anomalies within the data.

  • Analyse and improve efficiency, scalability and stability of our current processes by taking them apart and rebuilding them in your own innovative way.

  • Become the technical interface for our content-related development teams and technical account managers and help them decipher all matching related issues.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer, Brand at Quantcast (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Quantcast is a large scale, data driven organization that lives and breathes data, processing well over a million transactions a second. The Brand team builds large scale pipelines that let us target online users across the web and mobile apps. Quantcast engineers leverage our large datasets, computational power and analytic tools to build high quality and diverse targeting products that support Quantcast’s position as a world class leader in online advertising.


We are looking for people with strong engineering and big data experience to expand our Brand targeting capabilities. As a Senior Software Engineer you will design and build systems to identify the right users to target to drive clients’ brand goals. You will collaborate with other engineers and work on a variety of large scale systems including our Mapreduce cluster and global realtime bidding system.


Responsibilities




  • Develop software and techniques to target online users at a large scale




  • Lead software projects through the full technical life cycle, from design and development through deployment and support




  • Work with other engineering teams to coordinate brand targeting projects with other performance advertising projects




  • Work with product management and client services to gather project requirements and communicate project impacts

item.title: Java Engineer at Arria NLG (Surry Hills, Australia)
item.description: At Arria NLG, we develop software that uses bleeding-edge artificial intelligence technology to create natural language text that describes and explains diverse data sets. We’re looking for Software Engineers with commercial experience in developing Java applications to join us in building disruptive content creation applications, covering the full pipeline from data ingestion through data analytics and interpretation to the presentation of information in articulate natural language combined with cool graphics.

item.title: Software Development Engineer - Big Data at Hotels.com (London, UK)
item.description:
Are you an engineer who wants to work for a strong and innovative online travel technology company? Do you have a passion for turning data into meaningful information? Does working on a world-class analytics platform backed by a cutting edge Big Data implementation scaling to hundreds of terabytes any interest? Do you want to work with (and learn how to use) the latest Big Data technologies in the Hadoop ecosystem? 

Expedia Inc. the largest Online Travel Agency is looking for an experienced, highly motivated, self-directed Software Development Engineer to join the Hotels.com technology team.  In this role you will be responsible for the delivery of solutions on top of the Hadoop big data platform and will play a key role in a huge technology pivot. This entails working with the delivery team and business partners to flesh out requirements, complete solution design, development and ultimate delivery to the end consumers.  Our team has experience using a wide range of technologies and many years of Hadoop experience so we guarantee that you won't be bored and will learn a lot. We are also constantly looking for ways to improve our development methodologies and welcome fresh ideas and approaches


Responsibilities



  • Develop various facets of the Hadoop EDW Java/Hadoop ecosystem

  • Write clear, efficient, tested code

  • Develop code as part of a wider team through pair programming and code reviews

  • Contribute to both program and system architecture

  • Evolve development standards and design patterns

  • Work with business stakeholders to flesh out and deliver on requirements in an agile manner

  • Deploy and maintain applications in production environments

  • Communicate and document solutions and design decisions.

item.title: Front-End JavaScript Engineer @ high-growth DC startup FiscalNote at FiscalNote, Inc. (Washington, DC) (allows remote)
item.description:
About Engineering at FiscalNote
Our team has a wealth of diverse life and career experiences that allow us to think outside of the box and ahead of the curve. And we laugh – all the time. You'll get the opportunity to work at an institution pushing the boundaries of open data transparency, while collaborating with some of the industry’s brightest engineers and data scientists to devise, nurture, and implement cutting-edge solutions to continuously evolving engineering obstacles.


About the Position
Willy Wonka said “We are the dreamers of dreams.” Well, FiscalNote front-end engineers are the architects that make our open data dreams come true. Wild ambition isn’t lacking at FiscalNote, and only the most talented can visualize open-data products that have never been built before. Our front-end engineers love what they do, and they are on a mission to continuously improve upon and build the most beautiful and useful user interfaces the open data world has ever seen.


About You
Creative. Ambitious. Communicative. Driven.  You yearn to exercise your abilities in a greater capacity than on a tiny feature of a much larger product. Lending your talents across our entire stack, you not only love sharing your savvy with the team, but also crave the opportunity to absorb any and all knowledge from our hyper-collaborative environment. Your appreciation (bordering on obsession) for clean code and attention to detail have helped you shine brightly at previous positions. You’re tickled by the idea of implementing inventive uses of older technologies, but even more revved at the idea of leveraging the most modern front-end tools, frameworks, and languages. Most of all, though, you live to engineer creative interfaces that take the user experience to a whole new level.


You Have
- 2+ years of industry experience programming in JavaScript
- Expertise with HTML5 and CSS3
- Expertise with jQuery
- Knowledge of algorithms, data structures and Object Oriented programming
- Knowledge of and experience with JavaScript MV* frameworks. Ember.js is highly recommended.
- Undergraduate and/or graduate degree in engineering, computer science, or related technical field (<i>Preferred</i>)
- Proficient with Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, or related design software (<i>Preferred</i>)
- UI/UX design experience (<i>Ideal</i>)


In becoming a FiscalNoter, you’ll enjoy a plethora of benefits that you would expect at both an established company and at a startup. More importantly, though, is the opportunity to develop software that impacts real decisions -- decisions that substantially affect governing in the US and abroad. You will hone your engineering skills among peers just as motivated and skilled as you are, and in the process, develop a tight-knit camaraderie that will transcend simple software development.
