item.title: Algorithmic Software Engineer (junior/senior) (Berlin, Dublin) at Zalando SE (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
THE OPPORTUNITY



As a Zalando Algorithms Software Engineer, you will design and build the personalization, recommendation and optimization engines driving customer experiences enjoyed by millions of people. Whether junior- or senior-level, you will have the freedom to challenge our status-quo and help us define best practices for how we work. And you will be able to launch your own open source projects, contribute to others’ projects, build internal community around your interests, and strengthen your personal brand - while receiving meaningful support at every step.



WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR  



  • A degree in mathematics, physics, statistics or computer science

  • At least one year of professional experience programming in Java, Scala, or Python

  • Solid knowledge of algorithms and data structures

  • Strong analytical and critical thinking skills and a demonstrated ability to find creative solutions to technical algorithmic problems

  • Enthusiasm for microservices architectures, distributed systems and RESTful APIs

  • Knowledge of current trends in software design, architecture and web services

  • English language fluency


Additional preferred skills



  • Knowledge of applied machine learning / data mining techniques

  • Knowledge of graph theory, combinatorics and optimization methods

  • Experience with building and / or running large-scale applications

  • Experience with building applications using large data sets

  • Knowledge of R or other machine learning tools (Mahout, Spark, etc.)



YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Research, design and implement algorithms to improve our recommendation, personalization and optimization engines

  • Write code that your peers praise for its elegance and readability

  • Communicate effectively with our engineering, data science and algorithmic research teams and use agile processes

  • Be accountable for all aspects of your work, from research and analysis to testing and deployment



WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM US



  • One-month mentoring program

  • Internal tech talks, skills-building courses and technical “People Leads” who help you achieve mastery

  • Personal branding support: From preparing tech talks and blog posts to networking with industry leaders

  • Community: hack week’s, movie nights, coder dojos, +70 self-organized tech guilds and more

  • Competitive salary

  • Zalando shopping discount and commute discount

  • Relocation assistance for internationals



ABOUT ZALANDO


Zalando is Europe’s leading online fashion platform, doing business in 15 markets. Delivering first-class shopping experiences to our +15 million customers requires moving fast — with microservices, Agile processes and autonomous teams  —  and using cutting-edge, open source technologies. We are passionate about what we do and have fun while doing it. And we are willing to experiment and make mistakes: It’s how we grow.



WANT TO JOIN US? THEN GO AHEAD AND APPLY!


If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring processes, please contact recruiter Elena Ognyanova at jobs@zalando.de.

item.title: Software Engineer (Java) at EMBL-EBI (Hinxton, UK)
item.description:
We are seeking to recruit an experienced Software Engineer to work on the OpenMinTeD H2020 project, to create an e-infrastructure that fosters and facilitates the use of text and data mining technologies in scientific publications. You will join the Cheminformatics and Metabolism team at the European Bioinformatics Institute (EMBL-EBI) located at the Wellcome Genome Campus near Cambridge in the UK.

You will work with the OpenMinTeD consortium on the BioMedical use case for this consortium. You will also develop the curation tool for the ChEBI database at EBI and integrate the solutions produced by the OpenMinTeD consortium. Towards this end, you need to have excellent software engineering capabilities and be able to understand and implement software according to user requirements.

The EBI is part of the European Molecular Biology Laboratory (EMBL) and it is a world-leading bioinformatics centre providing biological data to the scientific community with expertise in data storage, analysis and representation. EMBL-EBI provides freely available data from life science experiments, performs basic research in computational biology and offers an extensive user training programme, supporting researchers in academic and industry.

item.title: Computer Science Trainer at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:

Bloomberg R&D is responsible for creating and maintaining all functions within the Bloomberg Professional Service. Our team works with the latest technologies and provides training for a technical staff of more than 2,000.

Bloomberg R&D's training team is looking for an experienced, hands-on software professional to prepare and deliver technical training to R&D developers and other internal customers. Our team works closely with other parts of R&D to analyze technical training needs and to provide training for job skills, professional development programs and graduate training. It is essential that candidates have technical expertise gained through practical programming experience, as well as advanced training experience, including the ability to apply that practical experience to communicate technical concepts effectively in a training environment.

item.title: Python Software Engineer at CodiLime Sp. z o.o. (Warszawa, Polska)
item.description:
CodiLime realizes projects for clients from all over the world, e.g. California, Japan, Israel, Malta and Scandinavia, rendering services to such companies as NTT, AT&T, Hitachi High Technologies, Juniper Networks, GigaSpaces, Mirantis.We work with cutting edge IT technologies in the following areas: Machine Learning & BigData, Cloud Computing, Software Defined Network. We code in Python, Java, Scala i C++, and use various tools, technologies and frameworks, including Celery, Hadoop, Spark, Flask, AngularJS. We work in accordance with Agile methodologies and Clean Code practices using tools such as JIRA, Jenkins or Gerrit.


Examples of projects under realization:


1. Together with our client’s team we take part in developing an open source system for management of complex cloud applications. Our task is to develop parts of the system responsible for monitoring virtual machines as well as processes taking place there and to produce an appropriate reaction of the system to the noticed problems. Additionally, we also work on integrating the system with other open source systems, such as Docker, SaltStack, JBoss, etc. Technologies: Python, Celery, Riemann, RabbitMQ, Cloud (OpenStack, AWS),Vagrant.


2. We create a system that predicts failures of medical devices. This is a two-phase project. At the first stage an IT system is designed for uploading measurement data from the devices, dividing calculations into a set of tasks, running them in parallel and presenting the results. The second phase includes time series (sensor data) analytics and estimating the risk of failure of given device. Technologies: Python, Celery, RabbitMQ, Azure.

  • Support continuous improvements to our development processes

  • Evolve  existing  software  system  applications  and  architecture  in  various  areas  as  needed; ensure that systems are robust to high usage and resilient to failures

  • Coach and motivate team members to achieve optimum performance levels and career development

  • Teach, learn and innovate

item.title: Frontend Developer /Visualization Expert at Zalando SE (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
The opportunity


Welcome to Zalando, one of the most exciting places for data science in Europe. At Zalando, love for fashion meets enthusiasm for top-notch data-driven technology. Within six years, we have become Europe’s largest online fashion store and we believe that a deep understanding of customer wishes and fashion trends is key for continuing this success story. To develop and enlarge this understanding, we are building one of the strongest data science teams in the business world. Our current projects include product recommendation, automatic fraud detection, customer segmentation and much more. We harness huge amounts of data from many different sources, create statistical models and develop and apply state-of-the-art algorithms. We are looking for you to join our team – to start immediately, in a permanent role and at our beautiful Berlin location.


What we are looking for



  • You have at least two years of work experience as frontend developer

  • You know JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3/LESS by heart and are able to create interactive prototypes out of thin air

  • You have experience with single page application frameworks like angular, backbone, ember, Meteor or Knockout

  • You are familiar with modern build tools like grunt or gulp

  • You keep up to date with latest developments in web technology

  • Experience with data visualization libraries like D3.js is a plus

  • Our team likes to work hard, but also to nurture a friendly and casual work environment. Joining coffee breaks is highly recommended to get to know your team members and it would also be great if you could help organize team events from time to time

  • It would be great if you want to work fulltime, but if you want only do part time, we will find a solution

  • We don’t need your date of birth or a picture of you in your application


Portfolio


We would like to get to know how you work. Please include an example of a project you are proud of in your application. You can send us a link, screenshots or anything that allows us to get a first idea of your style in a few minutes.


Your responsibilities



  • You will design and implement tools and visualizations that allow users to understand data analyses and interact with them

  • You will collaborate with data scientists, developers and product managers within an agile workflow to produce high quality outcome for challenging tasks

  • You will take responsibility for the whole lifecycle of the visualization projects, from choosing the technical platform, to creating UI designs /mockups and implementing them, right up to presenting results


What you can expect from us



  • A corporate culture where your skills are judged only by your results – our motto: wear sneakers, not ties

  • An international team of colleagues who will both inspire and offer you support

  • Training and further development opportunities to expand your skills and help you on your way

  • Free fruit and drinks, spacious kitchens and areas where you can relax

  • You’ll never get bored, there’s always something going on at Zalando

  • Attractive employee discounts in our online shop

  • Powerful hardware system environment on your desk, in a cluster and in the cloud


About Zalando


Zalando is Europe’s leading online fashion platform, doing business in 15 markets. Delivering first-class shopping experiences to our +15 million customers requires moving fast — with microservices, Agile processes & autonomous teams  —  and using cutting edge, open source technologies. We are passionate about what we do and have fun while doing it. And we are willing to experiment and make mistakes: It’s how we grow.


Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!


If you need guidance or have any questions about our recruiting and hiring processes, please contact recruiter Sameer Shaikh at jobs@zalando.de

item.title: Web Developer - Full Stack at HERE a Nokia Company (Berkeley, CA)
item.description:
Senior Web Developer/Tools Engineer



HERE Reality Lens Introduction:


Nokia HERE is a global leader in the mapping and location intelligence business. HERE Reality Lens utilizes advanced reality capture technologies to collect, process, and publish petabytes of street-level, aerial, and indoor spatial data to customers in over 72 countries around the world. These software and data services, the sixth largest on AWS, allow users to visualize high-resolution 3D panoramic and oblique imagery while interactively measuring, mapping, and modeling.


We use a lightweight agile process aimed at customer-driven milestones and give our engineers freedom in how they approach technical challenges. Engineering teams are supported with a highly automated continuous integration and deployment infrastructure.


Senior Web Developer / Tools Engineer:


As Senior Web Developer / Tools Engineer, you would help Reality Lens execute on our product vision, create great products, and make a great working environment. Your day will consist of tasks like researching, designing, implementing, and testing software. You should be a quick learner and communicate well. You're a team player who loves to both code and mentor others.


Ideal candidates will have developed and delivered scalable, robust API-driven services and data pipelines.



Responsibilities:



  • Create Canvas/WebGL and DOM-based solutions integrating 2D maps, 3D imagery and point clouds (aka “Smart Cities”).

  • Design and implement web-based tools for managing live operations and other shared platform services using a Node.js technology stack.

  • Integrate software with HERE platforms, processes, pipelines, and products.

  • Choose and implement analysis and design patterns and algorithms that enable systems or features to meet business and technical requirements.

  • Design data models for SQL and NoSQL databases and caches. (MySQL, MongoDB, Redis).

item.title: Linux Engineer; DevOps at 1010data (New York, NY)
item.description:
1010data has created the fastest database in the world via an easy-to-use, spreadsheet-like interface to make big data discovery easy across retail, consumer packaged goods, financial services, healthcare and telecom.


We are Seeking a Dev Ops, Linux Engineer skilled with handling large production environments to expand, automate and maintain our Linux fleet. 


With more than 20 trillion rows of data currently under management, 1010data is designed to scale to the largest volumes of granular data, the most disparate and varied data sets, and the biggest user populations. All while delivering lightning-quick system performance. 


If you have a passion for high performance computing you will be instrumental in building tools to manage a highly scalable, 24/7 available platform for data analysis. 



With a focus on scripting, process re-engineering and continuous integration; you blend the skills of an analyst with the technical chops of an engineer to architect solutions on issues that affect the entire company.


If you value the power of driving strategic vendor decisions and are confident in embracing new technologies to tackle our high volume, scalable problems we would like to speak with you! 


Responsibilities:



  • Scaling, managing and automating our Linux fleet as 1010data grows. 

  • Automate the management of cloud computing infrastructure

  • Build out HA/DR computing solutions

  • Ensure the overall health and performance of production environment

  • Proactively identify trends, determine root causes, and initiate appropriate action to resolve issues. 

  • Investigate and resolve hardware and software issues

  • Responsible for production systems sometimes after hours or weekends.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at SugarCRM (Cupertino, CA)

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - Machine Learning, Performance Targeting at Quantcast (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
The Performance Targeting & Optimization team’s mission is to help our customers understand their audience better and to deliver relevant advertising across all mediums on the Internet. The team builds and operates realtime prediction and control systems that power all our advertising products at scale. This means getting up-close and personal with cutting edge statistical models and machine learning techniques. You’ll have the opportunity to leverage Quantcast’s massive computing power to build tens of thousands of machine learned models, and to use these models to make over 2 million advertising decisions per second.


We are looking for top-tier senior talent to lead our efforts in designing, implementing and operating large scale ML systems in a production environment. The successful applicant will have industry experience applying techniques like classification, clustering and control optimization to solve big data problems. You’ll work within a machine learning group that is obsessed with improving the state of the art in performance advertising. You’ll take full ownership of the development and operation of ML systems to run advertising campaigns at a global scale. You’ll also introduce new products aimed at providing a complete targeting solution for our advertisers.


The team also works closely with our scientific advisors, Stanford professors Jerome Friedman and Trevor Hastie. As leaders in the fields of data mining and statistics, both professors take an active interest in Quantcast and our ongoing work.


Responsibilities



  • Design, build and operate large scale machine learning systems and supporting infrastructure.

  • Develop techniques to efficiently extract meaning from petabytes of data.

  • Improve existing ad targeting products and introduce new end-to-end products to delight our customers.

  • Interface with Product & Business Operations teams to translate business requirements into robust and scalable solutions.

item.title: Sr. Software Developer at Advion, Inc. (Ithaca, NY)
item.description:
Advion, Inc., with headquarters in Ithaca, NY, designs, develops, and manufactures mass spectrometers, chip-based ion sources, and microfluidic flow chemistry systems and consumables for the life sciences and related industries. We are the growing supplier of choice for our industrial and academic customers who are demanding accurate mass analysis, higher synthetic yields/throughput, and more productive research and scale-up. We are currently seeking a Sr. Software Developer to join our team in Ithaca.



The Sr. Software Developer will design, develop, and test software products used for controlling, acquiring data, and performing post-data analysis in complex laboratory instruments. Responsibilities include:



  • Software system architecture, API, instrument communication, and software installation

  • Supporting OEM’s application developments using Advion’s API.

  • Testing and troubleshooting software to help identify and resolve hardware, firmware, and software problems

  • Maintaining existing C/C++/Java/C#/Linux code

As the Senior Software Development Engineer, you will work on an agile team in the big data arena, building the infrastructure to support AudienceScience® Helios, a global media buying platform using real-time bidding and behavioral targeting technologies. We currently handle upwards of 9 billion requests per day, aggregating all of this data on our Hadoop clusters. Distributed systems experience a big plus and Hadoop experience an even bigger plus.

item.title: Senior Machine Learning Scientist, Personalization at Booking.com (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Would you like to translate terabytes of data into unforgettable holidays for millions of people around the globe? Booking.com, the world’s largest accommodation booking website, is looking for rock star Data Scientists to add to join our highly successful Personalization Team within the Front End department.


This team crunches endless amounts of data to provide our customers with the best possible experience. They focus on anything from understanding and predicting market data, to ranking all properties on our website, and providing our customers with the most relevant personalized recommendations.


B.responsible



  • Work in a multi-disciplined team where you’ll take full ownership of turning discoveries and ideas into machine learning models. You’ll use the model’s output to create and improve products for our customers, preferably in short development cycles

  • Research on how to improve customers’ experience, by using our vast amount of data

  • Actively contribute to taking data science at Booking.com to the next level

item.title: Hadoop System Engineer at Cognitive Medical Systems (San Diego, CA)

item.title: Java Developer at Altamira Technologies (Chantilly, VA)
item.description:
Altamira is a top open source technology company in the national security space. Headquartered in McLean, Virginia, Altamira serves the defense, intelligence and homeland security communities by focusing on creating innovative solutions leveraging common standards in architecture, data and security.


If you would like to be part of an Agile software development group working on challenging, cutting-edge applications for our customers, send us your resume!  In this position you’ll be able to create software utilizing technologies such as: Hadoop, Accumulo, Apache Storm, RabbitMQ, OpenNLP, OpenCV, jQuery, AngularJS, D3.js, AWS and many more.


Position Description


We are looking for a software engineer to build scalable back-end features for an emerging open source Big Data analysis and visualization platform called Lumify.  This platform offers exciting challenges for processing various types of structured and unstructured data to create a top-notch distributed system.


If you’re a passionate engineer who enjoys working with talented peers in a result-oriented environment, check out the project at http://lumify.io and contact us to join our team!

item.title: Implementation Developer at Stevens Capital Management LP (Wayne, PA)
item.description:
Stevens Capital Management LP (“SCM”) is a registered investment adviser with more than sixty employees that manages a multi-billion dollar hedge fund that has been in business for 20+ years.


SCM specializes in the rigorous development and disciplined implementation of empirically based quantitative trading strategies. Our highly productive team works in a fast-paced collegial environment, utilizing extensive data sets, technology and the scientific method to devise and employ trading strategies throughout the world’s most liquid financial markets.


We’re looking for exceptional candidates for the following position:


Implementation Software Developer


We're seeking highly driven, production-oriented developers who possess strong technical skills and the ability to work in a fast-paced collaborative environment. 


Primary Responsibilities



  • Develop and support multi-threaded applications with a strong emphasis on high performance.

  • Optimize our trading strategy implementation and performance analysis platform using network and systems programming.

  • Create tools to process, store and analyze quote, order and financial data.

  • Work closely with our quantitative research analysts, engineers and other groups to provide software solutions.


Requirements



  • Professional-level C++ programming experience in a Linux environment.

  • A Computer Science or Mathematics degree.

  • Outstanding problem solving skills.

  • Knowledge of shell scripts and other languages including Perl, Bash or CSH is a plus.

  • Experience with relational databases including Sybase, SQL Server and Oracle is a plus.

  • Experience with GUI design is a plus.

item.title: Software Engineer at Google (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
Google aspires to be an organization that reflects the globally diverse audience that our products and technology serve. We believe that in addition to hiring the best talent, a diversity of perspectives, ideas and cultures leads to the creation of better products and services.


Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how millions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our ambitions reach far beyond just Search. Our products need to handle information at the the scale of the web. We're looking for ideas from every area of computer science, including information retrieval, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking, security, data compression, and user interface design; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you work on a small team and can switch teams and projects as our fast-paced business grows and evolves. We need our engineers to be versatile and passionate to tackle new problems as we continue to push technology forward. 



Responsibilities


  • Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve software.

  • Manage individual project priorities, deadlines and deliverables.

item.title: Data Engineer at Essence (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Company:

Essence is a global digital agency and the world’s largest independent buyer of digital media. We blend data science, objective media and captivating experiences to build valuable connections between brands and consumers. Clients include Google, HP, Method, and Barclays. The agency is more than 480 people strong, manages over $700MM in media spend and deploys campaigns in 71 markets via offices in London, New York, San Francisco, Seattle, Singapore and Tokyo. Visit essencedigital.com for more information, and follow us on Twitter at @essencedigital.

The Role:

We are looking for a Data Developer who can write clean well designed Python and PL/SQL in a timely and scalable way. You must have strong experience building and optimizing ETL processes in a heterogeneous environment (Oracle 11g, PostgresSQL).


We’d like you to:

  • Develop new features and tools as needed

item.title: DevOps Engineer at Preact (San Francisco, CA)
item.description: Our Infrastructure team is responsible for maintaining and improving custom automation tools to configure servers and interface with AWS.  You will setup monitoring and alerting to ensure stability and continuity of our various services and machines.  You will plan and manage to ensure our infrastructure and operational needs are met as the company expands and our product continues to grow. You will communicate and plan with the Engineering, Science, Product and Customer Success teams.  You will take part in our 24/7 on-call rotation.  You will test and choose new technologies best suited for upcoming product features.

item.title: Senior Big Data / Cloud Architect - Bloomberg Vault at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:

Bloomberg is looking for a Senior Software Developer for our cloud-based real-time content filtering and monitoring platform for e-mail, instant messaging, voice and social media data. The service is part of Bloomberg Vault.

Bloomberg Vault is a startup in Bloomberg Enterprise group developing a cloud-based compliance archiving service, eDiscovery tools and real-time compliance monitoring infrastructure. Our software, which is hosted in Bloomberg's private cloud, has gained rapid market adoption with over 700 enterprises and archives over 60 billion messages.

With the explosive growth of social media and web collaboration data real-time content filtering and monitoring is a crucial requirement for business of any size to stay compliant with regulations. Our infrastructure process over 200 million messages a day checking content and interaction patterns and providing analytics and event-driven reporting.

We are looking for experienced software developers who are or want to become experts in areas such as geo-distribution, real-time processing, service hosting, message orchestration, high-available, fault-tolerant and low latency computation.

Candidates must be able to work independently to find a path to success by researching and recommending alternatives when faced with challenging situations. Candidates should have a passion for technology and a flexible, creative approach to problem solving. They should be able to take ownership of business requirements and devise and develop solutions that meet customer needs. Time to market is critical.

item.title: Open Source Software Engineer - Pivotal at Pivotal (Palo Alto, CA)
item.description:
Pivotal is looking for a few great engineers to join our GemFire/Apache Geode engineering team. Apache Geode (currently in incubation) is a distributed, in-memory, and transactional datastore designed to provide very high throughput with predictable latency. GemFire is built on Apache Geode and is deployed throughout the world by demanding customers serving mission-critical applications in financial, telecommunications, retail, and transportation industries.


You


You have a passion for large distributed systems to manage data on a massive scale. You love building highly concurrent systems that are also fault tolerant and extremely reliable. You follow current trends in topics such as stream processing and in-memory computing. You’d really like to believe there’s a way to defy the CAP theorem and get consistency, availability, and partition tolerance all in the same system (even if no one else has managed to do that yet). Above all, you love shipping software as a member of a collaborative team.


Us


At Pivotal, our mission is to enable customers to build a new class of applications, leveraging big and fast data, and do all of this with the power of cloud-independence. Pivotal’s offering includes the Big Data Suite, the most complete approach to enterprise data lakes and advanced analytics; Pivotal Cloud Foundry, the industry leading Platform as a Service product; and world leading ultra-agile application development through Pivotal Labs. Open source is an important part of our strategy. Many of our products are already open source; those that are not will be soon. 


The Big Data Suite includes HAWQ, our SQL on Hadoop solution; Greenplum Database (GPDB), our massively parallel data warehouse; GemFire, our distributed in-memory key-value store; and MADlib, our machine learning solution.


The GemFire/Apache Geode engineering team at Pivotal tackles challenges that come with massively parallel distributed systems operating at extreme scale to achieve incredibly low latency transactions. We delve into areas like stream processing, query optimization, parallel function execution, scalable distributed data structures, fault-tolerance paradigms, and peer-to-peer messaging. Here at Pivotal you'll be working on hard problems with a collaborative team, accelerating your growth as an engineer.


Where


GemFire engineering is located in our light-filled spacious office in Beaverton, OR.To make sure you start your day energized, we provide a catered breakfast every weekday morning, and unlimited snacks/drinks are of course available all day. Our collaborative, open-plan office space is filled with talented, like-minded engineers who enjoy taking advantage of our weekly Tech Talks, playing ping pong, and hanging out with their co-workers.

item.title: Lead Software Developer, Red Bull Data Services at Red Bull Media House (Santa Monica, CA)
item.description:
As a global media company, Red Bull Media House produces, publishes, distributes and licenses high-quality programming. Millions of viewers around the globe experience our TV and video products through Red Bull TV, a global digital video service with a growing portfolio of applications on key platforms including Apple TV, Xbox, Chromecast, iOS, Android, Amazon Fire TV as well as select Smart TV devices.


The Lead engineer within the Red Bull TV data services group will be responsible for the creation and maintenance of data collection, collation and analysis services to support the operation of the TV platform. The data will include video reporting, social streams, web content; click stream and application level elements. Outputs from this data will include recommendations, real time dashboards, quality of services insights, event reporting as well as several other business level reporting requirements.

The candidate would focus mainly on the front end of our real time trading system in C# and may also work in C++ on the server side, which assembles and distributes data to the front end. We strive for strong abstractions that allow for fast iteration, easy integration and short development cycles, allowing us to constantly learn from our data and empowering our clients to apply these insights toward product enhancements.

item.title: Dev Ops Engineer at Datto Inc (Boston, MA)
item.description:
Datto® is the leading provider of comprehensive data backup, recovery and business continuity solutions with over five million end points protected and approximately 3,500 active revenue generating partners worldwide and growing. With its Total Data Protection Platform Datto’s mission is to protect business data everywhere it resides, whether on premise, in virtualized environments, in the cloud, and software-as-a-service (SaaS) applications including Salesforce, Google Apps, and more. Datto stores in its purpose built cloud over 140 petabytes of data worldwide for businesses ranging from Fortune 500 enterprises to small businesses.


  Datto’s core technologies such as instant virtualization, Screenshot Backup Verification™, Inverse Chain Technology™, Backup Insights™, and end-to-end encryption are the cornerstones of its innovative solutions. Industry firsts also include 24/7/365 in-house tech support, white glove customer success support, and time-based cloud retention, that empowers its partners with predictable cloud billing. The Datto product line consists of the Datto SIRIS Family, Datto ALTO Family, Datto NAS and Datto Backupify.

item.title: Machine Learning Engineer at import.io (London, UK)
item.description:
import.io is one of the leading startups in enabling automated web data extraction. We use advanced Artificial Intelligence, NLP, Deep Learning, and Machine Learning technologies to understand contents on websites and extract entities for our knowledge graph.


import.io comprises of many different and distributed parts, and we are looking for someone who will help our complex and challenging systems evolve and grow! You will be part of the world-leading research and development team that creates our data extraction technologies like Magic.


What you'll do!



  • Research and development of algorithms to automatically extract data from web.

  • Prototyping, scaling, productising, and supporting the end-to-end pipeline of algorithms.

  • Collaborating with other members of the team to come up with innovative and disruptive technologies for understanding web and extracting relevant data.

  • Designing, implementing and testing new patentable algorithms in the field of AI, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, NLP.


What we'd love to see!


Essential:



  • Extensive experience in working with Python.

  • Extensive experience in Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Statistical Modelling, and NLP.

  • Bachelor, Master, or PhD in Computer Science, Physics, Math, Stats.

  • Experience in working with scalable algorithms, data structures, big data technologies (e.g. Spark, Hadoop).

  • Experience with developing on Linux or Mac OS X.

  • Great communication and collaboration skills.

  • To have a great attitude, and be fun to work with.

  • To be proactive, excited by our product, and to be invested in pushing it forward


Desired:



  • Experience with Java, JavaScript, and C++.

  • Experience in data extraction, web crawling, and data indexing.

  • Experience of working with agile methodologies.

  • Open source contributions and projects (bonus point for working on web related projects).

  • Knowledge of full-stack development.

  • Experience working in startups.


What you’ll get!



  • Working for a company that has won loads of international start-up awards! We’ve been named as one of the coolest places to work (twice)! We love what we do, and who we do it with.

  • Great location - With offices in both London and San Francisco, we are in the heart of the technology scene in both the US and Europe.

  • Great people - We’ve assembled an incredibly diverse, talented and spirited team who genuinely enjoy coming to work everyday.

  • Challenges - The freedom to grow and define your own role so you can leave work everyday knowing you’ve made a difference.

  • Learning on the job - Investigating new technologies is always encouraged

  • Healthcare - You get full coverage for medical, dental, and vision insurance.

  • Paid lunches - We have catered lunch everyday and provide plenty of tasty snacks.

  • A share in the company - All employees own a part of the company.

  • Fun & Games - It’s not all work; we have movie nights, lunch activities, happy hours and a bi-annual offsite.

  • Gym membership - 50% off Virgin Active membership

  • Individual training & book budgets

  • Your choice of laptop - Mac or PC

item.title: Lead Architect - Windows/C/Power Industry at LiveData Utilities, Inc. (Cambridge, MA)
item.description:
We have an exciting opportunity to join a spearheading smartgrid IT organization in a project team developing complex event processing products that manage large data streams responsible for monitoring and maintaining the grid.
LiveData Utilities designs solutions to improve grid uptimes, operational efficiency, and customer satisfaction in the energy generation and distribution space. We are the vision leaders in Operations Technology Service Bus space.
LiveData is looking for a Windows C software engineer with complex event processing, web server development, and data exchange experience to develop our next generation OTSB product: an enterprise class software that is ingesting sensor data from numerous external data sources, processing & monitoring those data streams at the rate of tens of thousands of data points per second. Significant experience with real-time systems, asynchronous event processing, network or http processing, large data processing systems.



Key Responsibilities - what you do on a daily basis



  • Lead advocate for architectural, structural, and design decisions for the product

  • Design software application components using C in a Windows environment, Python, and other programming tools that fuel core business applications

  • Develop next generation complex event processing systems & components to replace and extend legacy systems 

  • Find bugs and eliminate them. Cleaning up old and broken code should rank high on your list of therapeutic activities.

  • Knowledge Share. We operate in a fast paced environment, and you will frequently pair with other team members. We want you to share your expertise, making everyone else better and facilitating continuous learning

  • Create reusable processes, components and tools that others can leverage to accelerate progress

  • Stay up to date on the latest technology trends and techniques – and be prepared to propose new ideas when there is strong business value.

item.title: Production Programmer at Wiland, Inc. (Niwot, CO)
item.description:
Wiland is seeking dedicated, high caliber professionals who are smart and energetic, have a positive attitude and take pride in their work. Currently, we have an opening for a Production Programmer. The Production Programmer will focus on customizations needed to process incoming data and produce high quality output files to be sent to our Clients/Customers. This position requires broad knowledge of relational databases, UNIX commands, shell and Perl scripting, and multiple data file formats. Tasks and responsibilities of the Production Programmer position include:



  1. Write high quality SQL statements that will be included in both production and custom jobs.

  2. Use existing software tools and create new tools to produce output files to fulfill custom requests from Clients.

  3. Provide Tier 1 support, as designated, to the rest of Wiland’s organization for all internally developed applications and systems.

  4. Investigate and resolve data or system problems causing unexpected results.

  5. Support the Data Management team in conversions of incoming data files.

  6. Contribute in the specification and development of tools and systems to make jobs easier, less error prone, and more efficient.

  7. Use Wiland’s ticket tracking system (Jira) to maintain a record of all tasks performed and actions taken.

item.title: GO Software Engineer - Machine Learning Startup at Voleon Capital Management (Berkeley, CA)

The firm researches and deploys systematic trading strategies designed to generate attractive returns without being dependent on the performance of the overall market.


We seek candidates with a proven track record of writing correct, well-designed software, solving hard problems, and delivering complex projects on time. item.title: Senior Front-End Engineer at Synthace Ltd. (London, UK)
item.description:
Synthace Ltd. are looking for a talented and experienced front end engineer to spearhead development of the AnthaOS user interface.


Antha is a high level language transforming biological engineering by turning laboratory protocols into executable code defining physical operations such as liquid handling alongside logical operations and data processing. AnthaOS defines the execution environment for Antha processes and defines a number of front-end components for users to manage jobs, track stocks and examine data in addition to custom interfaces for more specialised purposes.


Day-to-day, you’ll be working with a tight-knit, multidisciplinary development team on an exciting project with plenty of technical challenge to get your teeth into. Technically, you’ll be delivering a web-based front end in Google Polymer across both mobile and desktop platforms, handling backend communications via SocketIO and RESTful services. Personally, you will be as meticulous in your attention to detail as you are uncompromising in your commitment to maintaining first class development practices and making user experience the first priority, values you will actively encourage in others.

item.title: Software Engineer at Hachi Labs (Bangalore, India)
item.description:
Come help us create the future of Hachi!


WE:
- at http://gohachi.com - are solving the problem of how people find and reach out to each other - a google map for people and relationships.
- Use PHP, MySQL, Neo4j, Sphinx, AWS, Git
- Are seeing excellent user-traction
- Have 41M+ people on Hachi. And their Billion+ relationships.
- Featured by MIT Tech Review, Techcrunch, Business Insider, and others
- Recipient of California Excellence Award 2013 (for software), Nominee World Technology Award 2012 (presented in association w/ TIME, CNN, Fortune, Technology Review, Science & Kurzweil AI; co nominees - Instagram, Pinterest)
- Have tons of data-engineering and data-science problems for you to solve.


WHAT WE ARE LOOKING TO DO -
- We have some technical debt that we accumulated - blame it on inexperience, hurry to keep up with user-growth, adding more features, etc. Now we want to fix things and put a rock solid platform for future growth.
- Oh, and we cannot stop scaling, so we need to re-architect things while meeting demand-growth.
- And we also need to add new features, to keep our competitive edge.


YOU:
- Cringe when you look at bad code and bad practices. But instead of complaining, you set things right, even educate others
- Are a really strong developer, with 4-6 years of experience (2-3 years of PHP experience highly preferred)
- Have experience with database / query tuning and performance.
- Polyglots get bonus points. Experience across different types of languages gets mega-bonus points. Open source contributors get a red-carpet welcome to the interview.
- Have experience working with a legacy system and then incrementally re-architecting things, adding tests, etc.
- Are disciplined about unit testing, continuous-integration and other good habits (honestly, we are not yet there and we'd like your help)
- Are a good communicator.
- Believe in data-driven decisions.


IF INTERESTED:
Check out the product and give us your critical analysis. Share your Github profile along with resume. Email at: careers@gohachi.com.

item.title: Scientific Software Lead, Proteomics at Novartis Institutes for BioMedical Research (Cambridge, MA)

At Novartis Institutes for BioMedical Research (NIBR), the NIBR Informatics team (NX) serves the global NIBR research community to provide best of breed, bleeding edge informatics platforms as well as in-depth data analysis services. Members of this group have a chance to participate in groundbreaking biomedical research activities to re-define the grammar for medicine in the future in the post-genome era.

This candidate will work closely with scientists and software engineers to re-define the NIBR-wide informatics systems to meet the challenges from proteomics enabled drug discovery research. This person should have proven record of building effective tools for scientists in a research environment. The candidate will be expected to work as a team member and/or leading a team to deliver solutions to support NIBR’s biology and proteomics research.

item.title: Software Engineer Team Lead - Hadoop at trivago GmbH (Düsseldorf, Deutschland)

Enjoy the freedom to question established processes, broaden your horizon and develop new things to impress our 80 million users per month!

In this role you’ll have the overview of our big data architecture and implement your own ideas to strategically drive our Hadoop cluster to the next level. We want someone not only to use but to build a complex Hadoop cluster and data pipeline infrastructure. If you are passionate about using technology in creative ways and enjoy playing with big data then we want to hear from you!


Your tasks:

  • Coach and mentor a growing team in an Apache Hadoop environment. On this note you will support the recruitment process of further team members and liaise with HR to devise innovative approaches to finding the next Hadoop prodigy.
