item.title: Senior Ruby on Rails Application Developer at Weather Telematics Inc. (Ottawa, ON, Canada)
item.description:
Position Summary


Weather Telematics is pursuing candidates that are looking to get in on the ground floor of a fast paced innovative startup, poised for growth.  The company recently moved into is new open concept R&D headquarters located in the character rich Hintonburg neighbourhood of Ottawa.  The company is currently raising financing and is hiring self motivated individuals that thrive in a flexible and agile corporate culture, where their ideas are heard and aligned with the corporate culture and objectives.


The Senior Application Developer is a critical member of our product infrastructure development team.  They work closely with the COO, CTO, and other developers in a scrum/agile project approach.  They are fully involved in the discovery and development stages of a distributed internet of things (IoT) framework (backend and frontend) based on an AKKA/Scala (backend) and the Ruby on Rails web framework (frontend).  The backend of the platform will involve the development of data aggregation socket services and an extensive API (potentially built on Rails).  Portions of the project will involve engaging with Machine Learning researchers to develop a set of web visualizations based on underlying data analytics developed on a Ruby on Rails platform.


Responsibilities will include maintaining existing projects and developing new applications, managing projects, delegating work, and providing assistance to junior developers.

item.title: Business Intelligence Software Engineer at Best Friends Animal Society (Kanab, UT) (allows remote)
item.description:
Come work in a warm and relaxed environment among the red rocks of Southern Utah!  We are adding to our amazing IT team and have 2 openings for Business Intelligence Software Engineers. 


Position Summary: The Business Intelligence (BI) Software Engineer’s role is to strategically design and implement BI software and systems, including integration with databases and data warehouses. This includes selecting, blueprinting, gathering requirements, designing, and rolling out BI solutions to end users. The Business Intelligence Software Engineer is also responsible for ensuring high levels of BI availability through support functions and in-depth testing.  The BI Software Engineer  will be responsible for setting the technical direction of BI projects within the framework of Enterprise Data Architecture.  The BI Software Engineer will also provide mentoring and guidance in best practices to other members of the Enterprise Data team.


Responsibilities:


Strategy and Planning (10%)



  • Assess and cultivate long-term strategic goals for BI development in conjunction with end users, managers, clients, and other stakeholders.


Acquisition and Deployment (10%)



  • Conduct research and make recommendations on BI products, services, and standards in support of procurement and development efforts. 

  • Evaluate and select database/data warehouse components, including hardware, relational database management systems, ETL software, metadata management tools, and database design solutions.


Operational Leadership (30%) 



  • Direct, organize, and lead projects in the implementation and use of new BI software tools and systems. 

  • Lead the integration efforts for merging BI platforms with enterprise systems and applications. 

  • Work with project managers to ensure that data entry, retrieval, change, and delete functions meet business requirements for project completion. 

  • Conduct job duties and responsibilities according to the organization’s business systems development methodology and/or its Systems Development Life Cycle (SDLC) methodology. 

  • Monitor alerts and troubleshoot BI tools, systems, and software; performance-tune these applications as necessary. 

  • Act as evangelist for BI benefits across the organization; promote BI usage to relevant departments.

  • Mentor and/or provide leadership to junior members of the team.


Engineering (40%) 



  • Design, code, test, and document all new or modified BI systems, applications, and programs. 

  • Develop the semantic layer, metadata, reports, and report definitions.  Develop graphs, dashboards, and portal interfaces.

  • Design databases, data models, data marts, and data warehouses. 

  • Analyze user requirements and, based upon findings, design functional solutions. 

  • Design and deliver end-user training and training materials; provide technical support as necessary.

  • Build specifications for BI front-end applications based upon user requirements. 

  • Produce ETL design guidelines to ensure a manageable ETL infrastructure for the BI system.  


Information Security (10%) 



  • Develop, test, and implement best practices within the BI ecosystem to ensure sensitive information is protected and only available to those with a need and the appropriate approved access to view the information.

item.title: Technical Engineer (Customer Success) at Logi Analytics (McLean, VA)
item.description:
COMPANY OVERVIEW



Logi Analytics enables enterprises to make better use of their data by delivering on the promise of analytics everywhere. By providing both a Web-based data discovery solution and a business information platform that can be embedded within applications, systems and processes, Logi Analytics helps its customers from the corner office to the factory floor to be more informed, make better decisions and improve corporate performance. With more than 1,200 customers worldwide, Logi Analytics meets the needs of organizations ranging from small businesses to Global 2000 enterprises. The company is headquartered in McLean, Virginia and has sales and support offices in the U.K. and Europe. Logi Analytics is a privately held, venture-backed firm with investments from Updata Partners, GroTech Ventures, Summit Partners and LLR Partners. For more information, visit LogiAnalytics.com.



SUMMARY



The Technical Engineer will assist existing customers in all aspects of the implementation, use and functional operation of Logi Analytics products. The incumbent must have a working knowledge of a wide range of technologies and serve as a contributing member of the team in technology discussions and operations. 



Responsibilities:



The range of the technical skills that are required to support the interaction between the Logi platform and client environments includes:



  • Web-based scripting technologies (JavaScript, CSS and/or HTML)

  • Common database systems (SQL Server, Oracle and/or MySQL)

  • SQL query writing

  • Basic networking skills, to include operating systems and OS security interactions

  • ETL processes and data modeling / data warehousing

  • Web Application technologies such as, DHTML and XML

  • Java and VB.NET programming language

  • Web server setup and configuration (IIS, Tomcat, Weblogic, etc.)

  • Data-driven web applications


The Technical Engineer will also:



  • Establish and maintain working relationships with internal teams, including professional services consultants, product management, engineers, and support staff

  • Maintain current functional and technical knowledge of the entire Logi Analytics product line

  • Manage and drive competing requests across simultaneous client engagements

  • Provide clear and constructive product feedback to product management based on customer requirements

  • Help to document best practices in developing and deploying Logi Analytics solutions

item.title: Software Developer - Front-end, Data Visualization at Exaptive (Oklahoma City, OK)
item.description:
Exaptive, Inc is an MIT affiliated, fast-growing software startup that has offices in Oklahoma City, Boston and Vancouver, Canada. We are now expanding our Oklahoma City team. 

We are looking for entry-level programmers that have some formal computer science training, but are just starting their careers. You should know javascript and some javascript libraries like jQuery, D3, etc, and have an interest in data visualization, data science, and internet technologies. Most importantly, you should be hungry to build big, important applications that matter, and looking for projects to flex your newly developed coding muscles on. 

Experience with a variety of different internet technologies would be a bonus, but not necessary - we view this very much as a learn-on-the-job type position and as a result are valuing smarts, motivation and desire-to-learn over experience. These positions will be based in downtown OKC, but with the opportunity for travel to Exaptive's Boston and Vancouver locations. The position will have the opportunity to evolve into a role in which the person has an equity-stake in the company. The right person will be excited about the dynamic and fast-paced (aka stressful) environment of a startup and view that as a benefit, not a drawback. The startup environment is not for everyone, but for the person who is looking for that sort of life experience, the opportunity to help build something from the ground up where individual contributions make immediate and substantial impacts on the company as a whole can be extremely rewarding. 

Those interested can find out more about the company, and view some demo videos of our software in actionon our website: www.exaptive.com. We were featured on the front page of the Business Innovation section of The Boston Globe (http://www.boston.com/business/technology/innoeco/2013/12/cambridge-based_exaptive_wants.html) and in Oklahoma City's The Journal Record (http://www.i2e.org/news/innovators-exaptive-inc/). Our Founder and CEO, Dave King, has been invited internationally to present our work. You can see a video of a presentation he recently gave to the Oklahoma Venture Forum about Exaptive's big-picture vision on our website. 

If you don't currently live in Oklahoma City, you should check out what this up-and-coming city has to offer: a burgeoning tech startup and creative sector, the largest food truck event in the nation, olympic rowing facilities, and a cost of living that can't be beat. For the right candidate we'll pay relocation expenses.

item.title: Data Scientist at Triggr Health (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
You’ll be responsible for defining, building, and supporting a platform that reaches people when they are most at-risk and empowers them through the extraordinarily challenging recovery journey. It is an incredibly exciting role as you will be working with cutting-edge technology on a number of products that span: consumer and enterprise; mobile and desktop; external and internal; user-driven and automated; and practical and academic areas. The challenges you will face are new and exciting and will require you to think holistically about how the platform interacts with an incredibly diverse set of stakeholders.


We are looking for a Data Scientist with a machine learning background who is excited about the thought of working with big data to solve a complex, challenging problem. You must be able to architect and build a scalable system to process, analyze and validate models in real time.


You need to be entrepreneurial, have a desire to be part of a small team of highly motivated, mission-driven people, and have the appropriate experience to have significant input into all parts of the product and company.  You have to be a hands-on coder who enjoys not just implementing algorithms, but designing them from scratch.


Everything we do is hyper-focused on how the product impacts every patient, provider, and team member. You will need to understand when trade-offs are necessary: we are growing very quickly, but quality is of critical importance given our mission. You will continuously iterate on our products in order to improve the long-term outcomes of the patients in our program. You will also be integral to forming and developing our culture in addition to helping hire all-star teammates to make Triggr Health an awesome place to work! Most importantly, you must have a strong desire to be a part of a mission-driven company and believe that with the right team, technology, and values, anything is possible.


This position requires someone who understands and embraces the fact that the “user” is a real person with a severe health condition. The work we are doing is incredibly exciting because the impact we can have is massive, but it also requires extra care and increased responsibility to ensure every decision we make reflects this understanding.

item.title: Software Engineer at MillimanMAX (Cambridge, MA)
item.description:
The Milliman predictive analytics group in Cambridge, MA is looking for software engineers to help bridge research and practice, towards changing the way the insurance industry does business. Yeah, we really do think we’re going to change the way this whole industry works. Although Milliman is primarily an Actuarial Science firm, that is not what we do. We’re a small team of motivated experts building a new product-oriented practice for tackling statistical problems in the insurance sector. We work with large, real-world datasets and advanced techniques spanning optimization, statistics, and machine learning. We are looking for exceptional and innovative individuals to help in building out tools/automation to support Milliman's Predictive Modeling Practice. This is a unique opportunity to take on a role that will allow end to end development and autonomy. You will be working closely with a strong team of researchers and engineers; your work will have immediate and tangible impact both internally, and within our clients’ operations. 


Responsibilities


Your primary function is to have your work support end-to-end work flow for high-volume customer data through the predictive modeling engines and back to the customer with full service BI/analytics using event-driven automation as well as designing and coding tools utilized in the extraction, refining, and data presentation arenas.



  • Implement, optimize, generalize and productionalize models and research emerging from the research team

  • Integrate predictive models into database-backed environments, real-time query APIs, and existing modeling pipelines

  • Think about high-level architecture, scalability, abstraction, modularity, and generalizability across clients and use-cases

  • Lead significant strategic projects focused on enhancements to core tooling and automation.

  • Design and develop custom exploratory tools for strange new data worlds.

  • Design and develop automation to harden the end-to-end data handling.

  • Help design and develop data analytics platforms for supporting customer access through interactive visualization

  • Design and develop tools for processing and correlating seemingly disjoint customer data

  • Design and develop tools for multiple database engines: both extraction and posting

  • Gently chastise the data-scientists for not writing better code - then show them how

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Appian Corporation (Reston, VA)
item.description:
As a Senior Software Engineer working on the Appian platform, your mission will be to ensure Appian is always fast, scalable and up to whatever tasks our customers configure it to do. You will be solving problems of scale and flexibility that most engineers never see, building a product capable of serving our customers in ways you never imagined. Your scope extends from the high-performance data layer to the cross-platform user interface. This position requires the mental agility to jump from the deep code-level view of Appian, to the designer’s view, to the end user’s view, and back again. Learn how to write software that runs software, and enhance Appian's cross-platform functional programming language.

You will design and develop systems that let our customers build amazing enterprise apps for mobile and the web without writing a line of code. The design decisions and judgement calls you make will impact millions of Appian users worldwide. You will be looked upon as an expert and advocate to fellow engineers on making design and reliability trade-offs in running large-scale services and engineering complex systems that fail gracefully and transparently to users.

As a successful candidate for this role you will have strong analytical and troubleshooting skills, fluency in coding and systems design, solid communication skills and a desire to tackle the complex problems of software design and delivery which are uniquely Appian’s.

item.title: Sr. JavaScript Framework Developer - JS/UI at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:

This is a key position in our UI Infrastructure Core Tech team responsible for driving next-gen Bloomberg development platforms enterprise-wide.

In this role you will be a key member of the team developing the JavaScript platform that provides the building blocks, framework, and infrastructure used by the firm's 3000+ R&D employees to build high-quality, high-performance applications used both internally and externally. The successful candidate will have experience implementing performant JavaScript applications with an emphasis on optimization, API design, and architecture. This is an opportunity to directly affect the daily lives of internal developers using a modern stack of JavaScript technologies to enable highly interactive desktop applications. Emphasis will be placed on developing well-tested and structured code, and the ability to work in a highly collaborative and fast moving environment.

item.title: Full Stack Software Engineer at Syntactx (New York, NY)
item.description:
Syntactx is seeking a Senior Full Stack Developer in New York City. The individual will be responsible for some or all of the following:



  • Building new features for our EDC system using a mix of client and web related technologies

  • Full stack development from back-end modeling to front-end UI design elements.

  • Scoping and estimating projects, assisting with technical documentation and troubleshooting of complex problems.

  • Communicating with management and other departments, reporting of status and risks, and working effectively with internal and external partners.

  • Working under minimal supervision, will be provided with assignments and objectives and given wide latitude for independent judgment.

item.title: Software Engineer - Build To Scale at Reveal Mobile (Raleigh, NC)
item.description:
Reveal Mobile builds cutting-edge mobile analytics products, and we need talented engineers who thrive in a fast-paced startup environment. New hires work alongside our top-notch engineers and product team to design, implement, and deliver our highly ambitious products. We don’t hire using a checklist (5 years of that, 3 years of this, etc.). It’s all about your passion and dedication to the craft of software. 


Your Responsibilities:



  • Build innovative, scalable application systems. Scalable is the keyword in that sentence. Our product touches millions of mobile devices every month.

  • Write maintainable code, working in a professional software engineering environment (source control, shortened release cycles, continuous integration and deployment, etc.).

  • Welcome change and complexity. We are on the leading, sometimes bleeding, edge of mobile development. That requires us to learn quickly and adapt fast. We are looking for folks to lead that charge, not just keep up with it.

item.title: Cloud Engineer- Python, Scala, Distributed Systems for Hot Open Source Company at Elastic (Mountain View, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Elastic is building out our Found Team focusing on Elasticsearch as a Service.  This is a great opportunity to help lead our Cloud efforts and make an immediate impact to our strategy and implementation. Note this role is remote Or can be at our offices in Mt View CA, Phoenix AZ, Berlin, London or Sydney


Our cloud product allows users to create new clusters or expand existing ones easily This  product would be built on technologies such as  OpenStack, AWS, Docker, and others to enable the Operations Teams to easily create and manage multiple Elasticsearch clusters.


Job Duties and Requirements



  • This person will develop software for our distributed systems and ES as a Service offerings.

  • This person will be familiar with failures and complications related to a cloud offering.

  • Help build the Found offering and work closely with the Found Product and Engineering Team.

  • Assist in designing a scalable cloud offering working across multiple clusters.

item.title: Data Visualization Application Developer at Esri (Redlands, CA)
item.description:
Are you excited by the potential to develop web, mobile, and tablet apps that thousands of people will use to tell their own stories? Do you love incorporating data visualization and geospatial concepts into what you do? We’re seeking a talented and ambitious developer to perform creative, groundbreaking work on a small, highly collaborative team of creative and motivated professionals.



Story Maps are open-source apps that combine interactive maps with multimedia content and innovative user experiences to tell informative and inspiring geography-based stories.



Responsibilities:



  • Develop and prototype responsive web applications and UI modules in JavaScript, HTML5, and CSS

  • Conceptualize and prototype innovative ways to combine maps, charts, timelines, and info-graphics into user-friendly storytelling applications

  • Work closely with software developers, product engineers, UX/UI designers, and story tellers in a highly interactive and creative environment

  • Solve technical challenges efficiently and effectively

  • Identify and leverage the latest technology and methodology

  • Document functionalities, processes, and best practices to support the growing community of story map authors

item.title: Sr. Development Engineer at AudienceScience (Pune, India)
item.description:
AudienceScience is seeking a talented Sr. Development Engineer to join our team. You’ll be responsible for the development of products and tools for the AudienceScience® Helios, a global media buying platform using real-time bidding and behavioral targeting technologies. We currently handle upwards of 9 billion requests per day, aggregating all of this data on our Hadoop clusters. Distributed systems experience a big plus.


 RESPONSIBILITIES:


* Work with Chief Architect to design and build scalable, efficient, distributed systems to meet business objectives following best practices for quality, testability and operability.


* Perform code reviews.


* Provide third-tier support for production systems.


* Work with development leadership and product management to evaluate new product and feature requests and recommend solutions.


* Provide mentorship to other developers.


* Stay current on state of the art technologies, and make recommendations for how these may be used to improve our systems.


* Play key role in recruiting and evaluating candidates for open positions.

item.title: Senior Java Server Engineer at Intensity (San Diego, CA)
item.description:
Senior Java Server Engineer – Pioneering Business Forecasts and Data Visualizations


Specific responsibilities and duties for the Senior Java Server Engineer include:



  • Participate in design and development of enterprise-class cloud-hosted web applications

  • Design and implement robust, secure RESTful APIs for interactive analytical systems

  • Write high quality, well-tested code

  • Contribute to all phases of software engineering from requirements definition to production releases

  • Collaborate with product managers, UI designers, and front-end developers to define functional requirements and translate them into technical requirements

  • Rapidly solve problems and fix bugs

  • Work with technology partners and vendors as required

item.title: Software Engineer Python/Django at OptimData (Paris, France)
item.description:
Entreprise


OptimData est un centre de R&D en fort développement fondé en 2015 par Laurent Couillard, ex DG d’Exalead, avec un actionnariat composé de Technia et Transcat, leaders internationaux reconnus dans la distribution de solutions IT d’entreprises. Son objectif est de développer, de maintenir et de distribuer des solutions logicielles en mode SaaS afin d’aider les industriels dans leur transformation digitale. OptimData se démarque par une approche innovante basée sur la valorisation des données internes et externes à l’entreprise.


Dans un premier temps, OptimData répond aux besoins non couverts dans le domaine du service après-vente dans les secteurs des biens d’équipement et machines spéciales au moyen de l’application ProductInUse.


L’équipe d’OptimData est composée d’ingénieurs R&D passionnés par les enjeux et problématiques modernes liés aux données: Big Data, Apprentissage automatique & Internet des objets.


Mission


ProductInUse est une application web basée sur une stack web moderne: ReactJs/API Rest Django/PostGreSql/Cassandra. Vous serez en charge du développement de l’API qui est un composant central dans l’architecture car il est “responsable” du modèle de données. Ce composant est basé sur le Django Rest Framework et la librairie d'analyse de données pandas.


Les objectifs du poste sont:



  • Mise à jour du modèle de données

  • Développement des nouvelles API

  • Contribution à l’amélioration de la partie devops (déploiement, monitoring …)


Étant donné la position centrale du poste, les interactions avec les équipe connectivité, data science, infrastructure & front seront nombreuses. L’équipe travaille en “sprint” hebdomadai


Environnement



  • Infra: Cloud IBM sur debian

  • Versionning: git/github

  • Devops: ansible

item.title: Sr Natural Language Processing Software Engineer at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:

The R&D ADSK Team at Bloomberg is looking for a seasoned senior software engineer to work on projects involving machine learning, natural language processing, and computation linguistics.

Our group develops sophisticated real-time systems that help create the best customer service experience possible. This includes the accurate routing of chat based questions to representatives based on their specialty and experience. We analyze chat conversations between representatives and clients in real-time to help assist the rep and create semi-automated systems to improve efficiency. You will have the opportunity to interface with the business to better understand the requirements and to drive the direction of the product.

We are seeking senior software engineers who can formulate a vision and work towards making it a reality. The ideal candidate would have background in mathematics and statistics as well as machine learning and natural language processing enabling them to contribute immediately to projects.

item.title: Senior Software Developer with BI skills at Coolblue (Rotterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
You’re the one bringing Software Development and Business Intelligence together.


What you tell your friends you do
"I automate fortune telling, I predict the future."


How will you be doing this?



  • By bringing your own deeply technical skill set to the table, and closely collaborating with your team in taking on the challenges that a rapidly growing e-commerce company faces.

  • By collaborating with others to design and choose the right platform and tools for the job.

  • By knowing what it takes to make new technology work with existing, enterprise IT environments.

  • By actively coaching and continuously providing feedback to team members.


What we have worked on last quarter



  • Created a first implementation of item-to-item recommendations.

  • Created automated sales forecast for (logistical) planning purposes saving millions in logistical overhead and storage cost, whilst still being able to keep our promises to our customers: next day delivery.


Team
You'll team up with some of the smartest, most motivated guys and girls you have ever worked with. Some of them are pretty junior, so they will need some coaching and guidance in real production software development. Next to that, you will work with your manager to create the ultimate partnership to ensure Business Intelligence becomes the indispensable core of Coolblue, providing insights and support for the business and customers.

item.title: Senior Big Data Architect at Warner Music Group (New York, NY)
item.description:
This is an exciting opportunity for a self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced environment looking to join the Big Data solutions team at Warner Music Group. 


Are you a passionate Big Data Architect looking for a new challenge? You get excited defining and leading engineering efforts for product vision, requirements and execution of customer driven innovation. You have a passion for coaching and mentoring teams. You take action on creative solutions and ideas. You thrive in a team environment, knowing that the whole is greater than the sum of its parts. You look at problems from different angles and seek out fresh perspectives. Warner Music Group wants to speak with you about how we can transform the music industry together!!!


Your Role and Responsibilities:



  • A self-starter who is a technology as well as a people person. Should be able to work in different abstractions from the lowest i.e. code and to the highest i.e. architecting and designing systems. Also be able to work with different teams and people to understand and facilitate the deliverables in a timely fashion.

  • Design and build scalable infrastructure and platform to collect and process very large amounts of data (structured and unstructured), including streaming real-time data.

  • Architect the data pipeline to meet the needs of a technology centric company.

  • Hands-on development as well as mentoring of a team of Data Platform Engineers.

  • Collaborate with key stakeholders to understand, document and prioritize key technology decisions, processes and business needs for data and intelligence. This will require an extensive technical background and experience with working on big data in a highly distributed environment.

  • Work with business analysts and business stakeholders to help define technology needs for the logging, processing, storage and presentation of data in a manner that delivers business value.

  • Liaise with other development and reporting teams through the implementation process of new reporting systems.

  • Create, define and deliver new processes that will enable better development efficiencies.

  • Own a road map to automate and key reports in a consistent and scalable fashion.

item.title: Software Programmer at Data Processors (Southbank, Australia)
item.description:
Due to expansion we are seeking direct applications from talented and passionate software programmers to join our Estimation and Evaluation team. The successful candidate will be joining an existing team of highly qualified and professional developers with a broad and proficient range of skills.

The types of systems that the successful candidate will support and test can broadly be defined within the family of algorithmic trading systems but don't let that scare you! Specific skills in finance and related algorithms are not required and domain specific information will be conveyed as part of on the job learning. Indeed, most of the work does not require specific knowledge but rather the willingness to learn and perseverance to ensure completion. Of key importance is the desire and willingness to solve problems of importance to business outcomes. Working well within a team is essential as is a dedicated and professional outlook on software development processes.

You will mainly be focused on the testing and support of general purpose software and systems to allow expert analysts to process online (live) and offline (historical) data. Online systems perform domain specific data transformations, algorithm application and validation of input and output data along with the hard performance constraint of a real-time system. Offline systems focus on algorithm evaluation (using distributed computation) and associated research and development (performed in collaboration with or by expert analysts).

Candidates with a Bachelor's degree in Software Engineering or Information/Computer Science will need to demonstrate experience in/with:



  • Software development environments using Agile methodologies

  • Unit testing frameworks such as JUnit, DUnit and/or PyUnit.

  • Build systems such as Jenkins and/or Bamboo.

  • One or more programming/scripting languages (Python, C#, C++/C, Java).

  • Defect Tracking and Source Control tools (eg. Jira, Subversion and Git).



You will need the following attributes:



  • Outstanding verbal and written communication skills including the ability to communicate effectively with technical and non-technical colleagues.

  • A strong proven focus on outcomes and deliverables..

  • The ability to think independently, act quickly and refocus following change.

  • A strong and proven desire to learn more effective and efficient ways of working.

  • Commitment to projects including extended post-implementation.

  • Self-motivated, pro-active and strong organisational skills.



The following competencies and experience would be considered valuable:



  • Delphi.

  • 2+ years experience in Quality Assurance/Testing or related experience .

  • Distributed computing/multi-threaded programming.

  • Statistical/numerical analysis.

  • Proficiency with XML/JSON data structures and constructs.

  • Hands-on testing experience with Windows, UNIX and/or Linux operations system.

  • SQL and PL/SQL.

  • TCP/IP and web technologies.


Ideally, we are seeking applications from candidates who are located in Australia and who already have the right to live and work here indefinitely and without any restrictions. However, if you hold the right to work in Australia unrestricted and indefinitely, but are not currently located here, but plan to be within the next month please apply.

Please do not hesitate and apply via the URL below.

Recruitment Process:

Please note due to the volume of applications received in response to our job adverts, applicants who have not applied via the URL will be automatically rejected. Those who have been short listed will be contacted with 72 hours of receipt of their application by a member of our HR team to schedule telephone interviews.

Following the initial telephone interview successful candidates will be required to attend a face to face interview which will include sitting a technical test specifically designed to test candidate ability for this position. The panel will consist of the Team Manager, Direct Manager and a Representative from the HR Team.

http://apply.dataprocessors.com.au

Please note all APPLICANTS MUST APPLY via the URL above and quote job reference PO65. Those who do not will be automatically rejected.

We look forward to receiving your application.

item.title: Senior Front End Developer Javascript and AngularJS at RealMassive (Austin, TX)
item.description:
RealMassive is looking for an über-talented & energetic front end web developer to help build and deploy our game-changing marketing platform. Creativity, personality, tats & piercings encouraged.


About You...


You are an experienced software engineer who is passionate about building quality software that delights customers and meets our organizational needs. You are a leader: others hold you in high regard and look up to you as a specialist in software development. When you promulgate opinions on software, others listen. For years, you worked diligently to establish a rock solid foundation in computer science. You continuously learn new technologies and stay apprised of current trends. When you create, it’s fast, clean, and elegant. Junior engineers are constantly learning from you and your work. You are on a path of continuous improvement. You can deliver under pressure and on strict timelines. You’re comfortable leading a team in agile practices and getting the most out of them. You can manage and code on multiple projects. You have an entrepreneurial spirit and strong will to jump in, produce, and lead. You’ve worked hard to get where you are, and you’re not done yet. Your next steps are Technical Director or VP of Engineering.


This senior level role reports directly to the CTO and includes coding and leadership.


Requirements



  • Expert foundation on the principles of computer science. A degree in computer science or related field; Masters or PhD preferred.

  • Expert in Javascript, AngularJS, and other front end frameworks and technologies.

  • Experience all across the stack.

  • 2+ years managing multiple projects.

  • 2+ years experience managing scrum teams.


Benefits



  • Competitive compensation (salary and stock options)

  • Medical & dental insurance

  • Relocation assistance available

  • Work with a close-knit, passionate team providing key innovations to an industry controlling an $15 trillion asset base.

  • Offices centrally located downtown with beautiful views of Austin

  • Weekly happy hours and other fun team building events


If you think you would be a good candidate, e-mail us a resume and cover letter to jobs@realmassive.com. No recruiters please.

item.title: Full Stack Developer at Essence (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Company:



Essence is a global digital agency and the world’s largest independent buyer of digital media. We blend data science, objective media and captivating experiences to build valuable connections between brands and consumers. Clients include Google, HP, eBay, and Expedia. The agency is more than 450 people strong, manages over $700MM in media spend and deploys campaigns in 71 markets via offices in London, New York, San Francisco, Seattle, Singapore and Tokyo. Visit essencedigital.com for more information, and follow us on Twitter at @essencedigital.



The Role:



Essence is looking for a web developer experienced with Python and Javascript to work on a client-facing applications used to track and optimize our biddable media purchasing. You would be joining a tight knit development team and will be working alongside other developers and product managers to solve complex technical problems while building and maintaining software applications.



Some of the things we'd like you to do:




  • Write clean, well-designed and reusable code

  • Write code that scales well and is easily maintainable by other developers

  • Lead efforts to optimize app performance and remove bottlenecks

item.title: Back End Engineer at Skyscanner (Miami, FL)
item.description:
Skyscanner obtains data from multiple web scrapers, API feeds and external data sources to power its front end website, mobile applications and B2B partners. You will work in an energetic and intelligent team of developers to expand our world-class coverage of flight data and prices.


Our Backend Engineers are the backbone of our business. They build the engines that power Skyscanner and platforms that can cope with the millions of user visits every day.


As the primary technical point of contact for an important part of our system, the Partner Engineering team pride themselves on understanding and successfully delivering the business requirements of all departments.


What are some of the core responsibilities?



  • Ensuring that flight prices in Skyscanner products are accurate and up-to-date.

  • Creating seamless redirects to third party websites.

  • Assisting with the maintenance of existing scrapers and data sources

  • Increasing our global coverage of flight and price data, with focus on your local area.

  • Liaising with 3rd parties (travel agents and airlines) over new integrations and maintenance.

  • Working with test team to validate the quality of solutions.

  • Updating existing integrations to expose new data and support new product features.

item.title: Senior Full Stack Software Engineer, Measure at Quantcast (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Quantcast seeks software engineering generalists that will work up and down the entire technology stack to build new features and products to drive the continued success of our Measure and Advertise businesses.

At Quantcast, these full-stack polyglots work in all aspects of agile application development, from DB schema design through Java business logic to advanced Javascript on the frontend. They also work with QC-specific, and other industry-leading, big data technologies (e.g. Hadoop, QFS) – our products are driven by data after all and we process an average of 30PB every single day!

The right applicant will thrive in an environment where independent decision-making based on product requirements is the norm. Individuals in this role will want to work on our many open-ended problems and will have an opinion when it comes to selecting the right tool/technology for the job (and the ability to explain why!).

As a Full Stack Software Engineer at Quantcast, you will have a major impact on how the world perceives and interacts with our products. We hope that you’ll bring your passion for application development to help us build truly world-class technology and products!

Example full-stack projects:

Advertising Reporting Infrastructure
Creating our client facing reporting infrastructure to provide campaign performance and analysis to internal and external clients

Online Measurement
Building new features for Quantcast Measure that will be viewed and used across the entire Web ecosystem

Mobile
Brand new mobile projects that range from prototyping to designing data schemas for both Android and iOS applications

Scaling Tools
Developing toolsets that support a number of core business operations at Quantcast

Brand Infrastructure
Building front end, data pipeline and server infrastructure to drive Quantcast targeting products for publishers

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - Mars Science Laboratory (MSL) at Jet Propulsion Laboratory (Pasadena, CA)
item.description:
Jet Propulsion Laboratory


Requisition ID 2015-5361
Posted Date 8/19/2015
Discipline Description Engineering Applications Software Engineering
Scheduled Hours 40
Hiring Organization 397G - DATA SERVICES
Education Bachelor's
Travel No
Clearance Options None
Job Locations US-CA-Pasadena
Category Software and Computing Systems
Career Level Level 3
Relocation Eligibility Yes
Minimum Years of Experience 6
Work Authorization U.S. Citizen or Permanent Resident
Clearance Status None

Overview:


Do you excel in an environment that values exploration and discovery? We have a universe of opportunities waiting for you!




The Jet Propulsion Laboratory (JPL) is NASA’s lead center for robotic exploration of the solar system. Our core competency is the end-to-end implementation of unprecedented robotic space missions to study Earth, the Solar System, and the Universe.




JPL, located in Pasadena, California, has a casual, campus-like environment situated on 177 acres in the foothills of the San Gabriel Mountains and offers a work environment unlike any other: we inspire passion, foster innovation, build collaboration, and reward excellence.





We are proud to be part of NASA and Caltech, as we explore the universe and make history through new discoveries.




We aim to do things never done before and to go places few can go. We dare mighty things…do you?




Responsibilities:


You will be a Software Engineer and member of the Data Services Group (397G) reporting to the Group Supervisor and will contribute to the software planning systems of the Mars Science Laboratory (MSL).  

You will utilize domain-specific engineering expertise to understand the needs of the customer, translate needs into requirements, develop prototype applications, iterate with customers and then deliver quality applications. Involved in entire life-cycle of system, including planning, development, deployment and maintenance. Responsible for understanding and meeting software operational and engineering requirements.

item.title: Technical Product Manager at Author it (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
Author-it has been an industry-leading provider of content authoring tools for more than 16 years. With our focus on SaaS solutions for the Life Sciences content lifecycle, we’re growing by leaps and bounds. But we also know we can do more, better. This is where you come in.



We’re looking for a smart, detail-oriented, and technical Product or Program Manager who will contribute to the next stage of evolving Author-it products and services. You’ll work on projects that span the Product Management and Engineering organizations, including front-end development, platform/API development, and QA, with vendor management opportunities for outsource projects.



As a Technical Product manager, you’ll work closely with functional leads to dive deep and solve both customer pain points and complex SaaS challenges (performance, scale, extensibility, security, and more). Our customer-centric philosophy extends across everything we do, whether you’re defining new UI with the UX Designer or optimizing our web services API with the Software Architect.



There’s interesting and exciting work ahead, and you can be a part of it.



Key responsibilities



  • Collect, assess, and prioritize customer requirements for future versions of Author-it products and services.

  • Collaborate with platform/API developers and infrastructure engineers to ensure the security, scalability, and extensibility of the Author-it Cloud service.

  • Collaborate with other PM team members to define the user experience for Author-it products and services.

  • Define the business and functional requirements for enhancements to Author-it products and services (Alternatively, write the user stories or scenarios.)

  • Create specifications and other planning artifacts for product enhancements and new features.

  • Work with developers and infrastructure engineers to ensure the security, scalability, and extensibility of all solutions proposed in specifications you create.

  • Collaborate with Scrum Masters and Technical Project Managers on project management tasks related to Engineering efforts, including both in-house development and outsourced (vendor) projects.

  • Work with the Interaction Designer to validate user experience designs through both ad hoc and formal usability testing, such as “card sort” affinity exercises and A/B testing.

  • Identify sources of user/customer data, such as usage metrics and community feedback, and then analyze the data with team members to provide recommendations for improvement to new or existing product behaviors.

item.title: Integration Architect - Bloomberg Law at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:

Bloomberg Law continues to expand its presence in the area of legal research by providing high-quality and innovative legal research solutions. The company is committed to bringing innovative changes in the industry to the way lawyers conduct research, keep abreast of current developments, serve their clients and attract new clients. Through BloombergLaw.com, we offer integration of legal research, news, collaboration tools and market information that is unmatched in the industry. Bloomberg Law is a unique opportunity to work for a start-up team and business unit but all the benefits of working within a large, successful and well-established company.

The R&D Bloomberg Law Integrated Solutions team is seeking a self-motivated senior software developer/architect with an interest in designing solutions for complex data problems and implementing scalable architectures to support the legal research platform. In this senior role, you will work with cross-application teams to identify cross-cutting problems and develop robust solutions toward enhancing the product and building scalable applications. The candidate must exhibit excellent problem-solving, architectural and programming skills with passion for solving large-scale data problems, quickly learning emerging technologies. The candidate should also demonstrate the ability to deliver large projects independently, while positively collaborating with different teams.

item.title: Java Software Engineer at HERE a Nokia Company (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Sr. Engineer – Java


The HERE Reality Capture & Processing (RCP) Platform team is expanding!


The RCP Platform team builds services designed to efficiently deliver our immense collection of 3D street-level and aerial content to product teams to power the next-generation of 3D consumer maps, enhanced navigation systems and more. We are looking for experienced candidates who will be able to work effectively in a multidisciplinary team environment focused on innovation and be able to learn and integrate complementary technologies inside and outside their specific area of expertise to deliver highly scalable and fault tolerant systems to optimize the way content feeds in to all of our products in the automotive, enterprise, and consumer spaces.



Responsibilities:



With a global fleet of vehicles collecting petabytes of 3D street-level and aerial data per year, you will be:
• Contributing to an engineering team charged with designing, architecting and building a platform to transform these massive data sets into building blocks for content creation.
• Building out services and APIs providing direct access to these rich 3D datasets.
• Work with Amazon Web Services as a storage and computing platform, especially with S3 and EC2.

item.title: Principal UI Engineer at Attivio, Inc (Newton, MA)
item.description:
Job Description


If you are passionate about creating impactful and intuitive UIs, consider yourself a trend-setter and creator of innovative solutions, have strong requirements gathering, design, coding and troubleshooting skills, and are relentless in your pursuit of developing well-architected software and delivering high-quality work, you will find the Principal GUI Engineer role in the Engineering Group satisfying and challenging.  You will be responsible for designing, developing, and supporting Attivio's new end-user, developer, and administrator GUI initiatives for Enterprise Search and Big Data markets.

Responsibilities also include –
•    Designing and developing the user experience for GUI initiatives, including creating and developing wireframes, storyboards and use cases.  
•    Creating and preparing recommendations on feature sets and technical infrastructure for assigned projects and new system modules.
•    Consulting with partners, customers, and end users to receive feedback regarding the design and maintenance of Attivio's technology and GUIs.
•    Researching and finding opportunities to take advantage of existing platforms and communities to improve user experience through GUIs.
•    Implementing GUI projects using Agile methodologies.

item.title: Software Engineer, Mobile at MoLabs (New York, NY)
item.description: MoLabs is focused on building the next great mobile-first platform. To get there, we are assembling a world-class product and engineering team. MoLabs' software engineers develop the scalable, mobile-first technologies that change how users consume, explore and interact with information and the world. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing and UI design. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to tackle new problems across the full-stack. With your technical expertise you manage individual projects priorities, deadlines and deliverables. You design, develop, test, deploy, maintain, and enhance software solutions. Software Engineers have a penchant for solving complex and interesting problems. Pushing the boundaries of current mobile platforms, you will perform technological feats under constrained environments and will be presented with exciting challenges in native mobile application development. Our Software Engineers in Mobile Applications work on many projects that carry varying responsibilities. You will build MoLabs products for either Android or iOS. If you are an Android Developer, you will develop applications primarily in Java and using the Android SDK. If you are an iOS Developer, you will develop applications and SDKs primarily in Swift or Objective-C and using the iOS SDK.

item.title: Full-stack JavaScript hacker @ fast growing VC backed start-up at Ice.com (Palo Alto, CA)
item.description:
About us:

Our mission is to use software and analytics to bring transparency to the opaque world of jewelry. We are backed by leading VCs including Khosla Ventures, Maveron, and Crosslink. 

Note: we acquired the domain name (Ice.com) a year ago (it is unrelated to the previous company). 

A few reasons why you should be interested in this opportunity:

  • The jewelry industry is a fragmented, $80B market (in the US alone), growing at 5%+ annually, that software has yet to disrupt. 
  • You will be joining an awesome team led by Brandon Proctor (founding CMO of one of the largest e-commerce retailers, Build.com) and Justin Yoshimura (3x exits). 
  • We are extremely data driven and technology/software is in our DNA. You won't be a second class citizen here, guaranteed. 
  • We don't have time for assholes or politics. 
  • Competitive compensation package including stock options. 
  • Small (17 person) and agile team. 

What we'd like to see:

  • True, full-stack engineers with 2+ years of production experience in Python/Django or Node.js strongly preferred.
  • Strong foundation in computer science, with competencies in data structures, algorithms, databases, software design and dev ops.
  • Work experience with relational databases and SQL.
  • Experience with agile development process in collaborative environment.
  • BS in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or Physics OR 4 years of relevant work experience.
  • Good understanding of performance tradeoffs.

Bonus Points:

  • We are currently using Magento, an open source e-commerce platform built in Zend PHP - yuck), but we are building a new, badass e-commerce platform in Django, Angular.js, Node.js and integrating it with Netsuite's order management tools (no need to re-invent the entire wheel, after all). Related experience is a plus.
  • if you have an awesome Github repo, open source contributions, or a cool project you can demo, please cut to the front of the line...

Responsibilities:

As a member of our small but seriously talented engineering team, you will play a key role in both shaping and building our technologies. Your scope will be broad, ranging from user-facing features to server-side components and libraries. We are looking for a generalist who enjoys learning and working with different technologies. And of course you will be expected to commit code on your first day. 

*This job description is not meant to be an all-inclusive list of duties and responsibilities, but constitutes a general definition of the position's scope and function in the company.

item.title: Node.js Developer at ADP (New York, NY)
item.description:
Unlock Your Career Potential: Technology at ADP. Do you enjoy exploring, identifying and inspiring the future of the workplace and the lives of millions of people? At ADP, the world's largest B2B cloud company, our Technology team is comprised of brilliant engineers, architects, data scientists, infrastructure experts, and more. We were first in our industry to offer a SaaS solution and continue to push the envelope utilizing the latest operating platforms to deliver the highly automated, intelligent and predictive solutions that are redefining what is possible. Named one of Forbes' "Most Innovative Companies" and one of Computerworld's "100 Best Places to Work in IT", we are committed to leading the way in product development and research, empowering you to bring to life the latest innovations that will forever change the way businesses manage their most vital asset, employees.



ADP is searching for a successful Senior Application Developer with Node.js to join our high performance team. The successful candidate will have a strong command of software programming, latest web technologies and frameworks. We strive for every interaction to be driven by our CORE values:Insightful Expertise, Integrity is Everything, Service Excellence, Inspiring Innovation, Each Person Counts, Results-Driven, & Social Responsibility.

item.title: Sr iOS Software Engineer at iRobot Corporation (Bedford, MA)
item.description:
Explore and leverage your career with one of the world’s foremost leaders in diverse robotics – from consumer, telepresence, and international defense and security, we are constantly creating robotic products that improve, impact, and change lives.


  As a Sr. Software Engineer – iOS Applications at iRobot, you will be developing mobile applications that control iRobot’s Consumer Home Products.


 In this role, you will collaborate with robot developers, designers, testers, and business managers.  You will have the opportunity to contribute to all aspects of the product development life-cycle.  The ideal candidate must be able to pick up new technologies quickly, be a strong team player, and rapidly adapt to changing business and customer demands. 


What you will do


As a member of an extraordinarily creative, motivated and talented team, you will develop new apps that interface with Consumer Robots, which are used by millions of people.



  • Design, implement, and test a new, iOS based, robot control application.

  • Collaborate with technical architects, test engineers, and user interface designers.

  • Write high quality code that is well documented and unit tested.

  • Participate in and drive code reviews.

item.title: Software Engineer at Fulgent Therapeutics, LLC (Temple City, CA)
item.description:
Fulgent Diagnostics is a rapidly growing CLIA-certified & CAP-accredited diagnostics laboratory. We offer comprehensive next generation genetic testing and great customer service for a wide spectrum of genetic disorders for diagnosis, genetic counseling, and prenatal testing. We are seeking a full-time Node.js/Web developer to join our fast growing bioinformatics team.



Short Description: 



"Full-time Node.js/UI Web Developer. Technologies: SQL, NodeJS, JQuery with knowledge in transaction processing. Minimum 2-years working experience. BA/BS in Computer Science.



Full Description:



Full-time Node.js/UI Web Developer



You'll be building web applications to enable our customers and enable our team members. You'll be thanked by both of them for improving our workflow, our turn-around-times, and for making their lives easier. You'll be building custom interfaces, work queues, weekly reports, dashboards, and integrating with several in-bound/out-bound interfaces. Above that, you'll be learning about bioinformatics and aiding in the diagnostic process of improving the lives of the customers we serve.



Must haves:



  • Exceptional ability with node.js, jQuery, Javascript

  • Exceptional ability with CSS, HTML5

  • Exceptional ability with SQL, PL/SQL

  • Exceptional ability with User Interface Design

  • Experience building PDF Documents

  • Experience building Reports and Dashboards

  • Experience with GIT Source Control

  • Experience with Windows and Linux

  • Experience with Transaction Processing

  • Experience manipulating data in JSON, XML, CSV, XLSX

  • Deep understanding of Web Security and User Authentication

  • Understanding of Browser Limitations

  • Understanding of Locus of Control

  • Strong communication skills

  • Works well in teams and also works well alone

  • Minimum 2 years working experience

  • Minimum BA or BS in Computer Science or equivalent 


Nice to have:



  • Experience with C/C++/Java/Scala

  • Experience with python, bash, regular expression


Must be willing to take a remote programming test as part of the application process. No independent contractors and no free-lancers.

item.title: Java/Scala Software Engineer at Feedzai (Lisbon, Portugal)
item.description:
We are looking for very high-tech engineers that have experience or have shown the ability to deal with hard software engineering problems - from an algorithmic and distributed systems perspective.


If your passion is building high-performant, scalable services, with elegant APIs and architectures you’ll fit right in! Join us in disrupting the hot market of digital payments and online fraud prevention!


Responsibilities:



  • Design & implement our backend architecture, from the data layer, to service orchestration to our RESTful APIs

  • Build the libraries and frameworks we use to build high-performance, reliable distributed services

  • Work on automated deployment as well as distributed logging and analytics so that we can be on top of things

  • Write reusable and testable code using the best tools for the job and participate in code reviews

  • You’ll be hyper-technical - deep understanding and optimisation are in our blood

item.title: Software Engineer, Backend at Cisco Meraki (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Meraki’s customer base has grown by a factor of 2-3 every year since we started, leading to a current request rate of over 200 million page views per day, and the Meraki backend team keeps our cloud management infrastructure scaling in the face of that growth.


Examples of the systems we've built/worked on include:



  • A secure, resilient overlay network that allows our backend to deliver configurations and gather statistics from our devices despite Internet routing anomalies and middleboxes.

  • A highly concurrent daemon that gathers updated statistics from every Meraki wireless access point, switch, and firewall every 45 seconds.

  • A custom database, written from scratch in C++, that processes over 1 million writes/second and intelligently partitions statistics data on disk for fast retrieval and efficient in-memory caching.


The backend team uses a number of different programming languages and systems, deliberately choosing the right tools for each particular application. We write code in C++, Ruby, and Scala. We use Linux, PostgreSQL, Rails, Jetty, Click, nginx, and memcached. We contribute to several open source projects.

item.title: Technical Lead for the next great mobile-first platform at MoLabs (New York, NY)
item.description: MoLabs is focused on building the next great mobile-first platform. To get there, we are assembling a world-class product and engineering team. MoLabs' software engineers develop the scalable, mobile-first technologies that change how users consume, explore and interact with information and the world. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing and UI design. You have deep expertise in building performant, scalable systems in C++, Java, Go or Python. Your design intuition should lean towards elegance and simplicity, and you should have experience with highly-scaled serving systems.

item.title: Full-stack web engineer for leading SaaS product at FreeAgent (Edinburgh, UK) (allows remote)
item.description:
We're looking for an full-stack software engineers to come and work on our flagship web-based product FreeAgent. We're a growing team of over 85 people, based in Edinburgh but with remote staff around the UK (7 engineers are fully remote).


We have a lot of happy customers (42,000+, NPS=75!), a lot of traffic (13 million+ page views/mo), and some lovely staff to work alongside, learn from and have fun with. We invest a lot of time in our platform (code health, scalability, security) as well as working on new features, which is nice.


Our engineers tend to be full stack, but we’re seeing people move towards more specialist work these days, such as front-end programming (we're doing a lot of React.js, primarily on our iOS app), our real-time accounting engine, data science. People play to their strengths really. Our stack is intentionally straightforward. It's sensible and sustainable. Javascript aside, we mainly write Ruby alongside MySQL, RabbitMQ, Elasticsearch, Puppet. Prior Ruby knowledge is not a requirement!


Please note we are looking for UK-based full-time staff right now.

item.title: Web Applications Developer at Yield Book (New York, NY)

item.title: Software Development Engineer, AWS Benchmarking team at Amazon (Cape Town, South Africa)
item.description:
Are you the sort of person who enjoys building software in the cloud? Can you automate processes so that they run continuously without manual intervention? Do you get excited by the performance aspects of complex architectures and like diving deep to find answers to hard performance questions? Do you want to make an impact on millions of developers and IT professionals? If so, we would like to talk to you.



The Amazon Web Services Benchmarking team is seeking a mid- to senior-level Software Development Engineer to join us in beautiful Cape Town. Our team focuses on understanding and improving the performance and usability of AWS and ultimately the end-to-end customer experience.



Responsibilities of the role include:

  • Designing and implementing cloud-based software solutions to automatically execute performance benchmarks

  • Analysing performance metrics and reporting to business stakeholders

  • Exploring and building new ways to make performance data accessible to internal users

  • Working closely with product teams and owners to understand the performance aspects of their services

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience

item.title: Senior Software Development Eng- Consumer Shopping Engagement at Amazon (Seattle, WA)

The Community Shopping team is looking for a creative, deeply technical and hands-on candidate to take community shopping experiences and the underlying technology to the next level. This is a strategic role in an organization and includes ownership of iconic Amazon products including customer reviews and Wish List. As a senior technical individual contributor you will join the ranks of Amazon’s most senior Technical Community You’ll help establish technical standards and drive Community Shopping’s overall technical architecture and engineering practices. You’ll work on our hardest problems, building high quality, architecturally sound systems that are aligned with our business needs. You will help us apply machine learning to many aspects of our business. You will help our teams develop a data services so that many internal technology teams can utilize the treasure trove of information provided by customers in reviews etc.

Basic Qualifications

Preferred Qualifications

· Master’s degree or PhD in computer science or related technical field

· Experience leading development life cycle process and best practices

· Experience mentoring/training the engineering community on complex technical issues





Professional traits that are not unique to this position, but are necessary for Amazon impact include:

Obsessed about doing the right thing for the customer

Analytical thinking and ability to translate data into business ideas

Ownership, drive, and bias for action

Using good judgment, has had to make strategic decisions with limited information.

Relentless pursuit of elevating progress

Strong written and oral communication skills

Ability to dive deep, peeling back the onion to understand root cause and implications

item.title: Junior to Mid Level iOS Developer at lettrs at lettrs (New York, NY)
item.description:

mobile technologies to the limits and will work well with a startup team as well as in-house and third party developers to design and build the next generation of lettrs applications.

item.title: Cloud Services System Engineer at MongoDB, Inc. (New York, NY)
item.description:
Join the fastest growing engineering team at MongoDB! We are looking for a systems engineer to join us in building the best database management system for the leading document database server. The MongoDB management service, Cloud Manager, is a cloud-based web application for deploying, monitoring, and backing up MongoDB deployments of any size and configuration.


Cloud Manager currently monitors tens of thousands of MongoDB nodes and backs up multiple petabytes of data. On a typical day, Cloud Manager processes over a billion metrics and replicates tens of billions of backup operations.


Tools we use include: MongoDB (of course!), AWS, CentOS, Chef, Nagios, Graphite, Load Balancers.


Responsibilities


You will design, implement, operate, and troubleshoot systems, services, and tools primarily in cloud-based environments. You will additionally participate in a weekly on-call rotation, and make occasional trips to our data centers.  Your responsibilities include resolving and escalating issues while advocating best practices to development teams.
