item.title: Sr. Scientific Software Lead (IS Beta) at Novartis Institutes for BioMedical Research (Cambridge, MA)
item.description:
At Novartis Institutes for BioMedical Research (NIBR), the NIBR Informatics (NX) serves the global NIBR research community to provide them with the best of breed, bleeding edge informatics platforms as well as in-depth data analysis services. The members in this group have a chance to participate in the groundbreaking medical research activities to re-define the grammar for medicine in the future in the post-genome era.

The NIBR Informatics is looking for a degree-educated Senior Scientific Software Lead with an excellent understanding of genomics, research data, and lab workflows, as well as experience in software engineering and informatics, to join a multi-disciplinary Discovery Biology Informatics Group. Work location will be in Cambridge, MA.

The successful candidate will work closely with scientists and talented software engineers to re-define the NIBR-wide informatics systems to meet the challenge arising from genomic drug discovery research. The ideal candidate should be a highly motivated team player with a strong understanding of genomics, as well as data management and analysis needs associated with target discovery and screening research. This person should have proven record of building effective tools for scientists in a research environment and be capable of leading a technical team to deliver solutions to support NIBR drug discovery biology research.

Major Accountabilities / Key Performance Indicators



  • Gather user requirements and perform needs assessments to guide development and selection of software systems.

  • Support scientific research with software systems which capture experimental design, enable data analysis and interpretation, and provide for regular communication on genomics projects.

  • Design and/or supervise development and testing of software systems to meet or exceed project objectives.

  • Lead, mentor, and inspire a high-performing team of developers by establishing high technical standards and demonstrating, by way of example, technical excellence in all stages of software development.

  • Manage and motivate high-performing teams of developers by setting clear expectations and delivering effective feedback.

  • Use software version control system, automated build tools, ticket tracking software, architecture documentation, and release engineering processes.

  • Develop and optimize techniques and methods to improve software development processes including test driven development, agile methodology, and pair programming.

  • Work closely with cross-functional groups (engineers and researchers, management, business analysts, and internal customers), in a highly matrixed organization to build constructive and effective relationships throughout the whole organization.

item.title: Senior Backend Engineer at Triggr Health (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
You’ll be responsible for defining, building, and supporting a platform that reaches people when they are most at-risk and empowers them through the extraordinarily challenging recovery journey. It is an incredibly exciting role as you will be working with cutting edge technology on a number of products that span: consumer and enterprise, mobile and desktop, external and internal, user-driven and automated, and practical and academic areas. The challenges you will face are new and exciting and will require you to think holistically about how the platform interacts with an incredibly diverse set of stakeholders.


More specifically, we are building apps on both Android and iOS, a customer-facing web application, a robust web services API, machine learning-driven analytics, and large-scale data processing. Although you will be focused on the back end system, you must be hyper-focused on how the product impacts every patient, provider, and team member. You will need to understand when trade-offs are necessary as we are growing very quickly but quality is of critical importance given our mission. You will be crucial to designing and implementing a scalable system from schema through software through operational tools. You will continuously iterate on our products in order to improve the long term outcomes of the patients in our program. You will also be integral to forming and developing our engineering culture in addition to helping hire all-star teammates to make Triggr Health an awesome place to work! Most importantly, you must have a strong desire to be a part of a mission-driven company and believe that with the right team, technology, and values, anything is possible.



This position requires someone who understands and embraces the fact that the “user” is a real person with a severe health condition. The work we are doing is incredibly exciting because the impact we can have is massive, but it also requires extra care and increased responsibility to ensure every decision we make reflects this understanding.

item.title: Software Engineer, Product Testing at Tableau Software (Palo Alto, CA)
item.description:
What you’ll be doing…


In this position, you will be a member of a team of dedicated software engineers focused on testing a suite of next-generation Visual Analytics and Collaboration products. You will help define the strategy for testing interfaces in a cross-platform manner. You will leverage open source tools and build new tools to help ship a high quality product that delights customers. In addition, you have a special fondness for things that are simple, elegant and effective.


Some of the things you’ll be doing include…



  • Writing code to create, improve and maintain new and existing frameworks

  • Analyzing source code to understand areas of risk and complexity to provide optimal test coverage

  • Helping Drive a Test Culture across the entire company

  • Other duties as assigned


Within Product Testing, there are different technical groups:



  • Client:  Tableau designs products for people who use software, not necessarily for people who buy software – the Client team in Product Testing is all about ensuring these products we build provide a delightful experience for our customers.  We understand our customers and how they use our products.  We build robust automation systems with Java and Python that precisely mimic product scenarios and validate the look and accuracy of the resulting visualizations.  We also use our in-development products every day to visualize data in the same way our customers do.  Our team is focused on our desktop client application for Windows and Mac, our browser rendered visualizations on all browsers and all platforms (Windows, mac, mobile) and also our native mobile apps on the iPad and Android tablets.

  • Mobile: The shift towards mobile devices and the increasing need to see and understand your data, are two of the hottest trends in the industry today, and the Mobile team at Tableau is at the confluence of the two. The Tableau Mobile team has been tasked with a single mission: to make the mobile experience the most delightful way for our customers to stay on top of their data. We build next-generation apps for iOS and Android for consumers and enterprises alike, and ensure quality through a variety of modern, innovative techniques, including white-box automation, data-driven pair-wise testing, and instrumentation tools.

  • Platform: As a member of one of our platform teams you’ll work on Tableau’s secret sauce. We are about connecting, querying, integrating and preparing data from nearly 50 different data sources. We are about calculations and statistical analytics. We are about first class test frameworks and more. Ideal candidates will be skilled in one or more programming language, for example Python, C++, C# or Java. Working knowledge of one or more database technology like SQL Server, MySQL, Oracle, DB2, Hadoop or Apache Spark is preferred. Our team verifies that Tableau’s platform is functionally correct, reliable, scalable and high performance for our Windows and Mac desktop as well as our server products. We employ modern testing methodologies to tame the permutation explosion beast and we have fun doing it.

  • Server: The Server Testing group at Tableau owns product quality for Corporate Enterprise Server and Cloud Hosted Services (Tableau Online and Tableau Public). We have a group of dedicated software engineers focused on quality covering overall end to end scenarios as well as functional, performance and scale-out testing of Frontend and Backend components. You will help define the strategy and for testing interfaces and implement tests in a cross-platform manner while leveraging open source tools and build new tools to help ship a high quality product that delights customers. We work closely with our developers and do our daily develop in Java.

  • Performance: Tableau is a product where smart meets speed. This means you can use Tableau to make sense of your big data and be creative. The Performance Test Engineer at Tableau measures and verifies the latencies of Tableau functionalities using different data sizes and sources; they also measure the Page Load Time and throughputs of the Tableau servers.  Our Performance Test engineers use cutting edge testing strategies, frameworks and tools to hold the product to a very high performance bar. Candidates for this group need to be familiar with object oriented languages and feel comfortable to use industry standard performance test frameworks such as JMeter.


Who you are…



  • Experienced. 1-5+ years of experience testing and profiling large-scale C++ systems and highly scalable Java and/or Ruby server systems that back dynamic, highly interactive web experiences. Experience testing on Windows platforms, with experience testing on multiple platforms including Linux. Strong knowledge of database concepts is a plus.

  • Highly Technical. You love writing things that “just work” – things that are robust, scalable and that perform well. Excellent understanding of languages such as C++, Java, Ruby, and Python as well as programming experience with Javascript and css/html. Strong knowledge of development and test tools, in particular Selenium, junit and java tools.

  • Passionate about Quality. A love of testing, tuning and analysis through a rigorous scientific approach.

  • Self-Motivated. You do good work and the drive to deliver is just a part of you.

  • Team Player. You enjoy collaborating with, learning from, and teaching others so we all can become better. You assume the good intent in others, and actively do your part to create a positive work environment.

  • Customer Focused. You want to learn about customers, their challenges & scenarios and you find satisfaction in shipping quality products that delight customers.

  • You have high standards, and your personal software practices ensure you deliver high quality no matter what.  You believe in constantly releasable quality, iterations, design for testability, and you build your own tools & techniques to achieve high quality and low cost of support.  You deliver better results through using quality practices every day, and you even have taught or influenced others to improve their practices.

  • Educated. Bachelor of Science in Computer Science or equivalent

item.title: Intermediate/Senior Javascript Developer to build complex applications at Ontario Institute for Cancer Research (Toronto, ON, Canada)
item.description:
Position:  Intermediate/Senior Javascript Developers


Site:   MaRS Centre


Department:  Informatics & Biocomputing  


Reports To:  Associate Director, Bioinformatics and Software development


Salary:  Commensurate with level of experience


Hours: 35 Hrs/week


Status:  Full-time, Permanent



The Ontario Institute for Cancer Research (OICR) is looking for two Javascript Developers to contribute to the technical development of Informatics and Biocomputing platforms. Within the Bioinformatics and software development group, our mission is to create and improve infrastructures and tools used by cancer researchers around the globe to fight cancer.


Open Source applications built by our department are handling vast amounts of data (2+ PB) and run on large compute environments.


Genomic Data Commons (GDC)


The GDC (http://goo.gl/mZ7Z6N) is a project in collaboration with the University of Chicago (UC) and the National Cancer Institute (NCI). Development started 10 months ago with a Data Portal to provide a means for researchers to search through 2+ PB of legacy data. Built using TypeScript and AngularJS the Portal just entered user acceptance testing and development efforts will now be focused on the next phase of the project, a Submission System that will allow researchers to post and validate their data into GDC. Built using cutting edge technologies like ES6 and React (http://facebook.github.io/react/) this application will provide a dashboard-like mechanism to researchers. GDC Restful APIs are built in Python using Flask.


Role: Intermediate Javascript Developer


On GDC we are looking for a talented front-end developer with strong JS skills and professional experience working with JS MVCs (Angular, Ember, React). As part of the development team, you will be working closely with our architect/team lead and Senior Business Analyst and will be actively participating to the creation of the submission system.


Nice to have:



  • Experience with React, Webpack, Flux, ES6, d3.js

  • Interest or experience in functional programming (underscore, lodash, ClojureScript)

  • Interest or experience in reactive programming (Rx.JS, bacon.js)



International Cancer Genome Consortium Data Coordination Centre (ICGC DCC)


ICGC DCC (https://dcc.icgc.org/), is our live, production system currently hosting some 65+ cancer research projects. The ICGC DCC Portal enable researchers to search through clinical, gene and mutation data, as well as downloading raw genomic datasets. Built using AngularJS, the portal uses mostly Highcharts, D3, SVG for visualization. Our mandate is to keep improving the portal by adding more features, one of our recent addition was to allow researchers to launch their own data analyses (https://dcc.icgc.org/analysis). DCC back-end is built in Java.


Role: Senior Javascript Developer


On DCC we are looking for a talented front-end developer with strong JS skills and professional experience working with web-based technologies such as AngularJS, D3, SVG to take an active role in developing new visualizations and features for the portal. Having a passion for interactive data visualizations, you have experience wrangling and making sense of large, multi-dimensional and complex datasets. You will be working closely with our Senior Business Analyst and Product Owner to implement new features into the data portal.


Nice to have:



  • Working knowledge of interaction-design, usability, information visualization principles

  • Knowledge of visual encoding and understanding of their capabilities and limitations

  • Comfortable with mathematics and algorithms (dealing with power sets, recursions, graphs, abstract syntax trees)



Working on cutting edge technologies (BigData, Cloud environments, REST, Microservices, Object Storage ...), using modern programming languages (Java 1.8, Javascript, Python …) and frameworks (AngularJS, Spark, Spring Boot, Hadoop …), our teams strive to use technologies to obtain the best possible outcome.



If you are passionate about software development, are a quick learner, enjoy producing & sharing beautiful code and want to become part of a team building complex environments from the ground up, just get in touch.

item.title: Senior back end developer at well funded startup at Arivale (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
Arivale is launching an entirely new sector based on scientific wellness with a goal to maximize wellness and minimize disease. Our scientific co-founder, Lee Hood, is a pioneer in the study of human genetics and helped invent 5 instruments at the heart of modern genetics. Dr. Hood has co-founded over a dozen biotech companies, including Amgen, Applied Biosystems, Systemix, Darwin, and Rosetta.  

We joined Arivale because we are highly optimistic about the potential to make a positive difference in the lives of millions of people. We hold each other accountable to achieve ambitious goals in a high trust environment. Additionally, we take employee wellness just as seriously as client wellness with benefits such as flexible time off and sick time policies, healthy snacks in the office, and Fitbits.

If you joined us tomorrow, you could find yourself working on any of the following projects:
- Client portals that present an ever growing set of personalized data and individualized recommendations in a delightful and intuitive way
- Mobile applications that enhance the Arivale experience and help clients make meaningful life changes
- Tools that make our coaches productive and enhance the client/coach relationship Analytics platforms that can drive scientific discoveries over insane amounts of personalized data
- Client communication platforms that automate our interactions with customers

We're looking for back end engineers that thrive on owning end-to-end solutions. As an early member of the team, you will have an opportunity to help us build the technical culture. We believe in well-crafted software, end-to-end ownership of projects, strong opinions loosely held, and rapid iteration. Our (current) stack is Python, AngularJS, Postgres, Docker, and AWS.

If you are interested, please send us your resume, LinkedIn profile, or Github repo.


Required qualifications
-Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field
-5+ years experience designing, developing, testing, and releasing high quality, consumer facing software products
-Expertise in at least one software layer (front end, back end, apps) and proficiency in one or more others (front end, back end, mobile apps, SQL and data modeling, DevOps, test automation)


Preferred qualifications
-A passion for the health and wellness space
-Previous experience and expertise using our existing stack (Python, Javscript, AngularJS, Postgres, Ionic, Docker, AWS)
-Proven success in delivering products and services in a high growth, startup environment
-Ability to exercise high judgment and work autonomously to deliver solutions to actual business problems
-A relentless drive to improve the status quo
-High standards for yourself and your team

item.title: Awesome Senior Devops Engineer needed at Taxibeat Ltd (, ) (allows remote)
item.description:
We are looking for an awesome DevOps Engineer to join our highly skilled development team, to help manage and drive operational systems, requirements and tool sets.  Taxibeat has numerous custom, complex systems running in our data centers to provide traffic and routing information. We are looking for someone who can take full control of our existing systems and infrastructure while helping us make decisions about new infrastructure and technologies to make it better.


The successful candidate will be a team player, capable of collaborating in a fast paced, devops oriented environment as well capable of working very independently with a high level of self-motivation.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - Front End at Appian Corporation (Reston, VA)
item.description:
At Appian, you will help us build our award-winning PaaS product that enables business people to build cloud and mobile enterprise applications with flexible, visual models instead of custom code. Appian discovers and unites enterprise data, connects users through social and collaborative engagement in the context of business data, and provides the leading suite of business process technology to enable rapid application development and optimization in every industry.


As a member of the Interface Designer team, you will help build a tool for creating dynamic, interactive interfaces.  Your goal is to enable designers to build complex interfaces using an intuitive, easy-to-use tool that provides live feedback at design time, allowing them to test the interface immediately as they build it.

item.title: Partner and Software Engineer - High Frequency Trading Hedge Fund in Boston at Domeyard LP (Boston, MA)
item.description:
Domeyard is a hedge fund focused on high frequency trading. We are backed by the founders of one of the largest hedge funds in the world ($55 billion in AUM) and pioneers behind one of the largest public internet companies in Asia. 


We are a flat organization, in which the founders sit next to the interns, and traditional titles don't exist. Our flexible work hours, casual dress code, startup environment (open office with a gaming room, snack pantry, catered food) and generous employee perks (insurance, transportation, phone, health and dental coverage) ensure that you can commit fully to your intellectual interests. We welcome cultural diversity and are able to sponsor H1-B visas. 



Our vision is to set new thresholds for modern computing.
We take pride in possessing some of the fastest trading technologies in the world. Our software engineers build the latest technologies to manage petabytes of data and generate fast, data-driven insights. Every day is a learning exercise: you will explore the frontiers of computer science, in areas such as distributed systems, concurrency, operating systems, networks, computer architecture, data analysis and UI design. We develop and iterate quickly; you will have access to every line of code and can switch between many projects.

Apply to join us! (Takes ~5 min.) 
We are looking for people who share our passion for technology, add a fun-loving character to our team, and inspire each other's growth. We also seek potential candidates that we can help nurture, which is why no financial experience is expected. You will be joining as an early team member and influencing the firm's direction, and have the opportunity to lead a team of software engineers within a few years. Feel free to show us any work that demonstrates your interests, e.g. code samples, academic publications, GitHub projects.

item.title: Front End JavaScript Engineer for Connected Buildings Movement at Lucid (Oakland, CA)
item.description:
As part of the JavaScript engineering team you will work on our core platform, BuildingOS. You will write software that changes how people interact with commercial buildings, brings legacy building technology online, and enables the deployment of the next generation of building IoT devices. You will work closely with a world-class Product Design team to solve hard user interface problems, and you will contribute to the open source libraries and tools that we are using to solve those problems.


We are looking for an experienced engineer who writes simple, composable, and reusable UI code. You'll work on the new UI that we're building in React and Flux, and you'll help migrate our legacy Backbone and jQuery apps to the new framework. We love clear, elegant code, and we value tooling and testing that helps us to move fast and experiment with new ideas.


This position is full-time and based in our office in downtown Oakland, CA.


Responsibilities



  • Work with Product Designers to build analytics, data visualization, and mapping applications

  • Build efficient and reusable front-end components

  • Identify and address performance bottlenecks

  • Participate in design and code reviews

  • Communicate and advocate for best practices for front-end engineering

item.title: Principal Engineer at First. (Durham, NC) (allows remote)
item.description:
About First.


First is a venture-funded startup at the intersection of predictive analytics and real estate tech. We identify when and why people will move, and build products to change the game for real estate professionals and consumers.


Our team is focused on shipping great products and driving innovation in a massive industry (2014 realtor commissions were >$69B). We believe in continuous improvement and sharing knowledge - whether through pair programming, speaking at meetups, and eventually open-sourcing parts of our system.


We’re moving fast and ready for a technical leader to join our CTO in building initial product offerings and automating our data platform.


Engineering


As one of our first engineers, you'll be a senior leader helping guide key architecture and technology decisions. You will reliably scale our data platform to support products and the needs of our data science team. This includes choosing and deploying our server and compute infrastructure (e.g., Ansible, Hadoop, Spark, etc) and building frameworks to support the development of our predictive models.

item.title: Senior Java Developer at Infusion (Toronto, ON, Canada)
item.description:
The Opportunity:



  • Working with one of our capital markets clients on a large scale, complex, highly visible project to understand their product vision and requirements.

  • Providing technical consulting to clients while recommending technologies and solution options that provide critical business operations such as processing multi-billion dollar transactions quickly and error free.

  • Working with cross functional teams to build, engineer, architect and design an electronic trading and risk management solutions

  • Using your Java background in development to work collaboratively with capital markets Traders and IT professionals to brainstorm use cases and problem solve issues.


  WHY INFUSION: 



  • You’ll build your portfolio by working alongside various capital markets leaders on a variety of large, complex, multi-million dollar projects.

  • We’re about transformation. You’ll be challenged to come up with creative solutions working on new technologies.

  • We invest in you. We host programming contest, hackathons and fun training sessions to keep you on top of your game.

  • You’re supported. Whether it’s a training, mentorship, breakfast basket, pizza, spa services, or Infusion’s monthly social events, Infusion takes care of you. 

  • Career progression is real. You will move up if you have the drive.

  • Our Infusion Air program gives you the opportunity to work on projects out of our global offices in North America and Europe.

item.title: Senior full stack developer at well funded startup at Arivale (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
Arivale is launching an entirely new sector based on scientific wellness with a goal to maximize wellness and minimize disease. Our scientific co-founder, Lee Hood, is a pioneer in the study of human genetics and helped invent 5 instruments at the heart of modern genetics. Dr. Hood has co-founded over a dozen biotech companies, including Amgen, Applied Biosystems, Systemix, Darwin, and Rosetta.  

We joined Arivale because we are highly optimistic about the potential to make a positive difference in the lives of millions of people. We hold each other accountable to achieve ambitious goals in a high trust environment. Additionally, we take employee wellness just as seriously as client wellness with benefits such as flexible time off and sick time policies, healthy snacks in the office, and Fitbits.

If you joined us tomorrow, you could find yourself working on any of the following projects:
- Client portals that present an ever growing set of personalized data and individualized recommendations in a delightful and intuitive way
- Mobile applications that enhance the Arivale experience and help clients make meaningful life changes
- Tools that make our coaches productive and enhance the client/coach relationship Analytics platforms that can drive scientific discoveries over insane amounts of personalized data
- Client communication platforms that automate our interactions with customers

We're looking for full stack engineers that thrive on owning end-to-end solutions. As an early member of the team, you will have an opportunity to help us build the technical culture. We believe in well-crafted software, end-to-end ownership of projects, strong opinions loosely held, and rapid iteration. Our (current) stack is Python, AngularJS, Postgres, Docker, and AWS.

If you are interested, please forward your resume, LinkedIn profile, or Github repo.


Required qualifications
-Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field
-5+ years experience designing, developing, testing, and releasing high quality, consumer facing software products
-Expertise in at least one software layer (front end, back end, apps) and proficiency in one or more others (front end, back end, mobile apps, SQL and data modeling, DevOps, test automation)


Preferred qualifications
-A passion for the health and wellness space
-Previous experience and expertise using our existing stack (Python, Javscript, AngularJS, Postgres, Ionic, Docker, AWS)
-Proven success in delivering products and services in a high growth, startup environment
-Ability to exercise high judgment and work autonomously to deliver solutions to actual business problems
-A relentless drive to improve the status quo
-High standards for yourself and your team

item.title: Sr. Software Engineer, Machine Learning Team at TubeMogul (Emeryville, CA)
item.description:
We are seeking a Lead Software Engineer to join our machine learning team to help define our next-generation, optimization platform working closely with Data Scientists. 

We’re looking for highly-motivated individuals with the right skills to help us in developing systems that will have a direct influence on the success of the company. Candidates must have solid experience working on large-scale, distributed systems. This will be an opportunity to take a lead on several core projects with considerations on key architectural and design decisions. 

Join us as we pursue the goal of facilitating the merger of television and on-line media into a consistent experience accessible across any connected device including desktop, tablets, mobile devices and more.


Responsibilities:



  • Lead software development projects enhancing our distributed optimization service and data lake, the core of TubeMogul’s technology platform

  • Work with Data Scientists to implement optimizations to increase campaign effectiveness

  • Collaborate on key architectural decisions and design considerations

  • Monitor and plan out core infrastructure enhancements (a.k.a. stay ahead of possible scalability bottlenecks)

  • Troubleshoot and resolve system problems and customer issues under very tight service level agreement.

  • Mentor junior developers (i.e. demonstrate good coding practices and helping them architect code smartly)

  • Contribute to and promote good software engineering practices across the team

item.title: Information Security Engineer at Gap Inc. (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
The Information Security Engineer works as a member of the Threat & Incident Management team (TIM team). The TIM team is part of Gap’s Information Security organization (InfoSec), working closely with infrastructure, application, and managed service provider teams to ensure the security posture of Gap’s global enterprise is maintained, including endpoint, network, server and border security.



The IT Security engineers serve as Subject Matter Experts (SME) for InfoSec’s portfolio of monitoring and logging tools, providing research, expert advice, and direction on configuration and management of the tools.



The Security Engineer has direct responsibility for working with all GapTech teams in delivering subject matter expertise for cybersecurity incident response and computer forensics services for suspected or confirmed cybersecurity breaches, emerging threats assessment, and supporting legal e-Discovery requests.


Responsibilities



  • Identify security issues and risks associated with security events reported by L1 or L2 InfoSec teams, or via alerts from various security tools, and develop remediation and/or risk mitigation plans

  • Leverage a wide range of security technologies including, but not limited to: SIEM/syslog, IDS/IPS, malware analysis and protection, content filtering, logical access controls, identity and access management, data loss prevention, content filtering technologies, application firewalls, vulnerability scanners, LDAP, security incident response and Identity Management software

  • Participate in incident response and investigations of suspected information technology security misuse or compliance reviews as requested by Gap’s Security Council, InfoSec management, or as required when alerts are received from InfoSec threat monitoring tools and threat intelligence sources

  • Work with InfoSec product vendors and service providers, to evaluate potential security offerings, including product evaluations, pilots and proof of concept installations

  • Assist in responses to internal and external compliance audits, e-Discovery data collection, penetration tests and vulnerability assessments

  • Coordinate maintenance of security-related systems (Anti-Virus, Patching, Intrusion Detection, Logging, Anti-spam, etc.)

  • Monitor current and proposed laws, regulations, industry standards, and ethical requirements related to information security and privacy

  • Conduct research on emerging products, services, protocols, and standards relative to the information security arena

  • Other duties as assigned

item.title: Machine Learning Scientist at insydo (Dubai, United Arab Emirates)
item.description:
The Role


insydo is looking for a talented and passionate Machine Learning Scientist with strong exposure to join our multi-national team and build a highly robust and scalable service.


Providing personalized and intuitive content to our users is a key mission for insydo.  Therefore continuously improving the quality of our recommendation system will play a significant part of your role. Do you like to solve non-trivial problems? Are you excited to overcome a real challenge and think outside the box? If yes- we want to hear from you! 


What you will do:



  • Define and evaluate models for real-time prediction and classification

  • Apply machine learning, collaborative filtering, NLP, and deep learning methods to massive data sets

  • Prototype and evaluate new algorithms

  • Iterate on recommendation quality through continuous A/B testing

  • Exploring data sources to understand properties and quality of real world datasets


We are looking for:



  • Individual with passion for building systems that apply advanced methods of computer science to real-world problems. 

  • Candidate with proven record of applying machine learning technics in commercial projects (e.g. artificial intelligence, recommender systems, user modelling, personalisation, data mining, data modelling, information retrieval or natural language processing).

  • Person with strong mathematical background in statistics, algorithms and machine learning.

item.title: Java Backend Developer (m/f) at Visual Meta GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
We are Visual Meta - an innovative, Berlin based internet company which has grown to over 200 employees since its foundation in 2009, and we're still growing at a relentless pace. We run shopping sites in 19 countries across three continents LadenZeile.de, ShopAlike.com.br, Shoppala.com, and ShopAlike.in. Despite our great success we have managed to retain a very friendly and open working environment. Since 2011 we have belonged to the Axel Springer Group and have benefited from its great network of online businesses. 


We are looking for “Java Backend Developer (m/f)” on a full-time basis to help us inventing, extending and scaling our backend services for leading shopping comparison platforms worldwide like LadenZeile and ShopAlike.


We deal a lot with data mining and analysis, large databases, images, search technologies, machine learning and web technologies. We code stuff that matters and reaches millions of people. Our technology stack is plain Java, MySQL, Hadoop, Spring, Eclipse and Tomcat.


Your responsibilities:



  • Managing the data warehousing, reporting and visualization

  • Improving our online marketing applications and our data processing / bidding systems

  • Developing back office applications / content management systems

  • Scaling databases for MySQL and Hadoop

  • Controlling the service integration and operating with administration tools


What we offer:



  • A committed, successful and international engineering team in one of the best tech companies in Berlin

  • Continuous training possibilities and room for further personal development

  • Large impact due to small, excellent development teams and professional data center environments

  • Leading-edge technology to solve challenging problems and to build great software

  • Healthy snacks (fruits, cereals), water and hot drinks

  • Flexible working hours, team events, corporate events and leisure activities to support your work-life balance


If you are interested in an exciting position within a friendly team, please submit your application in English to the attention of Johannes Schaback, including cover letter, CV, your earliest starting date, salary expectations as well as relevant references, by using the following Link: https://hire.jobvite.com/j?aj=orjlZfwO&s=stackoverflow


We are looking forward to receiving your application!


Visual Meta GmbH | Schützenstraße 25 | 10117 Berlin


www.ladenzeile.de | www.visual-meta.com

item.title: Senior Software Engineer (Palo Alto OR Seattle) at Coupang (Palo Alto, CA)
item.description:
Coupang - Sr. Software Engineer - Palo Alto or Seattle


What if you could set the standard of how e-commerce can and should be done around the world?


Now you can at Coupang!



We are Korea’s largest online retailer and our goal is to create the next-generation e-commerce model. According to Nikesh Arora, we are “one of the fastest-growing and most disruptive Internet companies in the world.” In just 4 years, we already have over 25M devoted users and over $2.5B in annual revenue. And we are just getting started!



We just closed a whopping $1 BILLION round of funding, and we are about to undergo hypergrowth! We have offices in Seoul, Shanghai, Palo Alto, Seattle, and Ontario, CA. We are looking to double our amazing team in the U.S.!



If you want to work in a fun, challenging environment while changing how the world thinks about e-commerce, then we want to hear from you!



About the role:



You’ll get to work with the best in the industry, with many of our team members coming from Amazon, eBay, PayPal, Facebookand more! You’ll work in a collaborative and open environment where we consider ourselves a family (Check out our Family Day!). And our agile environment will enable you to rapidly innovate with the most cutting edge technologies.



What you’ll do:


You’ll be faced with unique challenges to scale we aim to grow to more than 55M+ users in Korea alone. You’ll also get to push the envelope of what’s possible with mobile commerce (currently over 75% of our sales are done on mobile)!



Some specific things you’ll work on:



  • Highly Scalable and Reliable services oriented architecture

  • Big Data Analytics supporting data collection, modeling, and optimization

  • Strategic domains such as mobile payments, pricing, search, personalization, and supply chain management.

  • Consumer driven web and native mobile interfaces and APIs.



(We are only able to consider candidates local to the U.S. at this time. Thank you for your interest!)

item.title: Senior Scala Software Engineer at Weight Watchers (New York, NY)
item.description:
Weight Watchers uses modern Lean and Agile practices as well as best of breed Engineering practices to deliver leading consumer focused products. Weight Watchers places a major emphasis on mobile and digital solutions to help our members reach their goals. This includes integrating with technologies such as Fitbit & iOS Health, as well as building custom, intuitive products to serve our millions of members.As we rebuild many of our core experiences, we are seeking talented people who are excited to join our team. This is a rare opportunity to join a company embracing a modern Technology culture, where you will have the ability to improve peoples lives in a very meaningful way and have a major impact on Weight Watchers offerings to our members. As reliance on health and wellness awareness increases, you can be be part of the team that is leading the way.

Senior Scala Software Engineer

We’re hiring a core team that will build a new product technology platform from the ground up. The new platform will be a vital part of the company’s transformation and its reimagined product offering. From technology selection and architecture to team structure and processes, the core team will take on the challenge of building a new Micro Service Architecture that will power Weight Watchers over the coming years.

item.title: Software Engineer - C#, VB.Net, ASP.Net, Sharepoint at King & Spalding LLP (Atlanta, GA)
item.description:
Responsible for working on complex software engagements and systems integration projects from a development standpoint. Serves as a lead on medium-sized projects dealing with data warehousing, data migration and architecting middleware to facilitate the exchange of data between enterprise applications. This person will help architect technical solutions and then handle the coding and implementation of the software engineering phase of the project. This person will work closely with Project Managers, Analysts, Usability Designers and the rest of the Software Engineering group. They may be called upon periodically to meet with end users to assist in architecting solutions with the Analysts. This position works closely with Usability Designers and other Software Engineers to create web based application interfaces for various firm databases and products.

Qualifications:



  • Extensive knowledge and experience with a wide variety of Microsoft development tools and languages including C# and ASP.Net within the .NET Framework, SQL Server and Active Directory.

  • Extensive experience working with basic web scripting such as HTML, JavaScript, CSS and other interfacing technologies needed to support substantial web-based software applications.

  • Thorough understanding of software development processes and best practices.

  • Ability to handle high-stress situations and deal successfully with conflict.

  • Excellent analytical and communication skills (written and verbal) and the ability to relate technical information to a non-technical audience.

  • Excellent work ethics and the ability to work as a part of a team to accomplish assigned tasks and responsibilities.

  • Ability to manage multiple assignments and varying priorities.

  • Very organized, responsible, goal oriented with attention to detail.

item.title: Senior Level Back-End Web Developer at Moore & Scarry Advertising (Fort Myers, FL)
item.description:
Job Title:       Senior Level Back-End Web Developer


Job Status:     Full-time, On-site


Department:   Technology


Reports To:    General Manager of Digital Video


Job Description


Develop interactive web sites utilizing a strong fundamental knowledge of writing semantic, modular back end code using JavaScript, Python, and other data oriented programming languages or APIs.  Must understand and demonstrate the concepts of progressive enhancement, data analytics and future friendly code.   Must be familiar with application testing and debugging, have ample experience navigating MVC frameworks such as Angular, Django, Node, etc. Must have an understanding of data intensive applications, APIs, and utilize progressive iteration strategy as the fundamental work flow approach. A good understanding of responsive design/development.   Ability to work with front-end languages such as HTML (including HTML5), CSS3 are a major bonus. 


Required:


- Mastery of JavaScript, Python, and/or Javacscript with proven hands on experience


- Deep understanding and data intensive applications and their associated languages


- Experience with Node, Angular, Django, Ember, Backbone


- Expertise across multiple modern build systems with expertise spanning several systems of relevance


Experience defining technical project requirements


Experience designing/architecting complex, cross-functional solutions


- Skilled at bringing engaging user analytics to life using CSS transitions/animations, WebGL, Canvas, and JavaScript-driven animation


- Strong familiarity with CSS preprocessors (Sass, Less, Stylus, etc) and understands their benefits and limitations in producing efficient, maintainable code.


- Expert understanding of high-throughput back-end performance and creating data elements that make efficient use of resources for a large number of users


- Experience using Git


- Experience with back-end testing


Preferred:


- Experience defining, building and maintaining RESTful APIs (huge plus)


- Strong understanding of clean design and UX


- Familiarity with web analytic systems and concepts


Educational Requirements & Qualifications:


Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related degree, certification, or equivalent work experience. 


A minimum of 5-7 years of demonstrable experience with an active portfolio is required.  Advanced skill sets, and the ability to work independently with minimal oversight on complex technical project are a must.  The successful candidate will be well versed with standard terms and web protocols used in the domain. He/she must be able to design highly reliable back-end systems that span multiple technologies, and has used more than one web framework in a professional capacity and is well-versed with the idioms of those frameworks.


 Must have the ability to work well under pressure and thrive in a fast paced deadline driven environment.  Employee must be willing to increase skill set by utilizing employer paid training opportunities.

item.title: Software Engineer at Entrepreneurial Finance Lab (Cambridge, MA)
item.description:
About the Position:


EFL is seeking a technology guru to work directly on the intersection of software engineering and data science. As the primary lead on critical system operations and quality, you’ll have the opportunity to interact directly with clients all around the world and play a critical role in the smooth functioning of our critical modelling, data science, and software engineering processes.



You will work closely with EFL developers, statisticians, Account Managers, and customers. With responsibility for the end-to-end dataflow, you’ll ensure that our mobile platforms are working well in the field, our systems are running, and our data is being scored correctly. With responsibility for monitoring and client escalation issues, as well as critical roles during the new client launch phase, you’ll see an incredibly detailed view of how EFL works in 20 different countries around the world.



Primary Responsibilities:



  • Successfully manage and execute customer-facing Level 2 escalation issues

  • Develop hotfixes and upgrades to support a highly available cloud based platform

  • Participate in release deployment validation and processes

  • Develop automated testing frameworks and regression processes for a highly efficient quality system

  • Contribute and drive major development initiatives with codebases in Python/Django, R, MySQL, JQuery and React


Location: This position will be based either in our Boston office (in Cambridge) or Lima, Peru. At a minimum, this position will require an initial period of 2-3 months of up-front time spent in Lima followed by periodic trips back to Lima.

item.title: Senior Business Systems Analyst (Must have strong Salesforce.com experience) at CDK Global (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
CDK Global is seeking at Business Operations Analyst


POSITION SUMMARY


The Business Systems Analyst III provides advanced level of expertise in identifying, driving, developing and/or deploying technical systems and/or reporting solutions within the Services group. Associate is responsible for independently conducting the analysis of business issues and requests that require the creation, updating and/or enhancements to Services business systems and/or reporting solutions.


This person will apply their strong knowledge of established Services business processes to recommend appropriate solutions that help solve the identified business need(s). The BSA utilizes advanced knowledge of Salesforce, SQL, Tableau, and/or other applicable tools, technology, and business systems to perform gap analysis, document business requirements, recommend solutions, identify level of effort and deliver on complex business-critical projects. You will work directly with business and technology stakeholders, Services program management and supporting resources to identify and recommend appropriate technical solutions.


The Business Systems Analyst performs configuration and testing of agreed upon solutions as assigned. You will provide expert level of technical and business expertise to other team members including solution analysis, quality review and testing of developed solutions.


The Business Systems Analyst actively participates in business strategy discussions relating to new functionality, system solutions or other broadly scoped initiatives as assigned.


PRINCIPAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Business Analysis: Plans, conducts, and documents analysis efforts associated with assigned business processes and issues or initiatives that require creation of new and/or updating of existing business systems, tools and/or critical business processes. This includes managing business process review (BPR) sessions with stakeholders, documenting business requirements, providing relevant solution options and creation of functional specifications and use-cases to support any associated business system configuration or development efforts.

  • Systems/Application Support and Administration: Provides expert level of systems support, maintenance and administration for assigned systems.This includesadministration and configuration associated with assigned database, CRM, telephony or related applications and tools to ensure alignment with the requirements of the business. Provide subject matter expert to team members and stakeholders on assigned systems and other business-critical applications.

  • Reporting Development and Data Analysis. Develops, executes, and maintains assigned datasets, reports and data mining efforts specific to all core business systems supported by the Services Operations team. This includes performing expert level data and impact analysis on assigned metrics, business processes and systems to ensure accuracy and relevance to Services initiatives and business priorities.


KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES



  • Proven track record of researching and analyzing complex technical issues and then summarizing them via table, graphs, and written analysis

  • Strong verbal and interpersonal skills; exceptional writing skills demonstrated by delivering clear, correct and timely communications and effectively working with others.

  • Ability to analyze complex data or systems issues and to provide actionable recommendations to impacted teams based on the analysis

  • Ability to analyze complex business processes and identify efficiency opportunities and/or solutions to resolve process gaps or related business challenges

  • Identify, develop and document requirements that clearly support and communicate needs to Services stakeholders, IT and supporting teams

  • Ability to effectively present analysis and data findings to wide range of technical and non-technical audiences

  • Detail oriented with excellent time management and organizational skills to meet critical deadline

  • Ability to interface effectively with multiple functions/organizations and all levels of management.

  • Ability to design solutions that anticipate areas of contention and are adaptable to future changes

  • Strong data and problem solving ability

  • Ability to analyze, test and document solutions to ensure business requirements have been satisfied

  • Ability to administer data warehouse systems and other assigned systems/tools

  • Ability to effectively troubleshoot data inaccuracies, identify root causes, and take corrective action

  • Ability to effectively mentor and train associates within job family


PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS & WORK ENVIRONMENT


Duties are performed in an office environment while sitting at a desk or computer table. Duties require the manual ability to utilize a computer keyboard and the ability to read printed material. Duties may require the ability to travel via automobile or airplane. Duties may require being on call periodically and working outside of normal working hours (holidays, evenings and weekends).

item.title: Database Administrator at EMBL-EBI (Hinxton, UK)
item.description:
We are seeking a highly proficient and motivated Database Administrator to join the Database Administration Team (DBA Team), part of the Systems Applications team. Located in Hinxton, near Cambridge, the European Bioinformatics Institute (EMBL-EBI) offers a unique opportunity to acquire professional experience in an international scientific environment.

The Systems Applications team consists of 15 System Administrators responsible for our virtual infrastructure, database administration and desktop user support.

The DBA Team is responsible for the database administration of the large central database infrastructure that is deployed over a Virtual Infrastructure based on VMWare. This infrastructure serves most Services and Research groups at EMBL-EBI and incorporates databases across geographically distributed production, public facing and disaster recovery datacentres.

The job consists of providing day-to-day Database Administration activities for the Production, Development and Test database environments across the supported database technologies MySQL, Oracle, PostgreSQL, Vertica, MongoDB and MS SQL Server.

The activities of the Team include (but are not limited to):



  • Database software installation and configuration;

  • Back-up and recovery;

  • Dataguard and replication solutions;

  • Scripting;

  • Performance tuning;

  • Database virtualisation and databases in virtualised environments;

  • Exploring innovation;

  • Monitoring, reporting and keeping online documentation up-to-date; and

  • Interacting with database developers and application developers from the EMBL-EBI service groups.


The EBI is part of the European Molecular Biology Laboratory (EMBL) and it is a world-leading bioinformatics centre providing biological data to the scientific community with expertise in data storage, analysis and representation. EMBL-EBI provides freely available data from life science experiments, performs basic research in computational biology and offers an extensive user training programme, supporting researchers in academic and industry.

a10:author.a10:name: The Science and Technology Facilities Council

item.title: Software Development Engineer Ref: IRC202655 at The Science and Technology Facilities Council (Didcot, UK)
item.description:
STFC Rutherford Appleton Laboratory, Harwell, Oxfordshire


Salary £37,213 - £43,426 (dependent upon qualifications and experience and inclusive of annual allowance)


About The Role


We now have an opportunity for an experienced Software Development Engineer to join STFC’s Central Laser Facility (CLF), which provides scientists with an unparalleled range of state-of-the-art laser technology to carry out a broad range of experiments in physics, chemistry and biology.



This role will develop and support software systems which are used throughout CLF, and implement and maintain professional software development tools and techniques.



Further duties include:



  • Manage software development projects for large scale laser systems.

  • Develop laser and target area control systems using professional development tools and techniques, producing all relevant documentation.

  • Develop software for laser diagnostic equipment.

  • Automate target area systems and improve data collection and processing.

  • Maintain and develop Subversion and Trac configuration management system.

  • Develop software development policy.

  • Provide rapid response support consistent with the operation of a scheduled facility including out of hours work as appropriate.

item.title: Principal Technical Program Manager, Alexa at Amazon (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
Interested in Amazon Echo and Alexa? We’ve already added dozens of new capabilities to Alexa since launch, including Pandora, Google Calendar, Audible, sports scores and schedules, and more. But it’s still day 1 - you can be part of the team that makes Alexa smarter by creating new skills and capabilities.



You will have an enormous opportunity to impact the customer experience, design, architecture, and implementation of cutting edge products that will be used every day by people you know. No matter what the role, we’re looking for people who are passionate about innovating on behalf of customers, demonstrate a high degree of product ownership, and want to have fun while they make history.



The Principal Technical Program Manager role requires working with product management to define strategy and requirements, and leading cross functional development teams from design through delivery, and managing all related timelines. This position involves regular communication with senior management on status, risks and change control. Cross-team coordination, project management and executive presentation skills are essential.



The ideal candidate is a creative, demonstrated leader/manager with superior analytical abilities. This opportunity requires excellent technical, problem-solving, and communication skills. The candidate is not just a policy maker/spokesperson but drives to get things done. At the core of the position is delivery.



We are looking for a strongly technical, customer-focused Principal Technical Program Manager with skills that span research science, software engineering, product management and sheer vision. In this role you will:



- Own and manage customer directions in speech interfaces, defining the vision for the voice experience and unfailingly delivering in the customer’s interest;

- Use your depth in spoken language understanding technologies to drive investments in accuracy and end-to-end voice experience quality;

- Drive solutions from the data - dive deep into experience data to identify problems and push for solutions, writing your own analytic scripts and tools where necessary;

- Find the opportunities for multiplying innovation across different customers, ploughing individual technology advances into the core science and platforms;

- Drive consistent results and customer impact across the scientific and engineering teams.


  • Product development experience (including C++, Java, XML, messaging protocols, and Web Services)

  • Experience building processes, project management, and release schedules

  • 8+ years of relevant work experience in internet-related program and/or technical product management in a software applications environment

  • Bachelors degree in computer science, engineering or a related technical discipline




  • Knowledge of professional software engineering practices & best practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations

  • Experience in communicating with users, other technical teams, and management to collect requirements, evaluate alternatives and develop processes and tools as needed to support the organization.

  • Experience developing in a Linux environment and in utilizing virtual machines

  • Knowledge of industry standard test automation tools and experience in developing product test harnesses and instrumenting products to gather test results

  • Experience with test driven development and establishing unit test infrastructures

  • Experience automating the validating of modern user interfaces and messaging infrastructures

  • Experience with evaluating and integrating open source and in house developed toolsets

  • Excellent communication skills and the ability to generate and communicate meaningful development metrics

  • Expert in software quality and testing methodologies

  • Comfortable working in a fast paced, highly collaborative, dynamic work environment

  • Experienced in interacting and coordinating test activities amongst multiple teams

  • Experience with Web Services is a plus


Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer - Minority/Female/Disability/Vet
