item.title: Amazon Echo - Software Development Manager at Amazon (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
Interested in Machine Learning? How about Amazon Echo? We’re building the machine learning platform behind Amazon Echo and other Amazon products and services. We’re working hard, having fun, making history; come join us!



As the Manager of Software Development, you will be responsible for leading a team of engineers in design, development, test, and deployment of distributed workflow systems and machine learning infrastructure systems. A successful candidate will have an established background in developing distributed systems, a strong technical ability, excellent project management skills, great communication skills, and a motivation to achieve results in a fast paced environment. You will be helping to hire and build your team and systems, and will own defining the road map for your group.



Key Responsibilities:

  • Responsible for the over-all systems development life cycle

  • Management and execution against project plans and delivery commitments; Manage the day-to-day activities of the engineering team within an Agile/Scrum environment

  • Management of departmental resources, staffing, mentoring, and enhancing and maintaining a best-of-class engineering team

  • Work closely with the engineers to architect and develop the best technical design and approach

  • Report on status of development, quality, operations, and system performance to management

  • Customer engagement and product road map definition.




  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science (MS, Ph.D. in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, etc.)

  • The key requirement for this position is established skill designing and developing solutions to complex problems in a distributed systems environment.

  • Strong technical credentials, with at least 8 years experience managing software development teams, ideally with some hands-on architectural or distributed systems experience

  • Mastery of the tools of the trade, including familiarity with modern programming languages (Java, JavaScript, C/C++, Objective C) and open-source technologies (Apache, Hadoop)

  • A strong track record of project delivery for large, cross-functional, projects

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to present complex technical information in a clear and concise manner to a variety of audiences

  • A track record of communicating well with executives and non-technical leaders




  • MS, Ph.D. in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, etc.

  • Experience with big data solutions

  • Knowledge of ML fundamentals


Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer - Minority/Female/Disability/Vet

item.title: Web Developer at Istituto Italiano di Tecnologia (Genova, Italy)
item.description:
Fondazione Istituto Italiano di Tecnologia is looking for a web developer to join the Digital Unit team based in Genova, Italy.


We offer a competitive salary, young and friendly company culture, casual dress and a flexible work environment.


We are looking for a front-end Web Developer who is motivated to combine the art of design with the art of programming. Responsibilities will include translation of the UI/UX design wireframes to actual code that will produce visual elements of the application. You will bridge the gap between graphical design and technical implementation, taking an active role on both sides and defining how the application looks as well as how it works.


It's really important that you have a good knowledge of all the technologies that make a website work behind the scenes. We expect you to get involved, helping to maintain and extend the existing code base, creating brand new sections of websites as well as developing new sites and web applications.


Responsibilities



  • Develop functional and appealing web applications based on usability

  • Build reusable code and libraries for future use

  • Ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs

  • Optimize applications for maximum speed and scalability

  • Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders

  • Create quality mock-ups and prototypes

  • Write functional requirement documents and specifications

  • Maintain graphic standards and branding throughout the product's interface

  • Provide website maintenance and enhancements

  • Stay up-to-date on emerging technologies

  • Promote usability best practices

  • Assist back-end developers in coding and troubleshooting

item.title: Security Architect at Exaptive (Oklahoma City, OK)
item.description:
Exaptive, Inc is an MIT affiliated, fast-growing software startup that has offices in Oklahoma City, Boston and Vancouver, Canada. We are now expanding our Oklahoma City team. 

We are looking for an experience security architect that has designed scaleable and secure web application, and is also comfortable performing penetration testing and security analysis of systems. 

Some of the challenges of designing the Exaptive platform is that its goal is to be extended by third-party components, and those components will be bought and sold in a component store much like the Apple app store. This opens up opportunities for malicious code as well as introducing the complexity of financial transaction processing. On top of that, Exaptive frequently gets used for data science in fields that have confidential and proprietary data. So we're looking for someone with experience designing architectures that can deal with these things - someone with experience designing sandbox systems for large-scale multi-user environments, with financial transaction processsing applications, and with designing systems with secure data handling. 

This position will be based in downtown OKC, but with the opportunity for travel to Exaptive's Boston and Vancouver locations. The position will have the opportunity to evolve into a role in which the person has an equity-stake in the company. The right person will be excited about the dynamic and fast-paced (aka stressful) environment of a startup and view that as a benefit, not a drawback. The startup environment is not for everyone, but for the person who is looking for that sort of life experience, the opportunity to help build something from the ground up where individual contributions make immediate and substantial impacts on the company as a whole can be extremely rewarding. 

Those interested can find out more about the company, and view some demo videos of our software in actionon our website: www.exaptive.com. We were featured on the front page of the Business Innovation section of The Boston Globe (http://www.boston.com/business/technology/innoeco/2013/12/cambridge-based_exaptive_wants.html) and in Oklahoma City's The Journal Record (http://www.i2e.org/news/innovators-exaptive-inc/). Our Founder and CEO, Dave King, has been invited internationally to present our work. You can see a video of a presentation he recently gave to the Oklahoma Venture Forum about Exaptive's big-picture vision on our website. 


If you don't currently live in Oklahoma City, you should check out what this up-and-coming city has to offer: a burgeoning tech startup and creative sector, the largest food truck event in the nation, olympic rowing facilities, and a cost of living that can't be beat. For the right candidate we'll pay relocation costs.

item.title: Manager, Software Engineering at Rubicon Project (Los Angeles, CA)
item.description:
Do you live to solve problems, technical and otherwise?  Do you take responsibility where others fear to tread? Are you passionate, fast and detail-oriented in your work?  Can you communicate as readily with executives as with developers?  Do you want to manage people while staying technically hands-on?


If your answers to these questions are “yes”, great!  The Rubicon Project is growing, and we need development managers who are thorough and agile, capable of breaking down and solving complex problems, and have a strong will to get things done.  In the Data Pipeline team you will work on real-world problems working on big data sets where accuracy and speed are paramount, take responsibility for your systems end-to-end and influence the direction of our technology that impacts customers around the world.


Primary Responsibilities:



  • Be an end-to-end owner of software services spanning technology boundaries

  • Translate business requirements into technical designs and project plans

  • Write production-ready code and unit tests that meet both system and business requirements

  • Respond to feature requests, bug reports, performance issues and ad-hoc questions

  • Work collaboratively with multiple teams to deliver quality software

  • Support operation of services in production

  • Line manager of other developers

item.title: Database Administrator at Cognitive Medical Systems (San Diego, CA)
item.description: We are looking for a SQL Server DBA with ability to help architect and maintain multiple databases for development and production environments. This person should also have familiarity with data access techniques across multiple platforms and have the flexibility to support non-Microsoft operating systems and tools.

item.title: Senior Automation And Monitoring Middleware Developer at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:

The UI Infrastructure team provides the building blocks used by the firm's 3000+ R&D employees to deliver high-quality, high-performance functionality to our customers in a timely manner. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to work across a number of development scrum teams to support an agile continuous development and deployment environment. Strong technical and programming skills, excellent problem solving skills required. Day to day tasks involve development and integration of the Bloomberg Terminal's back-end infrastructure and the CI and monitoring framework needed for deployment and troubleshooting. The candidate will be responsible for ensuring the reliability, scalability and performance of the applications that are running on this infrastructure, as well as the long term evolution of the deployment monitoring infrastructure. The candidate will have experience with automation and monitoring using tools and technologies such as Jenkins, JIRA, Chef, Python, web and cloud services across a range of platforms including Windows, Linux, Solaris, and AIX.

item.title: Back-end Web Developer at Sorenson Media (Draper, UT)
item.description:
The Backend web developer will design, implement, and oversee the operations of systems to manage a high volume, commercially valuable, and technically challenging data stream. The project involves several aspects typical of current data-science: near real time, large volumes, transformations, escrow into reportable forms, analysis for patterns, long term storage, and global scope. The system is being built inside Amazon’s AWS cloud using state of the art technologies.


Duties & Responsibilities:



  • Responsible for designing an overall solution to the problem: proper subsystem selection, partitioning of the processing problems, operations, and analysis of the business problems must be considered.

  • Responsible for scaling and availability of the designed system.

  • Defines appropriate data archival strategy appropriate to working with massive scale, exponentially increasing datasets

  • Responsible for scaling backend data storage platforms spanning to a multi petabyte storage environment

  • Manages Amazon Web Services (AWS) footprint including costs, evolution, privacy, security, etc.

  • Must be able to integrate the new system with existing products and infrastructure.

  • Configures virtualized environments within AWS to support organizational goals (to include VPN, gateways, routing, security groups, IAM policy, and virtual hosts)

  • Leads the effort surrounding traditional Extract, Transform, and Load capabilities with the ability to crossover to modern message bus technology such as Apache Storm, RabbitMQ, and/or AWS Kinesis

  • Shows a strong ability to see below the superficial first layers of complex problem spaces—efficiently employs the tools appropriate to solve the problem at hand

item.title: BlackRock Developer at BlackRock (San Francisco, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Description


The Aladdin Product Group develops and supports every facet of BlackRock’s information systems needs. Our global teams perform a wide variety of activities from maintaining system stability to growing the features and functionality of our state-of the-art trading and asset management platform, Aladdin. The breath of our responsibilities calls for a diverse range of expertise. 


This role is for a Software Development position within the Core Transaction Processing team in San Francisco which is responsible for the development of Aladdin's Order Management/Trading, Trade Operations, Securities Lending and iShares systems. Collectively, these systems are the backbone of the Aladdin investment process. 


Responsibilities:



  • Working with project managers, technical leads, business owners and analysts through the whole SDLC: understanding systems requirements, designing and writing code, unit testing and documentation.

  • Work with other development teams to design and build reusable technologies

  • Understand and support existing systems, including resolving operational issues while working with teams located across the globe

  • Ability to execute and communicate solutions

item.title: Server-Side Software Engineer at Retroficiency, Inc. (Boston, MA)
item.description:
As a Server-Side Software Engineer at Retroficiency, you will specialize in developing back-end systems and APIs that support our front-end developers. You will play a key role in helping us design and deploy SaaS cloud-based products that are innovative and unique in our industry.


We are looking for a talented, experienced software engineer comfortable with modern libraries, build tools, workflow, and object-oriented design patterns. This role requires strong analytical skills, commitment to quality, collaborative work ethic, and cutting-edge coding skills. You should be rooted in object-oriented design and development and be comfortable with an Agile development approach.


Role Summary



  • Write server-side code for web-based, SaaS applications; develop prototypes quickly and create robust production SaaS services

  • Work closely with Building Energy domain experts to devise and develop product requirements, features, and algorithms

  • Work closely with Front-end engineers to develop and implement robust API services

  • Utilize object-orient design patterns in the implementation of reusable, performant, and secure components

  • Write subsystems that communicate in real time to external services using Web Services and/or APIs

  • Possess a strong understanding of relational (MySQL) database design concepts

  • Manage your own time and work well both independently and as part of a team

  • Translate agile software development stories into reusable units of functionality. Ability to estimate level of effort and prototype as necessary

item.title: Senior Application Developer at Contentive (London, UK)
item.description:
You might not have heard of Contentive yet. But we are about to make a lot of noise.


We're not one of those big, slow moving companies that are suffocating under its own weight. Instead, we're working to build a world-class platform with a great team in a high performing environment.


Our focus is firmly on developing our own products. Already we’ve deployed a mature stack that reaches a global audience. But we want to build more and continually evolve what we already have.


This includes content management systems, user insight tools, data harvesting, powerful reporting and analysis, marketing automation and dynamic content delivery – and that’s just the beginning.  The landscape we work in is always evolving and we evolve with it. Marrying one piece of tech when there are new offerings arriving every day, well, we don’t want to get left behind and our Developers love that. 


To be the best we need the best People and Products


This is a crucial hire for Contentive and one that is key to ensuring our products evolve and drive our company into a market leading position.


To achieve this you will work within our hive of discovery, learning and mastery that leverages a variety of technologies. For example: we might look at Python/Django for one project, maybe Python/Pyramid for another, how about MongoDB, ElasticSearch or Cassandra for something else, even PHP/Postgres for the odd job and for the front-end... SASS!


You will take ownership of the development process, ensure product iterations are successfully delivered, provide input to product design and technology decisions and help other developers improve and learn.


Reporting into our Head of Technology, you will work in agile/scrum team among other developers, data architects, testers, creatives, and product managers.

item.title: Full Stack Engineer - Budapest at Prezi.com (Budapest, Magyarország)
item.description:
We're looking for an engineer interested in writing and running the mission-critical backend services of Prezi and building forward thinking web experiences and interactions for our users.  


As a Full Stack Engineer, you’ll have the opportunity to work with a growing start-up, building things millions of people will see everyday. You will experience and experiment with new technologies and work with a group of people whom you can learn and keep pushing things forward. This position is located in our Budapest office.



You should be excited about:




  • Joining a team that focuses on the growth of the whole product




  • Working in a small, cross functional team with other engineers, designers, data analysts, marketing, product managers.




  • Creating customer facing applications




  • New technology and design




  • Working in a challenging, fast paced and always changing environment.




  • Working with big data





Challenges you will be working on:




  • Participate in building a microservice architecture which scales, routes around failure and lets us build complex systems out of small components as well as maintain existing web applications.




  • Run everything into the cloud (AWS), rethinking the assumptions that no longer hold in our current architecture.




  • Help us build our emerging JVM based stack (built on the Netflix open-source stack, mostly in Scala), which will power our next generation of services.




  • Open source some of the awesome things we’re working on.




  • Develop and maintain existing backend services (mostly written in Python) to ensure they are efficient, reliable and secure enough for our many million users.




  • Exploring exciting relationships, patterns, answers in our enormous data sets




  • Developing high fidelity functional prototypes to validate growth initiatives




  • Pro-actively enhancing our web platform

item.title: Principal UI Developer at ADP (Roseland, NJ) (allows remote)
item.description:
The Principal Application Developer is responsible for developing the ADP Reporting product for ADP's external clients. The ADP Reporting team is focused on building a cutting edge reporting product with a simple mission -- make it beautiful, performant, simple and useful. The product will include a simple drag and drop interface, report preview, a library of categorized fields/reports and will extend to the manager persona. The reporting solution will be tightly integrated with the Analytics solution to enhance the user reporting experience while also providing insightful information combining transactions data with predictive analytics, benchmarks and mash-up data so users can make intelligent business decisions.


We are seeking candidates with a desire to get involved with a product through its infancy and help contribute to its success. The right candidate will not only have strong technical skills but also possess the leadership skills needed to mentor junior developers (onshore and offshore) while meeting their own deliverables. We seek someone who is continually looking to grow, technically, as our architecture stack continues to evolve to meet the changing demands of our clients and growing user base.



Principal Application Developers work with product managers analysts, architects and engineers to plan, design, develop, test and implement information technology solutions consistent with the business objective.


Principal Application Developers at ADP are expected to be results-oriented, have knowledge of new and legacy technologies, have knowledge of the relevant platforms and environments, and be familiar with business process, functions and data within their domain to provide innovative, insightful, and secure solutions.

item.title: QA Engineer at SemanticBits (Herndon, VA) (allows remote)
item.description:
SemanticBits is looking to hire a talented QA engineer who can help us test the next generation clinical applications.

The ideal candidate will be self-motivated, a fast learner and passionate about testing software. He or she has a strong grasp of computer science fundamentals, experience working across different technologies, and the ability to think critically about problems and choose the right course of action.


You will...



  • Develop, manage and execute test plans and test cases.

  • Generate test reports and traceability matrix.

  • Decompose high-level business requirements into test scenarios.

  • Setup and maintain test environments.

  • Deploy software in Linux environment from .jar and .war files.

  • Build automated data-driven test harnesses.

  • Use several open source testing tools/frameworks such as SOAPUI, Selenium

  • Investigate and conduct root cause analysis of software and system defects.

  • Work as part of a team and interact effectively with others.

  • Mentor and supervise junior members of the team.

item.title: R&D Team Leader Network Design And Security at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:

Bloomberg's Network Design Information Security (NDIS) Team is looking for a developer to provide the building blocks for an automation system. The system will encompass both open source and third party vendor solutions. Working on all aspects of monitoring, alarming, and network security configuration for several hundred proxy servers, firewalls, caches, and load balancers. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to work on the initial builds and implementation of this multi- platform and multi-tiered system. Will be involved in the full life cycle from requirements generation, development planning, development, implementation, feature and bug fix.

item.title: C / C++ Software Engineer at Tenable Network Security (Columbia, MD) (allows remote)
item.description:
Tenable Network Security, founded in 2002, provides continuous network monitoring to identify vulnerabilities, reduce risk and ensure compliance.  Our products are relied upon by more than 20,000 organizations, including the entire U.S. Department of Defense and many of the world’s largest companies and governments --- -- we call this a start!


Tenable Network Security, founded in 2002, provides continuous network monitoring to identify vulnerabilities, reduce risk and ensure compliance.  Our products are relied upon by more than 20,000 organizations, including the entire U.S. Department of Defense and many of the world’s largest companies and government.  

Our global expansion is creating job opportunities for creative thinkers who are wired for action and delivering big results. We’re also stacked with industry rock stars who are just as comfortable keynoting a conference or delivering a podcast as they are mentoring up-and-coming colleagues. But what our employees are most excited about is our products. Our market-defining technology provides continuous network monitoring to identify vulnerabilities, reduce risk, and ensure compliance.


Tenable is looking for a highly motivated C/C++ Software Engineer to join the Development team for the Log Correlation Engine (LCE) product. The Log Correlation Engine processes, classifies, stores, and correlates log data for customers to identify and eliminate network threats. 


Primary Responsibilities:



  • Plan, design, implement, and test features and improvements to the core of the Log Correlation Engine.

  • Collaborate with the technical lead, Research, and QA teams to produce coherent and comprehensive software solutions.

  • Work with log data, vulnerability data, and security logs to improve and expand existing capabilities.

  • Develop innovative object-oriented, reusable, and stable code, and deliver solutions on schedule in an Agile environment.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Code42 Software, Inc. (Minneapolis, MN)
item.description:
As a Senior Software Engineer on the Business Enablement team, you will help design, develop, and maintain the processes and tools that enable Code42 to achieve its objectives and better serve our users, both internal and external. You will make a difference throughout the company by making others more efficient and providing new capabilities. You will help other developers design effective solutions and lend the benefits of your experience to new challenges. You will provide insight into application architecture and help evaluate 3rd party solutions for business needs. You will integrate, innovate, and have a good time while doing so. 


WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING



  • Designing and implementing software solutions for assigned projects, both independently and with teammates.

  • Writing unit and integration tests.

  • Testing, debugging, and troubleshooting data and software issues.

  • Documenting code and design, and reviewing code and design docs from others.

  • Estimating tasks and providing status updates when needed

  • Synthesizing requirements into cohesive designs while identifying gaps and contradictions.

  • Identifying improvements in our current systems and processes.

  • Collaborating with teammates and end users to deliver the right solution.

  • Participating in design discussions and code reviews.

  • Getting to know our systems and processes.

  • Helping to mentor and guide more junior developers.

item.title: Professional Services Engineer at The Intellisis Corporation (San Diego, CA)
item.description:
Professional Services Engineer Positions in San Diego, CA and Austin, TX


Our Services Team is responsible for delivering real-time process-transformation consulting expertise to our customers as well as ensuring the successful implementation of Hermosa solutions. Each member of the team is armed with the field experience to deliver real world, real-time solutions.


We’re looking for product developers with customer-facing experience who want more direct customer interaction and experience. It’s important to be a careful listener, with the ability to demonstrate knowledge and professionalism throughout customer engagements. Successful candidates will have a Computer Science/Engineering degree and a minimum of 5 years relevant experience. This position reports to the Sr. Director of Professional Services.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - (Full Stack .NET and AngularJS) at comScore, Inc. (Reston, VA)
item.description:
The comScore Survey Tech team is looking for a full stack Senior .NET Software Engineer who is familiar with all layers in software development. You will design and build high-scale applications that process large datasets and develop web applications for internal/external users. You will be working in a fast-paced environment, where we iterate quickly and work with cutting edge technologies. This is an exciting opportunity for developers with strong analytical and system design skills.



Essential Duties:



  • Participate in the requirements gathering, design and development of new systems to be incorporated into and improve the existing processing environment

  • Design and build scalable, high availability web services and portals

  • Work in a fast paced and agile development environment.

  • Manage multiple assignments and balance workload according to priorities

  • Collaborate and mentor team members to identify and implement project solutions



comScore, Inc. (NASDAQ: SCOR) is a global leader in digital measurement and analytics, delivering insights on web, mobile and TV consumer behavior that enable clients to maximize the value of their digital investments.



Through its Audience Analytics, Advertising Analytics, and Enterprise Analytics product suites, comScore provides its clients with a variety of on-demand software, real-time analytics and custom solutions to succeed in a multi-platform world. The proprietary comScore Census Network™ (CCN) leverages a world-class technology infrastructure to capture trillions of digital interactions a month and power big data analytics on a global scale for its more than 2,000 clients, which include leading companies such as AOL, Baidu, BBC, Best Buy, Carat, Deutsche Bank, ESPN, France Telecom, Financial Times, Fox, LinkedIn, Microsoft, MediaCorp, Nestle, Starcom, Terra Networks, Universal McCann, Verizon, ViaMichelin and Yahoo!.



We are an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

item.title: Web Application / Software Engineer at TrustYou GmbH (München, Deutschland)
item.description:
Software engineers at TrustYou constantly have to solve complex and interesting problems. We build products that ultimately benefit the travelers and we use user interface design, big data, machine learning, natural language processing and distributed computing to do so. TrustYou is looking for those rare, talented engineers who are comfortable getting out of their comfort zone, who never stop learning, who love responsibilities and want to drive a product from its initial conception to successful completion.


Software Engineers at TrustYou work in a team with other smart engineers and are responsible for an entire product or suite of features. They are expected to understand customer requirements, think up features that are useful and fun to use, and help to drive the implementation from specification to QA.


Our web applications are built with a modern stack of technologies and tools. Our Engineers are expected to to build large, modular and fast cross-browser JavaScript applications.


Responsibilities



  • Ship products that clients love to use!

  • Take responsibility for planning, execution and success of complex projects.

  • Team play together with other smart data and software engineers.

  • Roll up your sleeves and code to get your project done.


Minimum qualifications



  • Degree in Computer Science, or closely related degree

  • 2 years+ experience implementing beautiful and scalable web applications

  • Expert HTML, CSS & JavaScript knowledge

  • Experience implementing RESTful servers. We accept your background in a variety of languages (JavaScript, Python, Ruby, Java, etc.), but we only use JavaScript (NodeJS) or Python (Twisted, Tornado) and we will help you learn these technologies.

  • Working knowledge of relational databases

  • Good algorithms knowledge

  • Comfortable working in Linux

  • Fluent in English


Preferred qualifications



  • NoSQL, especially distributed databases

  • RequireJS or single page application frameworks (e.g. AngularJS, Ember.js)


Who we are


TrustYou is the standard for reputation in the travel industry. We search and analyze literally ALL hotel reviews on the web, and generate a summary for each hotel on the planet - what did guests like and dislike about this hotel? Try it out yourself by searching any hotel on our website or our mobile app!


Our data is powering over 100 hotel search engines around the globe. Additionally, we have built a social media monitoring and survey product for hoteliers, TrustYou Reputation Management. What are my guests complaining about? TrustYou is used by more than 10,000 hotels to answer that question and improve their services.


TrustYou is a startup with engineering excellence in its DNA. Our employees are experts in big data, machine learning, natural language processing, interactive JavaScript applications and web technologies. Our tech stack is varied and modern.


We work hard, but value a great working environment just as much. We offer perks and a comfortable office for creative work. Xbox breaks and office beers on Friday nights are part of our culture. Our visits to Oktoberfest and our developer getaway trips are legendary.


Job details


Team or role: Software Engineering


Job type: Full-time


Job location(s): Munich, Germany; Cluj-Napoca, Romania


How to get this job


We’d love to see a note about yourself along with your resume.


Write us at jobs@trustyou.com

item.title: Sr Software Developer - Changing the Way the World Learns! at D2L (Kitchener, ON, Canada)
item.description:
Every day, our software is used by millions of people around the world, and we are looking for individuals who share in our excitement and passion for transforming the way the world learns. At D2L, we believe that learning should be accessible and engaging. Our goal is to create easy, flexible, and smart software that ignites the desire to learn in everyone. To do this, we need to give talented, enthusiastic, and passionate people opportunities to create, develop, and collaborate on projects that revolutionize the learning environment.


You will be helping learners achieve their full potential. Think about the good you will do for the world!


At D2L, we are looking for developers that will help us advance our goal of using technology to transform teaching and learning around the world. Our software is used daily by millions of people around the world and we need developers who are up to the challenge that this presents. As a developer, you will help make dreams a reality.


We are looking for seasoned software developers who are passionate about developing software using engineering best practices. Senior software developers use past experiences & know-how to enable teams to be more productive & effective through the code they write, the decisions they make and knowledge they share. Your ideas and perspectives are essential to making sure we are investing in the right technology and effectively advancing our goal.


HOW WILL I MAKE AN IMPACT?


We need experienced software developers to join a tight-knit team of passionate developers using the latest technology and open-source software to deliver innovative solutions to new markets. You will build web apps that are beautiful, accessible, and usable across all mediums. Senior software developers are accountable for the design and implementation of fault-tolerant and highly scalable distributed systems and APIs.

item.title: Mobile & Front End UI Engineer / Inventor at Iodine (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Iodine is changing the way people find the right medical treatments. Our product is our voice, and we want you to shape it with us.


You work where design meets code. You know mobile UI patterns, HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript like the back of your hand. You're passionate about experimentation, innovation, and playing around with the latest front-end technologies. You write clean, compatible, powerful user interfaces with speed. Bonus: You're passionate about understanding your audience, and dreaming up ways to build great technological futures for them.


As a mobile & front-end engineer, you’ll work closely with the rest of our design, engineering, product, and clinical team to turn ideas into tangible user experiences. You'll combine your keen design sense, stellar front-end chops, and the right technologies, to realize these ideas and validate them with users. Your wizardry will translate design concepts into living, breathing prototypes and finished products—all to help people make sense of health decisions.


You will co-own and shape the future of health & medical apps—both online, and in people’s pockets.


We are a JavaScript shop—you’ll be working in React Native, React.js and LESS, with designers who can code.


Responsibilities



  • Work with our product team to design and implement rapid prototypes, by whatever means necessary.

  • Write clean, compatible, automated-testable React JSX and LESS to realize our ideas as a cross-platform, responsive front-end.

  • Build our reusable UI framework to help us create rich applications to interact with our data—code, widgets, and all—and help us identify and document its emergent rules.

  • Serve as a mentor for engineers, designers, and other peers at Iodine.

item.title: Full Stack Engineer at CrowdFlower (San Francisco, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
About Us:


CrowdFlower is changing the way work gets done, and we want you to help us make it happen.


We’re building a platform that makes it easy for data scientists to enrich their data by distributing work to an on-demand workforce located around the world. In addition to being an integral player in the red hot data science, machine learning and big data fields, we also provide critically needed work and income to millions of micro-tasking workers around the world. Everything our engineers do has real and tangible impact, everyday.


We need smart, innovative people to help us build scalable, resilient and responsive systems, working with our exceptional team in San Francisco’s Mission District. You can look forward to working with a dynamic, growing company in a casual and fun environment with an opportunity to make an impact at all levels of the business.


Learn more about our engineering culture at http://www.crowdflower.com/careers/engineering.


The Job:


When we say Full Stack Engineer, we're looking for someone that is comfortable building custom UI/UX as well as defining API endpoints for the UI to communicate with. In terms of MVC, the position looks like: 5% M, 75% V, and 20% C. The primary tools you'll employ are Rails and jQuery. You like to work with different technologies and are passionate about constantly learning new things. You take pride in designing elegant, simple solutions to challenging problems, creating quality software components and promoting best practices for agile software development. You will help us ensure we continue to evolve and keep our edge as a world­-class development team. 


Responsibilities:



  • Distilling complex requirements into simple interfaces.

  • Defining the future of CrowdFlower's platform.

  • Building new products that use the core CrowdFlower platform.

  • Improve the interface that tens of thousands of CrowdFlower contributors and clients use everyday.

  • Take pride and ownership in your work and encourage others to do the same

  • Promote best practices for writing maintainable, well­-tested code


Must Haves:



  • 3+ yrs experience on at least one significant production-level web app in Rails.

  • Experience in multiple programming languages (we primarily use Ruby and JavaScript).

  • A solid command of JavaScript. When something breaks, you either know exactly why it broke, or can find out easily.

  • The ability to design new interfaces - thinking up a creative solution and being able to implement it effectively.


Experience with these would be definite assets:



  • Client-side MVC - React and/or Backbone

  • Jasmine/TDD experience

  • An opinion about Web Components/ES6

  • Git skills and GitHub repos full of cool stuff you've hacked on

  • A great design aesthetic

  • PostgreSql, JQuery, Redis

  • AWS, Jira, Confluence.

item.title: Quality Assurance Analyst at Investors Economic Assurance, LLC (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Quality Assurance Analyst is responsible for the quality of the CapAssure® platform and delivery of theCapAdministrationSM  service.



  • Develop and maintain subject matter expertise for application and business

  • Work closely with both the business and development team

  • Author system specifications and documentation based on business requirements

  • Develop and document a product test plan strategy based on system requirements

  • Create data and develop test cases to enable end-to-end verification of accounting and financial workflows

  • Record and document results from test cases and compare to expected results

  • Develop tools or prototypes to facilitate and automate software testing from a system’s and data perspective

  • Perform setup and configuration tasks of client dedicated SaaS platform

  • Maintain consistency between multiple environments

  • Document and investigate client reported software defects or issues

  • Conduct root-cause analysis for client operational and transactional data

  • Assist the project management team with software release planning

item.title: Software Engineer - Medical Mobile Apps at InSpark Technologies Inc. (San Francisco, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
We seek a mobile engineer with a love of Android and iOS mobile development. Yours will be a pivotal role at the company with a high degree of influence over architectural and design decisions as well as responsibility for delivering high-quality, production-ready code within our regulatory and quality framework.


As a foundational member of the engineering team you will be primarily responsible for developing:


1.     The front-end for our iOS, Android and web applications for patients and their health care providers;


2.     On-device database management and local capture of user health information from connected medical devices and wearables.


3.     In conjunction with other developers, data transfer mechanisms to back-end systems for capturing, storing and managing all related health information.


You will be expected to verify your code through a variety of methods and work closely with other members of the team to perform system testing and validation studies.


As a lean start-up, our work environment emphasizes collaboration over supervision: We all know what we need to achieve and expect employees to work towards that end, individually and as a team. This role therefore has a high degree of individual responsibility attached to it. You will be expected to be self-motivated and have the confidence to share and pursue your ideas for how to achieve high-quality results in an efficient manner with limited direct supervision.

item.title: Research Scientist - Text-to-Speech at Amazon (Gdask, Polska)
item.description:
Amazon TTS team researches, develops and delivers cutting edge multi-language Text to Speech technology, leading in voice quality, accuracy and ease of use.

As part of our development team you will work within the Amazon Digital Products department. This department has developed significant digital businesses including Amazon MP3, Amazon Video on Demand, IMDB, Amazon Fire TV, the Kindle Fire and our recently released Amazon Echo.



We are a team of creative people who successfully combine passion and ambition in creating one of the best speech synthesizers in the world, and now are one of the most visible teams within Amazon where you will get the chance to have a huge influence on making a positive impact on customers all over the globe.

At Amazon, we take pride in building complete end-to-end solutions, staring from researching a problem, implementing the solution, building a scalable and reliable service and ensuring the service is there when you need it.

Our goal is to build a next generation Text-to-Speech (TTS) system that takes the user experience to the next level and speaks a large variety of voices in the world’s most spoken languages. The challenges we face is handling whole variety of data which need to be pronounced correctly (such as names, surnames, proper names, foreign words), as well as finding correlation of end-user ratings and internal TTS quality metrics. This requires an engineer approach to improve the basis of huge amount of synthesized texts and semantic knowledge of the text to improve pronunciation of context specific words.



This position is based in Amazon Development Center in Gdansk, Poland.



As part of our development team you will be responsible for research in speech synthesis, providing analysis using mathematical modeling tools to answer important questions, designing system architectures, utilizing code (C/C++, Perl or Java) and existing tools for modeling or prototyping, effective communication with management as well as with colleagues from computer science and business backgrounds. You will be involved in projects from concept to deployment, working closely with our core technology team, taking part in the complete project lifecycle.


  • MSc. or PhD degree in Computer Sciences, Machine Learning, or related technical field.

  • Proven track record of achievements in language research and development for Text-To-Speech, Automatic Speech Recognition or Natural Language processing

  • Professional experience in software development.

  • Knowledge of C/C++

  • Proficiency in at least one scripting languages (Perl, Python, Hadoop, Hive, etc)

  • Strong fundamentals in problem solving, algorithm design and complexity analysis.

  • Fundamentals in object-oriented design and data structures.

  • Strong personal interest in learning, researching, and creating new technologies with high commercial impact.




  • Knowledge of parametric and/or unit selection TTS technology.

  • Knowledge of software engineering practices & best practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations.

  • Clear, professional communication skills able to contribute to team discussions.


When applying, please enclose the following statement:

„I hereby give consent for my personal data included in my offer to be processed for the purposes of recruitment, in accordance with the Personal Data Protection Act dated 29.08.1997 (uniform text: Journal of Laws of the Republic of Poland 2002 No 101, item 926 with further amendments.

item.title: Software Engineer/Senior Software Engineer at Pax Technology Inc (Jacksonville, FL)
item.description:
PAX Technology, Inc. is a global payment technology provider, ranked the top 3 in the world! We offer a competitive compensation package and a unique team environment where innovative new processes assist everyone's productivity. We are currently seeking several Software Engineers (entry level to senior level) for our Jacksonville office. This highly motivated individual will lead the testing of mission critical payment processing technology. Our development environment is agile, with a test driven development philosophy.


Applicants must meet the following profile:


- College Degree in Computer Science/CIS or equivalent.


- Fresh graduate in Computer Science/CIS is welcome; training will be provided.


- More experience in writing code will be considered as Senior Software Engineer 


- Good team worker and open communicator.


- Detail-oriented and patient.


Main duties and responsibilities:


- Working with tech support team and development team about quality issue of application


- Observing, testing, diagnosing and reporting faults in the software and hardware


Computer languages: C/C++, C#, Java, Javascript 



If you think you qualify and will thrive in a busy and fast growing firm, please send a cover letter, resume and include the position applied for in the subject line. Please also include your current and expected salary as well as date available to start. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. Data collected will be used for recruitment purposes only.

item.title: Android Developer at Bluesmart (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Bluesmart is looking to hire an Android Mobile Developer. This is a unique opportunity to join as a very early employee a high-potential Silicon Valley Hardware+Software startup (Y Combinator, $2.2M crowdfunding). You will get to work closely with the engineering (software and hardware) team, build our first mobile apps, and grow as the company itself grows from a small team to a global leading company. Here you can read more about us and working with us. The team is split between Silicon Valley and Hong Kong.


Responsibilities:


As Android Developer, you will join a small team responsible for the development, deployment, and constant improvement of Bluesmart’s mobile applications. This includes the development of the app, the integration with our backend API, and the communication with the firmware of the Bluesmart suitcase. The team is also responsible for the testing and deployment of the app, the shipping of it to thousands of users, and the quick iteration into more evolved versions. You will work closely with the rest of the team to develop a mobile experience that is consistent with our product vision, while respecting the design guidelines provided by our design team and the conventions of the device ecosystems.

item.title: DevOps / Configuration Management Engineer at ABB (Kraków, Polska)
item.description:
Build the software product (compile and link).
• Lead the integration of source code between branches in the CM system.
• Perform entry-level debugging of source code to facilitate resolution of integration problems.
• Release the software product for customer use at the end of a development project.
• Automate repetitive tasks by scripting and development of software tools.
• Deploy the software product on internal test systems, some of which are virtual and some physical.
• Set up test systems from scratch, i.e. install OS, configure networking, install software, configure security.
• Create customized OS installation images of Windows and Linux to be used on both internal and customer systems.
• Provide performance data within the CM area, such as build times, lines of code, compiler warnings, etc, and make this visible to the rest of the team.
• Participate or lead improvement projects within the CM area, e.g. automating builds, creating interfaces between different tools.
• Be prepared to work odd hours at times – usually planned well in advance.

item.title: Senior Go Backend Engineer @ Wearable Intelligence at Wearable Intelligence, Inc. (San Francisco, CA)
item.description: We’re looking for passionate software engineers with experience developing complex backend services. Do you like the idea of a highly-available, micro-service oriented, well-defined architecture? Know REST and SOAP inside and out? You would play a major role in designing and implementing backend services that interact with many different types of devices, and support thousands of concurrent users. The ideal candidate is well-versed in more than one language and framework, and has experience building backend services composed of lots of moving parts (microservices) that interface via APIs and SDKs.

item.title: Android Engineer at LiveSafe (Arlington, VA)
item.description:
We are looking for a mid-level Android engineer to join our mobile engineering team. We develop both Andorid and iOS native moble applications used by over 100,000 people across the world. We are constantly looking to improve our platform and branch out onto new devices (Android Wear, IoT) to deliver added value for our users.


The kind of engineer we are looking for will likely identify as a:



  • Polyglot that gets a special satisfaction from picking up a new language, framework, or tool

  • Problem solver that does not relent until digging and discovering an issue’s root cause

  • Collaborator that thrives in a social, transparent, and “got your back” team environment

  • Person who cares deeply that their work realizes positive outcomes for our world

  • Someone that stays on the bleeding edge of technology to help enhance user experience even with new OS releases


You probably also have:



  • Strong opinions on what makes certain languages/tools/frameworks good, bad, or ugly

  • Sufficient experience with your favorite language/tool/framework to describe its faults and shortcomings

  • A pet software design principle that drives you nuts when not used

item.title: Senior Software Engineer, Android Applications at iRobot Corporation (Bedford, MA)
item.description:
Explore and leverage your career with one of the world’s foremost leaders in diverse robotics – from consumer, telepresence, and international defense and security, we are constantly creating robotic products that improve, impact, and change lives.


As a Senior Software Engineer – Android Applications at iRobot, you will be developing mobile applications that control iRobot’s Defense & Security Products.


In this role, you will collaborate with other mobile and robot developers, designers, testers, and business managers.  You will have the opportunity to contribute to all aspects of the product development lifecycle.  The ideal candidate must be able to pick up new technologies quickly, be a strong team player, and rapidly adapt to changing business and customer demands. The ideal candidate will also have experience building mobile applications (Java/Android) that control real time systems.


What you will do


In this role, you operate as a member of an elite and growing team of robot developers delivering the next generation of iRobot products.


 As a member of an extraordinarily creative, motivated and talented team, you will develop new products that are used by the military, state & local, and industrial markets; these are the robots that save lifes and keep people out of harms way.



  • Design, implement, and test a new, Android based, robot control application.

  • Collaborate with technical architects, test engineers, and user interface designers.

  • Write high quality code that is well documented and unit tested.

  • Participate in and drive code reviews.

  • Proactively write software documentation.

  • Maintain and identify areas for improvement in established software.

item.title: Software Engineer at Google (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to tackle new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.


Google aspires to be an organization that reflects the globally diverse audience that our products and technology serve. We believe that in addition to hiring the best talent, a diversity of perspectives, ideas and cultures leads to the creation of better products and services.



Responsibilities


  • Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve software.

  • Manage individual project priorities, deadlines and deliverables.

item.title: Software Developer (All Levels) at INRIX (Kirkland, WA)
item.description:
INRIX is on a path of unprecedented growth. The development team is aggressively driving innovation, design, implementation and deployment of large scale distributed applications and web services. Our core mission is to solve complex problems around big data and analytics. To develop and modify software to drive (pun intended!) the accuracy of predicting traffic flow and deliver the most valuable and accurate results to our customers!

The INRIX development team is a great place to grow your career and skillset. Our roadmap is bursting with opportunity for engineers to bring their best (and then some), solving intriguing challenges, and tangibly impacting the customer experience.

What you’re looking for:



  • A cutting-edge stack that combines open source and custom code to create a high-end traffic data and services platform serving millions of customers

  • Practical experience in working in a fast paced “start-up like” environment with high performing teams

  • Be part of a team where fun, smart, passionate, ambitious engineers are focused on delivering complex data and services that must be delivered with extremely low latency

  • A fast–growing global company where you’ll be challenged (required) to think about things that no one has thought of yet

  • A position where you’re an important voice in development, not one of many

  • Design, implement, and deploy large scale distributed applications and web services

  • Solve complex problems to develop software to drive the most valuable and accurate results to our customers


What we’re looking for:



  • Senior, Mid-Level, and Junior Software Developers -- experience with software development, architecture and deign, enjoys creating exciting products through hands-on coding

  • Experience in designing, implementing and deploying large-scale distributed applications and web services

  • Experience maintaining and extending applications and services through their lifetime

  • Experience in developing in Java on enterprise platforms (C# equivalent experience accepted)

  • Solid understand of graph algorithms

  • Demonstrated strong technical judgment in conjunction with passionate customer-focus

  • Be collaborative, have a strong work ethic, be reliable and a self-starter

  • Bachelor’s or advanced degree in computer science, mathematics, or related discipline


 What’s so exciting about our platform?

We’re working on a cutting-edge stack that combines open source and custom code to create a high-end traffic data and services platform serving millions of customers.  You’ll be joining a team focused on delivering engineering solutions to support complex services that must be delivered with extremely low latency.  You will have a strategic role driving decisions that will shape INRIX's capabilities and the future technical direction of our products.
Ideal Candidates have:



  • Strong experience in open source stacks and some experience in MSFT stack

  • Working knowledge in probability, statistics and analytics,  GIS/LBS concepts highly desired

  • Experience delivering and operating SaaS product offerings in an iterative, agile software lifecycle in AWS or Azure

  • Experience in Big Data architectures, NoSQL DB’s, Hadoop/HDFS/map/reduce, real time streaming analytics, visualization, or other technologies in the Big Data Analytics stack


Why make the move:



  • INRIX motorboat – Get your boat license and we’ll pay for the gas. You can walk from your office to the dock in 15 minutes. Take your family and friends skiing or tubing.  Yes, it’s big and it’s fast!

  • Free car – Well…. not really free.  But we have test cars with the latest traffic technology that you can take home.  We pay for the gas. 

  • Great Benefits – We’re as good as or better than most companies our size.

  • Free onsite snacks and drinks; Free Friday lunches – The food comes to you so that you write lots and lots of good code (at least we’re honest).

  • Bonuses 2x per year and Stock Options – Because you like to be rewarded and recognized for your hard work.

  • No Vacation Policy – You’re an adult and can manage your own vacation time.  Work hard; play hard.  Why does your company still have a vacation policy?

  • Family – We don’t believe that you should miss your child’s play because you have to attend a meeting. 

  • Are you ready to join a different kind of company?


INRIX is a leading provider of real-time traffic information, connected car services and analytics worldwide. The company leverages big data analytics to reduce the individual, economic and environmental toll of traffic congestion. Through cutting-edge data intelligence and predictive traffic technologies, INRIX helps leading automakers, fleets, governments and news organizations make it easier for drivers to navigate their world. 

Our vision is simple – to solve traffic, empower drivers, inform planning and enhance commerce.  INRIX is at the forefront of connecting cars to smarter cities and serves more than 350 blue-chip customers in more than 40 countries around the world.


Exciting things are happening all the time. Come join us!

item.title: Principal & Sr Software Engineer, iOS Applications at iRobot Corporation (Bedford, MA)
item.description:
Explore and leverage your career with one of the world’s foremost leaders in diverse robotics – from consumer, telepresence, and international defense and security, we are constantly creating robotic products that improve, impact, and change lives.


  As a Principal Software Engineer – iOS Applications at iRobot, you will be developing mobile applications that control an ecosystem of Robots in the home.


 In this role, you will collaborate with robot developers, designers, testers, and business managers.  You will have the opportunity to contribute to all aspects of the product development lifecycle.  The ideal candidate must be able to pick up new technologies quickly, be a strong team player, and rapidly adapt to changing business and customer demands. The ideal candidate will also have experience building mobile applications (iOS) that control real time systems.


What you will do


As a member of an extraordinarily creative, motivated and talented team, you will develop new products that are used by millions of people.



  • Develop new apps for IoT products that are used by millions of people.

  • This position will help to mentor and grow other engineers.

  • Design, implement, and test a new, iOS based, robot control application.

  • Collaborate with technical architects, test engineers, and user interface designers.

  • Write high quality code that is well documented and unit tested.

item.title: Quality Assurance Engineer (m/f) - Rendering & Cloud Computing at Dassault Systemes 3DExcite GmbH (München, Deutschland)

item.title: Software Development Engineer at Amazon (Dublin, Ireland)
item.description:
Amazon makes shopping more convenient for millions of customers and Dash Button and Dash Replenishment Service (DRS) are bringing this to a new level, revolutionizing the future of e-commerce. Reordering favorite consumables is easy with the simple press of Dash Button. With DRS, we will enable connected devices to fully automate replenishment, reordering needed consumables when they start to run low.



Our team is responsible for the backend web services, mobile app experience, and developer facing SDK & experiences that power the Dash Button & DRS. We are looking for talented Software Development Engineers to develop new & innovative experiences. This is an opportunity to work with a broad set of technologies and develop & deploy exciting new experiences to customers on a regular cadence.


  • Bachelor's Degree or higher in Computer Science or related field

  • 3+ years of professional software development experience

  • Strong Computer Science fundamentals in areas such as data structures and algorithms

  • Strong object-oriented design and coding skills in at least one modern programming language such as Java, C++, or C#

  • Experience building scalable systems/applications in a complex, distributed environment

  • Self-directed and capable of working effectively in a dynamic environment

  • Excellent leadership, problem solving and analytical skills

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills




  • Experience playing a lead role in building complex software systems that have been successfully delivered to customers

  • Experience developing software in a UNIX/Linux environment

  • Experience building distributed systems with strict performance requirements

  • Experience with iOS, Android, and/or web development

  • Knowledge of professional software engineering best practices for the full software development life cycle including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations

  • Knowledge in many disparate technologies, ranging from front-end user interfaces through back-end systems and all points in between

  • Experience communicating with users, other technical teams, and senior leadership to collect requirements, describe software product features, technical designs, and product strategy

item.title: Software Engineer at Google (Mountain View, CA)
item.description:
Google aspires to be an organization that reflects the globally diverse audience that our products and technology serve. We believe that in addition to hiring the best talent, a diversity of perspectives, ideas and cultures leads to the creation of better products and services.


Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to tackle new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.



Responsibilities


  • Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve software.

  • Manage individual project priorities, deadlines and deliverables.

item.title: (Senior) Datenbankentwickler (m/w) MS SQL, MySQL at infoteam Software AG (Bubenreuth, Deutschland)

(Senior) Datenbank-Entwickler (m/w)
MS SQL, MySQL


Bei der infoteam Software AG werden Sie Teil eines genialen Teams. Sie arbeiten für inter­nationale Kunden aus den Bereichen Industrie, Life Science und Medizin­technik für unsere Nieder­lassung an unserem Standort in Bubenreuth bei Erlangen.

Als Teil unseres dynamischen Datenbank-Entwickler­teams sind Sie zuständig für die fachliche und physikalische Daten­modellierung. Sie sind mit­ver­antwortlich, in welchen Strukturen und Formaten die Daten abgelegt und mit­einander verknüpft werden. Sie erstellen Daten­importe und -exporte, Reports und treiben unser modernes OLAP-System voran. Außerdem über­nehmen Sie die Administration und das Monitoring laufender Systeme. Auf Basis von funktionalen Kunden­anforderungen entwerfen Sie das technische Design und übernehmen anschließend selbst die Programmierung. Sie stehen in enger Abstimmung mit den Bereichen Analyse und Architektur und bieten Support bei der Lösung von System­störungen.

item.title: Dashboard Developers at NuData Security (Vancouver, BC, Canada)
item.description:
NuData Security is looking for talented Dashboard Developers to join our team and help us further develop our customer-facing web application.   


NuData Security is a leader in web and mobile risk-based behavioral analytics. We are headquartered in downtown Vancouver, British Columbia, and our client base includes Fortune 50 companies, giving us a global footprint. 


You hold elegant design and contextual information in equal regard. You’ve bookmarked the website Information is Beautiful because it is, but know that beauty still needs to serve a purpose. Take part in the design and creation of intuitive visualizations, making sophisticated data and results easy to understand and use. Join our team and build out and refine our toolset across the full range of functionality, including how the dashboard displays collected data and analysis, improving search functionality, charting, and configuration support. 


This is a permanent, full-time, in-office position. 


Qualification and Experience 



  • Minimum 2 years software development experience in a professional development setting;

  • Expert level knowledge and experience with developing in PHP;

  • Strong understanding of object-oriented development concepts;

  • Expert experience with at least one of the following programming languages: Java, C#, C++, Python, Objective-C;

  • PHP Web Development Framework experience with one of: CodeIgniter, Laravel, Symfony;

  • Source Control experience with one of: Perforce, Subversion, Git;

  • Expert knowledge of HTTP/HTTPS, RESTful services, Javascript, JSON, HTML/CSS, Web Application Development, AJAX, User Interface or User Experience Design (UI/UX Design);

  • Experience designing and developing customer-facing web applications and user interfaces;

  • Bachelors of Computer Science or equivalent degree; 


What we offer in return includes a beautiful view of the North Shore mountains, coffee that doesn’t suck, and colleagues that are as brilliant as they are likeable. We do cool things as a company. You know, like sword fighting, pinball playing, craft beer tastings. Plus all that normal stuff like a competitive salary, extended health benefits, flex-time schedules, and a work environment that encourages and supports professional development.  


If this sounds like you, apply and tell us why you’re the best candidate for the job.  


(Our focus currently on candidates that are either already in or willing to relocate to the Vancouver area, and who are already eligible to work in Canada.)
