You know how to manage test suites with Jenkins – just because Continuous Integration should be part of every project. You love to design and develop complex web portals. Troubleshooter is your second name. For you large quantities of data are easy to handle and a bugfix triggers a dance of joy in you. You don’t hesitate to try out new tools and you are always open for new ideas. You love to share your knowledge with your colleagues and also project managers whom you advise in terms of best solutions, priorities and planning.



This is what you can expect


You develop individual solutions for our clients based on Symfony2 and PHP as part of our teams. You design databases with Doctrine and improve data base accesses. You fix bugs, write documentation and discuss possible solutions – with your team, the project managers, designers and QA. And sometimes even with our clients. You can expect exciting projects, nice colleagues, a family-friendly atmosphere and a wonderful view over the Tempelhof Airport Field.

item.title: Software Engineer (C++), Traffic Team at HERE, a Nokia company (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
Do you want to work on projects with an amazing scale and develop solutions for millions of users? Keep reading!!




HERE Berlin is an innovative branch where an international team of 50+ nationalities creates location-based services at the highest level.


Join our fast growing, highly motivated Traffic team as an experienced Software Engineer specializing in C++ backend development. The Traffic team offers a unique chance of developing innovative features for visualizing traffic conditions used on automotive products, smartphones, mobile devices and web services.


Our Offerings



  • To join our highly motivated team in Berlin

  • To work with evolving and challenging technologies

  • To work together with specialists in an international team

  • To invent next-generation mobile services for users world-wide

item.title: Mobile Application Developer at BrainCheck (Houston, TX)
item.description:
BrainCheck is a funded Digital Health startup developing an innovative platform for tracking cognitive fitness and assessing conditions such as concussion and memory impairment. We sell to schools and athletic teams, industries where it is critical to be alert (e.g. oil & gas, trucking), as well as directly to individuals (especially athletes, parents, and those concerned about aging family members). Our state-of-the art technology is mobile-first (iPad & Android), gamified to appeal to a wide variety of test-takers, and HIPAA compliant.


If you have a passion for neuroscience, big data, big ideas, and building technologies that can make a real difference in people’s lives, this position is for you.


You'll:




  • Add new features to the existing app/backend in an elegant and maintainable manner




  • Think through technical challenges and build clean solutions




  • Maintain the existing application and consult with the team about possible technical issues down the road






  • Deploy on a regular basis (daily/weekly) and iterate quickly






  • Help maintain foundational open source projects

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at CreativeLive, Inc. (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
CreativeLive is looking for talented senior engineers to join our growing technical team in our San Francisco or Seattle office. You will be forging a new frontier in learning applications, leveraging and contributing to open source technology.


Our platform is built on Node.js and Angular.js, and the ideal candidate will be excited about applying their strong coding and architecture skills to an end-to-end JavaScript stack. 


Along with your fellow engineers, you'll be working with design and product to continuously improve the CreativeLive site and internal tools by:



  • iterating on prototypes

  • architecting modules and applications

  • refactoring existing parts of the site

  • extending our content management system

  • implementing data visualization dashboards

  • interfacing with (and creating) web services 

  • improving the scalability and fault tolerance of our distributed systems

  • actively contributing to refining our Agile development processes

item.title: Senior Application Developer with Node.js at ADP Innovation Lab (New York, NY)
item.description:
ADP is searching for a successful Senior Application Developer with Node.js to join our high performance team.  The successful candidate will have a strong command of software programming, latest web technologies and frameworks.  This is a senior position responsible for developing innovative, scalable and highly interactive web applications.
We strive for every interaction to be driven by our CORE values: Insightful Expertise, Integrity is Everything, Service Excellence, Inspiring Innovation, Each Person Counts, Results-Driven, & Social Responsibility. 


Responsibilities



  • Collaborate with business analysts to define software requirements for programming effort

  • Design and implement backend application interfaces for data and services

  • Support production software operations, test and debug programs

  • Report progress and status of assigned tasks to project teams and managers

  • Provide technical leadership and motivation to junior developers

item.title: Software Engineer at ADP Innovation Lab (New York, NY)
item.description:
We are seeking talented Software Developers with diverse backgrounds, creative expertise, and technical acumen who will offer new perspectives and challenge conventions.


RESPONSIBILITIES




  • Deliver highly automated, intelligent, and predictive solutions for our client offerings

  • Responsible for building out the Core frameworks of the Meta Data Driven Platform being developed in house, including building out the Source Control Management piece that will allow application developers to have their own isolated development environment

  • Deliver innovative solutions to drive next generation user experiences, designs, and technologies

  • Responsible for ensuring the successful transition to a Service Oriented Architecture framework with the help of containers

    • Spearhead POC’s on the latest technologies and help ADP choose the right tool for the right job

item.title: Software Engineer, Generalist at Connectifier, Inc. (Costa Mesa, CA)
item.description:
Build the next generation employment platforms, and help great companies find great people.


Connectifier is changing the way recruiting is done today. Our engineering team from Google, Microsoft Research, Berkeley National Lab, Carnegie Mellon, and Stanford is building large scale data analysis software that processes professional profiles from all around the web. By analyzing code repos, blogs, and social profiles we're helping recruiters and hiring managers connect more efficiently with the candidates best for their openings.


We are deployed at 25% of the Fortune-100, and our revenue is growing extremely fast. At Connectifier you'll get to work with top growing companies and fantastic brand names and deliver a best in class product.


Example projects


Build a predictive AI model of employee success based on a dataset of millions of people


Build infrastructure for running distributed, restartable tasks on a cluster of machines


Requirements


Bachelors Degree in Computer Science or commensurate work experience


Software engineering work or internship experience


Preferred experience


Application of algorithmic knowledge and intuition to solve complex problems


Experience building software with a statically-typed backend language (Java preferred. C, C++, Scala, etc. are all sufficient)


Knowledge of machine learning, aritifcial intelligence, big data and web technologies are a plus


How to apply and what to expect


Click the apply button below.


Be prepared to answer technical questions and write code to solve very challenging problems during the initial phone interview, a 5 hour on-site (or video chat) interview and on-site coding project.

item.title: AngularJS Front End Developer at Essence (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Company:



Essence is a global digital agency and the world’s largest independent buyer of digital media. We blend data science, objective media and captivating experiences to build valuable connections between brands and consumers. Clients include Google, HP, Method, and Barclays. The agency is more than 480 people strong, manages over $700MM in media spend and deploys campaigns in 71 markets via offices in London, New York, San Francisco, Seattle, Singapore and Tokyo. Visit essencedigital.com for more information, and follow us on Twitter at @essencedigital.



The Role:



Essence is looking for an experienced Javascript developer to work on our flagship product Olive, which in its current incarnation processes over $500MM in media spend a year. You would be joining a tight knit development team of developers, QA automation and a product manager to solve complex technical problems while building and maintaining our key software applications.



Some of the things we'd like you to do:




  • Write clean, well-designed and reusable Javascript

  • Write code that scales well and is easily maintainable by other developers

  • Lead efforts to optimize app performance and remove bottlenecks and memory leaks

item.title: Sr. Software Engineer - Java at Chewy.com (Fort Lauderdale, FL)
item.description:
The Overview:


As an engineer on our Ecommerce Systems team, you will deliver solutions and features for the leading online pet retailer in the United States. You will lead a team that is responsible for the vision, strategy, product roadmap, and development of Chewy’s core Ecommerce Platform which consists of customer management, order and shipment management, returns management, catalog management, competitive pricing tools, search and personalization services, and operational analytics.  You will have significant influence over the vision, features, and design of this critical platform. Working with other technology teams, you and your team will design and build interfaces that integrate with vendor & supply chain systems, fulfillment systems, and financial systems. This is a high-profile position that will have exposure across the entire business.


You will write simple and sustainable code that reflects a constant understanding of the business impacts. This is a terrific opportunity to join a thriving startup and have a significant role in its success. There is a tremendous opportunity to grow professionally and to be a part of a dynamic and successful team.

item.title: Application Engineer at Exaptive (Oklahoma City, OK)
item.description:
Exaptive, Inc is an MIT affiliated, fast-growing software startup that has offices in Oklahoma City, Boston and Vancouver, Canada. We are now expanding our Oklahoma City team. 


We are looking for a talented individual to be a key technical evangelist about Exaptive, educating the user community and customers in writing, presentations, and short videos.  He or she will support the sales process through demos, technical training sessions, proposals, and proofs of concept to identify customer needs, design solutions, and communicate Exaptive’s unique value.  This role is the bridge between us and our community, communicating our story to our community and representing that community in shaping our company’s direction.


We will provide intensive training during which you will create top notch documentation and video tutorials for our users – written and video.  The role will evolve according to the dynamic needs of a startup and to your talents and professional desires.           


This position will be based in downtown OKC, but with the opportunity for travel to other Exaptive and customer locations. The right person will be excited about the dynamic and fast-paced (aka stressful) environment of a startup and view that as an opportunity to excel. The startup environment is not for everyone, but offers the opportunity to help build something from the ground up where individual contributions make immediate and substantial impacts on the company as a whole can be extremely rewarding. 



Those interested can find out more about the company, and view some demo videos of our software in actionon our website: www.exaptive.com. We were featured on the front page of the Business Innovation section of The Boston Globe (http://www.boston.com/business/technology/innoeco/2013/12/cambridge-based_exaptive_wants.html) and in Oklahoma City's The Journal Record (http://www.i2e.org/news/innovators-exaptive-inc/). We were also recently named a Gartner Cool Vendor (http://blogs.gartner.com/michael-shanler/cool-vendors-in-life-science/).  Our Founder and CEO, Dave King, has been invited internationally to present our work. You can see a video of a presentation he recently gave to the Oklahoma Venture Forum about Exaptive's big-picture vision on our website. 

If you don't currently live in Oklahoma City, you should check out what this up-and-coming city has to offer: a burgeoning tech startup and creative sector, the largest food truck event in the nation, olympic rowing facilities, and a cost of living that can't be beat. For the right candidate we'll pay relocation expenses.

item.title: Web Developer at Garena Online Private Limited (Singapore)
item.description:
Description:


The web developer would be someone with strong experience in web and server side technologies. This is a fast-paced position that requires a high degree of energy and focus without compromising quality.


Responsibilities:



  • Write server-side Python code as well as client-side Javascript/HTML/CSS code that powers the whole web user workflow

  • Build new features and fix bugs

  • Build reusable code and libraries for future use

  • Optimization of the application for maximum speed and scalability

  • Implementation of security and data protection

  • Write high-quality, clean, maintainable code using engineering best practices (unit testing, source control, continuous integration, automation, design patterns, etc.)

  • Collaborate with other software engineers, product managers, user experience designer, and operations engineers to build new products with web technologies

item.title: Senior software engineer - equity + market salary at Ice.com (Palo Alto, CA)
item.description:
About us:

Retail Growth Fund acquired the Ice.com domain in 2014 to launch the best place for women to discover and purchase jewelry. We don't take any inventory because we're a marketplace - which means our capital goes towards building IP and acquiring/retaining users. 

A few things that make us interesting:

  • The jewelry industry is a fragmented, $80B market (in the US alone), growing at 5%+ annually, that software has yet to disrupt. 
  • You will be joining an awesome team led by Brandon Proctor and Justin Yoshimura (3x exits). 
  • We are extremely data driven and technology/software is in our DNA. You won't be a second class citizen here, guaranteed. 
  • We don't have time for assholes or politics. 
  • Competitive compensation package including equity in a high growth VC backed start-up (Crosslink, Maveron, Quest, Polaris). Salary/equity is determined based on a sliding scale: if you would like a higher salary, we can issue you less equity, and vice versa. 
  • Small (12 person), growing, and agile team. 
  • $1k gift card to dog food our own marketplace sellers! 

What we'd like to see:

  • True, full-stack engineers with extensive experience in Python/Django or Java. (Django is a key part of our stack but we use some Java). 
  • Strong foundation in computer science, with competencies in data structures, algorithms, databases, software design and dev ops.
  • Work experience with relational databases and SQL.
  • Experience with agile development process in collaborative environment.
  • BS in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or Physics OR 4 years of relevant work experience.
  • Good understanding of performance tradeoffs.

Bonus Points:

  • We are currently using Magento, an open source e-commerce platform built in Zend PHP - yuck), but we are building a new, badass e-commerce platform (Django, Java, Node.js and integrating it with Netsuite's order management tools (no need to re-invent the entire wheel, after all). Related experience is a plus.
  • MS or PhD
  • if you have an awesome Github repo, open source contributions, or a cool project you can demo, please cut to the front of the line...

Responsibilities:

As a member of our small but seriously talented engineering team, you will play a key role in both shaping and building our technologies. Your scope will be broad, ranging from user-facing features to server-side components and libraries. We are looking for a generalist who enjoys learning and working with different technologies. And of course you will be expected to commit code on your first day. 

*This job description is not meant to be an all-inclusive list of duties and responsibilities, but constitutes a general definition of the position's scope and function in the company.

item.title: Senior Software Developer at ThoughtWorks (Melbourne, Australia)
item.description:
ThoughtWorks is hunting for talented developers who know how to create great code to join us in Melbourne. 

Being a consultancy, our teams work on a huge variety of projects. You could be helping shape the digital strategy of a retail giant, building a new mobile platform for a bank, creating an app to support an awareness campaign for Indigenous Australians or helping the science community locate meteorites that have fallen to earth.  All of this whilst building quadcopters or robotic arms in your spare time.


Examples of some of our current projects:




  • Mobile applications including native Android and iOS for telco, retailers, banking clients as well as less traditional science and indigenous communities 

  • HTML5 rich web applications using AngularJS and NodeJS

  • Large scale distributed systems with big data using technologies like Storm, Hadoop, Elastic and Cassandra

  • Functional programming languages like Scala and Clojure for heavy data processing projects



We're a big believer in diversity.  We build software for a wide variety of people so we think that a wide variety of people should build our software.  We abhor and reject discrimination and inequality, and promote diversity in all its forms. We proudly, passionately and actively strive to make both ThoughtWorks and our industry more reflective and inclusive of the society that we serve.  As long as you're an opinionated, disruptive thinker, we'd like to hear from you.


We don't do bureaucracy, or hierarchy but you do get lots of autonomy and we actively encourage you to experiment with new technologies without limitation. 


In addition to all this, we have some great extra benefits including a generous training budget and one of the best parental leave packages in Australia.


As a general rule of thumb our languages and technical environments range across Java, Ruby, Scala, Clojure, C#, Python, iOS, Android and Javascript. Do you have 5+ years' commercial experience in any of these languages?  Are you a proud code geek looking for a home? Do you get a buzz out of helping others get their geek on? We'd love to talk to you!


To apply or find out more, use the links and we will be in touch soon.

item.title: Graduate Developer - Reboot the classroom at Sparx (Exeter, UK)
item.description:
As a Graduate Developer at Sparx, you’ll be an integral part of the team from day one, forming the heart of our technical expertise and potential.


You’ll be joining our team of games and software developers, supporting the development of the technical framework of the Sparx system. If software is your thing, you’ll be writing tablet native code (we currently work on iPads) to run the Sparx resource. You’ll get to see software you’ve helped program go live in a classroom the next day. Then you’ll be diving straight back in to making it better, getting into the detail, zooming out to look at the bigger picture, solving each problem and trying out the next idea. If gaming is more your thing, you’ll be supporting the designing, programming and testing of high quality games for a variety of subjects. The games you help create will need to get under the skin of what makes students tick and, working closely with the expert team around you, uncover exactly what is going to help them overcome each obstacle in understanding that they face.


Things happen at breakneck speed at Sparx and you’ll need to think creatively to help the team get from A to B. Our work is ever evolving so you’ll have plenty of opportunities to make your mark and take on increasing responsibility as time goes on.

item.title: Software Development Engineer at Amazon (Dublin, Ireland)
item.description:
At Amazon Web Services, we run one of the largest networks in the world. We are taking all the industry trends and blending them into the critical foundation of utility computing: the network. Our goal is to become the infrastructure platform for the world and our team will make the bones of the platform “the network”, work flawlessly. Not only supporting Amazon.com at the global level, but amazing global companies. (http://aws.amazon.com/solutions/case-studies/all/).



Amazon Networking is looking for senior software engineers to build a platform to manage thousands of network devices; providing significantly improved control, visibility and predictability for Amazon’s global network. Our goal is to eliminate human intervention and errors from network engineering, network build and device management by building tools and systems to successfully manage thousands of heterogeneous devices in dozens of data centers across the world.



ROLE

You are interested in being part of a high-bar team with global responsibility for network automation software used across all of Amazon’s businesses. You are interested in solving difficult software problems at massive scale. You want to talk to customers directly and design solutions that solve their problems through innovation and automation. You understand how to build software in a continuous integration and continuous deployment environment. You are interested in working autonomously and owning your own code from requirements to launch and for supporting it in the field. You enjoy solving challenging problems and working in a fast-paced, flexible, collaborative team environment.

· Strong customer orientation with ability to work directly with customer/product owner to define requirements and the associated acceptance criteria for user stories.

· Excellent software development skills, preferably in Python or Perl with Java, C/C++, Ruby acceptable as a substitute.

· Experience working in an Agile/Scrum development team with solid understand of the principles of continuous integration (CI), continuous deployment and test driven development (TDD).

· Excellent problem solving and troubleshooting skills with the ability to apply design patterns to common software problems and define dimensions of a solution including robustness, scale and maintainability.

· Strong communications skills both written and verbal are required for this role. The ability to present complex ideas in a convincing and understandable manner are a key requirement.

· Demonstrated ability to work in a team environment and as part of a cross-functional team with the ability to influence others as a senior technical contributor.

· Ability to mentor more junior software developers in best practice with demonstrated capability to maintain architectural vision and software quality during the implementation cycle.

· Knowledge of and previous development experience in a Linux or UNIX environment with a good understanding of networking concepts.

· 5+ years of industry experience in core product development, building production quality software.

· A solid grounding in Computer Science fundamentals, data structures, algorithms and deftness at object-oriented design and systems architecture: a bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science (or equivalent) is required.



· Certified Scrum Master Certification is a plus.

· Familiarity with networking protocols (OSPF, BGP, HSRP/GLBP, IPSEC/VPNs, DNS, HTTP).

· Familiarity with SOA design principles include orchestration and RESTful Interface definition.

item.title: Full Stack Software Developer at Intelliware Development Inc. (Toronto, ON, Canada)
item.description:
Intelliware is looking for full stack software developers to join our dev team. If you’re looking to work on everything from front-end to server-side code and database architecture, we’d love to hear from you.


At Intelliware you’ll have the opportunity to be part of a top-notch team and work on a wide range of complex projects. We have a unique team-based Agile environment with collaborative project rooms where you’ll find continuous learning opportunities and challenging work. Project teams work closely with client subject matter experts, end users and IT teams to deliver anything from proof-of-concept prototypes to bulletproof, long living, high volume production applications.


While working within a team in an Agile environment, you will be:



  • Designing high quality applications that are highly scalable and extensible

  • Estimating, tasking and prototyping

  • Contributing clear and maintainable code to a shared codebase

  • Collaborating with cross-functional team members on features, design and implementation

  • Investigating, learning and applying new technologies/processes

  • Clarifying requirements with team and client representatives


Intelliware’s niche is delivering mission critical software applications for complex business or technical challenges. The nature of our work allows project teams the opportunity to work with a wide variety of technologies although our core development is in Java and JavaScript. Recent projects we’ve delivered include technologies such as: AngularJS, jQuery, Meteor, Node.js, MongoDB, Apache Wicket, Spring Batch, Spring Data JPA and Hibernate.

item.title: DevOps Engineer at Advidi (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
If you would like to be involved in shaping the future of internet advertising (innovation), develop features which will be exposed to hundreds of millions of users every day (big data), go off the beaten path to design and develop high performance and high availability web applications (challenges), then you will be pleased with what Advidi has to offer. The Advidi SOA is composed of multiple critical components which are handling large amounts of live traffic and is the backbone of our business workflow. Thus, high availability, zero-downtime and minimum response times are critical.


As a DevOps engineer you will be taking part in the development of exciting new features for the company’s core software products. We are looking for people who get things done and would like to work on projects that add value to business and would enjoy working within an inspirational environment.


Responsibilities


You will support, develop and enhance highly scalable and highly available infrastructure for all our projects in Google Cloud. You will find a balance between creating awesome things that create an immediate impact and making sure that they're secure and maintainable in the long run. You will have an opportunity to be involved with product development as a software engineer and be able to develop your programming skills to the next level.

item.title: Software Engineer - Core Engine at Ontoit Holdings Ltd (London, UK)
item.description:
Ontoit is looking for an energetic and proactive Software Engineer responsible for developing the core of Ontoit's semantic search engine platform. In this critical and exciting phase of Ontoit's growth, you will be an integral contributor in forming the future of our company.


At Ontoit, we work in various fields of computer science, including machine learning, natural language processing, graph technologies, knowledge representation (ontologies), distributed systems, and web applications. The core technologies that we use include, but is not limited to, Apache Storm, Neo4J, CoreNLP, Apache Spark, Apache Cassandra and Java Spring. As a Core Developer, you will be involved in the development of these various fields. In conjunction with the CEO and key team members you will be involved in driving the design and technical specifications of the system and responsible for developing high quality code for challenging algorithmic back end development.


The compensation for this position will be in the range of £30-40,000 per annum plus potentially equity options, all depending on the experience and skill level of the successful applicant.


Ontoit will accept applications for this position until the 18th of September, 2015.

item.title: Experienced Javascript Developer at Qlik (Lund, Sweden)
item.description:
What makes you Qlik?


If working for one of Sweden’s Top 10 Great Places to Work sounds appealing, and you think we are interesting, please read on – we may be looking for you!


At the heart of Qlik, our product is developed in a highly innovative, high-impact Development organization, where team members continuously discover, give back and achieve extraordinary results. Our unique approach to the Business Intelligence world gives us the opportunity to develop, build and release cutting-edge software built in an Agile and dynamic environment.


At the core of our products are the user interfaces, driving a rich Business Discovery platform whether in QlikView, or Qlik Sense. With the ability to produce highly intuitive data analytics, your role will be to enhance and deliver a world class front end web based client for the user.


  Role & Responsibilities



  • Design, develop and maintain web-based client software

  • Research new requirements to understand and present technical options, scope, and risk.

  • Ensure that deliverables meet requirements and recommend alternatives where appropriate.

  • Document specifications and other relevant technical content as directed.

  • Communicate with engineering management and team leaders on task prioritization, scheduling, and coordination.

  • Collaborate and coordinate with other team members on all aspects of the process including user experience, architectural design, implementation, testing, and documentation.

item.title: Business Product Owner at MediaRadar (New York, NY)
item.description:
DESCRIPTION


You are a hands-on top performer who will augment our product team and focus on the future of our offerings. Your flexibility and desire to learn is essential. You have the passion and innate ability to become the “CEO” of every assigned initiative.



What you’ll be doing:



Our Business Product Owner will be an individual contributor, focusing on the business aspects of our strategic offerings. Your job will be spent on the following key objectives:



  • identifying and assessing business opportunities

  • building and managing product road maps

  • constructing the revenue model, understanding and managing revenue and costs levers

  • managing relationships with stakeholders in finance, marketing, sales and operations

  • establishing and maintaining key external partner relationships

  • working closely with the product and engineering teams in an agile environment to deliver amazing products to market

  • tracking success and failure via business analysis of metrics and analytics

item.title: Full Stack Software Engineer at Chatham Financial (Kennett Square, PA)
item.description:
This position is part of our models team, which is responsible for developing robust and scalable services to enable cutting-edge financial applications. Our models are implemented in a micro service architecture designed to support a variety of internal and external user applications. We are looking for developers who are interested in both software engineering and computation, with skills and experience including:



  • Object-oriented design patterns; languages including C#, C++ or Java; web frameworks like Microsoft MVC and angular.js; and relational and NoSQL databases.

  • Quantitative and modeling skills with an ability to learn techniques in numerical optimization, data mining, simulation, or model calibration.

  • Comfort with full stack software development, including computationally intense back-end development and service design, data storage and access models, enterprise level messaging patterns, and modern web development frameworks.

  • Proclivity towards refactoring and continuously improving OO code through agile development methods.

  • Testing skills including use of inversion of control, mocks, and stubs in unit testing and BDD testing frameworks like specflow and cucumber.


Additionally engineers on the models team work directly with operational teams, other software engineering and design teams, and our quant team comprised of Mathematics and Physics Ph.D.’s. Members of this team gain knowledge of our business and the mathematical models used in modern finance, and have the ability to deliver robust and scalable software meeting the needs of a variety of business users. The team has a strong core of existing developers who can help new members gain this knowledge.


Although not required, a typical successful candidate may have been involved in



  • Mathematical/quantitative competitions.

  • Open source development projects.

  • Advanced degrees in mathematics, computer science, engineering, or sciences.

  • R&D experience at the collegiate or professional level.


Our technology stack is constantly evolving but currently includes .Net, ServiceStack, RabbitMQ, SQL-Server, ASP .Net MVC, angular.js, Memcached, Redis, various Amazon web services, unmanaged C code, Nvidia Cuda, and Python. We also use developer tools like Team City, Subversion, Specflow, Graylog, and Visual Studio. We have specialized design, database administration, devops, and IT infrastructure teams to allow software engineers to focus on software engineering.


Finally, we work in a rapidly-changing, high-performance environment that relies on excellent communication and collaboration, so we look for people that are energized by being part of great teams, and looking to challenge themselves to learn new technologies and apply them to our technology stack. Most new employees say that Chatham is both the most challenging and most rewarding place at which they have ever worked. If this applies to you, we’d be interested to hear from you.

item.title: Software Engineer, Systems at MoLabs (New York, NY)
item.description: MoLabs is focused on building the next great mobile-first platform. To get there, we are assembling a world-class product and engineering team. MoLabs' software engineers develop the scalable, mobile-first technologies that change how users consume, explore and interact with information and the world. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing and UI design. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to tackle new problems across the full-stack. With your technical expertise you manage individual projects priorities, deadlines and deliverables. You design, develop, test, deploy, maintain, and enhance software solutions. Software Engineers have a penchant for solving complex and interesting problems. Pushing the boundaries of current mobile platforms, you will perform technological feats under constrained environments and will be presented with exciting challenges in native mobile application development. You are a software engineer who can write server-side code for web-based applications, for both internal and external use. You are comfortable and enjoy working on the full development stack - both backend and frontend. You are also a well-rounded developer who knows how to create robust high-volume production applications, and can develop prototypes quickly. The work is challenging, creative, fast paced and intellectually stimulating.

item.title: BMW Group - Principal System Debug Engineer/Infotainment Head Unit Software(m/f) at BMW Group (Ulm, Deutschland)
item.description:
THE PRODUCT IS THE HEART. AND IT IS THE BRAIN.


SHARE YOUR PASSION FOR MODERN INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY


Complex systems demand careful maintenance. Ideally from people whose good ideas and enthusiasm can truly shine in a supportive work environment. Because people like this make IT unique, smart and ready for the future. Without IT, the innovative power of the BMW Group would not exist.


We want this to strengthen even further, so our team is currently looking for a:


Principal System Debug Engineer - Infotainment Head Unit Software (m/f)


Job reference: 97998


BMW Car IT offers you the chance to take up a challenging role in automotive software development. Your role is to work with the performance & stability team for our next-generation Linux based automotive infotainment head unit system. Your key tasks and responsibilities will comprise:



  • Technical lead for stability specific problem solving.

  • System SW debugging.

  • Definition of methods to ensure product reliability.

  • Review changes in code and the environment to determine impacts on system performance & reliability.

  • Very close cooperation with architects, SW developers and test engineers.


Are you looking for an exciting challenge? Then join our team. We look forward to receiving your application. You can find detailed information and apply online at www.bmwgroup.jobs.

item.title: Senior Java Developer (m/w) at PROEMION GmbH (Fulda, Deutschland)
item.description:
PROEMION designs modern Telematics solutions for global machine data transmission, ready for evaluation via web portal or API. For the development of the next generation of this pioneering and exciting technology, we are always seeking highly motivated employees for our international  team.


We are looking for a Senior Java Developer (m/f) for our office in Fulda at the earliest possible date.


Job description



  • Continuous development and deployment of our backend services in Java

  • Development and refinement of our scalable, high-performance architecture to support our growth

  • Work in an international team of experts in accordance with the best methods such as unit testing, integration testing and code reviews

  • Assurance of technical standards and documentation compliance

  • Product development in a creative, agile environment in close cooperation with our customers

item.title: Senior Software Engineer, Transactional at Flixster (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
For this position, we’re looking for a senior software engineer who will drive the expansion of our movie ticketing platform. Your work will power online ticket sales for major theater chains. Every ticket sale will happen via the components you build and operate. It takes a steady approach, a high standard for quality and reliability, and the willingness and ability to own a high volume, high visibility workflow.


Responsibilities



  • You own the transactional data flow that powers our movie ticketing service (reliability, security, traceability, throughput, performance, etc). Movie-goers around the country are depending on you!

  • You build it, you run it. You design and implement robust software and the operational capabilities to keep things humming (trending, alerting, etc.)

  • You champion high quality and best engineering practices

item.title: Software Engineer at Gamma 2 Robotics at Gamma 2 Robotics (Denver, CO)
item.description:
The software engineer will participate as a valuable member of the engineering team at Gamma 2
Robotics, Incorporated. This position will be responsible for designing, programming, testing, and
installing robotic systems. This will include a variety of tasks related to developing the control
systems, sensors and drive systems for mobile robots.


The ideal candidate will have the ability to develop and implement standard engineering practices,
as well as provide detailed documentation upon project completion.


They will be familiar with Agile programming practices such as team coding, unit testing, and use
cases. They will be fluent with Java. Experience with C, C++, and embedded systems is a plus. A BS in Computer Science or Computer Engineering is desired.

item.title: Lead Software Engineer at OpenX (Pasadena, CA)
item.description: The engineering team at OpenX is looking for Python experts to build and maintain high-performance distributed systems. This is a Lead Software Engineer role with emphasis on Python/Django.

item.title: Software Engineer (Tower UI) at Ansible (Durham, NC)
item.description:
Ansible is looking for a Front-end Software Engineer to help design and build our Ansible Tower product.  The candidate will be responsible for working closely with various teams to ensure designs are not only possible, but have the required data from the provided REST APIs. Job leveling to be determined by years of relevant experience and skill set.


Primary Responsibilities:



  • Engage with the user experience team to make design visions a reality

  • Collaborate with other UI Developers, back-end engineers and various solution stakeholders to ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs

  • Develop maintainable, scalable, and testable front-end code

item.title: Full Stack Developer at Public Sector Software ltd (Royal Leamington Spa, UK)
item.description: We’re looking for an enthusiastic developer, ready to get their hands dirty with all aspects of our Stack, from data management with SQL to front-end/application development, and everything in between.

item.title: Senior Embedded Software Engineer at Ivenix (Amesbury, MA)
item.description:
About You


You want to put your fingerprint on something that will help bring medical care to the state of the art. You consider software craftsmanship an absolute necessity for a highly productive team. You use system-based thinking and thrive as a member of an agile, cross functional team. You know how to manage multiple tasks concurrently and correctly prioritize them. You are able to collaborate across hardware and software engineering aspects of system development to achieve great results. You also have the experience and knowledge we are looking for:



  • You are skilled in the development of embedded software on bare-metal chipsets

  • You have a deep understanding of the Linux operating system and have written drivers to control hardware

  • You have a strong understanding of the unique software development challenges associated with a  resource-limited, battery-operated, network accessible embedded device

  • You have 8+ years of embedded software engineering experience along with a degree in math, electrical engineering, or computer science

  • Experience with Agile Software Development practices is a plus

  • Experience in the medical device industry is a plus


The Position



  • Design and implement medical applications running on an ARM Cortex A9, STM32 and MSP430 chipset

  • Design and develop software that interfaces with hardware devices

  • Read electronic schematic designs, component data sheets, and derive requirements for embedded software

  • Review and engage in the development of software specifications compliant with our established quality system and design controls

item.title: Senior Backend Developer at Pixmob (Montréal, QC, Canada)
item.description: Join the adventure. As a Senior Backend Developer you will work in PixMob’s Research and Development team, which is responsible for designing and creating all PixMob’s products. You will be helping to create new PixMob experiences by developing and deploying back end systems, APIs and databases while working within Big-Data constraints. In addition to technical competence and experience, PixMob is looking for someone who will bring creativity and originality to the product design process.

item.title: Android Senior Software Engineer at Netflix (Los Gatos, CA)
item.description:
Netflix is the leading video streaming service globally and the Netflix Android app is one of the most widely used and highly rated mobile applications. We work hard to constantly improve the performance, features, and quality of the app as we expand our coverage to 150+ countries in 2016.


Our Android innovation team is currently leading development of new products and features for all mobile clients at Netflix. Examples of current and upcoming projects include:



  • redesign of the app for phones to provide easier and more personalized browsing of content

  • improved, more informative second-screen experience for Chromecast

  • dedicated experience for kids on tablets


Each client team also controls the code for its endpoint, which allows for the ideal amount of customization and control in transferring data across the wire. We make an effort to be flexible and up-to-date with our tools and processes, and are always working to reduce developer friction.


We'd love for you to join our team of senior engineers and take on this unique opportunity to delight millions of users each day!

item.title: Senior iOS Mobile Developer at Vertisense (Albany, NY)
item.description:
As an iOS developer, you will be developing mobile applications that are well architected and provide a great user experience. You keep up to date with current trends in mobile development technologies and best practices. You enjoy utilizing the Scrum agile development framework and have utilized it in the past. You have a strong work ethic and consider yourself a top producer of robust, clear and efficient code. You are a problem solver, and are comfortable finding/creating and implementing solutions.


Reporting to the Director of Product Software, you will develop, test, debug, document, and implement iOS applications. We are a small team so flexibility is essential. This is a unique opportunity to enter an established startup at the ground floor while leveraging off an already market successful consumer retail product into a new and fresh market space.


The Role:
• Develop, test, debug, document, and implement iOS applications
• Create high quality prototypes
• Utilize and contribute to best practices
• Maximize code reuse

item.title: iOS Software Engineer, Mobile Applications at Google (Mountain View, CA)
item.description:
At Google, we care deeply about our iOS users, and we develop for iOS as enthusiastically as we do for Android. We strive to enable users on any platform to access Google products and services — from mainstays like Maps, Search, and YouTube to cutting-edge projects like Translate, Photos, and Google Now — in the best possible way. And we solve problems at Google's unique scale, bringing large data to small devices and crafting elegant user experiences.


As an iOS software engineer, you’ll get to work on products that help millions of people around the world, and collaborate with other passionate mobile developers to bring the most delightful and useful services and apps to life. You should be comfortable with Objective-C and have extensive knowledge of iOS development techniques and practices.


Responsibilities



  • Design and implement new user-facing features in Google’s large, complex mobile applications.

  • Build the libraries and frameworks that support authentication, copresence, and cutting-edge network protocols.

  • Optimize mobile applications on the iOS platform.

  • Develop prototypes quickly.

item.title: SharePoint Administrator at WCER (Madison, WI)
item.description: The Wisconsin Center for Education Research (WCER) is looking to hire a SharePoint Administrator for their Technical Services group. WCER provides a working environment which encourages professional development, provides interesting projects, and affords developers the opportunity to work with the latest technology -- all while maintaining a healthy work-life balance. WCER is completely funded with grant research money but still provides the generous benefits of the UW system, including five weeks of vacation plus sick time.

item.title: Software Engineer at ALTA Language Services (Atlanta, GA)
item.description:
Software Engineer: Mid and Senior Level Positions Available

The engineering team at ALTA is a small group empowered to make decisions, think independently, and embrace the newest coding and technology paradigms. We write internal business applications as well as customer facing sites that are the core of all operations. We strive to push new features into the language services market and hunt for business opportunities to explore with our tech.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Zillow (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
Our Marketing Product Team is looking for a Senior Software Engineer to help us reach out and expand our audience of Zillow fans. You’ll work with our Marketing group on a wide variety of projects with high visibility, right on the front page of Zillow.com. Your work will be seen and used by millions. You’ll have a lot of latitude to run with your ideas to make Zillow.com the best place anywhere for our users to make their home-ownership dreams come true.


What you’ll do:



  • Delight our users with the features you’ll ship.

  • Write performance-minded, highly-readable code using OO best practices

  • Take ownership of product features

  • Be involved at all stages of application development, from UI design to final testing

  • Invent elegant solutions to hard problems

  • Collaborate closely with UI designers, Program Managers, Developers and Testers

  • Have fun!


What you’ll need:



  • BS in Computer Science or Computer Engineering

  • Minimum of 5 years of software application, systems and web development experience

  • A proven track record of high productivity in application, architecture, design, coding, troubleshooting and debugging with a bias toward action

  • Experience designing and implementing high performance services and APIs

  • Experience implementing RESTful web services

  • Strong experience with Java or Python

  • Technical expertise in Ajax (Javascript, XML, CSS and HTML)

  • Ability to carry out tasks with limited need for supervision

  • The ability to work in a fast, agile and nimble environment with frequent change

  • Excellent problem solving and critical thinking skills


You’ll have an edge if you have experience with:



  • Big data and No-SQL databases.

  • Customer targeting products such as segmentation and personalization

  • Spring framework

  • Tapestry, Mustache-Templates or YUI.

  • Developing on a Linux or other Unix OS platform

  • Relational databases, especially Microsoft SQL Server

  • Distributed systems design and development

  • Git

item.title: C# .NET Developer at YieldPlanet (Warszawa, Poland)
item.description:
You will be working with a team of dedicated engineers and data scientists on developing and maintaining the next generation of hospitality tech products. YieldPlanet development work is done in collaboration with Princeton University and polish Universities for our Business Intelligence applications. 
Our team is working in an agile environment and you will have direct impact on code and the final product.


In detail, you will be doing the following:
- Developing applications using .NET technology
- Customer requirements analysis
- Creating technical documentation
- Developing good quality Code
- Research new technologies and share discoveries with other team members

item.title: Lead Mobile Developer at Shoeboxed, Inc. (Durham, NC)
item.description:
You are a seasoned Mobile Developer and can help bring new features and improvements to our iOS and Android applications.


You’ll be working with both our product and development team on the mobile apps as well as with our marketing and management teams on mobile growth projects.

item.title: Front-End Engineer at Flexport (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Flexport is looking for talented front-end engineers to join our team here in San Francisco. This is a high impact and high ownership opportunity for self-starters interested in solving real-world problems and streamlining the inefficient industry of global trade.


What You'll Do



  • Create tools that make it easier for companies of all sizes to participate in global trade

  • Help build intuitive, highly efficient and performant interfaces to automate the repetitive parts of logistics


Our Stack


In the frontend, we serve a few isomorphic single-page apps using React for the views, organize the data flow with Flux architecture, and test our application with Jest. We use a hybrid version of Bootstrap styles mixed with hand-built Sass components as our CSS library and are moving away from Bootstrap as we continue building our apps. We follow OOCSS methodology and use Hologram for documentation.


On the backend, we're a Rails shop riding on AWS and Postgres RDS. Using Rspec we believe in just enough testing to provide full coverage without introducing a lot of change friction. Our architecture is light-weight and modular in nature adhering to the fat models, skinny controllers ideology.


Our Process


Flexport engineering is a close-knit team where everyone reviews each other’s Github pull requests. We are expected to learn from our peers and help others learn. Code is released almost everyday or whenever business requires. Our continuous releases are integrated with Travis and Github.

item.title: Software Engineer- Backend at Brandcrumb (Barcelona, Spain)
item.description:
We are looking for a smart and skilled Software Engineer to work on our backend systems. The successful


candidate will work with our team of scientists and engineers to design, develop, test and deploy large scale


data­intensive components to extend our current system. We will evaluate applications from Junior candidates


(less than 3y of experience in the field) on a personal basis.


Responsibilities


Design, write and test scalable code for solving large scale named entity recognition/disambiguation


problems


Design and develop service­oriented components to improve and evolve our data­intensive system


Analyze upcoming business requirements and requests for improvement and design solutions and


prototypes to tackle them elegantly

item.title: iOS Developer at Bluesmart (San Francisco, CA)
item.description: As iOS Developer, you will join a small team responsible for the development, deployment, and constant improvement of Bluesmart’s mobile applications. This includes the development of the iOS app, the integration with our backend API, and the communication with the firmware of the Bluesmart suitcase. The team is also responsible for the testing, deployment to thousands of users, and the quick iteration into more evolved versions. You will work closely with the rest of the team to develop a mobile experience that is consistent with our product vision, while respecting the design guidelines provided by our design team and the conventions of the device ecosystems.

item.title: Systems Engineer at Brandcrumb (Barcelona, Spain)
item.description: We are looking for a proactive, talented, visionary Systems Engineer that will work together with our developers to improve the deployment, availability, and performance of our cloud-based infrastructure and bring it to the next level. The successful candidate will play a key role in deploying and maintaining a rapidly growing network of servers and services that handle high loads with low latency.

item.title: Software Engineer - Growing Startup at OrderMyGear.com (Dallas, TX)
item.description:
Come join us at OrderMyGear (OMG!) and play a pivotal role in a rapidly changing industry. You will be part of a small but growing development team, making a direct impact on the development process and culture.


We’re building our platform with tools like Docker, Go, PHP, Node, Backbone, React and other exciting technologies (we always pick the right tool for the job).


IN THIS ROLE YOU WILL:



  • Work closely with all teams to understand needs, distill requests down, come up with a plan, get buy-in, and implement.

  • Build and maintain internal tools that enable our business to make data-driven decisions.

  • Collaborate closely with the team to set the technical direction of our platform.

  • Be proactive in solving problems and comfortable in moving quickly.

item.title: Technical Operations Engineer- 3rd Shift at Spot Trading LLC (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
Are you a talented IT professional? Do you see yourself working with cutting-edge technology in a low latent environment? Are you passionate about solving complex problems that others give up on? Can you picture yourself supporting traders and automated trading systems? Can you query a database on the fly and produce data a trader can act on immediately?


Time, speed, and expertise are critical in our industry! We need an overnight IT Analyst who can facilitate quick resolutions to any trading or technology-related incident or request. As a member of Spot’s team, you will be constantly challenged!



  • Reconcile positions

  • Process Corporate Actions

  • Walk the datacenter to ensure all devices are operating correctly.  Troubleshoot those that indicate something is wrong

  • Trigger, monitor, and troubleshoot the initialization of the Production applications

  • Perform various IT Infrastructure checks

  • Monitor and troubleshoot the initialization of the Staging applications

  • Work with third party vendors to resolve issues

  • IT projects and tasks as assigned

item.title: Software Engineers (to work in Python/Django) at Fusionbox (Denver, CO)
item.description: At Fusionbox, the engineers work on tasks that span from server provisioning and system administration to server-side development to JavaScript fronted interface developing. We use git, Puppet, nginx, Postgres, memcache, Django, Backbone, AngularJS, Ember.js, and React--but we are always open to trying out new things. In addition to working on client projects, we have our own portfolio of open source projects that the engineers maintain.
