item.title: Senior Software Development Engineer at Motorola Solutions (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
Senior Software Development Engineer


Location: Seattle, WA



We are a small agile team that works like a startup within a big company. Motorola Solutions is known around the world for innovation in Enterprise Mobility, Public Safety and Wireless Infrastructure. We are leading the next wave of innovations that enable people, enterprises and governments to be more connected and more mobile. We are seeking a senior software developer to join our team in Seattle to work with our core WAVE product and IP telephony code. Our ideal candidate will have protocol-level IP network development experience and a desire to work on challenging problems in a multithreaded distributed system.



You will work on the WAVE audio processing Engine, the WAVE SDKs, network modules, IP telephony, Supernode peer routing, and other sophisticated real-time two-way communications components. Our software is used by demanding organizations worldwide and we have very high quality and craftsmanship standards.



You will be responsible for creating and maintaining sophisticated low-level code and the frameworks required to test, build, and certify it. Your optimization and debugging skills will be called into play daily. Understanding of H.323, SIP, and audio CODECs will be of great value to our team. Your professionalism lets you learn quickly, adapt to changing situations, help others, and take care of the details. You communicate well and get along with other people. And your sample code is a joy to read.



Key Responsibilities:



  • Design, development, and maintenance of core WAVE components

  • Specifications, architecture, wiki pages, and other design documents

  • Creation of unit tests and test scaffolding

  • Cross-training and mentoring

  • Providing accurate estimates and meeting your scheduled commitments

  • Primarily acts as a multiplier by building systems, authoring tools, or introducing policies or patterns that raise the level of productivity of the entire organization

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Avalon Healthcare Solutions (Tampa, FL)
item.description:
Avalon’s Software Engineers supports projects through the use of software development tools under limited supervision using prescribed methodologies. Software Engineers work collaboratively with other technical and business resources. You will analyze, design, develop, document and support various custom applications, portals, data exchanges, services and integration with other applications and systems to support the evolving needs of the company.


Job Requirements



  • Develops complex, modular and reusable application code which utilizes SQL data sources.  Able to performance tune applications.  Develops multiple, modular objects and the messaging interface between objects to create a complex software package.  Reuses objects and can create object inventories.

  • Can create a detail design document through the assessment of business requirements.  Can work in a team to assess alternatives to different designs and choose best solution to fit business needs.

  • Demonstrates an ability to read, interpret, create and maintain complex Conceptual, Logical and Physical models to include context diagrams, data flow diagrams, process flow diagrams, data dictionaries and logical flow charts, under limited supervision.

  • Able to develop unit test plans which include regression testing and the packaging of tests into consecutive steps based on logical dependencies to ensure quality delivery. Assists in the development of functional test plans used to verify that a specific system functions according to actual requirements and established guidelines.

  • Able to perform moderate to complex application administration & support. Ability to triage and resolve application and integration issues. Document and track product defects.  Demonstrates the ability to develop and implement solutions for the causes identified.

  • Able to evaluate, recommend and exploit evolving technologies in the design and implementation of application infrastructure for scalability, reliability, availability and serviceability and identify the trade-offs and risks associated with each.

  • Adheres to and contributes to definition of good database design practices.  Conceptual understanding of referential integrity, locking and transaction processing.  Understands impact of data modeling decisions on system performance and resource usage.  Able to do complex queries and updates of tables. 

  • Software Developers will contribute to, and follow the defined Avalon Agile SDLC / Change Management process for developing, testing, maintaining and deploying code.  Contributes to and follows established coding standards.  Able to perform code reviews and assess the work of other team members to ensure quality delivery and compliance with procedures.

  • Has an understanding of the strategic alignment of IT solutions with business objectives.  Demonstrates a working knowledge of specific components of health plan operations and associated technical dependencies.

item.title: Executive Technical Director at AKQA (Shanghai, China)
item.description:
Responsible for the inspiration, innovation and continuous delivery in every idea, product and service that AKQA crafts, the Executive Technical Director is the driving force behind technical strategy. They recruit, build and coach an excellent team that is able to provide a robust framework for build, test and deployment, surpassing client expectations.


Inspired by best practice, state-of-the-art techniques and technological innovation across enterprise, consumer applications and experiences, the Executive Technical Director provides unique outlooks and solutions for our clients.


Located in Shanghai, China, as part of AKQA you will have access to world-renowned thought leadership from influential authors, athletes, artists and entrepreneurs. You will work in an environment that fosters a meritocratic culture, surrounded by some of the brightest minds in their fields.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer, Test at Kyruus, Inc. (Boston, MA)
item.description:
Position Summary:


We are looking for a passionate engineer to raise the bar on accelerating delivery and improving quality at Kyruus.  As a software engineer in the test organization, your responsibilities will be to create frameworks, tools, and applications that will drive the engineering organization to understand the current level of quality of our products, and identify where to invest in the creation of more tests. Simply put, your job is to enable product development by helping developers help themselves.


Sample Responsibilities:



  • Build metrics to track and assess the quality of our releases

  • Create tools that will continue to allow the engineering team to scale while quickly delivering high quality software

  • Assess product quality through management and aggregation of information from test automation frameworks

  • Present quality metrics to enhance our overall process, advise the engineering leadership team on resource allocation and improvement strategies

  • Take the lead on organizing the mechanics of our test processes

item.title: Director of Quality Assurance at Lumeris (Maryland Heights, MO)
item.description:
Join Our Growing Team!


Lumeris™ provides the information technology, guidance, and operational services necessary for hospitals and health plans to transform their organizations into high-performing accountable delivery systems.


Our revolutionary technology platform for accountable care integrates data from disparate systems across the continuum of care, provides complete visibility into the clinical and financial performance of the enterprise, and delivers applications and information to key stakeholders at the point of thought. Lumeris also provides health care consulting and professional services that help organizations establish the necessary clinical and business processes, methodologies, and operational capacity to create their own successful accountable health care delivery systems.


The depth and breadth of our solutions — combined with the company’s extensive real-world experience in accountable care — make Lumeris the ideal partner for any health care organization seeking the significant benefits of a better connected, aligned, and informed accountable delivery system.


Lumeris is privately owned by Essence Group Holdings Corporation (EGHC) and backed by investors including Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers, Camden Partners, and Sandbox Industries.


Why Join Lumeris?


At Lumeris you will be part of team that is focused on solving a national healthcare problem.  And you will have the ability to contribute while working for a purpose. Our environment is fast-paced and change oriented and is focused on growth and employee engagement.  At Lumeris we believe talent is utilized best when given the opportunity to succeed.  That is why we have removed the boundaries that inhibit success and focus on fostering an environment that allows employees to utilize their talents.



  • Implement consistent global Quality Assurance metrics and processes for activities to include visual inspection, test automation, and performance characterization to ensure organizational product quality is realized while improving release velocity.

  • Facilitates, prioritize, and communicates functional, non-functional, integration, end-to-end, and scheduling requirements for QA efforts associated with multiple intake paths within the product development lifecycle.

  • Manage employee staff and outsourced resources in transaction application and data analytics quality testing efforts as well as performance and stress testing management. Mentor and support colleagues to assure they continually build their skills while delivering QA on products that meet requirements and exceed expectations

  • Design, create, and implement testing strategies for complex lifecycle, high volume, multi-channel transactional healthcare SAAS applications systems and associated data applications including business intelligence and data analytics applications

  • Drive quality metrics and review performance levels against those metrics for transactional systems and data products

  • Drive continual performance efficiencies by way of best practices leadership and best practices adoption

  • Drive increased efficiencies and testing cost reductions by way of best increased and comprehensive automation practices

  • Develop the long term team strategy for QA testing, automation testing, load testing, QA best practices, and team talent development

  • Optimize and implement creative QA sourcing engagement processes, ensuring all capital and maintenance projects are delivered on schedule and to our quality standards

  • Contribute to the definition and compliance of standard quality processes, best practices, and lead changes where improvements must be made

  • Recommend and assist in the implementation of standardized tools for operational processes and liaise with vendors and internal customers to identify and implement value-added, industry standard best practices to achieve QA operational efficiency

  • Lead the QA team in a manner that delivers results as experts, but approaches software testing with the eye of novices Measure success by what you finish and deliver

item.title: Senior Developer- Core Java at Infusion (New York, NY)
item.description:
Senior Java Developer


New York City


Are you a Java development superstar with strong consulting capability and proven record of designing and delivering innovative enterprise solutions?  Would you like to have an opportunity to build your own team and to positively impact our business?  If yes, read on!


Infusion is a global innovation, technology, and design firm.  We are seeking a Senior Developer to join our New York team. Our project teams build software from the ground up, using the best technologies and frameworks for the job.  You will help us create environments that maximize developer productivity, and help set our strategy for delivering major projects to our clients.


The Role:


You will be joining our Capital Markets team to build large scale business solutions and work directly with are clients - who are some of the world’s leading investment banks!  You will be responsible for developing new components for saving, calculating, and aggregating massive amounts of real time data for a massive overhaul of a global risk system. This ongoing program that will help transform the business and will allow the production of aggregated risk services, enable the allocation of capital, improve decisions for trading, and assess risk and overall accountability of across the Bank. 


H1 transfer and relocation expenses will be offered to qualified candidates.

item.title: Senior Java Back-End Software Engineer at VMware Bulgaria (Sofia, Bulgaria)
item.description:
VMware is the leader in cloud infrastructure, business mobility and virtualization software. A pioneer in the use of virtualization and policy-driven automation technologies, VMware simplifies IT complexity across the entire data center to the virtual workplace, empowering customers with solutions in the software-defined data center to hybrid cloud computing and the mobile workspace.

With 2014 revenues of $6.04 billion, VMware has more than 500,000 customers, 75,000 partners, and 18,000+ employees in 120+ locations around the world. At the core of what we do are our employees who deeply value execution, passion, integrity, customers, and community. Want to be part of a compassionate community that thrives on architecting what's next in IT?

Responsibilities:
- Design and implement the next generation architecture of VMware's virtualization products
- Be part of a software development team working in collaboration with management, quality assurance, user experience and technical publications teams
- You will define/analyze the product requirements, write/read functional and design specifications, write/support the code
- You will perform code reviews to the rest of the team members and will receive code reviews of your code as well
- You will have to adhere to VMware internal processes during the whole development cycle – idea, patent, requirements, specifications, designs, implementation, bug fixing, QA, support, etc.

Required:
- Experience with product development or strong willingness to switch from outsourcing to product development
- General programming knowledge - object oriented principles, data structures, algorithms, design patterns, memory management, etc.
- Solid background in fundamentals of computer science and development process
- Willingness to innovate, learn and share knowledge, invent and patent new algorithms and technologies
- Professional programming experience in Java and related technologies
- Experience with distributed systems
- Experience with enterprise architectures – remote method invocations, extensive XML usage, stateless designs, load balancing, SSL security, etc.
- Experience with web services (REST, SOAP, WSDL etc.)
- Experience with multi-tiered architectures (Service-Application-Presentation)
- Experience in developing UI application in Java and Flex is a big plus
- Willingness to develop both front and back end applications
- Willingness to use different programming languages to address the specific product needs (Python, Batch Scripting, etc.)
- Excellent analytical and problem solving skills
- Willingness to work without close supervision and with proactive goal-oriented attitude
- Willing to practice into other roles like code review, pair programming, QE automation
- Excellent communication skills and fluent English (speaking/reading/writing)

Desired:
- Hands-on experience in utilizing Spring Framework
- Experience with Python
- Experience working in an agile environment is a plus

VMware offers:
- Attractive compensation package - competitive salary, flexible bonus scheme, company sponsored mobile phone plan and additional long term incentives
- Individual career path - management and technical career growth, enhanced by learning and development program, regular performance assessment, teams of world-wide IT professionals
- Healthy work environment - company sponsored medical program, food and beverage program, sport activities, open communication
- Work-life balance – 25 days paid vacation, team buildings and celebrations All applications will be treated with strict confidentiality.

As part of the VMware global standards for integrity you will be required to go through a pre-employment screening process before you join.

All applications will be treated with strict confidentiality.


No visa or work permit requirements for EU citizens or EU work permit holders

item.title: Sr. Software Engineer (Middleware) at SolarCity (San Mateo, CA)
item.description:
SolarCity is seeking a highly talented and versatile Software Engineer with a strong understanding of object oriented programming and SaaS systems.  In this role, you will transform terabytes of real-time data into practical and action-able information for our customers as well as our technicians.  That data comes from our tens of thousands of customers with solar electric systems, energy meters, and grid connected batteries.  We have a lot data and even more on the way - you will be crunching, transforming, graphing, caching, and archiving a growing stream of information.


Your work will accelerate the adoption of clean energy, and improve the lives of hundreds of thousands of users.  You will get to work with a small, fast-paced, and dedicated software team to design and develop cutting edge products.

item.title: wanted: Android Engineer hacker / bandmate at The Hackerati (New York, NY)
item.description:
What We Do


Technology Consultancy


The Hackerati is a high-end, boutique consulting firm delivering Engineering as a Service to diverse clients, from Fortune 250s to startups.


Why You Should Join Us


We're not afraid to be our wild selves.


We’re different. With mottos like be fearless and weird is good, our unique perspectives on life and technology make us great people to learn from and work/party with. We sponsor lunches and happy hours, band practice, electronics like Glass/Oculus/Myo, and we’ve presented at the UN—twice. We rock that familial vibe, and you should join us if you enjoy a blurred line between work and play.


What To Expect


Deliver the industry's most challenging projects.


Hackerati consultants are like The Wolf from Pulp Fiction: we solve problems. Hard ones. To do so, we deploy teams of Hackerati to work onsite with clients around NYC, and also build products in-house, both for ourselves and clients. A typical project lasts between 6 and 9 months—Thus there is constant diversity of work.

item.title: Systems Administrator at Synthetic Genomics, Inc. (San Diego, CA)
item.description: At Synthetic Genomics, Inc., we are dedicated to developing and commercializing genomic-driven solutions to address global challenges. We are currently seeking a Systems Administrator to join our fast-growing, dynamic and collaborative team in La Jolla, CA.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at CrowdTwist (New York, NY)
item.description:
About Us and the Role:


CrowdTwist is seeking a Senior Software Engineer for our growing team based in New York City.  In this role, you will work directly with all areas of our platform while adding new features and new products to the CrowdTwist platform. You will be involved in many different projects as we continue to grow and enhance our platform.  Your work will be in front of millions of people and will directly influence the loyalty program offerings for many of our clients, such as Pepsi, Nestlé, Lancome, Ubisoft and Zumiez.


We are a venture-backed NYC based company that provides the most comprehensive omni-channel loyalty & analytics solutions for industry leading brands. We're relaxed, experienced, hard driving and are changing our industry.


Your work will span many areas of the CrowdTwist platform, including but not limited to:



  • The consumer-facing loyalty program experience

  • Our RESTful APIs

  • Our scalable microservices architecture

  • Our client-facing content management applications

  • Integrations with social networks (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Foursquare, etc) and vendors (PoS, ESP, CRM, Bazaarvoice, OrderGroove, etc)

  • Our data-driven, client-customizable JavaScript SDK


This role is for an engineer who loves to roll up their sleeves, dive in, and tackle any problem with speed and precision.  You will be utilizing your experience with object-oriented software design and implementation, data modeling, and building high-performance, highly scalable web and data processing applications.  We operate in an agile manner, so you must thrive in a fast-paced environment and enjoy shipping product.


In this role, you will work with a broad backend tech stack, including but not limited to:



  • PHP

  • Java

  • Oracle

  • Redis

  • MongoDB

  • RabbitMQ

  • Docker

  • Amazon Web Services (EC2, VPC, ELB, S3, RedShift, CloudFront etc.)

  • Various third-party services (Twilio, SendGrid, EdgeCast, etc.)

item.title: Watson Software Engineer, Search at AlchemyAPI, an IBM Watson Company (Denver, CO)
item.description:
AlchemyAPI, an IBM company, is used by customers across dozens of countries, including some of the largest companies in the world. We're solving real-world problems affecting billion-dollar industries. Come help us build amazing technology and do it at scale.


We are looking for a talented search engineer to join our growing team. In this role, you will play a critical part in building a scalable data analytics and search platform that powers our next generation of products. Successful candidates will have an extensive background in Lucene-based distributed search systems such as ElasticSearch (preferred) or Solr with a solid understanding of Lucene internals.

item.title: Director, Solutions Architect-Java, Agile, Product Delivery at Fidelity (Durham, NC)
item.description:
Fidelity Strategic Investment Products and Data (SIPD) is seeking Director, Solutions Architect to lead project delivery for our Retail Managed Account Product Line.  The Solution Architect will create and maintain architecture plans and specifications for related applications.  He/she also guides project and program level decisions to ensure alignment with the Fidelity Enterprise Technology architecture strategy. Strategic Investment Products and Data (SIPD) is a shared technology services organization within Enterprise Technology.  SIPD manages and supports Guidance and Planning tools, Managed Accounts offerings, and Integrated Data Solutions across multiple Fidelity companies. The Director of Architecture will be located in Durham, NC; Smithfield, RI; or Merrimack, NH with periodic travel to Boston and North Carolina depending on location. 


Primary Responsibilities



  • Provide architecture leadership for Managed Accounts product delivery

  • Participate in all aspects of Manage Accounts product innovation

  • Develop and assess technical solutions for the Managed Account product line

  • Identify approaches, tools, techniques, and technologies to meet business requirements

  • Recommend solutions that address functional and quality goals of systems

  • Establish, implement, and enforce appropriate architecture standards in the creation and implementation of the technical solution

  • Ensure delivery teams are following engineering best practices

  • Responsible for technical implementation of architectural components when needed

  • Assess and explain the present and future rationale of architecture decisions

  • Mediate opposing viewpoints and negotiate equitable solutions to ensure successful and stable outcomes for the Managed Accounts product space

  • Contribute to multi-year technical roadmap, blueprints and reference architecture plans for the Managed Account product line

  • Provide strategic architecture guidance in support of project delivery estimates

item.title: Principal Software Engineer at clypd (Somerville, MA)
item.description:
You will be learning all aspects of the system and contributing to them. You will work with the rest of the engineering and product teams to deliver quickly and fluidly using Agile methodologies. You will use Continuous Integration and Test Driven Development techniques to build rock-solid code.
 

Skills and experience:

  • Achieved at least a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering
  • 10+ years of experience
  • Willingness to learn and improve your web stack skills: front end, back end or both
  • For front end: experience or interest in building interactive user experiences with modern HTML5 and JavaScript, and comfortable working with the services that drive them
  • Previous use of MV* frameworks on the client (AngularJS, Ember, ...) and/or server side (Rails, Django, Grails, ...) a huge plus
  • For back end: experience in working with large data sets, database performance, REST APIs, and Go a plus
  • Excitement about startups and working with a small (but quickly expanding) Agile team
  • Communication is key; our work is heavily team-oriented, and we are looking for someone who is comfortable participating and contributing to the team
  • Passion for delivering quality code and products. Code reviews and automated tests are an integral part of our development process. We are always looking for new ways to improve.

Our stack:

  • Ruby on Rails, React, JQuery, RSpec/Capybara
  • Go
  • Docker
  • PostgreSQL/RDS, Redis
  • AWS

Perks and benefits:

  • Competitive compensation and stock options
  • Comprehensive benefits package (Health, Dental, Vision, Long-term and Short-term disability, 401(k), cell phone subsidy, commuter safety subsidy)
  • Unlimited paid time off  - take the time you need to operate at peak performance
  • Learning culture that includes weekly Lunch and Learns and a formal mentor program
  • Amazing office space in Davis Square, one of the hottest neighborhoods in Somerville
  • Open and relaxed office layout, including standing desks, walking desks, and a choice of comfortable seating
  • Macbook and Thunderbolt display
  • Three rotating beer taps, iced tea and iced coffee on tap, wine bar, tea bar, and more
  • Game room with darts, foosball, Xbox One, PS4, and more
  • Fun team outings and celebrations, an annual company outing and holiday party

Who we are:

clypd is a leading player in one of the hottest emerging markets of programmatic TV, disrupting the $74 billion television industry. We are on a mission to change television advertising, to make it more efficient and effective for TV media companies, consumers, and advertisers. We've built an advertising technology platform to empower media companies with programmatic strategies. Our sales platform delivers workflow automation, data-enhanced decisioning and provides media partners with tools to manage their sales efforts.

We are looking for awesome people to join a growing and fun team. We aim to create an environment that is open and transparent, collaborative, supportive, and diverse. We are looking for engineers who want to learn about the latest technologies to craft scalable and maintainable code. The problems we are solving are challenging and interesting and we want your help.

item.title: Front-end Developer at EcoHealth Alliance (New York, NY)
item.description:
Are you interested in applying your design skills to help researchers identify the next global infectious disease threat?


EcoHealth Alliance is seeking a Web Designer for our tech team. As part of a small team of developers, data scientists, infectious disease scientists, you’ll develop tools to support EcoHealth Alliance’s mission in conservation and global public health.


Description and Responsibilities:



  • Help design and enhance the UI/UX of our data-driven web applications

  • Create wireframes, mockups, and prototypes of applications and their components that effectively communicate interaction and design ideas to developers

  • Help with the implementation of designs using HTML, CSS and JavaScript (Jade, Stylus and CoffeeScript)

  • Conduct user research and evaluate user feedback

  • Assist with the visual branding of the tech team’s projects

  • Help establish and promote design guidelines, best practices and standards

  • Content management of EHA website


EcoHealth Alliance is an equal opportunity employer offering competitive salary and a comprehensive benefits package that covers 100% of the monthly health care premium costs for the employee and their family when applicable (including dental and vision coverage), a 403(b) pension plan, flexible work schedules, a minimum of 10 days paid vacation annually, paid holidays, work from home days, and a pre-tax transportation withholding for commuters in New York City. EcoHealth Alliance may encourage employees to attend conferences when appropriate, and enroll in courses for the joint purposes of professional development and promoting the EcoHealth Alliance mission.


The position is based at EHA headquarters in New York City (Manhattan). Local candidates are preferred, with possible relocation assistance available.


How to Apply:


To apply, you must send your resume and a personalized cover letter as one document to dev-jobs@ecohealthalliance.org with the subject of "Designer 2015". Applications without cover letters will not be evaluated. This cover letter will help us assess your ability to communicate effectively and will be used as the primary mechanism to determine whether a candidate is asked to interview for the vacant position. The cover letter is the most important part of your application. In your cover letter, please briefly describe your background and any experience you may have with designing or developing web applications and public health. Be sure to mention why you are interested in working on a research-and-development oriented team at a health and conservation focused non-profit.


Applicants are encouraged to to include a link to their portfolio or sample work.


Thank you for your interest in EcoHealth Alliance!

item.title: Senior Software Engineer, Solar Performance Analytics at SolarCity (San Mateo, CA)
item.description:
SolarCity is seeking a talented developer to develop software tools in Python to evaluate photovoltaic system performance. You will work with a team of analysts who are experts in how solar systems function, and need your help to implement smart software algorithms that identify underperforming systems. You will develop both the underlying analysis engine, and the user interface and data visualization tools used by our teams responsible for servicing underperforming photovoltaic systems.


The ideal candidate would have proven results in developing user interfaces and middleware for data analysis. You seek out the simplest solution, but don’t shy away from more complicated algorithms and mathematics when appropriate. You like leading the full software development cycle, from requirements gathering and architecture, through coding, testing, and deployment, and you enjoy working on small teams, where you can make a big individual impact.

item.title: Senior iOS and Android Developers at Infusion (Toronto, ON, Canada)
item.description:
Infusion, an award winning Microsoft Gold Partner, has new openings for a talented and experienced Senior .Net Consultant with a background leading projects ensuring that they are completed to the highest standards. As a Senior Consultant you will lead high profile projects, working with the best talent in Krakow to ensure we continue to deliver for our clients.


Infusion creates digital experiences and advanced technology solutions that bring our clients' businesses to new levels. Our international offices offer a full suite of information technology services with a focus on talent, technology, and design-driven methodologies, placing Infusion at the forefront of interface exploration. Infusion builds touch solutions on all platforms executing tablet, touch, and gesture based solutions for many of the world's largest organizations in the retail, financial services, hospitality and tourism, and government sectors.


Key Responsibilities and Duties:



  • Develop application components and features with limited oversight.

  • Independently resolve problems, test and debug.

  • Adhere to project governance-developing according to industry best practice.

  • Work with senior team members to validate design and implement decisions.

  • Ability to take and follow directions, ask questions, and raise risks.

  • Contribute suggestions and creativity to the team.

  • Acquire domain knowledge in the client’s areas of business focus.

  • Focus on building strong and lasting client relationships by “doing right by the client”.

item.title: Cloud Architect m/f at Cloudreach GmbH (München, Germany)
item.description:
How will you spend your time at Cloudreach?


You will be working in the following areas (and more!):



  • Consulting with our German customers helping build and architect new solutions, data center migrations and scaling their adoption of cloud technologies

  • Green field development of Amazon Web Services infrastructure (EC2, RDS, EMR, etc), e.g. looking at an existing service or data centre and then architecting a more effective solution in AWS. You might work on a major eCommerce platform, a MySQL database migration, a Big Data project, or building a scalable mobile backend

  • DevOps: Systems engineering work with frameworks such as Chef or Puppet - as well as helping to break down barriers between silo’d teams. We automate everything

  • Not doing any out of hours shift work - yay!

item.title: (SENIOR) SOFTWARE DEVELOPER CoC Navigation (m/f) at Harman Becker Automotive Systems GmbH (Garching, Deutschland)
item.description:
Tasks / Responsibilities:



  • Define use cases, negotiate interfaces and implement prototypes and solutions in the emerging field of navigation related online services to supply solutions at and beyond market expectations

  • As part of a matrix organization work with engineers, designers, testers and managers as needed to help integrate and productize your solution.

  • Integrate of new functionality into an existing solutions

  • Propose new ideas, approaches and implement them Elaboration and implementation of component design, concepts, algorithms for new features in area connected services/location based services

  • Performance Analysis / Profiling of implementation

  • Technical coordination with developers of navigation controllers, navigation engine and online services

  • Analysis, improvement, and optimization of complex, distributed algorithms for geo-data processing

  • Elaboration and implementation of component design, concepts, algorithms, and architecture for new navigation features


Our Offer:


Continue your career at Harman, one of the worldwide leaders in infotainment and car audio. We have been successfully doing business for decades and are proud to have all premium car manufacturers as clients. As a Harman employee, you will have the opportunity to actively shape the future and be an important part of Harman's success story. Our dynamic and international business offers you numerous opportunities to further develop and make an impact. Your knowledge and commitment will be rewarded with an attractive compensation package. HARMAN is an employer who values equal employment opportunities for both, women and men. Applications from qualified women are particularly welcome.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - Android at HERE, a Nokia company (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
We need a Senior Mobile App Developer with in-depth knowledge in Java and Android. This is an experienced position that requires fluency in the latest Java capabilities and Android SDK. As an Android developer you will be a key member of our growing mobile engineering team, developing industry-leading mobile applications and SDKs. The ideal candidate is a quick learner who is not afraid of digging deep into new technical challenges, loves to work with Kanban in small teams, and has experience shipping one or more Android apps that are currently available on Google Play Store. Backend experience in node.js and JSON REST API design is a plus. 


What we offer...


At HERE, we strive to deliver memorable moments and unforgettable experiences for our employees. You'll have the opportunity to work with highly respected industry professionals from around the world, and learn from their experiences every day. In return, we will prepare you for future opportunities to progress within the business and drive your own career; acquiring new skills and expertise along the way.

item.title: C/C++ Software Engineer at Intel Corporation (Shannon, Ireland)
item.description:
As a Senior Software Engineer / Technical Lead, you will work with Intel Shannon DCG/NPG Software development team to deliver leading edge enterprise and communications platforms that will enable tomorrow’s Data Centre infrastructure and accelerate cloud computing adoption from high-end co-processors for supercomputers to low-energy systems, as well as solutions for big data and intelligent devices.


You will be based in Shannon, Co. Clare as a member of a talented team of software engineers with a broad range of experience. You will have the opportunity to collaborate with multi-site projects working on cutting edge hardware. You will enjoy a world class work environment and you will be empowered to full fill your greatest ambitions.

item.title: Database Developer at Best Lawyers (New York, NY)
item.description:
Best Lawyers is seeking a Database Developer for a new interactive legal platform, built on the foundation of our 35 years as the most respected legal peer review network. The primary role will be to develop and support the databases running this new platform, ensuring maximum up-time, speed, and scalability, in a Windows Azure SQL environment.


The developer will be challenged to maintain, improve, and create new features in an ever-changing environment while ensuring stability and site performance. Applicants should love challenging the status quo and strive to make everything easier, faster, and more robust.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer (Elevated Careers) at eHarmony (Los Angeles, CA)
item.description:
As a founding member of our new Job Compatibility Engineering Team, we are looking for a Senior Software Engineer. You will work our product to develop the next generation of matching technologies to power eHarmony’s new Job Compatibility product for job seekers and recruiters. Our mission is to provide candidate users with an entirely new way to find jobs that fit their skills at companies with which they are profoundly compatible, and recruiters to find talent that will truly thrive in their new positions. You will work on the technology that will bring this mission to life.


As the Senior Software Engineer you will:


Drive the development of an entirely new enterprise website



  • Work with internal and external resources to implement and integrate new and existing systems

  • Create modules to extract features and signals from diverse data collections

  • Process large data logs to detect patterns and insights

  • Build tools to improve the targeting and relevance of eHarmony’s job matching platform

  • Work with Machine Learning specialists, Product Management and QA Teams to deliver reliable, high-performance systems

item.title: Operations Engineer | DevOps at Wikimedia Foundation (San Francisco, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Summary


Wikimedia is seeking a DevOps engineer to work on the Analytics team to help maintain and build infrastructure used to measure Wikipedia’s reach and impact.  DevOps engineers work with software engineers, technical operations, product managers and researchers to ensure they have the Big Data tools they need to improve Wikipedia for hundred of millions of people around the world.


Description



  • Perform day-to-day operational tasks (deployment, maintenance, configuration, troubleshooting) on many aspects of Wikimedia’s analytics infrastructure

  • Assist in the research, design, and implementation of Wikimedia analytics infrastructure and services

  • Implement and utilize configuration management and deployment tools (specifically puppet, salt)

  • Coordinate and communicate with other members of the Wikimedia engineering teams

  • Incident response and diagnosis of system outages or alerts

  • Write and update internal documentation of systems and processes

item.title: VP of Software Engineer, Data at Centro (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
ABOUT THE PRODUCT AND ENGINEERING TEAM


At Centro, we’ve always been about making people’s lives better—from our employees to our clients. Today, we’re building a unified platform to execute every digital media advertising transaction, thus providing a new level of automation and intelligence in ad tech. This is an enormous task that will disrupt an industry and improve the lives of those who work within it.

To do this, we’re aggressively growing our team of engineers, product developers and designers. We are imaginative, passionate, determined and relentless in our efforts. Of course, we are fascinated by the complexity of engineering problems at this scale—it’s what brings bright minds together. But what keeps us coming back (and why we love coming to work everyday) is the chance to improve how work gets done: freeing up people’s time so that they can dream bigger and make life better.

Come build something amazing with us.


ABOUT THE ROLE


The ideal candidate will have experience in deploying, designing, and implementing big-data solutions using a diverse set of technologies and solutions. This leader will head a team that builds the powerful data discovery and analytical capabilities that provide the insight that drives strategic decisions for the enterprise, our customers, and optimizes business performance. The position will support each business unit with their data discovery and analytics. The ideal candidate will possess the thought-leadership skills to drive our big-data agenda and the interpersonal and networking skills to develop critical relationships across the organization.

item.title: Database Specialist Programmer at 21st Century Oncology (Fort Myers, FL)
item.description:
21st Century Oncology is a leading developer and operator of radiation therapy centers, medical oncology, and multi-specialty practices throughout the US.  Our centers, which are freestanding and hospital based, provide a full spectrum of radiation therapy services and medical oncology treatment to cancer patients, and multi specialty care to patients in the areas of Urology, Gynecology and medical specialties.  We are growing and need highly qualified candidates to join our team.



We are seeking a Database Specialist Programmer to support our growing Clinical IT Team in Fort Myers, FL.  He/she will perform a variety of programming assignments requiring knowledge of established programming procedures and data processing requirements.


Responsibilities will include developing, maintaining and troubleshooting application using .Net Windows C#, .Net Web C# application, Java and Javascript; also backend tier developing, maintaining and troubleshooting application using MS PL/SQL and Stored Procedures.


ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:



  1. Code, test and troubleshoot programs utilizing the appropriate hardware, database, and programming technology.

  2. Learn all databases running in the company environment and develop queries to retrieve data and to store data to produce custom reports with valuable medical and business information.

  3. Maintain and modify programs new and existing applications; make approved changes by amending flow charts and documentation, develop detailed programming logic, and coding changes.

  4. Evaluate interrelationships between programs such as whether a contemplated change in one part of a program would cause unwanted results in a related part.

  5. Analyze performance of programs and take action to correct deficiencies based on consultation with users and approval of supervisor.

  6. Confer with users to gain understanding of needed changes or modifications of existing programs. Resolve questions of program intent, data input, output requirements, and inclusion of internal checks and controls.

  7. Write and maintain programming documentation.

  8. Analyze client/server and micro-computer based software solutions compatibility with company requirements.

  9. Maintain confidentiality with regard to the information being processed, stored or accessed.

  10. Document programming problems and resolutions for future support reference.

  11. Design, develop and maintain database applications.

  12. Write SQL statements and stored procedures

  13. Learn and maintain interfaces with vendor  representatives to resolve problems.

  14. Design, develop and maintain interfaces using HL7 protocol (Mirth Corp appliance)

  15. Assist other team members doing support work to new/existing application.

  16. Other duties as assigned.

item.title: Perl Software Engineer - Las Vegas, NV at SUPERNAP (Las Vegas, NV)
item.description:
Join SUPERNAP - A Switch Company
Switch, the developer of SUPERNAP data centers, is the revolutionary technology solutions company led by inventor and solutionist Rob Roy. As Founder and CEO he holds 218 patents and patents pending that have produced an essential and future-forward transformation in data center architecture, engineering, technology and operations. His vision also resulted in the creation of the SUPERNAP CORE Cooperative. It is the world’s only $3 trillion independent purchasing and collaboration ecosystem, guided by the company’s unique operating ideology called Truth in Technology.

Designed by Rob Roy, the Switch award-winning Tier IV Gold SUPERNAP data centers are certified as the highest-ranking colocation data centers in the world and are maintained by the highest-rated mission critical operations teams. With more on-net, independent cloud providers than any other physical cloud gateway, SUPERNAP connects thousands of clients and providers from within the facility. SUPERNAP is the recognized world leader in colocation design, development and mission critical operations.

SUPERNAP, with clients ranging from sophisticated startups to Fortune 100 powerhouses, enables unparalleled mission critical solutions that make a difference in innovation, ROI and communities as a whole.

Perl Software Engineer - Las Vegas, NV

The purpose of this position is to design, architect, develop and test new web-based software applications and address issues with production systems, while also providing technical research, support and training as necessary. The ideal candidate will have a hard time placing a title on their skill set because besides being a Perl rockstar, they are also revered as a Linux Engineer, have a very respectable amount of network knowledge, and are just as good at "putting out fires" as they are with developing new code.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:



  • Responsible for architecting, developing, and testing new web-based applications in Object Oriented Perl.

  • Improve, fix, and test production web-based applications in Object Oriented Perl.

  • Utilize MySQL and DBI for data storage and retrieval within Perl applications.

  • Make technical recommendations based upon the current production applications and future applications.

  • Discuss and clearly articulate complex technical topics with technical and non-technical staff, and occasionally customers.

  • Eager to interact with other teams and departments, as well as customer facing and commercial teams.

  • Perform other duties and special projects as needed and directed.



    • Required Job Skills:



  • Expert Perl programming experience.

  • Experience with relational databases and SQL.

  • Knowledge of HTML, JavaScript and CSS.

  • Systems/software development experience in a Linux and/or *nix environment.

  • Advanced Perl Scripting, threading, forking and object oriented concepts experience.

  • Source control (GIT, SVN, CVS, etc.) experience.

  • Knowledge of PC LOAD LETTER.

  • Good sense of humor.



    • Computer Equipment and Software:



  • Comprehensive technical knowledge of software, servers, workstations, and the internet in general is expected.



    • Education and Experience:



  • BS degree in Computer Science or equivalent technical schooling and/or work experience.

  • 5-10 years experience (additional certifications preferred).




    • Physical Demands:
    The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

    While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit, stand, walk, bend, use hands, operate a computer, and have specific vision abilities to include close and distance vision, and ability to adjust focus working with computer and business equipment.

    The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to 10 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move up to 100 pounds.
    ____________________________________________________


    A STRICT BACKGROUND INVESTIGATION AND DRUG TEST WILL BE REQUIRED OF ALL CANDIDATES IN ALL DEPARTMENTS.

    Competitive salary commensurate with experience.

    Benefits include a group health, dental and vision plan, long term disability and life insurance, 401(k) Plan, FSA, paid vacations and paid holidays.

    Apply online click here

    SUPERNAP - A Switch Company
    7135 South Decatur Blvd.
    Las Vegas, NV 89118



    SUPERNAP is an equal opportunity employer.

    Principals only please. Temporary or permanent placement recruiters, please don't contact this job poster. Please do not contact job poster about other services, products or commercial interests.

item.title: DevOps Engineer at INRIX (Kirkland, WA)
item.description:
INRIX (based in Kirkland, WA) is seeking a DevOps Engineer within our development team to help manage and drive operational systems, requirements and tool sets.  INRIX has numerous custom, complex systems running in our data centers to provide traffic and routing information. We are looking for someone who can take better control of our existing systems and infrastructure while helping to make decisions about new infrastructure and technologies to make it better.


The successful candidate will be a team player, capable of collaborating in a fast paced, devops oriented environment as well capable of working very independently with a high level of self-motivation.


Responsibilities:



  • Develop automation and processes to enable teams to deploy, manage, configure, scale and monitor their applications in data centers and in cloud

  • Actively participate in high level team activities such as suggesting architecture improvements, recommending process improvements and conducting tool evaluations

  • Help solve business needs with technology by evaluating different technology options and vendor products

  • System troubleshooting and problem solving across platform and application domains - will be expected to participate in on-call escalations to troubleshoot customer facing issues

  • Takes ownership of end-to-end solutions provided by teams across the organization

item.title: Security Engineer at Hotels.com (London, UK)
item.description:
The online travel market never stands still. The opportunity is huge and the competition is fierce. At Hotels.com, we're in the thick of it. We live and breathe travel. Our technology team is insanely passionate about using the best technology and processes to give our customers the best possible experience finding hotels for their business or leisure travel needs. We want them to feel the same passion for travel that we do.


Why build your career at Hotels.com?


 * You'll get to work with some spectacular people both from the technology team and wider business


 * We work hard to create a supportive, collaborative, and fulfilling place where you can progress your career


 * We have many of the best bits of a start-up but with the resources of the world's biggest travel company


 * We love open source and actively participate in the open source community


 * We win prizes (Netflix Cloud Prize for one)


 * We do hackathons where you can branch out of your usual area to contribute something different and innovative


 * We host and speak at meet ups


 * We want everyone on our team to have the tools and resources to succeed in their career


 * We get to do all of this in a lovely, comfortable office in a nice, central part of London


What we're looking for in you


 * We want you to come with passion, creativity, deep expertise, openness, flexibility and drive. Practicality and common sense are important to us.


 * We want you to be focused on moving the business forward. We don't just talk about security for the fun of it. We focus on how it matters to our customers and our business.


 * We want you to have a keen interest in the business, not just a given security topic. We want you to understand the big picture and how your work fits into it.


 * We want you to be excited the field of internet security like we are.


 * We want you to participate in the Hotels.com technology community, the wider Hotels.com team, and the wider security community around the world.


We live, eat, and breathe travel powered by technology. We work hard and play hard. We're never satisfied. We celebrate success and learn when we sometimes fall short.


Your job


Helping our business succeed through the power of data is a key priority across our business. In this role you'd be responsible for helping us achieve that by developing software to help us harness the power of the data available to us.


* Establish, maintain, and communicate Hotels.com security strategy.


* Establish and promote security best practices for developers, testers, and system administrators.


* Analyse security threats and propose strategic and tactical mitigation.


* Work with teams across Expedia, Inc. technology organisations on security related topics.


* Serve as primary owner for ongoing security audits.


* Manage vulnerability testing done on behalf of Hotels.com.


* Perform vulnerability testing when required.


* Manage and drive work related to obtaining and maintaining various security related certifications (i.e. PCI).


* Participate in architecture reviews to represent security concerns.



Your background


 * University degree or equivalent in computer science


 * Proven experience in security-related roles


 * Demonstrable knowledge of web technology


 * Prefer knowledge of Java development


 * Excellent verbal and written communication skills


 * Proven influencing and partnering skills


 * Proven organisational skills to manage security related remediation across functional teams


 * Excellent familiarity with common web security exploits and defences


 * Good system and network level knowledge


 * Knowledge of the Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI-DSS), TÜV SÜD s@fer-shopping, and SOX


 * Experience with enterprise level Security strategies


 * Experience with industry standard security tools from vendors like Fortify and Acunetix


 * Awareness of current and emerging industry best practices related to security


 * Familiarity with native mobile application security concerns

item.title: Software Engineer - Team Leader at Ontoit Holdings Ltd (London, UK)
item.description:
Ontoit is looking for an energetic and proactive Software Development Team Leader to lead the programming team responsible for developing all code underlying the Ontoit search engine platform. In this critical and exciting phase of Ontoit's growth, you will be an integral contributor in forming the future of our company.


At Ontoit, we work in various fields of computer science, including machine learning, natural language processing, graph technologies, knowledge representation (ontologies), distributed systems, and web applications. The core technologies that we use include, but is not limited to, Apache Storm, Neo4J, CoreNLP, Apache Spark, Apache Cassandra and Java Spring. As a Team Leader you will oversee the development from start to finish within all these fields. In conjunction with the CEO and key team members you will develop all technical specifications and be responsible for the delegation for tasks to team members. You will compile all technical documentation developed by the team and manage the overall code development process ensuring high quality, effectiveness and appropriateness of all code.


The role is expected to break down as approximately 20% Project/Team Management, 30% Quality Assurance, 50% Development.


The compensation for this position will be in the range of £40-55,000 per annum plus potentially equity options, all depending on the experience and skill level of the successful applicant.


Ontoit will accept applications for this position until 18th September, 2015.


Job responsibilities:



  • To develop high quality code for challenging algorithmic back end development

  • To help CEO plan and execute the process and delivery of development tasks in a custom Agile framework.

  • To help CEO review completed tasks from the development team and hold to a high standard of quality.

  • To help CEO manage task delivery timeline and expectations.

  • To help CEO maintain and apply policies and guidance of development workflow and processes.

  • To help CEO allocate work to individuals of the team based on assessment of each strengths and weaknesses.

  • To help CEO be a point of escalation for development issues within the team, making sure you are open and available to team members and take ownership of issues raised to you.

  • To help CEO carry out a mentoring and coaching role to team members in order to assist in their development.

  • To help CEO drive the development and direction of our scientific work in computer science related fields.

item.title: Engineering Manager at Tripwire (Portland, OR)
item.description:
About Tripwire


Why join us: IT security is in our DNA! With offices in Portland, San Francisco, Atlanta, London, Tokyo and counting, we have continued to grow by developing our products to meet the challenges posed by today’s threat heavy environment. Over 8,100 enterprises and government institutions worldwide, including 46% of the Fortune 500 rely on what we do to protect their critical IT infrastructure and sensitive data. We are passionate about your ongoing development and always making things better. Become a part of Tripwire, a team that brings out the best in you!


About Us: We are a leading global provider of risk-based security and compliance management solutions, enabling enterprises, government agencies and service providers to effectively connect security to their business. Tripwire provides the broadest set of foundational security controls including security configuration management, vulnerability management, file integrity monitoring, log and event management. Tripwire solutions deliver unprecedented visibility, business context and security business intelligence allowing extended enterprises to protect sensitive data from breaches, vulnerabilities, and threats. Learn more at www.tripwire.com or follow @TripwireInc on Twitter.




Job Summary


As a member of the Engineering Management team, this position will oversee a team of cross-functional engineers designing, developing and testing Tripwire’s flagship product, Tripwire Enterprise.  The value that the team delivers will sustain the product, support its large customer base and enhance the offering to meet the emerging needs of the information security market.


This position is responsible for supporting the engineering team through coaching, mentoring and adoption of strong working agreements and agile principles.  Successful candidates will have a leadership approach that empowers decision-making at all levels of the organization, focuses on removing impediments to team success, and holds individuals to high standards of craftsmanship, professionalism and execution.


This position will also provide value to the development of the organization, working to enhance engineering practices and drive continuous improvement toward efficient, innovative delivery.

item.title: Recommender Systems/Machine Learning for Connected Audio at Bose at Bose Corporation (Boston, MA)
item.description:
About The Team:

The Algorithms & Cloud Experiences group is a small interdisciplinary team that builds compelling cloud applications for connected Bose products. We participate in the full product/feature lifecycle: imagining new customer-facing features, designing compelling user interfaces, constructing appropriate software architecture and infrastructure, implementing compelling proofs of concept, and scaling our solutions to serve millions of users. Join us to invent and build exceptional experiences, beginning by helping millions of customers rediscover their love of music.

Job Description:


We are seeking a Machine Learning Specialist to expand our core team. In this role, you will be responsible for the algorithms that underlie the experiences we create. You will apply your practical experience dealing with messy data, your deep understanding of machine learning fundamentals and algorithms, your willingness to write code to explore problems and understand data, and your ability to implement solutions from scratch, all while solving challenging real-world problems at large scale. Example problem spaces include contextual music recommendations, playlist generation, and clickstream prediction, but those are just to get you started.


Objectives:



  • Within the first month, gain a broad understanding of the algorithms used in our existing products and prototypes. Gain familiarity with our existing data sets.

  • Within the first three months, develop a fleshed out plan for implementing and testing the first versions of a handful of (already imagined) feature concepts. Demonstrate initial proof of concept of at least one new feature. In collaboration with other team members, outline a plan for building a scalable implementation.

  • At the end of the first six months, demonstrate end-to-end proof of concept of at least one customer-facing feature. Be an active participant in the conception of new feature concepts.


Please take a few minutes to insert a cover letter when you apply! We truly value candidates who take a few extra minutes to give us a clear understanding of what makes you 'tick'. Tell us whatever you think is most important. If you're not sure how to start, here are some ideas:



  • What technologies would you most like to use and/or learn about at Bose?

  • What are the 3 most important things you're looking for in a career at any company?

  • Tell us something about you to help us understand why you are unique.

item.title: Cloud/DevOps Engineer for Connected Audio at Bose at Bose Corporation (Boston, MA)
item.description:
About The Team:

The Algorithms & Cloud Experiences group is a small interdisciplinary team that builds compelling cloud applications for connected Bose products. We participate in the full product/feature lifecycle: imagining new customer-facing features, designing compelling user interfaces, constructing appropriate software architecture and infrastructure, implementing compelling proofs of concept, and scaling our solutions to serve millions of users. Join us to invent and build exceptional experiences, beginning by helping millions of customers rediscover their love of music.

Job Description:

We are seeking a cloud engineer to expand our core team. In this role, you will be responsible for the architecture, implementation, and scalability of our cloud services. The ideal candidate will be comfortable choosing the appropriate technology underpinnings, defining the end-to-end architecture, configuring the full stack through DevOps techniques, managing the data, and working with Application and Algorithm specialists to ensure the system’s scalability and performance. The ideal candidate is a cloud native, deeply familiar with handling computationally heavy workloads using Infrastructure-as-a-Service solutions.

Please take a few minutes to insert a cover letter when you apply! We truly value candidates who take a few extra minutes to give us a clear understanding of what makes you 'tick'. Tell us whatever you think is most important. If you're not sure how to start, here are some ideas:

• What technologies would you most like to use and/or learn about at Bose?

• What are the 3 most important things you're looking for in a career at any company?

• Tell us something about you to help us understand why you are unique.

item.title: Web Developer at FTI Consulting (New York, NY)
item.description:
ABOUT THE OPPORTUNITY:
A Web Developer is responsible for providing support and web application development as they relate to litigation, dispute resolution or financial investigations. He/she will assist businesses, government entities and law firms in complex, application development requiring the understanding of relationships between various information sources, complex modeling or information sharing.


PRIMARY DUTIES:
As a Web Developer, you will develop in-depth knowledge of your clients' objectives and challenges in order to design and implement innovative strategies to assist them through their current difficulties and prepare them for the future. Responsibilities will include, but will not be limited to, the following:


• Identifying the relationships among multiple sources and types of data, and organizing this information to facilitate effective data analysis.
• Designing, creating, and implementing client centric web applications.
• Analyze, code, and test simple to moderate modules (both new and changes to existing programs) from design specifications.
• Learn existing applications and design new tools to improve processes.


BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:
• Minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field.
• 3+ years of Web Application development.
• Experience working in a team orientated environment.


REQUIRED SKILLS:
• Proficient in Object Oriented Programming
• Proficient in MySQL, PostgreSQL, t-SQL, PL/SQL, or other relational database query language.
• Proficient in .NET, Java, Python, PHP or Ruby.
• Experience with MVC frameworks such as Laravel, Django, Rails, or Zend
• Proficient in Javascript, HTML5 and CSS3
• Experience with version control systems such as Git, SVN or Mercurial
• Able to work in a team as well as independently.
• Able to adapt quickly in handling multiple/evolving tasks as a result of new engagements and/or re-prioritized deadlines.
• Highly motivated, hard-working, eager to learn, and able to motivate others.
• Able to regularly communicate status (to both internal and external clients).
• Able to produce high quality and/or final work product under strict deadlines.


PREFERRED SKILLS:
• Proficient in Node.js, Phantom.js, jQuery, Prototype.js, AngularJS, Bootstrap
• Proficient in Linux and Apache
• Experience with Agile principles and test-driven development (TDD)
• Experience with APIs.
• Proficient in a relational data modeling.
• Familiar with Oracle Application Express (APEX).
• Flexibility to provide night and weekend coverage when requested.


POSITION CLASSIFICATION: Exempt
FTI Consulting is an Equal Opportunity Employer

item.title: Javascript Engineer to help disrupt software security at Codiscope (Boston, MA)
item.description:
There’s incredible excitement and urgency around developing secure software.  But today’s security tools are unwieldy and expensive to implement, fit poorly in modern agile development processes, and often simply pile up bugs of questionable value.  We’re disrupting software security by replacing assessment tools with development tools that build security into software as it’s developed. We scale secure development in today’s app focused, DevOps centric, continuous deployment world.


As a Senior Software Engineer, you will help our users understand the impact that our products are having in their organization. You will transform mountains of data into actionable insight. You will tackle challenges to deliver blazing fast performance, scale through a microservices architecture, and drive new data storage solutions like NoSQL. You will play a prominent role in our small but strongly backed company and you’ll help accelerate our success.


Responsibilities:



  • Redesigning and transitioning our legacy J2EE application stack towards a MEAN stack

  • Helping move our product to a SaaS model addressing features such as multi-tenancy, streaming

  • Manage for performance and flexibility in distributed architectures

  • Being a strong communicator with ability to coordinate and follow-up aggressively

  • Conducting technical evaluations of new JS frameworks and plugins

  • Conducting code reviews

  • Mentor and develop junior engineers

item.title: CTO - Data Scientist w/ AWS + financial data expertise at Quadrant (New York, NY)
item.description:
Quadrant builds innovative tools to find, visualize, and analyze data. We are looking for an in-house CTO + Data Scientist with strong AWS and financial data experience. You will be a core member of a founding team in a small office. Great communication and adherence to very high standards is essential.


We're building an industry-leading platform for querying, analyzing, scaling and distributing time series data. The CTO must be fluent in large-scale data processing using AWS services. Words that shouldn't scare you include partitioned tables, automated testing, Amazon Aurora, Cloudflare, recommendation engines. You must also like building things that have never been built before.


Our clients include large banks, asset managers, hedge funds.


Qualified candidates will be:



  • Intellectually curious & competent

  • Speed and Security focused

  • Experienced in implementing best practices and techniques

  • Organized

  • Able to design & implement high-performance systems

item.title: Node / Javascript Engineer at Weight Watchers (New York, NY)
item.description:
Uniquely positioned to lead the way in the exciting HealthTech industry, Weight Watchers uses modern Lean and Agile practices as well as best of breed Engineering practices to deliver leading consumer focused products. Weight Watchers places a major emphasis on mobile and digital solutions to help our members reach their goals. This includes integrating with technologies such as Fitbit & iOS Health, as well as building custom, intuitive products to serve our millions of members.

As we rebuild many of our core experiences, we are seeking talented people who are excited to join our team. This is a rare opportunity to join a company embracing a modern Technology culture, where you will have the ability to improve peoples lives in a very meaningful way and have a major impact on Weight Watchers offerings to our members. As reliance on health and wellness awareness increases, you can be be part of the team that is leading the way.

To help us achieve our goals, we are seeking Node Software Engineers to join our team. You will leverage your knowledge to develop new consumer focused products using modern Engineering such as Continuous Integration and Deployment. As a developer at Weight Watcher, your code, designs and decisions will be highly visible, and will directly impact and delight lots of users.

item.title: Android Developer - Sling TV at Sling TV (American Fork, UT)
item.description:
Summary:


Television is at an inflection point. New technologies and businesses are rapidly evolving and reshaping how we watch TV. We are Sling TV, an OTT (over-the-top) TV service that delivers live U.S. and international programming, as well as video on demand, over the Internet. We are seeking a Software Engineer to join our American Fork, Utah - based team. This is an exciting position in a fast moving project that requires the ability of candidates to hit the ground running. What we’re building is revolutionary and every employee participates in a profit sharing program. Come be a part of changing the face of TV!


Sling TV delivers content from Disney/ESPN, HBO, AMC, Turner, Scripps, EPIX, Univision and Maker Studios, and is available on Amazon Fire TV, Amazon Fire TV Stick, current-generation Roku players, Roku TV models, Xbox One, Android, iOS, Macs, PCs.


#TakeBackTV


Responsibilities:


Working as part of a team to deliver a great television experience on a myriad of devices ranging from televisions and set top boxes to mobile devices. Primary responsibility is to improve our Android application, while also identifying techniques to simplify complexity and redundancy across the application. The ideal candidate has a history of developing elegant and intuitive user experiences on a variety of platforms, and knows what separates mediocre user experience from great ones.

item.title: Site Reliability Engineer at Ping Identity (Denver, CO)
item.description:
As a Ping Identity SRE, you will be involved in every facet of our On-Demand SaaS services. From conceptual design of interconnected sub-systems to network design, platform testing and analysis, security policy, service troubleshooting, and application performance. Ping SREs own responsibility for application performance, monitoring, and adherence to SLAs. Everything needs to just work, all the time... and you’re the one who’s responsible. If things need to get fixed in the middle of the night, you’re the one to get it done.


Working within the DevOps Team, you’ll be expected wear many hats. From first responder to performance analysis, system architect, capacity planning and monitoring support. Our DevOps team is fully integrated and running continuous deployments daily. SREs are expected to provide input wherever possible in the product’s development, deployment and design.

Responsibilities:



  • Linux systems administration, configuration, troubleshooting and automation.

  • Experience with virtualization platforms such as VMware, Xen, KVM and public cloud resources such as AWS or Rackspace Cloud.

  • Analysis of complex system behavior, performance and application issues.

  • Development of monitoring solutions and analysis across multiple data centers.

  • Capacity analysis and planning, traffic routing, and security policies for Ping’s market leading Single Sign-On SaaS applications.

  • Develop, maintain and administration of cutting-edge infrastructure deployment tools.

  • This is a 24/7 on-call position with a rotation schedule. You’re expected to jump out of bed to fix stuff when it’s down.

item.title: Software Engineer, Insights Applications (Contractor) at Red Bull Media House (Santa Monica, CA)
item.description:
Red Bull Media House is building a program to deliver a new level of actionable insights around online conversations and engagement that can be used to better inform business decisions across marketing, media and digital teams. The development of a proprietary social analytics and insights reporting platform aims to translate and distill large volumes of data into an accessible understanding of target audience whereabouts, affinities, behavior and trends. These insights will be used to influence major innovation initiatives as well as decisions related to athlete sponsorships, music artist partnerships, video and film projects, events, digital product functionality, editorial planning, brand campaigns, media and marketing solutions among many others.


 The Software Engineer within the Red Bull Digital Analytics & Insights group is responsible for the implementation and maintenance of the various software products and tools required to drive global Red Bull Digital Analytics & Insights platform and business operations including analytics and insights reporting, UX configuration and construction, user management, marketing and advertising.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer, Android Team at TripAdvisor (Boston, MA)
item.description:
TripAdvisor, the world’s largest travel site, is looking for a talented senior software engineer in the native Android team. In this role, you'll be a driving force in the Android team. You will take the lead on key technical features, help others in the team with the harder problems, work closely with product on specs, and interface with the API and iOS teams to take the app to the next level. We iterate and deploy code fast, and everyone is looking at the impact that the team makes to our numbers.


We're rocketing up the hockey stick, playing with the coolest toys, and working on interesting problems that engage both the technical and aesthetic sides of the brain. We move quickly - projects are short (generally 3-7 days), and we have a new native release every month. The features you create will be used by millions of people every day. Trip is well known for having an extremely strong engineering organization - you'll be working with the best and getting stuff done, in the fastest growing area of an incredibly profitable, growing, fun company. Download our Android app and give it a spin!


The Facts


* Our apps are used around the world and have been download over 100 million times


* TripAdvisor has well over 100 million average monthly mobile unique visitors, which is doubling year-over-year


* We have over 3 million unique users / engineer, among the highest in the industry


* As mobile devices are replacing desktops and laptops as the standard for browsing the web, we have a unique opportunity as well as the market position to capitalize on enormous monetization potential


You Will


* Design complex systems and lead the technical solution of projects


* Work closely with our product and design teams to define feature specifications


* Be responsible for the code quality on your team


* Mentor more junior developers


* Develop, deploy and maintain the consumer-facing features of the TripAdvisor native Android App


* Be responsible for all aspects of software engineering, from design to implementation, QA and maintenance.
