item.title: Software Engineer C#/.Net at WheelRight Ltd (Oxford, UK)
item.description:
Developer – C# / .Net required to join a ground breaking technology company to develop innovative new products for the global marketplace. The business is expanding rapidly and requires dynamic developers to join the development team. As part of the team they would be responsible for a wide range of tasks from researching and recommending new methods of implementation through to coding and testing new software.


The WheelRight systems are designed using a combination of software, hardware and mechanical designs working together. This is an opportunity to be involved in the capture and processing of real-time data along with back end database design and customer interface development.


Work is in progress on the development of new products involving the use of image processing techniques. Opportunities exist for new engineers to be involved with the development of algorithms in this field. With a growing customer base there is also an increasing demand for software developers within the team to support differing user interface requirements.


This role is based in Oxfordshire.  Applicants must have existing permission to work in the UK.

item.title: Front End Developer at Spin Systems, Inc. (Fairfax, VA) (allows remote)
item.description:
In addition to being an extraordinary engineer, we want a team member who is passionate on wearing different hats in a small product team:  designing new features, making good product decisions, writing bullet proof code, programming at all levels of the application stack, and contributing to the design of beautiful user interfaces.  We would like you to have most of the following skills prior to joining our team.  If you think you’re missing one or two skills, you can make up for it with passion, attention to detail, a collaborative attitude, a willingness to learn -- and we’ll teach you the rest when you arrive.


Responsibilities



  • Participate in all phases of the system development lifecycle including creating technical designs, program code, test plans, and verifying test results. Apply reusable code design and design patterns in a test driven development environment

  • Develop technical design documentation based on functional design specifications and implement solutions using object oriented programming techniques

  • Work as part of a team of developers (user-interface, middle tier business logic, data access) and application architects interfacing with business analysts, database developers, infrastructure architects, and quality assurance testers to ensure the successful delivery of an integrated solution meeting the needs of the business.

  • Provide development estimates for implementation and project plans

  • Review applications in all phases of development to ensure adherence to development standards.

  • Research, recommend, and adopt best practices and design patterns for development.


 Qualifications



  • A Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, or a similar science and engineering discipline, and a minimum of 3 years of progressive post-graduate experience. 

  • 3+ years as a professional engineer, building and maintaining web applications from concept to production.

  • Fluent with the core of our current technology: HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, and jQuery.

  • SharePoint 2013 administration and/or development experience using NCSS (No Code Sandbox Solutions) or SharePoint 2013 App Model is a very strong plus but not required.

  • Proven skills developing RESTful and oData services using C#.

  • Experience in writing complex SQL queries and executing SQL, TSQ, PL/SQL scripts using ADO.NET against MS SQL Server and Oracle databases.

  • Strong object oriented design skills and familiarity with n-tier applications and Service Oriented Architecture.

  • Preference given to candidates exposed to test driven development and agile software methodologies such as SCRUM and XP

  • US Citizens only, Secret Clearance required.


 EOE/M/F/D/V.  We participate in E-Verify

item.title: Software Engineer- iOS at Sling TV (American Fork, UT)
item.description:
Summary: Television is at an inflection point. New technologies and businesses are rapidly evolving and reshaping how we watch TV. We are Move Networks, makers of Sling TV, an OTT (over-the-top) TV service that delivers live U.S. and international programming, as well as video on demand, over the Internet. We are seeking a Senior Software Engineer to join our American Fork, Utah - based team. This is an exciting position in a fast moving project that requires the ability of candidates to hit the ground running. What we’re building is revolutionary and every employee participates in a profit sharing program. Come be a part of changing the face of TV!


Responsibilities:


You will be responsible for the software design, implementation, and maintenance of one or more of our client platforms that include smart televisions, set top boxes, mobile phones and tablets, desktop and laptop computers, and other consumer devices.


You will have a history of developing elegant and intuitive user experiences on a variety of platforms, and know what separates mediocre user experience from great ones. Collaborating with the team, UX designers, and product management, you will create an innovative UI experience optimized for your platforms.

item.title: Software Engineer Python Specialist Job Ref 19 at First Light Fusion Ltd (Begbroke, UK)
item.description:
Vacancy Specification


First Light Fusion is seeking a Python engineer to join our cutting-edge numerical team that is developing a set of tools for the prediction and analysis of inertial confinement fusion. We have built a multiple-fluid compressible flow solver from the ground-up that brings together heavily templated C++ for performance and Python for user interaction.


Our toolset makes extensive use of third party libraries such as CGAL (www.cgal.org), OpenVDB (www.openvdb.org), VTK (www.vtk.org), and boost::python for wrapping. Work is coordinated through github and organised through agile best practices, including test driven development where appropriate. The successful candidate will engage with the existing technical program, while also providing leadership for the Python components of development, including architectural decisions.


Additionally, we continue to develop a library of Python code to process in-house experimental data. The successful candidate will contribute to the architecture and quality-control of the diagnostic tools in this ever expanding code base. It is anticipated that this stream of work will involve significant time in close collaboration with the experimental team, for example engaging in pair programming.


Benefits


A competitive package, opportunity to participate in the company’s share option scheme, and relocation expenses.


How to apply


Please upload a covering letter / supporting statement and CV to www.firstlightfusion.com/careers quoting the job reference. We will commence interviewing candidates on 30th September 2015 and the post will remain open until filled. Two referees should be available on request.


Informal enquiries may also be addressed to careers@firstlightfusion.com. 


CVs sent by recruitment agencies will not be read, and in the event that the company receives a CV from both the direct applicant and a recruitment agency the CV will be treated as a direct application by the individual only. Unsolicited contact from Recruitment agencies will be disregarded. 


We are an equal opportunities employer. This role will be subject to background checks.

item.title: Manager, Software Development at Amazon (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
Amazon strives to be the world’s most customer-centric company, where customers can research and purchase anything they might want online. We set big goals and are looking for people who can help us reach and exceed them. Kindle is the best-selling product in the history of Amazon.com and our team is responsible for providing the best shopping experience for all the Amazon.com devices and accessories including Kindles, Tablets, Echo, Fire T.V. and much more. We are the most innovative and fastest growing businesses at Amazon. You should be passionate about customer experience and think it’s fun to utilize, extend, and invent Amazon’s AWS technology. This critical role will continue to build on the current success by leading a software development team responsible for multiple aspects of the Devices and Accessories store. We are looking for a proven, hands on, results-oriented Software Development Manager to lead a team that will build the future experience for our customers, who are looking for the best product and accessories to meet their needs.



In this role you will be responsible for:

  • Hiring, leading, mentoring a world-class engineering team

  • Working effectively with product managers, designers, and business teams to deliver the best overall experience factoring in financial goals and usability goals

  • Working closely with engineers to architect and develop the best technical design and approach

  • Establishing a consistent, scalable engineering framework and excellent development processes

  • Owning and report on status of development, quality, technical operations, and system performance




  • A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related field is required.

  • Deep understanding of computer science fundamentals (data structures, algorithms and programming languages, messaging and asynchronous architectures)

  • A track record of great hiring of technical team members and leaders

  • Minimum 6 years of software development experience

  • Minimum 3 years of people management experience

  • Track record of building quality software and operating services delivering high quality, performance and availability.

  • Experience working effectively across functional teams

  • Ability to achieve stretch goals in a highly innovative and fast-paced environment

  • Ability to communicate and discuss software components in simple, general terms with business partners and in great detail with software development engineers

  • Strong sense of ownership, urgency, drive, independence, and flexibility

  • Analytical approach to problem solving and a track record of driving results through continuous improvement

  • Ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously and proficiency at leveraging precious resources

  • Composed, poised and professional demeanor




  • High attention to detail and proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously

  • Composed, poised and professional demeanor

  • Willingness to roll up one’s sleeves to get the job done

  • Well-timed tenacity and conviction

  • Vocally self-critical

item.title: TECHNICAL BUSINESS ANALYST at GroupeSTAHL (Sterling Heights, MI)
item.description:
Position Summary



The Technical Business Analyst collects, documents, and maintains the authoritative list of requirements for all development efforts.  The Technical Business Analyst is accountable for the functional design and adherence to corporate software development methodologies, as well as coordination across all technical resources throughout the lifecycle of a software development project.  Secondary responsibilities include creation and maintenance of various types of documents, testing support and assisting in project management/delivery activities. The Technical Business Analyst drives the collaboration with business area(s), IS, and technology to ensure that requirements are gathered and communicated effectively in order to meet the clearly defined system objectives.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities


- Responsible for defining and managing the scope of Business Systems projects.


- Track projects, timelines and ensures execution of the Technology Projects.


- Defines functional, usability, reliability, performance and support QA requirements of a system.


- Creates and performs feature testing and determines environmental needs.


- Provides the link between the technical and business views of the system by ensuring that the technical solutions being developed will satisfy the needs of the business.


- Partners with business, architecture and infrastructure and oversees all service levels to ensure business area satisfaction.


- Defines development strategy, standards and support tools.


- Proactively works with stakeholders to identify future system opportunities and enhancements.

item.title: Junior to Mid Level Front End Developer - Java, Angular, JSON APIs, and Web Serv at Fidelity (Durham, NC)
item.description:
The Fidelity Institutional Technology group at Fidelity Investments has an exceptional opportunity for a Software Developer / Engineer. This role will participate in the design, development, implementation and support of mission critical trading focused web applications and financial tools. Under moderate supervision, conduct the analysis, design and development of software to support a robust trading and supporting platform, contributing to the overall success of projects as they move through the different phases of the project life cycle. 


Your knowledge will be called upon to meet guidelines and standards that will allow our team to continue to deliver important and vital solutions for our customers.  Our projects involve developing functions and tools used by Registered Investment Advisors (RIAs) and Correspondents.  Our web applications use modular JavaScript frameworks (such as Angular, Backbone, etc.), JSON APIs, Java and Web Services.  You should be able to understand technical designs at the application level, define strategies and work closely with fellow developers.  You must be able to describe problems and recommend solutions to project leaders.  You must have great communication skills, be a team player, and have an aptitude for learning new technologies.


Primary Responsibilities



  • Designing, developing, and implementing web applications in a dynamic financial services environment

  • Contributing effectively at many different points in a project life cycle as an individual contributor

  • Adhering to project timelines, addressing and resolving technical issues

  • Coordinating functional/technical group discussions with analysts and developers under moderate supervision

  • Delivering on both projects and support tasks in a dynamic environment

  • Developing concise and clear technical design documents based on analysis of business requirements

item.title: Principal Software Engineer at Minted (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
About Minted:


Minted is a design marketplace that connects you to the world’s best independent artists to create something one-of-a-kind. Minted’s unique crowdsourced model represents a modern marketplace – one where the community decides what goods are showcased and sold. This model ensures fresh, on-trend designs are continuously being added to Minted. Our community of independent artists and designers spans 48 states and 43 countries. Our art, stationery, and textiles products have reached over 40 million homes worldwide. Minted is funded by Benchmark Capital, IDG Ventures, Menlo Ventures, Technology Crossover Ventures, and Norwest Venture Partners, along with angels Marissa Mayer, CEO of Yahoo!, Jeremy Stoppelman, CEO of Yelp, and Yishan Wong, former CEO of Reddit. We are headquartered in San Francisco, CA. 


About the Role:


Minted is seeking a talented principal software developer with a strong vision who is looking for the opportunity to express that vision across Minted.  You’ll help design and implement a top tier 1 ecommerce platform, helping it scale 100x beyond its current load. You will develop your vision and teach our talented engineering team how to build it while enabling independent artist all over the world to bring their talent to consumers.


Specific Responsibilities:




  • Create strong object oriented designs, both for module and service level interactions




  • Serve as a technical lead on our most demanding, cross-functional projects.




  • Consistently create clean code and teach best practices to junior engineers




  • Dive deep understanding our complex eCommerce systems to derive root causes and propose fundamental changes




  • Design both large and small changes to existing software, and decide which is needed




  • This is a startup!  You will get lots of opportunity to show off your design skills in a large and complex environment with great growth potential




  • Find operational problems through dashboards and alarming.




  • Prove success of projects with metrics and reporting




  • Work with a minimum of technical supervision and supplemental engineering support, while responding efficiently to multiple program priorities




  • Effectively research and benchmark Minted’s technology against other competing systems in the industry




  • Contribute intellectual property through patents.

item.title: Assistant Vice President, Application Developer Consultant, at State Street (Boston, MA)
item.description:
This role is part of/in support of the Office of Regulatory Initiatives (ORI); ORI was created to manage complex enterprise risk issues, often spanning multiple functions and businesses. ORI is focused on the areas of Capital Planning and Stress Testing; AML; Liquidity; Credit Risk Management; Legal and Compliance Reputational Risk Management; Interest Rate Risk, Volcker Rule, IT.

This position is for a Senior Developer working on multiple Risk and Regulatory related initiatives. The position requires a strong background in application development, a good understanding of leading IT technologies in particular J2EE, RDBMS and Web Development. The person in this role will be completely hands-on and will work with cross-functional teams. The work will require a candidate to be competent in all aspects of the software development lifecycle. 

The candidate must be able to work independently with moderate input from his/her manager. The candidate must be able to multi-task in a faced paced environment while producing detailed and accurate output. The candidate must be energetic, eager to learn and embrace change.

item.title: API/Backend Developer - Mobile Apps at Avvo, Inc. (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
We’re looking for great software developers to help us connect people with the legal help they need.


As an API / Backend Developer, you’ll build fast, easy-to-use APIs to help our Mobile team ship remarkable apps. You’ll bridge between our iOS, web, and platform teams, and help us unlock new ways to bring our data to other apps and devices.


About the Team:



  • We mostly run on Rails, but have brought in technologies like Go, Angular.js, Scala, and Sinatra. We’re open to using the right technologies for what we build.

  • We iterate quickly, and ship multiple times a day.

  • We work in small teams with product managers and designers, and help shape the products we’ll be building from day 1.

  • We have a strong tradition of supporting open source. Projects like resque_scheduler, robut, resque_unit, and jsonapiclient were all extracted from our codebase, and we’ve contributed several patches back to Rails.


Why Avvo?


Right now, you have an opportunity to join the team while it’s still on the small side, and grow your career faster than you would at almost any other company. You’ll be able to help shape our dev organization and define our culture.


Companies in our position are rare, and joining a company like ours will be one of the most memorable parts of your life.

item.title: Infrastructure Architect at Exaptive (Oklahoma City, OK)
item.description:
Exaptive, Inc is an MIT affiliated, fast-growing software startup that has offices in Oklahoma City, Boston and Vancouver, Canada. We are now expanding our Oklahoma City team. 

We are looking for an infrastructure architect that has experience designing complex web-application architectures, is familiar with a wide variety of technologies, and knows how to pick the right technology for the job. Exaptive is more than just a data analytics platform. It's a complete ecosystem for data science - that means it is comprised of a bunch of different pieces that all have to work together. There is the web-based development environment, the Xap Store, and the Cognitive Network. Each component introduces its own set of infrastructure requirements. In addition, we have a consulting branch of the business which sometimes needs infrastructure design decisions in response to unique custom client requirements. 

This position will be based in downtown OKC, but with the opportunity for travel to Exaptive's Boston and Vancouver locations. The position will have the opportunity to evolve into a role in which the person has an equity-stake in the company. The right person will be excited about the dynamic and fast-paced (aka stressful) environment of a startup and view that as a benefit, not a drawback. The startup environment is not for everyone, but for the person who is looking for that sort of life experience, the opportunity to help build something from the ground up where individual contributions make immediate and substantial impacts on the company as a whole can be extremely rewarding. 

Those interested can find out more about the company, and view some demo videos of our software in actionon our website: www.exaptive.com. We were featured on the front page of the Business Innovation section of The Boston Globe (http://www.boston.com/business/technology/innoeco/2013/12/cambridge-based_exaptive_wants.html) and in Oklahoma City's The Journal Record (http://www.i2e.org/news/innovators-exaptive-inc/). Our Founder and CEO, Dave King, has been invited internationally to present our work. You can see a video of a presentation he recently gave to the Oklahoma Venture Forum about Exaptive's big-picture vision on our website. 

If you don't currently live in Oklahoma City, you should check out what this up-and-coming city has to offer: a burgeoning tech startup and creative sector, the largest food truck event in the nation, olympic rowing facilities, and a cost of living that can't be beat. For the right candidate we'll pay relocation costs.

item.title: Software Engineering Manager at Amazon (Dallas, TX)
item.description:
Why are Software Engineers important at Amazon?



At Amazon, we hire the best minds in technology to innovate and build for the benefit of our customers. That intense focus on customers is why we are one of the world’s most beloved brands – it’s part of our company DNA.



Our challenges are big - impacting millions of Consumers, Sellers, Content Creators, and Developers & Enterprises through countless products – and we are searching for a certain kind of person who is excited by the idea of owning; people who like to build new platforms, features and services from scratch, developers who can manage the ambiguity and pace of a company whose ship cycles are measured in weeks, not years.

We speak multiple languages, working on multiple platforms to solve immensely complex challenges in large-scale computing by using your skills in data structures, algorithms, and object oriented programming. We have a variety of teams to choose from; our opportunities are broader than you might think. You could find yourself working on a small development team in one of our many organizations: Advertising, Amazon Customer Service, Amazon Web Services, Business & Corporate Development, Digital Entertainment, eCommerce Platform, Fulfillment and Operations, Global Corporate Teams, Amazon Devices, Retail, Search and Discovery Technology, Seller Services, or Amazon Subsidiaries.
Amazon is a place where builders build.



What are examples of work that Software Engineers are doing at Amazon?

· Powered companies from Netflix to NASA: Amazon Web Services has provided companies of all sizes with an infrastructure platform in the cloud that powers hundreds of thousands of businesses in 190 countries around the world. Here at AWS, you’ll experience unparalleled ownership and impact on our product development, and be empowered to innovate and deliver.



· Built the Amazon Devices experience: We have gone beyond Kindle, our best-selling e-reader to our powerhouse Fire tablets, built for work and play with our Fire OS operating system. For streaming media lovers, we have created Amazon Fire TV and Fire TV Stick with voice search, massive video selection, and gaming. Exploring new solutions with products such as Amazon Echo, a new category of device designed around your voice with far-field voice recognition, and Amazon Dash, a handheld scanner to help you order groceries from Amazon Fresh.



· We help users find what they want: Amazon Search and Discovery helps hundreds of millions of shoppers spending tens of billions of dollars annually find what they want, get what they need, and discover what they'll love. We are innovators who love to experiment and are obsessed with letting customers tell us what works. We are obsessed with automation, and leverage technologies and massive amounts of data and machine learning to delight our customers. Work on Prime Air, Prime Now, or other customer solutions to help us define the future.

item.title: Full Stack Development Engineer at Groupon International (, )
item.description:
Groupon are seeking experienced full stack developers to work in our Dublin office to design and build high-scale, web and mobile e-commerce applications that run non-stop around the globe. We work in small, independent and collaborative teams to architect massively scalable and reliable systems.  As part of our Dublin technology team, you'll use a variety of technologies and development practices to build pioneering local commerce applications used by hundreds of millions of people.

You'd be a great fit for this position if you're comfortable working with a small team, rapidly iterating a multi-component software stack and taking the initiative to add great new features that we haven't even dreamed up yet. Come help us build and power our rapidly growing international e-commerce platform!


Awesome things you will be doing!


You will work on our Ruby on Rail and Node.js e-commerce platform (similar architecture to Groupon I-tier) while delivering superior mobile and desktop user experiences.


We are producing high quality cross-browser and cross-platform code as we maintain high quality and test coverage while adding new functionality. 


We certainly work in an agile environment so we would like you to research and champion new innovative open-source technologies and frameworks and because you will be an awesome candidate we know you will embrace mentoring junior developers on technical issues and modern web development best practices.


No country is the same and we, the local extensions team, know this better than most.  Most of our time we spend touching multiple code bases to provide that one feature a country can't live without.  If you're interested in touching many code bases or get bored from spending forever on the same project, this position is made for you.

We traverse the links from frontend to backend, sometimes multiple backends.  We're exposed to lots of different code bases, encountering most languages under the sun, usually in code, but sometimes in speech too.  Would you like to be a part of us?

item.title: Full Stack .NET Web Developer at Frontpoint (Vienna, VA)
item.description:
Are you seeking the freedom to creatively solve interesting problems while also engineering something that genuinely makes a difference? Join the company that brought technological advancement to the home security industry!


We’re looking for a full stack .NET Web Developer to join our awesome development team.This is a fast paced, enterprise scale, B2C environment. Our developers build software for all components of the organization. This involves heavy front-end web development for systems that are both internally and externally facing, integration with back-end third party APIs, analytical services, & tons of data. We have awesome tools at our disposal like the latest Visual Studio, Resharper, the RedGate SQL Bundle, top-notch hardware setups.  We use the latest versions of all our tools and do our best to keep up with the rapid evolution of javascript and other front-end frameworks.


 If you like a start-up culture without the start-up risk, you’ll love working at Frontpoint! 


Responsibilities:



  • Write tons of code across the full stack – front end Web UI, middle tier service layer, and back end database

  • Perform analysis of requirements and design

  • Create and execute unit tests and perform basic systems testing

  • Participate in peer code reviews and technical meetings

  • Mentor lower-level engineers in coding practices and process

  • Work in an Agile Scrum team process, collaborating closely with fellow developers, DBAs, QA, team leads, and stakeholders

  • Troubleshoot and support system and application problems

item.title: Be a hero in helping us solve complex Big Data problems! at kCura (Portland, OR)
item.description:
The Sr. Software Engineer (Portland) is responsible for delivering results for the Product Development department by:


• Contributing to an Agile team that solves complex challenges and builds working software


• Rapidly producing high quality code • Being a dependable and highly skilled development resource for peers


The Sr. Software Engineer performs the following functions, in addition to others, in the administration of their position:


• Documents and demonstrates solutions by developing documentation, flowcharts, layouts, diagrams, charts, code comments and clear code.


• Prepares and installs solutions by determining and designing system specifications, standards, and programming.


• Improves operations by conducting systems analysis, recommending changes in policies and procedures.


• Encourages pair programming and collaborative design


• Thinks out loud- Consistently communicates ideas to others


• Provides development expertise to team members  through education and review


• Always open to new ideas and encourages innovative practices amongst peers


• Works collaboratively with QA professionals to encourage defect prevention over detection


• May be required to handle technical support calls after hours about two times a year. If Client Services is working on a ticket and they are not able to solve an urgent issue, they will reach out to the level I developer to assist to get the issue resolved.


In addition to the above responsibilities, the Senior Software Engineer is expected to display professionalism in the following ways:


• Maintain an attitude of commitment through outward display of willingness


• Practice positive interactions - lean on encouragement in place of judgment


• Impress responsibility on others by displaying ownership in tasks


• Act in the best interest of the overall team

item.title: C# Developer at Best Lawyers (Aiken, SC)
item.description:
Best Lawyers is seeking a C# Developer for a new interactive legal platform, built on the foundation of our 35 years as the most respected legal peer review network. The primary role will be to develop and support an API infrastructure for this initiative. The developer will also be challenged to maintain, improve, and create new features in an ever-changing environment while ensuring stability and site performance.


We are seeking a passionate developer looking to join a strong team. We need a proud problem solver, constant learner, and a continuous contributor to the team IQ level.

item.title: Software Engineering Manager at Amazon (Boston, MA)
item.description:
Why are Software Engineers important at Amazon?



At Amazon, we hire the best minds in technology to innovate and build for the benefit of our customers. That intense focus on customers is why we are one of the world’s most beloved brands – it’s part of our company DNA.



Our challenges are big - impacting millions of Consumers, Sellers, Content Creators, and Developers & Enterprises through countless products – and we are searching for a certain kind of person who is excited by the idea of owning; people who like to build new platforms, features and services from scratch, developers who can manage the ambiguity and pace of a company whose ship cycles are measured in weeks, not years.

We speak multiple languages, working on multiple platforms to solve immensely complex challenges in large-scale computing by using your skills in data structures, algorithms, and object oriented programming. We have a variety of teams to choose from; our opportunities are broader than you might think. You could find yourself working on a small development team in one of our many organizations: Advertising, Amazon Customer Service, Amazon Web Services, Business & Corporate Development, Digital Entertainment, eCommerce Platform, Fulfillment and Operations, Global Corporate Teams, Amazon Devices, Retail, Search and Discovery Technology, Seller Services, or Amazon Subsidiaries.
Amazon is a place where builders build.



What are examples of work that Software Engineers are doing at Amazon?

· Powered companies from Netflix to NASA: Amazon Web Services has provided companies of all sizes with an infrastructure platform in the cloud that powers hundreds of thousands of businesses in 190 countries around the world. Here at AWS, you’ll experience unparalleled ownership and impact on our product development, and be empowered to innovate and deliver.



· Built the Amazon Devices experience: We have gone beyond Kindle, our best-selling e-reader to our powerhouse Fire tablets, built for work and play with our Fire OS operating system. For streaming media lovers, we have created Amazon Fire TV and Fire TV Stick with voice search, massive video selection, and gaming. Exploring new solutions with products such as Amazon Echo, a new category of device designed around your voice with far-field voice recognition, and Amazon Dash, a handheld scanner to help you order groceries from Amazon Fresh.



· We help users find what they want: Amazon Search and Discovery helps hundreds of millions of shoppers spending tens of billions of dollars annually find what they want, get what they need, and discover what they'll love. We are innovators who love to experiment and are obsessed with letting customers tell us what works. We are obsessed with automation, and leverage technologies and massive amounts of data and machine learning to delight our customers. Work on Prime Air, Prime Now, or other customer solutions to help us define the future.

item.title: Senior Front End Developer at Crossover (São Paulo, Brazil) (allows remote)
item.description:
Ready to make $60,000 USD and eager to join a network of the most talented remote workers in the world? If so, this role is for you. Work for Crossover, and you’ll earn the most competitive wages on the market, collaborate with the most skilled teams in your field, and work for the most elite companies in the world. Sound too good to be true? Take a closer look...



What to Expect as a Senior Front-end Web Developer at Crossover


Join Crossover and you’ll be given the responsibility of combining the art of design with the art of programming. You will be implementing, iterating or even completely revamping the front-end code of a number of applications to be based on today’s modern JS frameworks. You should have an unrelenting drive for quality, with a passion for responsive UIs with tight animations. You will work closely with a global team of developers in utilizing the best-in-practice architecture, tools, and design patterns in web development. And most importantly, you will be expected to demonstrate a deep understanding on how to build custom web applications (including animations) by leveraging backend REST services through the use of data driven JS frameworks.



Compensation


At Crossover, you’ll earn extremely competitive wages while enjoying the flexibility of working from virtually anywhere on the face of the earth:




  • Salary: 30 USD/hr




  • Position type: Full time (40 hours per week)




  • Location: Global

item.title: C# Developer at Best Lawyers (New York, NY)
item.description:
Best Lawyers is seeking a C# Developer for a new interactive legal platform, built on the foundation of our 35 years as the most respected legal peer review network. The primary role will be to develop and support an API infrastructure for this initiative. The developer will also be challenged to maintain, improve, and create new features in an ever-changing environment while ensuring stability and site performance.


We are seeking a passionate developer looking to join a strong team. We need a proud problem solver, constant learner, and a continuous contributor to the team IQ level.

item.title: Mobile Engineer at Triggr Health (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
You’ll be responsible for defining, building, and supporting a platform that reaches people when they are most at-risk and empowers them through the extraordinarily challenging recovery journey. It is an incredibly exciting role as you will be working with cutting-edge technology on a number of products that span: consumer and enterprise; mobile and desktop; external and internal; user-driven and automated; and practical and academic areas. The challenges you will face are new and exciting and will require you to think holistically about how the platform interacts with an incredibly diverse set of stakeholders.


More specifically, we are building apps on both Android and iOS, a customer-facing web application, a robust web services API, machine learning-driven analytics, and large-scale data processing. As a mobile engineer, you will be working on both platforms in addition to working in the API layer.


You must be hyper-focused on how the product impacts every patient, provider, and team member. You will need to understand when trade-offs are necessary: we are growing very quickly, but quality is of critical importance given our mission. You will continuously iterate on our products in order to improve the long-term outcomes of the patients in our program. You will also be integral to forming and developing our culture in addition to helping hire all-star teammates to make Triggr Health an awesome place to work! Most importantly, you must have a strong desire to be a part of a mission-driven company and believe that with the right team, technology, and values, anything is possible.


This position requires someone who understands and embraces the fact that the “user” is a real person with a severe health condition. The work we are doing is incredibly exciting because the impact we can have is massive, but it also requires extra care and increased responsibility to ensure every decision we make reflects this understanding.

item.title: Principal UI Software Engineer at clypd (Somerville, MA)
item.description:
You will be learning all aspects of the system and contributing to them. You will work with the rest of the engineering and product teams to deliver quickly and fluidly using Agile methodologies. You will use Continuous Integration and Test Driven Development techniques to build rock-solid code.
 

Skills and experience:

Achieved at least a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering
10+ years of experience
Willingness to learn and improve your web stack skills: front end, back end or both
For front end: experience or interest in building interactive user experiences with modern HTML5 and JavaScript, and comfortable working with the services that drive them
Previous use of MV* frameworks on the client (AngularJS, Ember, ...) and/or server side (Rails, Django, Grails, ...) a huge plus
Excitement about startups and working with a small (but quickly expanding) Agile team
Communication is key; our work is heavily team-oriented, and we are looking for someone who is comfortable participating and contributing to the team
Passion for delivering quality code and products. Code reviews and automated tests are an integral part of our development process. We are always looking for new ways to improve.

Our stack:

Ruby on Rails, React, JQuery, RSpec/Capybara
Go
Docker
PostgreSQL/RDS, Redis
AWS

Perks and benefits:

Competitive compensation and stock options
Comprehensive benefits package (Health, Dental, Vision, Long-term and Short-term disability, 401(k), cell phone subsidy, commuter safety subsidy)
Unlimited paid time off  - take the time you need to operate at peak performance
Learning culture that includes weekly Lunch and Learns and a formal mentor program
Amazing office space in Davis Square, one of the hottest neighborhoods in Somerville
Open and relaxed office layout, including standing desks, walking desks, and a choice of comfortable seating
Macbook and Thunderbolt display
Three rotating beer taps, iced tea and iced coffee on tap, wine bar, tea bar, and more
Game room with darts, foosball, Xbox One, PS4, and more
Fun team outings and celebrations, an annual company outing and holiday party

Who we are:

clypd is a leading player in one of the hottest emerging markets of programmatic TV, disrupting the $74 billion television industry. We are on a mission to change television advertising, to make it more efficient and effective for TV media companies, consumers, and advertisers. We've built an advertising technology platform to empower media companies with programmatic strategies. Our sales platform delivers workflow automation, data-enhanced decisioning and provides media partners with tools to manage their sales efforts.

We are looking for awesome people to join a growing and fun team. We aim to create an environment that is open and transparent, collaborative, supportive, and diverse. We are looking for engineers who want to learn about the latest technologies to craft scalable and maintainable code. The problems we are solving are challenging and interesting and we want your help.

item.title: Sr. Java Developer at ADP (Pasadena, CA)
item.description:
POSITION SUMMARY


At ADP, innovation is a core value that is now foundational to all parts of the business. Our collaborative environment is designed for collocated teams to work, live and play together focused on delivering products that solve BIG customer problems.


With ADP building a startup culture in Pasadena, we are able to accelerate new products focused on Customer Driven Design, Data Visualization, Social, Mobile and Digital Payments. In Pasadena we are building a culture driven by "LeanStartup" principles with co-located teams, empowered to make decisions and fail fast along the way. Our goal for the Pasadena Innovation Center is to have small teams with development, design and product focused on BIG customers problems with simple elegant solutions our customers will LOVE.


RESPONSIBILITIES:



  • Participate in planning, development and testing of key features

  • Perform design, code, and unit test software on a predefined schedule using technologies, techniques, and tools to ensure high quality, performance, and reliability, at varying levels of complexity.

  • Following department coding standards, write well documented programs that perform effectively and efficiently.

  • Performs system analysis and design in accordance with established procedures and policies. Provides accurate estimate of time needed to complete work.

  • Will develop test automation scripts with Selenium, Java, CA LISA, SOAPUI and other tools

  • Provides support for specification, design, testing, deployment, documentation and production.

item.title: Quality Assurance Developer at Ontoit Holdings Ltd (London, UK)
item.description:
Ontoit is looking for an energetic and proactive Quality Assurance Developer responsible for developing automated test suites for the entirety of Ontoit's semantic search engine platform. In this critical and exciting phase of Ontoit's growth, you will be an integral contributor in forming the future of our company.

At Ontoit, we work in various fields of computer science, including machine learning, natural language processing, graph technologies, knowledge representation (ontologies), distributed systems, and web applications. The core technologies that we use include, but is not limited to, Apache Storm, Neo4J, CoreNLP, Apache Spark, Apache Cassandra and Java Spring. As a Quality Assurance Developer, you will be developing automated test suites for the development in these various fields. In conjunction with the CEO and key team members you will be involved in driving the design of automated test systems, creating test cases, and responsible for developing high quality test code for challenging algorithmic back end development.

The compensation for this role also includes significant equity options, all depending on the experience and skill level of the successful applicant.

item.title: Devops Engineer at Rally Health, Inc. (San Francisco, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
DevOps Engineers at Rally Health work incredibly close with our engineering and product teams to help design, implement, and scale our predominantly Scala and MongoDB based architecture. We are obsessively focused on maintaining high availability for all of the services we manage, while also implementing the infrastructure solutions that our product teams need in order to succeed.


If you have implemented and supported a cutting edge public cloud environment on top of: AWS, MongoDB, CDN, ELB; deployed and managed environment using Chef; and have excellent analytical skills, and a taste for good engineering. WE WANT YOU!  


You will have opportunities to combine your technical ability, strategic thinking and detail-oriented execution in a fast-paced, dynamic, entrepreneurial environment at Rally Health. Your work will contribute to the design and management of serious infrastructure that is servicing large amounts of data and traffic, work with an outstanding engineering team, and employ state-of-the-art tools and techniques.


Responsibilities: 





  • Build and maintain a highly fault tolerant infrastructure on public cloud

  • Build and document cutting-edge automation tools to improve capacity and velocity for software engineers and production operations

  • Collaborate with our development team to implement and evolve solutions for a wide array of challenging projects

  • Improve provisioning, automation, configuration, integration, deployment and release processes

  • Mentor, train and develop team members for career progression and learning

  • Participate in 7x24 on-call rotation

item.title: Lead Full Stack Developer at Cupris Health (London, UK)
item.description:
Cupris Health is working to transform healthcare provision in the NHS and developing markets. We need a lead developer who can deliver our ambitious pipeline of products to realise our vision of a seamlessly connected healthcare system that provides beautiful, smart tools for doctors to give better care to patients closer to home.


You’ll have complete ownership of the stack, developing new functionality, integrating with complex healthcare processes, and working on machine learning algorithms to assist in the diagnosis of patient conditions. Your work will define the company’s growth and ultimate success. 


You will be an early member of our rapidly growing team, passionate about improving healthcare delivery in the UK and globally.


You will have the freedom to choose the stack, but the existing stack consists of: iOS app in Objective C, backend in Ruby on Rails, hosted on Heroku and AWS.

item.title: Technical Support Lead at Vena Solutions Inc. (Toronto, ON, Canada)
item.description:
About the Role


Lead the support team and build a strong feedback loop between the product development and customer support teams to ensure that customer success. Use customer feedback to improve the product, and technical feedback to improve our customer service. You will be the voice of our customers internally, bringing product feedback and technical issues to the engineering team, and using your deep understanding of our customers to influence the prioritization of product improvements.


You will also communicate product and technical updates to the customer success team, so that they can expertly resolve any issues.


The Technical Support Lead will work with internal teams including Professional Services, Quality Assurance, and Product Development as required in order to completely resolve customer issues.



Responsibilities



  • Prioritize and escalate highly impacting issues

  • Manage / coordinate critical communications

  • Ability to manage and resolve customer issues

  • Manage customers’ expectations and experience in a way that results in high customer satisfaction

  • Develop and maintain technical expertise in assigned areas of product functionality and utilize that expertise effectively to help customers / partners

  • Create knowledge base materials dedicated towards operational efficiency while also empowering and enabling the Customer / Partner Community

  • Research, document, and escalate cases according to procedure

  • Review support cases for technical and troubleshooting accuracy

  • Ensure client requests are acknowledged and resolved within service level agreement times

  • Provide a superior client experience by providing timely updates and problem resolution

  • Identify and document opportunities for improvement based on client suggestions

  • Work closely with Product Development and the Quality Assurance teams to move issues through the software release process

  • Actively participate in job related training

  • Define and describe technical best practices

item.title: C++ (Senior) Developer for the SAP HANA database team Job at SAP SE (Walldorf, Deutschland)
item.description:
COMPANY DESCRIPTION

SAP is the global market leader for business software and thus contributes a considerable part of the world's economic power grid. At SAP you get your chance to put your ideas into action with maximum impact.The SAP HANA in-memory database is the basis for new, ground-breaking SAP applications and is widely agreed to be a highly valuable asset in the SAP software portfolio. In-memory computing is made possible through recent technology advances in main memory, multi-core processing, and data management. It leverages technology innovation to establish real-time analysis of business data and combines both transactions and analytics to improve existing business processes with a dramatic increase in performance. The SAP HANA in-memory database as basis for the in-memory computing shows enormous promise as a key driver for SAP market of the future. The development of the SAP HANA in-memory database is distributed over all continents. You will be part of the development team in Walldorf with more than 100 exceptionally talented and motivated colleagues. We live code development in a flexible and agile way. You will be part of small and self-organized groups of developer.

EXPECTATIONS AND TASKS

We seek for developers with strong focus in C++ system or application programming. The main task of the job is to drive and implement development topic as part of a development team inside the core of the SAP HANA in-memory database. You can expect to work on some of the following tasks:
- Write meticulous software implementations in classical main memory database areas such as compression algorithms, distribution algorithms or query processing as well as in domain specific extensions like processing of geo spatial information, graph processing, hierarchical information processing or database programming languages
- Write basic regression tests for your own code using different programming languages (e.g. C++, Python, SQL) and testing frameworks (e.g. Google C++ Testing Framework)
- Do code reviews and code audits to spot opportunities for improvements with respect to usability, testability, supportability, or potential performance penalties

WORK EXPERIENCE

Working experience in software development.

EDUCATION AND QUALIFICATION / SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES

We are looking for candidates who are committed to a technology career path. Your set of application documents should contain a cover letter and CV, copies of the obtained degrees and references. Required skills
- Strong C++ programming skills
- University degree in computer science or related technical discipline
- Basic knowledge on relational database management systems
- Excellent German and English both spoken and written
- Willingness to analyze and debug complex problems
- Good communication skills Preferred skills
- Experience in Administration, Programming or Profiling on Linux
- Knowledge of code-analysis tools e.g. Valgrind, Intel Amplifier, Cppchecker
- Experience with continuous integration concepts and tools e.g. Git, Gerrit
- Python or Shell-Scripting programming skills
- Working experience in the area of system or application programming with C++
- Expertise with architecture of relational database management systems101014132

item.title: Systems Engineer at ROBLOX (San Mateo, CA)
item.description:
About the Job
Become a member of an elite technical team advancing the infrastructure of ROBLOX, the largest indie game development platform in the world with more than 17 million unique active users. We are ranked #1 among kids entertainment sites in the U.S. for the number of daily visitors, total minutes, total page views, total visits, and average length of visits by ComScore. Each month we have more than 4.4 million active users and more than 70 million hours of engagement. Our users have created more than 15 million games and have played 2 billion hours since 2008.

As a Data Center Ops Engineer, your duties will include, but are not limited to:



  • Maintain a 99.9% SLA for a 24/7/365 production environment

  • Triage, troubleshoot, and solve production issues caused by failures in hardware, configuration, networking, vendor outages, and continuous software upgrades

  • Quickly resolve complex problems encountered during the installation and operation of our applications, to ensure negligible impact on players and internal operations

  • Prioritize and multitask daily responsibilities, while being flexible enough to respond to emergent high-priority issues

  • Design, deploy and configure servers and complex firewall environments

  • Assist in implementing disaster recovery procedures and system failover efforts

  • Collaborate with highly skilled and driven colleagues in a dynamic, agile environment

  • Collect, document and help manage vendor-related services

  • Manage systems and develop contingency plans

  • Participate in on-call rotations


Our infrastructure management system is highly automated, enabling engineers to interact with thousands of servers across multiple environments in parallel via the command line. Our application space includes database scalability, caching, message queuing, wide-table search, recommendations, user ratings, services for mobile devices, gaming cloud management, and virtualization. We live in both the cloud and traditional data center environments.


Perks & Benefits:



  • Robust medical, dental and vision insurance

  • 401k

  • Flexible time-off

  • Wellness reimbursement

  • Free onsite parking & other commuter benefits

  • Free catered lunches & a fully stocked kitchen with unlimited snacks!

  • Chance to work with a top-notch team on cool and unique projects!


ROBLOX does not accept unsolicited resumes from 3rd party recruiters.

item.title: Software Engineer - NLP Developer at Ontoit Holdings Ltd (London, UK)
item.description:
Ontoit is looking for an energetic and proactive Software Engineer responsible for developing the core of Ontoit's semantic search engine platform. In this critical and exciting phase of Ontoit's growth, you will be an integral contributor in forming the future of our company.


At Ontoit, we work in various fields of computer science, including machine learning, natural language processing, graph technologies, knowledge representation (ontologies), distributed systems, and web applications. The core technologies that we use include, but is not limited to, Apache Storm, Neo4J, CoreNLP, Apache Spark, Apache Cassandra and Java Spring. As an NLP Developer, you will be involved in the development of our Natural Language Processing system component. In conjunction with the CEO and key team members you will be involved in driving the design and technical specifications of the system and responsible for developing high quality code for challenging algorithmic back end development.


The compensation for this position will be in the range of £30-40,000 per annum plus potentially equity options, all depending on the experience and skill level of the successful applicant.


Ontoit will accept applications for this position until 18th of September, 2015.

item.title: Senior Java Engineer for Disruptive Insurance Startup at Goji (Boston, MA)
item.description:
Insurance is a complex product that everyone needs but few understand. At Goji, our mission is to deliver something that consumers aren’t getting anywhere else – clarity and peace of mind. In a market that bombards consumers with gimmicky ways to save, we provide consumers an easy way to comparison shop top brands and purchase insurance that best fits their needs. By combining human expertise with smart technology, Goji has helped over 700,000 people make better, more informed decisions. As a result, we have grown quickly to become one of the largest independent, online insurance agencies in the country.


Job Summary:


Our vision is to integrate the fractured value chain from consumers to insurance carriers by building cutting-edge applications (e.g. Expedia or Charles Schwab for insurance). Thus, technology and data are at the core of what differentiates us in a large industry that is ripe for disruption. Here are a few of the ambitious projects we are working on:



  • A responsive SaaS application for our sales process that integrates a robust predictive dialer, a dynamic customer relationship management system, and an end-to-end insurance buying platform

  • Real-time lead buying platform based on rigorous data analytics

  • Integrating with carrier partners to transact policies completely on our platform

  • Customer facing portal to purchase, view and manage policies


The Goji development team is led by folks who have leveraged their backgrounds in computer science, math and engineering to build and scale multiple technology companies. We strongly believe that empowered people are the key to building a great company, and our development process focuses on iteratively improving our product as well as ourselves as individuals and as a team. We are looking to add a Senior Engineer who can be a core member of our team and work on every part of the stack to accelerate product development. So if you share our ambition and want to help shape the technology that will make it happen, then join our team!

item.title: Senior Full Stack Web Engineer at ROBLOX (San Mateo, CA)
item.description:
Help us build the world’s best user generated gaming platform, supporting integrated desktop and mobile gameplay. We have a viral gaming directory, a massive virtual goods catalog, and an engaged social network. We also have a broad technology stack, including best-of-breed open-source components, a high-speed C# back-end, SQL and NoSQL data stores, and cloud services (both Amazon and our own proprietary cloud).


ROBLOX does not accept unsolicited resumes from 3rd party recruiters.

item.title: Software Developer for dynamic startup, latest web technologies at MindLink Software (London, UK)
item.description:
You will work with our kick-ass core development team to design, develop and deliver our high-quality full-stack solutions in JavaScript and C#.


Want to build high-quality mobile applications? You will, with MindLink targeting all major mobile operating systems (iOS, Android, BlackBerry 10) we use hybrid technology (cordova) to deliver a native experience with a highly shared code base.


Excited by developing and using your own APIs? MindLink has a core RESTful API that can be used to develop integrating components - you will help shape that API and use it for fun and useful side projects. Think hooking into GitHub, JIRA or the London Underground.


Love the latest technologies? We are passionate about using the latest technologies to deliver even better applications. The latest advancements in ECMAScript and .Net are readily brought in to make code more readable, more efficient and more modern.


Want to improve your JavaScript or .Net knowledge? You can, MindLink is full of bright engineers who you will work with closely developing across the full MindLink stack.


Care deeply about performance? We do too! Whether it's improving the user experience or optimising protocols to minimise data transfer there is always a way to get a little more performance.


Want to take on the next big challenge? MindLink is making professional chat easy, elegant and powerful. Innovating what once was stale and integrating into the lives of millions of professionals in companies around the globe.


Think you have the skill, ideas and playful determination to join our team? You could be part of research and development or the fast-paced agile product release team.

item.title: Java Frontend Developer (m/f) at Visual Meta GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
We are looking for Java Frontend developers (m/f) on a full-time basis to help us invent, extend and scale our frontend services for leading shopping comparison platforms worldwide like LadenZeile and ShopAlike.


We, the IT team, believe in lean & agile software engineering and create websites for desktop, phone & tablet devices, native apps & inhouse applications for Visual Meta.


We code stuff that matters and in three different areas - Frontend, Mobile & Backend.


On the Frontend and Mobile side we deal a lot with modern web technologies such as Java, CSS, SASS, Javascript & jQuery.The Backend technology stack consists mainly of MySQL, Spring, Tomcat, GWT, HBase, Hadoop and ElasticSearch.


Your responsibilities:



  • Implementing new frontend features in cooperation with our Product Management and Graphic team

  • Setting up A/B-Tests to assure effectiveness and user acceptance of new/already existing functionality

  • Monitoring and improving the page load time on desktop, mobile and tablet pages

  • Good knowledge and awareness on-page search engine optimization


What we offer:



  • A committed, successful and international team

  • Large impact due to small, excellent development teams and professional data center environments

  • Leading-edge technology to solve challenging problems and to build great software

  • Continuous training possibilities and room for further personal development

  • Flexible working hours and a great office in the heart of Berlin

  • Healthy snacks (fruits, cereals), water and hot drinks

  • Team events, movie nights, table football, ping-pong, company bikes, etc.


If you are interested in an exciting position within a friendly team, please submit your application in English to the attention of Marcel Pierry including cover letter, CV, your earliest starting date, salary expectations as well as relevant references.


We are looking forward to receiving your application!

item.title: Backend developer - Medior/Senior C# .NET at Amsterdam based startup at Neocles (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Are you ready to change an industry and work on software serving global players? Then join our team!


You will write server-side code (.NET C#) for web-based applications and create robust high-volume production applications. You're able to develop prototypes quickly and will work with a team of developers and product managers to ensure that engineering know-how and excellence is shared and nurtured. You have to be able to communicate your ideas clearly and concisely and work in a team well. And last but not least you "Think API".

item.title: Software Developer at Wiland, Inc. (Niwot, CO)
item.description:
Wiland is seeking dedicated, high caliber professionals who are smart and energetic, have a positive attitude and take pride in their work. Currently, we have an opening for a Software Developer. The Software Developer will work closely with the Development Team Lead and the Product Management Team to develop and maintain software to support the cooperative database environment.  The Software Developer will collaborate on designs, develop, maintain and document assigned software projects.  This individual will follow the Wiland design methodology and collaborate on design documents.  The developer will focus on new product development, system enhancements, and system maintenance projects as dictated by strategic business priorities.  The primary responsibilities of the Software Developer position include:



  1. Collaborate on design as requested and participate in design reviews.

  2. Develop/modify program code per the approved design.

  3. Follow approved methodology and programming standards and guidelines.

  4. Develop and execute unit test plans to prove the accuracy and integrity of the modified computer programs.

  5. Author and /or maintain Technical Documentation on all new and modified systems.

item.title: Senior Mobile Engineer - Android at DraftKings Inc. (Boston, MA)
item.description: DraftKings is seeking a Senior Android Software Engineer to join our world-class engineering team building the next generation Android apps. As a Senior Android Software Engineer you will work through the full project lifecycle to design, develop, test, implement and support our Android apps applications using HTML, CSS, Javascript, Java and the Android Studio. Design and implement new features, create UI, debugging and data modeling. Assist in testing all applications against software and hardware versions. Provide timely turnaround and documentation of bug fixes during test cycle. Additionally, any experience working with large-scale server-side systems using object-oriented languages is a plus.  We are constantly optimizing and improving in an iterative fashion to deliver the highest-quality experience to our users.  In your role as an Android Software Engineer, you will have the opportunity to work in a dynamic environment on highly impactful projects. Working in small teams or independently, you will have the autonomy to take projects from concept to production engaging cross-functionally with stake holders.  We are looking for team players who are able to tackle problems under tight deadline constraints and deliver imaginative solutions.

item.title: Security Analyst (m/f) at Zalando SE (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR  



  • You are an excellent communicator

  • You have a degree in computer science

  • You have at least 2 years of experience in the security industy, ideally Web or application security related

  • You have a good understanding of both frontend and backend technologies

  • You have preferably experience in HTML5 and its security implications

  • You are fluent in both the German and English language

  • Having certifications like GIAC-GSEC, SSCP, CISSP is a plus


YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES



  • You will be collaborating with other tech and product teams and determine threats to our infrastructure

  • You will construct data flow charts and threat models for systems and application environments

  • You are going to perform penetration tests and code reviews

  • You will be consulting development teams during the patching process

  • You are expected to work independently and bring in ideas to decrease security debt

  • You are also expected to present your results therefore good presentation skills are required


WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM US



  • Through our mentoring program you will be able to work independently very quickly

  • We use Open Source technologies

  • Weekly Tech Talks and regular technical exchange with other Berlin-based startups

  • The ability to choose your OS (Linux, MacOS) and IDE (Eclipse, IntelliJ, NetBeans, ...)

  • Powerful hardware system environment

  • Flat hierarchies -- we live the motto “Wear sneakers, not ties”

  • An international team with top experts who will inspire and support you

  • Complimentary fruit, beverages and table soccer

  • You will never be bored! Zalando offers a very variable working environment


ABOUT ZALANDO


Zalando is Europe’s leading online fashion platform, doing business in 15 markets. Delivering first-class shopping experiences to our +15 million customers requires moving fast — with microservices, Agile processes & autonomous teams  —  and using cutting edge, open source technologies. We are passionate about what we do and have fun while doing it. And we are willing to experiment and make mistakes: It’s how we grow.


WANT TO JOIN US? THEN GO AHEAD AND APPLY!


If you need guidance or have any questions about our recruiting and hiring processes, please contact recruiter Sameer Shaikh at jobs@zalando.de

item.title: Python Web Developer for Trading Firm in Chicago's River North area at Old Mission Capital, LLC (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
We are currently seeking a dedicated software engineer to join our technology team in Chicago.  You will be taking over primary responsibility for a key internal system used to track and analyze trading activity.  Responsibilities include:



  • Build new features and fix bugs in Python, Django, SQL and some C++

  • Create web applications for traders and middle office

  • Develop server-side programs for real-time trade processing

  • Develop server-side scripts and programs for post-trade analysis

  • Work closely with traders, operations personnel and developers to manage and improve systems

item.title: (Senior) Software Developer (w/m) at etracker GmbH (Hamburg, Deutschland)
item.description:
Lust auf die Entwicklung innovativer Software im Data Science-Umfeld?

Dann freuen wir uns, dich als

(Senior) Software Developer (w/m) mit Leidenschaft


in unserem Team zu begrüßen!

Du hast maßgeblichen Anteil an der Weiterentwicklung unserer komplexen und im Markt ausgezeichnet positionierten Software und entwickelst diese in einer Open Source Web-Architektur weiter. Die eigenverantwortliche Implementierung von vielschichtigen Erweiterungen in einer High Traffic Software-Architektur, die im Wesentlichen auf NoSQL- und In-Memory Datenbanken aufsetzt, steht dabei im Fokus deiner Aufgabe.

Bei uns findest du



  • agile Entwicklungsmethoden in Verbindung mit hoch automatisierten Release-Prozessen

  • gelebtes Software Craftsmanship

  • neueste Technologien und visionäre Lösungen

  • Continuous Delivery-Prozesse und Light Weight Container

  • Testautomatisierung vom Unit- bis zum Integrationstest

  • Entwicklung nahe am Betrieb

  • ein hohes Maß an Selbstständigkeit und Selbstorganisation innerhalb der Teams

  • Freiraum, um eigene Ideen voranzutreiben und umzusetzen

  • die Mitarbeit in einem hoch professionellen Team, das Spaß an seiner Arbeit hat

  • Raum für persönliche und berufliche Weiterentwicklung

  • eine attraktive Bürolage im Herzen Hamburgs mit Blick auf Rathaus und Michel



Wir wünschen uns



  • ein abgeschlossenes Studium mit Informatikschwerpunkt oder eine entsprechende Ausbildung mit Abschluss und Berufserfahrung

  • sehr gute Praxis in Java oder einer anderen OO-Programmiersprache und im OO-Design

  • idealerweise sichere Beherrschung moderner Internettechnologien oder aber eine hohe Web-Affinität

  • vorzugsweise UNIX Know-how

  • eine systematisch-analytische sowie nachhaltige Arbeitsweise

  • eine hohe Bereitschaft, neue Methoden und Technologien kennen- und beherrschen zu lernen



Lust auf etracker?

Dann freuen wir uns auf deine Bewerbung ausschließlich per E-Mail unter Angabe deiner Gehaltsvorstellung sowie deines möglichen Eintrittstermins an jobs@etracker.com.

Lust auf etracker aber noch Fragen?


Dann kann Elke Hollensteiner bestimmt weiter helfen: 040 55 56 59 52.

item.title: Android Engineer at SwiftKick Mobile (Austin, TX)
item.description:
SwiftKick is hiring skilled, creative, and adaptable Android Developers/Engineers. This is an opportunity for developers with strong Java experience and attention to detail, to contribute to a variety of challenging and cutting edge apps. You will drive the development of apps that embody SwiftKick's commitment to building pixel-perfect products that people love to use.

Typically 2-4 people are assigned to each project, each with an opportunity to give input on design and development. We encourage collaboration and creativity. You will interact with our engineers and may architect solutions with our customers and their engineers as well.


As a member of the SwiftKick team you must be inspired by technology and have a passion for creating innovative technical solutions in a fast, energetic environment.

Responsibilities of a BI Developer include the design, development and maintenance of data marts, reports and dashboards, along with ETL solutions. item.title: Internship Technology (m/f) at Westwing Home & Living (München, Deutschland)

item.title: Software Developer at Excel4apps (Pittsburgh, PA)
item.description:
The Excel4apps Core Development Group is looking for the best and brightest minds in software development. As a Software Developer you will be a vital part of the Core Development team, responsible for developing, supporting and maintaining core Excel4apps product frameworks and services.


We enjoy our work as much as we enjoy working together and want developers who can get things done while having a positive influence on our workplace environment. The successful candidate must enjoy developing software, care about code quality, and be committed to craftsmanship.


Job Outcomes



  • Develop and Support the Excel4apps Wands Java Development Framework.

  • Work with Product development teams to implement new, and extend existing features and functionality.
