item.title: Automation Architect at Workday (Pleasanton, CA)
item.description:
Help develop and implement an overall test automation strategy for unit, system, and load testing


Drive improvements in tools supporting Test Driven Development


Own and evolve the test structures by working with development teams to align with application modules and use cases


Design and construct data-agnostic tests that can be used as reference implementations that others can follow


Improve existing test automation suite (i.e. make them faster, more flexible and easier to use)


Monitor test quality to ensure alignment with test automation standards


Work with development peers to ensure consistency of test development


Track the coverage of the unit tests across a functional area and insert new test cases as necessary


Monitor passed vs. failed tests throughout a product release cycle and utilize our issue tracking tool to log bugs and/or enhancement requests

item.title: QA Engineer at Spoon.net (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
Spoon makes groundbreaking virtualization software that allows businesses, developers, and consumers to stream applications over the web, distribute server workloads and create automated test environments. Imagine simply installing a small plugin and being able to instantly run Firefox, Skype, Chrome, Spotify, or any other application without downloading it.


Founded in 2006, Spoon.net is a profitable, rapidly growing company with a multi-million dollar revenue base. We are seeking quality assurance engineers to join our virtual machine engine, server infrastructure, developer products, and web development teams.


QA engineers design and execute test plans, develop automated test and monitoring systems, assist analysis of customer technical issues, and work closely with product designers and developers to maximize product quality, performance, and reliability.


Primary Responsibilities



  • Create, execute, and maintain comprehensive test plans. Product areas include: virtualization engine, data storage and analysis, desktop client, web site (client and server), server infrastructure, and development tools

  • Design and create automated test suites to verify the performance and functionality of software products and services

  • Build and test virtualized applications and analyze virtual machine errors

  • Quickly learn new languages and technologies appropriate to a range of problem domains

  • Work closely with developers to maximize product quality and maintain accurate defect tracking records

  • Work effectively with development team members, product management, contract staff, and customer engineers to solve extremely challenging technical and design problems

item.title: Software Engineer -- Personalization at TripAdvisor (Boston, MA)
item.description:
TripAdvisor, the world’s largest travel site, is looking for dynamic, passionate and effective Software Engineers to join our team. Our product is the wildly successful travel website www.tripadvisor.com. Our website and mobile apps provide our users with a rich user experience to research, collaborate, and contribute. We have big data with over 150 million reviews, opinions, photos, and videos reaching over 260 million unique visitors each month.


We are seeking developers for our Personalization team, which is responsible for understanding, analyzing and delivering knowledge based on the activities of the millions of users of our site.


Can you operate in a highly-iterative agile development environment, delivering significant new functionality every week?Can you interact with a wide variety of peers across the organization to get to a single result? Are you, above all else, passionate about what you do and who you do it for?

item.title: Software Developer - Planning and Scheduling Systems at Tracsis plc (Leeds, UK)
item.description:
A talented software developer is sought to join our fast growing, successful software company which specialises in resource planning and scheduling software applications for the public transport industry.


The role will see the successful candidate interpret business requirements to develop and deliver high quality, customer focused applications and technical solutions. Working as part of an agile team, the role includes all aspects of the software lifecycle, from assessing business requirements and design through to testing, deployment and maintenance. We strongly encourage proactive learning, and personal development. We emphasise good technical practices and value long-term quality and continuous improvement.


Both recent graduates and experienced developers will be considered for this role. Candidates must hold a 2.1 or higher degree in Computing, Science, Engineering or Mathematics or a related discipline.

item.title: Sr. Systems Administrator at Playtika Santa Monica (Santa Monica, CA)
item.description:
Playtika Santa Monica is seeking an awesome Systems Administrator to work in our world-class team.  This role will contribute to the creation of an environment and culture which will help us develop the next generation of social games in our Santa Monica, CA offices.


What you'd be working on:




  •     Deploy / Manage Linux Servers (Dell / Ubuntu / CentOS)




  •     Server Deployment & Change Management (iDRAC / Ansible / Cobbler / Chef / )




  •     Data Centers & Cloud - Deployment and Management




  •     Monitoring & Management Tools (New Relic / Nagios / Icinga / Collectd / SNMP / Zabbix)




  •     Load Balancing HTTP/HTTPS (Brocade / Foundry / HAProxy)




  •     Web Servers (Apache / Nginx / Lighttpd / Tomcat / Jetty)




  •     Caching Servers (Memcache / Couchbase / Redis)




  •     SQL Database Servers (MySQL, including replication)




  •     Networking (Switches, Load balancer, Firewall)

item.title: Senior Software Development Engineer, AWS Networking at Amazon (Dublin, Ireland)
item.description:
Amazon is looking for Software Development Engineers to build the software that monitors one of the world’s largest and most complex networks. Tens of millions of customers rely on Amazon’s network for using our retail websites, accessing content on their Kindles and building applications and businesses on top of Amazon Web Services (AWS). Our goal is to become The Infrastructure Platform for the world - achieving this goal requires high-leverage, massively scalable software systems. Our success depends on our world-class network infrastructure, and our network depends on our Network Monitoring team.



· You are interested in being part of a high-bar team with global responsibility for the Network Monitoring software used across all of Amazon’s businesses.

· Solving problems at scale excites you.

· You don’t implement specs from analysts and architects - you talk to your customers and design solutions to their problems. You automate and innovate.

· You do not push just one technology agenda - you choose the best tool for the problem at hand.

· You believe that the craft of software engineering is about writing code right the first time. For you, code reviews and automated testing are not chores - they’re a core part of writing great software.

· You don’t throw your code over the wall. You launch it, own it, support it and make it incrementally better for the benefit of your customers.

· You enjoy working in a flexible, fast-paced, collaborative team environment.

· Computer Science degree, or equivalent experience.

· Ability to gather customer requirements and deliver innovative solutions.

· Strong track record of launching projects of significant complexity.

· Ability to mentor other software developers to maintain architectural vision and software quality.

· Experience with software engineering best practices (code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, release and change management).

· Very strong problem solving and coding skills.

· Understanding of data structures, algorithms and their performance.

· Proficient at designing software systems, from high-availability large-scale distributed systems to your application’s object model.

· Understanding of the building blocks of computer systems; comfortable working with bits & bytes.

· Knowledge of at least one scripting language.

· Comfortable with Linux and a good understanding of networking concepts.



· Experience of working in a DevOps team.

· Experience developing robust, highly scalable distributed systems.



aws-sdesdm-ea

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Becton, Dickinson and Company (Durham, NC)
item.description:
Our mission is to advance healthcare by improving self-care tools and strengthening the relationship with clinicians and caregivers. Our team is building disruptive solutions using smart medical devices and mobile applications to support and engage chronic disease sufferers, such as diabetics. We are building a platform to include mobile applications for patients and caregivers, a clinician portal, and real-time analytics. Ultimately, our goal is to support BD’s mission to help all people live healthy lives by building world-class integrated solutions for the chronically ill.


About You:


This position primarily focuses on creating the back-end software needed to support our chronic care platform. You should have experience in building mobile and/or web based applications with a focus on the back-end and a passion for improving the state of healthcare.



The Senior Software Engineer position will play a critical role in the full life cycle of our chronic care solution - from design and development through ongoing maintenance.


Responsibilities:



  • Act as a full-stack developer focused on the back-end. Working in C# you’ll design, build and maintain the systems used by our mobile and web clients to enable our solutions.

  • Assist in building the rich client applications on mobile (Xamarin) or web (Javascript / Angular).

  • Assist Data Scientists in translating models into production at scale.

  • Mentor and lead junior developers in the implementation of software components.

  • Maintain and support the code base.

  • Make the team better – Bring your skills and experience to our team and help us take our game to the next level!

item.title: Junior Test Automation QA Engineer with Java at aspect (Galway, Ireland)

  • Executes test plans for manual and/or automated tests.

item.title: Software Developer- Build Footlocker's eCommerce Platform at Footlocker.com / Eastbay (Wausau, WI)
item.description:
Footlocker.com / Eastbay is on the cutting edge of on-line retail technology. Our evolution has led us to expand our systems and we are searching for ambitious, tech-savvy and forward thinking Software Developers who want to take taking their career to the next level without losing the ability to code innovative and amazing applications.


Footlocker.com / Eastbay operates the direct-to-consumer business for Foot Locker, Inc. - the world’s leading retailer of athletically inspired footwear and apparel. Our brands include Footlocker, Eastbay, Champs Sports, Footaction, Kids Foot Locker, and Lady Footlocker. In fact we manage 16 of the largest sport inspired web and mobile sites on the net, which enjoy over 250 million visits per year. 


Footlocker.com / Eastbay has ambitious goals. Help us exceed them! 


Our Development Team is good at what they do. They work with new technologies on innovative projects, delivering elegant solutions through collaboration. Our team members are best-in-class; they are Students of the Business; aggressive and clever. We want a growing Developer who has the passion to be part of this motivated team!


This is an ideal environment for a savvy, solutions oriented developer to come in and truly progress in their career. Footlocker.com / Eastbay is looking for a developer to plan, develop test and document computer programs. Here’s what you can expect as a Footlocker.com / Eastbay Developer:

  • Provide business process flow and architectural design documentation

  • Effectively troubleshoot and communicate to help solve software issues

  • Stay current with software tools, technologies, and methodologies

  • Engage in a highly collaborative Agile Development culture

  • Grow as a Student of the Business through interaction with teams across the organization

item.title: Java/Ruby Developers at Miklos Systems, Inc. (MSI) (Fairfax, VA)
item.description:
Java and Ruby Software Developers


Northern Virginia


Relocation assistance will be available to qualified candidates.


Miklos Systems, Inc. (MSI) was founded in 1993 when Betsie Miklos chose to build a better kind of software development company. Over the years, people who have come to MSI have found approachable management, a culture of integrity, and an environment of technical excellence. Together, we have become a small company with a large impact on our people and our customers and we are pleased to announce that we have just become 100% employee-owned.


MSI employees work with customers across the Federal Government to build tools vital to our nation’s security. Our engineers, developers, and testers solve problems ranging from big data analysis to automated testing, from cloud engineering to website design and development.


Our Positions

  • Offer access to many contract positions via multiple contract vehicles.

item.title: Front-end Javascript Developer at iXara Ltd (Great Gaddesden, UK) (allows remote)

A distributed team, building a new slick product, using the very latest, state of the art web technologies: Javascript, HTML5, CSS and WebGL for only the newest browsers and touch devices. We also use Node.js, React, Vanilla JS, Git, Mocha, Karma and TeamCity.


Contract or Permanent. Competitive salary dependent on experience, plus benefits including Company pension contributions & private medical insurance (for permanent employees based in the UK).


If you have the right skills and the determination to succeed, this is your opportunity to work on a product that will be used by millions of people, and to contribute to the most amazing, slickest, web-based creative tool being developed today.


Location


Remote working or UK office based. You can work from anywhere you like (but within +/- 3 hours of the UK - please do not apply for this role if you are outside this range), with occasional visits for face to face meetings with the rest of the team, most of whom are also remote workers.

As an SDE on the team, you will need to solve a wide spectrum of technical challenges and be comfortable participating in technical discussions across multiple, global technology teams.

• Be an owner of services and applications you write-- from design and implementation to production troubleshooting
• Translate functional specifications into logical, component-based technical designs

item.title: Software Engineer - Cleantech Startup at EnergySavvy (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
EnergySavvy is looking to grow our flagship product team, Optix Engage. As one of Washington’s Best Workplaces two years in a row, we know that politics and bureaucracy never make great products. We focus on results and creating high-quality, user-centric software. Ideas and innovation thrive in our open, meritocratic culture.


Software engineering is the heart of our company. We rely on our developers to collaborate and shape the product direction. This means a leaner specification process and an excellent end product that's been built with the type of feedback you can only get by trying out aspects of each feature as they're developed. You’ll iterate quickly with an emphasis on clean and reusable code.


We’re building a new product that’s transforming the way businesses save money on energy. If you’re excited about the opportunity of working on a new product, making decisions around architecture and design, this would be a great fit for you. We don't care if you've never tried Python, Django or React. EnergySavvy embraces smart software engineers who are eager to learn, and if you've created great projects in Rails or other MVC frameworks, you'll pick it up fast.

item.title: Senior Full-Stack Ruby on Rails Developer at Aureso (Singapore) (allows remote)

You have strong experiences in working with Ruby and building cloud services/software solutions? Ideally (not obligatory) you also have acquired deep developer knowledge (min. 2 years experience) in at least one of the following fields: Digital Marketing, CRM, Capacity Planning, Business Intelligence or Big Data management? Then you are the one we are looking for to strengthen our engineering team!


This is an exciting opportunity (temporary/project-based or full-time) for mid-/senior-level RoR developers who are interested in defining and revising the architecture direction, building key elements of it and providing thought leadership. You will design, develop and ship innovative new user experiences for the automotive retail industry (and beyond) and assist in monitoring the production service to ensure reliability and performance.


You'll be on a team with a lot of freedom, and as a result, own a lot of responsibility. Take features from conception to completion and become a core member of the development team at every level of the platforms stack!

item.title: Sr. Software Engineer at Intentional Software (Bellevue, WA)
item.description:
Are you the person on your team who is always looking for the precise abstractions to express the solution? Do you believe that the process of writing software applications is far less efficient than it could be? Are you the type who wishes that user interfaces had kept up with the developments in modern graphics hardware, and that the cool UIs in movies were available to people in real life?


Intentional Software Corporation (ISC) is looking for smart developers to contribute to a next-generation software platform and/or applications built using that platform. Our software captures the intent of users and projects it into many useful forms, including direct-manipulation UIs with rich graphics and animation. By conforming to this model, applications automatically acquire a rich set of high-level functionality that few companies can afford to develop themselves.


We are continually improving our platform and are also building flagship applications in-house that leverage and showcase our technology.  We are looking for software engineers who thrive on continually pushing the envelope, and we think we offer one of the best opportunities in the industry to truly apply your skills.

item.title: Software Engineer - Network Function Virtualization Orchestration at Casa Systems, Inc. (Andover, MA)
item.description:
Casa Systems, Inc. seeks to hire another talented Software Engineer to join its SDN/NFV group based in Andover, MA.


The Software Engineer will impact the organization by focusing on Network Function Virtualization (NFV) Orchestration development in accordance with software development practices, procedures and quality standards established by the company. 


ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: 



  • Participate in requirements development and analysis activities.

  • Design and build the orchestration layer for Casa VMs.

  • Review and test software components for adherence to design requirements.

  • Will be responsible for providing full system and software life-cycle support.

item.title: Watson Machine Learning Engineer - AlchemyAPI at AlchemyAPI, an IBM company (Denver, CO)
item.description: Here at AlchemyAPI, we are crafting solutions to some of the most interesting problems in AI today. Are you interested in poring over literature relevant to computer vision and channeling interesting ideas to drive development of impactful products? Have you seen examples of mind-blowing NLP results and wondered how you could replicate them, or to make them better? If the thought of developing, prototyping, and industrializing real applications of AI with deep learning is exciting to you, then we should talk. From the data curation and training of machine learning systems to the preparation of robust and battle-tested object oriented code, the work of a machine learning R&D role at AlchemyAPI is always exciting.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - Python at StorageCraft Technology Corporation (Draper, UT)
item.description:
This is an exciting opportunity for a talented and enthusiastic software engineer who wants to make a difference within a successful, growing company. StorageCraft is looking for a Software Engineer to work on a range of in-house projects. The job provides a degree of freedom that you will not find in larger companies; you will be able to work using multiple software languages and operating systems and help shape the complete design from the ground up. If you are an enthusiastic coder that is looking for a job that makes use of your critical thinking and creativity, then this is it.


DUTIES
You will work within a small, friendly software engineering team and work on a number of critical products and projects. There is always a wide variety of problems that need to be solved so you will be expected to learn and adapt quickly, providing the best solution for each problem. Ideally you are detail-oriented, self-motivated, a problem solver and work well in a fast moving, dynamic work environment.


Minimum Qualifications:



  •  3-5+ years of experience of writing good quality code in C++, C#, Java or similar

  •  Proven experience of writing scripts in Python, batch, Perl and other languages

  •  Solid understanding of coding concepts including object orientated design

  •  Proven experience of both Windows and Linux

  •  Knowledge of various development methodologies including Agile

  •  Knowledge of building and compiling products developed in multiple languages

  •  Knowledge of application deployment technology and installers, including the MSI model and related technology (e.g. Installshield, WiX, NSIS etc.).

  •  Willing and able to learn quickly and work within a team


Knowledge of any of the following is an advantage:



  •  Django 

  •  Virtualization technology 

  •  Experience with complex application build systems and installers

  •  Windows and Linux command line options and utilities

  •  Experience with any test automation frameworks and methodologies

  •  Backup technology, including block-level backups and the VSS framework

  •  SQL database experience

  •  SQL Alchemy

  •  Linux development experience


Education:
Associates or Bachelors Degree in Computer Science or related field or equivalent experience preferred.


EOE/Minorities/Females/Vet/DisabilityThis

item.title: Pre Sales Technical Evangelist at Openmind Networks Inc (Mountain View, CA)
item.description:
Are you a smart, creative, people-oriented engineer? Are you passionate about the software developer community? If so, we’d love to meet you!


Golgi is a cloud service for connectivity and data transport that decreases time to market in delivering IoT Solutions. Developers define their service using Thrift and use Golgi to generate type-safe APIs specific to their needs. Golgi significantly cuts development time and allows the developer to concentrate on adding value to their app or device.



You will be a passionate evangelist for Golgi (http://golgi.io) as well as a champion for developer interests within Openmind Networks. This is a position for engineers who love being out in the wild working with developers around innovative technology.
You will help build and foster the community and help extend the technical direction around the product by being the lead Developer Advocate for Golgi.


Your responsibilities will include the following:


- Educate prospective clients by assessing customers’ needs and recommending solutions that optimize value for both the customer and Golgi - Create momentum and drive the success of Golgi through your interactions with third party developers


- Hands-on coding with developers on-site; 1st line technical support for developers


- Evangelize Golgi by participating in technical presentations on conference panels, at user groups, on social media/blogs/forums, at meetups, through technical articles, etc.


- Generate sample content (demo applications/snippets), tutorials and technical documentation using a variety of development languages and platforms; Publish open-source projects that allow developers, partners and customers to quickly understand and utilize our SDK


- Advocate for developers internally and influence the technical direction and roadmap for Golgi. Work cross-functionally with Engineering, Business Development, and Marketing

item.title: Logistics and Operations Software Engineer at Good Eggs (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
What we’re building:


The Good Eggs operations and logistics team builds the platform that empowers our entire supply chain, from the tools that help our producers know what and when to make products, to the software and hardware that manages the flow of food through our warehouse and delivery network. Our systems go beyond the screen, and include mobile and hardware platforms that help our associates deliver food faster than anyone else in the industry.


How you can help:


We're looking for engineers who are interested in a multidisciplinary engineering environment, and who are excited by building high-scale software that interfaces with equipment and displays on the floor. As an engineer on our team, you'll be responsible for the architecture, design, development, and testing of new tools and equipment we are developing to streamline the process.


How we work:


We run a mature Agile engineering process complete with test-driven development, pair programming and continuous deployment of features throughout the day. Our core platform is built on Node.js, MongoDB, AngularJS, and CoffeeScript. We're in the process of expanding into new domains, including iOS application development and software that runs on embedded devices in our hub (IoT). Don't worry if you haven't done it all: we are happy to train the right person to work in this environment.

item.title: Software Engineer at Amazon (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Why are Software Engineers important at Amazon?
At Amazon, we hire the best minds in technology to innovate and build for the benefit of our customers. That intense focus on customers is why we are one of the world’s most beloved brands – it’s part of our company DNA.

Our challenges are big - impacting millions of Consumers, Sellers, Content Creators, and Developers & Enterprises through countless products – and we are searching for a certain kind of person who is excited by the idea of owning; people who like to build new platforms, features and services from scratch, developers who can manage the ambiguity and pace of a company whose ship cycles are measured in weeks, not years.

We speak multiple languages, working on multiple platforms to solve immensely complex challenges in large-scale computing by using your skills in data structures, algorithms, and object oriented programming. We have a variety of teams to choose from; our opportunities are broader than you might think. You could find yourself working on a small development team in one of our many organizations: Advertising, Amazon Customer Service, Amazon Web Services, Business & Corporate Development, Digital Entertainment, eCommerce Platform, Fulfillment and Operations, Global Corporate Teams, Amazon Devices, Retail, Search and Discovery Technology, Seller Services, or Amazon Subsidiaries.
Amazon is a place where builders build.


What are examples of work that Software Engineers are doing at Amazon?


· Powered companies from Netflix to NASA: Amazon Web Services has provided companies of all sizes with an infrastructure platform in the cloud that powers hundreds of thousands of businesses in 190 countries around the world. Here at AWS, you’ll experience unparalleled ownership and impact on our product development, and be empowered to innovate and deliver.



· Built the Amazon Devices experience: We have gone beyond Kindle, our best-selling e-reader to our powerhouse Fire tablets, built for work and play with our Fire OS operating system. For streaming media lovers, we have created Amazon Fire TV and Fire TV Stick with voice search, massive video selection, and gaming. Exploring new solutions with products such as Amazon Echo, a new category of device designed around your voice with far-field voice recognition, and Amazon Dash, a handheld scanner to help you order groceries from Amazon Fresh.



· We help users find what they want: Amazon Search and Discovery helps hundreds of millions of shoppers spending tens of billions of dollars annually find what they want, get what they need, and discover what they'll love. We are innovators who love to experiment and are obsessed with letting customers tell us what works. We are obsessed with automation, and leverage technologies and massive amounts of data and machine learning to delight our customers. Work on Prime Air, Prime Now, or other customer solutions to help us define the future.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Sorenson Media (Draper, UT)
item.description:
We are looking for a team player.  We are not looking for a rock star or ninja.  We succeed as a team.  We are looking for a self-driven, world-class software engineer seeking excellence to contribute to the design and development of a varied and sophisticated application—the glue in a system to ingest, process, store, and deliver large amounts of data.


Our team is a high-functioning, agile team strictly adhering to the scrum process. We are self-organized and peer-based. We prioritize technical debt, technical improvements, and bugs—not just features. We highly value testing. We work on concise stories with unambiguous acceptance criteria.  Our executives understand the impact of mid-sprint interruptions and allow us to focus on producing world-class technical solutions.


You will be collaborating closely with data engineers and video engineers to ensure that the system satisfies requirements and is robust and scalable.  You will have significant influence in deciding which technologies are chosen throughout the system.  We are confident you will find satisfaction working with our team to bring innovative technologies to fruition.

item.title: Cloud Systems Engineer at mParticle (Boca Raton, FL) (allows remote)
item.description:
We are looking for a skilled Cloud Systems Engineer who will be responsible for supporting our growing application infrastructure. The candidate will be responsible for maintaining strict production SLAs of a custom distributed application running on AWS cloud infrastructure, monitoring, alerting, incident management, SOP, capacity planning, change management, security, and overall platform stability and improvement.
 
The ideal candidate will have a deep technical understanding of Linux operating systems and at least an intermediate understanding of Windows operating systems, strong experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS), advanced scripting skills, experience with variety of monitoring solutions, deep understanding of network communications and excellent troubleshooting skills.


Finally, we are seeking someone who wants to be a major contributor in a small, dynamic work environment, loves a challenge, and has a strong balance of technical and people skills.
 
The Cloud Systems Engineer will be responsible for:



  • Maintain, monitor, and improve the performance and availability of the 24x7 production environment including networks, servers, databases, etc.

  • Participate in on-call rotation and provide hands-on support during emergencies, outages, and service transitions.

  • Define and monitor compliance to production environment SLAs.

  • Participate in creating long-term and short term strategies for scaling the production environment.

  • Adhere to a comprehensive incident management program including problem management.

  • Generate KPIs for service availability, uptime, and adherence to SOPs, and SLAs.

item.title: Looking for New Talent! C++ (Associate) Developer for the SAP HANA database team at SAP SE (Walldorf, Deutschland)
item.description:
COMPANY DESCRIPTION

SAP is the global market leader for business software and thus contributes a considerable part of the world's economic power grid. At SAP you get your chance to put your ideas into action with maximum impact.The SAP HANA in-memory database is the basis for new, ground-breaking SAP applications and is widely agreed to be a highly valuable asset in the SAP software portfolio. In-memory computing is made possible through recent technology advances in main memory, multi-core processing, and data management. It leverages technology innovation to establish real-time analysis of business data and combines both transactions and analytics to improve existing business processes with a dramatic increase in performance. The SAP HANA in-memory database as basis for the in-memory computing shows enormous promise as a key driver for SAP market of the future. The development of the SAP HANA in-memory database is distributed over all continents. You will be part of the development team in Walldorf with more than 100 exceptionally talented and motivated colleagues. We live code development in a flexible and agile way. You will be part of small and self-organized groups of developer.

EXPECTATIONS AND TASKS

We seek for developers with strong focus in C++ system or application programming. The main task of the job is to drive and implement development topic as part of a development team inside the core of the SAP HANA in-memory database. You can expect to work on some of the following tasks:
- Write meticulous software implementations in classical main memory database areas such as compression algorithms, distribution algorithms or query processing as well as in domain specific extensions like processing of geo spatial information, graph processing, hierarchical information processing or database programming languages
- Write basic regression tests for your own code using different programming languages (e.g. C++, Python, SQL) and testing frameworks (e.g. Google C++ Testing Framework)
- Do code reviews and code audits to spot opportunities for improvements with respect to usability, testability, supportability, or potential performance penalties

WORK EXPERIENCE

- 0 - 2 years
- We are looking for candidates who are committed to a technology career path. Your set of application documents should contain a cover letter and CV, copies of the obtained degrees and references

EDUCATION AND QUALIFICATION / SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES

Required skills:
- Strong C++ programming skills
- University degree in computer science or related technical discipline
- Basic knowledge on relational database management systems
- Excellent German and English both spoken and written
- Willingness to analyze and debug complex problems
- Good communication skills Preferred skills:
- Experience in Administration, Programming or Profiling on Linux
- Knowledge of code-analysis tools e.g. Valgrind, Intel Amplifier, Cppchecker
- Experience with continuous integration concepts and tools e.g. Git, Gerrit
- Python or Shell-Scripting programming skills
- Working experience in the area of system or application programming with C++ (eg. internship or working student experience)
- Knowledge in architecture of relational database management systems101014132

item.title: Lead/Senior .NET Developer (Full Stack) at Frontpoint (Vienna, VA)
item.description:
Are you seeking the freedom to creatively solve interesting problems while also engineering something that genuinely makes a difference? Join the company that brought technological advancement to the home security industry!


We’re looking for a Lead/Senior .NET web developer to join our rapidly growing development team. This is a fast paced, enterprise scale, B2C environment. Our developers build software for all components of the organization. This involves heavy front-end web development for systems that are both internally and externally facing, integration with back-end third party APIs, analytical services, & tons of data. We use the latest versions of all our tools and do our best to keep up with the rapid evolution of JavaScript and other front-end frameworks. If you like a start-up culture without the start-up risk, you’ll love working at Frontpoint!


Responsibilities



  • Perform & lead development of complex software applications

  • Write tons of code across the full stack – front end Web UI, middle tier service layer, and back end database

  • Perform analysis of requirements and design

  • Create and execute unit tests and perform basic systems testing

  • Participate in peer code reviews and technical meetings

  • Mentor engineers in coding practices and process

  • Work in an Agile Scrum team process, collaborating closely with fellow developers, DBAs, QA, team leads, and stakeholders

  • Troubleshoot and support system and application problems

item.title: Software Engineer - Java Back End Development at Tillster, Inc. (San Diego, CA)
item.description:
Software Engineer - Java Backend Development (Mid to Senior level) 



RELOCATION ASSISTANCE AVAILABLE


RIGHT TO WORK IN US REQUIRED.  WILL TRANSFER EXISTING H1-B



We are a successful and well-funded growth company in beautiful, sunny, San Diego, CA with sub-offices in Los Angeles and Alpharetta, GA. Due to continued company growth we are looking to hire some key Java Developers to join our growing team. You will have 5+ years or more of overall Java Engineering experience to join our Enterprise Ordering Systems group. You’ll be engaged in hands-on coding, managing process, procedure and projects.

At Amazon, we hire the best minds in technology to innovate and build for the benefit of our customers. That intense focus on customers is why we are one of the world’s most beloved brands – it’s part of our company DNA.

item.title: Senior Test Automation Engineer - Atlanta / Alpharetta at Intelligrated Software (Alpharetta, GA)
item.description:
This position will be responsible for the development and support of automation applications. Responsible for applying expertise in tools and methodologies to develop the requirements, procedures and guidelines for the automation testing efforts of all Intelligrated software applications prior to deployment to ensure they are performing according to specifications and are free of errors. This includes defining the automation test plan and strategy, testing environment, scenarios, creating/modifying scripts and data required, executing tests, and reporting on findings. Also responsible for organizing the resources necessary to prepare and execute tests and reporting back to the development team on issues to be addressed as required. This may include automation of testing processes, and the identification and management of testing tools and standards.  In addition this person will:



  • Work with development to ensure their code and the test automation code will interact efficiently together

  • Be responsible and accountable for one or more of the major components of the test automation framework; this will include the design, development, delivery, maintenance and evolution of these components

  • Develop and maintain test script requirements

  • Review broken scripts for suites and resolves/fixes them

  • Identifies vulnerabilities in automated testing and defines and manages plans to mitigate risk

  • Deliver project assignments on time, within budget and with high quality

  • Participate in the automation feasibility analysis for new systems/applications

  • Propose the acquisition of new testing tools to management

  • Participate in the Agile software development cycle, including meetings, iterative development, estimations and design sessions

  • Create the automation test plan for a project, conceiving of the testing strategy and approach

  • Be responsible for the creation of all project level automation test plans, detailed test plan, or phase level plans such as component, system, integration or user acceptance test plan

item.title: Software Engineer, Embedded Systems at SolarCity (San Mateo, CA)
item.description: SolarCity is seeking a highly talented and versatile software engineer to develop technologies that enable wide scale deployment of renewable energy generation.   You will be part of a fast-paced and dedicated engineering team that develops embedded software and hardware systems for solar monitoring, energy storage and energy efficiency applications. Most of the software you develop will be in Python on embedded Linux platforms.  The ideal candidate will be an excellent programmer, have some experience with remote data acquisition and control, and be adept at rapidly learning and implementing new technologies.  Your work will affect every single one of our customers that have chosen clean, low cost energy.

item.title: Software Developer (1 - 5 years experience) - Multiple Openings at Power Advocate, Inc. (Boston, MA)
item.description:
Looking for an opportunity to work alongside the Senior Technology team of a leading-edge Big Data SaaS technology and consulting company that provides market intelligence to the energy industry? Interface with our Executives, Product Owners and Senior Software Developers? Work on a team in a culture that fosters individual responsibility and team success? Interested in emerging Big Data technologies?


If you like to work independently and be a player on a dynamic team in a SCRUM environment, if you want to expand your software development skill sets and have opportunities for career advancement, we have the job for you!


SUMMARY: PowerAdvocate is seeking a dynamic individual to join a high performing software development team. Work with code to develop functionality as requested by product owner and our customers as well as work as a key member in a self-organizing SCRUM team, which focuses on continuous improvement and short, iterative development cycles and produces 98%+ bug-free releases.


ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES: In addition to the following, other duties may be assigned to meet business needs.



  • Analyze and design applications

  • Write software to solve problems for customers

  • Working on front-end web development using Java, jQuery, ExtJS, Css, and HTML

  • Working on back-end website service using Java development, an Oracle database, Spring, EJB, MVC, Hibernate, Solr and Single-Sign-On.

  • Have fun!

item.title: Engineering Manager - Technical leader for a Music Software Company at BMAT Music Innovation (Barcelona, Spain)
item.description:
BMAT is an innovative and fast growing software company with a team of young and international tech/music lovers located in the sunny Barcelona.


We are looking for an Engineering Manager who has the mission of leading outstanding technical teams like R&D, IT, Software Development, among others, to guarantee the quality in our product development and services for the music industry. You will report to the Board and works closely with other functional leaders in the company, being responsible for the translation of the company strategy to the technical team, managing them with a hands-on behavior to achieve the objectives in the expected timing and quality. You will be the responsible for all of the company’s product development activities and the satisfaction of the team members.


Essential Duties & Responsibilities



  • Develop strategic planning, direction and control of product development activities.

  • Provide technical direction and guidance, as well as hands-on project management, for all product development.

  • Ensure the optimal application of technology and engineering resources to meet product development and/or customer requirements

  • Detects conflicts and risks, find solutions and report them.

  • Ensure that the product is fully and correctly defined and documented.

  • Hire, coach and direct team members to acquire necessary resources to meet scheduled commitments.

  • Represent the company managing the customers during the process of product development and maintenance.

item.title: Senior PHP Software Engineer at The Idea People (Charlotte, NC)
item.description: The Idea People are looking for an experienced web developer. You will be responsible for delivering applications that drive cutting-edge technology development. You will be responsible for the creation and implementation of a wide variety of web-based products using PHP, JavaScript, HTML5, and MySQL/NoSQL. Our team enjoys challenges and thrives on cool design delivery.

item.title: Senior Enterprise Technical Program Manager at Time Inc. (New York, NY)
item.description:
The job:


Are you looking for a position where you can use your technical program management skill to deliver experiences that impact millions of customers? Are you a well-organized technical problem solver with great project management skills? Do you have a computer hardware or software engineering background? The ideal candidate has a track record of delivering large-scale, high-complexity technical projects on time, on budget, and to specification. S/he should be experienced with agile and waterfall methodologies and adept at following a “thin vertical slices” approach to product development. The ideal candidate is a good problem solver with 7 to 10 years of technical program management experience who is also an expert in project management. Core Responsibilities:In this role, you will be responsible for leading and implementing enterprise scale software projects with strategic data and analytic components and helping to optimize effective program management practices for Time Inc.


You will:



  • Start with a defined problem and work with a team to design and implement highly available technical solutions.

  • Work with other engineering team members to troubleshoot and fine-tune technical solutions.

  • Create effective and achievable project plans including workstreams, timelines, scope, and communications and status reporting plans.

  • Be the “go to person” for everything relating to the projects you own.

  • Interface with work stream and media teams and represent the core project team to review and manage deliverables to completion.

  • Deliver regular status updates with core team members and executives including reporting on key project activities, milestones, and escalating and solving real-time problems.

  • Schedule team meetings and publish all meeting minutes.

  • Ensure action items are properly assigned and completed with appropriate due dates.

  • Escalate project issues and risks where appropriate, and assure problem resolution.

  • Present project health to Executive Steering Committee on a regular basis.

  • Work with the program management team to design and implement simple sustainable project management and governance systems.

item.title: Back- End Web Developer at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI)
item.description:
Back-End Web Developer



Michigan State University (MSU) is seeking an innovative and creative Back-End Web Developer responsible for managing the interchange of data between the application and the browser. This role focuses on the server side of programming for the web, yet also requires understanding the programming languages that control the display of content in the browser.



Responsibilities


The Back-End Web Developer:



  • Integrates user-facing elements developed by front-end developers with server-side logic

  • Develops and modifies object-oriented frameworks both inside and outside of a CMS

  • Builds reusable code and libraries

  • Develops front-end code that meets or exceeds WCAG 2.0 AA and W3C web standards

  • Develops applications that interface with web services

  • Implements security and data protection

  • Provides detailed estimates of time and resources required to meet project objectives

item.title: Senior Quality Assurance Engineer at HBC Digital (New York, NY)
item.description:
As a Senior QA Engineer, your day to day activities include: developing test scripts, executing tests and analyzing results, solving complex problems, providing/evaluating solution options, collaborating with IT teams, researching new products and/or working on internal projects. Your job requires ability to: manage multiple tasks with competing priorities, adapt to changes in scope or schedule, work under tight timelines, be creative in working through obstacles, effectively communicate, collaborate with business and technical teams, and deliver on time. You are expected to know how to effectively manage a project from planning to delivery. You can be assigned individual project or participate in group project, in a lead or contributor capacity. Additionally, you are responsible for administrating of QA systems and tools. Last but not least, you will be conducting performance/load testing, and/or assigned functional projects.

Requirement:


  • Proficient with HTML, JavaScript, and CSS.

  • Fluent in Object Oriented Design and Object Oriented Programming.

  • Proficient in a high level programming language (Java/C# - prefer Java).

  • Ability to maintain/enhance existing (complex) Java code.

  • Familiar with Windows Server and Linux Operating System.

  • Proficient with SQL and able to create DB table schema, stored procedure, and trigger.

  • Good knowledge of system networking (understand switch, router, load balancer, network monitoring, etc.

  • Background in performance/load testing ecommerce architecture.

  • Knowledgeable of the various data exchange formats like XML, JSON, etc.

  • Ability to analyze complex data sets (log analysis, network package analysis, etc.

  • Familiarity with Continuous Deployment and Continuous Integration.

  • Ability to lead a technical team.

  • Ability to solve complex problems and recommend solution options.

  • Project management and time management skills.

  • Ability to effectively communicate with business and technical audiences.

  • Capable of multi-tasking and working through multiple priorities.

  • Self-starter, go-getter, and team player.

  • Flexible to work extended hours or off-hours when needed.

item.title: Software Engineer - Quality Assurance Developer at Ontoit Holdings Ltd (London, UK)
item.description:
Ontoit is looking for an energetic and proactive Software Engineer responsible for developing the core of Ontoit's semantic search engine platform. In this critical and exciting phase of Ontoit's growth, you will be an integral contributor in forming the future of our company.


At Ontoit, we work in various fields of computer science, including machine learning, natural language processing, graph technologies, knowledge representation (ontologies), distributed systems, and web applications. The core technologies that we use include, but is not limited to, Apache Storm, Neo4J, CoreNLP, Apache Spark, Apache Cassandra and Java Spring. As a Quality Assurance Developer, you will be developing automated test suites for the development in these various fields. In conjunction with the CEO and key team members you will be involved in driving the design of automated test systems, creating test cases, and responsible for developing high quality test code for challenging algorithmic back end development.


The compensation for this position will be in the range of £30-40,000 per annum plus potentially equity options, all depending on the experience and skill level of the successful applicant.


Ontoit will accept applications for this position until 18th September, 2015.

item.title: Developer, Baseball Systems at Cleveland Indians Baseball Company (Cleveland, OH)
item.description:
The Cleveland Indians are seeking a Developer of Baseball Systems to join the Baseball Software Development team in building baseball applications and transitioning existing systems to web and mobile applications. We are looking for someone to collaborate with Baseball personnel, along with colleagues and peers on the Information Systems team, to rapidly deliver working software and tools for Baseball users. The position can focus on ideation, delivery, break/fix and everything in between.


RESPONSIBILITIES & DUTIES:
• Work closely with Baseball Operations and Information Systems personnel to design, develop, and improve new and existing baseball applications
• Create tests and documentation for bug fixes and new application features/functions
• Design and develop dashboards and various analytical tools to directly support front office and field personnel
• Build and/or support mobile-friendly user interfaces and experiences
• Build and/or support web services and business-layer applications that speak to both back end databases and front–end interfaces
• Provide development support and guidance to Baseball Operations power users and general support to all Baseball Ops front-office and field personnel, as needed
• Examine and where appropriate, prototype new technologies in the pursuit of creating competitive advantages through software, applications and tools
• Work closely with Data Architects and Infrastructure/Operations resources on the Information Systems team to ensure secure, scalable and high-performing applications

item.title: Software Developer Specialist at NASDAQ (Philadelphia, PA)
item.description:
Description of Group:


Global Technology Services (GTS) is committed to maintaining NASDAQ’s technology leadership position by developing and delivering innovative, cost efficient and short time-to-market technology solutions to our business partners and customers. GTS provides technology and tools to the NASDAQ MarketWatch teams around the world.


The NASDAQ MarketWatch department conducts two major functions — disclosure and compliance — to maintain an orderly marketplace and a level playing field for market participants, investors and the general public. In an effort to foster marketplace integrity, the MarketWatch department oversees the complete and timely disclosure of material information by NASDAQ-listed issuers. In addition, MarketWatch monitors compliance with NASDAQ rules and policies through real-time surveillance of price and volume information reported by market participants.


Typical Job Functions:



  • Assist in the design, development, and support of Nasdaq's MarketWatch Surveillance and related current and future applications.

  • Translate business requirements into well-designed and documented software components based on a mix of technologies (Java EE, AngularJS, Jersey, Junit, Postgres, MySQL, Microsoft SQL Server, etc.)

  • Work closely with NASDAQ Marketwatch, infrastructure support, and development teams

  • Provide major contributions to the overall architecture of MarketWatch tools with a focus on scalability, maintainability and performance

  • Participate in all phases of the lifecycle of software application development with an emphasis on architecture, design, quality, code reviews and implementation

item.title: Application Security Engineer at New Relic (Portland, OR)
item.description:
Are you ready for your next security challenge? New Relic is growing our world-class security team, and you have the opportunity to be part of it!


If you want to work in a dynamic environment with fast paced adoption of innovative technologies that creates a constant flow of new security challenges - then we have the job for you!


We are looking for passionate security professionals that want to be part of an exciting company that values employee empowerment, experimentation, and work-life balance. The right person will be driven to solve complex security challenges, push their skills, and learn new ones.


In this role, you will be responsible for promoting, designing, and evaluating application security in all phases of the development life cycle. You will work with groups and individuals from across the company, including development, support, and QA. More importantly, you will be on the leading edge of defining how to do security right in a continuous-deployment, cloud-based environment.


In this role, your responsibilities will include:



  • Identifying security issues and risks across New Relic's products and services via threat modeling, design and code reviews, and security testing

  • Working with engineers to build secure software, addressing and mitigating security issues and risks

  • Evaluating designing, and implementing security tools and automation, including monitoring

  • Participating in security incident handling

  • Evangelizing and building awareness of security throughout the development organization, including providing training

item.title: Team Lead, Automation Development at Rogue Wave Software Canada Inc. (Ottawa, ON, Canada)
item.description:
Reporting to the Manager of Quality Assurance, the Team Lead will lead the automation test developers to test, validate, automate and support Rogue Wave Software’s product suite. This position is responsible for cultivating and enhancing the products’ quality and current processes, while actively maintaining and analyzing the project schedules. This position will also require the influencing and mentoring of QA professionals, providing technical solutions when needed. We are seeking a rock star team leader with the technical and leadership know-how to get things done.


Core duties and responsibilities:



  • Development, execution and analysis of automated test plans



  • Write automation tests in various development languages to validate software functionality and identify errors/non-compliance

  • Executes test cases and gathers statistics to allow for analysis of test data

  • Monitors and completes in depth analysis of test data to identify incorrect tool behavior and causes

  • Ensure the quality and productivity of the team

  • Provide technical/process guidance on how to test complicated features

  • Work to implement and improve standards, guidelines and best practices for test activities

  • Lead, motivate and engage a team of star testers

  • Build the team capability through coaching and development

  • Coordinate scheduling across groups; project planning

  • Assist QA manager in determining resource requirements

  • Participates in code reviews of peers and creating/updating and recommending changes to our coding standards

  • Identify, create plans and implement innovative ideas that create efficiencies and increase quality

  • Issues status report to manager describing results

  • Make a difference every day.

item.title: Work Hard, Have Fun, Be Nice at TechEmpower (El Segundo, CA)
item.description:
Let's be honest: you became a developer because you like to build things. Interesting things, useful things, cool things. It's like building with Legos, only you get paid, and there are always plenty of the right color pieces.


At TechEmpower, we build things. Interesting things. Cool things, mostly in webapp form. We build them as individuals, because we're creative people. We build them as teams, because we like to help each other grow, and because we know that collaboration improves even the best code.


Having the best people doesn't hurt, either. We've got most of them already, and we're looking to find the rest. You can build things with us. What's the catch? We're pretty darn selective.


To work as an individual, you have to be motivated and creative and thoughtful and serious. To work on a team, you have to be respectful and energetic and open and absolutely not a jerk. We need developers who can work on every part of an application, from the data store to the page–sometimes known as full stack developers. And to be a full stack developer, you have to know technology and want to learn more technology, because those acronyms just keep coming.


Our clients expect us to work with them, not for them. We help them define their problems, and we provide solutions, on time and on target. We're service-oriented, and you should be too.


Still reading? Please apply! And check out our Web Framework Benchmarks while you're at it.  We pretty much wrote the book on that one.


Just so you know:



  • Teams range between 2-6 people

  • Developers are exposed to up to 2-3 projects per year, one project at a time

  • All development is done on high-performance workstations with 4K displays. A lot of code fits in 3840x2160 pixels!

  • We maintain an informal, comfortable environment, just like the old college computer science lab, but with grown-up hours

  • Everybody's nice

item.title: Software Development Engineer in Test - Senior Staff at Motorola Solutions (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
Software Development Engineer in Test -  Senior Staff


Location: Seattle, WA


We are a small agile team that works like a startup within a big company. Motorola Solutions is known around the world for innovation in Enterprise Mobility, Public Safety and Wireless Infrastructure. We are leading the next wave of innovations that enable people, enterprises and governments to be more connected and more mobile. This position is in the Core applications development group based in Seattle, responsible for creating the WAVE platform used for critical communications around the globe.



Our office has a great downtown location looking directly out onto Puget Sound, Olympic Sculpture Park and Elliott Bay Trail. We provide secure, covered, paid parking, dog Fridays and summer BBQs on the deck!



Responsibilities:


-Designing and building automated software testing frameworks in C# that verify the integrity of a critical voice communications platform


-Plan, create and run manual functional, integration, performance and security tests in a Windows environment


- Be a sysadmin for your test network, including configuring Windows servers, hypervisors, switches and troubleshooting data and audio routing using Wireshark


- Work as part of an Agile development/test team


- Influence and guide the team’s automated testing approach

item.title: Lead Application Developer (Java) at ADP (Pasadena, CA)
item.description:
With ADP building a start up culture in Pasadena we are able to accelerate new products focused on Customer Driven Design, Data Visualization, Social, Mobile and Digital Payments. In Pasadena we are building a culture driven by "LeanStartup" principles with co-located teams, empowered to make decisions and fail fast along the way. Our goal for the Pasadena Innovation Labs is to have small teams with development, design and product focused on BIG customers problems with simple elegant solutions our customers will LOVE.


We are seeking diverse Java Engineering talent with different experiences, backgrounds, education, creative expertise, technical acumen, etc. that will offer new perspectives and challenge convention as we focus on the future of ADP for years to come.


The Lead Software Engineer will work in a team of Java engineers to create scalable and robust SmartCompliance backend applications and services. We are using the Java with Spring framework building RESTful webservices and other application services. This is the perfect time for an enthusiastic engineer to add your knowledge of API's, RESTful webservices and various technologies to the team so that we can deliver a superior user experience to ADP SmartCompliance users!


We strive for every interaction to be driven by our CORE values: Insightful Expertise, Integrity is Everything, Service Excellence, Inspiring Innovation, Each Person Counts, Results-Driven, & Social Responsibility.


RESPONSIBILITIES:



  • Join a team of talented software engineers, plan, execute and deliver top quality software deliverables on-time.

  • Act as a primary, dedicated technology interface owning the technical responsibility for architecture, analysis, design, development, and implementation of responsive user interface. 

  • Work closely with product to define and implement and improve user experience.

  • Overall, you will be responsible for day-to-day task management and sprint planning, working closely with product and stakeholders, participating in design sessions, leading and mentoring engineers to ensure that they follow best practices and guidelines, performing heads-down development, working on technical integrations with frontend UIs and other Backend APIs, and working with QA to assure top quality deliverables on-time.

item.title: Senior Full Stack Engineer at Triggr Health (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
What does this role entail? You’ll be responsible for defining, building, and supporting a platform that reaches people when they are most at-risk and empowers them through the extraordinarily challenging recovery journey. It is an incredibly exciting role as you will be working with cutting-edge technology on a number of products that span: consumer and enterprise; mobile and desktop; external and internal; user-driven and automated; and practical and academic areas. The challenges you will face are new and exciting and will require you to think holistically about how the platform interacts with an incredibly diverse set of stakeholders.


More specifically, we are building apps on both Android and iOS, a customer-facing web application, a robust web services API, machine learning-driven analytics, and large-scale data processing. As a full-stack engineer, you must be hyper-focused on how the product impacts every patient, provider, and team member.


You will need to understand when trade-offs are necessary: we are growing very quickly, but quality is of critical importance given our mission. You will continuously iterate on our products in order to improve the long-term outcomes of the patients in our program. You will also be integral to forming and developing our culture in addition to helping hire all-star teammates to make Triggr Health an awesome place to work! Most importantly, you must have a strong desire to be a part of a mission-driven company and believe that with the right team, technology, and values, anything is possible.


This position requires someone who understands and embraces the fact that the “user” is a real person with a severe health condition. The work we are doing is incredibly exciting because the impact we can have is massive, but it also requires extra care and increased responsibility to ensure every decision we make reflects this understanding.

item.title: Full Stack JavaScript Developer at New Visions for Public Schools (New York, NY)
item.description:
New Visions for Public Schools is looking for a Full Stack Developer to join our CloudLab Team, whose role will be to provide technical leadership around the analysis, design,development, testing, implementation and  integration of secure REST APIs and service-oriented web applications in both client and server-side Javascript frameworks (Angular JS, Node JS, Hapi) with backends in both MongoDb and Postgres.  The New Visions CloudLab Team designs, builds and maintains web applications that respond to educator needs and supports school leaders in effectively integrating data and technology. This team’s work is integral to New Visions’ direct support to nearly 200 public NYC high  schools in modernizing their tech  infrastructure to improve the responsiveness and quality of operations, instruction and student support. The problems we are solving are challenging and interesting and affect urban schools everywhere.  We are looking for an engineer excited about public service and the prospect of joining a fun and growing team in an open and transparent, collaborative, supportive, and diverse environment. 


Essential Job Functions



  • Leadership, Vision, and Communication

  • Help lead the New Visions CloudLab in its evolution from a leading non-profit edtech laboratory to a software development operation that employs smart practices and technologies to create scalable solutions for schools around the world.

  • Play a visionary role in the design and communication of a software architecture that will leverage modern Javascript frameworks to allow the optimum blend of flexibility, security, and scale.

  • Play a leadership role on a team of four engineers in adopting continuous integration and test driven development techniques and best practices to improve the stability of both our existing and future tools.

  • Provide ongoing guidance as we explore and wrestle with the inevitable trade-offs between  scalability vs. flexibility, complexity vs. user capacity, utilities vs. out of the box solutions, etc.

  • Play, teach, and learn with us in search of the most agile and sustainable ways to organize the fun that is our work.


Software Design and Development



  • Work directly with the School Tools and Systems Development team on discovery, specification, implementation, user-feedback, and iteration of applications that gain adoption and improve schools by winning hearts and minds.

  • Collaborate with relevant New Visions staff within iterative design cycles that are coupled to data coaching and school-facing relationships that ground product development in the careful qualitative appraisal and optimization of user-experience, as well as rigorous analysis of resultant usage analytics and student performance data.

  • Develop secure REST APIs and service-oriented applications in both client and server-side Javascript frameworks (Angular JS, Node JS, Hapi) with backends in both MongoDb and Postgres

item.title: Senior Frontend Engineer for Onefootball at Onefootball GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
While being the latest platform launched by Onefootball, our web app (https://app.onefootball.com) is at the centre of our sharing infrastructure and an important source of information for football fans on both mobile and desktop. 

Your Role


You’ll join our web team and work directly on the existing code base of the web application and the related administration tools. The product is fresh enough so that we don’t have a lot of cumbersome legacy code and we follow the industry’s best practices to keep the job pleasant. We're always open to suggestions and expect you to use your experience to constantly improve our product. You should be fun to work with and like to learn and teach everyday. Also we value pragmatism and intellectual curiosity. Since you'd be working closely with other teams from different departments, your job is to make sure your voice is heard both inside and outside your field of expertise.

The position is located in our awesome football office in Berlin. We offer free drinks and food and great team events such as tech talks, football public viewings, sport events, lunch roulette and of course support with relocation and Visa application processes.

Who we’re looking for


You are passionate about programming and have already successfully developed products for a large and diversified user base. You ideally have more than 4 years of experience in coding for the web, a solid background in computer science concepts and a good understanding of the entire lifecycle from design, engineering to release and maintenance.

You master unit testing and respective frontend developer tools (we use bower + grunt + less but any similar variation is fine). You have a good comprehension of browser performances, UX across multiple screen sizes and you are attentive to details. Ideally, you have gained a significant experience with AngularJS.

If this sounds like you, we’d love to hear from you. And if you’re a football fan, all the better.

item.title: Python Developer at Esri (Redlands, CA)
item.description:
Are you an exceptional, driven, and passionate Python developer who also has knowledge and experience with C++ or C#? Join our agile and innovative team responsible for designing and developing next-gen Esri software.



Responsibilities:



  • Create Python packages and modules that follow the Python and industry-standard design patterns

  • Design, develop, and maintain Python packages for GIS analysis, data management, and visualization workflows

  • Develop a new robust and rich Python window for computing analysis and mapping workflows in ArcGIS for Desktop

  • Find, analyze, and fix bugs/performance problems whenever and wherever they occur

  • Build and ship quality software by working effectively with members of other software development teams in an agile, highly interactive, and creative environment

item.title: Mobile Engineer at SOLS (New York, NY)
item.description:
Our mobile app is a core component of our platform.  Today, it enables our providers to prescribe SOLS.  Tomorrow, it will enable anyone, anywhere to order SOLS for themselves and their friends.  It will also be the connection to our Smart SOLS to help our users monitor their daily walking habits and improvements.  We are looking for engineers who want to help us build an app that our customers will love to use.  Success in this role requires a combination of initiative, technical capability, and passion to deliver.  We are looking for people who can demonstrate the following skills, talents, and experiences:



  • A passion for turning an idea into something tangible through elegant, maintainable code

  • Experience building, deploying, and maintaining mobile apps and mobile platforms

  • Comfort and experience working beyond Objective-C.  Our stack includes python, PHP, and C++, so its important that you are willing to get your hands dirty with other components when needed to get your job done.

  • An appreciation for agile, testing, and shipping products frequently

item.title: Senior Software Engineer (Java, Large-Scale Distributed Systems) at Jasper (Santa Clara, CA)
item.description:
Jasper is a fast-growing pre-IPO company headquartered in Santa Clara, CA. We are the pioneer and global leader in cloud-based platforms for the Internet of Things (IoT). We deliver the world’s only purpose-built IoT platform, empowering enterprises and mobile operators of all sizes to deploy and grow successful connected service businesses.


We are actively hiring Java Software Engineers at all levels. If you think you have what it takes to be a Jasper Player, please take a look at our job description and send us your resume. 


Responsibilities:



  • Design, implement and maintain the system

  • Convert business requirements into technical requirements and communicate those goals effectively to your team

  • Work closely with other Lead Developers and Architects to define application APIs exposed to other internal or 3rd party applications

  • Own component software designed, documented, built, and deployed

  • Fully automated unit tests as per Jasper Software Standards

  • Create designs that fulfill functional requirements while ensuring scalability, performance and maintainability for the application

item.title: Sr Application Security Engineer at NetSuite (San Mateo, CA)
item.description:
Summary:
As a senior security engineer you will focus on finding and fixing vulnerabilities, promoting good security practices, and designing security frameworks for use by NetSuite developers. The ideal candidate loves both building and breaking software. This is a job where details matter, and there are a lot of details, including all of web security, mobile security, cloud security and software security. You must be able to tell the difference between a big problem, a minor weakness, and a false positive. You must help developers understand security concepts and security practices. You need to be friendly but uncompromising when it comes to getting security right.


Responsibilities:
• Identify, reproduce, and report security issues
• Do security reviews for feature design/implementations
• Design and implement Security APIs

item.title: Customer Integration Engineer at NuData Security (Vancouver, BC, Canada)
item.description:
NuData Security is looking for developers who have a flare for coding and way with words to join our Customer Success Team.   


NuData Security is a leader in web and mobile risk-based behavioral analytics. We are headquartered in downtown Vancouver, British Columbia, and our client base includes Fortune 50 companies, giving us a global footprint.


This customer-facing role integrates the NuData SaaS solution into client interfaces, the trusted guide before, during and after onboarding. Provide one-on-one assistance for customer calls, participate and lead project meetings, even travel on site for customer integrations. You’ll sharpen your coding skills writing code samples for customers, tweaking systems during implementation, following up with solid QA verification, and build product plugins for third-party web application frameworks. It’s beyond customer support – it’s customized customer integrations, an integral part of our product.


This is a permanent, full-time, in-office position.  


Qualification and Experience 



  • Minimum 4 years software development experience in a professional development setting;

  • Expert level knowledge and experience with at least one of the following programming languages with emphasis on object-oriented development: PHP, Java, C#, C++, Python; the primary development will be in PHP so at least some prior experience with PHP is required;

  • Strong knowledge of HTTP, RESTful services, Javascript, JSON, HTML/CSS, Web Application Development;

  • Experience designing and developing high availability, scalable web services with both SQL and NoSQL databases;

  • Experience with scalable/cloud-based software platforms, Amazon Web Services experience would be an asset;

  • Background in use of logging and monitoring support for server-based software components;

  • Basic understanding of Internet Security, Online Behavioral Analysis, and Machine Learning;

  • Exceptional understanding of data structures;

  • Strong software design, written and verbal communication skills;

  • Ability to lead customer engagements without supervision;

  • Bachelors of Computer Science or equivalent degree.


What we offer in return includes a beautiful view of the North Shore mountains, coffee that doesn’t suck, and colleagues that are as brilliant as they are likeable. We do cool things as a company. You know, like sword fighting, pinball playing, craft beer tastings. Plus all that normal stuff like a competitive salary, extended health benefits, flex-time schedules, and a work environment that encourages and supports professional development.  


If this sounds like you, apply and tell us why you’re the best candidate for the job.  


(Our focus currently on candidates that are either already in or willing to relocate to the Vancouver area, and who are already eligible to work in Canada.)

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Crytek GmbH (Frankfurt, Germany)
item.description:
Crytek is looking for an experience Senior Software Engineer to support our Web / Publishing team.


As a Senior Software Engineer, you will be responsible for working on the design, development and ongoing support for game, application and tools technologies used by Cytek’s games-as-a-service (GaaS).


The successful candidate will be an experienced engineer in developing game technologies and have an interest in distributed systems, multiplayer games, databases, tools development and game client technologies.


Responsibilities:
