  • Develop, support and iterate on the integration of company products.

  • Creating a reliable and high performance online service which stands for quality.

  • Work directly with Crytek studios to resolve technical issues.

  • Participate in the scoping and sizing of tasks.

  • Work towards the goal of shared common technologies where applicable.

  • Ensure appropriate, accurate and up-to-date technical documentation.

  • Debug, reproduce and triage bugs to create solutions.

  • Take ownership for building and maintaining platform tools.

  • Contribute to making self-publishing a success.

item.title: Senior Full Stack Software Engineer at V12 Group (Red Bank, NJ)
item.description:
The Senior Software Engineer will be accountable for leading a small team as well as developing and maintaining key modules of the V12 Group's suite of SaaS applications. The Engineer will be working on a variety of applications and next generation products.

Responsibilities



  • Design, develop and modify modules based on functional and system requirements

  • Work closely with Product Owner for understanding the functional and system requirements

  • Work closely with Software Engineers to ensure architectural integrity and product quality

  • Mentor junior engineers in development methodologies and best practices

  • Participate in testing process through unit testing and bug fixes

  • All other duties as assigned

item.title: Senior Java Software Engineer at EcoSys (New York, NY)
item.description:
Be heard, have influence and do work that is constantly challenging. Being a developer at EcoSys means that you’re part of a collaborative team focused on a product that is actively changing, not just supporting and maintaining an existing product. You’ll work alongside of our owners and newbies alike on cutting edge enterprise software that’s pushing the envelope in the areas of enterprise-level data volumes, user configurability, and flexibility.


We’re looking for a seasoned Java server-side developer with a wealth of experience designing, developing and perfecting server-side systems that are able to process complex business rules, multi-layered transactions and scale to thousands of users. As a Java expert you will be designing and building complex object-oriented systems.  You must have a firm handle on how to solve real-world business needs with elegant, reusable and efficient Java code/architecture. Only veteran software developers with demonstrated full-lifecycle delivery experience will be considered, meaning you need to possess a strong foundation in the science and discipline of structured programming.

item.title: Senior Product Development Manager at 2U, Inc. (New York, NY)
item.description:
What We're Looking For:


2U is a leading provider of software-based education, enabling premier universities to take their Master’s degree programs to the online space. We separate ourselves by offering well-designed and intuitive learning products that deliver the best education possible. If you decide to join us, you will have the opportunity to work with a dynamic group of Engineers, QA Analysts, and other Product Managers building and maintaining these learning products that will be used by faculty and graduate students from some of the top universities in the world.


Responsibilities Include, But Are Not Limited To:



  • Conceptualizing and launching products and product solutions for our Learning Systems group

  • Developing a deep understanding of users through data analysis, student and faculty interviews, usability testing, etc.

  • Ensuring all Learning Systems product initiatives (i.e. LMS, mobile, content tools, etc.) are in line with the organization’s overall goals and strategy

  • Defining, communicating, and executing short and long-term product goals into a comprehensive product road map

  • Assisting other PDM’s in maintenance of roadmaps for the various Learning Systems products

  • Collaborating with our VP, Product Development in establishing best practices for managing and monitoring project health

item.title: Mobile Application Developer Android/iOS at Rocket Internet SE (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
As a Mobile Engineer at Rocket Internet you help launching and supporting successful startup companies all over the world.


If global scale and speed of execution is exciting to you, if you are passionate about your craft and if you are striving to build apps that matter to millions of people around the world, Rocket Internet is the right place for you!


Growing at an incredible pace we’re looking for sharp and passionate mobile engineers that help us make our mobile applications the best in the world.


What we offer:




  • Agile, cross-functional team with lots of responsibility on the team level




  • Build 200+ mobile applications for our startup companies that reach millions of users in 100+ countries every day




  • Many opportunities to grow on a personal and professional level




  • Work with great people from many countries




  • Challenging projects




  • Competitive salary




  • Relocation package ensuring a smooth transition to work and live in Berlin

item.title: Information Systems Application Specialist Full Time at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY)
item.description:
Information Systems Application Specialist – Full Time



Stony Brook University’s Faculty Student Association has an immediate need for an Information Systems Application Specialist. This position plays an integral role in various FSA software/hardware applications including analysis, design, integration, testing and automation. This position is a valuable member of the team that will provide technical guidance and professional administrative support to program managers, department heads, administrative officers, faculty, support staff and various other members of the University. The IS Application Specialist continuously seeks to enhance operations by exploring and executing other ways to improve data analysis, integration capabilities and reporting and demonstrates superior technical knowledge, resourcefulness and possesses outstanding communication skills while adhering to high standard of excellence.



Required: Bachelor’s Degree; in lieu of degree, 4 years of directly related f/t computer support experience or a combination of higher education and computer support experience totaling, 4 f/ years may be considered; 3 years of f/t experience in MS Windows server troubleshooting and software maintenance; knowledge of Microsoft Windows servers and networking; proficient with major relational database management systems (RDBMS) including Oracle, Microsoft SQL or Sybase; proficient with SQL, stored procedures, triggers and report writing using Crystal Reports or other similar report writing tools; experience in creating clear, concise and accurate training manuals and systems documentation; experience with programming languages such as .Net and JavaScript, of coding processes, web services and security measures; prior experience performing analysis work; ability to work independently and as a member of a team; excellent written and oral communication skills. Preferred: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field; experience in project management; experience with point-of-sales systems such as Micros, Business Intelligence platforms such as Pyramid Analytics or Tableau, document management systems, and campus card systems; experience working with MS SQL Server BIDS, ETL, SSAS, SSRS.



Excellent benefits package and salary commensurate with experience.



Send a resume and cover letter with salary requirement by 9/24/15 to Human Resources Manager, Faculty Student Association, 250 Stony Brook Union, Stony Brook, NY 11794-3209, or Fax to (631) 632-6573 or email responsehiringmanager@gmail.com



Equal Opportunity Employer, females, minorities, disabled, veterans.



PI91659940

item.title: Android Developer at Appthority (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
As an Appthority Android developer you will be the lead engineer responsible for the design and implementation of an Android app that complements the industry’s leading system for automated, scalable Mobile App Risk Management. In this role, you will be responsible for design and implementation of an app that performs on-device malware detection, and synchronizes to the Appthority cloud solution via REST API. Your design scope will also include enterprise deployment strategies in light of privacy and security concerns.


Working at Appthority as an engineer is intellectually challenging, professionally stimulating, and potentially world-changing. This is not a lifestyle web site or a niche application. Rather, Appthority is a leader in the rapidly expanding world of mobile computing and mobile app security. We feel good about what we’re doing, and we have fun doing it!

item.title: Full Stack Engineer at a Rapidly Growing Startup! at PaperG (Bellevue, WA)
item.description:
A PaperG Full Stack Engineer works as a key member of the engineering team, helping push our products to new heights. As a Full Stack Engineer, you will have a wide span of opportunities to tackle different technical problems across the technology spectrum. You are empowered to make technical decisions, and will own large projects from inception to completion. We have a smart team that is always striving to learn and innovate. If you like doing the same, we would love to have you on our team.

RESPONSIBILITIES: You will have many opportunities to 'choose your own adventure' inside the company. Engineers in this role tackle a number of projects from implementing a machine-learning algorithm for predicting and eliminating ad fraud to writing a highly scalable tracking system with billions of data points. Regardless of your project, here are some responsibilities common to all your projects:



  • Write high quality code for a product seen by millions everyday 

  • Work with product team to develop innovative, highly usable features

  • Make architectural decisions to deal with scaling and high availability

item.title: Senior .NET & Web developer at DecisionHealth (Gaithersburg, MD)
item.description:
DecisionHealth is seeking talented and highly motivated Senior- and Mid- level .NET & Web developers to build state-of-the-art business-to-business web products in the healthcare sector.


Want to work in a no-BS continuous improvement environment? Where excellence and getting things done matter more than dress code or process formalities? Where professionals like yourself invest time strategically to minimize support needs and preclude firefighting? Then come and join us in this exciting, critical stage in our growth, as we implement Lean development practices, pay out the technical debt, and create a sustainable tech platform for business growth!


DecisionHealth is a 30 years old information product company, specializing in the area of healthcare administrative reference information, with headquarters in Gaithersburg, MD -- right in the heart of the Rio/Washingtonian waterfront! To passionate craftsmen looking to make a difference we offer a developer-friendly agile process, healthy work/life balance, respect for industry-accepted best practices, and a small team environment where your voice will be heard.


Responsibilities include working independently and in teams to develop web applications and backend systems that meet user specifications, participating in all activities from user story mapping, to brainstorming screen mockups, to high-level design and prototyping, to coding, unit-testing, and deployment support.

item.title: Hiring Devs Who Get Things Done & Love Continuous Deployment at TSheets (Eagle, ID)
item.description:
On the surface, we build time tracking software that our customers’ employees love. Beneath the surface, you will find the development team tackling mobile technologies, web technologies, location-based services, multi-homed data centers, distributed caching strategies and generally working on providing exceptional products and user experiences every day.


If deploying code daily to hundreds of thousands of users sounds interesting, exciting, and challenging, you might be a great fit!


In addition to technology challenges, we are a tight-knit team that supports each other in every way we can. Joining our team means making meaningful contributions and quickly seeing those contributions come to fruition.


What You Will Do



  • Help define and build new features in a clean and modular way

  • Write code used by hundreds of thousands of users every day

  • Assist in the design and implementation of our REST API

  • Debug and resolve application issues reported by our users

  • Receive and provide implementation feedback in the form of peer code reviews

item.title: DevOps Engineer at Rewards Network (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
This role will be part of a team that makes the Rewards Network production application stack as well as configuration manager a priority. In coordination with your team, you will be supporting Web Sites, back-end processes, integrations to partner systems as well as provide the business with on-demand ad-hoc data requests and analysis.



  • You will triage, communicate status, and drive resolution for issues with the iDine.com website, our partner websites, APIs, as well as the tools and backend systems that support our entire Dining Rewards Program

  • You will help automate both deployments and configuration management using tools like Chef and Team City

  • You will carry out root cause analysis of incidents and provide developers with the necessary analysis to fix production defects

  • Supporting the business and the Agile Development teams, you will assist with their functional understanding of the production system as it works

  • Working regularly with the Development Team, you will learn how to debug existing software and help offload developer support responsibilities

  • You will participate in an on-call rotation

item.title: Sr. Software Development Engineer - iOS at OfferUp (Bellevue, WA)
item.description:
You have a solid career in software development and fell in love with iOS. You have a portfolio of successful apps you’d love to show us. You have a strong understanding of Objective-C, a deep knowledge of Cocoa and Cocoa Touch framework classes, and a hearty appreciation for Agile and iterative development practices. On previous projects you’ve worked with map integration, push notifications, social SDKs, and JSON responses from web APIs. You share our passion for good UX/UI design and have strong experience building compelling touch & gesture interfaces. 


You will be responsible for the creation and implementation of significant portions of the OfferUp iOS app. You will craft clean and well-documented code, hit deadlines, exercise professionalism and maintain an active interest in the overall success of what we're building as a company, beyond just the scope of your projects.

item.title: Senior Mobile Engineer - iOS at DraftKings Inc. (Boston, MA)
item.description: DraftKings is seeking a Senior iOS Software Engineer to join our world-class engineering team building the next generation iOS apps. As a Senior iOS Software Engineer you will work through the full project lifecycle to design, develop, test, implement and support our iOS apps applications using Objective-C, Cocoa, Xcode and the iOS SDK. Design and implement new features, create UI, debugging and data modeling. Assist in testing all applications against software and hardware versions. Provide timely turnaround and documentation of bug fixes during test cycle. Additionally, any experience working with large-scale server-side systems using object-oriented languages is a plus.  We are constantly optimizing and improving in an iterative fashion to deliver the highest-quality experience to our users.  In your role as an iOS Software Engineer, you will have the opportunity to work in a dynamic environment on highly impactful projects. Working in small teams or independently, you will have the autonomy to take projects from concept to production engaging cross-functionally with stake holders.  We are looking for team players who are able to tackle problems under tight deadline constraints and deliver imaginative solutions.

item.title: Senior Full Stack Ruby Developer - $21M Series B!!! HUGE growth!!! at Distil Networks (Arlington, VA)
item.description:
• Design and implement massively scalable backend system tying in postgres, rails and redis

  • Design and implement frameworks connecting our global CDN network to our backend infrastructure

  • Build out new reports and analytics for our customer facing, rails-based portal

  • Help our data science team scale our business analytics and collection abilities

  • Help train and mentor junior developers

item.title: Senior Software Engineer (Backend Web Developer) at U.S. House of Representatives (Washington, DC)
item.description:
Vacancy Announcement Number: CLK-007-15


Closing Date: August 14, 2015


Proposed Starting Date: Immediate


The Office of the Clerk for U.S. House of Representatives is seeking a dynamic and innovative Senior Software Engineer (Backend Web Developer) to join a development team that is dedicated to building and enhancing systems critical to legislative operations, used by Members of Congress, Committees, other internal agencies and the public. This position will focus on designing and developing intuitive and reliable services, as well as assist with system planning, analysis and data modeling efforts.


Works in a small work station in an office environment without an expectation of privacy where noise levels are usually moderate. As an experienced Senior Software Engineer, the applicant must have the temperament to communicate with a variety of personalities in a tactful, pleasant and professional manner. The applicant must also be able to exercise discretion and independent judgment in fulfillment of responsibilities.

item.title: iOS Engineer at SwiftKick Mobile (Austin, TX)
item.description:
SwiftKick is hiring skilled, creative, and adaptable iOS Developers/Engineers. This is an opportunity for developers with strong Swift/Objective-C experience and attention to detail, to contribute to a variety of challenging and cutting edge apps. You will drive the development of apps that embody SwiftKick's commitment to building pixel-perfect products that people love to use.


Our projects usually range from one to six months. In a year, you could easily work on six different projects. Typically 2-4 people are assigned to each project, each with an opportunity to give input on design and development. We encourage collaboration and creativity. You will interact with our engineers and may architect solutions with our customers and their engineers as well.


As a member of the SwiftKick team you must be inspired by technology and have a passion for creating innovative technical solutions in a fast, energetic environment.

item.title: Senior Web Developer at Jonas Construction (Markham, ON, Canada)
item.description:
Jonas Construction is seeking a motivated individual who enjoys working within a fast paced, dynamic environment, who isn’t afraid of pressure and can provide expertise and leadership while developing complex web applications (back and front-end). If you are someone who gets excited about new technologies, who is passionate about coding and solving problems and doesn’t see it as a day job, but a hobby. Then we are looking for you!


The Jonas Development team understands the entire Software Development Life Cycle, with solid knowledge of integrated systems. We value the opinion of everyone within the team while choosing new technology, working on architecture or designing an UI. The ideal candidate will be a highly creative and a self-motivated problem solver with the ability to handle numerous projects simultaneously.  In addition, this strong communicator requires a proven ability to articulate ideas.

item.title: Technical Integrations Manager - Renewable Energy Sector at Greenbyte AB (Gothenburg, Sweden)
item.description: Greenbyte is looking for a skilled and thorough Technical Integrations Manager (TIM). As TIM, you will be responsible for customer deployment and integration, mainly regarding real-time digital communications between our cloud services and our customer’s renewable energy assets, e.g. wind and solar power SCADA systems. Talking TCP/IP, IPSEC, SQL, FTP, HTTP, DNS, SSH and various other protocols is something you do with pleasure. You have thorough experience with networking and the Internet protocol suite and feel comfortable manipulating route tables and configuring IPSEC tunnels. You know your way around a Linux terminal and prefer clean shells to cluttered GUIs. You will be working closely with both the development team as well as our Customer Success Manager to ensure that the digital communication aspects of our services are of the highest quality.

item.title: Sustainable Software Engineer at Appboy (New York, NY)
item.description:
We're looking for Sustainable Software Engineer to build internal tools and features for the Appboy platform. In addition, this role will also require the candidate to be the technical escalation for our success team when needed. This role is a software engineering role, as this person will also be responsible for programming on the Appboy dashboard or backend, helping out the mobile team, and working on minor infrastructure projects. One day you may be building internal tools to help our success and support organizations with automating a workflow, and the next day building new features to be used by thousands of Appboy customers.


Sustainable Software Engineers may be required to split on-call responsibilities with other team members, though after-hours support is uncommon. Proficient Support Engineers have the opportunity to grow into full-time backend software engineers on the Appboy platform.


We are not interested in recent coding school graduates at this time, please do not apply if you recently graduated from schools such as General Assembly or App Academy.



Responsibilities:
-Become an expert in how our product works from a technical standpoint
-Be the technical point of contact for customer issues from Appboy’s customer success organization
-Add new features and fix customer-facing bugs
-Build or buy new support tools to help automate common tasks and challenges

item.title: Java Front-end Developer (m/f) at SimScale GmbH (München, Germany)
item.description: For our fast growing international development team, we are looking for a passionate and experienced Java Front-end Developer (m/f) who will lift the SimScale platform front-end to the next level mainly using the Google Web Toolkit (GWT). Your job involves the continuous analysis, handling and improvement of the SimScale UI/UX together with design and simulation experts. You will also work with typical front-end technologies like CSS and JavaScript. Additionally you will be involved in enhancing the 3D viewer as well as maintaining the front-end performance and its security.

item.title: Software Engineer, Red Bull TV at Red Bull Media House (Santa Monica, CA)
item.description:
As a global media company, Red Bull Media House produces, publishes, distributes and licenses high-quality programming. Millions of viewers around the globe experience our TV and video products through Red Bull TV, a global digital video service with a growing portfolio of applications on key platforms including Apple TV, Xbox, Chromecast, iOS, Android, Amazon Fire TV as well as select Smart TV devices.


The engineering group within Red Bull TV is responsible for providing the underlying apis and infrastructure required to deliver the VOD, Live and Digital Linear consumer experiences across all devices and platforms. Engineers will work in conjunction with the product architect to design and implement modern, scalable and maintainable solutions to any technical requirements. They will be heavily involved in growing the team and will be expected to contribute to any significant technical decisions.

item.title: Embedded Software Engineer at Adept Technology, Inc. (Pleasanton, CA)
item.description:
1. Implement embedded software for our robot controllers (eV+ language and servo code) 2. Specify, design, and implement functionality and behaviors of embedded robotic subsystems 3. Design, implement and maintain drivers for controller peripherals (serial ports, USB, I2C, Ethernet, FireWire, SD Card, Force Sensor) 4. Support existing products 5. Write Unit Tests for implemented features 6. Participate in product architecture design


A successful candidate will be expected to contribute positively to the development efforts in the embedded software team, implement key features in eV+ and have the ability to solve problems through solid debugging techniques. He/she will report to the manager of the embedded software group and must be capable of working with a distributed and international software team, with electrical engineers and technicians and other teams. He/she will also work with Applications Engineers.



EDUCATION: At least 4 years of experience in embedded software development BS or MS in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or Mechanical Engineering.

item.title: Front-End Architect at EcoSys (New York, NY)
item.description: As the leader of our front end development team you will be seeing through your vision of an ideal UI architecture, focused on extensibility, performance, and usability. You will be choosing and applying modern web frameworks on top of an existing highly scalable and flexible back end. You will be designing mobile/responsive best practices and then guiding team members in applying them. EcoSys EPC’s web functionality includes a configurable interface whereby users can build dashboards and interactive screens from UI building blocks that include rich HTML5-based graphical data visualizations, responsive spreadsheets and forms, and an in-browser report builder.  These are the building blocks your new framework will deliver.

item.title: L2 Software Support Engineer - $30K at Crossover (Bengaluru, India) (allows remote)
item.description:
We are looking for dynamic software support engineers join our team of highly skilled support professionals. Aurea’s ambition is to be a radically different enterprise software company that empowers our people to challenge convention every step of the way in delivering success for our customers. You will work on cutting edge technology in a fast paced and constantly improving virtual support center of excellence, with the option of working from the comfort of your own home.


PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:




  • Own and resolve customer issues for our broad customer base of fortune 500 companies




  • Supporting mission critical applications during in various time zones




  • Reproduce issues from customers' description of the problem and/or from customers' code snippet.




  • Read and interpret product log files.






  • Cross train on multiple technologies across different verticals and Industries






  • Troubleshoot, diagnose and resolve customer issues independently, making use of the resources available to you.




  • Write a knowledge-based article for every new issue you resolve




  • Attention to detail in analysis and CRM case updates.




  • Communicate effectively with customers, including expectations for callbacks and follow-up on their issues.




  • Manage difficult customers effectively and professionally, seeking help from senior staff or forums and other resources available to you as needed.




  • Log bugs with development team with clear and precise information, detailing the issue and how to reproduce.




  • Demonstrate an increasing level of customer care skills




  • Weekend on-call coverage for production issues (once you’ve reached the appropriate experience level)



  • Role is based during Eastern Standard Time or Central European Time

item.title: Watson Software Engineer, Product at AlchemyAPI, an IBM Watson Company (Denver, CO)
item.description: At AlchemyAPI, we are looking for talented software engineers to join our fast growing team. As a product engineer, you will be exposed to a variety of challenging problems and work closely with our R&D engineers to transform ideas into customer ready APIs.

item.title: Fast paced, fun startup - Platform Web Software Developer (Python, C#) at Complion (Cleveland, OH)
item.description:
Come work for an early stage SAAS company where you can significantly improve the process of how medical research is conducted. 


Complion is cultivating a fast-paced, agile development environment where creativity and teamwork are paramount. Successful candidates are individuals who thrive on collaborative teams where everyone works on everything, and everyone is encouraged to contribute ideas across all levels of the organization.   We encourage developers to work on quirky side projects (such as Office Gong Robots), participate in hackathons within the greater tech community and enjoy discussing Leroy Jenkins.


As a Platform Software Developer, you will use your development skills to develop applications and systems that will help researchers find the next medical breakthrough and accelerate the growth of Complion. We currently have a repository with terabytes of data and now looking to scale to millions of documents a day while working on cutting edge digital signature approaches. We are looking for a candidate to work closely with our CTO to establish and implement our software development needs.

a10:author.a10:name: The Henry M. Jackson Foundation for the Advancement of Military Medicine Inc.

item.title: System Administrator at The Henry M. Jackson Foundation for the Advancement of Military Medicine Inc. (Frederick, MD)
item.description:
The Henry M. Jackson Foundation for the Advancement of Military Medicine, Inc. (HJF) is seeking a System Administrator to support the U.S. Army Medical Research and Materiel Command's Biotechnology High Performance Computing Software Applications Institute (BHSAI) [www.BHSAI.org] located in Frederick, Maryland. HJF provides scientific, technical, and programmatic support services to the BHSAI.


Responsibilities:



  1. Install, configure, test, maintain, monitor, and troubleshoot IT infrastructure components such as servers, network switches, firewalls, data storage, and user workstations

  2. Organize and maintain physical equipment inventory

  3. Analyze and assess IT support requests from users and provide prompt technical solutions

  4. Document processes and procedures

  5. Work independently and as a proactive member of a team

  6. Maintain a high level of personal responsibility and ownership

  7. Provide programming support and perform other duties as assigned

item.title: Ruby on Rails Developer at IT Glue (Vancouver, BC, Canada)
item.description:
Overview:


We are seeking a full-time Ruby on Rails developer to join our growing team as we work on an exciting new product that is absolutely blowing up. We are a local software-as-a-service (SaaS) business founded in 2013 providing documentation software for IT service providers worldwide.


We are well-funded and are currently in what can only be categorized as hyper-growth. We need your help to rapidly implement new features and help us scale the platform as we extend our global reach.


You Will Love:



  • Challenging and diverse projects built on the latest open source technologies

  • The opportunity to get in early while on the precipice of a massively successful product

  • Working with a team of young, highly-driven and like-minded individuals

  • A team that appreciates and demands the craftsmanship of elegant, well-tested code

  • The opportunity to have a direct and meaningful impact on our products and customer base without any bureaucracy or red tape

  • We love collaboration and your input will be more than welcome

  • The ability to learn from, and mentor, other developers hungry for knowledge and better ways of doing things

  • 27" iMacs

  • An office with a full kitchen and gym

  • Extended health and dental benefits

  • Flexible work hours/environment

  • Highly competitive table tennis matches

item.title: Delphi Software Developer at De Novo Software (Los Angeles, CA)
item.description:
We're looking for people who enjoy thinking about programming, talking about programming, and yes, also enjoy the activity of programming.


You would be joining a small team - 6 highly skilled developers on site, and 2 more when you include the president and CTO, both of whom spend as much time as possible in the code. Our company is technology-focused - meaning that getting the right architecture and code is more important than meeting arbitrary deadlines.


Our ideal candidate will be looking for more than just writing another web front end to a database. You enjoy theoretical aspects of software development, such as design patterns, OOP and software architecture. We have regular seminars on different aspects of software development and frequent discussions regarding software architecture choices. Developers work on all aspects of the software and drive all architecture, coding, and testing decisions. You will not be afraid to speak up to challenge design decisions or to offer new approaches to problems - in fact, you are encouraged to.



  • Will work in a small company environment.

  • Will report directly to CTO.

  • Will perform software coding and testing.

  • Will investigate new technologies and tools.

  • Depending on experience, candidate may perform software design and documentation.

  • Some Telecommuting OK

  • Permanent position only

item.title: Software Engineer at Synergyse (Toronto, ON, Canada) (allows remote)
item.description:
Synergyse creates highly interactive and measurable cloud training, adoption and productivity tools. We started by teaching everyone how to use Google Apps proficiently and it worked really well. We are working on hard problems in big data, HTML5, media delivery and real time technology. Our backend technology and web runs on the Google App Engine. Our frontend uses the Chrome Extension, jQuery, Google Closure. We use some of the latest technologies across the board!


Synergyse is based in Toronto and we managed to be profitable within a couple of months of starting it. Our clients tend to be in the enterprise and education world, but our technology is consumer facing and fun. It’s the best of both worlds. We are seeking a highly talented Software Engineer who's able to take on and deliver important parts of the software to users.


Why you should join us



  • Ability to define product and engineering as one of our first hires

  • Work with a highly motivated and talented founding team

  • Be a part of a business that has a good business model, good revenue stream, and makes flagship technology

  • Flexible and casual work environment with opportunity to work remotely

  • Competitive compensation ($100k-$150k), equity and full benefits

item.title: Watson Software Engineer, Infrastructure at AlchemyAPI, an IBM company (Denver, CO)
item.description: We're looking for talented C++ engineers to join our team. If you can write multi-threaded code in your sleep -- call us. If you love STL and Boost, come talk to us. If you enjoy writing performance-optimized code that must run reliably for years without memory leaks or segmentation faults, we want to talk to you. You'll get an opportunity to work on some really interesting projects that have a major impact.

item.title: Talented Developer Wanted at The Learning Experience (Boca Raton, FL)
item.description:
At The Learning Experience, you will be exposed to a wide range of technologies from custom-written mobile apps, the latest Web Development technologies and standards, cloud computing, big data analysis, and much more!  The Learning Experience is a family-owned national franchise company with a fun, rewarding and challenging work environment.


The Childcare industry is fast-growing and while some may not immediately think of technology when they think of childcare, we do!  We make use of technology in everything we do to solve business problems and most importantly, to insure our children are in a safe environment that promotes learning and advancement.  Our top-notch childcare centers boast excellent security features and our staff use mobile devices on a daily basis.  Our proprietary curriculum exposes children at an early age to touch technology, cameras, basic publishing, and other common computer concepts.


Our fast growing development team is looking for candidates who are passionate and inspired people that want to be part of a mastermind development team.  Candidates should be self-motivated and able to work well in a team environment.  We are a fast-paced, creative, and driven company looking for candidates with the same traits.


The Learning Experience offers a generous compensation package including:  Competitive salary, paid time off, medical insurance, childcare benefits and educational tuition reimbursement.

item.title: Senior Cloud Developer at INRIX (Kirkland, WA)
item.description:
INRIX is looking for a Senior Cloud Developer to join our team. We are building a comprehensive new mobile SDK, innovative services, new branded INRIX experiences, and helping our partners leverage our SDK into their experiences.  We have a great team in place, and are looking for a senior developer take things even further.


 On the Mobile team at INRIX, we value open discussion, pushback, and management by objective and prioritization.  You will be working closely with our Android, iOS, and QA teams.


How do we plan and build software on the Mobile Team?


It’s full Scrum and Agile.  That means weekly sprint planning, poker planning, retrospectives, backlogs, stories -- the full solution.  We work together as a small team, 100% scrum based, and as little process as possible. 


If you love fast paced development or planning, or you want to learn this skill, the INRIX Mobile team is the place to be.  If you want to ship real experiences, you want to point at something and say “I did that”, and you want to work with customers at scale, INRIX is the place for you.


Must Haves:



  • Customer focus — Our job at the end of the day is to delight customers through technology, you need to be 100% customer focused.

  • Experience —  At least 4 years as a backend developer showing experience in software development, architecture and design, passion for shipping services, and planning.

  • Cloud Technologies — Experience pushing AWS technologies to the limit and a passion to be keep on top of the latest innovations in the cloud is a must.

  • Scalability - Everything you do must work with customers at scale.

  • Passion for detail - TDD, Unit Testing, Automation, Black Box, White Box, etc.  If you have an obsession with producing high quality code, you’ve come to right place.

  • Computer Science - You should know the fundamentals of algorithm and data structure design/selection and be able to defend your choices.  


Why Develop with INRIX? The INRIX development team is a great place to grow your career and skillset.  Our roadmap is bursting with opportunity for engineers to bring their best (and then some), solving intriguing challenges, and tangibly impacting the customer experience. 


Our space is dynamic, it changes all the time, and we are 100% focused on solving for our customers.  Today we might be building the next great mobile app; tomorrow it might be a new traffic app in the new hot car.  Our customers are literally building everything you can imagine, and lots you can't.  Our data, SDK, apps, and cloud are used across a breadth of experiences and device types. 


We take career development very seriously on the mobile development team.  Part of our goal is to invest in you. We will support you and help you get better in your craft. We also expect you to teach us a few things along the way. 



Why make the move:



  • INRIX motorboat – Get your boat license and we’ll pay for the gas. You can walk from your office to the dock in 15 minutes. Take your family and friends skiing or tubing.  Yes, it’s big and it’s fast!

  • Free car – Well…. not really free.  But we have test cars with the latest traffic technology that you can take home.  We pay for the gas. 

  • Great Benefits – We’re as good as or better than most companies our size.

  • Free onsite snacks and drinks; Free Friday lunches – The food comes to you so that you write lots and lots of good code (at least we’re honest).

  • Bonuses 2x per year and Stock Options – Because you like to be rewarded and recognized for your hard work.

  • No Vacation Policy – You’re an adult and can manage your own vacation time.  Work hard; play hard.  Why does your company still have a vacation policy?

  • Family – We don’t believe that you should miss your child’s play because you have to attend a meeting. 

  • Are you ready to join a different kind of company?


INRIX is a leading provider of real-time traffic information, connected car services and analytics worldwide. The company leverages big data analytics to reduce the individual, economic and environmental toll of traffic congestion. Through cutting-edge data intelligence and predictive traffic technologies, INRIX helps leading automakers, fleets, governments and news organizations make it easier for drivers to navigate their world. 

Our vision is simple – to solve traffic, empower drivers, inform planning and enhance commerce.  INRIX is at the forefront of connecting cars to smarter cities and serves more than 350 blue-chip customers in more than 40 countries around the world.


Exciting things are happening all the time. Come join us!

item.title: Software Engineer II at Lumeris Austin Texas (Austin, TX)
item.description:
Join Our Growing Team!


Lumeris™ provides the information technology, guidance, and operational services necessary for hospitals and health plans to transform their organizations into high-performing accountable delivery systems.


Our revolutionary technology platform for accountable care integrates data from disparate systems across the continuum of care, provides complete visibility into the clinical and financial performance of the enterprise, and delivers applications and information to key stakeholders at the point of thought. Lumeris also provides health care consulting and professional services that help organizations establish the necessary clinical and business processes, methodologies, and operational capacity to create their own successful accountable health care delivery systems.


The depth and breadth of our solutions — combined with the company’s extensive real-world experience in accountable care — make Lumeris the ideal partner for any health care organization seeking the significant benefits of a better connected, aligned, and informed accountable delivery system.


Lumeris is privately owned by Essence Group Holdings Corporation (EGHC) and backed by investors including Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers, Camden Partners, and Sandbox Industries.


Why Join Lumeris?


At Lumeris you will be part of team that is focused on solving a national healthcare problem.  And you will have the ability to contribute while working for a purpose. Our environment is fast-paced and change oriented and is focused on growth and employee engagement.  At Lumeris we believe talent is utilized best when given the opportunity to succeed.  That is why we have removed the boundaries that inhibit success and focus on fostering an environment that allows employees to utilize their talents.



  • Responsible for designing and developing the rich presentation layer based on technologies such as HTML5, JavaScript, CSS3, MVC, and ASP.NET

  • Responsible for designing, developing, and consuming Open API’s using REST and OAUTH 2

  • Responsible for designing and developing the middleware tier using C# and Microsoft .NET Framework

  • Responsible for designing and developing the data access layer that interfaces with RDBMS such as Microsoft SQL Server and no-SQL databases like MongoDB and Hadoop

  • The candidate will participate in all phases of the software development lifecycle from requirements gathering and design to coding and testing

  • Work with cross functional team members - such as Development Leads, Architects, Quality Engineers and DBAs - in a highly collaborative development environment

  • Work directly with partners on the integration of outside solutions into Lumeris’ application frameworks

  • Identify and implement industry best practices for software development; be able to introduce and train peer groups on these practices

  • Lead the way by developing company standards for software development

  • Work with and lead, at a project level, the local and offshore staff responsible for the research and development efforts

  • Continually build the skills of colleagues through mentoring and training

item.title: C++ Experienced Software Developer at think-cell Software GmbH (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
We are looking for smart, creative developers with a solid theoretical background. You should be able to look at a problem from the user's perspective, discuss abstract concepts with fellow developers, as well as produce an elegant implementation. Developers we have hired in the past mostly hold an exceptional master's degree in computer science or even a doctorate.


At think-cell, we like flat hierarchies. You will work largely independently and will be responsible for the whole range of activities when implementing a new feature. We expect each of our developers to do architecture, design, implementation, customer feedback and bug fixing,  rather than splitting these activities between several people. We thus minimize communication losses and put everyone in control of their own work. Your ideas are welcome, even if they mean that we have to change a lot of code to make things better.


We have published several scientific articles in the areas of Artificial Intelligence and Computer Graphics and we will encourage you to do the same. We sponsor visits to conferences and have close connections to universities and research institutes in the U.S. and Germany.


think-cell encourages a healthy work-life balance. We do not work at night or on weekends, and support our staff's families with a full-time company nanny. She is available for free when children are sick, or if you just feel like spending an evening out.


We pay very competitive salaries, and offer our developers EUR 120,000 annually following one year of employment. If necessary, we will go out of our way to help you relocate to Berlin, and will do what we can to help you acquire a work permit.

item.title: Data Quality Analyst at Sainsbury's (London, UK)
item.description:
Digital & Technology at Sainsbury’s has never been more exciting. Our brand new centre of excellence in Holborn is crafting world-class apps and services to revolutionise retail. Ambition knows no bounds here and we’re recruiting some of the most talented colleagues around to make sure we reach our amazing potential.


Our customer data will be more incisive and more accurate than ever before, thanks to you. As a Data Quality Analyst, you’ll offer real expertise to our Customer Insights and Customer Analytics teams. Not to mention developing the ‘single customer view’ as part of our Helios project.


As a Data Quality Analyst you’ll:



  • Be responsible for the quality of customer data – ensuring everything from accuracy to time management

  • Manage the process that allow us to load and transform third party data as well as other ad-hoc data processing requests

  • Vigilantly investigate poor data quality and anomalies while also resolving customer and product data quality issues

  • Work with Customer Analytics to derive new data for the marketing database using SAS

  • Offer outstanding support to the Customer Data Senior Business Analyst on other projects when needed


You’ll need:



  • SAS or SQL programming experience for data manipulation

  • A background working with large volumes of customer and transactional data

  • In-depth understanding of how the Data Protection Act applies to consumer marketing

  • Excellent MS Office skills, especially in Excel

  • A relentless approach to throwing yourself into your work with little supervision and the networking and communication skills to support it


As a level C4 colleague, you can expect:



  • Car loan up to £10,000 or season ticket loan on public transport

  • 10% discount at all Sainsbury’s stores and online shopping

  • Sainsbury’s 7.5% Retirement Pension Plan

  • Bonus scheme enabling you to earn an extra annual payment of up to 10% of basic salary

item.title: Hadoop Developer, Senior at Booz Allen Hamilton (Chantilly, VA)
item.description: Ingest data from various structured and unstructured data sources into Hadoop and other distributed Big Data systems. Support the sustainment and delivery of an automated ETL pipeline, using a suite of COTS, GOTS, Java, Perl, and other tools. Validate data that is extracted from structured and unstructured data inputs, databases, and other repositories, using scripts and other automated capabilities, logs, and queries. Enrich and otherwise transform the extracted data as required. Produce monitoring and reporting of data flow through the ETL process and perform data extractions, data purges, or data fixes in accordance with current internal procedures and policies. Complete problem tickets containing bug fixes, design modifications, and changes based on customer requirements. Track development and operational support via user stories and decomposed technical tasks in a provided issue tracking software, including GIT, Maven, or JIRA.

item.title: C++ Software Engineer- Bucharest or Prague at Anritsu (Praha, eská republika)
item.description:
Anritsu has been a major player in the information and communication field for 120 years. Anritsu’s Multi-Dimensional Assurance Solution provides Communications Service Providers with unrivalled visibility of network and service performance that enables optimization of the customer experience, understanding of how customers use data services and understanding the impact problems have on customers.


This is an exciting opportunity for you to join the international development team in Romania or the Czech Republic.


As a Software Engineer you will be responsible for the design, implementation, testing, maintenance, and support of software components for the Anritsu product range. You will be developing software implementations to the specified Anritsu standards and conventions.                                        


As a key member you will undertake the delivery of software design, development, maintenance and technical documentation in accordance to the management requirements, development practices and industry best practices. You will also be developing and maintaining specifications and user documentation in accordance with the relevant Anritsu methodologies. Your role will involve problem analysis, resolution, performance of quality control/Verification and Validation (V&V) activities in accordance with the relevant Anritsu methodologies.


Your input will be highly valuable to identifying continuous improvement to the relevant Anritsu methodologies. You will also be involved in software support activities which include global customer visits.

item.title: Senior Data/Database Software Engineer at TripAdvisor (Boston, MA)
item.description:
The “TripAdvisor for Business” (T4B) team is responsible for areas of the business where we allow travel-related business like: hotels, resorts, travel agencies, vacation rentals, and restaurants to connect with their customers and travelers around the world. We help these businesses promote themselves by generating unique and new opportunities to build their brand and grow their businesses.


T4B’s Partnerships team is responsible for projects supporting display and integration of TripAdvisor content on third party websites around the world as well as integrating third party presence on TripAdvisor. This team designs and maintains the major portals into the TripAdvisor ecosystem for our business customers.


Now that you’ve got an idea about what the T4B team does, here’s some detail about the role!


This is a fast-moving and growing team and looking for someone who is just as comfortable whipping up a web page as developing the platform that will deliver that dynamic page to millions of visitors per hour (yes, millions per hour!).


So, until Chuck Norris applies for this job…


We’re looking for an experienced full-stack engineer with in-depth and hands-on knowledge of PostgreSQL, Hive/Hadoop and Microsoft SQL Server which is used to deliver our content. In this role you will design API’s, build global e-commerce systems, and create analytic platforms for customers and everything else facing our business clients.

item.title: PHP Developer/Drupal 7 Developer at Society for Science & the Public (Washington, DC) (allows remote)
item.description:
Society for Science & the Public (SSP) is looking for an energetic and innovative full-time Drupal Developer who is well experienced with selection and use of a wide range of Drupal modules, able to extend existing modules or write new modules from scratch, able to theme using best-practice techniques, and is experienced with tools in LAMP environments.


You will be working with new and emerging technologies for online engagement and support integration with the Drupal CMS. The ideal candidate will have the ability to self-manage and work quickly, effectively, and efficiently in a team environment with a close attention to detail. The ideal candidate will have 3+ years full-time Drupal development experience, including module selection, module development and theming using Drupal 7.


Primary Responsibilities


•Construct conceptual and technical designs that include the use of Object-Oriented (OO) techniques
•Write PHP code based on requirements defined
•Develop Object-Oriented (OO) code and/or provide maintenance and enhancements to existing code based upon a solid understanding of OO design
•Work with business users to gather requirements, write functional and technical specifications
•Conduct multiple levels of testing including unit, system, integration and performance
•Estimate and plan iterative/agile releases
•Configure Drupal and create custom modules to meet requirements
•Design, develop, and test an overall solution that includes a content management system (CMS), including capabilities such as social collaboration, analytics, CMS content entry, CMS content migration, explicit/implicit personalization, developing content types or content objects, site architecture, and page templates
•Estimate and plan releases for a CMS implementation
•Anticipate issues and risks at the module level and escalate appropriately


To learn more about Society for Science & the Public, please visit www.societyforscience.org


This is a full-time position.


SSP is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer


SSP is committed to equal employment opportunity. In order to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities to all individuals, SSP does not discriminate against employees or applicants for employment on any legally recognized basis, including but not limited to: veteran status, race, color, religion, gender, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, ancestry, national origin, disability, personal appearance, family responsibilities, matriculation, political affiliation, age and/or any other categories protected by the laws of the United States or the District of Columbia.

item.title: System Administrator III at Institute for Defense Analyses (Alexandria, VA)
item.description:
Overview


With minimal supervision, this position designs, administers, maintains and provides technical support for IDA’s network and server systems and services. Responsibilities include the coverage and scheduling of Help Desk tickets and Change Requests, taking lead roles on projects for corporate-wide IT initiatives, mentoring members of Enterprise IT Operations on systems integration and operations, ensuring systems compatibility and standards of configuration are maintained on all new and existing systems, promoting IT best practices, and general server maintenance. Due to the nature of this position, and the requirement for extended coverage, this position may be required to work hours outside of a regular schedule.


Responsibilities


1.Takes the primary role as project leader and designer of new IT technology initiatives. Provides formal project management documentation and partners with junior administrators and systems analysts to ensure the successful transition and operation of these new technologies as the junior administrators and systems analysts assume a maintenance role following the implementation. Designs effective processes for the roll-out and continued services of all IT initiatives to include support functions.
2.Develops testing and integration plans for new systems and software in order to ensure compatibility with IDA’s current network IT infrastructure. Builds new physical and virtual systems to design specifications and follows proper disposal procedures for retired systems. Ensures all systems meet or exceed the intended business and security requirements and comply with IDA’s minimum configuration standard and configuration management guidelines. Ensures all systems are properly configured to communicate with the corporate asset management system.
3.Designs, builds and delivers reliable disaster recovery and backup capabilities with local and offsite restoration capabilities.
4.Mentors junior staff and ensures all project and daily task schedules are maintained.
5.Oversees and coordinates the work assignments of junior system administrators.
6.Maintains technical documentation, to include the development and publication of standard operating procedures for systems and processes under their control.
7.Coordinates resources necessary to help resolve network problems or issues that involve other EITO or IT directorate groups.
8.Administers and maintains the systems and services, internal and external, physical and virtual, on IDA’s classified and unclassified networks, to include standalone systems and services, to ensure optimum performance and availability.
9.Conducts regular system maintenance to include monitoring, tuning, capacity planning, and adjusting configurations as necessary to resolve problems, minimize downtime, and to enhance capabilities. Systems can be identified as, but are not limited to, servers, workstations, networks, appliances, remote access systems, NOCs, and SOC systems.
10.Provides system support to minimize downtime, this may include error detection, systems analysis, and timely intervention to prevent or correct system problems.
11.Assists Information Security Analysts collect system security audits and perform Computer Emergency Response Team actions.
12.Ensures the success of patch management, software deployment, and network operations for the systems and services within their area of responsibility.
13.Provides technical support and responds to all assigned Help Desk tickets and Change Requests.Works with fellow senior analysts when necessary to quickly resolve critical system or service outages.
14.Maintains technical proficiency as new IT technologies are implemented at IDA. Keeps abreast of new and developing IT technologies and makes recommendations, as appropriate, to improve or correct IDA’s services and system performance.
15.Responds to critical after hours support issues.
16.Communicates all computer network, system and service problems and outages immediately to the Server Operations Supervisor and/or EITO Manager.
17.Performs other duties as assigned.


Qualifications


1.Bachelor of Science degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience in related field.
2.Seven years minimum experience in system administration and trouble-shooting networked systems. Requires a working knowledge of Ethernet, TCP/IP, UDP, DNS, media converters, network cabling, e-mail and web services, and remote access methodologies.
3.Seven or more years experience with Windows operating systems; experience with Mac, UNIX, Linux and network system administration desired.
4.Experience with data backup systems, asset management tools, SANs, VoIP, and virtual machines desired.
5.Must be self-motivated and able to work with minimal supervision.
6.Ability to communicate effectively in both written and verbal form and with all levels of employees; possess good interpersonal skills.
7.Project management experience a plus
8.Must be willing to work hours outside of a regular schedule.
9.Ability to obtain and maintain appropriate security clearances.


IDA is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing a working environment that is free from discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy and gender identity), sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, status as a protected veteran, marital status, genetic characteristic or any other legally protected condition or characteristic.

item.title: wanted: Senior Front End Engineer / bandmate at The Hackerati (New York, NY)
item.description:
What We Do


Technology Consultancy


The Hackerati is a boutique tech consulting firm delivering Engineering as a Service to a diverse client base, from Fortune 250s to startups. We focus on providing product delivery services in the areas of agile, big data, cloud, mobile / multi-screen, and web applications. We are a team of unconventional thinkers, visionaries, scientists, and entrepreneurial engineers.


Work We've Done


In the last 3 years, we’ve worked on a broad range of projects, including Web (90M unique visitors per month), APIs, native mobile (iOS/Android with millions of downloads), mobile web, machine learning, natural language processing, Big Data (330+ TB/mo), real time bidding, real time event processing (10k events/second), wearable devices, facial recognition, augmented reality, programmatic advertising, wrangling browsers and geospatial applications.


We are technology and process agnostic, so as a team member you’ll be exposed to many different technologies. We use proven technologies, following basic architectural principles and design patterns and practice Agile Engineering in a collaborative shared repo team development setting.


Our stacks consist of Objective C, Swift, Java/Android, Java/Hadoop, PHP, Python, Scala, Groovy/Grails, Ruby/Rails, Angular, React and Erlang.  


A great plus of being a Hackeratus is that you can draw upon a broad and deep collection of best practices from our respective Practice leaders to help you grow professionally.


Why You Should Join Us


We're not afraid to be our wild selves.


We’re different. With mottos like be fearless and weird is good, our unique perspectives on life and technology make us great people to learn from and work/party with. We sponsor lunches and happy hours, band practice, electronics like Glass/Oculus/Myo, and we’ve presented at the UN—twice. We rock that familial vibe, and you should join us if you enjoy a blurred line between work and play.


What To Expect


Deliver the industry's most challenging projects.


As Hackerati consultants we solve problems. Hard ones. To do so, we deploy teams of Hackerati to work onsite with clients around NYC, and build products in-house, both for ourselves and clients. Engagement teams vary in size and a typical project lasts between 6 and 9 months—Thus there is on-going diversity of cool new things to build.

item.title: Saas Senior Operations Analyst - $20/hr at Crossover (Istanbul, Turkey) (allows remote)
item.description:
AES SaaS Senior Operations Analyst - $20/hr


Are you a logic-driven IT professional who thrives in operations or customer support roles? Are you team-oriented, self-motivated, and quality-driven? If you are a keen problem solver excited by opportunities to demonstrate and maintain high quality in both communication and ownership of your given area of responsibility, if you possess knowledge of production systems and if you excel at problem analysis and solution recommendation — then this job is for you.


Aurea enables global enterprises to create transformative experiences for their customers across a range of industries including retail, travel & hospitality, insurance, energy, life sciences, and insurance. Aurea’s products enable companies to build, execute, monitor, and optimize the end-to-end customer journey across multiple channels and touch-points to maximize growth through a superior customer experience. Aurea serves over 2,000 customers worldwide.


AES, an Aurea product, is a business process outsourcer for EDI transactions and billing for the retail and wholesale electric and gas utilities markets. Our mission is to provide accurate and transparent transactions and invoices to our customers. We provide a team-oriented environment that supports every employee in solving problems and getting the job done well.


Job Description


The AES SaaS Sr. Operations Analyst is responsible for providing second level support to both internal and external clients for resolving incidents and service requests. You will adhere to ista’s internal processes for incident and service request resolution, and change management through proper execution and documentation — all from the comfort of your own home. This position is 100% remote; you never have to fight traffic to the office again, and you have the freedom to choose where you put in your 40 hours to be most effective each week.


Key Responsibilities


In this role you will:




  • Analyze issues and data anomalies and identifying solutions.




  • Perform level 2 support functions for incidents.




  • Emphasize resolving issues escalated to Operations.




  • Recognize and act on opportunities for efficiency improvements.




  • Review and write SQL queries for analysis and resolution of issues.




  • Navigate a complex database system.




  • Assist in off-hours coverage via escalation of priority incidents (choosing shifts that overlap with the time period of 6am-6pm Central Standard Time)




  • Perform manual tasks/processes in support of business and operational units.




  • Research and resolve alerts and problem accounts in a timely manner.




  • Ensure all tasks are completed correctly, including letter generation and delivery, invoice generation and delivery, and alert management.




  • Work with retail utility providers to identify and resolve operational account anomalies.




  • Compose and produce reports, documents and related material.




  • Maintain Operation procedural documentation in the knowledge base.



  • Perform other operational tasks as assigned.

item.title: Automation Quality Assurance Engineer at VMware Bulgaria (Sofia, Bulgaria)
item.description:
VMware is the leader in cloud infrastructure, business mobility and virtualization software. A pioneer in the use of virtualization and policy-driven automation technologies, VMware simplifies IT complexity across the entire data center to the virtual workplace, empowering customers with solutions in the software-defined data center to hybrid cloud computing and the mobile workspace.

With 2014 revenues of $6.04 billion, VMware has more than 500,000 customers, 75,000 partners, and 18,000+ employees in 120+ locations around the world. At the core of what we do are our employees who deeply value execution, passion, integrity, customers, and community. Want to be part of a compassionate community that thrives on architecting what's next in IT?

Responsibilities:

• Work in SDDC [Software-Defined Data Center] Solution Quality Engineering team to Design and qualify SDDC Solutions for various customers including the non-functional attributes like performance, security, interoperability, etc., in Cloud environment
• Support in design and validation of Federation Enterprise Hybrid Cloud and VVRD [VMware Validated Reference Design] document, as part of Agile groups
• Identify the potential integration/interOp challenges from reading PRD and functional spec. of involved products, talking with customers, field engineers and internal customer to understand the interoperability requirement for products in suite, towards SDDC Deployments. Write SDDC level integration/interOp test plans, test specifications, and certify integration/interOp requirements
• Ensure test environment reflects the operating environment of our customers Design and implement the customer test beds and End to End applications/various workloads simulated from a customer environment, documented in Federation EHC and VVRD
• Design and execution of automation scripts to support Automation of E2E workflows/use cases derived out of Federation EHC and VVRD
• Design Interoperability/compatibility Test Matrix and Requirements-based use cases, Test execution, reporting and tracking the overall progress, analyze risks and come up with the mitigation proposals
• Work with the required stake holders to escalate/resolve open issues
• Have an excellent Customer Focus related testing and develop Customer use cases in order to have our products work in customer like environments
• Deep understanding of customers through use cases, Alpha, Beta, IT use and the validation of those use cases
• Need to build very tight relationships with the field in collecting feedback and by sharing engineering expertise
• Co-ordinate with development and test teams for SDDC Solution testing across various VMware products and 3rd party products
• Support the BU vision of multiple SDDC Deployments
• Drive implementation of End to End Automation of customer workflows/use cases
• Act as a customer advocate, looking for innovative ways to improve current quality processes and procedures
• Mentor junior engineers

Requirements:

• BS in Computer Science or Computer Engineering, Master is preferred
• Experience in testing in an enterprise or system level environment
• Positive mindset, excellent attitude, energetic, motivated, sharp learner, dedicated and hard working
• Experience and knowledge in automation frameworks is a must
• Strong experience in gathering test/use case requirement from customers, PMs and reading spec., familiar with risk based test design, test cases (automation/manual) implementation and execution, test resource/planning knowledge and experienced in Solution level, Integration and InterOp testing
• Passionate about quality
• Good understanding about the best practices, SDLC/SQLC processes, methodologies of QE, detail oriented and good follow through skill
• Manage activities to meet their delivery dates and publish the testing status report to different functional teams, management, project, engineering etc. clearly on regular basis
• Experience in testing Cloud solutions
• Possess the in-depth knowledge of Operating Systems (Windows/Linux/Unix) and one or more of the following areas: System administration, Networking and transport protocols, Storage (SAN) and file systems technology
• Strong analytical skill, critical thinking and debugging/trouble shooting skills with initial triaging of software/hardware failures
• Strong collaboration skills, good leadership and initiative to work with teams which might cross different business units, departments and partners to finish the end to end product integration/interOp testing independently
• Excellent written and verbal English communication skills
• VMware product experience is a plus

VMware offers:

• Attractive compensation package - competitive salary, flexible bonus scheme, company sponsored mobile phone plan and additional long term incentives
• Individual career path - management and technical career growth, enhanced by learning and development program, regular performance assessment, teams of world-wide IT professionals
• Healthy work environment - company sponsored medical program, food and beverage program, sport activities, open communication
• Work-life balance – 25 days paid vacation, regular team buildings and celebrations

Before you join, VMware will require you to go through a pre-employment screening process.

All applications will be treated with strict confidentiality.


No visa or work permit requirements for EU citizens or EU work permit holders

item.title: Developer at Ecology and Environment, Inc (Portland, OR)
item.description:
Ecology and Environment, Inc. is a fully integrated environmental consulting firm committed to supporting sustainable development through responsible environmental stewardship.  We are seeking an Associate- and Senior-Level innovative and forward-thinking Developer at our headquarters in Buffalo, NY or our regional office in Portland, Oregon.  In these challenging positions, the Developer will be responsible for designing and developing web-based solutions and will work with colleagues and clients to create appealing and fully functioning websites.


This challenging position requires the candidate to have experience with ASP.Net C# web development to develop project websites and internal systems.  Experience with ASP.Net, C#, and SQL server required.  Our developers are part of an integrated IT/GIS group which is a very dynamic results-oriented group.  Our successful candidates must be highly motivated to work in a very fast-paced and exciting consulting environment. 


Responsibilities:



  • Develop modern, data-driven ASP.NET web applications using Visual Studio, C#, and SQL Server using Microsoft platforms, frameworks, and tools

  • Use modern web development technologies including HTML, CSS, and JavaScript to build fast and intuitive user experiences

  • Participate in project planning meetings to design and document software features, requirements, and specifications

  • Communicate directly with stakeholders to share project updates, provide training, discuss new feature ideas, and troubleshoot problems or issues

  • Maintain, support, and enhance legacy applications

  • Remain current on web technology trends, and rapidly learn and apply new skills and tools during the life cycle of a project

  • Assist with business development initiatives (demonstrations, client meetings, presentations, bids and proposal support, etc.

  • Senior-level:

    • Serve as lead developer for new and existing projects

    • Work with managers and developers in making platform, technology, and tooling decisions

    • Mentor junior staff developers and perform QA/QC on other team members solutions



  • Associate-level:

    • Serve as developer for new and existing projects with opportunity to take on lead developer responsibilities

    • Opportunity to work with managers and developers in making platform, technology, and tooling decisions




Requirements:



  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, or a related field

  • Senior-level:

    • 7+ years of experience with custom web based data driven application development, using C# and .NET technology is required.  Including working experience in using Microsoft platforms, frameworks, and tools

    • Strong knowledge of HTML, CSS, and Javascript and jQuery frameworks

    • Strong knowledge of Web Services (REST & SOAP)

    • Transact-SQL experience



  • Associate-level:

    • 3+ years of experience with custom web based data driven web application development, using C# and .NET technology is required.  Including working experience in using Microsoft platforms, frameworks, and tools

    • Familiarity with HTML, CSS, and Javascript and jQuery frameworks

    • Familiarity with Web Services (REST & SOAP)

    • Familiarity with Transact-SQL



  • Collaborate on solutions by facilitating and improving communication amongst technical staff and clients

  • Excellent problem solving skills. Good oral and written communication skills with external and internal clients of varying levels of computer literacy

  • Must be a self-starter, highly motivated, organized, and self-disciplined in order to organize time and work efficiently in a face-paced and exciting consulting environment

  • Experience with consulting or contract work is a plus

  • Ability to travel as needed for client meetings and business development


Must be eligible to work in the United States.  Visa sponsorship will not be provided for these positions.


E & E is its people. We are a knowledge based culture with an integrated staff of more than 85 scientific and engineering disciplines – a group of innovators who pave the way in implementing environmental solutions. E & E offers a competitive compensation and benefits package along with opportunities for professional growth in a flexible, team-oriented environment. Please view our website at www.ene.com to apply on-line.


Ecology and Environment, Inc. is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

item.title: Web Developer - ASP. Net / C# / MVC / JavaScript at Creative Clarity Ltd (Milton Keynes, UK)
item.description:
Salary : £ Dependent on experience
Location : Woburn, Milton Keynes, Buckinghamshire, Bedfordshire


 Are you an experienced Lead Developer looking for a new job? Here’s something to think about…


 Introducing Clarity. You may not know us but ten years in, we’re pretty proud of what we’ve achieved so far.


We’re an integrated, creative marketing and digital agency that likes to keep things simple. Our Clear Thinking (practical rather than academic) approach works for our clients and, as a result, we’re rapidly growing. 


Our home is a funky, countryside barn where our people get the time, space and fresh air they need to do what we do brilliantly! But… while we may be rural, we have international projects and work with a number of leading Global brands. 


Growing the business and doing great work is all down to our most important asset; our People. This is where you come in…


 So what’s the opportunity?


We are looking for a Developer with solid experience in .NET programming. With a host of exciting new projects due to begin this is a fantastic time to join our rapidly growing Agency. You will be working as part of a talented team to deliver new innovative digital solutions across multiple sectors for internationally renowned brands. You will be seen as an experienced developer and it will be your responsibility to share best practice with other team members. You will be expected to set the high standards, continually motivating and improving on personal and team capability whilst working collaboratively to deliver great digital products/solutions.


Clocking on and off…


Your duties day to day:



  • Eperienced at designing cross-platform solution architecture

  • Creating/enhancing/developing in Umbraco CMS and web and mobile applications
