  • Understanding customer requirements and creating all associated technical documentation (technical build, information/solution architecture, test plans)



  • Advocating improvements in development practices

  • Enhancing the scalability and performance of systems whilst delivering customer requirements quickly, reliably and efficiently

  • Contributing to continually improving the development framework

  • Ability to liaise when required with product owners, business analysts, developers and QAs to establish and implement requirements and resolve live operational issues for our clients


Left Brain or Right Brain? Which are you?


We think diversity is what makes a team function in the super league so we want to meet you whether you’re creative, pragmatic, logical or even completely off-the-wall at times. What’s important to us is that you’ll feel like an individual here and your voice is heard.


That said there are some traits we will need you to have:



  • Highly motivated and passionate about what you do

  • Can do attitude, not afraid to challenge or push new ideas forward

  • Self motivated and honest in your actions

  • Ability to work independently, as well as part of a team

  • Imaginative, intelligent approach to solving problems

  • Proactivity - finding solutions for the client and Clarity

  • Seeing the big picture

  • High attention to detail and consistent follow-through

  • Work well under pressure

  • Ability to take responsibility and drive concepts forward

  • To act with professionalism at all times

item.title: VP of Engineering at Zeppidy (Portland, OR)
item.description:
This role is responsible for leading our high performance platform development team, development planning, enhancements to platform architecture, high quality on-time releases, technical documentation, security, hands on best practice code, technical support, and development operations.


Individuals applying for this position must have the developed skills to quickly get underneath technical details and easily articulate broad and deep technical details. This executive role will be the primary technical interface of the company to all stakeholders.


ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES


Owner and key contributor of:


1)  Zeppidy Platform Development Team




  • Lead, manage, and grow Zeppidy’s high performance local and remote platform development teams




    • Supervises, and provides performance management to project managers, developers, and QA team.




    • Leads daily agile scrum and workload.






  • Recruit and Develop the Best Engineering Talent




    • Work closely to continually enhance our platform development team through training, coaching and mentoring for both technical and soft skills.




    • Be a developer advocate in the community and ensure the company continues to hire top talent who fit our culture, enabling them to excel in our fast-paced, goal-orientated, and nimble environment.






  • Risk Management of Code Knowledge and Intellectual Property




    • Continually for cross-train developers on system architecture, code base, business rules, processes, and procedures.




    • Maintain technical documentation to ensure completeness and updated including use cases, system architecture, server info, data flow, database, code and module documentation.






2)  Zeppidy Platform and Architecture




  • Release High Quality Software






  • Implements best practice coding and implementation solutions of platform functionality




  • Plan development schedule from product roadmap and deploy on time system changes that meet requirements for functionality, performance, scalability, reliability, security and adherence to development goals and principles.




  • Define and prioritize project backlog for successful incremental releases. Update and manage execution of the backlog for incremental releases.




  • Meets measured strategic development goals on time and within budget




  • Lead the progression of the Zeppidy platform ensuring innovation ahead of industry alternatives




    • Work collaboratively with executive team on the vision for Zeppidy’s architecture to support the demands of today and the future.  




    • Lead platform management and development team to execute the vision.




    • Analyze competition and recommend appropriate development strategies and platform enhancements






  • Lead the Evolution of the Development Operational Model




    • Evolve development organization standards, policies, processes, procedures, key performance indicators, and organizational structure to support the organization activity and growth.






  • Lead the Advancement of our Software Development Lifecycle




    • Advance and evolve our agile development process and tooling to help our teams stay productive, happy, motivated, and accountable to platform development goals.






  • Manage Development Reporting and Finances




    • Monitor, review and provide executive-level progress updates and results to development plan.




    • Work closely with CFO and CEO to create and monitor development budgets and financial forecasts.






3)  Zeppidy Executive Team




  • Work closely with the executive team to help run and grow the business. Be a key contributor to the executive team. Help create and execute company strategy in alignment with core purpose and values.




  • Be the public’s technical face for the company. This includes investor relations (calls during due diligence), fund raising, developer community, press & media as needed.




REQUIRED EDUCATION AND SKILLS




  • Computer Science or related degree or equivalent professional qualification




  • 8+ years of experience designing and developing web and mobile solutions




  • 5+ years of experience in leading web and mobile development of consumer applications in early stage companies




  • 5+ years of supervising an Agile team




  • 3+ years experience with TDD or BDD, unit testing and end-to-end testing.




  • 3+ years experience formulating executive level presentations and reports




  • Demonstrated public speaking skills and presence




  • Demonstrated project management skills with firm understanding of the SDLC




  • Current hands-on best practices leveraging MySQL, Solr, Java, PHP, Drupal, Javascript, XML, JSON, Restful APIs, Geospatial data, Maps, Android, iOS.




  • Familiarity with Jira and GitHub




  • Mastery of UI/UX design




  • Ability to develop new approaches to complex design problems






  • Ability to prioritize and manage work to critical project timelines in a fast-paced environment




  • Superior attention to detail, excellent at multi-tasking, good organization skills




  • High degree of flexibility and resourcefulness in resolving issues and bringing ideas to life




  • Ability to work independently and collaboratively




  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills




PREFERRED EDUCATION AND SKILLS




  • Master’s of Business Administration or another advanced degree




  • Experience with RETS and IDX real estate data formats




  • Understanding of the residential real estate ecosystem

item.title: Technologist with C++ focus for high frequency trading firm at Xanadu Trading (Barcelona, Spain)
item.description:
Xanadu Trading is a young knowledge and technology based proprietary trading start-up. We are active in one of the most intense industries in the world. We trade our own capital, for our own risk and benefit, and have no customers. Xanadu is focused on high frequency algorithmic black box futures trading as well grey box options market making on Eurex, LIFFE and CME. We have offices in both London and Barcelona.


Options market making software needs to be at the same time very fast and responsive as well as reliable and bug-free. This is what has made developing in this area one of the most challenging, difficult and interesting propositions around. Xanadu's young technology department not only aims to compete in this area, but to disrupt it - from (almost) scratch, and with less man power than most competitors. And in order to do so, we are looking for great technologists.


As one of the first technologists in our young startup you will work directly with Xanadu's founder and head trader and will have varied and often changing responsibilities. In general, you will be responsible for working on parts of our automated trading tools in C++. Depending on your preferences and business requirements you might also do some front end development in Java - or work on statistics, data analysis and data visualization in R. Whatever it is going to be, it will be at the very heart of what Xanadu does and crucial to its success.


In summary, we offer:
  - Highly intellectual and competitive atmosphere
  - No sales pitches (we don't have customers - we code for ourselves, to our specs, to solve our problems, on our timeline)
  - Ability to use advanced mathematical modelling skills
  - Ability to write robust and highly efficient code, where both make a tremendous difference
  - English speaking work environment
  - Free food
  - Social activities
  - Nice office space
  - Very competitive salaries (salaries are negotiable and depend on experience - for fresh graduates total remuneration starts at 36k€ excluding benefits)

item.title: Automation Test Engineer - Telecom at Gogo Business Aviation (Broomfield, CO)
item.description:
Gogo Business Aviation is the world's leading provider of airborne communications. Until recently, time spent in the cabin of a business jet meant that you were disconnected from the world circling below. That’s all changed. Airborne technology has finally caught up with the rest of the world. Simply put, voice, data and even the entire Internet can be at your disposal during flight–in the cockpit and in the cabin. Now you can use that time to return calls, answer email, download files or simply conduct a little firsthand Internet research. Using Wi-Fi or wired connections, in the U.S. or around the world.

As a key member of the Gogo Business Aviation engineering team, the Automation Test Engineer - Telecom will be responsible for quality assurance and testing of software associated with embedded Linux based data and telecommunications system products. The overall system involves proprietary software/hardware communicating via a wireless link through a satellite network to ground stations. You will be responsible for test case creation, test execution, and test automation development to verify the overall system including the application and embedded software.   

Gogo Business Aviation is committed to the development of full automation test tools and complete automated test environments as a necessity to our success. We understand that to truly scale software development in an Agile world it requires financial and resource commitment to automate regression test capability. We are creating world class automated test environments and we are looking for people that share our vision!      

Do you want to work on the latest technology with people who are experts in their field and have fun working together? 
Come on board the Gogo Business Aviation engineering team!  

How will you make a difference?



  • Verify, validate, and regression test software for features including: PBX switching systems, VoIP/SIP, wireless telecommunications protocols including data communications, and device’s graphical user interface;

  • Create test plans, test scripts and test cases for product validation and bug fixes based on system requirements;

  • Identify opportunities to introduce and implement test automation;

  • Identify and effectively troubleshoot software/network problems and implement appropriate corrections;

  • Lead test effort from early development to release of product. 

  • Occasional travel to work with contract developers will be involved. 


Gogo Business Aviation LLC is an equal opportunity employer and works in compliance with both federal and state laws. We are committed to the concept regarding Equal Employment opportunity. Qualified candidates will be considered for employment regardless of race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, marital status, medical condition or disability.

item.title: Lead / Sr. C# Full Stack Engineer (C# / MVC / SQL Server) at Medidata Solutions (New York, NY)
item.description:
Medidata Solutions (NASDAQ:MDSO) has an immediate opportunity for highly skilled Lead Software Engineers to work on our flagship product Rave. Rave is used everyday by pharma companies, biotech and clinical research organizations the world over. Medidata's Rave is part of a platform that provides our customers with the most advanced tools for planning, executing and managing their clinical trials. Result? 7 of the top 10 grossing drugs in 2013 were developed on our Medidata platform. 


We are continually building and improving our SOA cloud-based clinical trial solutions to put innovative technology and insightful data into the hands of researchers allowing new treatments to reach markets safely, efficiently and effectively. Working at Medidata will allow you to impact society in a positive way.


The engineers who best fit at Medidata are those that make good decisions, communicate well, and are eager to make an impact. We are curious, flexible, passionate, honest and selfless. We enjoy freedom and responsibility and can get things done. We are not afraid to fail and have the confidence to remain calm in stressful situations. We can survive on our own but prefer working as part of the team of equally talented peers. We are self-improving and disciplined and enjoy learning and sharing what we've learned. We are missionaries, not mercenaries.


What's in it for you?
We offer our engineers a highly competitive compensation that includes base, bonus and a strong benefits package that includes medical and dental insurance, vision care, short- and long-term disability insurance, life insurance, health care and dependent care flexible spending accounts FSA), commuter FSA, 401K, tuition reimbursement program, paid company holidays and unlimited paid time off.

We provide top of the line computers (PC or MacBook Pro), adjustable standing desks and the most comfortable work spaces. We have plenty of space for collaboration, game room and a private rooftop terrace.


We help our developers be more efficient by providing them with a license for Visual Studio Premium with MSDN, a ReSharper license, and a PluralSight subscription.


Every engineer gets an opportunity to work on a personal-interest project for two weeks every six months. We send people to conferences to learn, get exposed to new ideas and bring back the knowledge and the contacts that they acquired.

item.title: Data Associate Refining and Chemicals at Wood Mackenzie (London, UK)
item.description:
Our expertise in the refining and chemicals sectors is driven from our unique databases, economic models and forecasts. We provide comprehensive asset and company valuations, in-depth market analysis and insight into key issues. This objective research helps companies around the world to identify, evaluate and rank growth opportunities.


Role Purpose


This role is in the EMEARC Refining and Chemicals team. The successful candidate will be responsible for the team's data from end to end; assisting Research Analysts with tasks ranging from data sourcing to building VBA/SQL solutions and the population and production of the team's research products, ensuring data integrity at all times and with a view to delivering workflow process efficiencies wherever possible.


Main Responsibilities


• Primary ownership of the team's data
• Collect and compile industry data from both external and internal Wood Mackenzie sources into team spreadsheets and then into the Wood Mackenzie database
• Create and maintain automated processes involving databases, spreadsheets and web sites
• Create and prepare datasets for data visualisation solutions such as Spotfire.
• Maintain data quality and integrity, revising as necessary, and maintaining audit records of base data and subsequent revision for all Refining and Chemicals teams
• Produce reports and data queries as required by the team
• Collect and compile data using feeds from both external and internal Wood Mackenzie sources using Kapow Software
• Contribute to the effort of synchronising all web scraping, forecasting and reporting platforms across Markets teams
• Create and maintain data links to mapping interfaces and implement edits to and maintain the currency of the regional maps where relevant
• Prepare charts and tables for publication/presentation and assist with publishing research to the Wood Mackenzie client website
• Devise and implement data gathering and storage protocols to minimise business risk and maximise operational efficiency
• Support data gathering and processing activities to support consulting engagements as appropriate
• Understand and interact with other Wood Mackenzie teams by developing relationships with wider Data and Operations Analyst community

item.title: Market Data C++ Developer at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Market Data department develops high quality software that handles inbound and outbound data for various Bloomberg products. We manage massive volumes of data from major exchanges and contributors around the globe including the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE), the London Stock Exchange (LSE) and the Tokyo Stock Exchange (TSX). We deliver billions of data points a day to customers through our market-leading enterprise reference data product. Our data enables global market makers to make financial decisions and is held to the highest standards. Our developers are involved in all aspects of the software development life cycle including requirements gathering, project management, design, development, testing and release.

There are two main groups in Market Data (Feeds and Data License). More information on individual teams within these groups and their products can be found below. When you apply, you will have the ability to select your preferred team.

>> Feeds

The Feeds group builds low latency systems in a Linux environment. We gather data from financial sources across the globe to deliver quality market data sets. We strive to provide the highest quality of data while maintaining minimal latencies on high throughput real-time market data.

Exchanges

The Feeds Exchanges team develops feed handlers from North and South American exchanges. We provide critical data to our clients for high profile exchanges such as NYSE, NASDAQ, CME, BM&F/Bovespa and TSX. Our initiatives include improving the resiliency of our feed handlers through enhanced data recovery mechanisms while upgrading to our latest infrastructure to improve upon our data model.

Contributions

The Contributions team processes data from central banks, global banks and inter-dealer brokers for non-exchange traded OTC markets using industry standard protocols. We strive to make our system simple, efficient and fault resilient. We build scalable and massive infrastructure used by our business and operations teams to increase data accuracy, deployment and troubleshooting of real-time feeds, reducing time-to-market for our clients. Ongoing projects include the next generation of cloud infrastructure to increase fault tolerance, load distribution and on-demand resource management.

News

The News team provides reports on earnings, interest rates and major economic indicators like unemployment numbers, housing reports and consumer indices. Our systems connect the Bloomberg terminal with information from social media such as Twitter and Weibo. Our automated systems also cater to algorithmic trading.

Tactical

The Tactical team excels at investigating, debugging and fixing mission critical problems as they occur in real time. Our main goal is to provide a timely response to all client-facing issues. We build tools to better debug and enhance the development experience. Tactical developers work closely with feed handler developers to identify gaps in the product and enforce operational and functional standards, upholding quality in the market data product.

>> Data License

Data License is Bloomberg's market leading enterprise reference data product. Our customers are key financial players who use our products to power their trading applications, risk management and corporate action processing, which requires our system to be ultra-reliable and our data to be of the highest quality. Our product lines offer a variety of programmatic interfaces for a wide range of information on nearly all types of financial instruments including fixed income, credit default swap, currencies, equities and futures and options. We work closely with our business and sales teams to develop solutions to satisfy customer demands.

Core

The Financial Data Delivery Core team builds and maintains high performance systems that feed billions of data points per day to Bloomberg's customers through its market leading enterprise reference data product. Our system delivers information on nearly all types of financial instruments to key players in the industry who rely on its accuracy.

Bloomberg Valuations (BVAL)

The BVAL team builds a product that calculates pricing for over two million liquid and illiquid fixed income securities at several snapshots throughout the day. This evaluated pricing data is delivered with related regulatory information to enterprise customers in order to meet requirements such as net asset valuation calculations. Our product calculates, validates and delivers millions of data points. This rapidly growing product requires a highly efficient, scalable and fault-tolerant architecture. We are working on a proof of concept using Hadoop to address scalability needs and new offerings that will allow our clients to evaluate their portfolio risks and help them meet the many new regulatory requirements.

Content

The Content Generation and Distribution team builds systems that deliver a wide range of information on nearly all types of financial instruments including equities, options, derivatives, indices, bonds, commodities and currencies. We work with hundreds of databases and a distributed system that utilizes multiple processes across dozens of machines to generate the needed data. Our data is delivered to clients via various mechanisms such as web services, MQ and SFTP.

Workflows/Analytics

The Workflows and Analytics team designs and implements flexible, usable, and performant systems for ensuring data quality and consistency across our feeds and workflows. Developers in our team use a variety of technologies, including C++, Python, Perl, Java, JavaScript, Comdb2 and Hadoop.

Metering

The Metering team is responsible for building high performance distributed systems for managing large volumes of client data. We work with multiple groups within Bloomberg and develop tools to transform and efficiently store the data for trend analysis, billing and business intelligence. We are leveraging Hadoop to meet the demands of the massive amount of data we collect and analyze, and the complexity of algorithms that operate on the data. Our technology stack for the next generation system will include Webservices, Apache Kafka and Hortonworks Hadoop distribution.

item.title: Backend Engineer at Enigma (New York, NY)
item.description:
As a Backend Engineer on the Intelligence Team you'll be responsible for crafting part of our service-oriented architecture. You'll be given the opportunity to work with massive amounts of heterogeneous data, helping the design and development of large scale disambiguation, classification and clustering services.


Our ideal candidate is well versed in the landscape of old and new data storage systems as well as a solid understanding of REST/CRUD best practices. He/She should understand the tradeoffs involved in server/database/application decisions and can confidently support claims with sound evidence. He/She can effectively design and implement experiments/benchmarks to inform technical decision making.


On the Intelligence team you'll be interacting with engineers and scientists working on analytical tools and will need to be able to understand machine learning nomenclature on a high level.

item.title: Senior Program Manager - Mobile at INRIX (Kirkland, WA)
item.description:
INRIX is seeking a talented, passionate Senior Program Manager on our Mobile team.  This is a leadership position for a results-oriented person with the ability to communicate effectively, encourage sound decision-making, and guide your team to successfully deliver on commitments. The applications and services built by the team are highly visibility within the company. 


This role is a unique opportunity to join a successful company and help grow it to the next level.  If you want to lead the delivery of a wave of inspiring new consumer applications and services that will bring millions of people greater sanity, improved communication and better productivity then this is the role for you.


Who we’re looking for:

The ideal candidate is results-oriented, collaborative, assertive, organized and is committed to delivering amazing work in a team environment. You will be responsible for delivering mobile products and services as a Product Owner of the Android mobile team.  As a Product Owner, you will work with UX, services groups and other POs to deliver on key scenarios for the next INRIX Traffic application. As a Product Owner, you will work with customers to determine needs and/or deliver custom solutions.  You will review internal processes, make continual recommendations for improvements and sets vision, values, methods, and metrics for the team.



  • You’re experienced in Android mobile app and cloud services development, and can ramp up on complex engineering challenges with ease.

  • You’re a master communicator – it is a key strength of yours and you can communicate complex problems in simple, easy-to-understand language to a variety of audiences – engineers, partners, customers, designers, salespeople and executives.

  • You’ve worked with a number of external clients before, and understand their expectations for understandable costs, regular updates on projects, etc.

  • You have deep engineering experience, and can guide the team to create the right layers between reusable app platform components and core product experience.

  • You’ve seen products get into trouble in every way imaginable, and know how to avoid these pitfalls on your future projects.

  • You’re an expert in Agile engineering process and can prepare and communicate product roadmaps that are based on weekly agile sprint delivery cycles.

  • Proven results as a Product Owner in short sprint cycles.

  • You have a history of working through ambiguity to create great products.

  • You constantly push our product forward and our team to achieve more than they thought they could.

  • Bachelor’s or advanced degree in Computer Science (or a great reason for not having one).

  • You have managed a UX process to deliver great experiences in your projects.

  • 6+ years of relevant professional experience.

  • Prior experience as a developer is a plus.


What you’re looking for:



  • A fast paced “start-up like” environment with an Agile workflow and small, high performing teams.

  • Being part of a team where smart, passionate, and ambitious engineers, testers, and PMs both support and challenge one another.

  • A fast–growing global company where you’ll be challenged to think about things that no one else in the company has thought of yet.

  • A position where you have the chance to influence major industries that most people interact with regularly and help define the future state of the art experiences for those industries.


We also have some great perks:



  • INRIX motorboat – Get your boat license and we’ll pay for the gas. You can walk from your office to the dock in 15 minutes. Take your family and friends skiing or tubing.  Yes, it’s big and it’s fast! 

  • Free car – Well not really free... but we have a couple new test cars with the latest traffic technology that you can take home. We pay for the gas. 

  • Free Parking & Electric Vehicle Charger onsite - We have a covered garage with enough spots to go around.

  • Great Benefits – We’re as good, or better than most companies our size.  We even pay 100% of our employees’ medical, dental, vision, and disability premiums. 

  • Lots of free food – We have free onsite snacks and drinks; Friday family style lunches, and stocked fridges with lunch items for everyday!  The food comes to you so that you write lots of good code (at least we’re honest). 

  • Bonuses 2x per year and Stock Options – Because you like to be rewarded and recognized for your hard work. 

  • Open Ended Vacation Policy – You’re an adult and can manage your own vacation time.  Work hard; play hard, and don’t bother counting the days. 

  • Family – We don’t believe that you should miss your child’s play because you have to attend a meeting.  The CEO even sends a handwritten card and gift to your child on their special day.  How many CEO’s do that?


INRIX is making a positive impact in the world:


INRIX, Inc. is the fastest growing traffic intelligence platform in the world delivering smart data and analytics to solve transportation issues worldwide. INRIX is leading efforts to leverage Big Data to reduce the economic, environmental and individual toll of gridlock. 

Today, commuting by car or public transportation can be slow, aggravating, and well… painful.  In this position you’ll have the power to keep millions up-to-date and in control of their daily schedules and commutes, just for starters.  You’ll also have the freedom to propose brand new consumer products and user scenarios in which INRIX provides value to millions of consumers multiple times a day.  This is bigger than navigation – there are whole new product categories to invent.


Are you ready to join a different kind of company?  Exciting things are happening all the time. Come join us!

item.title: Data Platform Architect (Java) at OnePlus (Shenzhen Shi, China)
item.description:
• Design and develop data platform infrastructure

  • Design and develop systems for big data collection and analytics

  • Implement both online and offline solutions and multidimensional query support

  • Design and develop real-time data analytics and streaming cloud services

item.title: Data and Operational Engineer (Software) at TGS Management Company (Irvine, CA)
item.description:
At TGS, data and operational software developers form a core part of our business and are among our most valued resources. This role is mission critical, so we’re searching for an uncommonly reliable professional who enjoys writing programs, working with data, and providing support for large-scale production systems.


In addition to software development and data management, this position is likely to involve interaction with external resources such as data providers, brokers, dealers, and software vendors, as well as colleagues from the research and engineering teams.

item.title: Android Developer at Actual Experience plc (Bath, UK)
item.description:
We’re looking for an experienced Android Software Developer who can take the lead on the development of our Android software offerings in two significant areas.


A component of our service is a measurement software client that takes network and application level measurements. This is proven on Mac, Windows and Linux platforms and we now want to develop it to run on mobile devices. We are also developing an engaging mobile app for the business leaders of our customers to access the results of the analysis we perform with the measurements.


You will be leading the development of both the measurement software on Android and the mobile app.

item.title: c# / .net Developer at Dealogic (London, UK)
item.description:
Join Dealogic and help transform how capital markets operate. We are the way financial institutions enable their people to collaborate, make decisions and execute socially important function of optimising the flow of capital around the world. We deliver the best and most innovative software technology and the most respected and trusted content through highly skilled, connected and creative people.


The Role


If you are a passionate engineer, and think you have some of the skills, drive and talent to   help write good code to build a great product, we’d really like to hire you.


We have a great opportunity within one of our teams for an eager engineer. As part of the role you will be working with talented people on designing, coding and testing our products through the latest technology.


You will be working in an Agile environment with Continuous Integration and Delivery as part of the process. Currently we are delivering every two weeks to our clients, however our ambition is to continuously be able to deliver when a feature is ready.


The Team


Our team manage and maintain what is regarded by our clients as one of the most trusted & respected sources of global capital markets intelligence.


The team consist of technology driven individuals interested in working on cutting edge technologies with quality products and data.


There is a good mix of Greenfield & Brownfield projects the team is undertaking as part of   the roadmap and good design is at the forefront of what is currently being worked on.


As a member of our team your contribution would have organisational impact and provide an excellent growth opportunity.

item.title: Sr. Full-Stack Engineer at Crunchyroll (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Crunchyroll is looking for world-class backend engineers to work on our suite of internal APIs. Example services include media and video, user account management, eCommerce, digital publishing, payments social media, and more. The ideal candidate is a full-stack LAMP engineer. Qualified candidates are highly technical and have a knack for building production-quality services for millions of users. They are professional software engineers with strong technical design principles, not hackers. They think before they code, they adhere to principles of software abstraction in API design, and they are cognizant of capabilities as well as limitations in what they build. They are not married to a specific language or implementation, but see the merits in using the right tool for the job.


Responsibilities



  • Work with other engineers and technical product managers to implement and maintain features for our internal platform

  • Improve the reliability of our services via robust testing infrastructure

  • Improve the scalability of our services through proper planning and changes to architecture

  • Improve the availability of our services through better monitoring, performance reporting, error reporting

  • Improve the server response times of our APIs by profiling and identifying bottlenecks and eliminating them

  • Improve the security of our systems

  • Work with devops and sys admin to deploy new technologies

item.title: Quantitative Developer at AQR Capital Management (Greenwich, CT)
item.description:
AQR Research and Portfolio Management is seeking quantitative software developers. Our developers are responsible for building the core systems that drive the quantitative strategy research and portfolio implementation that powers AQR. Our development teams are small, motivated, and highly productive. Working side by side with the researchers and portfolio analysts, you will become intimately familiar with the investment philosophy which drives AQR.


We believe that the next innovation to transform our business could come from anyone at AQR. Expect to be recognized not only for your diligence and hard work today, but for your vision for tomorrow. We are mathematicians, computer scientists, and engineers passionate about advancing financial research and pushing the limits of today’s technology.


As a quantitative developer, you will build or extend our:



  • Proprietary portfolio construction and optimization techniques

  • Global asset risk estimation system incorporating millions of data points

  • Intuitive research APIs leveraging cloud computing and cutting-edge visualizations

  • High-performance historical simulation engine

  • Workflow platform using services, messaging, and graph-based dependency awareness

item.title: Backend Software Engineer at Football Radar (London, UK)
item.description: At Football Radar, we analyse and predict football matches. As a backend engineer you’ll have the chance to help build and maintain all the software that makes that possible – everything from modern web applications to statistical models, real time data platforms to cloud infrastructure. Our backend engineers are involved in everything the company does and deal with all kinds of different challenges. A lot of our code is in Scala, which we are using increasingly, but we still have lots of PHP code, and a few odds and ends in other languages. You don’t need to know Scala for this role, however: we’ll help you learn it if you don’t know it, and many of our engineers had no real Scala experience before they started. We are just looking for great programmers who are passionate about their work. If you like a challenge, and want to work with really smart people, we would like to hear from you.

item.title: Cloud Systems Engineer at Cloudreach (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Cloudreach’s Systems Engineers work with challenging technical solutions for industry leading clients. We love all things cloud related and believe passionately in the innovation it can drive.


How will you spend your time at Cloudreach


You will be working in the following areas (and more!):




  • Green field development of Amazon Web Services infrastructure (EC2, RDS, EMR, etc), e.g. looking at an existing service or data centre and then architecting a more effective solution in AWS. You might work on a major eCommerce platform, a MySQL database migration, or building a scalable mobile backend




  • DevOps: Systems engineering work with frameworks such as Chef or Puppet - as well as helping to break down barriers between silo’d teams. We automate everything




  • Technical deployment and consultancy related to Google Apps for Business - for example designing a complex Single Sign On solution




  • Not doing any out of hours shift work - yay!




What do we look for?




  • You’ve studied Engineering, Computer Science or a similar subject




  • You’re super motivated and have at least a year’s working experience. We can find a great role for you with 1 year or with 10+ years experience




  • Scripting skills - ideally Python or Ruby, but talk to us if you love to hack in any language. We look for people who automate everything where sensible. If you had 10 servers, you wouldn’t update each one manually right?




  • You’ll probably prefer a command line to a GUI




  • Solid knowledge of Linux (or perhaps Windows) Systems Administration/Engineering




What are our cloudy perks?




  • A top spec laptop. You want a Macbook, not a ThinkPad right?




  • Unique ‘cloudy’ culture where we keep our feet on the ground and our heads in the Clouds - this year’s project is building a Quadcopter on our 3D printer




  • Plenty of holidays - increasing with every year of happy cloudy service. You’ll also get your birthday off to open your presents/eat lots of cake




  • Great career development opportunities with an assigned mentor




  • Centrally-located offices - where the cool kids hang out




  • Good food and team ‘cloudy’ lunches, taking over a restaurant every Friday




  • If you do something amazing, we’ll give you a spot bonus




  • The chance to work on side tech projects to build something cool, unrelated to your day to day work




  • Overseas work opportunities - if you want them




  • Working with a collaborative, social team and levelling-up your skills faster than you will anywhere else

item.title: Java Developers - MTT - Dublin 2 at Mobile Travel Technologies Ltd (MTT) (Dublin, Ireland)
item.description:
Note: We are not in a position to accept applications from those requiring Green Card/ Work permit sponsorship. Applicants must already be eligible to live and work in Ireland.


Location   



  • We are based in Hanover Court, Erne Street Lower, Dublin 2. Our city offices are close to a host of amenities and well served by all major bus, Luas and rail routes.


Where does the role fit in MTT?



  • Working in a small tightly focused team of experienced Java developers, testers & designers, you will be responsible for the end to end delivery of MTT’s next generation of mobile applications.


What will I be doing?



  • Writing new and reusable server code to support our mobile applications in an agile, test driven development environment

  • Develop flexible RESTful services (Spring MVC, Spring data)

  • Work with our mobile developers to develop API

  • Integrate with diverse travel systems across Airlines, Hotels etc. (using Apache Camel)

  • Define business rules and logic to connect our mobile products to various back end travel systems

  • Deploy server to Tomcat running in Amazon AWS (currently investigating Spring Boot as an alternative)

  • Research & identify new technologies to drive internal innovation.

item.title: Web-Based Application Developer - Help Eliminate Bad Debt for our Clients at ONLINE Information Services, Inc. (Winterville, NC)
item.description:
ONLINE is seeking an experienced software development professional for the position of Developer who will work with other developers in maintaining database backed websites for our customers and partners.


As a .NET Web Developer , you will be creating both internal and customer-facing web-based applications. Examples of applications that we have developed and are supporting are; reporting interfaces for the collection and viewing of real-time data from our app.

item.title: Software engineer (work with Node.js on a realtime relational database) at Airtable - democratizing the database (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
From a software engineering standpoint, Airtable is a uniquely challenging product — it has a purpose-built relational database engine supporting realtime synchronization between different users, collaborative undo and formula calculations, and visual revision history. On the outside, it has a polished, desktop-grade web interface and beautifully tap-friendly mobile apps.


We're looking for engineers who understand the difference between solving hard computer science problems and writing highly maintainable code in a team setting, and can cheerily excel at both.



Unlike single-purpose apps, we think of Airtable as a horizontal toolkit composed of intuitive building blocks that people can repurpose to create their own applications. Our product roadmap is filled with interesting enhancements and additions to this toolkit that greatly expand the boundaries of Airtable's capabilities.


Our company is built upon a philosophical commitment to providing the best possible experience for the end user, even if it requires going to great lengths in engineering and design effort. We plan on building this company for decades to come, and while we love rapid iteration where it makes sense, we also take the time to make farsighted architectural decisions and place great emphasis on code quality over raw speed.


We believe in the power of highly motivated and capable individuals to accomplish great things in small teams, with end-to-end ownership of projects and rapid iteration. If you'd like to join us, we'd love to hear from you.

item.title: Principal Software Engineer, Realtime Bidding at TubeMogul (Emeryville, CA)
item.description:
We are seeking a Principal Software Engineer to help define our next-generation, real-time bidding platform. With over 250,000+ decisions per second, we are building out infrastructure enhancements to focus on availability, performance and availability.

Candidates must have solid experience working on large-scale, distributed systems. This will be an opportunity to take a lead on several core projects with considerations on key architectural and design decisions.


Responsibilities:



  • Lead software development projects enhancing our distributed real-time bidding system, the core of TubeMogul’s technology platform

  • Collaborate on key architectural decisions and design considerations

  • Monitor and plan out core infrastructure enhancements (a.k.a. stay ahead of possible scalability bottlenecks)

  • Troubleshoot and resolve system problems and customer issues under very tight service level agreement.

  • Work with machine learning team to implement optimizations to increase campaign effectiveness

  • Mentor junior developers (i.e. demonstrate good coding practices and helping them architect code smartly)

  • Contribute to and promote good software engineering practices across the team

item.title: Web Application Architect at TubeMogul (Emeryville, CA)
item.description:
We are seeking a Web Application Architect for our Platform Architecture team. The Platform Architecture team is responsible for the robustness and long-term scalability of TubeMogul's platform, from backend to the UI.

Members of the Platform Architecture team are expected to be thought and action leaders within engineering, looking ahead and figuring out how to solve TubeMogul's most difficult problems.  This requires a unique combination of hardcore (and hands-on) technical chops, architectural vision, software engineering savvy, and excellent communication skills.  You should possess a passion for technology that is readily apparent in your work and/or personal projects.  Ideal candidates will have deep experience with high volume user-facing systems.


Responsibilities: 



  • Research, advise, and design the backbone architecture of TubeMogul's front-end products:  Web UI, mobile UI, ad units. 

  • Design, prototype, and/or implement new user-facing features in TubeMogul's products.

  • Specify or help to design/build reusable libraries and frameworks that support TubeMogul's products.

  • Optimize web applications to maximize speed and scale. Support diverse clients from high powered desktop computers to small footprint mobile devices.

  • Write client-side code for web-based applications, create fast, easy-to-use, high volume production applications, and develop prototypes quickly.

  • Communicate and lead technology adoption efforts across teams.

item.title: Lead UI Developer at RPX Corporation (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
RPX is seeking a dynamic individual to contribute to the success of the Data and Technology Solutions department. In this role, the Lead UI Developer will help design, deliver, and support technology infrastructure to meet the growth needs of RPX. In this role, this individual will be a trusted technology expert in the web applications team responsible for conceptualizing and designing technology solutions to meet business needs. The Lead UI Developer will provide technical thought-leadership in collaboration with the product management team, engineers, and their respective managers to deliver innovative and automated solutions in an agile, dynamic environment. This individual reports to the Director, Engineering & Enterprise Architecture.


Role

  • Interact closely with Product/Engineering management on the road map and technology concepts

  • Collaborate with global development teams in bringing the concepts to market rapidly

  • Build rapid prototypes and demo application features

  • Keep a pulse on the trends in the industry and identify technical innovations

  • Participate in cross company technical initiatives

item.title: Build and Tools Tech Lead - DevOps, Jenkins, C++, Python at HERE, a Nokia company (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
We are looking for a technical lead to join the newly founded Connected Driving DevOps team. If you are passionate about complex, distributed development environments, continuous integration/delivery and quality and efficiency in the embedded space, then this could be the position for you. This is an opportunity to lead a team that can be the backbone for delivering the next generation of navigation systems to the Automotive industry. 




Your task will be



  • Responsible for driving the enhancement and automation of our continuous integration and delivery processes.

  • Facilitate the continuous integration process across multiple code repositories and environments.


    • Evangelising DevOps best practice and facilitating adoption of DevOps methodologies across teams.



  • Creation and maintenance of a DevOps dashboard and alert system.

  • Technical GoTo regarding all things CI/Build and Test Automation (Design, implementation, execution, evaluation)

  • Integration tests, Integration trouble shooting and error debugging

item.title: Software Engineer - Web and Mobile Technologies at Advanced Systems Concepts, Inc. (Morristown, NJ)
item.description:
Advanced Systems Concepts, Inc. (ASCI) is a Systems Software engineering company located in Morristown, NJ. We create software products of our own design and have done so for more than 30 years!  As we continue to grow, ASCI is looking for individuals who also enjoy the Software Engineering process using Agile/SCRUM methodologies, and who are looking to use the latest software technologies and tools to advance our company goals as well as their own understanding of software systems. A passion for Software Engineering along with the ability and desire to learn are key.


Responsibilities:



  • You will be part of a Scrum Development team working on Web and Mobile products.

  • As part of that team, you will be working on both Server and Client side aspects of the product.

  • You will be working on the latest software technologies that are used to build leading edge software products.

  • Candidates must be able to work independently as well as within a group. Attention to detail, positive attitude, the ability to learn and be challenged and pride in quality and timeliness are all attributes the successful candidate will have.

item.title: Senior and Intermediate Java and/or .NET Developers (GTA) at Retalon (Toronto, ON, Canada)
item.description:
We are growing and building exciting technology!


We are looking for people, who love doing things first time, have a passion about building the most advanced and accurate predictive engine around, people who love learning new things and share their ideas.


Our team of developers is made up of very talented, creative, and accomplished people. We value every single member of our family and make sure that we bring out the best in each of them.


Developers can choose the tasks they’d like to work on, choose their roles (architecture, analysis, pure development, professional services) or create their own mix. We are embracing Java 8 and Lambda expressions. Feel free to bring with you any language running on JVM: Clojure, Scala, Ruby, Groovy, JavaScript, or in .NET


To ensure that we stay ahead of the curve, we encourage learning and allow developers to dedicate 10 to 20% of their time to work on the “technology roadmap” of their choice.

item.description:

item.title: SharePoint Developer at MetroStar Systems (Reston, VA)
item.description:
MetroStar Systems (MetroStar) is an award-winning Information Technology solutions provider. We are seeking a result oriented SharePoint Developer to join the MetroStar team at a customer site in downtown Washington, DC.  A security clearance is not required, but the candidate must be able to obtain a Public Trust for receiving a government badge and authorization to work on premises.


The individual needs to know SharePoint front-end admin configuration, front-end custom development using SharePoint Designer, and back-end custom development using Visual Studio.  ASP.NET and SharePoint object model experience is needed.


Responsibilities include but not limited to:



  • Build, configure and integrate 2007/2010 SharePoint websites

  • Develop and administer web parts, timer jobs, workflows and InfoPath forms

  • Implement style sheets, templates and workflows for content types

  • Optimize pages for peak performance

  • Prepare and migrate content

  • Create custom SharePoint style sheets and web parts

  • Create and modify web pages within SharePoint applications

  • Design and develop user interface elements in SharePoint

  • Perform master page deployments

  • Design and develop websites using SharePoint Designer 2010

  • Write, test and deploy code using ASP.net, C#, JavaScript, HTML, CSS and XSLT

  • Manage software artifacts using Team Foundation Server

  • Design and develop InfoPath Forms

  • Manage and administer InfoPath 2007/2010 and 2010 InfoPath Services

  • Display data, charts and dashboards using SharePoint 2010 Excel Services / Business Intelligence

  • Analyze and troubleshoot problems within intranet environment

  • Administer the intranet search engine (i.e.,configuring, monitoring and reporting);

  • Monitor broken links

  • Establish and publish performance metric reports;

  • Conduct testing to support intranet enhancements including all code changes

  • configuration changes and system upgrades

  • Work with business systems development staff to integrate applications

  • Communicate with Microsoft technical support and customer infrastructure staff to resolve

  • issues related to intranet

  • Conduct Section 508 testing, remediation and documentation

  • Provide Tier 2 end user support for intranet (i.e.,system enhancements and upgrades)


Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:



  • Two years of experience in SharePoint front-end administration (for example, administering lists, views, web parts, etc. with Full Control)

  • Two years of experience developing web front-end with HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and XLST - including working within SharePoint Designer

  • Sine experience with application development experience using the Microsoft .NET Framework with C# ASP.NET and SQL Server


Educational/Training Requirement: Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering or Computer Science (or at least six years of software engineering experience


Security Clearance: Ability to obtain and maintain a government clearance


Physical Requirements / Work Environment: Works in a normal office environment with controlled temperature and lighting conditions

Travel: Some travel may be required


Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA): Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential job duties of the position.


The statements herein are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees, and are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. Furthermore, they do not establish a contract for employment and are subject to change at the discretion of MetroStar Systems.

MetroStar Systems is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Equal Opportunity Employment/ Affirmative Action provider including Women/Minorities/Veterans/Disabled.

item.title: Software Developer at Nanometrics (Ottawa, ON, Canada)
item.description:
We are looking for a software developer to join our team of smart, creative engineers to help build our next generation of products.


How we work


We work in an informal, fun, fast-moving, collaborative environment with minimal hierarchy. While we have the freedom to set our own hours and the flexibility to maintain an excellent work/life balance, we work hard to ensure that our products are delivered on time.


We develop a full range of software -- from customized Linux kernels and advanced signal processing applications, to web services and APIs.  We believe in using the best development tools and practices, and use an Agile approach.


What we do


Nanometrics creates innovative software and systems for detecting and monitoring seismic activity. Our products make a difference in people’s lives by helping to understand the significant human impact earthquakes have around the world. Our customers are leading researchers and companies who use our products for earthquake scientific research as well as natural disaster warning systems, nuclear non-proliferation monitoring, and induced seismic activity detection. Our systems are deployed on every continent and in some of the most remote and harsh environments on Earth, from deserts and mountains, to the Arctic and the bottom of the ocean.


This position is available in our Ottawa office, located on the edge of the Greenbelt. Close to biking paths and bus routes, and a short commute to many nearby residential areas.

item.title: Senior Software Developer for Visual Interface Technology at Banc3 (Princeton, NJ)
item.description: BANC3 has an opportunity that is available for immediate hire involving Optics/Visual Interface Technology with a soldier worn head mounted displayproviding an intuitive ‘heads-up’ visualization of tactically-relevant geo-registered icons through augmented reality and/or situational awareness system linked to an Android device. It is a government funded project that we will start execution on shortly. Our team will consist of the several experts in various tasks in all aspects of the project like wireless networking of soldier weapon sights, android devices and heads-up-displays (HUD)/ Head mounted displays (HMD).

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Becton, Dickinson, and Company (Durham, NC)
item.description:
BD (Becton, Dickinson and Company) is a global medical technology company that manufactures and sells medical devices, instrument systems and reagents, and is dedicated to enriching people’s health throughout the world. BD offers a very competitive compensation and benefits package, and a strong leadership commitment to individual development and learning.


The Senior Software Engineer position will play a critical role in the full life cycle of our chronic care solution - from design and development through ongoing maintenance. This role primarily focuses on creating the back-end software needed to support our chronic care platform. You should have experience in building mobile and/or web based applications with a focus on the back-end and a passion for improving the state of healthcare.


Additional duties & responsibilities include:



  • Act as a full-stack developer focused on the back-end. Working in Java you’ll design, build and maintain the systems used by our mobile and web clients to enable our solutions.

  • Assist in building the rich client applications on mobile (Xamarin) or web (Vaadin).

  • Assist Data Scientists in translating models into production at scale.

  • Mentor and lead junior developers in the implementation of software components.

  • Maintain and support the code base.

item.title: Lead PHP Developer at Academic Approach (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
The Lead Developer will bring Academic Approach’s Learning Management System to life. We’re tech savvy but we need help taking our vision and product to the next level. As the Lead Developer, you will help to create and maintain products that inspire and transform students’ and schools’ exam readiness and college readiness and in doing so, will forever change a student’s trajectory towards college success.


The Lead Developer will need to be a self-starter that is confident in their coding capabilities, a creative thinker, a skilled developer, and a great communicator. You will be the lead developer at Academic Approach, a company that is trusted throughout the education community for its expertise, professionalism, and care for students. You will have a great opportunity to take on increasing leadership roles, including the potential to build a team around you and eventually be considered for a Chief Technology Officer position.


The position will be based out of our Chicago office. However, we are flexible if the candidate would rather work out of our New York office. If the candidate is a perfect fit with Academic Approach and is not located in Chicago or NYC, we will consider allowing him or her to work remotely. 


Key Responsibilities



  • Design, create, and maintain a web-based test prep and learning management system that is currently in development

  • Provide technical ownership and oversight across all areas of application development from requirements gathering through delivery

  • Oversee and perform development in PHP

  • Design, code, test, debug, and document software according to the functional requirements

  • Oversee and perform analysis, diagnosis, and resolution of errors

  • Work closely with the contracted development and design team

  • Effectively manage time to include work on multiple projects, tight deadlines, and prioritize assignments as necessary

item.title: Senior Cloud Architect at Rubicon Labs, Inc. (Austin, TX)
item.description:
A critical component of the Rubicon cloud and Internet of Things (IoT) security platforms is a scalable trust infrastructure. This candidate will be responsible for driving innovation in design and development of a distributed cryptographic trust brokering service. This service will integrate with a custom Rubicon secure execution environment and must be architected with the following in mind: reliability, low-latency, redundancy, security, and as needed administrative functionality. Rapid prototyping will be done with cloud software emulation followed by customization for Rubicon trust server hardware that forms the foundation of server and device security.



The candidate will be a key contributor of the engineering team delivering our first generation enterprise security solution for Rubicon Labs. Duties will include:



  • Translating technical requirements to engineering tasks

  • Estimating level of effort for engineering tasks

  • Participating with the engineering team to drive architectural design

  • Collaborate with product and business development teams to define customer solutions

  • Prioritizing engineering tasks based on business objectives and customer needs

  • Implementing and unit testing new or modified system modules and/or features

  • Producing technical documentation

  • Acting as a mentor to junior members of the engineering team

  • Proactively keeping current with relevant technical trends, techniques, tools and systems

item.title: Java Developer - Publishing/Newsroom at Financial Times (London, UK)
item.description:
Projects you might work on



  • A greenfield development role, working on a team building a new content platform using APIs for content delivery and harnessing triple store capabilities for semantic enrichment in order to offer more flexible ways to ingest FT content that will lay the foundation for building the next generation of FT.com. We actively use BDD, continuous delivery and DevOps within the team as a recipe for success and accelerated agile delivery.



  • A position within our Editorial Technology programme. This exciting new programme means working directly with our Editorial team to support the newsroom's continued digital evolution through the creation and adoption of new tools and improvements to existing tools.  Work will initially include exploring the world of data in the newsroom, and using our Content API to feed into our CMS.


Responsibilities


This role will work within the development team, developing and unit testing solutions to meet business requirements in a timely manner. Development at the FT is done within larger programmes of work using individual agile streams and within that framework this role will be required to implement fully robust software solutions, working closely with the QA team members to develop a repeatable, end-to-end testing process.

item.title: Software Developer Team Lead at Kenan Advantage Group (North Canton, OH)
item.description:

The candidate should have a positive attitude and a high aptitude for solving complex business and technical problems while dealing with challenging schedules.

item.title: Software QA Automation Engineer at CYREN GmbH (Berlin, Germany)

  • Map the QA aspects of development process into goals such as verifications, activities, measurements, abilities, and commitments

item.title: iOS Developer (C, C++) at Guided Knowledge Central (Bucureti, Romania)
item.description:
We are looking for an experienced and talented full-time colleague to join our development team. You will work on iOS mobile applications development, new ones as well as updates to existing apps, related to music and sports. In this role, you must be able to work well with other team members, multi-task, quickly adapt to new development environments, learn new systems, create reliable/maintainable code and find creative and scalable solutions to difficult and complex problems. Up for the challenge?


We offer:



  • Competitive salary

  • Professional work environment (from smart juniors to patent authors)

  • Great personal and professional development opportunities

  • Valuable exposure to different teams and cultures
