We appreciate evolution at every level and people's evolution is the base for growth, modernization and innovative solutions. If you are willing to work with us and let your creativity glow, join us in this big adventure.

item.title: Software Engineer (Scala) at Connexity (Camarillo, CA)
item.description:
Connexity is looking for a talented, highly motivated Software Engineer II (Scala).  We are not a LAMP stack shop, but rather a NoSQL, Big Data, Real-Time stream processing shop. Our architecture is unique and our software stack purposefully diverse. We are searching for an engineer that likes a challenge, wants an opportunity to work with cutting edge technologies, and thrives in small teams. We are looking for a developer that wants to "own" key aspects of the client interface and take pride in its evolution. Your contributions will be immediate and will be felt throughout the company. Connexity is fun, fast-paced, and open-ended with a strong entrepreneurial spirit and with emphasis on being innovative.  We also provide ample opportunity for our engineers to grow their skillset beyond web development, offering a chance to design around several NoSQL platforms including Hadoop.


YOU WILL BE ACCOUNTABLE FOR



  • Write design specifications, programming specifications, and documentation

  • Develop and maintain applications written in a Scala platform environment, operating on a Linux platform or appropriate technologies

  • Create logic to interface with RDBMS and NoSQL systems (Postgres, HBase, Hadoop)

  • Develop systems and APIs for interfacing with open and proprietary network services and complex business logic/algorithms

  • Design, deliver, develop and implement features and functionalities for large-scale, multi-tiered, distributed software applications, tools, systems and services

  • Assist in the writing of unit and functional tests and documentation for the projects/tools

  • Assist in gathering and analyzing of business and functional requirements and translate requirements into technical specifications for robust, scalable, supportable solutions that work well within the overall system architecture

  • Working with members of the Engineering team, participate in the completion of aggressive goals and meet strict deadlines

  • Try to resolve problems and roadblocks as they occur and escalate as necessary

  • Interact with internal and external peers and/or managers to exchange semi-complex information related to assigned activities

  • Be an active participant in an Agile/SCRUM environment

item.title: Systems Engineer, AWS Network Monitoring at Amazon (Dublin, Ireland)
item.description:
Amazon is looking for Systems and Software Engineers to build and scale the software that monitors one of the world’s largest and most complex networks. Tens of millions of customers rely on Amazon’s network for using our retail websites, accessing content on their Kindles and building applications and businesses on top of Amazon Web Services (AWS). Our goal is to become The Infrastructure Platform for the world - achieving this goal requires high-leverage, massively scalable software systems. Our success depends on our world-class network infrastructure, and our network depends on our Network Monitoring Scaling team.



- You are interested in being part of a high-bar team with global responsibility for the Network Monitoring software used across all of Amazon’s businesses.

- Solving problems at scale excites you.

- You do not implement specs from analysts and architects - you talk to your customers and design solutions to their problems. You automate and innovate.

- You do not push just one technology agenda - you choose the best tool for the problem at hand.

- You believe that the craft of software engineering is about writing code right the first time. For you, code reviews and automated testing are not chores - they are a core part of writing great software.

- You do not throw your code over the wall. You launch it, own it, support it and make it incrementally better for the benefit of your customers.

- You enjoy working in a flexible, fast-paced, collaborative team environment.

- Very strong problem solving and coding skills.

- Bash experience plus knowledge of at least one scripting language (Python, Perl, Ruby)

- Strong track record of working in areas of significant complexity and 'getting things done'

- Record of mentoring other engineers to maintain architectural vision and software quality.

- Understanding of data structures, algorithms and their performance.

- Proficient at designing software systems - from high-availability large-scale distributed systems to bespoke scripted solutions.

- Advanced UNIX (preferably Linux) systems engineering skills.

- A strong understanding of core internet technologies (e.g. TCP/IP).

- Understanding of the building blocks of computer systems; comfortable working with bits & bytes.



- Computer Science degree, or equivalent experience.

- The desire to work in a fast paced and constantly evolving agile environment

item.title: Software Engineer at Yext (New York, NY)
item.description:
We believe the most successful engineering orgs move quick and communicate efficiently.  To facilitate this, we keep our teams small at at 3-7 members, use Scrum methodology, and run two week sprints with daily stands up.  The first Monday of the sprint is planning, and the second Friday is demo day where teams show off what they've accomplished the past two weeks.


Our mission is to be a global software company that is constantly pushing the envelope.  Whether it's scaling our systems to handle another 100k locations, doing R&D on new products and features, or minimizing the time it takes information to go from our CMS to our publisher partners, our engineers work on challenging problems that make an impact.  The best way to learn is hands on, so we're going to have you pushing code from week one.  


Responsibilities



  • Participate in full life-cycle software development

  • Design, implement, and deploy highly scalable and reliable systems

  • Build storage systems, libraries, and frameworks.

  • Contribute ideas for new features and identify areas for improvement proactively

  • Collaborate effectively across teams, including outside of engineering

  • Write clean, tested, and well-documented code

item.title: Front End Developer / Designer > Global Platform for Local Culture at The Culture Trip (London, UK)
item.description: This is a great opportunity to take up a key Development and Design role in an exciting, very-fast growing global platform for local culture. You will work closely with CEO, CTO and a top-notch multi-disciplinary team (editorial, social, product, R&D) to ensure delivery of world class UI/UX across multiple platforms (web, mobile web, Android and iOS) and refine product definition. You will code the front-end and integration with the backend and be involved in the design for the site revamp and mobile app. We will transition and migrate from a proprietary CMS to an open-source CMS over the next few months. The company just secured Series A funding and is executing a substantial recruitment drive over the next few weeks. We would like this position filled asap.

item.title: Software Development Manager at Communication Service for the Deaf (Austin, TX)
item.description:
CSD is now hiring a Software Development Manager to lead the development and implementation of next generation products and services for Deaf and Hard of Hearing communities. The Software Development Manager leads our team of designers, developers, programmers, and engineers charged with releasing innovative technologies benefiting the global marketplace.

You'll get to:


  • Lead CSDs multi-state Software Development team, ensuring optimal allocation of internal and contracted programming talent and resources to ensure timely delivery of deliverables and project milestones. Evangelizes and drives engineering best practices.

  • Collaborate with internal stakeholders in evaluating strategic technology development, management of product priorities and projects, defining the goals and development plan for each software project, and establishing policies and procedures for software engineering and programming teams to meet product specifications

  • Provide technical insight and judgment of feature/schedule/cost tradeoffs. Ensure that product architecture and technology decisions support corporate strategies and future direction of the products

  • Manage the Design/Code Review, Unit Test, Component Test and such activities, and support the Quality Assurance team with ensuring quality products and deliverables

  • Establish platform scalability metrics, testing criteria, data samples, and system configuration and revises, as appropriate, to support long-term growth and sustainability of services

  • Define and publish coding best practices and standards, scalability goals, and provides continued mentorship of the development team to adopt and apply those standards

  • Ensure timely delivery of software products based on established specifications

  • Define, deploy, and drive sustainable and repeatable process improvements through the entire software development lifecycle

  • Tailor and implement software development methodologies, best practices, and standard work to achieve the highest product quality while continuously improving performance, productivity and execution of the software organization

  • Motivate and mentor team members, developing a sense of empowerment and shared responsibility for CSD products and services

  • Define and champion leading software technologies to improve the efficiency, quality, and ease of use of our products and solutions

Most importantly, the ideal candidate will be an experienced professional who wants to change the world for the good. Lex Luthers need not apply.

Benefits


CSD offers a competitive benefits package for full-time employees. For a full list of benefits and perks, please visit the career page.

Communication Service for the Deaf, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Affirmative Action Employer and drug free and tobacco free workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

item.title: Early Stage Career - Java Software Engineer at Kobalt Music Group (London, UK)
item.description:
As a graduate software engineer at Kobalt you’ll be involved in the whole development lifecycle: requirement gathering, specification, development, building, testing and deployment of our in-house system and writing fast, reliable and clean code on a daily basis. Our new developers are always mentored by an existing and more experienced member of the team.


This is no small task: our system is currently responsible for sending worldwide notifications of all of our clients’ songs; and it delivers albums, singles and videos to a whole host of digital services, including iTunes, Spotify, YouTube and many others. It also licenses use of our clients work in TV, Film, Games, and Adverts. Once all of that has been done, it then has the not-so-small job of processing the millions of resulting payments through to our clients. All of this is just the tip of the iceberg, and everything that happens in our system is reflected in our industry-leading client Portal so that our clients know what’s happening.


This means that you’ll be working with core Java libraries, Swing UI, J2EE technologies and Apache/Tomcat, and testing with JUnit. You could be modifying or creating new third party integrations with AWS, PayPal, Docusign or others. Perhaps you’ll be adapting our processes for encoding, transcoding, and delivering master audio and video files. No one week will be like another as we strive to improve and innovate.


At all times you’ll be responsible for ensuring your changes move swiftly through our continuous integration processes, and liaising with other departments to improve their overall experience of our systems.

item.title: Senior Java Developer at Autodata Solutions (London, ON, Canada)
item.description:
Autodata Solutions is looking for multiple Senior Java Developers for their London, Ontario office.


Position Overview:


As the Senior Developer, your primary role is to design, code, test, debug and analyze software programs and applications. You will be expected to drive and contribute to researching, designing, documenting, and modifying software specifications throughout the production life cycle in areas with broad scope. This position contributes heavily to the guidance and mentoring of other developers.  This role is being offered as a permanent full-time opportunity without the option of working remotely. 


Key Responsibilities:



  • Write software components and applications according to specifications and industry standards with thorough code reviews and mentor others in this effort

  • Occasionally acting as the project Technical Lead, you will work with Business Analysts, Architects & other Programmers in conceptualizing and developing new software programs & applications

  • Guide & assist in the preparation and documentation of program requirements 

  • Run and monitor software performance tests on new and existing programs for the purposes of correcting errors, isolating areas for improvement and general debugging

  • Generate statistics and prepare reports for management and/or team members on the status of the project

  • Liaise with Network Administrators, Systems Analysts, Database Administrators and Software Engineers to assist in resolving problems with client software products or software systems


Apply for this role directly using the following link: Click Here!.  We look forward to hearing from you!  For more information about Autodata Solutions, we invite you to check out our website at www.autodata.net.


We thank all applicants for their interest however only those selected for an interview will be notified.  Autodata Solutions is an equal opportunity employer.  We are compliant with AODA legislation; if you require work related accommodations, please specify.

item.title: Software Engineer at Best Friends Animal Society (Kanab, UT)
item.description:
Are you an amazing Software Engineer who can provide expertise, leadership and mentorship to our IT team so that homeless pets will have technology on their side?  Our IT is growing so come work among the beautiful red rocks of Southern Utah!


Position Summary:  Responsible for providing technical expertise, leadership and mentorship to the software engineering team.  Ability to help define and set coding and architecture standards and practices and give similar input on other technical items.  Will work closely with the Sr. Manager of Application Services to determine priorities, technical approach and future direction.  Will actively generate code, participate in code reviews and be involved in deployments and operational support.


Responsibilities:



  • Providing software engineering team with leadership, technical expertise and mentorship.  Working closely with the team on ensuring that the project goals are being met with the solution being coded, that standards are being followed and efficient practices are being employed.  Will help to define a standard methodology for development and ensure that all solutions are compliant. (40 percent)

  • Actively generate code, do code reviews and similar operation support/project related activities.  Will take an active hand in projects and difficult operational issues. (40 percent)

  • Work with the Sr. Manager of Application Services to understand and plan future work, discuss technical approach and other similar items. (10 percent)

  • Participate in required administrative tasks.  Will actively participate in operational support meetings, CRM support meetings and other key business support items. (10 percent)

item.title: Software Engineer(s), C/C++ and Java at Rockwell Collins IMS (formerly ARINC) (Annapolis, MD)
item.description:
At Rockwell Collins, it’s our people who make the difference and are the backbone of our technologies. Employing some of the most talented, dedicated people on the planet is not by chance. People from all over the globe choose Rockwell Collins as the cornerstone of their careers, helping create and deliver communications, integration, and engineering solutions that our global customers demand so that our world keeps moving and stays connected. Join Rockwell Collins and help shape our future while creating yours.

Rockwell Collins Surface Transportation Systems in Annapolis, MD is currently seeking a motivated Software Engineer(s) with programming experience in C and Java to join our development team. The ideal candidate(s) will perform all phases of software engineering in a SCADA and train control environment. It includes requirement analysis, design, development, code / unit test and system integration, test and field installation.

Other duties will include, but are not limited to:

- Perform software development.
- Work with and extend existing components to implement client requirements.
- Participate in Requirement analysis and Design / Code reviews.
- Assist with software testing and documentation.
- Handle documentation for procedures, training and enhancements.
- Participate on project teams to adapt ARINC's AIM rail control system for new customers.

The ongoing goals for this position are as follows:

- Design new elements or changes in scope of project software.
- Maintain and enhance existing software baseline.
- Participate in code reviews and knowledge transfer.
- Interact with end customer on technical issues.
- Meet schedule deadlines and remain within budget.
- Follow and enforce engineering guidelines set in software development methodology.
- Contribute to team coding standards and monitor the code base for compliance.
- Ability to interact with customers and correctly interpret their needs and requirements.
- Establishes and maintains effective professional relationships with internal and external stakeholders.
- Diligent Work ethic.

WE HAVE MULTIPLE OPENINGS FOR THIS POSITION.

A small organization mentality is critical for success in this position: a passionate can-do attitude, exceptional communication skills, and the ability to collaborate while acting as a thought leader in your area of expertise will serve you well at RootMetrics. Sound good? Once hired, here’s what we’ll need you to do.

item.title: Software Engineer at Telit (Lincolnshire, IL)

We are looking for a developer with experience in building high-performing, scalable, enterprise-grade applications. You will be part of a talented software team that works on mission-critical applications. You will be responsible for application development while providing expertise in the full software development lifecycle, from concept and design to testing. We have only a small technical team here so your skills are key to our success. Local candidates only.

  • Contribute in all phases of the development lifecycle.

  • Write well designed, testable, efficient code.

item.title: Android Developer at Motorola Solutions (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
We are a small agile team that works like a startup within a big company. Motorola Solutions is known around the world for innovation in Enterprise Mobility, Public Safety and Wireless Infrastructure. We are leading the next wave of innovations that enable people, enterprises and governments to be more connected and more mobile. This position is in the mobile applications development group based in Seattle, responsible for creating the WAVE Mobile Communicator used for critical communications around the globe. The enterprise mobility market is rapidly growing and we are looking for a strong strong Android developer to join us in delivering world-class solutions!


Responsibilities:


Work within an agile team to architect, design, build, test, and maintain our Android and iOS applications.


Collaborate with our cross-functional server and web client teams as well as other teams (some remote) who have a hand in creating the WAVE portfolio of products.


Work closely with other engineers, QA, project manager, and the product development team. Proactively "dogfood" the product to identify areas for improvement or enhancements.


Perks:



      Great downtown location looking directly out onto Puget Sound, Olympic Sculpture Park and Elliott Bay Trail


Secure, covered, paid parking



      Dog Fridays


Summer BBQs on the deck

item.title: DevOps Engineer at ROBLOX (San Mateo, CA)
item.description:
DevOps Engineer


About the Job


Become a critical member of an elite technical team advancing the infrastructure of ROBLOX, the largest platform in the world for emerging and independent game developers. We aren’t just building a publisher tool, but rather a technology platform providing developers with the tools they need to create their own world class games, bringing User Generated Content to the gaming space. With our user base consistently growing, we remain the #1 ranked kids entertainment site in the U.S. by ComScore. Each month we have more than 5 million active users and over 80 million total hours of engagement with peak concurrent users approaching over 200K.


You, being a talented engineer with the ability to take a big problem and break it down into smaller pieces to find the best possible solution, will work closely and collaboratively with our 5-person Ops Team on our internal development tools and automation pipelines. You will build out and significantly automate several parts of our continuous integration and test automation systems, design and build tools used internally by the engineering team, and help implement best in class configuration management and provisioning systems. You are a jack of all trades who loves having an impact on your team and product by:



  • Maintaining a 99.9% SLA for a 24/7/365 production environment

  • Developing automation to automatically detect and recover production issues in all layers from hardware, configuration, networking, and vendor outages, and continuous software upgrades

  • Quickly resolving complex problems encountered during the installation and operation of our applications, to ensure negligible impact on players and internal operations

  • Prioritizing and multitasking daily responsibilities, while being flexible enough to respond to emergent high-priority issues

  • Designing, deploying and configuring extremely complex computing environments characteristic of large-scale gaming systems

  • Leading in the execution of disaster recovery procedures and system failover efforts

  • Collaborating with highly skilled and driven colleagues in a dynamic, agile environment

  • Managing systems and developing contingency plans

  • Participating in on-call rotations


Our infrastructure management system is highly automated, enabling engineers to interact with thousands of servers across multiple environments in parallel via the command line. Our application space includes database scalability, caching, message queuing, wide-table search, recommendations, user ratings, services for mobile devices, gaming cloud management, and virtualization. We live in both the cloud and traditional data center environments.


Perks & Benefits: 



  • Robust medical, dental and vision insurance

  • 401k

  • Flexible time-off

  • Wellness reimbursement

  • Free onsite parking & other commuter benefits

  • Free catered lunches & a fully stocked kitchen with unlimited snacks!

  • Chance to work with a top-notch team on cool and unique projects!

item.title: Full-Stack Software Developer at Avvo, Inc. (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
We're looking for great software developers to help us connect people with the legal help they need.


About the Dev Team:



  • We mostly run on Rails, but have brought in technologies like Go, Angular.js, Scala, and Sinatra. We're open to using the right technologies for what we build.

  • We iterate quickly, and ship multiple times a day.

  • We work in small teams with product managers and designers, and help shape the products we'll be building from day 1.

  • We have a strong tradition of supporting open source. Projects like resque_scheduler, robut,resque_unit, and jsonapiclient were all extracted from our codebase, and we've contributed patches back to Rails.


Right now, you have an opportunity to join the team while it’s still on the small side, and grow your career faster than you would at almost any other company. You'll be able to help shape our dev organization and define our culture.


Companies in our position are rare, and joining a company like ours will be one of the most memorable parts of your life.

item.title: Salesforce Developer (m/f) at Delivery Hero (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
About the Job:


Delivery Hero is building the next generation global online food ordering platform. Our awesome international team already operates in 34 countries worldwide. We feature an environment with feedback exchange throughout the company from people who are genuine, ambitious and fun. We are looking for passionate and smart people to join us on our mission. Our ideal candidate will be enthusiastic, innovative, and good at “getting things done“. So, would you like to play an active role in our future? If so, then there is an exciting job and a workplace in the heart of Berlin waiting for you!



Your Mission:



  • Design, configure and administration of SFDC including but not limited to, Apex, VisualForce Pages, Triggers, JavaScript, Workflows, Approval Processes, Apex, assignment/escalation rules

  • Design, develop Salesforce components using apex code, visual force pages, SFDC APIs

  • Work cross-functionally with other engineering teams, such as product development and Interface development

  • Author technical design documentation that fully defines all application code and the underlying methodology for the design decisions made

  • Contribute in conducting code reviews to ensure that code quality is at the highest level possible

  • Troubleshoot issues, Identify complex problems and analyze potential solutions including workarounds as well as provide timely fixes


We offer you:



  • Startup atmosphere: Kicker, Video games and parties

  • Safety of a large company: pension scheme and stability

  • Nice work environment and English as working language

  • Spare time to spend on research and training

  • Flexible and agile company with flat hierarchy

  • For applicants from abroad: relocation package and german lessons

  • Please apply with your complete documents in English or German language.

item.title: HBO Senior Software Engineer at HBO (New York, NY)
item.description:
OVERALL SUMMARY:


The Business Systems Software Engineering team at HBO enables the business workflows using creative and pragmatic technology solutions. We are a software engineering group that develops and supports applications critical to the creation, marketing, distribution, and reselling of HBO products and are a fundamental part of HBO’s innovation and success, with offices in New York City and Seattle.

Realizing this mission requires a staff of highly motivated and technically flexible software professionals across a variety of disciplines: development, program management, test, and design. We are hiring people to build a team that can create engaging, high-quality solutions, platforms and interactive experiences.

We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer with the knowledge, motivation, and energy to help build robust and flexible custom applications as well as integrate third-party software packages. Our group supports departments such as Business Affairs, Creative Services, Enterprises, and Program Strategy and Planning.

item.title: JavaScript Developer - Sling TV at Sling TV (American Fork, UT)
item.description:
Summary:


Television is at an inflection point. New technologies and businesses are rapidly evolving and reshaping how we watch TV. We are Sling TV, an OTT (over-the-top) TV service that delivers live U.S. and international programming, as well as video on demand, over the Internet. We are seeking a Software Engineer  to join our American Fork, Utah - based team. This is an exciting position in a fast moving project that requires the ability of candidates to hit the ground running. What we’re building is revolutionary and every employee participates in a profit sharing program. Come be a part of changing the face of TV!


Sling TV delivers content from Disney/ESPN, HBO, AMC, Turner, Scripps, EPIX, Univision and Maker Studios, and is available on Amazon Fire TV, Amazon Fire TV Stick, current-generation Roku players, Roku TV models, Xbox One, Android, iOS, Macs, PCs.


JavaScript and HTML 5 engineer to support Xbox and HTML5 clients.  This is AP work and backend analytics.This is a unique opportunity to develop video ecosystem software in JavaScript around the built-in video support in HTML5. We have influence in the web standards and are heavily involved in emerging video delivery systems. The position involves developing web-based client-side software to interface with our high-scale video back-end systems. This position is focused on creating JavaScript libraries to support a web UI built on our video ecosystem framework.


Responsibilities:



  • Follows coding standards, unit tests and integration tests

  • Communicates constantly with other server and operations teams

  • Takes ownership of the project and innovates on library API design and standards

item.title: PHP Developer w Too Much Creativity for Large Firm at NuRelm, Inc (Pittsburgh, PA) (allows remote)
item.description:
We are seeking a developer to install, extend, build and support a wide array of PHP-based content management and e-commerce systems. We don't want somebody who just does what they're told, but somebody who truly loves to create and relishes a tricky challenge.


NuRelm provides a wide breadth of experience, plenty of room for professional growth, a fun workplace, and an environment that values the input of everyone on the team. We are looking for a smart person who loves the Web, who loves to learn, and who enjoys working on a variety of technologies / projects.


Benefits:


Full health coverage with prescription/dental/vision, paid vacation (3 weeks the first year, 4 weeks after the second, 5 weeks after 5 years), stock options, flexible schedules, telecommuting options (we telecommute 3 days a week and work from Cube Creative Space in East Liberty), gear allowance, frequent team building activities disguised as happy hour.


Duties:



  • Develop, test, and support PHP web applications.

  • Develop and maintain websites using common PHP-based CMS tools such as Drupal and WordPress.

  • Develop and maintain online stores using common PHP-based e-commerce systems such as PrestaShop.

  • Develop software through the entire software development lifecycle while adhering to agile methodologies.

  • Learn new tools and techniques for building great software.

  • Willingness and aptitude to move seamlessly between multiple programming languages, frameworks, and platforms.

  • Bring your own expertise to share with the staff and add to your experience by learning from others in a collaborative environment.

  • Administration and support of client sites hosted under Windows and Linux.

item.title: Senior Mobile SDK Engineer (iOS and Android) at Kahuna (Palo Alto, CA)
item.description:
Kahuna is the trusted leader for successful marketers and product managers to delight their customers in the mobile era.  We are looking for senior software engineers to help architect the next generation of mobile SDKs for the Kahuna engagement platform.  The SDK is embedded in our customer’s applications on hundreds of millions of devices.  These applications are sending billions of end-user events a month which allows our customers to understand and communicate to end-users with personalized content at the right time and on the right device.


As a mobile SDK engineer you will be directly responsible for delivering high quality SDKs to our customers that their application developers will love and will allow them to easily drive end-user engagement with their brand.  You will have the opportunity to keep up with the latest trends in mobile and wearable technologies, application development and the nuances of operating systems and runtime environments.  


This is a ground floor opportunity to work on cutting edge technologies, big data processing and real-time communication with connected devices.  You will work in a fun environment with some of the best engineers in SIlicon Valley.  You will also gain invaluable experience from being a developer evangelist and providing thought leadership on building intelligent mobile applications of the future.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Opera Mediaworks (San Mateo, CA)
item.description:
Responsibilities


We are looking for a talented individual to join our team of developers responsible for building the Opera advertising platform.


This position will entail delivering everything from small incremental improvements to existing systems, to building out new systems as we continue to refine our operation and grow into new market verticals. As well as being enthusiastic about the product we are building, the qualified candidate will be skilled in application architecture, and will have rock-solid hands-on experience with all or most of the technologies currently in use. These include: Linux, PHP, Javascript, HTML, XML-based web services, and MySQL. This is a fast-paced dynamic environment that calls for someone with ample skills and energy. This position is located in San Francisco, CA and San Mateo, CA. Work in a Global company. Flexible work hours.

  • Design system architecture and code applications based on product and market input from Product and Engineering management.

  • Improve development process and add automation to create high quality, reliable system builds. Experience with Subversion is preferred.

item.title: Lead Developer / Co-Founder at ShopAGoGo LLC (Pittsburgh, PA)

ShopAGoGo LLC, a funded e-commerce startup, has an equity opportunity for a visionary professional ready to assume the role of Lead Developer/Co-Founder (LD).  Co-Founder level recognition and responsibility creating and managing software applications that directly generate millions of dollars in revenue will be rewarded with salary and company stock options.



  • Lead Developer / Co-Founder will be integral to growing company technology platform and brand assets for merger or acquisition

item.title: Lead Software Engineer - Site Development at Cimpress (Vistaprint's Parent Company) (Lexington, MA)
item.description:
The R&D Team (code name: Columbus) was named to “conquer the blue ocean” by disrupting and opening up a new market for Cimpress and Vistaprint.  Specifically, this relatively small team has started building an entirely new technology stack hosted in the cloud that leverages Vistaprint’s deep domain knowledge in the field of mass customization and e-commerce to enable many new types of products to be purchased and customized online. 


A large part of this work is focused on creating new, more intuitive user experiences for customizing products virtually over the web, disrupting how customers purchase many of these products currently.  While much of this is green field development, it requires exceptional engineers that will routinely have a huge impact on the business.  Engineers are expected to have solid experience in back-end and middle tier development in addition to expert level knowledge of client side development, technologies and best practices.  Particular focus will be on delivering truly innovative user interfaces that let people seamlessly select, design, and preview customized products online.  You will work with multiple technologies and programming languages.  Our engineers develop across our entire technology stack, from the database and back-end APIs up through the presentation layer.  We’re currently working on a number of interesting projects that will have strategic impact for the business:



  • Substantial improvements to our product visualization capabilities including accurately depicting particular types of decoration on non-flat, irregularly shaped products.  These improvements will be leveraged in highly configurable ways such that they can be easily extended to partner organizations.

  • Catalog and product organization and find-ability improvements including algorithms that leverage deep product data to easily find similar or related products amongst very large product populations

  • We have a number of other challenging projects in our queue that have the opportunity to vastly improve our customer experience, e.g. in-line text, dynamic design portability and re-colorization and merchant tools to support integration with locally specific brands or customer sets. 


As a Lead Software Engineer on the Columbus development team you will be joining an experienced, highly driven development team.  You will work within green field development areas that create new business opportunities for a large and fast growing company.  Particular focus will be on delivering scalable solutions that automate what are often manual processes within other businesses.  You will work with multiple technologies and programming languages.  Our engineers develop across our entire technology stack, from the database and back-end APIs up through the presentation layer. 


Requirements:



  • At least 5 years of industry experience using Object Oriented programming languages (C#, Java, C++).

  • Web development experience.

  • Experience with javascript

  • Strong written and oral communication skills.

  • BS/MS in Computer Science, MIS, CIS, or equivalent.

item.title: Senior 3D Software Engineer at E4D Technologies (Richardson, TX)
item.description:
Are you resourceful, innovative, forward thinking, committed and have a passion for software development? If you are, please read on!


We have an excellent opportunity for a 3D Graphics Software Engineer to join our R&D team and contribute to developing our next generation 3D design software using innovative UI and intelligent algorithms to make the CAD/CAM process more intuitive.


E4D Technologies is a high-tech medical device company focused on 3D imaging, successful entrepreneurship, and commercialization of new technologies. The company has taken the dental profession to a higher level of productivity, patient comfort and convenience with its E4D CAD/CAM restorative systems and software solutions for dental offices, laboratories and teaching institutions.


We use the latest tools and standards to develop high-performance, cross-platform 3D design applications that keep us extremely competitive in our market. Our team is lean and mean, using scrum to develop high-quality code quickly and efficiently. E4D is an R&D-driven company, with an executive leadership team led by 3D coders.  Like technology itself, E4D Technologies is moving the future of digital dentistry forward with ongoing investment in imaging and CAD/CAM technology. With research and development led by the top electrical, mechanical, optical, firmware, and software engineers in the industry, E4D Technologies is committed to staying on the leading edge of precision, quality and digital applications


You will participate as high-level technical expert in design, coding, testing, and debugging.  Please visit our website at e4d.com.

item.title: Senior QA Engineer at HyTrust (Mountain View, CA)
item.description:
HyTrust is seeking a Senior QA Engineer to help improve the quality and performance of its award-winning flagship product, HyTrust CloudControl. The ideal candidate will combine hands-on experience on one or more virtualization platforms, an understanding of the ecosystem in large customer environments, and an instinct for uncovering quality, usability and performance issues. 


The HyTrust product suite provides control and visibility for virtualized infrastructures as well as encryption and key management capabilities for cloud-hosted virtual machines and data.

item.title: .NET Software Developer at 21st Century Oncology (Fort Myers, FL)
item.description:
21st Century Oncology is a leading developer and operator of radiation therapy centers, medical oncology, and multi-specialty practices throughout the US.  Our centers, which are freestanding and hospital based, provide a full spectrum of radiation therapy services and medical oncology treatment to cancer patients, and multi specialty care to patients in the areas of Urology, Gynecology and medical specialties.  We are growing and need highly qualified candidates to join our team.



We are seeking an experienced .NET Software Developer to support our Financial Systems team in Fort Myers, FL. 


This position will be responsible for the development, maintenance, and support of custom PC applications, conversions, interfaces, and utilities to further the business objectives of this organization. This position will cooperate with I.T. management and existing programmers to deliver complete projects, including gathering end user requirements, designing, prototyping, coding, testing, implementation, and maintenance. Position reports to the IT Development Manager.

item.title: Python Software Developer to Help Build Our Betting Platform! at BetBright (Dublin, Ireland)
item.description:
We are looking for an experienced Python Software Developer to join our ever-growing development team. As a Python Software Developer, you will be delivering quality user-friendly software for BetBright using your seriously awesome programming skills (for real).


As an experienced developer, you get the requirements of a start-up environment with its fast-paced, changing nature and are keen to continue adapt and develop your skill set- keeping up to date with existing and emerging technologies.


You will be:



  • Developing high quality, efficient code to meet business needs

  • Designing and developing websites ensuring strong optimization and functionality

  • Updating our betting system to work with new market types

  • Adding new pre-play or in-play sports to our sportsbook product

  • Functionally testing all developed code to a very high standard to enable QA to test efficiently

  • Researching and proposing appropriate new technologies to meet business challenges

  • Developing websites with high levels of usability targeting specific audiences

  • Analysing, reviewing and modifying web systems by maintaining, documenting, testing, developing and monitoring

item.title: Software Engineer at Raise.com (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
Job Description:


Raise is looking for its next generation of technical leaders.  As part of a cross-functional agile team, you strive to build user-focused solutions with technical superiority.  You balance usability needs with the functional and performance requirements befitting our global marketplace.  You share the knowledge gained through your career through mentoring, code reviews, and frequent pairing sessions.


As part of a small, fast growing team, there is immense growth potential both from an engineering as well as a business standpoint. If you're a smart, hardworking problem solver who enjoys working with autonomy, but understands how to take complete ownership of a project while meeting deadlines, this is the perfect role for you.


___


Raise Engineering:


Our software engineers are solving problems at scale for our online, gift card marketplace. Our user base and e-commerce transactions are growing exponentially. The challenges of keeping our services running 24x7, and adding new features to accelerate our business, all while moving incrementally to a continuous-deployment, microservice architecture are all awesome problems to solve. An understanding and commitment to our team approach to software development is of primary importance. Teams build software here. Besides obvious technical strengths, we look for passion for well-crafted software, professionalism, drive to learn new technologies, the joy of building solutions for our business and users, and the desire to cultivate a challenging, innovative, and supportive engineering culture.


Engineering teams at Raise have a great deal of autonomy and independence, with real ownership of the products and features they build. This role requires a unique balance of software-development skill and product sense — so the ideal candidate will have experience building substantial customer-facing products or services.


Impact- Raise is an engineering culture at its core. Our goal is to create an optimal environment where engineers regularly see and feel the difference they make.


Elegance - We care about code. Every engineer, from leadership to individual contributor, code on a daily basis.


Tackling Challenges - We don’t believe in being fast followers. Instead we’re focused on creating amazing experiences for customers while solving problems they knew existed.


Professional Growth - Each engineer has an individual career plan carved out for them upon joining Raise. Whether you want to be an individual contributor or have aspirations for leadership, we’ll work to help you realize your career goals.


Smart Team - Great people want to work around great people. We understand that, so we’ve created a thorough and systematic hiring process to ensure we only hire top quality engineers.


Disruptive Goals - Raise engineers think BIG. We never settle for mediocrity and are excited about our future.

item.title: Senior DevOps Engineer at Schrödinger (New York, NY)
item.description:
Our mission: Dramatically improve human health and quality of life by developing and applying advanced computational methods that transform the way compounds and materials are designed.


What we do:We develop a software platform for drug researchers, replacing labor-intensive procedures in favor of automation. Our platform gives access to an unparalleled combination of collaboration, data access, and computational modeling tools that speed up the drug discovery process. This technology allows scientists to run virtual experiments on massive compute grids and to analyze the resulting large dataset efficiently as a team.


Who we are: We are a community of passionate, friendly, and skilled team players. We are a diverse set of developers, entrepreneurs, and scientists who have made the decision to collaborate together on something with significant human impact. We take pride in our relationships with many satisfied clients, including numerous large pharmaceutical companies. Our investors are fellow technology visionaries, including Bill Gates.


The position: As a Senior DevOps Engineer at Schrödinger, you will design and develop scalable methods of building, deploying, and supporting our enterprise application services and systems across various machine infrastructures (primarily Amazon AWS). These are industry-transforming systems that our users (drug researchers) depend on daily to move their projects forward.


The position is one that draws on technical skills stemming from development operations, systems engineering, as well as systems administration. You will leverage these existing technical strengths to understand our existing infrastructure while being given the freedom to innovate major improvements to meet changing needs. This role is primarily an engineering one that does not require experience in the physical sciences (chemistry, biology, or physics).


Responsibilities:


Architect and implement the infrastructure for building, testing, deploying, tuning, and troubleshooting our engineering team’s production and development systems


Advise the development team on best practices throughout the design process of their applications, to ensure that they can be delivered to manageable and highly available production environments


Communicate frequently with stakeholders to prioritize infrastructure enhancements by DevOps team


Design and manage our monitoring/alerting systems


Organize and participate in the on-call schedule process for our operations team


Requirements3+ years of relevant work experience: DevOps/Infrastructure, Test Automation, Systems Administration, and/or Development


Experience working with modern infrastructure operations and automation tools:


server virtualization (e.g. Amazon AWS, Xen, Rackspace, VMWare)


cluster configuration (e.g. Chef, Puppet, Salt)


continuous integration and testing (e.g. Jenkins, Hudson, BuildBot)


Proficient knowledge of and passion for the UNIX operating system:process limits, devices


networking / http


system administration and bash


we primarily use Ubuntu/Debian, Centos/Red Hat


Experience solving security problems:


certificate management, network/firewall configuration, encryption


Experience working with Monitoring and Alerting Tools:e.g. Datadog, Nagios, Zenoss


Experience with a modern scripting language:


e.g. Python, Ruby


Experience with the deployment and maintenance of databases:e.g. PostgreSQL, MySQL, Oracle, MongoDB


Experience with source control


e.g. GIT, SVN


Proficient interpersonal skills (oral/verbal communication), complemented by an ability to collaborate in a team environment


Enthusiasm for solving interesting problems and a willingness to learn


Ability to ask smart questions, think outside the box, and be creative


Pluses:


Bachelors in CS/Engineering/related field


Experience deploying distributed web applications:


e.g. Apache, Nginx, NFS, LDAP


Experience working with containerization (e.g. Docker, Vagrant, LXC)


Advanced DBA skills


Experience with maintaining databases and database replicationScience minor or independent interest (chemistry, physics, biology, or related)


Check out the website for our platform here: https://www.schrodinger.com/livedesign/



We are prepared to offer a highly competitive compensation package for an exceptionally well-qualified candidate. Benefits include medical, dental, 401(k), flexible spending account, 3+ weeks vacation, and tuition reimbursement.

item.title: Software Engineer -Voice Guidance,Text-to-Speech(TTS) at HERE, a Nokia company (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
HERE Berlin is an innovative branch where an international team of 50+ nationalities create Location Based Services at the highest level.


Join our fast growing, highly motivated Navigation team as an experienced Software Engineer specializing in voice package development. The Navigation team offers a unique chance of developing voice guidance features for cutting edge turn-by-turn navigation products used on automotive, smartphones, mobile devices and web services.


You will be responsible for creating high quality voice directions for navigation systems used in over 40 different countries/languages.


 The responsibilities include (but are not limited to):
 


  • Design, development and maintenance of voice directions software for turn-by-turn navigation products

  • Development of tests and test automation tools for the voice directions software and related content.

  • Being accountable for the quality assessment of the software both functionally and non-functionally.

  • Ensure proper deployment of the software to test and public servers

  • Integration of delivered technologies in the voice software

  • Coordination of  activities with project and product management

  • Documentation of developed code, tools and test environments

  • Coordination of new feature implementation with other teams

item.title: DevOps Engineer - AWS, Cloudera, Hadoop... at Chartboost (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
We deal with an extraordinary amount of traffic, our platform encompasses everything from API calls to servicing a real-time dashboard to delivering ads to mobile games. 


We are looking for someone with energy to take our mission-critical infrastructure to the next level. This includes provisioning, load balancing, service hosting and uptime, monitoring, alerting and everything else. 


You are looking for the opportunity to work in a complex, high traffic system and be given the freedom to create this system the “right way”.  We really want this role to “own” this side of our platform and build and be responsible for making our platform awesome and reliable.

item.title: Backend Software Engineer at Planet Labs (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Software touches every corner of our company, enabling us to continually improve every process by controlling the tools that run them. In addition to our internal tools that control the manufacturing, testing, operating and optimizing the satellites we also run a massive data processing pipeline that crunches terabytes of imagery (and will soon do that every single day). We run a cloud-first, API-driven architecture. Our goal is to enable everyone in the world to access our imagery, so huge web-scalability is a requirement. Our ‘full stack’ runs from the spacecraft to our web tools, and there are enough hard and interesting problems to keep many teams busy for a long time to come.


Our Backend Software engineers currently code primarily in C and Python. We run tens of thousands of jobs per day on an AWS infrastructure with PostgreSQL, Flask and ElasticSearch.  Our applications are built on a foundation of open source projects. We work to be active contributors of those projects and dedicated stewards of new open source image processing and infrastructure projects.

item.title: Senior App Developer at BBC (Cardiff, UK)
item.description:
myBBC is a new and high profile programme designed to make the BBC online experience feel personal and relevant to our audience, encouraging them to view, listen to, or play with our content; be that content they know and love, or content we help them discover. It’s basically about content!


As Tony Hall, Director General of the BBC, said; “it's the start of a real transformation – the myBBC revolution. How to reinvent public service broadcasting through data. But we will always be doing it in a BBC way – not telling you what customers like you bought, but what citizens like you would love to watch and need to know.”


Sounds exciting, eh?


So, what will you do on a daily basis, to help make a difference to the delivery and continuous development of the myBBC product? Glad you asked…


You’ll:



  • Create analytics measurement code for integration into BBC Apps such as iPlayer and iPlayer Radio, and across the entire BBC estate.

  • Build well-designed, performant code libraries.

  • Communicate effectively with teams across the BBC on integration of code, supporting integration, and helping diagnose issues.


And you’ll lead the technical design of code components where appropriate.


You’ll also keep up to date with developments in the field that may be advantageous to your own delivery. As well as help and coach other team members as you see fit.

item.title: IOT Software Engineer Embedded Linux Development at Intel (Leixlip, Ireland)
item.description:
Creating and extending computing technology to connect and enrich the lives of every person on Earth--that's our vision, is it yours? We are changing the world at Intel. 


Step inside our world and you'll find one brilliant mind after another working together in a spirit of collaboration that is simply contagious. And through this shared dedication-this culture of innovation and exploration-we do more than deliver the latest technologies. We deliver the future. See for yourself. Look Inside. 


That's where you come in. We need innovators and proven communicators like you to push our thinking. We need your strong collaboration and organizational skills, as well as your ability to effectively work with and manage teams. You will help push us to the next level. Joining us means joining a dynamic team at a company that has established a reputation for innovation. 


As an IoT Software Engineer – Embedded Linux Development in Quark Design team you will play an integral role in designing and developing software for new Quark silicon devices, ensuring that we develop outstanding products. Your responsibilities will include but are not be limited to: 


- Conducting or participating in multidisciplinary research and collaborating with design, layout and/or hardware engineers in the design, development, and utilizing of productivity enhancement layout tools and design rule checkers, electronic data processing systems software.


- Determining computer user needs, advising hardware designers on machine characteristics that affect software systems such as storage capacity, processing speed, and input/output requirements, designing and developing compilers and assemblers, utility programs, and operating systems. 


- Responding to customer/client requests or events as they occur. Developing solutions to problems utilizing formal education, judgment and formal software process.

item.title: Enterprise Support Engineer at Unity Technologies (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Unity’s Technical Support team is at the front line of the company; we solve the problems that other people can’t solve, and we look good while doing it. Our customers have crazy tight schedules and high expectations, and our developer relations engineers are up to the challenge in providing rapid, accurate, and personable assistance. As a member of the specialized Enterprise Support team, you will be instrumental in ensuring the success of our very-highest-profile customer productions.


Travel is a must, and it certainly won’t hurt to have a passion for solving intractable, never-before-seen problems on a daily basis.

item.title: Team Lead Software Engineer at TheLadders (New York, NY)
item.description:
Based in SoHo, TheLadders is an engineering-team-driven organization. We empower our software engineers to not just build great products, but to have a real say in the ‘how’ and ‘why’ the products are being built. We practice continuous integration, test-driven development, peer code reviews, pair programming and collaborative design studios. You’ll be on the cutting edge of current software development best practices and in the position to assist in the introduction of new ones.


At TheLadders, the Team Lead Software Engineer has not only the technical chops to roll up their sleeves and provide technical leadership to major projects, but also manage a team of engineers. You manage your project goals, contribute to product strategy, and help develop your team to be amazing.


In this role you will:



  • Write high-quality, efficient, testable code in Java and other object-oriented languages

  • Collaborate with some of the best engineers in the industry

  • Mentor other developers

  • Contribute to planning, design, implementation, testing, operations, and process improvement as the leader of a Scrum team.

  • Build something incredible!


Responsibilities of the Team Lead Software Engineer:



  • Manage a team of software engineers (backend, frontend, full stack), including task planning and code reviews.

  • Drive technical projects and provide leadership in an innovative and fast-paced environment.

  • Take responsibility for the overall planning, execution and success of complex technical projects.

  • Contribute technically to projects.

  • Work closely with product management team to ensure we're building the best products.

item.title: Senior Windows Engineer at SANS Institute (Seattle, WA) (allows remote)
item.description: Senior Windows Engineer responsibilities will be focused on the installation, maintenance and monitoring of SANS critical computing infrastructure, including our Learning Management System, Active Directory/IDP, and other Windows OS and Linux-based OS-based server systems. In addition, the position will be responsible for continually monitoring and adjusting the performance of our learning management systems and other business critical systems, identifying system performance issues, and making recommendations on hardware or software modifications to optimize system performance.

item.title: Android Developers at Babajob Services Pvt Ltd (Bengaluru, India)
item.description:
Babajob started as an experiment to help everyone – regardless of their literacy, income and computer skills – elevate their class level by finding a better job. We help households and companies like OLA, Puma and SnapDeal hire drivers, rural delivery workers, office helpers, housekeeping staff, cashiers, cooks and countless other roles in the modernizing economy of India.



Our interfaces span voice-only automated and call center systems to mobile apps and SMS/WhatsApp interactions to multilingual,  responsive sites for employers and job seekers, all with the goal of facilitating the right job seeker and employer connecting, calling each other, actually showing up for interviews and ultimately getting hired.



The last year has been awesome for us. We just crossed 3.5m users, have 100,000s of active users each month, receive 20,000 calls a day, 7x'd our revenue in the last 6 months and raised $10m from SEEK, the biggest job marketplace in the world, with the top job sites in Australia, China, Brazil, Mexico and many African countries.



In order to achieve our vision of helping 100s of millions get reliably hired, we are building iOS & Android apps for the largest aspiring job sector marketplace in India. In order to execute this with technical precision and scale, Babajob is building a team of highly talented engineers to deliver best in class mobile experiences.



What you will do



  • Take complete ownership of the mobile products you work on including but not limited to design, development, testing and delivery

  • Build a polished, well-performing application around a server API.

  • Work debugging a live app from crash logs and if needed track issues back from the client into the server code

  • Unit test for reliability and robustness.

  • Collaborate with cross functional teams in defining and delivering the roadmap for products on mobile and tablet devices

  • Conforming to industry standards for mobile application development, create internal technical documents and mentoring junior engineers


 What you should have



  • 3 Years of Native application development experience on Smartphones with expertise in Android

  • Experience using mobile platforms programming environments such as Eclipse and Android SDK

  • Experience in using testing and conformance frameworks for Android.

  • Experience using Web Services and Data parsing using XML, JSON.

  • Experience developing applications using multi-client development platforms such as PhoneGap, Titanium or similar platform is a strong plus

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, or equivalent

item.title: Principal Engineer (Matching Engineering) at eHarmony (Los Angeles, CA)
item.description:
eHarmony is looking for a highly talented individual to join our Matching Engineering team! Every day, eHarmony matches millions of people based on deep compatibility, built on decades of psychological research and Machine Learning. Matching is the core of eHarmony, and you have a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to be right in the middle of it. 

Your challenge as a Principal Engineer on our team will be to implement and scale these matching systems, to support ever more complex modeling processes, across a rapidly growing community of users. 


In this position, you will be responsible for:



  • Getting to work with innovative new technologies (e.g. Hadoop/Map-Reduce, NoSQL stores like MongoDB and Voldemort, AWS based cloud computing, SOA via REST services)

  • Working on a matching system that creates trillions of potential pairings in our candidate pool (over 51 million registered users)

  • Designing core back-end Matching components

  • Coding day-to-day in Java, and other languages such as Scala, Ruby, Groovy, C++.

  • Analyzing and improve the efficiency, reliability and scalability of components across the Matching infrastructure

item.title: .Net/C# Application Software Developer at SWC Technology Partners (Oak Brook, IL)
item.description:
SWC Technology Partners is searching for full-time .Net/C# Software Developers, who are experienced and passionate technologists, desiring a full time employment role in which they can leave their mark on the business world.  If you desire to work for a company that challenges you as well as provides opportunities for growth, while working with other talented developers – then SWC is where you need to be!


Our software developers can expect to work with cutting edge technology, deliver high quality solutions across various local industries, and collaborate with a team working on holistic web development projects that range in size and scope, as well as receive continuous career development opportunities. This candidate will report to the Director of Software Solutions Group.





Responsibilities:




  • Software Development: Perform hands-on customized development and unit testing of web based software solutions for our customers primarily based on Microsoft technologies, including but not limited to Microsoft .NET, Microsoft SQL Server and SharePoint

  • Software Design: Produce practical software and database designs that meet both business and technical requirements

  • Consulting: Gain a deep understanding of client needs and play an integral part in defining and proposing practical solutions to meet or exceed client expectations

  • Software Architecture: Participate in defining the software and database architecture for new solutions

  • Business Requirements Consumption: Ability to gain a deep understanding of written and verbal business requirements provided by other business analysts or customers

  • Quality Assurance: Actively participate in quality assurance, including hands-on system and user testing of the software developed when required

  • Business Requirements Gathering: Participate in client requirements gathering sessions and accurately document business requirements

  • Implementation and Support: Software deployments and ongoing software support

item.title: Senior Software Engineer-Java/Scala(Automotive) at HERE, a Nokia company (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
HERE Berlin is searching for a Senior Software Engineer with strong Java skills and interest in Scala to join our Automotive Cloud Team


About the Team


The team develops backend services, most of which are exposed using REST based interfaces. As our new team member, you will be participating in all stages of the software development lifecycle in an Agile/Lean environment and be responsible for designing, implementing and testing key components for Automotive Cloud Services products. As a Sr. Software Engineer, you will have a breadth of knowledge and success in developing highly-scalable web services as well as the ability to comprehend requirements, complete work in a timely manner and communicate information effectively. We are currently mainly developing our Software in Java, but will use Scala more frequently going forward.


 As a Software Engineer in our team, a variety of tasks is waiting for you:



  • Development of applications or system components

  • Software design and review

  • Requirements definition and analysis

  • Unit testing

  • Investigation and root cause analysis of software and system defects

  • Maintain and run tools and processes that support and automate software product release

item.title: QA Engineers, Mid-Sr. Levels at Tripwire (Alpharetta, GA)
item.description:
Tripwire delivers advanced threat protection, security and compliance solutions, enabling enterprises, government agencies and service providers to confidently detect, prevent and respond to cybersecurity threats to their business. Headquartered in Portland, Oregon, Tripwire’s customer base extends into vertical industries including government, energy, financial services, retail, manufacturing, education and entertainment. Almost all executive branch agencies of the U.S. federal government and half the Fortune 500 turn to Tripwire for their IT security and compliance needs. With thousands of customers in nearly 100 countries, there’s a reason why organizations turn to Tripwire.
Tripwire is growing and we have multiple Software Engineering openings for our core product, Tripwire Enterprise. Most of our work is server-side. We are most interested in talent and drive, but specific experience and skills matter too. Ideal candidates will have backgrounds like this:


  • Enterprise product development using modern C++

  • Scalable, distributed systems using asynchronous messaging (e.g. AMQ)

  • Knowledge/interest in the field of security

  • Agile process based on the SCRUM framework


As a successful candidate, you will demonstrate clear thought processes and communicate well with technical and non-technical audiences. You should thrive in a collaborative environment, advocate directly and politely for ideas, and speak up in support of your team. You should be a creative problem-solver, providing thoughtful approaches to challenging technical problems that solve real business needs.

item.title: Senior Protocol Firmware Engineer at SunCulture Solar (Mountain View, CA)
item.description:
Duties and Responsibilities:



  • Develop products from concept, through design, manufacturing and support to end of life

  • Work with hardware teams on board bring-up

  • Interface with contract manufacturing to support diagnostics and operations

  • Interface with various hardware and software vendors on complex system integration tasks to achieve efficient, cost-effective and delightful product solutions

item.title: Software Engineer at Silicis Technologies Inc (Westfield, IN)
item.description:
As a key member of the Silicis team, you will be responsible for development, execution and measurement of Silicis’ software. You will also be responsible for the continued integration and modification of existing software to improve performance and meet new platform requirements. The ideal candidate is a versatile developer who can translate design solutions to the highest quality standard C#, WPF, and C embedded software, and has an eye for detail that allows them to own the final quality assurance of their solutions. The applicant must demonstrate a strong interest in application development, the development process, and a curiosity and excitement for new software technologies and techniques. This position will also work closely with other disciplines as needed in a team environment that includes other electrical, software, mechanical, and aeronautical experts all working toward the success of Silicis’ platform.


Primary Responsibilities:



  • Designing, coding and debugging applications in C# for robotic platform and ground control applications

  • Work closely with Electrical Engineers on electronics & low level system interaction

  • Participate in software, electronics and systems design requirements/reviews for identification of metrics, system risk and reliability analysis

  • Coordinate software system installation during final assembly and verify system functionality to ensure specifications are met

  • Maintain standards compliance

  • Support, maintain and document software functionality for internal use and field training manuals

  • Perform multidisciplinary tasks in order to meet design/delivery requirements & timelines

  • Full lifecycle application development

item.title: Software Developer II at COCC (Southington, CT)
item.description:
COCC delivers complete enterprise processing solutions to financial institutions throughout the northeastern United States. Listed among American Banker's FinTech 100 and the Inc. 5,000 fastest growing companies in the nation, COCC inspires the industry with innovation and top quality support. Designated as a Top Workplace in Connecticut, COCC recognizes employees as the core of our success! COCC offers a progressive training program to support employees in personal and professional development.

COCC is currently seeking a Software Developer to code specific standard applications and design, repair or enhance software. Successful applicants will be motivated, energetic and enthusiastic people able to work in a group environment on major development projects. This would be a great opportunity for recent college graduates who want the opportunity and experience to work with cutting edge technology.

Primary Responsibilities:
• Designs and codes solutions for specials, conversions, enhancements and defects

item.title: Senior Web Developer at Sheridan College (Oakville, ON, Canada)
item.description:
Reporting to the Digital Marketing Production Manager, the Senior Web Developer leads and communicates the technical and functional development of Sheridan’s primary web properties including supported marketing systems, software and web applications. The Developer leverages their expertise and knowledge of web application architecture and development to achieve the strategic goals and objectives of Sheridan College through digital marketing initiatives.  The supported marketing systems, software and web applications are: Sheridancollege.ca (Sitecore CMS, WordPress), Emarketing (Emma EMS, Sitecore EXM, Subscription Centre), Print Experience Manager (PXM), Digital Marketing System (DMS, xDB) and the Continuing Education Online Store (E-Store/Active Commerce), in addition to numerous related smaller software, systems and applications. 


  Specific responsibilities include:
• Leading evaluation and development efforts of technical enhancements and modifications to the existing corporate websites and applications, which includes: reviewing requests to determine feasibility of implementation; defining site objectives by analyzing user requirements; envisioning features and functionality; developing recommendations by comparing advantages and disadvantages of custom development and purchased alternatives;  designing and developing user interfaces to internet applications by setting expectations and features priorities throughout development life cycle; determining design methodologies and tool sets; completing programming using languages and software products; designing and conducting tests; integrating applications by designing database architecture and server scripting; studying and establishing connectivity with network systems, search engines, and information servers;
• Assessing and analyzing requirements for new website features, functionality and application modules for design and implementation purposes which includes: meeting with end-users to determine needs and define scope of new projects; analyzing requirements and specifications, in the context of existing functionality and application modules, business processes and available technologies, to identify and document the impact and advise the user community of the implications;
• Providing senior technical support to maintain the existing corporate websites and applications which includes: troubleshooting complex web application issues; tracking and monitoring the resolution of reported issues; documenting solutions for resolved issues and following up with end users to ensure complete closure of reported issues;
• Providing high-level technical evaluation and analysis for web application enhancements and upgrades which includes: Reviewing existing customizations, enhancements and interfaces and determining how they are impacted by upgrades; reviewing and testing technical changes and documenting modifications;
• Maintaining, developing and sharing technical currency in a rapidly changing environment which includes:  researching new internet technologies and software products; participating in educational opportunities; reading professional publications; maintaining personal networks; participating in professional organizations;
• Performing other related duties as assigned;


Appointment Details:
Department: Marketing & Brand Strategy
Campus: Trafalgar (may be assigned activity at any campus)
Employee Group: Support Staff
Reference #: 15/S/68
Payband: J
Hourly Range: $35.52 - $41.18
Hours of Work: 40
Hours/Week: 800am - 5:00pm


Application Deadline: Open until filled

item.title: C++ Software Engineer, Mid and SR. Levels at Tripwire (Alpharetta, GA)
item.description:
Tripwire delivers advanced threat protection, security and compliance solutions, enabling enterprises, government agencies and service providers to confidently detect, prevent and respond to cybersecurity threats to their business. Headquartered in Portland, Oregon, Tripwire’s customer base extends into vertical industries including government, energy, financial services, retail, manufacturing, education and entertainment. Almost all executive branch agencies of the U.S. federal government and half the Fortune 500 turn to Tripwire for their IT security and compliance needs. With thousands of customers in nearly 100 countries, there’s a reason why organizations turn to Tripwire.
Tripwire is growing and we have multiple Software Engineering openings for our core product, Tripwire Enterprise.
This position is a leadership role requiring hands-on ability, deep technical expertise and the ability to influence across teams.
We are most interested in talent and drive, but specific experience and skills matter too. Ideal candidates will have backgrounds like this:


  • Enterprise product development using modern C++

  • Scalable, distributed systems using asynchronous messaging (e.g. AMQ)

  • Knowledge/interest in the field of security

  • Agile process based on the SCRUM framework


As a successful candidate, you will demonstrate clear thought processes and communicate well with technical and non-technical audiences. You should thrive in a collaborative environment, advocate directly and politely for ideas, and speak up in support of your team. You should be a creative problem-solver, providing thoughtful approaches to challenging technical problems that solve real business needs.

item.title: Head of Engineering (Ruby/Rails) at Guide Financial (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
If you are Ruby/Rails rockstar, committed to changing the world, are excited by audacious technical challenges, have experience leading a high performing team, and also love rolling up your sleeves and directly contributing to software development (about 50% of the time) – this is your dream job. 


This is a critical position for us (we consider it our "third co-founder"), and will impact all aspects of our company. Ruby on Rails expertise is a requirement, as is prior experience managing a team.


Read more about Guide Financial here.


Responsibilities



  • Hire and manage an engineering team to build world-class software products that are well-designed, thoroughly tested, and highly scalable

  • Serve as a inspiring technology leader to develop, mentor, retain and grow a high performing team

  • Provide significant and ongoing individual software contributions as part of the development roadmap

  • Develop and collaborate on key architectural decisions and design considerations, within Guide Financial and across John Hancock Labs
