  • Drive successful project execution on schedule and within budget

  • Ensure software engineering best practices are utilized and continuously monitored and improved

  • Work closely with other stakeholders (including design, data science, business strategy and operations, and others) to develop and deliver a product requirements

  • Continuously monitor and upgrade software to maintain industry-leading security and compliance requirements

item.title: Development Lead, Loblaw Digital at Loblaw Digital (Toronto, ON, Canada)
item.description:
Loblaw Digital is the team behind building and operating the digital businesses for Canada's largest and most successful retailer. We create leading mobile-responsive e-commerce experiences, including Loblaws Click & Collect (shop.loblaws.ca), an innovative online grocery shopping experience. We also built and operate the award-winning JoeFresh.com (Canada and US), along with the iPad/iPhone app.

Based in downtown Toronto, we operate like a startup with the resources of a much larger company. We are an entrepreneurial, fast-paced, collaborative, and fun team working to transform the way Canadians shop.

To achieve this goal, we are looking for talented and passionate individuals who want to solve challenging problems and make a significant and lasting impact on Canadians.
Role Mandate:

Working from our downtown office, you will report to the Director, Software Development and will assist in building, improving, and maintaining a world-class, multi-channel eCommerce platform. This is a hands-on technical role, leading and mentoring a team of both senior and junior developers within the eCommerce Team. You will also lead by example, developing software across the full-stack of a multi-channel platform from HTML, CSS, and JavaScript to server-side Java.

Responsibilities:

• Manage the day-to-day activities of the Development Team
• Ensure long-term direction of the project from a technical perspective
• Motivate, coach, and train team members in a manner that will exceed business’ expectations
• Provide clear directions and guidance on technical issues to all team members
• Write high-quality code for web-based applications, to create and improve robust high-volume production applications
• Develop and evaluate prototypes and ideas quickly
• Take the lead in code and architecture reviews
• Lead the effort to create and refine a modern, efficient front-end using JavaScript, CSS, and HTML using the Spring framework
• Translate wireframes, creative design, and functional requirements into final products
• Develop JavaScript solutions using standard frameworks including JQuery
• Construct design documents and documentation to aid in maintenance and code reuse
• Assist in acceptance testing for business and technical requirements
• Improve program logic and performance tuning while guaranteeing quality assurance
• Work closely with the Quality Control and Technical Communication team members to ensure high quality deliverables
• Provides input to status reports on the “health” of the application.
• Provides support by ensuring stability of the application and addressing and resolving business issues in a timely manner.

item.title: E-commerce Software Engineer at Canada's Largest Retailer! at Loblaw Digital (Toronto, ON, Canada)
item.description:
Loblaw Digital is the team responsible for building and operating e-commerce businesses for Canada’s largest and most successful retailer. We create leading mobile-responsive e-commerce experiences including Loblaws Click & Collect, an innovative online grocery shopping experience. We also built and now operate the award-winning site JoeFresh.com in Canada and the US, as well as the Joe Fresh iPad and iPhone apps, and we are proud to announce the launch of beautyBOUTIQUE.ca, our newest site that allows all Canadians to #bringBEAUTYhome with the click of a button.

We are based in downtown Toronto and operate like a start-up with extensive resources. We are an entrepreneurial, fast-paced, collaborate, and fun team working to transform the way Canadians shop.

To achieve this goal, we are looking for talented and passionate individuals who want to solve challenging problems and make significant and lasting impact on Canadians.


We are an agile shop, constantly tinkering with our process to make all our lives better. That process includes JIRA Agile for end-to-end agile project management and defects, Bamboo for CI, Git (Stash) for source control, Selenium for automated testing, JRebel and 15" Retina MacBookPro's for all our developers.


Responsibilities:



  • Java Development on the hybris eCommerce platform

  • Responsive front-end development using Javascript, CSS, HTML in a Spring framework

  • Translate wireframes, creative design, and functional requirements into functional xHTML/ CSS / Javascript

  • Develop JavaScript using standard frameworks

  • Conduct and participate in design sessions and review design documents

  • Conduct code and architecture reviews

  • Lead and participate in service capacity planning and demand forecasting, software performance analysis and system tuning

  • Profile eCommerce application to identify performance bottlenecks.

  • Debug and refactor code as needed to improve those performance bottlenecks.

  • Some system administration of Linux, Apache, Tomcat and Oracle environments.

  • Work with various Loblaw IT teams to design and architect integration into Loblaw IT systems.

  • Work together with external design and development agencies.


Skills & Requirements



  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or similar

  • 3+ years of experience in software engineering

  • 2+ years experience in object oriented design and development in Java

  • 1+ years experience developing with the Spring Framework

  • Advanced skills using J2EE Frameworks and Libraries specifically such as Hibernate, JPA and JDO

  • Database development skills including SQL programming, solid understanding of relational database technologies, logical and physical data modeling, preferably on an Oracle database

  • Backend and Frontend/Web development experience with JSP, JavaScript, JSON, jQuery, HTML, CSS

  • Experience with web app servers, such as JBoss, Websphere, and Weblogic

  • Experience using standard development tools, such as Eclipse, Ant, Git

  • Experience developing SOAP and/or REST based web services

  • Strong understanding of XML and JSON and how to manipulate using document based and stream based API’s

  • Experience working with an Agile methodology, frequent releases, automated testing, builds, deployment

item.title: Senior Software Development Manager at SonoSim, Inc (Santa Monica, CA)
item.description:
Job Description – Senior Software Development Manager


SonoSim, Inc., a start-up company, is seeking a Senior Software Development Manager to lead the technical team in scaling our product suite, company, and team. This candidate should be a self-motivated individual with strong leadership skills seeking to work in a high energy, team-oriented and friendly environment. This position reports directly to the CEO.


Job Description



  • Provide technical project management and leadership in the overall production of a high-quality ultrasound training client-server application using Agile/Scrum methodologies. This software-based product incorporates some hardware elements.

  • Manage a collaborative team of software engineers, QA analysts, and system administrators to deliver a high-quality ultrasound training simulation product.

  • Responsible for the technical production schedule and the implementation of evolving business requirements and feature sets into working product.

  • Produce iterative releases every 2 weeks as part of our Scrum methodology.

  • Liaison between Executive Management and Development Team.

  • Grow and scale technical team as company expands.

  • Collaborate with Director of Operations on Product Fulfillment, including management of Release Versioning Software, Activation Files, Software Updates and Upgrades, Server Management and Data Transfer.

  • Identify opportunities for process improvement and automation.

  • Oversee continual improvement of the code base through targeted refactoring, working unit tests, and any necessary design documentation.

  • Employ Quality Assurance best practices and standards defining, collecting, and interpreting metrics and diagrams.

  • Participate in regular status reviews with all stakeholders

item.title: Fashion+Big Data Startup looking for Backend Engineer, Madrid at StyleSage - Fashion meets Big Data (Madrid, Spain)
item.description:
StyleSage is a venture-backed fashion tech startup that creates cutting edge innovation in the data and fashion space. As recent graduates from Techstars, the world's #1 startup accelerator, we are looking for a motivated backend engineer to join our product team in Madrid, Spain.

You will be responsible for the building tools that process, analyze and monitor data -- the most important part of our product! Additionally you will:



  • Build tools that analyze data to make the quality checking process faster and more automated

  • Work with our team of international experts in web data extraction

  • Perform ad-hoc data analysis on existing data in our database

  • Use machine-learning techniques to find insights and data anomalies

  • Our current development team is only 4 people, so you will also get to see all other activities as well


We are looking for a Full-Time candidate to work with us in our Madrid office.


Interested? Apply today!

item.title: Fashion+Big Data Startup looking for Front/Full-Stack Developer, Madrid at StyleSage - Fashion meets Big Data (Madrid, Spain)
item.description:
StyleSage is a venture-backed fashion tech startup that creates cutting edge innovation in the data and fashion space. As recent graduates from Techstars, the world's #1 startup accelerator, we are looking for a Front-End/Full-Stack Developer to join our team in Madrid! As Front-End Developer your main responsibilities would include:



  • Improve the UX of our frontend and develop various frontend features using Django / Python, Javascript, AngularJS, HTML5 and CSS.

  • Develop charts that visualize data from our database using d3.js and other frameworks.

  • Our current development team is only 4 people, so you will also get to see all other activities as well



We are looking for a Full-Time candidate to work with us in our Madrid office.


Interested? Apply today!

item.title: Data Scientist at Evidence for Policy Design (Cambridge, MA)
item.description:
Evidence for Policy Design at the Harvard Kennedy School of Government (EPoD) seeks a qualified data scientist to provide support on data analytics initiatives. The candidate will work with our Data Analytics Lead to perform data cleaning and analysis, manage databases, and produce graphics and basic software applications. In addition, the candidate will be involved with the production of policy-related op-eds and data journalism-style pieces.



The position is part-time with an initial duration of 6 months and may be open to extension based on performance and subsequent demand. The position may involve travel to India.



To apply, please send a CV, cover letter, and link to your GitHub account to Eric Dodge (epod@hks.harvard.edu) with “Data Scientist Application” in the subject line. Applications will be accepted through September 30, 2015.

item.title: Data visualization engineer: Javascript at Timetric (London, UK)
item.description:
Timetric is looking for a data visualization engineer to join our small London-based technology team, and help us build great data-visualization products. Our core technology is Javascript, using ReactJS, talking to a Python/Django backend, and we build interfaces for people to visualize and explore rich datasets.


Although the technology team is small, we're part of a growing company, and we're responsible for a suite of established B2B business intelligence products, working closely with a world-class sales team and expert content creators.


We've got ambitious plans to grow and improve all our products, and build first-class interfaces that inform and delight our users. We'd love to hear from data-savvy, design conscious developers who'd could help us!

item.title: PROGRAMMER ANALYST at Western Nevada College (Carson City, NV)
item.description:
The Programmer/Analyst position is responsible for the development, implementation, and support of major application systems, and analyzing business procedures.


MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES:


• Application support – Provide ongoing technical support for various software applications to all college administrative staff.


• Application Implementation – Implement any purchased software systems, enhancements to existing software systems, and modifications to existing software systems required byNSHE system or legal requirements.


• Business Analysis – Understand and evaluate business procedures to provide a software based solution which increase productivity and efficiency to existing procedures.


• Application Development – Create new software based solutions/enhancements for both students and staff using WNCs existing framework.


• Participate in program assessment and program review.


• Serve on college and NSHE committees.


DECISION-MAKING & JUDGMENTS:


• Determines if a software based solution will increase productivity.


• Weighs whether a software based solution is feasible given the college’s current technologies and skill set.


Complete job description and to apply online, https://jobs.wnc.edu/postings/1348

item.title: Senior Full Stack Engineer at Sophos (Burlington, MA)
item.description:
SENIOR FULL STACK DEVELOPER



At Sophos, we operate at the cutting edge of technology, protecting businesses worldwide against complex threats, viruses and spam. We build high quality software security products in a fast-paced, nimble environment and we've been doing it for over 20 years.


Join us to help our customers protect their business and meet compliance needs.


Role


Senior Software Engineers possess the ability to function as a technical lead, providing technical direction to other developers. Frequently have direct responsibility for product features or key technology choices and implementation. Collaborates as part of a team for the development of complex systems; including requirements analysis, concept development and design, implementation and testing, demonstrating flexibility of role as required.



  • Candidates located in other areas of MA & NH are also welcome to apply


Main Duties



  • Drive design and implementation leveraging modern design patterns

  • Ability to partner effectively with UX, PM, DevOps, QE and other developers to design and implement meeting the spirit of requirements

  • Pride in authorship of code

  • Experience in modern front end frameworks

  • Technically curious to keep present on advances in technology

  • Experience with segregation of model, presentation, and business logic.

  • TDD experience and strong desire to build in test from the start.

  • Write code (Test or Product) to deliver against project timescales, quality and requirements in various languages including Java or other selected languages for Sophos Cloud products.

  • Conduct Unit, System and Integration testing and fixing errors, with guidance if required.

  • Work with best of breed Cloud technologies (NoSQL, high throughput event processing, cloud-scale data analytics, etc)

  • Design small software components (Functionality, defect fixes or automation) that form part of a larger solution, in line with team objectives

  • Define Test scenarios and Test cases to ensure quality of the teams deliverables

  • Provide guidance and mentorship to junior developers in daily Scrum meetings.


Experience and Skills



  • BS in Computer Science or equivalent

  • 7+ years of JAVA, API, JavaScript, Angular JS, Java Web Services, UI Skills, Json.

  • Experience using and creating RESTful APIs.

  • Experience with the following technologies (recommended);

    - MongoDB
    - Redis

  • Experience/knowledge with CI/CD

  • Experience with Agile Software Development methodologies

  • Excellent attention to detail

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills


Essential



  • Design and write high quality code

  • Evaluation of code and design quality

  • Understands how products and technologies interface with each other and fit with the strategy and business needs

  • Evaluation of technical and functional specifications and their cohesion

  • Negotiation

  • Technical problem solving

  • Effective communication with different types of audience

  • Risks Assessment and Mitigation

  • Coaching and training

  • Team Working


Benefits


In most cases, the compensation package includes:



  • Medical insurance

  • Dental insurance

  • Vision insurance

  • Life insurance

  • Long-term disability insurance

  • 401k plan

  • Vacation time

  • Gym membership compensation

item.title: Senior PL/SQL Database Developer at FUJIFILM Medical Systems, Inc. (Morrisville, NC)
item.description:
FUJIFILM Medical Systems U.S.A., Inc. is a leading provider of diagnostic imaging products and medical informatics solutions to meet the needs of healthcare facilities today and well into the future. From an unrivaled selection of digital x-ray systems, to the Synapse® brand of PACS, RIS and cardiovascular products, to advanced women’s health imaging systems, Fujifilm has products that are ideal for any size imaging environment. The Endoscopy Division of FUJIFILM Medical Systems U.S.A., Inc. supplies high quality, technologically advanced FUJINON brand endoscopes to the medical market. FUJIFILM Medical Systems U.S.A., Inc. is headquartered in Stamford, CT with offices in the Raleigh, NC region. For more information please visit www.fujimed.comand www.fujifilmendoscopy.com.


Senior Database Developer


 Our team is looking for the person who was labeled “the over achiever”.  The one who let the cookies burn in the oven because you were busy thinking about database schemas instead of watching the timer.   Are we getting close?


 Being the first to figure things out and wants to work with complex data schemas because a challenge is why you get up and come into work every day.  And it’s why we want to talk to you.


 We’re hiring a database developer for our team and we want someone who gets a rush out of taking the lead and starting something new.


 Bigger is better!


 This position will let you work not oly on improving our current product with the latest web technologies but also being part of a team that is building an entirely new platform for our Synapse product for not just radiology but to include cardiology and other imaging modalities and suite of products.


 For starters, you’ll be working on our Synapse Cardiovascular product where you will be a hands-on database developer writing stored procedures, schemas, changing schema objects, normalizing, debugging issues on the front end and down to the database level. 


 And just when you think you’d like a little something more to do you will be doing a little performance tuning and optimization for peak performance because you love a challenge and want to figure out what locks up and how that can be fixed.


 Just in case that isn’t enough to challenge you, did we mention that we’d love for you to have some experience with C++ or C# and some .Net so you can do some middle level development on the database.


 And this is only the starting point. Whether you want to know more about the specific details of your systems or the leadership opportunities we offer, you’ll have the chance to build your skills and knowledge base from day one.

item.title: Solution Developer- C# .net at Hyland, creator of OnBase (Westlake, OH) (allows remote)
item.description:
Do you aspire to not only develop software but also have an appetite for traveling and interacting with customers? Do you enjoy learning new and exciting technologies in an ever evolving software development landscape and have 5 years of .NET programming or equivalent language experience (C#, VB.NET, or Java)?


If so Hyland Software is looking for experienced Solution Developers to analyze, develop and design customized business solutions for Hyland clients. When you join Hyland Software, you will be working for one of the largest independent ECM vendors in the world. You will work alongside dedicated teams who provide incredible customer service and develop innovative solutions for Hyland clients. The Solution Developer develops solutions to solve business problems and integration needs by utilizing various platforms (web services, console applications, ASP.NET, BizTalk, and more). Our solutions vary from simple scripting to enterprise bi-directional integrations with various line of business applications and can be for a wide range of business processes.  


Candidates should have a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience in Software Development. If you are detail oriented, enjoy problem solving, possess a thorough understanding of the latest technology and love working with customers please apply today.


Position Responsibilities:



  • Lead business discovery  meetings, in collaboration with other Hyland Solution Consultants.

  • Gather business requirements  and establish technical specifications for the client’s customized solution.

  • Work with customers to design, implement, and support OnBase solutions, in accordance with Hyland methodologies to satisfy customer needs.

  • Mentor and coach Junior Solution Developers on client projects, through the creation of customized solutions for client business needs.

  • Manage complex client projects that encompass large scope or require more complex solutions.

  • Use Hyland's developed OnBase APIs to extend and integrate OnBase into others systems.

  • Work on customized solutions to integrate with business applications such as ERP, SIS, or other line of business applications.

  • Create technical documents such as Requirements Documents and Administration Guides to be distributed  to clients once project is completed. In addition, participate in creating and documenting best practices for API Solutions.

  • Produce Test Plans for product creation- testing the client's customized solution prior to the deployment of the solution.

  • Prior to the deployment of a customized solution, collaborate with clients, Project Leads and Managers to discuss changes to product functionality and ensure quality and consistency of the final product.

  • In collaboration with the  client's Technical Business Unit, deploy the customized solution into the client's site.

  • Accurately manage and report all time worked on client projects.

  • Support reseller and customer OnBase API development efforts through participating and consulting services, including presenting, answering, and informing future clientele at conferences. 

  • Develop knowledge of OnBase, the OnBase APIs, and best practices for creating OnBase solutions.

item.title: Senior Application Developer at University of Pennsylvania Libraries (Philadelphia, PA)
item.description:
The University of Pennsylvania Libraries seeks a progressive programmer to join its growing Digital Library Developer team. Working with an innovative blend of open-source and best-in-breed development tools, the Senior Application Developer creates software for multiple, complex digital library projects in the areas that include discovery, repository systems, researcher profile services, and business intelligence. Project work is designed and executed in teams comprised of software engineers, subject matter experts, and operations staff that emphasize collaboration and creative problem solving across a range of disciplines. The position reports to the Director for Digital Library Development and Systems, and supports a wide range of computing services which enhance and facilitate teaching, learning and research efforts of the University. Digital library development makes use of a full range of skills, including coding, technical architectures, application specifications, database design, and workflow analysis. The Senior Developer is responsible, along with other programmers, for testing, quality assurance and the life cycle management of library applications. The Senior Developer is a participant in and at times leads project teams to implement IT services, technical solutions and designs, and often has the support of a small crew of junior developers. The position also provides expertise on metadata that are relevant to digital library implementation and the development of local, reusable methodologies for metadata interactions.

The Senior Developer operates with a high degree of independence and professionalism in managing job responsibilities, work priorities, methodologies, and routines. The position requires a readiness to research IT developments and tools, to apply the findings of research to design and programming, and in general, to bring best practices and the latest concepts in the field to application development. The position is responsible for researching, recommending, managing and maintaining technical metadata standards for structured data repositories such as Oracle & MySQL databases, Apache Jackrabbit, Solr, and XML documents. The senior developer participates in IT planning as well as the execution of planning priorities.

The work requires close collaboration with a variety of audiences, including Library staff at all levels, project managers and developers across campus, Penn faculty and researchers, and IT professionals from other institutions and commercial firms. The Senior Developer must be highly effective working in groups and with subject matter experts who may not be IT professionals. The successful candidate will join a team of energetic and creative contributors. Responsibilities include timely and responsive communication, fulfillment of deadlines, and a readiness to engage in the bidirectional sharing of knowledge and expertise with colleagues.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer (Java Web Apps) at Sony Network Entertainment International (Los Angeles, CA)
item.description:
The primary role for this position will be to work on the development of back-end applications and components and the integration with third party systems. The ideal candidate must be a skilled Java developer with experience in web application development, full life-cycle application development and systems integration. He/She will work with peers on the development of large scale systems that support other Sony's businesses in the digital content area. The role will primarily be focused on development and delivery of projects. This entails architecture, coding, unit testing, bug fixing and assistance in the deployment to production as well as maintenance knowledge transfers. The Sr. Java Software Engineer is expected to communicate with senior members of the Technology group by providing status, identifying and raising issues and participating in planning activities.


Our group develops software for the PlayStation Network and Sony Entertainment Network. These networks provide online services for the PS4, PS3, PSP, Vita, Tablets, mobile phones, PC, Bravia TVs and more. We build large internal enterprise applications which integrate and support such services as Movie/TV Show streaming, PSN gaming commerce and much more. Our environment is fast, agile and we use some of the latest tools out there.



  • Write Java code for internal application development

  • Write and execute unit tests using the JUnit framework

  • Apply and help refine coding standards

  • Gather requirements from business users for application development projects

  • Create required documentation including low-level design documents, User Interface wireframes and simple UML diagrams

  • Ownership of the implementation and delivery of small or mid-size features

  • Design small features or implement more complex features as designed by technical lead

  • Communicate estimates, schedules, issues and dependencies to technical or project lead

  • Increase expertise in the areas of development related to the assigned projects

  • Identify and address issues independently

  • Fix bugs and provide support for business and maintenance teams

  • Refactor existing code base and improve overall quality of code

  • Perform knowledge shares

  • Proactively improve development processes

  • Participate in the establishment of best practices

item.title: Developer at Squla (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Your role?


In this role you will get the opportunity to work within a team of great developers who work hard every day on the Squla platform, the games and great features for the Squla platform web applications. You will be




  • building end-to-end features for the Squla platform web application;

  • testing your features and being fully responsible for them when they go live;

  • perform maintenance and bug-fixing as required.

item.title: Full Stack Software Engineer at NewsCred (New York, NY)
item.description:
NewsCred has always had a clear social mission – to help the journalism industry survive by building the world’s first content ecosystem and disrupting the status quo.


How are we doing that? By building a revolutionary technology platform for all of the world’s content. Filtering, streaming and organizing millions of articles a day, in real-time. That’s a lot of data, a lot of content and a lot of opportunity to build something amazing. Join a brilliant, fun team of engineers that are solving big problems every day.


NewsCred is looking for a Full Stack Software Engineer with the technical skills and talent to navigate our entire stack, solving interesting and challenging problems along the way. Whether you’re:



  • improving our search infrastructure using the latest techniques in information retrieval and natural language processing, or

  • analyzing terabytes of usage logs to discover what content performs best for our customers, or

  • building a revolutionary content consumption UX,


you will play a key role in all parts of the product lifecycle: brainstorming, design, prototyping, planning, implementation, and launch.


Individuals that succeed at NewsCred are intelligent, highly motivated, fearless team players with great senses of humor.  They proven self-starters and quick learners. You will write lots of code that solves both visual and technical challenges, delivering high impact solutions to our customers around the world.


The Stack
We’re not dogmatic about specific technologies but here’s a list of some of the stuff we’re using:



  • Python

  • Solr

  • Django

  • AngularJS

  • MySQL

  • MongoDB

  • Ansible


The Team
The engineering team at NewsCred consists of some of the most brilliant, considerate, and fun-loving people you’ll ever meet. We're highly selective; we seek people who can contribute and share in the success and happiness of our team. We organize ourselves into small, autonomous teams that are as self-sufficient and independent as possible. This allows us to maintain our scrappy, entrepreneurial culture as we grow


About You
You love creating software so much that it’s disconcerting to your family and friends. The idea of game night and free lunch sound fun. You find few things as satisfying as reading and writing beautiful code and you plan on pushing some code on your first day. You’re irresistibly curious about the latest emerging technologies. You may or may not have a computer science degree.

item.title: Ruby Architect at Razer Inc. (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
We are looking for a senior software engineer with extensive experience in architecting, implementing, scaling, and supporting high-traffic / high-availability commercial web services and applications in a distributed cloud-based environment. This particular role requires significant experience in full stack web application development utilizing Ruby on Rails under Heroku and Amazon Web Services.


This is a very hands-on role, and you would be joining a small team of engineers to develop cutting edge services, applications, and API’s that will be utilized by both our internal and external customers around the world. As a senior engineer on this team you will have significant impact on future direction and development of these services.


Responsibilities:



  • Help design, develop, and support high-traffic, high-availability web services and applications

  • Insure successful delivery and 24/7 operation of all developed services and applications

  • Design and implement well-structured, easily maintainable, well-documented code, APIs, and test scripts

  • Optimize and/or debug code as needed to maximize performance, scaling, usability, and quality

  • Assimilate new technologies and solve complex problems, formulating and evaluating technical alternatives based on experience and data-driven decision making skills

  • Generate and update documentation and technical/functional specifications as needed

  • Provide development support and troubleshooting assistance to clients and/or other teams

  • Participate in agile planning, scope estimation, and updates for team projects

item.title: PDS Petrotechnical at PDS Petrotechnical (Sofia, Bulgaria)
item.description:
QA Test Professional

If you are looking for a stable international company in which you can really develop your career, PDS Bulgaria is the right company for you!

QA Test Professional role at PDS, location Sofia, Bulgaria
As a QA Test professional at PDS you design, develop and execute (automated) tests for web and windows applications, which meet the acceptance criteria as based upon the current requirements and product backlog items. You plan and coordinate the testing activities across a project and define quality metrics to monitor test results in a timely manner. Part of your responsibility is also to make gap analysis and technical reviews in order to define & evaluate processes and propose improvements.

You are part of the local team in Sofia and you communicate and cooperate with all (international) stakeholders involved, like the QA Testing supervisor, product owners, the scrum team and developers to align testing practices with their needs and to improve processes, product effectiveness, integration and usability.

Projects you are working are for our major Oil & Gas Exploration and Production (E&P) clients. This requires an onshore, professional organization, ‘state of the art’ technology and also an approach for which we established a Centre of Expertise (CoE) for petrotechnical software research and development.

Together we achieve goals and our customer needs.

To be able to perform in your QA role, experience with Microsoft (test) products like Team System, Test Manager, Lab Center and Hyper-V is required. Coded UI technology and Smartbear’ TestComplete is also used by our team.

item.title: Python Software Developers at Rackspace, the #1 managed cloud company (Blacksburg, VA)
item.description:
Do you believe Open Source will always innovate faster? Are you most comfortable on the cutting edge of technology? If this describes you and you’re ready to attack some of the most complex problems in the industry, then it’s time for you to take on the challenge of being a large contributor to the Open Source world for Rackspace.


With over 300,000 customers hosting their environments from ten data centers across the globe, the opportunities to build, design, develop, and provide solutions in an in enterprise cloud computing environment is here.  Rackspace can help you carve out a new career path.  This isn’t a wish, it’s the real deal.


Would you like to be part of the next big product in the Rackspace cloud? As a cloud API developer on the Atlanta team you will design and develop a variety of products that connect the Rackspace managed cloud together with other innovative Cloud products.

The role you will play will help customers seamlessly integrate cutting edge tools into their system architectures, that will change the face of computing. As a result, you will have an opportunity to work on many high impact, high visibility products that will take fanatical support to new heights.


Do you want to be the next Fanatical Racker? Rackspace is looking for a software developer who will design and develop cutting-edge APIs for large-scale cloud based services. Join us and work with a team of energetic individuals who are passionate about Rackspace as the #1 Managed Cloud provider. You will work on a dynamic, Agile team to develop high-quality software in a fun, collaborative environment!


As a software developer at Rackspace, you will be working in a high-energy team, writing great software by using the best software development practices in the industry today. Passion for all aspects of software development is a must.


This position is located in Blacksburg, VA, a town in southwest Virginia.  Blacksburg, home of Virginia Tech, is nestled on a plateau between the Blue Ridge and Allegheny mountains. You’ll be doing world-class development for a cloud computing leader in a beautiful location with a temperate climate and very short commute time.


Responsibilities:



  • Write web application front-end code in JavaScript, HTML, and CSS

  • Unify disparate product data models into a coherent user experience.

  • Diagnose and fix bugs

  • Write clean and maintainable code using engineering best practices (unit testing, SOLID principles, Agile methods)

  • Work with other software developers, product managers, user experience designers, and operations engineers on a daily basis

  • Mentor and guide less experienced team members to provide technical direction

item.title: Operations Engineer at Cloudreach Europe Limited (Edinburgh, UK)
item.description:
Cloudreach are Europe’s only top tier partner of choice for both Amazon Web Services & Google - the giants of the cloud computing industry. We’re the best at what we do. We provide a range of valued services to the Enterprise, and we see the need to recruit a number of highly technical and dynamic individuals to help us maintain our reputation and continuous customer satisfaction as we continue to grow in the cloud !!



Why do you want to work with us?



  • You want to be one step ahead: The future of IT is in the cloud, and we work with the leaders in this space. You will get exposure to new technology and new data analytics tools.

  • You want interesting work: This role is complex and analytical, with the chance to become an excellent data modeller and to work both with internal teams and directly with clients. You will endeavour to automate any repetitive tasks.

  • You want a progressive culture: The established culture is friendly, with a lot of banter and we firmly believe that work should be fun. At the same time we value personal growth and understand that a great organisation is one made up of diverse individuals.

  • You want to broaden your knowledge of food or drink: We’re in the heart of Edinburgh, next to some of the oldest and best restaurants and pubs in the UK. We regularly go out for lunch and after work as a team. And if you’re not up for a wee jaunt to the pub, there’s always beer and juice in the fridge.



What we are looking for?

Cloudreach is looking for a number of capable sysadmin engineers or developers who have a passion for operations with 3-5 years relevant experience who are keen to grow their technical and business skills in a fast growing company. We’d like to see someone who has had exposure to infrastructure with automation. If you are curious about the Cloud and have possibly dabbled with AWS and Google Apps we want to speak to you. We subscribe to the concept of "DevOps", where we use development skills in the operational environment in order to increase service quality. Typically our customers use an extensive array of technology running on either Linux (with Open Source) or the Microsoft stack.
The beauty of this role is that as the hardware layer is abstracted, you focus on honing your technical skills, and the interesting stuff, rather the heavy lifting. The intent is to fix or work around the root cause of operational issues, so that they do not reoccur.

You will be working with the following new technologies (and more):



  • Linux / Open Source

  • Microsoft technologies

  • Management of and automation of management of these systems

  • Amazon Elastic Computing cloud

  • Google Apps



Responsibilities



  • Action incident / problem cases related to the support of customer systems in line with Service Level Agreements

  • Liaise with customer directly in the case of major incidents

  • Carry out pro-active maintenance

  • Action service requests

  • Ensure knowledge of the platforms is accurately maintained

  • Produce statistical information as required to support ITIL reports

  • Assist in customer migrations by Service Delivery teams (to Google Apps / Amazon Web Services)

item.title: Senior Software Development Engineer at Rhapsody International/Napster (Seattle, WA.) (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
Rhapsody is experiencing significant growth in subscribers, expanding internationally, and is always looking to bring in top talent. We have start-up feel with the security of a strong revenue stream. With more than 3 million paying subscribers and over 32 million songs, Rhapsody is leading the digital music service revolution in the US (and soon globally).  We make it possible for fans to listen to any song, anytime and anywhere.


About The Role:  
In this role you will focus on development of Java-based middle tier and back-end services. The Platform Services team within Rhapsody International is responsible for the creation, delivery and support of back-end systems such as user profile services, ecommerce services and music data services. The team consists of technical architects, developers, test engineers, business & technical analysts, program/project managers, headquartered in Seattle, Washington.


As our new Senior Software Development Engineer you'll be responsible for development of major areas of functionality. You hold yourself to high standards and strive to bring out the best in others .


Perks:


We are very proud of the culture that we have built at Rhapsody.  Below is a snapshot of some of our benefits and perks, but what you will be most blown away by is the amazing talent you will get to work with here.



  • Benefits, including medical, dental, vision, life insurance

  • Free Rhapsody Premium Account (with great music discovery advice from your peers)

  • Brand new state of the art office in downtown Seattle’s Columbia Tower

  • Centrally located near public transportation,  ferries, bike parking, as well as subsidized commuting options.

  • Highly collaborative, hardworking, open environment where you’ll work alongside extremely creative and dedicated people.

  • One of the most generous paid time-off packages in the industry and you are encouraged to use it

  • In-house private music concerts on the incredible Rhapsody Stage

  • Brown bag Lunch & Learn sessions

  • Sponsored off-site company events.




The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification.  They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified.  All personnel may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed.  Rhapsody International Inc. is an equal opportunity employer.

item.title: Platform Mobile Engineer at SHOP.CA (Toronto, ON, Canada)
item.description:
Mobile is a key channel for SHOP.CA and we want to provide our customers with the best mobile (App and HTML) shopping experience.  As Head of Mobile Engineering, you will be responsible for creating, maintaining and executing SHOP.CA’s mobile strategy for phone, tablet across HTML and app solutions.  You are passionate about mobile and user experiences and will create mobile solutions that our customers love to use.  You will create daily KPIs and measure and report on the success of our mobile channels focusing on results first.  You are innovative and will work to create solutions that leverage the latest mobile capabilities in localization, notification, bar-code scanning, voice, etc to create stunning ecommerce solutions for our customers.  You have drive, energy and passion to contribute to a hyper-growth startup in the fastest growing segment in Canada.


Responsibilities:



  • Contribute to the SHOP.CA development organization helping to make SHOP.CA a world-class mobile destination with a terrific consumer experience

  • Develop daily KPIs on mobile site and app utilization, conversion rates, etc

  • Make proactive recommendations to improve customer experience based on analytics

  • Lead the strategy and recommend solutions to meet SHOP.CA’s mobile strategies including

  • support for mobile HTML on phone and tablet devices as well as apps.

  • Participate in development planning sessions and meet agreed deliverable dates for new

  • features and enhancements

  • Safeguard consumer data in accordance with SHOP.CA’s data security policies

  • Adhere to SHOP.CA’s software development lifecycle (SDLC)

  • Work effectively with a tight team of world-class designers, web developers and back-end developers

  • Define, and implement front-end standards for performance, analysis and personalization

  • Quickly resolve outstanding defects and issues

  • Use all available and emerging creative development tools in your work

  • Work collaboratively with team members to clarify business requirements, create comprehensive and viable designs with effort estimations.

  • Actively participate as a direct resource to projects as required in the following areas:


    • Wireframe development (PhotoShop or other similar programs), site (XHTML, DHTML, HTML,

    • CSS, AJAX, JSP, PHP, Flash and JavaScript files) and other solutions employed by SHOP.CA

    • Architect, design, develop, maintain and support all software components of SHOP.CA mobile solutions (iOS, Blackberry & Android)

    • Implementation of business logic server-side in Java/JSP to support the mobile eCommerce platforms.


  • Creating documentation for new features and application changes

  • Supporting our QA team in testing your features formally (test scenarios) as well as informally.

  • Build out QA test ‘lab’ for devices and handsets necessary for the QA team to adequately test SHOP.CA’s mobile strategies

  • Working with our infrastructure team to debug issues as they arise in production.

  • Innovating new solutions and researching new technologies that may complement SHOP.CA’s eCommerce site – help make SHOP.CA’s mobile commerce experience world class


We work in an aggressive, energetic and sometimes frantic environment where exceptional coders thrive. You must be willing to join an early stage, hyper growth company that will require significant time commitments to be successful. It’s not for the meek here, but if you have what it takes, we will push you hard and you’ll gain incredible experience and knowledge solving challenging software engineering projects.

item.title: Senior Project Manager - PMO at Tillster, Inc. (San Diego, CA)
item.description:
Senior Project Manager - PMO


LOCAL CANDIDATES ONLY PLEASE


You will be working directly with Tillster's Head of PMO to manage the initiatives for some of our company’s largest clients. Responsible for the successful delivery phase of multiple Tillster customer solutions. Role is the primary internal project team lead, which requires the ability to effectively balance strategic issues with the day-to-day tactical delivery issues.

item.title: Senior Front End Developer at Semantico Limited (Brighton, UK)
item.description:
Semantico is an award winning digital publishing solutions company with offices in the UK and USA. We build data driven websites and web applications, delivering innovative publishing solutions for leading publishers, institutions and scholarly societies such as Oxford University Press, Wiley, Bloomsbury and McGraw-Hill Professional.


We have a great opportunity for an experienced Senior Front End Developer to join our highly collaborative, cross functional Design/Production team.


Working with the Head of Design, our User Experience Architect and Business Analysts, you will help create a culture of quality, innovation and excellence. This is an important role within Semantico as you will be responsible for the direction and integration of our front end technologies, and influential in the growth of our front end team.


Your role will involve interaction with developers, UX practitioners and visual designers to produce effective user interfaces, taking part in multiple projects and sharing a team ethos. We build both customised and 'out of the box' solutions, building platforms that enable publishers to distribute their content online: our designs are original and innovative and offer the chance for you to develop your skills in a highly specialised environment.


We are seeking someone who has demonstrable experience in all aspects of digital production processes and possesses excellent communication and time management skills. Our ideal candidate will be pro-active, positive, able to anticipate issues, have a ‘can do’ attitude and be willing to work outside of their comfort zone when necessary.


Experience of javascript and MVC/MVP is vital, as is knowledge of a commercial/agency environment and an interest in emerging technologies.


In return, you will join an ambitious and expanding company who builds strong teams with an emphasis on training, innovation and skill sharing. Our aim is to continue to grow and to nurture from within, creating an organisation made up of committed and innovative staff who are at the core of our projects. Our staff have the opportunity to contribute to and attend key meetings, travelling to clients based in the UK and North America.


We offer a generous salary, benefits including an individual personal training budget as well as internal training programmes, a contributory pension plan, 31 days’ holiday inclusive of public holidays and increasing with service, Cycle to Work scheme, childcare vouchers, fruit delivered to the office and the best coffee in Brighton.


To apply for this position, please read the full job description below before sending in your CV and a cover letter that includes your salary expectations and why you feel you are suitable for the role to HR@semantico.com


The closing date for submissions is mid-day on 23 September 2015.


We will endeavour to reply to all applicants to advise whether or not they have been invited to interview.


Please note:  If it is not obvious from your application that you have the right to work in the UK, please confirm in your covering letter that you have this right and are UK based, or that you are moving to the UK and specify the timescales for your relocation.


Full Job Description


Primary Purpose of the Role:



  • The Senior FED will be an experienced developer who will have control of the use of front-end technologies and processes.

  • The mentoring aspect of the front-end team will include leading front-end team meetings and working with the development team leader group in a continuous improvement program.

  • The Senior FED will be passionate about technology; have exceptional technical and problem solving skills, and a positive, results driven attitude with a personable and approachable character.

  • The Senior FED should anticipate problems before they occur, manage risk and find ways to accomplish project goals regardless of changing circumstances.


Principal Relationships:



  • Head of Design & UX

  • Development team leads

  • User Experience architect

  • Business Analyst

  • Project Managers


Key Responsibilities and Tasks:



  • Lead, inspire and motivate the front-end team

  • Control of front-end technology decisions

  • Ownership over Semantico’s accessibility standards

  • Maintain high quality code output from team members

  • Meet development milestones on time and to a high level of quality

  • Technical leadership of multiple projects, including responsibility for quality of delivered solution

  • Mentor and lead front-end developers and manage freelance resources

  • Interaction with client throughout product life-cycle

  • Assist with the creation and sign off of specifications,wireframes and designs

  • Work closely with the Head of Design and other team leads on continuous improvement

  • Recruitment of front-end development personnel

  • Training of front-end development personnel

  • Experienced in all aspects of digital production processes


The above list of job duties is not exclusive or exhaustive and you will be required to undertake such tasks as may reasonably be expected within the scope of the job.

item.title: Software Engineer (.net/Ruby) at Careerbuilder (Norcross, GA)
item.description:
Software Engineer (.net/Ruby)


The strength of our solutions and brand combined with your expertise empower us to literally change peoples’ lives!

Who We Are:


This is an exciting time at CareerBuilder as we continue the rapid growth of our global HR Software as a Service operation. Fueled by technology that is years ahead of the competition, we’re doing something the industry has never seen before: unifying the recruiter experience in one pre-hire platform that is always on, is data-driven and is easy to use. You’ll see us expand into more markets with innovative products and services that are changing the way companies recruit new talent around the world. As a Software Engineer at CareerBuilder, you’ll have the opportunity to do something extraordinary. Our employees are what drive our success and are at the very core of our identity.


Who You Are:


Software Engineers at CareerBuilder solve interesting business problems that span the range of deriving intelligence from big data, engaging job seekers on mobile devices, to building applications in the cloud.


Helping developers integrate their code with others through release management, automated testing and deployment one minute, and then showing no mercy in a vigorous game of table tennis the next –the life of a CareerBuilder Software Engineer is never dull! Bring your ideas, your skills, your object-oriented background and your quick-draw and come join our team. Pursue next-generation technologies and tools to help support the platform that is matching job opportunities with employment seekers around the globe. You’ll be given plenty of independence and autonomy with which to work, and you’ll be able to spend 10% of your time just learning new tools and languages. If you have a passion for solving complex problems, thrive in a fast-paced environment, CareerBuilder has a place for you. If you have the passion for developing cutting-edge solutions to business problems and you meet our qualifications, we want to talk with you!


As a Software Engineer, you will come up with new and innovative platform development ideas for ALM. Best of all, we participate in the open source community, which allows for plenty of flexibility and room for innovation as you experiment and tinker alongside some of the best Software Engineers in the business.

Here are some of the toys you’ll get to play with:


* REST 
* Visual Studio
* Distributed Computing 
* TFS and Github
* .NET 4.5 
* Saucelabs
* Automated Testing 
* SOA
* MVC 
* Linux
* Chef
* RubyRails

item.title: Senior Software Developer (Java) at adacado (Vancouver, BC, Canada)
item.description:
Adacado is looking for exceptionally motivated people who love to see the impact of their work on a global scale and who want to be a part of something special and highly unique.


Adacado is seeking an experienced (Java) software developer to evolve our real-time creative advertising platform.  The successful candidate will work closely with all members of the development team to design, implement, test, and deploy the next generation of the Adacado software suite, and maintain each iteration from cradle to grave.  As Adacado is quite diverse in its functions, a senior developer will always have the opportunity to (and is expected to) learn and play with new technologies, and to bring innovation to the table, evolving, enhancing and optimizing the Adacado platform over time.  The successful candidate must also have the ability to diagnose problems across the entire software and hardware stack rather than just debug a piece of code.


Adacado is not expecting you to arrive with everything you need to know.   We work in a highly collaborative environment where we’ll educate you on the technologies we’ve adopted while you help to further innovate Adacado, be it software, procedures, or fun!


Adacado is located in the heart of Vancouver with easy access to public transit and employees are offered generous telecommuting privileges.  We also have a hub in Kelowna, BC.  We maintain very flexible work hours, a casual dress code and a relaxed low-pressure environment.  All developers in the office are provided with dual-monitor stations or laptops and the freedom to use whichever development tools they are most comfortable with.   Lunch is served hot every Friday, snacks are plentiful, and we engage frequently in events beyond work.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - Mobile iOS Android at MAG Technologies (Dallas, TX) (allows remote)
item.description:
MAG Technologies is a well funded startup, and the developer of a secure chat mobile app. Our app has a strong focus on privacy, user choice, and beautiful, usable interfaces. The positions are for self-starting senior developers who can take ownership of project components and deliver long-lasting, maintainable, extensible, and optimized code. Given the app is a messaging app, there is a server tech component as well. We are thus looking for great computer scientists with a broad expertise in object oriented software development, service oriented architecture and APIs, and an advanced expertise in Android and/or iOS. This is a unique opportunity to lead the technical evolution of an app in the prestigious mobile chat and messaging space. 


Responsibilities will include:



  • Design, Development, and Testing of newer features in the Android or the iOS version of the app

  • Fixing bugs and maintaining code - all the while ensuring we follow industry best-practices and design patterns, and ensure the most efficient use of computing and storage resources

  • Collaborating with other engineers on the project

  • Researching, exploring, and executing newer, better approaches to solving our software development and maintenance challenges

  • Participating in some user testing, as well as receiving feedback on app usability, and improving the app based on such feedback

  • Interfacing with XMPP server, and possibly coding a bit on the server side as well

  • Using many modern APIs, SDKs, and tools, and learning new tools as needed


Remote applicants: Only those within a 3 hour drive from downtown Dallas, TX, please.


What else to expect?



  • Walking meetings

  • Top notch equipment

  • Being surrounded by startup enthusiasts, and highly qualified software engineers both within and outside the company

  • Awesome Dallas high-rise views

  • Flexible work schedules, as long as goals met

item.title: Machine Learning at Hivemapper (Burlingame, CA)
item.description:
Hivemapper maps the Earth for drone fliers. That's a lot of data!  How do we teach our data collection engine to systematically crawl and extract the billions of pieces of data we need to map the earth for drone fliers.  Our earth crawler and extractor has acquired hundreds of millions of interesting objects on the planet, from 'hidden'  to 'hidden' . We have 'hidden' spanning the entire earth. 



At Hivemapper you'll help design and build the machine learning systems to collect the earth's data and instantly deliver the most relevant results to drone pilots. One day you might be figuring out how to process these terabytes of data and those billions of database rows. Another day you might be designing how to send five square miles of detailed 3-D map data to our drone fliers in under 100 milliseconds. And another day you might be out flying a drone with the man who took Hivemapper to Nepal.


We are backed by Spark Capital (Oculus Rift and Twitter), Google Ventures, Homebrew, and Harrison Metal.


[Hivemapper is currently building in stealth mode]

item.title: Senior Operations Engineer at SugarCRM (Cupertino, CA)
item.description: SugarCRM Operations has an immediate opening for a customer-focused information technology professional in the role of Site Reliability Engineer. Leveraging Open Source technology to deliver highly available services, our operations group provides 24/7 support in an energetic, fast paced work environment. The successful candidate will possess the focus to work through challenges to ensure customer success and the drive and autonomy to work independently.  You possess excellent written and oral communication skills, deep technical knowledge and experience in a startup environment. We're looking for someone who will be a mentor and can help define the infrastructure that powers all of our online services. You are self-motivated and have a strong commitment to quality.

item.title: Senior Site Reliability Engineer at New Relic (Portland, OR)
item.description:
The SRE team at New Relic consists of engineers who work directly within New Relic's development teams providing operationally focused thinking and development within our products. If you love building highly available products and sharing your experience with others, you will enjoy helping us take our platform to the next level of excellence.

This is a challenging and exciting space. We are actively working to improve the high-availability characteristics of our platform at scale. Designing systems for transparency, with abundant logging, monitoring, and graphing, helps us easily determine the health of the system at any moment. It takes creativity and skill to weave diverse requirements into the functionality our customers have come to depend on. 

Responsibilities:



  • Work directly inside development teams with an eye towards developing for operational readiness.

  • Improve and build upon our automation tools for systems provisioning, monitoring, trending, and management.

  • Independently learn new technologies and master the New Relic platform so that you can provide 'full stack' diagnostics, when necessary, to help determine the root cause of internal problems.

  • Communicate effectively with fellow SREs and other engineering teams, and describe problems succinctly with sufficient detail that you can hand-off an ongoing problem to another team or a peer for completion.

  • Strategize with fellow SREs and other engineering teams on complex problems, and make decisions and recommendations about systems improvements after analyzing possible courses of conduct.

  • Perform periodic on-call duty as part of a global team maintaining the availability and performance of the New Relic site and APIs used by third-party services, as well as the various internal services and systems that these core interfaces depend on.

item.title: Infrastructure Technology Architect at Time Warner Inc. (Atlanta, GA)
item.description:
Time Warner, Inc. - Job posting preview























The Technology Architect is responsible for the research, formation, creation, documentation and any and all work product related to architectures under their domain of expertise or assignment. Such domains include, but are not limited to Workplace/End-user technologies, Security, Networking and Compute/Data Center/Cloud Platforms.







This role is also responsible for steering of the technology strategy within portfolio of EIS developed Architectures. The Technology Architect Assists the Chief Architect and the Integration Architects in maintaining a complete and appropriate strategy based on defined project needs, design principles, best practices or industry direction. The Technology Architect brings a wide range of Technical and professional capabilities to the role and acts as an escalation point for technical issues related to the deployed architectures within EIS and within Technology Groups of Time Warner or its Divisions.

Responsibilities:






Within their Domain of Expertise (SME for a particular core capability):




  • Provide project specific architectural and comprehensive technology designs, solutions and implementation plans for areas under their domain of control.




  • Review and evaluate, cost and develop optimized infrastructure designs based on rigorous understanding of returned benefits and ROI/TCO. .




  • Evaluate entire projects from a technical stance, guaranteeing that the methods and technologies used are practical and correct and fit for purpose.




  • Validate and challenge the detailed technical infrastructure architectures provided by the technology partners, fellow team members and vendors in support of a project or technical solution.




  • Assist in transition of the developed solution to implementation with partnership from O&E.




  • Act as final path of escalation within their area of expertise for any architecture under their development or control.




  • Investigate the viability of upcoming and emerging technologies to improve the infrastructure's stability, longevity and adaptability.




  • Consult in development of architectural strategy, including technology standardization, infrastructure guiding principles and modernization.




  • Develop a technical architecture based on any R&D or existing knowledge that are dependable, scalable and fit for purpose and can be transitioned to implementation by SI&D or O&E.




  • Assure any developed architectures fit appropriately within the overarching EIS Vision and Strategy for that service area.




  • Beyond an individuals Domain of Expertise (General Technology and cross-technology):




  • Have a detailed understanding of other technologies and exhibit proficiency in those technologies beyond their core capability.




  • Be stretched by assignments into detailed understanding of those areas of technology (such as Workplace/End-user technologies, Security, Networking and Compute/Data Center/Cloud Platforms.




  • Understand the “cross-pollination” of technology verticals and be able to apply both areas of expertise and areas of knowledge to provide a cohesive end to end architectural approach and solution.

item.title: Social Commerce Developer at SHOP.CA (Toronto, ON, Canada)
item.description:
SHOP.CA is Canada’s leader in online shopping, providing a premium Canadian experience that combines an authoritative selection of products, unparalleled service and a social commerce. Launched in July 2012, SHOP.CA has become the fastest growing retail site in Canada and top 10 most visited Canadian owned ecommerce site.  As a SHOP.CA Social Commerce development team member, your role will be to work on Social Commerce, ensuring that integrations with social networks continue to work through upgrades as well be in charge of integrating the SHOP.CA platform with new social networks.  You are innovative and will work to create solutions that leverage the capabilities to create stunning ecommerce solutions for our customers.  You have drive, energy, and passion to contribute to a hyper-growth startup in the fastest growing segment in Canada.


Responsibilities:



  • Contribute to the SHOP.CA development organization helping to make SHOP.CA’s Social Commerce world-class for customers a terrific user experience including Member Registration, Connection Social Profiles to SHOP.CA Member Profiles, Social Sharing Out from SHOP.CA and Social Sharing In to SHOP.CA, and Invite-a-Friend

  • Quickly resolve outstanding defects and issues

  • Work collaboratively with team members to clarify business requirements, create comprehensive and viable designs with effort estimations

  • Participate in development planning sessions and meet agreed deliverable dates for new features and enhancements

  • Safeguard consumer data in accordance with SHOP.CA’s data security policies

  • Adhere to SHOP.CA’s software development lifecycle (SDLC)

  • Work effectively with a tight team of world-class designers, web developers and back-end developers

  • Create documentation for new features and application changes

  • Supporting our QA team in testing your features formally (test scenarios) as well as informally

  • Work with our infrastructure team to debug issues as they arise in production

  • Innovate new solutions and research new social networks and their technologies that will complement SHOP.CA’s eCommerce site – help make SHOP.CA’s Commerce platform experience world class including working with Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Pinterest and many more.

  • Actively participate as a direct resource to projects as required in the following areas:


    • XHTML, DHTML, HTML, CSS, AJAX, JavaScript files, and other solutions employed by SHOP.CA

    • Architect, design, develop, maintain and support all software components of the SHOP.CA Social Loyalty Network platform

    • Implementation of business logic server-side in Java for low level social network integrations



We work in an aggressive, energetic and sometimes frantic environment where exceptional coders thrive. You must be willing to join an early stage, hyper growth company that will require significant time commitments to be successful. It’s not for the meek here, but if you have what it takes, we will push you hard and you’ll gain incredible experience and knowledge solving challenging software engineering projects.

item.title: DevOps Automation Engineer at Lumeris (Maryland Heights, MO)
item.description:
Join Our Growing Team!


Lumeris™ provides the information technology, guidance, and operational services necessary for hospitals and health plans to transform their organizations into high-performing accountable delivery systems.


Our revolutionary technology platform for accountable care integrates data from disparate systems across the continuum of care, provides complete visibility into the clinical and financial performance of the enterprise, and delivers applications and information to key stakeholders at the point of thought. Lumeris also provides health care consulting and professional services that help organizations establish the necessary clinical and business processes, methodologies, and operational capacity to create their own successful accountable health care delivery systems.


The depth and breadth of our solutions — combined with the company’s extensive real-world experience in accountable care — make Lumeris the ideal partner for any health care organization seeking the significant benefits of a better connected, aligned, and informed accountable delivery system.


Lumeris is privately owned by Essence Group Holdings Corporation (EGHC) and backed by investors including Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers, Camden Partners, and Sandbox Industries.


Why Join Lumeris?


At Lumeris you will be part of team that is focused on solving a national healthcare problem.  And you will have the ability to contribute while working for a purpose. Our environment is fast-paced and change oriented and is focused on growth and employee engagement.  At Lumeris we believe talent is utilized best when given the opportunity to succeed.  That is why we have removed the boundaries that inhibit success and focus on fostering an environment that allows employees to utilize their talents.


Summary


We are expanding our operations and looking for talent to join our organization.  This is an exciting opportunity to join a first class technology team who is developing accountable delivery solutions for the healthcare industry.  The role of the DevOps Automation Engineer is to analyze, design, implement and validate strategies for continuous deployment to both host- and cloud-based infrastructure while ensuring high availability on both production and pre-production systems. Also, the ability of this role to design and implement automated dynamic environments to support the needs of delivery teams, plus collaborate with functional and technical team members to develop deployment strategies for existing and new types of services.   


The successful candidate will partner with Development, QA and IT Operations teams to successfully deliver Lumeris solutions to our customers.  The DevOps Automation Engineer is development-oriented and will become familiar with our critical operations – including event management – and to develop tools and automation that will make our operations more efficient and provide more time to advance best-in-class operations and development practices. Our operational responsibilities are constantly evolving and require engineers to remain flexible and reactive to new priorities while maintaining a consistent record of delivering results employing the latest tools for continuous delivery and continuous integration


Primary duties will center on automating the management of software configuration, build operations, and deployment systems.  Expected to create, maintain, and manage the infrastructure used to build software applications, as well as basic systems testing and troubleshooting of code after deployment.



  • Design and develop complex high performing scripts and applications that support automation and innovation

  • Create and implement best practices and standards with regards to the automation of tools and services

  • Administer users of our software development life cycle tools which include source code management, build operations, work tracking, and project reporting.

  • Experience with cloud and virtualization technologies: AWS, VirtualBox, VMWare, KVM, zones/containers, Vagrant, Docker

  • Experience with configuration management tools such as Chef, Puppet, or Ansible

  • Experience building services in one or more languages (Python/Perl/Ruby/Java)

  • Data management skills



  • Dedication to providing a great customer experience

  • Excellent troubleshooting skills and ability to correlate system behaviors based on known interdependencies between those systems

  • Comfort with collaboration, open communication and reaching across functional borders

item.title: Quality Assurance Engineer at Bomgar Corporation (Ridgeland, MS)
item.description:
Our Quality Assurance team is currently looking for software testers with strong Linux experience. So what flavors are you familiar with?


As a QA Engineer, you will be responsible for planning and implementing the QA procedures for daily, milestone and release candidate testing of the Bomgar product line of screen-sharing and remote control technologies.


For this position, we need someone who displays individual motivation and the keen ability to respond with innovation to new tech problems and new possibilities. In other words, we need you to think outside of our Bomgar Box!


As a member of the QA team, you will be responsible for the quality of software released to the company’s sales and marketing departments.  Our QA Engineers work closely with our development team creating new products while enhancing existing products.


 Our QA Team:



  • Determines test objectives and standards by studying software requirements, writing test cycle plans, test cases, and test scripts.

  • Meets test objectives by determining testing methods, cycles, phases, and conditions; set up testing environment and equipment.

  • Identifies software capability and reliability by conducting functional, system, and performance tests.

  • Resolves testing problems by modifying testing methods during tests; conferring with management to revise test objectives and standards.

  • Maintains testing database by developing defect tracking and regression testing information requirements; designing information system; enter test outcomes; secure data.

  • Reports test outcomes by collecting, analyzing, interpreting, summarizing, and displaying data; recommend software changes.

item.title: QA Lead / Software Engineer in Test at Simply Business (London, UK)
item.description:
Simply Business – We are looking for a QA Lead (this could be a ‘step up’ role for you, or you could already be coming with this experience)


Based onsite in Moorgate, London


The exciting part = It’s totally a blank canvas for someone to come in and set the direction and strategy of our QA and drive that change across the company.


We’re the UK’s leading price comparison site for small businesses and startups looking for insurance. We’ve completed disrupted an ‘old school’ and traditional industry and revolutionized it with our state of the art technology and now we’re looking to grow!


The role



  • You will be our most senior QA person and responsible for taking an excellent Agile QA team to a
    new level

  • Hands-­on whilst leading a team of 6 QA Analysts and setting the direction and strategy for the team
    and the QA function as a whole

  • You will liaise with our Tech Leadership team to continue the strong integration of our QA function in
    the development process

  • As we do Continuous Delivery, your testing focus will be geared heavily to the automation side of
    things, but we do what makes most sense for each situation

  • Work with product owners and track leads to review and set story and feature acceptance criteria

  • Implement business functionality in a testable form

  • Develop appropriate and maintainable test automation functionality at unit, integration and system
    tiers

  • Act as a customer champion within the team, representing risks and needs when implementing
    solutions


Some things we believe in


*Creating an best-in-class technology culture – Agile / Lean / TDD / Continuous Delivery (we release software to production about 14 times a day on average) / pair programming / cross functional teams working together on projects (Dev/QA/UX/product) / Active participation in open source


*Never chaining ourselves to a technology – always experimenting and ‘using the right tool for the job’


*Thought leadership – we host meetup groups and present talks in our office and the community


*Creating a great working environment and culture (modern open plan office, flexible hours, remote working, regular team events, paid company holidays abroad, afterwork clubs – like UX, Robotic, Data science clubs, finish early on fridays, ruby coding challenges over pizza, lunchtime TED talks and lot’s more!)


*Continuous learning – we look to pay for conferences and courses. Recently we have sent some of our team out to Miami, Portugal and Barcelona for tech events and conferences (paid for).


Our tech stack


Cucumber / RSpec / Turnip / Jasmine
Ruby on Rails
MongoDB
RabbitMQ
Puppet/Boxen
AWS
