SASS / HAML / HTML5 / CSS3 / JavaScript / CoffeeScript / jQuery


This list is always changing as we do not believe in limiting ourselves with technology, we are always experimenting and using the right tool for the job

item.title: Developer - Technology and New Ventures at Access Copyright at Access Copyright (Toronto, ON, Canada)
item.description:
Access Copyright has an exciting opportunity for a Developer - Technology and New Ventures to join our close-knit team in the heart of Downtown Toronto. 


Our recently formed Technology and New Ventures team is focused on identifying and developing strategy growth opportunities that integrate copyright clearance and content access with new digital services and partners. We are looking for candidates with experience in the education technology sector, including digital rights and content management systems, e-book publishing and distribution, online retail and e-commerce, as well as emerging digital and mobile technologies.  


In this role, you will be focused on primarily on software development related to delivering permissions/licensing API's for our right's management system. You will also provide day-to-day support for our "mission critical" back-office enterprise software. As such, you should be experience with both .Net front end and Oracle back end skills sets. 


Primary responsibilities include:



  • Acquire working knowledge of our current information systems and, working as part of a team, propose integration solutions with various technology partners as business opportunities are realized;

  • Develop Permissions logic using Oracle database schema objects to be called by various systems including web services and web applications;

  • Enhance our existing data model in order to support Web Services as identified by our business development group;

  • Develop the web services approved by our business development group in order to support new business opportunities and partnerships;

  • Develop and deploy applications/systems, and reports using Oracle Developer Suite 10g and Visual Studio .NET/Web Services technologies;

  • Develop Business Intelligence dashboards for Management and Technology partners;

  • Develop new information systems applications as well as maintain existing applications in an Agile-like environment;

  • Engage in preliminary testing prior to a QA release. Contribute in preparing QA test plans for larger projects; and 

  • Other duties and ad-hoc projects as required.

item.title: Ground-breaking Social Enterprise Seeks - Full Stack Engineer at Social Finance Ltd (London, UK)
item.description:
Social Finance is now hiring a Full Stack Engineer to work alongside our growing team, including founder Toby Eccles, director Stephen Brien and product manager Daniel Miodovnik.


As a full stack engineer, you will have end-to-end responsibility for the technology on which our apps, analytics and insights are built. In addition, you will architect, develop and launch our suite of new products and services. As an engineer within Social Finance Digital Labs, you will be at the forefront of the technology revolution we are bringing to the public and social sector.


This will be a challenging role. To deliver on this vision will require all of your energy, abilities and ambition. You will be a polyglot, already adept across the full-stack and keen to get up to speed with new technologies. You will be an engineer at heart: hands-on, unafraid of getting stuck in and focused on great results.


Your day to day activities will encompass anything and everything that’s required to build great tech: architecture, engineering, story planning, and of course, heads-down coding. You know what a high performance team looks like and will insist that the team is well organised so as to achieve brilliant results.


You probably bring several years of applied experience, perhaps in a start-up, tech firm or consultancy. And you will definitely bring a thirst for learning, a love for technology and a deep desire to solve real world problems.

item.title: Senior QA Performance Engineer at Fidelity (Durham, NC)
item.description:
Fidelity Investment's Fidelity Institutional Technology (FIT) division is seeking a Senior Software Quality Assurance Performance Test Engineer for our Durham, NC site. The individual will be responsible for managing the projects as well as testing of  multi-tiered distributed applications. A strong background in performance testing and/or in web development is well suited for this position.  Knowledge of multiple application infrastructures and strong communication skills are required. The Performance Testing & Engineering team is a group of highly skilled engineers who help design, test, and monitor high performing financial service products. In addition to a diverse and deep technical understanding the team members are experts in performance testing and financial services.


Fidelity Institutional Technology (FIT) enables business partners to win in their respective marketplaces by designing, building and maintaining the technology platforms and products of Fidelity Institutional and parts of the Retail and Workplace Investing divisions.


Primary Responsibilities



  • Develop test strategies using project artifacts as well as in depth interviews of architects and development leads

  • Create or modify performance scripts for Web based applications using HP LoadRunner with the Web and Web Services protocols

  • Execute performance tests on applications to assure capacity and stability of the applications meets requirements for production deployment.

  • Monitor all impacted systems for network connection disruptions as well as any obscure application behavior resulting from a network anomaly.

  • Measure resource consumption of components and processes and latency at measurable points in the systems under test

  • Identify application bottlenecks and assist engineers with improving application performance and reducing latency

  • Communicate performance testing results and identify areas for improvement with stakeholders at all levels

  • Manage project deliverables and drive delivery of performance output with project managers, developers, and peers.

  • Provide interim reports as well as a final report that summarize results to senior management.


Why Fidelity?



  • Three consecutive years on CareerBliss’ Top 50 Happiest Companies Employees Survey

  • A company that is committed to innovation and being an industry leader by investing in technology

  • More than 12,000 technology professionals utilizing an Agile methodology enterprise-wide

  • Access to top-tier technology platforms, OS, and frameworks

  • Non-traditional benefits like our Concierge Service, Computer Equipment Purchase Assistance Program and profit sharing eligibility


Company Culture


At Fidelity, you can find it all here.  We reward ambitious, passionate individuals with a work environment that fosters diversity, teamwork and collaboration as well as encourages innovative ideas and fresh thinking. We recognize the value that employees’ individual differences can contribute to the bright and strong future of our company.

item.title: Front End Developer at Priceline.com (New York, NY)
item.description:
Priceline.com, the leading online destination for smart travelers, is seeking an intelligent, motivated full-time developer to join our growing team.  Our creative, flexible company culture merges the agility of a start-up with the stability of an established, international public company.


The ideal candidate is passionate about creating well-architected solutions; well-versed in JSP development; familiar with pulling data from an Oracle database and architecting REST-based APIs for consumption by the front end; and comfortable with version control. 


Our agile development process centers around A/B testing incremental changes and empowering our technologists to suggest best practices. We understand the dynamic nature of technology, and we support our developers’ efforts to stay on the leading edge by attending meet-ups, going to conferences, and educating one another through code reviews and presentations. 


What You’ll Do:


You’ll be working in a small, tight-knit team, supporting our high-traffic Hotel, Airline, Rental Car and Vacation Package businesses, building applications that deliver real value to our customers.


You’ll be working closely with Product and Design team members on a modern technology stack grounded in node.js, with an MVC-based javascript framework (currently AngularJS) delivering data from our REST-based APIs. You will be optimizing our sites for cross-device performance, including mobile, desktop, tablets and phablets, with an emphasis on time to start render.


*This role can be in NYC or Norwalk, CT

item.title: SR. QA Engineer at Tripwire (Portland, OR)
item.description:
Why join us: IT security is in our DNA! With offices in Portland, San Francisco, Atlanta, London, Tokyo, Singapore and counting, we have continued to grow by developing our products to meet the challenges posed by today’s threat heavy environment. Over 8,100 enterprises and government institutions worldwide, including 46% of the Fortune 500 rely on what we do to protect their critical IT infrastructure and sensitive data. We are passionate about your ongoing development and always making things better. Become a part of Tripwire, a team that brings out the best in you!

About Us: We are a leading global provider of risk-based security and compliance management solutions, enabling enterprises, government agencies and service providers to effectively connect security to their business. Tripwire provides the broadest set of foundational security controls including security configuration management, vulnerability management, file integrity monitoring, log and event management. Tripwire solutions deliver unprecedented visibility, business context and security business intelligence allowing extended enterprises to protect sensitive data from breaches, vulnerabilities, and threats. Learn more at www.tripwire.com or follow us @TripwireInc on Twitter.


Job Summary

The Senior Software Quality Assurance Engineer is responsible for a leadership role in an agile 
research and development organization, working closely with scrum teams to execute on product backlogs, champion customer focused solutions, drive successful defect resolutions, and communicate product readiness to key product stakeholders. 


Key Responsibilities & Duties



  • Take a lead role and mentor junior staff members, both on and near-shore 

  • Facilitate initiative level planning across multiple scrum teams

  • Evangelize and implement best QA and Development practices 

  • Apply independence and creativity to problem solving across project assignments 

  • Establish and drive short-term and long-term goals for a small team of test engineers 

  • Design, author and execute automated and manual test procedures to ensure timely defect discovery 

  • Document clear, concise and detailed product defect reports and work with developers to ensure successful defect reproduction and resolution 

  • Engage and participate on an Agile team of a world class software engineers 

  • Provide ongoing project status to direct management and stakeholders 

  • Maintain strong customer focus when producing results 

  • All other duties as assigned. 




Scope

Working independently and with the Scrum teams, the Senior Software Quality Assurance Engineer resolves a wide range of diverse problems utilizing personal judgment and experience to develop solutions in a creative manner. Interacts with employees at all levels of the organization and takes personal responsibility for meeting the needs of the customer while demonstrating an understanding of business objectives. Authority to act within defined policies within the area of expertise/knowledge as directed. Effectively communicates research findings to the organization and develops plans for implementation. Determines necessary resources required and develops goals and metrics for function.

item.title: Data Scientist (The Walking Dead) at Next Games (Helsinki, Finland)
item.description:
If you’re a startup-minded pro with a passion for games and a brain that can tackle any given problem in a unique way, then keep on reading as we’re on the look for our new team member for The Walking Dead game team:


DATA SCIENTIST


As our Data Scientist, you’re responsible for generating insights from large data sets produced by our games and players. Working closely with our EP’s and game teams you’ll get to service and manage our day-to-day data requests and analyses hands-on.


This is what you’ll get to work on:



  • Work with product teams to define data to be collected from our products for analysis

  • Analysis of key performance indicators, such as customer acquisition, retention, lifetime value and virtual economy balance

  • Defining the data acquisition of AB tests and analysis of the gathered AB test data to estimate the effect on key metrics and choose the best features

  • Develop models for predicting player behavior

  • Answer in-depth analytics questions from the team and create reports of the results

  • Identify and report actionable insights to internal stakeholders, suggest recommendations and influence the direction of the business by effectively communicating results


Your experience and skills include:



  • 2+ years experience in a data scientist or analyst role, involving some of the following: data analytics, CRM data analysis, data mining, business intelligence, machine learning, predictive modeling

  • Expert knowledge in SQL-related languages

  • Knowledge in statistical programming languages (R, etc.) and in Big Data technologies (Hadoop, Hive, Pig, NoSQL, etc.)

  • Experience in interpreting data and analytics results to provide actionable insight into user/product behavior and deriving conclusions from those insights

  • Comfortable working in an international, fast-paced, challenging and stimulating organization

  • Excellent written & verbal communication skills in English


Here at Next Games we aim high, and will ask you to do the same. In exchange, you’ll be part of a team that is great to work with, who is dedicated and passionate about what we do – we believe passion is contagious. Giving each Nextgamer the tools and means to succeed in their job is our priority. We believe the fruits of our labor should be shared with everyone at Next Games. We offer the opportunity to work with a great bunch of passionate and dedicated people, a competitive salary and benefits package, and first and foremost a big challenge.



If you believe in the same things, don’t hesitate any longer, apply now!



When you apply, please email your CV, a cover letter along with your salary request to data.scientist@nextgames.com. Please apply soon, as we’ll proceed once we’ve found the right person to join our team!



For further information about the position please contact our CPO, Joakim Achrén at +358-500 625 398 during the following time:



Friday 21.8. between 13.00 – 14.00 (EEST)

item.title: Information Security Analyst at California State University - Northridge - CSUN (Los Angeles, CA)
item.description:
Job Title: Information Security Analyst
    
Job ID: 4977
    
Full/Part Time: Full-Time
    
Regular/Temporary: Regular
    
Job Code: 0420 Information Technology Consultant -12
    
Job Grade: Expert
    
Department: IT Information Security-8280
    

    
CSUN's Commitment to You
    
CSUN is strongly committed to achieving excellence through teaching, scholarship, active learning and diversity.  Our values include a respect for all people, building alliances with the community and the encouragement of innovation, experimentation and creativity.  CSUN actively encourages qualified candidates to apply who demonstrate a commitment to serving a diverse student population as well as a commitment to maintaining an inclusive work environment.
    
About the University
    
Serving more than 42,000 students each year, CSUN is one of the largest universities in the United States. CSUN ranks 10th in the country in awarding bachelor's degrees to underrepresented minority students, fifth nationally in awarding master's degrees to Hispanic students and enrolls the largest number of deaf and hard-of-hearing students of any U.S. state university. CSUN's 171 academic programs and engaged centers enjoy international recognition for excellence. CSUN currently partners with more than 100 institutions of higher education in 22 countries around the globe and attracts the largest international student population of any U.S. master's level institution. Situated on a 356-acre park-like setting in the heart of Los Angeles' San Fernando Valley, the campus features modern educational buildings and world-class LEED Gold-certified performing arts and recreational facilities recognized as among the best in the country. CSUN is a welcoming university that champions accessibility, academic excellence and student success.
    
Major Duties
    
Under the direction and general supervision of the Information Security Officer (ISO), the Information Security Analyst conducts regular security/risk assessments and internal security audits to identify gaps between campus policy/standards and current practices and procedures. The incumbent generates remediation action plans and manages through to completion with key stakeholders and system owners; conducts university-wide threat assessments, and recommend updates to the annual IS Plan, Policies and Standards; conducts confidential data and protected data system reviews; coordinates with campus procurement, vendors, and campus stakeholders to conduct documented product and service-provider security risk assessments; for on-premise and cloud-hosted solutions; manages the day-to-day operations of the campus-wide Information Security Awareness Training program, including online training management systems, development and distribution of periodic awareness updates via various communication channels, campus events, and targeted training sessions and department/college presentations for specialized risk areas; e.g. PCI, FERPA, HIPAA, Red Flags; generates security reports and key metrics, and produces management-level summaries.  In partnership with network engineering, monitors and tunes the university Intrusion Detection Systems; serves in a secondary capacity for conducting forensic investigations, incident response, security systems/server administration, and responding to reports/inquiries submitted by members of the university community via email, phone, in-person, and the case management system; perform other duties as assigned.
    
Qualifications
    
Equivalent to graduation from an accredited four-year college or university in Information Security, Computer Science or a job-related field.  Equivalent to five years of full-time, senior level experience working as part of an Information Security team in support of a medium-to-large diverse organization.
    
Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities
    
Thorough knowledge of the CISSP Information Security domains, risk assessment methodologies, NIST security standards, and California laws and regulations related to data privacy. General knowledge of LAN/WAN network systems, firewalls, VPNs, VoIP, virtual server platforms, storage area networks, web application development, and other information technology systems. Functional knowledge of: Desktop computers (Windows, XP, 7 and MAC OS X), Governance, Risk, and Compliance Systems (Risk Sharing Asset Management (RSAM)), Vulnerability Assessment Systems (Qualys and Accunetix), Forensics Equipment (Encase, BackTrack, media cloning hardware), Anti-Virus and Anti-Malware (Microsoft Security EndPoint (SCCM), Symantec EndPoint, and other AV/AM hardware and software), Awareness Training Software (SkillPort, LearnerWeb, SANS, etc.), Web Content Management System (Drupal), Intrusion Detection systems (Juniper firewall/IDS).  Ability and specialized skills to: apply and assess user needs; identify, analyze and address user problems; provide ongoing project leadership to technical development staff; analyze problems and propose effective solution; understand functional and procedural requirements and develop alternative solutions; relate system solutions to departmental management and staff; and communicate effectively both orally and in writing; make presentations; conduct meetings; provide user training; and establish and maintain effective working relationships with others. Excellent interpersonal, communication (written/verbal), analytical, organizational, teamwork and time management skills. Ability to build and maintain positive working relationships as part of a team.
    
Pay, Benefits, & Work Schedule
    
The university offers an excellent benefits package.

The salary range for this classification is: $6249 - $10,541
The anticipated hiring range: $6249 - $6667, dependent upon qualifications and experience.

Hours: Full-Time; 40 hrs/wk: Monday - Friday; 8:00am - 5:00pm.
    
General Information
    
This position is a sensitive position as designated by the CSU.

A background check (including a criminal records check) must be completed satisfactorily before any candidate can be offered a position with the CSU. Failure to satisfactorily complete the background check may affect the application status of applicants or continued employment of current CSU employees who apply for the position.

The person holding this position is considered a 'mandated reporter' under the California Child Abuse and Neglect Reporting Act and is required to comply with the requirements set forth in CSU Executive Order 1083 as a condition of employment.
    
How To Apply
    
Please complete the CSUN on-line application/resume upload submission process in order to be considered for any open position within the university and its auxiliaries. The hiring department will contact the best qualified candidates and invite them to participate in the interview process.

Application Screening begins September 9, 2015, and will continue until position is filled.

In order to be considered in the initial review, applications must be submitted prior to the date listed above. Application submissions received after the application screening date will be reviewed at the discretion of the University.

For more detailed information on the application and hiring process, please view the link below:
http://www.csun.edu/careers/
    
Equal Employment Opportunity
    
California State University, Northridge is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer.  We consider qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, gender, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, genetic information, medical condition, marital status, veteran status, or disability. Applicants who wish to request an accommodation for a disability may contact the Office of Equity and Diversity at (818) 677-2077.
    
  


Apply Here


PI91745615

item.title: Senior Python Developer at Applecart (New York, NY)
item.description:
Senior Python Engineer


We are looking for an expert, creative, self-motivated, and problem-solving back-end software engineer to join our company as a Senior Developer and central member of our engineering team. This position will focus on building infrastructure and mechanisms for large-scale online data mining and data collection. A successful candidate should have significant experience with web crawler/spider construction, web etiquette, concurrency, and text-processing.


Responsibilities/Duties



  • Work individually and as a member of technical and non technical teams to scale and expand Applecart’s products and proprietary technology 

  • Collaborate with the Partners and the rest of the development team to conceive of, architect, and develop revolutionary, scalable data collection software that will be deployed nationally for maximum impact on behalf of major political campaigns and national advocacy movements.

  • Construct and manage Applecart’s data collection and data mining infrastructure 

  • Responsibilities include, but are not limited to: 

    • Managing a sophisticated and large-scale data collection and processing infrastructure 

    • Constructing and adapting a robust AWS server infrastructure to process and run large data jobs (billions of records) 

    • Conducting advanced database design for collecting, processing, and storing large volumes of data 

    • Work closely with a team of data scientists to incorporate robust machine learning algorithms into existing application codebase 

    • Parse and standardize large volumes of structured and unstructured data

    • Design and implement infrastructure to integrate new data sources into social graph engine

item.title: Senior Software Engineer, Query Processing at Tableau Software (Palo Alto, CA)
item.description:
What you’ll be doing…


You’ll be developing cutting-edge software for the best visual data analysis products available. Query processing is one of the most complex technical challenges in Tableau. You will compile, optimize and rewrite queries for all different types of data sources. In addition to traditional relational query optimization, you’ll work on optimizing federated queries across multiple data sources with diverse, often non-relational, data models. You will be expanding the analytical product capabilities and performance of the Tableau products through query optimization and through our custom in-memory columnar storage engine. You will be constantly challenged to leverage your creativity and your technical prowess to improve Tableau.

Some of the things you’ll be doing include…



  • Extend and improve Tableau’s query pipeline that creates analytical queries enabling visualization of data.

  • Improve the performance and scalability of our in-memory data engine and extend it to support ever more diverse kinds of data.

  • Improve query performance through new algorithms, caching, concurrency, and scaling. These queries can operate on dozens of database platforms, enabling individual users and enterprises to rapidly federate and explore their data through insightful visualizations.

  • Create innovative algorithms to provide a better experience with live queries against an ever more diverse set of data sources. These may include API-based web data sources, cubes, graph data, relational and NoSQL systems such as Hadoop.

  • Leverage your creativity and technical prowess to extend our customer’s ability to see, understand, and “reach out and touch” their data; in whatever form that data it happens to be.

item.title: Lead Data Architect at Leap (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
We're looking for a Lead Data Architect, ideally with experience working on a SAAS or enterprise product.  You will work closely with the CTO and founders to discuss new schema design and future predictive capabilities for our real-time financial analytics products.  You should have experience with system design that follows best practices and leverage REST API's, as well as the ability to ensure that our entire stack is testable and scaleable. You like solving core problems around scalability and performance, thinking about how to leverage new tools, and optimize systems.


If you have management experience, or looking to grow in that area, this role will evolve into a technical leadership role as we grow.


Responsibilities include:


• Work closely with the CTO and Product team to define, design and prototype new features to our custom analytics and data visualization tools


• Develop highly scalable data ETL, data warehouse, and reporting solutions


• Help mentor the team on data architecture, new tools, and predictive functionality


• Investigate, propose, and/or prototype new tools for added security, storage and scalability

item.title: DevOps Engineer at OnDeck (New York, NY)
item.description:
OnDeck (ONDK) uses data aggregation and electronic payment technology to evaluate the financial health of small and medium sized businesses to efficiently deliver capital to a market underserved by banks. Through the OnDeck platform, millions of small businesses can obtain affordable loans. We are changing the way small businesses borrow money by combining our passion for Main Street with cutting-edge technology. We evaluate businesses based on their actual performance, not personal credit, and that’s enabled us to say “yes” more often and faster than traditional lenders.


What excites us at OnDeck? Technology. Innovation. Small businesses. We believe in our employees and power their growth by challenging them every day and offering careers that inspire. We’re all about teamwork, passion and making an impact.


Department overview:


The Credit and Data Analytics teams at OnDeck are responsible for the models and policies that drive our success in the industry. Through our data-driven approach, our models and tools sift through thousands of data points to (I) target businesses via marketing (ii) evaluate & quantify the financial health of our applicants (iii) enable prudent credit risk management and (iv) provide an industry leading customer experience The team combines model building experience with a strong focus on software engineering best practices to ensure our models can be deployed in production and impact the day to day functioning of our business.


In this role you will:



  • Work with a small, high impact data engineering team to develop a production quality data warehouse with complex, unstructured data in AWS

  • Make subsets of this data available to third party (internal) applications via a set of APIs. Ensure these APIs are production grade in terms of uptime and response time

  • Work with a team of really innovative data scientists as a partner in deploying a set of highly innovative machine learning based data products into a production environment

  • Develop monitoring, audit and logging tools to ensure business critical APIs are performing as expected

item.title: Manager, Data Engineering at Namely (New York, NY)
item.description:
Are you obsessed with data, tools and metrics? Have you used any ETL or data pipeline tools to process data? Do you love to build teams and manage talented engineers?
Are you interested in tools that gather, store, and analyze user metrics and product usage? We are looking for a Manager of Data Engineer to manage a team while contributing ideas, innovation, solutions and code to one of the hottest startups out of NYC!

item.title: Core Developer; large-scale analytics solutions at 1010data (New York, NY)
item.description:
We are seeking a Core Developer to design and implement large-scale analytics solutions; including building tools and interfaces used both internally and by customers, high performance data manipulation algorithms, and innovative ways to visualize and deliver result sets to customers.


Our Core team builds portable code that enables our customers to use 1010data’s system in a more autonomous way while maintaining performance when dealing with massive amounts of data.  They work directly with our customers for tangible feedback on products/technology, enabling rapid release cycles.


If you appreciate the end-end ownership of building tools from scratch and are confident embracing new technologies to make a tangible impact come evolve our product as we continue to change the rules of big data discovery.


Responsibilities:

  • Build, tune and manage cloud based applications

  • Create technology solutions which have critical business impact

item.title: Data Architect at Twilio (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
The Twilio Architecture team is responsible for the architecture of Twilio’s platform. The Data Architect will be a core member of the team focusing on designing data topologies and pipelines for handling and storing the immense amount of data we capture every day.


About the job:


As an experienced software engineer, you will be developing the architecture that will be instrumental in operating globally available, resilient and highly performant services used by hundreds of thousands of developers and apps.

Successful candidates will be strong developers with deep experience in data modeling, data storage and Business Intelligence systems.


Responsibilities:



  • Drive the technologies and policies needed to store, manage and interact with Twilio's data.

  • Work with the engineering teams to help choose technologies, design system architecture and model data in a scalable and efficient way.

  • Develop proof of concepts, shared libraries and services that will be used across the product engineering organization.

  • Coordinate with Sales Operations, Marketing and Finance to help understand their data needs and how disparate systems will integrate.

  • Tackle some of the most challenging problems in distributed computing, data persistence, and more.

Experience in specific programming languages isnot required; however the right candidate knows how to program and has the interest and ability to learn new languages quickly.


The right person appreciates the end-end ownership of building tools from scratch and is confident embracing new technologies to make a tangible impact and evolve our product as we continue to change the rules of big data discovery.


Responsibilities:

  • Create technology solutions which have critical business impact

item.description:

In the Senior QA Engineer – Big Data role, you will be responsible for participating in the design and development efforts of our big data testing infrastructure for functional and performance testing. item.title: Senior BI Consultant at Infusion (New York, NY)
item.description:
BI Senior Consultant


Role:


We are looking for a Business Intelligence Consultant to join our team in New York. Infusion’s Business Intelligence (BI) practice is a Microsoft Gold Certified BI Partner that was awarded Microsoft Impact Award for BI Partner of the Year. Our team consists of highly skilled individuals that are specialized in business process automation, data management, design, architecture, reporting and analytics. The BI Team takes a business first approach with our clients as we work closely them to understand and analyze their business and operational processes; their data collection mechanisms; their data reporting and decision making processes. This analysis allows us to formulate a vision and plan to work towards streamlining their enterprise wide processes to efficiently collect, manage, report on and analyze the data that is required by decisions makers.


We create a vision that looks beyond the traditional walls of departmental data silos and increases proactive lines of communication across an enterprise to ensure the right people are receiving the right data at the right time (when it is needed). Typically, we utilize the Microsoft Business Intelligence technology stack to build enterprise solutions that complement an organization's BI vision and goals. We provide our clients, across various different industries, with the tools and skills to organically grow and evolve Business Intelligence throughout the organization.


Job Duties:



  • Perform Enterprise wide business process analysis

  • Work closely with our clients to define system requirements

  • Design/implement Databases, Data warehouses and BI solutions around high volume enterprise applications

  • Develop business insight through reporting and dashboarding solutions

  • Provide training for our clients in the BI and data warehousing space

  • Execute rapid prototyping to support presales activities

  • Provide team leadership/co-ordination on projects

  • Provide expertise in cutting edge BI technology

  • Participate in Industry communities

item.title: Big Data Applications Developer at 1010data (New York, NY)
item.description:
Our Retail Solutions team is seeking a creative, execution focused Developer to architect and build Big Data applications used by thousands of business users at Fortune 500 Retailers. 


With more than 20 trillion rows of data currently under management, 1010data is designed to scale to the largest volumes of granular data, the most disparate and varied data sets, and the biggest user populations. All while delivering lightning-quick system performance.


The 1010data Consumer Insights Platform (CIP) is 1010data’s premier retail data monetization portal which enables retailers to provide valuable and relevant store data to suppliers.


You will build applications that drive significant business value to retail customers by empowering merchants and suppliers to make better decisions through data-driven collaboration based on a single version of the truth. Example applications include analytically identifying the best promotions, forecasting sales, or creating analytic customer segments.  


Ideally you’re comfortable with SQL or a similar database query language, but experience with a specific programming language isnot required.  For us it’s more relevant that you are interested, willing and able to learn new languages quickly and possesses proven experience building (coding) software solutions. 


Using astoundingly powerful proprietary analytic database software, you will construct complex queries to produce actionable information to inform client business decisions.


Our culture of ownership ensure you will truly own the roadmap and architecture of applications you develop.


Big picture, fastidious developers that are able to operate with ambiguity yet always deliver will thrive in our flat organization that rewards results.


If you are passionate about using technology to solve real world business problems and add substantial value to the company—we would be excited to speak with you!


Responsibilities:



  • Develop and release production ready large-scale enterprise applications used by hundreds of customers and thousands of users

  • Build scalable code that can run analyses against billions of rows of transactions in seconds

  • Manage design of technical solutions to specs; Collaborate with key stakeholders (e.g users, analysts, sales) to understand requirements and build valuable applications

Factual is looking for a Lead Systems/DevOps Engineer to head up a small Sysops/DevOps team. Our search is for a special kind of Sysops/Devops engineer -- one who codes to automate, is comfortable with cloud and physical infrastructure, and treats metal like a resource (e.g. hasn’t named a server after a greek god in at least 5 years).

This is a great opportunity to manage serious infrastructure that is servicing large amounts of data and traffic, work with a large and outstanding engineering team, and employ state-of-the-art tools and techniques.

item.title: Quant Developer at Marriott Sinclair (Little Chesterford, UK)
item.description:
The role of Quant Developer is open to a capable and motivated mathematician with software development expertise.  We're looking at a broad range of experience levels here, from new graduates to gurus, and we want anyone coming on board to be prepared to learn and improve their skills.  We're a young company with an open, relaxed atmosphere, and we're looking for people that are in turn open to new ideas and ways of doing things.


The role involves a broad range of activities:



  • Development of the Tyche software product.  All development proceeds according to modern software development practices such as continuous integration testing, and code produced needs to be mathematically correct and highly efficient.



  • Determining mathematical solutions to problems, and determining how best to express those solutions in terms of computer code.  The problems to be solved may be concrete practical problems such as how to find an optimal investment strategy, or how best to calibrate a mathematical model to data, or more abstract problems such as how best to efficiently execute a sequence of mathematical operations.



  • Testing and quality control.  This is hugely important to us.  Any work needs to be thoroughly tested, and a comprehensive set of tests should be submitted for the work alongside the code, to add to our regression testing suite.



  • Maintenance and support of Tyche.  For this, read bugfixing ;)!  We have a low bug-rate at present, and have very rigorous systems for bug recording and monitoring, but fixing bugs generally takes priority over new project work.


The term "Quant Developer" can be used to mean a broad spectrum of things in the industry.  At one end, there are essentially pure quants who hack programs together, and at the other end there are dedicated software developers with little mathematics.  We don't really fit in to that.  At Marriott Sinclair we take the software development equally as seriously as the mathematics.  The team here are professional software developers at the same time as being serious mathematicians; we don't compromise on either area.


Please submit a CV and covering letter to Mark at Marriott Sinclair.

item.title: Senior Java Developer at Semantico Limited (Brighton, UK)
item.description:
Semantico is an award winning digital publishing solutions company with offices in central Brighton and the USA. We deliver innovative solutions and consultancy to a global client base of publishers and scholarly institutions.


We’re proud of the fact that every aspect of our work is in-house, from initial requirements gathering through UX design and build, all the way to aftercare for the products we deliver. Our clients value Semantico’s partnership approach: we don’t just build products, we build relationships that allow us to understand and deliver on our clients’ long-term needs.


We are looking for a talented Senior Java Developer to join our fast-paced and innovative solutions team. Team members are expected to be able to work across projects of all scales, from large internal investment programmes run with agile methodologies, to small features for client sites which are well-defined prior to sale and run to strict timeframes.


As a growing company, every member of our team is valued and invited to have a say in the future of the Semantico technical strategy. We also believe in training – each staff member has their own training budget - and promoting from within, so this is an ideal environment if you are always looking to learn something new and want to build on your career.


In return, we offer an exciting opportunity in a company at the forefront of digital publishing. A competitive salary and bonus scheme are available for the right candidate as well as a personal training budget, a contributory pension plan, 31 days’ holiday inclusive of public holidays and increasing with service, a 35 hour week, Cycle to Work scheme, childcare vouchers, various fresh coffees, fruit delivered to the office, a relaxed dress code. Our office hours are 9.30 – 5.30pm.


To apply for this position, please read the full job description below before sending in your CV and a cover letter that includes your salary expectations and why you feel you are suitable for the role to HR@semantico.com


The closing date for submissions is end of play on Wednesday 23 September.  


We will endeavour to reply to all applicants to advise whether or not they have been invited to interview.


If it is not obvious from your application that you have the right to work in the UK, please confirm in your covering letter that you have this right and that you are UK based, or that you are moving to the UK and specify the timescales for your relocation. 


Full Job Description


Primary Purpose of the Role:


The Senior Java Developer will design and develop new software, major enhancements to existing applications, and fixes within defined time, cost, and quality targets.


Principal Relationships:




  • Developers




  • Technical Team Leads




  • Project Manager & Scrum master




  • QA team




  • Systems & Support teams




Key Responsibilities




  • Work with technical leads, project management and quality assurance


    staff to design and develop and deploy high quality applications for our clients




  • Develop systems that adhere to architecture standards, risk management and security policies




  • Work on projects both large and small, with the same attention to detail




  • Understand project development from both a commercial and software engineering perspective




  • Work with systems and support teams to deploy applications and provide post-deployment aftercare




  • Unit test software thoroughly to ensure highest quality levels possible




  • Produce updates to system documentation




  • Utilise system analysis skills to understand business requirements and produce system designs




  • Assist in estimating and planning work




  • Work with quality assurance staff to aid in testing and develop automated test scripts




  • Assess code for compliance to standards, perform code reviews and design reviews




  • Take a lead role on development projects, mentoring colleagues as required




  • Work on multiple projects with varying priorities and deadlines




  • Recommend best practice techniques for build, test and project delivery through constant evaluation of activities




  • Review existing applications and end to end solutions, providing recommendations for improvement

item.title: Infrastructure Engineer at Rally Software (Boulder, CO)
item.description:
Rally is seeking an experienced, self-motivated, and passionate Infrastructure Engineer to join our team.  Are you someone who loves to solve big problems and who doesn’t settle for the status quo?  We believe in finding the right tool, hardware, or software for the job, we don’t care if it’s open source or proprietary.

If it makes our systems faster, more secure, and scalable we want to hear about it.   Because we are an Agile company you won’t be working in a silo.  We need you to have broad experience in system administration, network operations, some coding experience, build and release engineering, performance engineering and site operations.  We don’t expect anyone to know everything, we just need people who are quick studies that aren’t afraid to jump in with both feet and learn by doing.


An entrepreneurial fast paced mentality is critical for success in this position: a passionate can-do attitude, exceptional communication skills, and the ability to collaborate while acting as a thought leader in your area of expertise will serve you well at Rally Software. Does this sound like a challenge you're ready for?


Once hired, here’s what we’ll need you to do.


Key Responsibilities:




  • Partner with developers, architects and the business to optimize the integration and delivery of existing and new services




  • Support, troubleshoot and maintain the Rally global production infrastructure ecosystem (AWS, data center, and on-premises installations)




  • Build and maintain configuration management recipes in Chef




  • Enable autonomy in development teams through the creation and delivery of valuable self-service and automation capabilities




  • Work with developers and product owners to lead operational readiness throughout the SDLC




  • Pair with other engineers to promote skills enhancement and knowledge sharing




  • Research and share the latest innovations in automation and virtualized infrastructure




Skills Required:




  • BS/MS in Computer Science or 5+ years of relevant industry experience




  • Prior experience supporting large scale, highly available, service-oriented, distributed production systems.




  • Very strong Linux experience in a highly-available production environment




  • Experience building production hosting environments from bare metal up




  • Familiarity with SaaS, PaaS or IaaS




  • Strong understanding of best practices around release engineering




  • Exposure to different types of data storage




  • Strong written & oral communication skills are essential




  • Experience using tools such as Git, Docker, Puppet and/or Chef




  • Advanced scripting skills




You will be successful in this role if you:




  • Believe in Agile principles and iterative development




  • Can be autonomous and self-driven but work across teams to collaborate on common ideas and strategies




  • Are comfortable working with automation and are willing to learn tools you aren’t familiar with




  • Enjoy exploring and experimenting with new ideas and sharing with others




  • Can communicate ideas clearly and effectively




  • Have a positive attitude when engaging with our customers (development teams, the business and occasionally external customers)




Location: Boulder, CO (relocation assistance available)


Rally’s global headquarters is in Boulder, Colorado, with 9 additional offices spanning 4 continents. At Rally we believe that we can’t inspire innovation in our customers if we’re not innovative ourselves. We empower our teams by offering them flexibility, autonomy, and a culture founded upon open communication and collaboration. Recently awarded Best for the World: Worker Impact award for the third year in a row by B Labs, Named #8 on the “Best Medium-Sized Workplaces” by Fortune Magazine, a “Best Company to Work For in Colorado” and ranked in the “Top 100 Best Places to Work” in the nation from Outside Magazine, Rally offers a highly collaborative culture and work-life balance that attracts and retains top talent.


Rally is an Equal Opportunity Employer!

Rally Software Development Corp., a wholly owned subsidiary of CA, Inc.

item.title: Stream (Techstars) - Senior Python developer at Stream INC (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
About Stream

Stream (GetStream.io) is building a new kind of data store. A data store to build, scale and personalize feeds. Our users access Stream via a blazing fast, highly available and simple to use API service. We run on a very complex tech stack, highly optimized for performance and availability.


Stream is a well funded startup with offices in Amsterdam and Boulder. We are looking for an experienced Python developer to join our development team in Amsterdam. Your responsibilities include build features for Stream's API service and storage layer as well as contribute to our open-source library (Stream-Framework)


Here are a few of the reasons we think this work is fun and challenging:



  • High performance demands. You will get to choose efficient data structures and algorithms for high performance. This often requires understanding the details of stdlib and how other libraries such as django, gevent, celery work.

  • We run a collection of services, each with different requirements and patterns optimized for efficiency. To name a few: single threaded, multi-threaded, multi-process and event-driven.

  • Complex testing scenarios.

  • Designing a simple, clean, and easily-understandable API is hard.

item.title: Data Warehouse Engineer (junior/senior) at Zalando SE (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
The opportunity


As a Zalando Data Warehouse Engineer you will become a critical part of one of the most innovative teams in ecommerce. You will consult and support different stakeholders across the entire company by providing data-driven solutions to business and technical challenges. You’ll join our accomplished team of experts in integrating data from many sources into our single-point-of-truth data warehouse. And you will have the freedom to launch your own open source projects, contribute to others’ projects, build internal community around your interests, and strengthen your personal brand—while receiving meaningful support at every step.


What we're looking for



  • Demonstrated professional experience programming in Python, Java, or PL/SQL

  • Experience maintaining, refactoring and extending large code bases

  • A preference for agile methodologies

  • A passion for working with relational databases: reading, writing and optimizing complex statements; modelling data structures, and designing ETL processes

  • The ability to communicate effectively with diverse teams

  • English language fluency


Your responsibilities



  • Develop expertise in understanding our business processes and the many related requirements

  • Collaborate with our analysts to create and implement new initiatives based on our stakeholder requirements

  • Act as a liaison between your team and other teams within Zalando Tech

  • Maintain, optimize and extend our data warehouse infrastructure using Oracle, Exasol and PostgreSQL databases


What you can expect from us



  • Internal tech talks, skills-building courses and technical “People Leads” who help you achieve mastery

  • Personal branding support: From preparing conference talks and blog posts to industry networking Community: hack weeks, movie nights, +70 self-organized tech guilds and more

  • Competitive salary

  • 40% Zalando shopping discount and commuter discount

  • Relocation assistance for internationals


About Zalando


Zalando is Europe’s leading online fashion platform, doing business in 15 markets. Delivering first-class shopping experiences to our +15 million customers requires moving fast — with microservices, Agile processes & autonomous teams  —  and using cutting edge, open source technologies. We are passionate about what we do and have fun while doing it. And we are willing to experiment and make mistakes: It’s how we grow.


Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!


If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring processes, please contact recruiter Matthias Rempel at jobs@zalando.de.

item.title: Data Engineer - Python, PostgreSQL and Redis at Lyst (London, UK)
item.description:
Lyst are looking for a Data Engineer to join our Analytics team and work on the huge data projects that are integral to Lyst’s day to day operations.


Data lies at the heart of everything we do here at Lyst, from understanding our users better to making mission critical decisions, we always look at the data first.


We record nearly 100 million rows of data a day just from user interactions. To support this volume, we have built our own analytics architecture, predominantly in Python and leveraging the convenience of many cloud services like AWS Redshift, Lambda, CloudFront, S3, etc.


With this sea of data growing everyday, you will work hand in hand with our analysts and data product managers to ensure that our analytics data pipeline is clean, efficient and scalable as the business and traffic increases. From building bespoke BI tools, ensuring analytics engineering requests are responded to in a quick manner to architecting new solutions. You will work on things such as:



  • Improving our analytics data architecture, ensuring scalability and resiliency

  • Streamline the anomaly detection process across all our data, and build tools and processes around it to speed up the required actions to solve any anomaly

  • Improving our internal BI tool, Looker, and tools surrounding it to ensure Analysts are able to provide amazing insight to the business.

  • Understanding the query requirements from our data analysts and optimising our database (table) design to make them faster and more efficient.

  • Fixing the interesting problems we face in the best way possible; we are not constricted to tool sets and languages. If you find a solution to a problem that will work better, we use your idea. Best idea wins.

  • Creating a development platform, tools and pipeline that is effective and easy to iterate with.

  • Building your own brand and skills. Lyst is a company that will encourage and support you to get involved in the wider community. Events like FOSDEM, PyCon, JS London are regular occurrences on our calendar.

  • Creating better solutions for everything we do, from our culture to the code. This is your company, own it.



WHAT WE USE


Python, JavaScript, Django, PostgreSQL, Redis, AWS, Objective-C, Elasticsearch, Docker, Ember.js, RedShift, Pandas, IPython Notebook



As you can see we are really excited about the data we have here hopefully you will be too. We expect you to have already had some exposure to working in a commercial environment as an data Engineer. You will have the ability to not only work as a hands on member of the team but also the


We like to build things that solve problems, you will not be constrained by process - we work in small product teams that take a lean approach to building things. We believe that there is no silver bullet to fix the problems and challenges we face: instead we encourage consistent iteration to ensure we are always solving problems. We care deeply about collaboration, feedback and trust; all of our engineers take ownership of committing their own code and ensuring that everything is bug free and reliable.


If the above resonates and you would like to strongly influence the direction of our products and our culture, work with amazing people and hang out with Albert and Bruce, the office dogs. Artisan beers. Good Coffee. Great people.


If you would like to apply please do so right away, if you would like a bit more info feel free to get in touch with Tris on jobs@lyst.com.

item.title: Senior Big Data Software Engineer- $90K at Crossover (Lahore, Pakistan) (allows remote)
item.description:
Are you a Senior Software Engineer that has spent several years working with Big Data technologies? Have you created streaming analytics algorithms to process terabytes of real-time data and deployed Hadoop or Cassandra clusters over dozens of VMs? Have you been part of an organization driven by a DevOps culture, where the engineer has end to end responsibility for the product, from development to operating it in production? Are you willing to join a team of elite engineers working on a fast growing analytics business? Then this role is for you!



Job Description



The Software and DevOps engineer will help build the analytics platform for Bazaarvoice data that will power our client-facing reporting, product performance reporting, and financial reporting. You will also help us operationalize our Hadoop clusters, Kafka and Storm services, high volume event collectors, and build out improvements to our custom analytics job portal in support of Map/Reduce and Spark jobs. The Analytics Platform is used to aggregate data sets to build out known new product offerings related to analytics and media as well as a number of pilot initiatives based on this data. You will need to understand the business cases of the various products and build a common platform and set of services that help all of our products move fast and iterate quickly. You will help us pick and choose the right technologies for this platform.



Key Responsibilities



In your first 90 days you can expect the following:




  • An overview of our Big Data platform code base and development model




  • A tour of the products and technologies leveraging the Big Data Analytics Platform




  • 4 days of Cloudera training to provide a quick ramp up of the technologies involved




  • By the end of the 90 days, you will be able to complete basic enhancements to code supporting large-scale analytics using Map/Reduce as well as contribute to the operational maintenance of a high volume event collection pipeline.




Within the first year you will:




  • Own design, implementation, and support of major components of platform development. This includes working with the various stakeholders for the platform team to understand their requirements and delivery high leverage capabilities.



  • Have a complete grasp of the technology stack, and help guide where we go next.

item.title: Foundational Applications C++ Developer at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Foundational Applications department builds some of the most innovative and heavily used applications and infrastructure in the financial industry. We work on communication systems, compliance and archiving solutions, charts and visualizations, news, search and recommendation systems and big data infrastructure.

Our developers operate at the intersection of in-depth technical research and an aggressive time-to-market. We not only own the full life cycle for the products we build, but also work closely with our business counterparts and UX design teams to strategize on next generation features and functionality. We are dedicated to using and contributing to open source, have an active presence at industry conferences and collaborate with top universities.

>> More information on individual groups and their products can be found below. When you apply, you will have the ability to select your preferred group.


Instant Messaging

Bloomberg Instant Messaging (Instant Bloomberg, or IB) is used by the Bloomberg community for real-time communication including exchanging quotes, trade ideas, news and other financial information. IB handles close to 250 million post events per day. Our usage has grown considerably over the past few years, requiring that we maintain a sophisticated UI and a state-of-the-art distributed architecture which can scale to the most extreme load without compromising performance. We also build a unified multimedia communications product called BConnect. We work with open source software and encourage interaction with the wider technology community by contributing changes and taking part in related meetups and conferences.

Bloomberg Vault

Bloomberg Vault (BVault) is a startup within Bloomberg developing a cloud-based compliance archiving service, eDiscovery tools and real-time compliance monitoring infrastructure. The explosive growth of social media and web collaboration require businesses to remain compliant with an increasingly regulatory environment. Our software, hosted in Bloomberg's private cloud, archives over 60 billion messages and has gained rapid market adoption with over 700 enterprises. Our infrastructure processes over 200 million messages a day, checking content and interaction patterns, and providing analytics and event-driven reporting.

Mail

The Bloomberg Mail (Message) group builds a cloud-based platform used for Internet email, bond announcements and pricing, financial research distribution and other communication on the Bloomberg terminal. Our network of users, connected through the platform, relies on our real-time performance, ironclad security and tight integration with financial data and Bloomberg applications. Message is built on top of open source, commercial and proprietary technologies. This highly available distributed system includes comprehensive storage, search infrastructures, real-time email transport and delivery pipelines. We build APIs for integration with other applications and systems, and a feature-rich user interface optimized for our customers.

News

The News group develops one of the most heavily used applications on the Bloomberg terminal that provides search, real-time alerts and analysis. We build systems that process over one million news stories a day from over 80,000 sources. We provide scalable products that meet strict indexing latency requirements and synthesize and present an overwhelming amount of unstructured information to our clients. Bloomberg News uses our systems and workflows making them the fastest, most influential news agency in the world.

Government Intelligence

The Government Intelligence group helps investors quantify the impact of government activities such as legislation, regulation and contracting. Our work includes ingesting large unstructured public data sets and discovering actionable data points to alert clients in real-time. We design scalable search and database solutions to aid discoverability and analysis.

Charts and Custom Indices

The Charts and Custom Indices group builds visuals that make it easier to absorb information and identify data trends. In addition to visualizations, we develop analytical platforms that retrieve, aggregate and process large data sets. Our services run on dedicated Linux servers and require stability, scalability and speed.

Search and Discoverability

The Search and Discoverability group builds a federated search and question-answering engine to ensure Bloomberg clients can find the right information as quickly as possible. We use open source search technologies and natural language query understanding to build an intuitive search functionality. Our platform searches millions of data points from dozens of structured and unstructured data stores and natural language question-answering engines.

Financial Data Infrastructure

The Financial Data Infrastructure group builds the next generation of infrastructure to take in large amounts of financial data. We use big data and cluster management technologies to achieve high performance, reliability and transparency. Current initiatives include: price history infrastructure to store and manage billions of historical time series data points; data pipeline to ensure transparent and accurate delivery and governance of data; data snapshot for real time access to thousands of data points about millions of securities; and, Bloomberg Query Language to provide a rich access and calculation layer on top of all Bloomberg data.

item.title: Systems Security Engineer at 1010data (New York, NY)
item.description:
1010data has created the fastest database in the world via an easy-to-use, spreadsheet-like interface to make big data discovery easy across retail, consumer packaged goods, financial services, healthcare and telecom.


We are seeking a Security Systems Engineer to establish, lead and implement measures to protect the privacy of our customer data and intellectual property.


With more than 20 trillion rows of data currently under management, 1010data is designed to scale to the largest volumes of granular data, the most disparate and varied data sets, and the biggest user populations. All while delivering lightning-quick system performance.


The right person appreciates the end-end ownership of building tools and is confident in embracing new technologies that come with cutting edge security.


If you are a security authority and hands on engineer excited to employ cutting edge techniques to manage and secure massive amounts of data in dynamic web environments we would like to speak with you!


Responsibilities:



  • Designing and implementing advanced security techniques in parallel and distributed systems environments

  • Mining security data, performing deep analysis to discover unrealized threats, in order to provide better transparency and more accurate metrics.

  • Developing new and innovative methods for automating security log analysis and event processing.

  • Implementing identity and key management infrastructure.

  • Implement HIPAA, SSAE16 compliance initiatives

  • Understand and review technical documents such as operating system and application system logs, code snippets, and information security best practice/regulatory guidelines.

  • Work collaboratively with developers as well as non-technical business units.

item.title: Senior Software Development in Test at Rackspace, the #1 managed cloud company (Windcrest, TX) (allows remote)
item.description:
Do you believe in the power of Open Source? Were you the kid that took apart the family TV not just to see how it worked but because you thought you could make it better? Can you detect and prevent the invasion of bugs better than the Orkin man?  If you answered yes to any/all of these, then you really need to be a Software Development Engineer in Test at Rackspace.


With the largest OpenStack public cloud in the business and our commitment to provide our customers the best platform to continue changing the world, the life of an SDET at the Rack can be quite unique and rewarding. How is this possible? Easy—we help match your passions, birthday wishes, and Sherlock skills with the right opportunity to be GREAT. Here’s a preview to get you started:


Pushing the Limits of the Cloud:
OpenStack…heard of it? Yep we worked with NASA as founders so of course we have some of the most notable upstream contributors on the planet. Whether for our public or private cloud offerings, our Devs are pounding out code in Python, Ruby, Java or whatever’s the next big thing at a break-neck pace. So when it comes to SDETs, we take pride in being true partners in excellence; not some robot or second-tier Dev whose only task is to cross off test cases from a checklist. Our SDETs have a tinker’s mind with a natural curiosity to know where we are going and to anticipate the unexpected. Diversity drives innovation so our teams are dispersed across the globe—even working from their favorite Cheetos-stained gaming chair at home.


Internal Innovation:
Ten data centers around the globe with several hundred thousand servers that all need to seamlessly interact like one of your LAN parties back in college. If you like HUGE environments then jump on into this playground. Our DevOps Engineers, Software Developers, and Infrastructure Engineers have to keep up with the demands of the industry that didn’t exist, oh maybe 5 minutes ago.  Our SDETs who partner with these teams are literally building their dreams to insure what’s new today is built to withstand the strains of tomorrow. Bulletproof code—that’s how we roll.


This is NOT your uncle’s Quality Engineering team where there was a lack of software development to accomplish testing and the job was just about manual button pushing. Are you ready to change the game doing what they said can’t be done? Are you ready to automate bigger things better and faster? What are you waiting for? Click that apply button, talk with one of our talent specialists and get ready to jump on in to the best adventure you’ve ever had.


Still not convinced? Hear from the Rackers who do this day in and day out but still can’t believe this is their job. QE at the Rack

item.title: Senior Software Developer, Application Integrations at Smartsheet (Bellevue, WA)
item.description:
Love building awesome apps, integrations and API-based mashups?  Want to help shape and grow a new developer community?  Smartsheet is taking collaboration by storm with a product loved by 6M+ users in over 189 countries.  Join the Platform Team on its quest for world domination, help break down barriers between services, build apps that make you proud, and have fun doing it.



If you are a passionate engineer who likes variety and wants to touch many products and technologies, you will fit right in with the Platform Team.  From day one, you will write shippable code and make contributions across the board - from building rock-solid production integrations with Google, JIRA and Salesforce to experimental data visualizations and mashups, cool workflows with DocuSign and Evernote. The Platform Team is an agile team of experts in Smartsheet RESTful API who tackle problems on a variety of platforms using a number of programming languages. Sometimes referred to as the "Apps and Integrations" team, we build apps and integrations, influence the API roadmap, as well as help our partners and developer communities integrate with Smartsheet by providing SDKs, sample code and guidance.



Responsibilities:



  • Become an expert on the Smartsheet API and Platform apps, solutions, and tools.

  • Work directly with Product Managers to help determine roadmap, assess scope, provide input on tradeoffs, and make technical recommendations.

  • Architect and implement solutions, including front-end and back-end elements. Our stack includes Java Play! framework, AngularJS, Postgres and RabbitMQ all running on Heroku. We also build stuff in Python, Ruby, PHP and C#.

  • Design scalable database schemas and write efficient queries.

  • Provide technical advisory and assistance to customers, partners and internal stakeholders working with the Smartsheet API.

item.title: Senior Software Developer (Java) at Global Blue (Vienna, Austria)

item.title: Cloud Systems Engineer at Cloudreach (New York, NY) (allows remote)
item.description:
Cloudreach's Systems Engineers work with challenging technical solutions for industry leading clients. We love all things cloud related and believe passionately in the innovation it can drive. 


We're a global top-tier partner for both Amazon Web Services and Google - two giants of the cloud computing industry. We are looking for Windows or Linux engineers who are capable of delivering awesomeness on cloud engineering projects. Maybe you're a Systems Administrator, a Systems Engineer, a Site Reliability Engineer, or perhaps a DevOps Ninja - we can offer you something new. 


Our Cloud Platforms team is the best at what they do - DevOps meets consultancy. It's not your average job because Cloudreach is not your average company. You won't be bored - there's plenty of variety in our project work and you'll always be learning.


Not if. When will you join the best Cloud engineering team in the industry?


Where has Cloudreach come from?



  • We were an idea formed in a London pub. Now we're a global business with hubs across Europe and North America. That growth is fuelled by a special team, developing tech solutions for interesting clients you will have heard of

  • We were voted #1 Small Business to Work For in 2013 and our management won Best Leadership


How will you spend your time at Cloudreach?


You will be working in the following areas (and more!):



  • Green field development of Amazon Web services infrastructure (EC2, RDS, EMR, etc) e.g. looking at an existing service or data center and then architecting a more effective solution in AWS. You might work on a major eCommerce platform, a MySQL database migration, or building a scalable mobile backend

  • DevOps: systems engineering work with frameworks such as Chef or Puppet - as well as helping to break down barriers between siloed teams. We automate everything.

  • Technical deployment and consultancy related to Google Apps for Business - for example designing a complex Single Sign-On solution

  • Not doing any out of hours shift work - yay!

item.title: Software Engineer, JavaScript at SolarCity (San Mateo, CA)

SolarCity is committed to bringing cleaner, more affordable energy to more people. In order to make that happen, we have a dedicated group of software engineers working on the most interesting projects in the industry. We are looking for bright, talented, and versatile software engineers to join our team and help us build tools and products that will accelerate the adoption of clean energy, and improve the lives of hundreds of thousands of users. You will get to work with a tight-knit, fast-paced, and dedicated software team on cutting edge products.

The ideal candidate is smart, driven, loves learning, solving challenging problems and getting things done.

You’ll be responsible for designing and developing cutting edge web applications that sustain our continued growth. These projects will be challenging, but will play a key role in empowering our workforce and informing our customers and advocates.



Some of the software projects we’re working on include:


• Real time energy production and consumption monitoring
• Distributed energy management using battery storage
• Microgrid monitoring and administration
• Internal tools to mobilize our workforce
• External apps to facilitate solar adoption
• Graphical CAD systems for auditing and design
• 3D whole house energy simulation models
• Pricing and proposal tools
• Project management, scheduling, and resource allocation

• Quadcopters used in site inspection and modeling
• Gamification

item.title: Senior PHP Developer at Coolblue (Rotterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
As a PHP Developer at Coolblue you will make sure our web shops are ridiculously fast and meticulously kept.


What you tell your friends you do
"I build web shops. And no - I will not fix your computer."


What you will really be doing



  • Coming up with new functionalities and building them.

  • Improving the technology that runs over 300 web shops.

  • Improving the user-friendliness of all of those web shops.


How will you be doing this?



  • You are an all-rounder in a Scrum team. You will have your own specialization, but you will also be able to perform all other tasks within the team.

  • You prioritize your own work together with your team and Product Owner. You will receive immediate feedback from end users and you will have a lot of opportunities to experiment.

  • You will be using the right tools for whatever job will be thrown at you. Choices that were made in the past are not rules.

  • You will work in a motivated team to meet ambitious deadlines. There is always a budget for good ideas.

  • Big data is your guru, your gut feeling isn't. To measure is to know.


What we have worked on last quarter



  • Faceted search. Search and filter real-time product information, hundreds of times per second, for 90.000 products in 280 shops.

  • Responsive design. One codebase, lots of devices, but always the optimal user experience.

  • Reviews. A completely new infrastructure for better performance and scalability. Improved usability for both customers and moderators. More reviews, more interaction, less spam, better conversion rates.


What a day in the office might look like
You open a pull request in GitHub for your last changes in the Javascript codebase of one of the back-end services for our new faceted-search functionality. You have fixed a bug in a de-serialisation method that was causing metadata to leak from JSON objects. Considering the large amount of simultaneous, relatively small requests these services process, Node.js seemed the obvious choice. So you had to abandon your usual work field of PHP and give the old Javascript another chance. Once again it proved itself a powerful language, capable of building beautiful stuff. Maybe the front-enders were right after all? Now that this has been tackled, you return to PHP. You had this idea to optimise the determination of the sorting order of the filters on the site...


Team
You will be working in a team with three to five other developers, each of them with their own specialization, ranging from PHP to Javascript. Your team will be complemented by a Scrum Master and a Product Owner.

item.title: Pet Products Web Developer (Excellent Nerfgun and Beer Drinking Skills required) at Radio Systems Corporation (PetSafe) (Knoxville, TN)
