item.title: Test Developer - Changing the Way the World Learns! at D2L (Kitchener, ON, Canada)
item.description:
Every day, our software is used by millions of people around the world, and we are looking for individuals who share in our excitement and passion for transforming the way the world learns. At D2L, we believe that learning should be accessible and engaging. Our goal is to create easy, flexible, and smart software that ignites the desire to learn in everyone. To do this, we need to give talented, enthusiastic, and passionate people opportunities to create, develop, and collaborate on projects that revolutionize the learning environment.


Test Developers at D2L are passionate about building quality, secure, high performing software. They tackle tough technical and non-technical testing challenges.


You will contribute to technology that will transform teaching and learning around the world. Our software is used daily by millions of users in more than 20 countries.


Work on an agile development team which includes dedicated Developers, Testers, Designers, a Technical Product Manager, and a Development Manager


• These teams can tackle any problem in any area - you'll see a variety of problems and technologies
• All members of the team contribute to the definition, requirements, development, and testing of the problems we are solving

• Automate the tests that bear repeating

HOW WILL I MAKE AN IMPACT?


• Enable test-first designs like Test Driven Development and Behaviour Driven Development
• Build performance tests to ensure we are always improving product performance.
• Build the frameworks to enable automation, continuous integration, and continuous delivery

item.title: Principal Medical Software Architect at Cambridge Consultants (Boston, MA)
item.description:
Main purposes of the job


This position offers the rare opportunity to take a leadership role in the Medical Technology business and help shape the future of intelligent, connected medical devices. If you are excited about solving complex, multivariate technical and systems challenges in the medical domain, are passionate about developing robust, safety-critical software that serves a meaningful purpose, and have excellent interpersonal and leadership skills, then this role could be for you. You will work with our clients and lead the creation of innovative multidisciplinary products and technologies in the medical space.


This role offers continuous exposure to the latest developments in an exciting field poised for growth, as well as the variety of working with many companies, technologies, and people who are passionate about the future of the role of technology in healthcare.


This role is based in our new state-of-the-art innovation center, located in Boston, MA.


Type of work undertaken by the group


The Medical Technology Division undertakes the development of innovative new medical devices and systems from concept, through prototype manufacture, to new product introduction, often surmounting considerable technical challenges.


We undertake development projects across a wide range of categories including surgical tools, drug delivery devices, diagnostic instruments, and critical care.


We combine highly creative lateral thinking with excellent technical skills and broad industry experience to form powerful development teams. Our work ranges from complete product developments to providing consulting services for our clients on their technology, strategy or development processes. Every project is a unique technical challenge, and provides a rich learning experience.



Typical development project examples include:



  • Cloud-connected disease management product with crowd sourced data analytics

  • Point of care diagnostic instrument with sample handling, optics and microfluidics

  • Embedded systems for remote patient monitoring applications

  • Wireless pacemaker implant, including ASIC development

  • Novel surgical tool involving machine vision, automation, and complex UI

item.title: Full Stack Software Engineer (Angular, Node.JS, Microservices) at Careerbuilder (Norcross, GA)
item.description:
Full Stack Software Engineer (Angular, Node.JS, Microservices)


The strength of our solutions and brand combined with your expertise empower us to literally change peoples’ lives

Who We Are:


This is an exciting time at CareerBuilder as we continue the rapid growth of our global HR Software as a Service operation. Fueled by technology that is years ahead of the competition, we’re doing something the industry has never seen before: unifying the recruiter experience in one pre-hire platform that is always on, is data-driven and is easy to use. You’ll see us expand into more markets with innovative products and services that are changing the way companies recruit new talent around the world. As a Software Engineer at CareerBuilder, you’ll have the opportunity to do something extraordinary. Our employees are what drive our success and are at the very core of our identity.


Who You Are:


Are you a Full-Stack Software Engineer with a passion for making experiences that delight your users? Are you an expert in JavaScript, Cloud Computing, Web Services, and full-stack development with a strong desire to continually learn new technologies including Node.JS, Angular, and the like? Can you code effectively despite the threat of flying Nerf darts whizzing past your head and frequent beer runs?


As a member of the Apply Experience Team, you will have the opportunity to work on Careerbuilder’s core technology, the application path. The team has been tasked with building Careerbuilder’s next generation apply experience.


To achieve this experience we’re leveraging cutting-edge technologies, platforms, and concepts like Node.JS, Angular, Javascript, SQL/NoSQL, CSS 3, HTML 5, Microservices, and .NET.


If you’re looking for experience in a multi-language shop, working with teams across the globe, working on a mission critical product then look no further!

A Day in the Life...


* We follow Scrum and adhere to truly Lean/Agile Software development principles
* Bring your code to life using your choice of a MacBook Pro, Air, or a Windows laptop if you prefer
* Our coding philosophies align with SOLID principles and Clean Code embodies our culture
* We work in a highly collaborative merit-based environment where everyone is encouraged to share their ideas

item.title: DevOps/Ruby Engineer at Stitch Fix (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
About the Team


Stitch Fix has an extensive internal platform for managing our business, from inventory management to warehouse logistics to our own Personal Styling platform, each serving thousands of internal users who run the business every day.  Our public-facing infrastructure is growing as well, helping millions of our customers be their best selves.  It’s all tied together with an array of user-facing applications and back-end services.


We’re ops savvy, but not ops-focused. While we are currently hosting our Rails apps on Heroku and leveraging their add-on ecosystem, we are only married to what works, and are constantly re-evaluating our technical infrastructure.  We aren’t afraid of change if that helps us deliver faster, better, and more reliable solutions to our business partners and customers.


This is where you come in. Stitch Fix needs a Ruby and Rails developer with a keen interest in development tools, technical operations and “developer happiness”.  We have a lot of applications, services, and infrastructure, and we need someone who can be dedicated to make sure it’s meeting the needs of the development team.


About the Role


You’d be walking into a welcoming and diverse environment that is built around partnership, integrity, feedback, responsibility, and innovation. We have over 20 Rails apps and services, hosted on Heroku, and deployed with a high degree of consistency. Our mature engineering team is truly partners to those that run Stitch Fix by providing efficiency & effectiveness with the tools we develop.


You’re excited about this opportunity because you will...



  • Make application development and deployment easier for the engineering team

  • Help us solve thorny problems around performance and fault-tolerance

  • Build tools and systems to manage security

  • Make sure we’re up-to-date on the best practices of our service providers (Heroku, AWS, etc.)

  • Investigate new tools & technologies our team can use to solve problems for the business

item.title: Systems Engineer at Amazon (Dublin, Ireland)
item.description:
Want to work on the cutting edge of cloud computing services at massive scale?



Amazon Web Services (AWS) is looking for Systems Engineers for the AWS Database Services team in Dublin, Ireland. This team is working in the heart of AWS managing rapid growth services such as Redshift Amazon is building some of the largest distributed systems in the world and we need smart people to help plan and put together the pieces.



The Systems Engineers within our team are instrumental in creating, automating, deploying, operating and scaling a massive always-on distributed system. We are seeking passionate engineers with strong Linux systems engineering skills who pro-actively automate away problems and constantly look to improve quality of service.



The ideal candidate will have thrived in operating complex systems, diagnosing and resolving the hardest corner case problems. You are fast on your feet and excited by the challenge of working in a hyper-growth environment where priorities shift quickly. In addition to your linux systems skills you will be very comfortable with networking & database technologies. You must be able to triage situations quickly and work equally well with internal engineers and external customers to bring about swift problem resolution in ways that persist and are reusable for multiple services.



You will be expected to deliver on these kinds of things in the first six to twelve months on the job:



Automate away recurring problems:

· Develop or further existing application and system management tools and processes that reduce manual efforts

· Design and participate in the development and delivery of operability-related features such as system health monitoring, diagnostics, repair, and other self-healing automation.

· Monitor the health of the fleet, automating system health, maintenance tasks, and reporting systems as needed.



Manage capacity in the face of massive growth:

· Maintain fleet inventory management, including producing, maintaining, and evolving capacity plans for various components.

· Adapt and improve operations management systems and processes to accommodate rapid and increasing growth in systems and traffic.

· Define and/or refine hardware requirements and selected designs.

· Participate in the design and execution of production acceptance tests and new hardware evaluations.

· BS Computer Science or other technical degree and/or related experience

· 5+ years of solid *NIX system administration experience

· Scripting skills in one or more of Perl, Python, Ruby, Bash or Java.



· Experience running and maintaining a 24x7 Internet-oriented production environment, preferably across multiple data centers, involving (preferably) at least hundreds of machines.

· Automation or monitoring framework experience, deployment or development

· Demonstrable expertise around specifying, designing, and/or implementing system health, performance monitoring tools, and software management tools for 24x7 environments.

· Experience with very large distributed systems such as large scale distributed database systems, storage farms, and/or horizontally scaled request processing fleets

· Experience with hardware load balancer administration, network optimization, or other related and demonstrable TCP-level experience

· A solid grasp of networking fundamentals, preferably including hands-on experience with load balancers, switches, routers, etc.



*LI-JF1

item.title: SENIOR PRODUCTION SOFTWARE QA ENGINEER at Body Labs (New York, NY)
item.description:
DESCRIPTION


Body Labs makes the world's most sophisticated data-driven digital model of human shape and pose. We have extensive capabilities, tools, analytics and know-how in the areas of modeling specific individuals (such as fit models) or sub-populations (eg. targeted consumers, athletes, plus-sizes, etc.). We work closely with apparel and equipment companies to help them better understand and visualize their target consumers’ body shapes and motions, and improve their design-to-manufacturing workflow. Our current clients include large sports apparel manufacturers and the US Army.


Our forward product focus is on BodyKit, a set of APIs and embeddable components that can be used by any developer or company to easily build apps or tools that interact with the human body. With BodyKit we’ll power the next generation of custom clothing websites, fitness tracking apps, virtual reality experiences, and more.


Body Labs is looking for a highly-skilled and driven Production QA Engineer. We need someone who can design and implement testing, validate a large scale application deployment to production servers. You will be part of our internal product/engineering team, requiring teamwork, focus, and drive.


RESPONSIBILITIES


Design and implement testing infrastructures by writing code to validate a large scale application deployment, partner with software developers to create/code test tools and implement automation concurrent with product development. In this role, you will need to possess a broad view of the entire product deployment to ensure appropriate/efficient re-use of existing libraries, methods, classes, etc. in adequate automation tools and infrastructures. In addition, you will have following responsibilities:



  • Participate in software code/design/requirements review processes to assist with deciding what unit tests to write and ensure testability of new code.

  • Collaborate with Software Development team to maintain consistency and testability of our software.

  • Work with developers on all aspects of quality in software, database, migration and maintenance routines.

  • Collaborate with Software Development team in all aspects of the development lifecycle from early design feedback,

  • functional automation, reliability, stress, performance, integration testing, through to supporting production issues.

  • Create, maintain, and execute test plans and test cases. Analyze and report results, track defects, and participate in day-to-day QA support activities.

item.title: Vice President Software Development at Kliger-Weiss Infosystems, Inc. (Greenvale, NY)
item.description:
POSITION MISSION:


KWI continues to be the true leader in enterprise-class cloud platforms for end-to-end retail solutions. We support all of our retailers on a single platform, providing economies of scale to all.  As the leading cloud based retail provider, KWI represents thousands of stores with millions of transactions across 100 plus retailers – by far the largest solution provider of POS in specialty retail. 


The Vice President of Software Development is responsible for leading the design, development and delivery of innovative cloud-based enterprise solutions to meet evolving business, market and customer needs. The Vice President of Software Development will be accountable for establishing a clear strategic vision, building process excellence, building organizational capability, driving execution and measuring and improving performance to deliver market-leading quality. The Vice President of Software Development will oversee the entire Software Development Life Cycle process. This includes leading the Architecture, Development, Quality, Software Development Support and Store Systems teams. This position will also lead offshore development initiatives and interface with clients and vendors.



JOB FUNCTIONS:



  • Build and lead high performance teams sharing common vision and goals, adapting quickly to challenges and changing business environments.

  • Ensure delivery of software products on time with first-time quality.

  • Establish world class software teams: hire, train, and mentor talent that meet our core values.

  • Define, deploy, and drive sustainable and repeatable process improvements through the entire software development lifecycle.

  • Tailor and implement software development methodologies, best practices, and standard work to achieve the highest product quality while continuously improving performance, productivity and execution of the software organization.

  • Define and champion leading software technologies to improve the efficiency, quality, and ease of use of our products and cloud-based solutions.

  • Define and measure Key Performance Indicators (KPI) and drive corrective actions throughout the entire software department based on real data and results.

  • Manage and facilitate multiple development teams both local and remote to ensure software development efforts meet quality objectives and launch targets while promoting cross-functional teamwork.

  • Identify both strategic opportunities and potential threats associated with emerging technologies, and execute software development plans that ensure our cloud-based solution remains best of breed.

  • Prioritize, direct and appraise the activities of development managers.

  • Determine, justify and obtain approval for project resources and prioritize and manage resource allocation based on changing business priorities.

  • Manage morale of software development organization. Create and communicate employee performance evaluations and development plans. Ensure consistency in all compensation actions for organization.

item.title: Lead Systems Developer at Tennessee Housing Development Agency (Nashville, TN)
item.description:
LEAD SYSTEMS DEVELOPER



APPLICATION DEADLINE IS SUNDAY, SEPTEMBER 27, 2015 AT 11:59 P.M.



Division: Information Technology


Reports to: Director of Information Technology 


Location: Nashville, TN


Full-time/Part-time: Full-time


Salary Grade: 43


Monthly Salary Range Minimum: $5,984


FLSA Classification: Exempt (03)


Note: eligible for telecommuting up to two days a week depending on workload and current projects



Critical features of this job are described under the headings below. They may be subject to change due to changes in our business processes or other business-related reasons.



POSITION SUMMARY:  Performs the role of Lead Developer on all programming projects, including the establishment, communication and enforcement of coding standards, reviewing the work of team members, and performing key, advanced code development where necessary to ensure consistent delivery of high-quality services and products to THDA staff.



ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES


Essential duties and responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned.



  • Trains and coaches all developer positions, developing staff skills and encouraging growth and development; makes assignments and monitors work progress.



  • Performs the role of Lead Developer on all programming projects, including the communication and enforcement of coding standards, reviewing the work of team members, and performing key, advanced code development where necessary.

  • Develops and enforces all programming procedures and standards with the oversight of the Director of Information Technology; uses industry best practices surrounding the Agile System Development Life Cycle (SDLC) methodology.

  • Exercises a knowledge of project management and software development techniques and works closely with Project Manager to complete the requirements of software applications; examines project deliverables in a timely manner for adherence to organization standards to ensure that user and system requirements are met.

  • May conduct reviews with users of preliminary system design products and plans; reviews program design to ensure compatibility with needs and business requirements.

  • May investigate the availability of application software packages that will accomplish proposed system or program goals, researching and evaluating similar systems and participating in vendor demos to determine if existing software may meet user requirements.

  • Creates database objects, user interface code, business logic, reports, Structured Query Language (SQL) scripts and stored procedures, and other code required to implement systems; creates, defines, and implements application frameworks.

  • Resolves problems encountered in the use of THDA-developed applications, which can include working with other Information Technology staff; de-bugs computer programs selecting approriate application development languages and troubleshooting tools.

  • Maintains technical knowledge of software development techniques, investigating new tools and utilities for software development as necessary.

item.title: IT Application Developer at Provider Resources Inc. (Erie, PA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Position Description: IT Application Developer


Under the supervision of the Application Development Lead, the Application Developer is responsible for creating web-based and stand-alone software applications to support Provider Resources, Inc. (PRI) business objectives and contractual obligations. Primary responsibilities will be using Microsoft developer technologies (primarily .NET and C#) in creating new applications and modifying existing applications. PRI requires the Application Developer to work with other developer-related applications such as Microsoft SQL Server, Microsoft SQL Server Reporting Services, and Microsoft Internet Information Services (IIS). Primary qualities for this position are problem solving skills, ability to independently find solutions to complex issues, attention to producing quality software, and willingness to work off-hours when necessary. This position requires that the candidate undergo an extensive background check prior to being offered full time employment. The developer must be willing to work with sensitive data and follow all the rules and guidelines applicable.


 Responsibilities



  • Understand and represent PRI’s mission, vision and values to all internal and external customers.

  • Engage clients in appropriate communication and interpersonal skills that manages client expectations and builds a collaborative relationship with the client.

  • Interact with government and private sector clients, partners, and PRI staff in a professional and accountable manner, and as a representative of PRI management.

  • Writing software requirements documentation using Microsoft Word and other applications as appropriate.

  • Creating detailed software design documentation using Microsoft Visio, Microsoft Word, and other applications as appropriate.

  • Create SQL scripts, stored procedures, and user functions in T-SQL for Microsoft SQL Server.

  • Create and deploy reports for Microsoft Reporting Services.

  • Creating and modifying web form based web applications in C# and ASP .NET and deploying these applications to new and existing sites.

  • Prioritize and work multiple tasks across multiple projects or work efforts.

  • Follow change control process outlined in PRI IT Manual to ensure integrity of the production environment and delivery of quality products.

  • Ability to isolate, replicate, and verify defect fixes.

  • Ability to communicate clearly (written and verbal) to include all forms of documentation as well as updating management regarding deliverable timeline changes.

  • Ensure requirements are understood and meet with the appropriate personnel as needed to completely develop-to and meet requirements.

  • Communicate with management regarding problems – especially those that impact deliverable timelines.

  • Identify any potential quality issues per defined process and escalate potential quality issues.

  • Coordinate with other developers, the test team staff, and program management team staff as necessary to ensure a quality product is produced in a timely fashion.

  • Perform other duties as assigned.

item.title: Seeking Front-End SW Engr To Help Us Create Experiences For The Digital Consumer at Sling Media (Foster City, CA)
item.description:
Sling Media seeks a Sr. Front-End Software Engineer who will be tasked with creating rich user experiences on core components of the streaming media and viewing platform.   Candidates should be able to provide technical expertise and logically thought out solutions to complex web applications that utilize many moving pieces.  


This individual must be a self-starter and task oriented as they will be working closely with a geographically diverse team.  This opportunity requires development of best practices through experience and research.

item.title: Cloud Infrastructure Engineer at Mendix (Rotterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
At this moment we are looking for very smart and fun new Cloud Infrastructure Engineers. Our Cloud team develops, deploys and maintains the global Mendix Cloud. With state-of-the art technologies and tools we build reliable and scalable systems so our customers can get their applications in production faster than ever before. 


You will work on:



  • Our world-wide Mendix Cloud that enables our customers to deploy and run their applications with one click

  • Cloud Foundry and our +open sourced+ Cloud Foundry service brokers that integrate with various AWS products (EC2, ECS, S3, RDS, Route53, ElastiCache, etc.)

  • Designing, building, shipping and maintaining Distributed Systems and Micro Services

  • Building a scalable, reliable and highly available platform on top of unreliable infrastructure

  • Our diverse software stack, containing code in Java (Spring Boot, ), Python, Go, Lua, Swagger and if you have good arguments to use it, your favorite language

  • A (clicky) keyboard of your choice

  • Everything from the front-end (a Mendix app) to low-level systems

  • Advanced configuration of NGINX, PostgreSQL and the JVM

  • Assuring all systems are always available by also being responsible for running them in production, we are a DevOps team with 3rd line on-call support duty


We should have a chat if you:



  • Have a BSc./MSc./PhD in Computer Science or related technical field

  • Have strong skills in software development and scripting paired with strong knowledge in systems and networking

  • Run *nix on your workstation

  • Are fluent in English

  • Are passionate about technology. Show us your hobby projects!

  • Have a positive, result driven, entrepreneurial spirit

  • Are proficient with Java, Python, C-sharp or other relevant modern languages. We're shifting more towards statically typed languages

  • Have experience with cloud development and technologies, especially AWS and Cloud Foundry

  • Have a deep understanding of distributed systems and their specific failure scenarios

item.title: Software Development Manager - Global eCommerce Firm at Quidsi (via Andiamo) (Jersey City, NJ)
item.description:
Our Client is a parent-centric retail technology company. They deliver delightful experiences, products, and expertise by offering a curated selection of products, lightning-fast delivery, incredible customer service, and an easy-to-navigate shopping experience.



Their sites are host to millions of daily visitors and our warehouses are run by hundreds of autonomous Kiva robots. Their entire operation from our websites/apps, to our fulfillment centers and customer care center is focused on creating an enjoyable end-to-end customer experience. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright and driven people who are energized by "what if." If you'd like to help us build the place where people can find and buy anything online, come and innovate with us!

We are seeking a Software Development Manager to lead technical direction and develop solutions to advance the goals of the business. You'll have technical ownership of a functional area and manage a team of talented engineers. This is truly unique career opportunity for a technology leader who likes to invent as well as dive deep. The ideal hire is a hands-on team leader who has previous experience overseeing a broad range of platform integrations, improvements and some customer-facing features. Their SDMs operate at all levels of the technology stack, supporting a broad set of clients and collaborating with a wide range of internal and external service providers.

Key Responsibilities:



  • Guide development teams and be responsible for overall systems development life cycle

  • Translate functional and technical requirements into detailed project plans and schedules

  • Manage the day-to-day activities of the engineering team by defining, implementing and maintaining a coherent, progressive development strategy for our product line

  • Manage process and quality of service improvements, planning, project management of software deliverables within the team, and management of resources across teams

  • Maintain current technical knowledge to support rapidly changing technology

  • Possess architectural depth to steer teams toward highly performing systems

  • Communicate effectively with your team and with stakeholders at all levels of the company

  • Create and execute appropriate quality plans, project plans, test strategies and processes for development activities in concert with business and project management effort

  • Build an effective development organization by driving the recruiting and hiring of senior level engineers, developing and managing the group, and conducting performance reviews of team members

  • Delivery of quality applications on-time and on-budget


Qualifications:



  • BS in Computer Science or related discipline

  • 5+ years of software development experience in Java or C++ and object oriented design

  • Minimum of 3 years leading, mentoring, and developing a team of technical talent


Preferred Qualifications:



  • Results oriented person with a delivery focus and demonstrated ability of achieving stretch goals in a highly innovative and fast paced environment

  • Demonstrated ability to make data-driven decisions and manage complex initiatives from conception to launch

  • Experience building and operating highly available, highly scalable, high-volume systems

  • Working experience with UNIX/Linux and service oriented architectures

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills

  • Ability to work well with people and be both highly motivated and motivating

  • Strong analytical skills with excellent problem solving abilities

item.title: Software Developer (Java) Vienna at Global Blue (Vienna, Austria)
item.description:
OVERVIEW


You have the passion to generate and write clean code? In this position, you will be responsible for the development and support of Java and/or .NET/C# projects and applications with highest quality and commitment through the entire Software Development Lifecycle. This highly responsible role involves offering state of the art technology solutions that will drive forward Global Blue’s Tax Free Shopping and Currency Choice product offerings. item.title: Music Information Retrieval/Machine Learning for Connected Audio at Bose at Bose Corporation (Boston, MA)
item.description:
About The Team:

The Algorithms & Cloud Experiences group is a small interdisciplinary team that builds compelling cloud applications for connected Bose products. We participate in the full product/feature lifecycle: imagining new customer-facing features, designing compelling user interfaces, constructing appropriate software architecture and infrastructure, implementing compelling proofs of concept, and scaling our solutions to serve millions of users. Join us to invent and build exceptional experiences, beginning by helping millions of customers rediscover their love of music.

Job Description:

We are seeking a Music Information Retrieval Specialist to expand our core team. In this role, you will be responsible for the algorithms that underlie and enable the next generation of music experiences. You will apply your algorithmic expertise, your willingness to write code to explore problems, and your ability to implement solutions from scratch, all while solving challenging real-world problems. The ideal candidate will have experience with music service APIs, DSP, Machine Learning, and recommender systems (e.g., collaborative filtering and content-based solutions). Example problem spaces include contextual music recommendations, music similarity, playlist generation, and tempo/intensity estimation, but those are just to get you started.

Objectives:

• Within the first month, gain a broad understanding of the algorithms used in our existing products and prototypes. Gain familiarity with our existing data sets.

• Within the first three months, develop a fleshed out plan for implementing and testing the first versions of a handful of (already imagined) feature concepts. Demonstrate initial proof of concept of at least one new feature. In collaboration with other team members, outline a plan for building a scalable implementation.

• At the end of the first six months, demonstrate end-to-end proof of concept of at least one customer-facing feature. Be an active participant in the conception of new feature concepts.

Please take a few minutes to insert a cover letter when you apply! We truly value candidates who take a few extra minutes to give us a clear understanding of what makes you 'tick'. Tell us whatever you think is most important. If you're not sure how to start, here are some ideas:

• What technologies would you most like to use and/or learn about at Bose?

• What are the 3 most important things you're looking for in a career at any company?

• Tell us something about you to help us understand why you are unique.

item.title: Software Engineer CB1 Integrations at Careerbuilder (Norcross, GA)
item.description:
Software Engineer – CB1 Integrations


The strength of our solutions and brand combined with your expertise empower us to literally change peoples’ lives!

Who We Are:


This is an exciting time at CareerBuilder as we continue the rapid growth of our global HR Software as a Service operation. Fueled by technology that is years ahead of the competition, we’re doing something the industry has never seen before: unifying the recruiter experience in one pre-hire platform that is always on, is data-driven and is easy to use. You’ll see us expand into more markets with innovative products and services that are changing the way companies recruit new talent around the world. As a Software Engineer at CareerBuilder, you’ll have the opportunity to do something extraordinary. Our employees are what drive our success and are at the very core of our identity.


Who You Are:


Are you a Software Engineer with a passion for developing scalable, anti-fragile solutions? Are you an expert in object oriented programming with a strong desire to continually learn new technologies including Go and Docker? Do you want to create next generation microservices? Do you want to work one a team that has the freedom to make their technology choices and manage their own microservices? Can you code effectively despite the threat of flying Nerf darts whizzing past your head?


As a member of the CB1 (CareerBuilder1 Team), you will have the opportunity to work on an exciting new initiative. The team has been tasked with fully integrating several disparate products within the CareerBuilder family of sites, and presenting a single cohesive experience to our users.


To achieve these goals, we are leveraging RESTful APIs and several different technologies and platforms including PHP, Node.js, Ruby, Go, and .NET. If you’re looking for experience in a multi-language shop, with teams across the globe, working on a mission critical product then look no further!


A Day in the Life…


* Help us pave the way to better serve our customers by integrating our suite of products into our future single sign-on platform
* We follow Scrum and adhere to truly Lean/Agile Software development principles
* Bring your code to life using your choice of a MacBook Pro, Air, or a Windows laptop if you prefer
* Our coding philosophies align with SOLID principles and Clean Code embodies our culture

item.title: Quality Assurance (QA) Engineer for a PROFIT500 Company at Microdea, Inc. (Richmond Hill, ON, Canada)
item.description:
The Gig:


QA engineers work closely with development engineers and play a critical role in all phases of development projects from requirements review to release. The successful applicant must possess a strong understanding of highly scalable enterprise level web based application testing and Client/Server application testing through all stages of the system development life cycle based primarily on a Windows platform. They must be able to identify current best practices for common UI design and functionality. Knowledge of SQL, relational database applications (database schemas and structure) are a must. Job tasks include, but are not limited to, translating test plans into automated test scripts, unit test cases and end-to-end workflow test scenarios. QA engineers are expected to have initiative and strong analytical skills and welcome the opportunity to take a role in applying effective quality management processes from early development phases to final release. The qualified individual will join a growing quality assurance group within a growing engineering organization.

item.title: Site Reliability Engineer / Software Engineer at trivago GmbH (Düsseldorf, Deutschland)
item.description:
Join our team and actively shape the technical future of the world’s largest online hotel search. Work with top-notch technologies in a unique work environment with exciting career perspectives. Enjoy the freedom to question established processes, broaden your horizon and develop new things to impress our 80 million users per month!

Due to trivago’s rapid growth our site traffic is now reaching around 3 billion requests per month. For this reason we are looking for an experienced Site Reliability Engineer to join our dynamic Software Engineering department and ensure a reliable, fault-tolerant production environment. We want all our users to experience trivago at its best, and you are the person who will make this happen. If you are a master of PHP, eager for a new challenge and looking for the freedom to experiment with new technologies then we look forward to hearing from you!


Your responsibilities:



  • Monitor applications in production (Price Search, Community, Hotel Manager etc.) and solve any issues or complications that arise, especially during peak traffic hours.

  • Build a fault-tolerant and scalable environment to support our rapidly growing business.

  • Research solutions for new projects, pitch pioneering concepts and build prototypes to drive trivago's technological infrastructure forward.

  • Design and build customized cutting edge tools by experimenting with new technologies.

  • Collaborate with stakeholders and ensure maximum productivity by guaranteeing a reliable production environment.

  • Share your technical know-how with the team and document your tests, solutions, concepts and approaches for future reference.

item.title: Principal Engineer at Getty Images (New York, NY)
item.description:
Getty Images is looking for a Principal Engineer who wants to lead one of the best engineering teams in the business as part of our Internal Platform team. We are a lean company, data-driven and committed to delivering real customer value. We are interested in finding someone who is smart, dedicated, a quick learner and raises the bar for our team. This role is focused on Scala, Akka, RabbitMq, ElasticSearch, AWS, CoreOS and various other technologies that we use. If you aren’t an expert in these technologies already we’ll help you get up to speed quickly. To learn more about our technology stack and our team’s work check out the following deck from a NYC tech talk:


https://speakerdeck.com/mhamrah/the-new-enterprise-rabbitmq-akka-and-aws-at-getty-images


Who You Are:


You love developing elegant solutions to complex problems. You follow the development community on twitter and are passionate about finding ways to improve quality, performance and delivery times. You have a great mix of technical and soft skills which allow you to excel in a highly collaborative, agile work environment. You are a passionate developer who has led in the design, quality, and testing of any development platforms built in Scala or Java. You make strides to learn new languages and tools and look for ways to incorporate them into the team. You are able to level up both senior and junior members of the team. You can partner with the PM organization helping build out visions for the software that you build.

item.title: Director of Eastern Region Solutions Engineering & Services at Puppet Labs (New York, NY) (allows remote)
item.description:
Department: Customer Success
Reports to: SVP of Customer Success       
Location: Anywhere, East Coast   

Enjoy leading technical, customer-facing teams?  Do you love IT automation software?  Excited about what Puppet is doing and want to be a part of it?

Puppet Labs is hiring a Director of Eastern Region Solutions Engineering & Services to help drive strategic direction for the department and set the daily operations for the Eastern Region, which is comprised of Solutions Engineers (pre-sales) and Professional Services Engineers (post-sales).  The Director will coach a growing team to ensure we are delivering outstanding services to Sales and our customers.  

In this role, you will both ensure we continue to support our Sales team and champion our customers needs and oversee PS engagements with customers as well as manage team members, milestones, and activities.  You will coordinate with peers and other departments, such as User Experience, Engineering, and Sales to collaborate on special initiatives and to formalize feedback and communication loops.  

You will work with the other Customer Success Directors to ensure best practices in pre and post-sales activities are implemented across the organization.  You will participate in the development of the services roadmap and represent the needs of customers.  Working with the Director of Partner Enablement you will ensure that the Eastern Region service and training partners are enabled to provide high-quality support through Puppet authorized partner programs.   

This position operates in a team-oriented environment.  As a result, you must build and maintain strong and effective working relationships internally with peers on the services management team, sales, marketing, business development and product marketing.  As a leader you must also ensure that your team creates and maintains effective working relationships with various internal and external teams.

Qualifications

  • A combination of  8 years management experience in building, leading and growing field-based pre-sales teams and professional services teams in an enterprise software or open source company.  Focus of experience should be on the pre-sales side.

  • Excellent leadership skills, with proven success in hiring, leading, engaging and motivating staff, as well as working effectively across departments.

  • Strong customer orientation with demonstrated experience in achieving a high level of customer satisfaction

  • Able to identify problems, resolve escalations (including collaborating with others when necessary), act decisively and show good judgment.  Able to gain sponsorship and consensus on key initiatives

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills; highly refined interpersonal skills; and high caliber presentation skills.   The ability to successfully translate product information to both technical and non-technical professionals at all levels of an organization is required.

  • Empathy with our customers and their problems through experience in a Unix/Linux systems administration or development role.

  • Strong industry knowledge (configuration management, data center management, and systems management domains)

  • Excellent time and project management skills

  • Experience in developing and launching service offerings;  generating and interpreting business and service delivery key metrics; and managing multi-department budgets

  • Ability to travel up to 35-50% nationally and internationally

  • BA or BS degree in computer science or a related field

Application Instructions

Please include a cover letter with your application describing why you are interested in working for Puppet Labs, and how you feel your experience fits the listed qualifications of the position.

Working for Puppet Labs

Our mission at Puppet Labs is to drive the cost of technology change to zero.  We make IT automation software for systems administrators, freeing them from repetitive work and fire-fighting so they can do more interesting and higher-value work for their organizations.  Our most important measure of success is their love for our products.

We're growing fast, but we're determined for everyone here to have a real impact on the company and our customers every day.  We're driven and restless.  We encourage creativity and collaboration.  By challenging each other, we foster continuous improvement.  We hire carefully for passion, self-motivation, intelligence, curiosity, and adaptability.

We offer excellent health benefits for employees and family, a flexible time-off policy (that we do insist you use), and a variety of methods to grow your skills and further your career.  We have employees all around the US, the UK, Sweden, Canada, the Czech Republic and Australia.  Our headquarters in downtown Portland, Oregon, is one block off Tom McCall Waterfront Park with views of Mt. Hood, Mt. St. Helens and the Willamette River.

Puppet powers thousands of companies, including Twitter, Yelp, Disney, Google, Citrix, eBay, NYSE, Cisco WebEx, Salesforce, Bank of America and PayPal.  Our investors include Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers, VMware, Google Ventures, Cisco, True Ventures, Radar Partners, and Emerson Street Partners.

Puppet Labs is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, ancestry, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class.

If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are limited in the ability or unable to access or use this online application process and need an alternative method for applying, you may contact 877-575-9775 for assistance.

item.title: Senior Software Developer at Fetch Rewards (Madison, WI)
item.description:
About Us


Our vision is to leverage technology to transform shopping into an engaging, rewarding, and


delightful experience. We're a vibrant team of innovators who have embarked on a journey


to reinvent how people shop. Our first stop: Grocery. Our technology platform, based


around a free smartphone app, ensures that users have the best shopping experience


possible. Over the last 18 months, Fetch Rewards has become one of the fastest growing


tech startups in Wisconsin.


Our offices are located in downtown Madison overlooking the iconic Capitol Square and


adjacent to dozens of restaurants and shops. We like to celebrate our victories, big and


small, and we’ve never been accused of taking ourselves too seriously.


As a small and agile team, we pride ourselves on the caliber of our work and the scope of


our ambition. We have two sayings that sum up the ethos of Fetch Rewards: Defeat the


Odds! and What’s next?


We're committed to working with innovative and passionate people. As a young company,


we need team players who can go above and beyond their individual responsibilities to help


the company build towards its vision. If the challenge of disrupting a stagnant industry


alongside a hard working and funseeking team, then read on!


Why this role is important to us


A senior services developer at Fetch Rewards is someone who can be handed a


challenging problem and design and develop an appropriate solution with little to no


assistance. This role will focus on building back-end services to integrate seamlessly


with our data warehouse, mobile platforms, and other systems. This will be a key


leadership position on the team providing guidance and technical direction with our


back-end services and systems.

item.title: Software Infrastructure Developer (C++) at Bloomberg LP (London, UK)
item.description:
We develop the core foundation on which Bloomberg developers build their applications - libraries that interface with a wide range of technologies, programmable real-time data-processing pipelines, deployment systems and development tools. We are technologists who live and breathe high-performance, well-factored, scalable, testable code which can react quickly to new business initiatives.

Our developers are valued as technical experts and go-to resources throughout the company. Our users, as well as our managers, are highly technical people. Within our group, all developers have responsibility for the full software development lifecycle, from requirements gathering through coding to deployment and maintenance.

More information on individual teams, technologies, and their products can be found below. You will have the ability to select the team you are interested in based on your preference or expertise.

Teams in Software Infrastructure:

Application Frameworks

UI Framework - We build and maintain an in-house real-time data-processing framework, which is used by over 3,000 developers to write high-quality, easy-to-use and efficient applications within the Bloomberg Terminal. We are responsible for extending the core libraries to support more varied, complex and scalable solutions, and enhancing the toolkit for application developers, such as adding tools for performance analysis, debugging, introspection and optimization.

Rapid Infrastructure - We produce the next generation of tools for enhancing developer productivity and the infrastructure behind the Bloomberg Terminal. We are responsible for creating software in C++ in both UNIX and Windows development environments. We work closely with other stakeholders to produce both the frameworks and tools used by all application developers to build and deploy their UI and applications.

Developer Experience

We are a team of technologists, engineers, evangelists and trainers charged with helping our developers deliver their best work. We are not afraid to make large investments to build our own tools when it will make us better able to outpace the competition. At the moment we work with Phabricator, Jenkins, DPKG, GitHub Enterprise, Coverity, Jira and anything that fills gaps and joins them together.

Market Data Distribution

API Technology - We are responsible for Bloomberg's data distribution infrastructure, which is the largest in the world, providing low-latency market-data and value added Bloomberg data via our open API (http://www.bloomberglabs.com/api/). We support scalable, distributed, high-performance software that provides mission-critical data delivery to all Bloomberg desktop customers and a large number of enterprise-level applications.

Market Data Systems - We build backend services and distribution infrastructure for Enterprise Solutions products such as, but not limited to, BPOD/B-PIPE (Bloomberg's consolidated real-time and reference data feed) and the rapidly expanding Event Driven Trading Feed (EDTF) business.

Systems Infrastructure

We build low-level UNIX infrastructure that is critical to Bloomberg's systems. Our areas of responsibility include: high volume, low latency realtime data distribution; enterprise wide software deployment systems; FIX connectivity; and PKI security services. As the rest of Bloomberg R&D fundamentally relies on our products, we have high standards for correctness, performance and scalability. We are a highly collaborative team who are passionate about building reliable systems to solve real world problems.

Ticker Plant

We develop real-time software for our high-profile system which sits at the core of the Bloomberg infrastructure. We process market data from around the world, driving the majority of downstream Bloomberg applications. We address the market demand for low-latency solutions by providing innovative software powered by the most comprehensive, timely and accurate financial data in the world. We work closely with multiple businesses and sales groups to design and develop our applications to satisfy ever-growing customer demands.

item.title: Data Architect at Blackbaud (Emeryville, CA)
item.description:
Build a great career. Help the people that change the world.


Where else can you work alongside talented people, develop a rewarding career and create impactful tools for some of the world’s most successful and socially responsible nonprofits? It's not something you find every day. But we have it all: a growing, fast-paced software business, an environment where you can thrive professionally and the everyday reward of knowing that you’re part of a community that’s enabling meaningful change and we are immensely proud that our expertise is helping our 29,000+ customers accomplish their missions. They serve as a constant source of inspiration to us, and give purpose to our work.


Description:


We’ve got tons of data; you’ve got the skills make it useful. As a Data Architect on our Shared Services team, you will use your experience architecting, designing large-scale systems using Big Data technologies (e.g. BigTable, Hadoop, Cassandra) to help us design and build a highly reliable and highly scalable data platform to help us manage, analyze and productize vast amounts of non-profit data. The new platform will serve as the foundation both for a suite of new data services that enable our clients to deliver on their missions with increased efficiency and effectiveness, as well as for several existing data systems that we will be refactoring.


We work in small, close-knit agile teams. Our goal is to maintain an atmosphere that balances tough projects while still having fun. In this role, you’ll have the opportunity to:



  • Work in a progressive, team-oriented, growth-driven environment where innovation is king

  • Nurture, grow or change the direction of your career map – we see the value in exploratory andconventional goals

  • Solve challenging problems with like minds to make the solutions a reality


Responsibilities:



  • Lead architecture/design, technology selection and implementation of a data platform over Big Data technologies

  • Drive innovation by exploring, investigating, recommending, benchmarking and implementing data-centric technologies for the platform

  • Contribute to the technical design efforts - ensuring the system design meets scalability andperformance requirements

  • Provide technical mentorship for junior engineers on new technologies and development techniques

  • Be the technical architect for our data platform.


About Us:



  • Modern office space with private balcony, comfortable seating and gas grill

  • Beautiful views of the Berkeley Marina and Golden Gate Bridge

  • Easily accessible by BART (via the free Emery-Go-Round shuttle), Amtrak and public transit

  • LEED-certified building (LEED-EB:O&M Silver rating)

  • Stocked kitchen (fresh fruit, cereal, snacks, drinks)

  • Monthly company-sponsored lunches/happy hour

  • Conveniently-located cafe in building’s lobby; 3-minute walk to Emeryville Public Market, popular food trucks and the shops/theatres at Bay Street Plaza

  • Onsite Gym

item.title: Cutting Edge Angular and c# Development | Big Data Software. at R6 Web Design (Loganholme, Australia)
item.description:
Along with friday afternoon bevs (coffees, milkshakes, chai lattes... or whatever you like..) we get together on a friday afternoon upstairs and battle out on Halo.  Bring your wits, your stamina, and get your game on.  Seriously though... R6 has a culture of work hard, play hard.  Get satisfaction from your work, and build lifelong friendships.


We build phenomenal websites, cutting edge applications for the self storage industry, and the motorsport industry.  Right from c# big data analysis programs, through to AngularJS Futuristic web applications.  No two days are the same at R6 - if you like to be challenged, and work on leading edge technologies, you'll love working at R6.


You'll be working on Big data desktop apps (c#) that are revolutionising a 100 billion dollar industry.  You'll also headline the development of cutting edge web applications for the motorsport industry.  Hours are flexible, and you'll get to design things how you want.  We'll set the task, and you figure out how to do it.

item.title: Software Engineer and Data Geek at SocialCops (New Delhi, India)
item.description:
We are hiring across our Engineering teams for our office in New Delhi, India, 


Front End Engineer


Our Front End software engineers will responsible for building the features that decision makers will see and interact with to make massive decisions affecting millions of people. As a front end engineer you will be part of an agile team which is iterating on the product on a weekly basis. You will specialize in building responsive and elegant web UI.


We're looking for engineers with a keen eye for design. We use JS frameworks including D3.js, Backbone.js ReactJS & Leaflet apart from HTML5 and CSS. 


Back End Engineer


Our backend engineering team is the backbone of product development at SocialCops. We know that the best backend engineers understand that there are different ways to solve the same problem and each method has it’s own trade offs, thus we’re on the lookout for someone who can think, weigh each trade-off and make the better decision. You are expected to work well in a team, have a passion for performance and optimization and at the same time have great knowledge of building a scalable product. You will be directly responsible for developing and testing APIs. You own the product development at SocialCops and will be required to think on your feet to make quick tweaks to the product that will make the lives of our users incrementally better. You are expected to have extensive knowledge of best engineering practices.



We’re looking for people with a working knowledge of OAuth, Microservices architecture, Version Control Systems, how CDNs work, HTTP request lifecycle across various web frameworks, basic DevOps with experience/expertise in Python, node.js, MVC frameworks, Document, Key-Value, Columnar Stores, Amazon Web Services etc.


Data Engineer


Our data engineering team is the core of the work we do at SocialCops and you’ll be responsible for fuelling its growth. As a data engineer, you will be responsible for building a fast, scalable and reliable architecture for the purpose of gathering, organizing, storing and setting up batch or real-time processing pipelines on top of it thus providing clean and organized information to scientists who analyze it to solve problems. Your work will also involve natural language processing, turning semi-structured, human-readable content into highly structured machine-readable databases and thus make sense out of it. You will be building search algorithms that make our data searchable by data point, indexing millions of data sets in the process. The aim is to build the first search engine for ‘developing world’ data. You are expected to have extensive knowledge of databases and best engineering practices.


We are looking for people with a working knowledge of Distributed file systems, Data Wrangling, Machine Learning, Natural Language Processing, API frameworks like express, hapi, with experience/expertise in Python, Pandas, Elasticsearch, NoSQL databases, node.js etc.


Android


Our Android engineers are building an application which works in the remotest and the most rugged parts of the world - on devices as cheap as USD 30. We build for the next billion - which means our average users can't speak english & have never used a mobile phone before. Just last month, the app was used to collect over 20 Million data points. Enough said =)

item.title: Software Developer at Word Machinery (Fayetteville, AR)
item.description:
A successful and expanding organization seeks an energetic and motivated developer to join our team of skilled technology professionals for a full time permanent position. This is an opportunity for a skilled, growth-focused developer to utilize his or her talents to enhance business efficiency. The position offers the opportunity to work in an always-exciting role rather than suffering through a grueling “sit-at-your-cubicle-and-code all day" environment. The successful candidate will be responsible for database administration, authoring/designing software applications, and supporting existing software.


Duties and Responsibilities include but not limited to:



  • Designing and implementing new data structures, writing stored procedures and functions

  • Identify database performance issues such as deadlocks or connectivity. Tune the database systems and scheduling of jobs for nightly maintenance.

  • Write ad-hoc queries/reports as requested by Management team

  • Developing and maintaining ERP software using VB.NET front end and SQL back end.

  • Participate in technical meetings, answer questions, and troubleshoot day-to-day issues related to data requirements and data quality.

  • Document, track, and communicate unresolved data problems and recommend solutions.

  • Ability to assess business needs and determine appropriate technical solutions.

  • Developing mobile software for iOS

item.title: Senior C++ Developer at Sisense (Tel Aviv-Yafo, Israel)
item.description:
We are Sisense. We disrupt the Business Intelligence market. Our product allows business users to analyze humongous amounts of data without being experts and without help from IT. How? By building on a set of unique and cutting edge technologies, wrapped up in a killer product. We are looking for talented C/C++ engineer to be part of our core technology team. 


As an engineer in Sisense, you will be part of the team developing the core of our Big Data Analytics Columnar Database, ElastiCube.
ElastiCube is an award winning database with an advanced query execution engine.


You will develop and improve advanced features/technologies including:



  • Big Data transformation engine (TB scale).

  • Multidimensional queries (advanced analytics)

  • Cache-oblivious algorithms.

  • Superscalar decompression.

  • In-chip vectorization.

  • Parallel I/O.

item.title: Data Scientist at Feedzai (Lisbon, Portugal)
item.description:
We are looking for data scientists with as much skill as passion and large amounts of both! Come and help us disrupt the hot hot market of digital payments and online fraud prevention!


You will be working in a cross-functional team where you will be able to tackle complex fraud detection problems and where your main responsibilities will be:



  • Work close with our product development team and with other R&D team members in thorny fraud detection problems.

  • Support your answers and findings with appropriate statistical techniques and methods.

  • Contribute to the team knowledge by keeping up with the state-of-the-art in machine learning applied to our domains.

  • Communicate findings within the organization, particularly the management, product and delivery teams.

  • Develop solution prototypes and help integrate them with the product.


What we offer:



  • Career growth and ninja skills over a set of emerging technologies and tools such as Spark, Scala, Hadoop, Cassandra, R, Weka, and more.

  • Independence to choose preferred tools and techniques to solve problems and minimize time-to-completion.

  • Become a member of an award-winning, amazing, driven, focused team which is disrupting the market.

  • Relaxed working environment in Lisbon, Europe’s Leading City Break Destination city.

item.title: Software Engineer, Distributed Data at BuzzFeed (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Company


BuzzFeed is the social news and entertainment company, providing the most shareable breaking news, original reporting, entertainment, and video across the social web to our global audience of more than 200M. BuzzFeed is also redefining online advertising with social, content-driven publishing technology.


BuzzFeed is headquartered in New York City, with additional offices in 16 cities in 10 countries across the world.


The Job


As a software engineer sitting with our Data Tribe, you’ll help build the next generation of data tools. The ideal candidate shares our belief that the right tools and data can empower our editors and producers to do amazing things they didn’t previously think possible. The overall mission of the team is helping the company learn how content works and performs no matter how it lives; you’ll be building flexible systems to support that. Because we produce content for a social web, you’ll build out integrations with external platforms to assist in data collection, build flexible systems to support all the different ways we can categorize/organize content, and develop and maintain tools for unifying and communicating data for audiences across the company.


You



  • have technical proficiency in Python or other high-level OO languages

  • have experience with external platforms APIs (Facebook, Twitter, YouTube)

  • are familiar with various DBs (mySQL, Redis, Mongo)

  • value reliability and simplicity over performance

  • value UX and craft elegant and intuitive interfaces

  • identify opportunities to automate and build tools to make your team’s lives easier


What you get in return



  • A competitive compensation package (including equity) and benefits that start on day one

  • A collaborative & close-knit team: our team is NYC-based and in the office because as great as technology is, there are few substitutes for in-person collaboration

  • Top of the line equipment and an office stocked with plentiful snacks, coffee, drinks and more

  • A company that takes its work seriously, while taking ourselves not-so-seriously

item.title: Analytics Platform Developer at nModal Solutions Inc. (Toronto, ON, Canada)
item.description:
We are looking for an outstanding Developer to help us build the next phase of our platform- someone who writes great code fast and wants to be involved in creating fantastic software and getting it to market quickly.  There aren't any layers of management here- you will be working directly with the founder and CEO, and will be a core part of the team.


Your mission is to build new connectors to state of art data APIs as well as enhance the nModal cloud data platform.  


You will get a chance to build at scale with the Azure platform, and integrate with technologies such as Tableau Software, Google BigQuery, Amazon Redshift and others. 


We work on a fast release schedule, whether it is to implement incremental enhancements or launching something new by desiging and building a minimum viable product and geting it into the hands of beta testers and customers quickly.


This is a contract position, 5 months to start, with the potential for a permanent position as a core member of the development team.

item.title: Report Developer/Product Analyst at Spoonflower (Durham, NC)
item.description:
If you haven’t heard yet, Spoonflower is an e-commerce-based business that makes it possible for individuals to design, print and sell their own fabric, wallpaper, or gift wrap.  Printed to order, no quantity is too small or too large. We digitally print all of our fabric at our  facility in Durham, North Carolina.  We love what we do.  Surface design aficionados, fabric lovers, internet geeks, DIYers, designers, sewists, and quilters call it home.



As a Report Developer/Product Analyst within our Product Development department, we will look to you to collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather, analyze and document reporting requirements to meet business needs.  The Report Developer is expected to translate business requirements into specifications that will be used to implement the required reports and dashboards, potentially created from multiple data sources.  Our reporting environment is a custom web application with Ruby on Rails, DataTables.net, Google Visualization, D3, and other components. If you have full stack development experience, but you favor writing complex SQL over all other disciplines in the stack, we are looking for you.


Job Responsibilities:



  • Write and understand complex SQL routines that perform well on large volumes of data

  • Use data mining, segmentation, and other analytical techniques to capture important trends

  • Demonstrate expertise in data extraction, transformation and loading (ETL) between similar and dissimilar systems using SQL Programming

  • Demonstrate expertise of data transformation between flat files, XML and relational system structures

  • Employ analytic skills to create hypotheses and share stories about what the data is telling us

item.title: Vice President of Engineering at Umbel (Austin, TX)
item.description:
Summary: 


We are a team of agile, boundary-pushing problem-solvers who love to invent and improve. The VP of Engineering will lead a group of passionate, talented engineers (approximately 15 engineers with plans to grow rapidly) that are building a customer data query and analysis SaaS platform. Our core technology—a distributed, decentralized, bitmap index—is unrivaled and capable of performing complex queries over 200x faster than alternative solutions. You will report directly to our CEO and work very closely with our Chief Data Scientist to build an industry leading SaaS platform capable of delivering insights to our clients. 


What You Must Do To Be Successful In This Position:



  • Manage, coach, and mentor a rapidly growing team of 15+ front end, back end, and integrations engineers

  • Successfully scale our team, which is set to more than double over the next 9 months

  • Lead our Engineering recruiting charge by acting as an evangelist and improving the hiring processes

  • Be a cultural leader for our Engineering team

  • Work with our Chief Data Scientist to achieve groundbreaking R&D and architectural improvements

  • Oversee and execute multiple projects across the entire stack while maintaining stability, quality, and scalability

  • Work closely with our Product team to manage and prioritize requirements, balancing short-term and long-term needs effectively

  • Hone our agile development methodologies and team throughput

  • Drive technical performance improvements

  • Be the voice of Engineering and communicate to the entire company

  • Be a leader in the company and a voice for key executive level decisions on behalf of Engineering

  • Willingness to roll up your sleeves and even commit code when necessary is a plus
