item.title: Scientific Software Developers at D. E. Shaw Research at D. E. Shaw Research (New York, NY)
item.description:
Extraordinarily gifted software developers are sought to join a New York–based interdisciplinary research group pursuing an ambitious, long-term project aimed in part at fundamentally transforming the process of drug discovery.  Among the group’s current research activities is the development of new algorithms and software for large-scale data analysis and simulation both on commodity clusters and on massively parallel special-purpose supercomputers of our group’s design.

Particularly relevant areas of expertise might include computational biology, Python and C/C++ programming, molecular dynamics, scientific visualization, computer graphics, full-stack web development, scientific workflow management, high performance data-parallel computing on multicore and GPU architectures, and the development of large-scale data management, cheminformatics, and/or analysis frameworks, but specific knowledge of any of these areas is less critical than exceptional intellectual ability and a demonstrated track record of achievement.

If you are interested in being part of a team of the world’s leading biologists, chemists, and computer scientists, please use the link below to submit your application material.  We are prepared to reward exceptionally well-qualified individuals with above-market compensation.

To submit an application, please use the link provided below: 
http://www.deshawresearch.com/recruit/jobs/Ads/StackOverflow/JrSP

D. E. Shaw Research is committed to building a diverse team. We offer an intellectually rigorous and stimulating work environment that is also supportive, flexible, and welcoming. We do not discriminate in employment matters on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, pregnancy, national origin, age, military service eligibility, veteran status, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, or any other protected class.

item.title: Principal Software Engineer, Big Data at Avigilon (Somerville, MA)
item.description:
Avigilon’s business intelligence group is seeking an experienced software developer to participate in the development of a platform to process data from thousands of security cameras and devices remotely with technologies relating to data mining and visualization, embedded systems, distributed systems, and integration with mobile applications.



The candidate must have experience in the following areas:



  • Architecture of cutting-edge cloud platform of services and APIs

  • Interfacing third-party services for machine learning, video and data analysis, and data visualization

  • Design of RESTful APIs with low-latency/real-time requirements

  • Ingestion, Processing and handling of large, remote, real-time telemetry and video data sets

  • Data warehousing

  • Collaboration with product teams to integrate devices with the platform


Our office is currently located on Middlesex Turnpike, Billerica but relocating to Assembly Row, Somerville in November.

item.title: Python Developer at Trimble Navigation (Westminster, CO)
item.description:
About Trimble Data


Trimble Data develops scalable, cloud-based geospatial systems. Our goal is to make geospatial processing simpler and faster for consumers by interfacing many varied geospatial applications into a cohesive whole.


Our primary system is the Trimble Data Marketplace, a storefront for geospatial data. The Marketplace enables customers to find, customize, and download data quickly and easily.



Python Developer


We are seeking a self-motivated and enthusiastic software engineer to join the Trimble Data Cloud Processing Development team. Python developers are responsible for developing and maintaining highly scalable geospatial processing systems that will handle petabytes of data.


As a member of the Trimble Data Cloud Processing Development team you will use a wide variety of technologies, such as Python, FME, and AWS to solve problems and have the opportunity to explore and use emerging technologies.


We are looking for intelligent, innovative, and driven developers. We will consider applicants with limited experience in the technologies listed below, however you must have strong Python skills.


Key Responsibilities




  • Software engineering with a healthy dose of performance engineering and DevOps.




  • Use Linux and Windows system administration knowledge to set up and maintain working cloud distributed systems.




  • Use BASH, BATCH, Python, C, C++ and other specialty languages to develop and maintain backend systems for Trimble Data.




  • Use AWS to manage and grow our cloud strategy.




  • Work within your team and with other teams to ensure the overall vision of the project is being fulfilled.

item.title: Software Infrastructure C++ Developer at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Software Infrastructure department develops the foundation on which Bloomberg developers build their applications - libraries that interface with a wide range of technologies, programmable real-time data processing pipelines, deployment systems and development tools. We are technologists who live and breathe high performance, well-factored, scalable, testable code that reacts quickly to new business initiatives.

Our developers are valued as technical experts and go-to resources throughout the company. Our users and managers are highly technical people. Within our group, all developers have responsibility for the full software development lifecycle, from requirements gathering and coding to deployment and maintenance.


>> More information on individual groups and their products can be found below. When you apply, you will have the ability to select your preferred group.


Ticker Plant

The Ticker Plant group is at the core of both the Bloomberg Professional Service and Enterprise Solutions products that process market data from around the world and drive the majority of downstream applications. The Ticker Plant system provides low latency processing of market data from around the world while servicing client queries from our cutting edge time series database. Our systems process billions of ticks a day and are highly fault tolerant and scalable. Our group researches and implements industry leading technologies such as high throughput time series database, low latency tick streams, and various efficient, robust and scalable components for Bloomberg's market data storage and distribution system.

Feeds Infrastructure

The Feeds Infrastructure group provides the platform that supports our feed handlers in processing market data from exchanges and contributors around the world. The platform consists of a high performance, reliable and scalable framework used to build and deploy these feed handlers and the host environment in which they run. The team provides solutions that can be reused across feed handlers to meet the market's quickly evolving demands. Our systems run 24/7 and require resiliency and seamless failover.

Feeds Infrastructure Applications

The Feeds Infrastructure Applications group builds an array of services used by feed handlers, Ticker Plant, the Enterprise product and terminal applications. The services facilitate the global distribution and processing of market data, system scalability and operational management of feeds. We solve some of the most critical feed and Ticker Plant software problems and provide the tools to manage these systems.

Data Distribution (API)

The Data Distribution group builds and maintains the largest global network in the world, spanning five continents. The infrastructure is built using state-of-the-art technologies to deliver low latency market data and news throughout the world via OpenAPI (www.openbloomberg.com/open-api). The group uses commodity software/hardware platforms to develop high performance C++ code and multithreading to achieve peak rates and optimize bandwidth and latency.

Application Framework

The Application Framework group builds the infrastructure and libraries used for developing applications at Bloomberg. This includes the application runtime environment, the UI toolkit exposed to developers, the client-side rendering engine and integration with real-time data. We are responsible for advancing the next generation of UI technology and giving our applications the advantages of the latest paradigms and features. Our group builds the tools for profiling and debugging applications and a custom IDE for developing them.

item.title: Sales and Support Engineer at Factual (Los Angeles, CA)
item.description:
Factual is looking for a scrappy engineer to help our customers’ engineering teams understand, integrate with, deploy, debug, and troubleshoot our software and APIs.  You have been the problem solver of last resort, capable of diagnosing and resolving issues in production environments, and finding and implementing workarounds when necessary. You have described the implementation and behavior of software systems to people inside and outside of your organization, in-person, over the phone, and through IM and email. You’ve explained your systems to people of varying degrees of technical aptitude, ranging from “not technical at all,” to your coworker engineers who are working on the project every day.


This job is ideal for someone who likes to spend part of the day talking to people, part doing forensic work sifting through log files and telemetry data, part hacking together simple demos and documentation that helps customers understand complex software.

item.title: Database Developer at V12 Group (Red Bank, NJ)
item.description:
V12 Group has been providing customers, clients, and users of Launchpad, our marketing cloud, with leading technology, quality data, and an unparalleled customer experience. 


The Database Developer will be accountable for developing and maintaining the relational databases of the V12 Group’s suite of SaaS applications.


Responsibilities


• Design, develop and manage relational databases.
• Programming using SQL and SQL/RDBMS utilities.
• Work closely with Product Managers and Reporting Team for understanding the functional and system requirements
• Work closely with Software Engineers to ensure data integrity and overall system quality.
• Proactively monitor, troubleshoot and resolve database performance issues.
• Participate in testing process through unit testing and bug fixes.
• All other duties as assigned

item.title: Database Administrator at V12 Group (Red Bank, NJ)
item.description:
V12 Group has been providing customers, clients, and users of Launchpad, our marketing cloud, with leading technology, quality data, and an unparalleled customer experience. 


The Database Admin/Engineer will be accountable for developing and maintaining the rapidly growing relational database infrastructure for the V12 Group's suite of cloud-based applications.


Responsibilities



  • Design, develop, and manage relational databases

  • Programming using SQL and SQL/RDBMS utilities

  • Work closely with Product Managers and Reporting Team for understanding the functional and system requirements

  • Work closely with Software Engineers to ensure data integrity and overall system quality

  • Proactively monitor, troubleshoot and resolve database performance and develop solutions

  • Oversee database backup and recovery

  • Capacity monitoring and planning

  • Participate in testing process through unit testing and bug fixes.

  • Maintaining data infrastructure documentation

item.title: Software Engineer - Data Platform at Loggly. (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Loggly is looking for a high-energy development engineer who is eager to design and deliver the innovative product sets that will drive the next phase of our growth.


Responsibilities:


Loggly‘s development team is responsible for designing and delivering the world’s most popular cloud-based log management solution. As a key engineer on this team, you will collaborate with engineers, product management, and the operations team to develop innovative features on top of our big data stack. You will have full lifecycle responsibilities for key product functionality, spanning design and development of features.


You will be expected to create robust, scalable, multi-threaded, and distributed systems that operate 24x7x365. This is an exciting opportunity to work in a highly innovative environment with new technologies as we continue to evolve our products and extend our leading market position. Our culture is fast-paced, performance-oriented, open and collegial, and lots of fun. This is a full-time position based in San Francisco, CA.

item.title: Software Engineer - Functional Programming - Multiple Positions & Levels at NAVIS (Bend, OR)
item.description:
NAVIS is looking for a creative, motivated Software Engineer to join us as a critical member of our Engineering Team in beautiful Bend, Oregon.  


NAVIS is seeking highly-competent "development athletes" to join our team, rather than position players.  This means you know how to develop rich code, regardless of the tools you use - you are very capable and easily learn new technologies.  We are re-architecting many of our products from the UI through the database, and we are exploring (and have already implemented) new technologies to add to our existing technology ecosystem, including the use of functional programming with Clojure / ClojureScript. The primary focus of this position is coding new, creative, operational software that enhances our products. 


It’s an exciting time to be at NAVIS!


This developer will design, develop, optimize and test client/server and web applications in an Agile / SCRUM setting primarily based on Open Source technologies. As part of the Engineering Team, you will collaborate closely with the Chief Technology Officer (CTO), Chief Innovation Officer (CIO), Technical Team Leads and other Product Team members, to design exceptional software / product solutions to meet customer needs.


If NEW software development is appealing, this position could be a great fit! The Engineering Team has multiple projects that often start at the concept stage and develops new products and/or product features from scratch. Our products are constantly evolving with our client needs - we are not simply maintaining existing products.


This is a full SDLC development position. The candidate must be willing to take on all aspects of the development process, and be ready to support applications in production environments. He/she may be asked to test code sets, document software, and implement products and related solutions. Strong knowledge of design patterns and software development best practices must be shown at all times. A high degree of creativity and motivation is required of the successful candidate, who is expected to operate with limited direct supervision. This developer needs to have a willingness to do whatever it takes to make the products and the company successful.


WHY WOULD YOU WANT TO WORK FOR NAVIS?



  • NAVIS was a finalist in the 2015 Oregon Tech Awards Technology Company of the Year - http://www.navisblog.com/navis-finalist-in-the-15-oregon-tech-awards-technology-company-of-the-year-growth/ 

  • NAVIS is growing fast due to high market demand for our products. Our products are successful because they truly help our clients succeed and grow. We demonstrate our value to our clients every single day.

  • We are building new technologies and enhancing existing ones - we are NOT standing still. We are re-architecting our products from the UI through the database. This means we need strong, creative, intelligent developers with great ideas that love to build awesome software products.

  • Our technology is blossoming and we will be utilizing some of the latest and greatest technologies on the market today.

  • The Oregonian has listed NAVIS as a "Top Place to Work in Oregon" in 2012, 2013, and 2014. We live the core values listed below - they are not window dressing.

  • Strong technical leadership in a team-based atmosphere

  • Your work matters; your impact will be visible

  • Local, established Oregon-founded and based company

  • Healthy financial foundation

  • We give generously to local charities and offer opportunities to participate to directly help those in need

  • Competitive base salaries with a 10% annual bonus target and a full benefits package, including matching 401(k)

  • You get to LIVE and WORK in Central Oregon - what could be better than that?


At NAVIS, we live our Core Values:



  • Golden Rule: Treat others as you would want to be treated

  • Integrity: A person of your word, highly trusted

  • Innovation: Open and involved in creating or executing on "new"

  • Passion: Love the TEAM, the clients and the work we do

  • Attitude: Consistently display a positive, can-do attitude


LOCATION OF THIS POSITION:


To foster a highly-collaborative team environment, this position will be located in beautiful Bend, Oregon.


ABOUT BEND, OREGON:


Bend, the county seat of Deschutes County, covers 32 square miles. To the east is high desert vegetation and to the west, Bend is surrounded by U.S. Forest Service land. The city is noted for its scenic setting, mild climate, year-round recreation opportunities and growing economy. At an elevation of 3,625 feet, Bend enjoys the predominately dry climate of the Great Basin. Sunny days, cool nights and low humidity characterize the weather.


 Love the outdoors? 


 The following activities are all right out your doorstep (quite literally, in many cases):



  • Mountains, mountains, mountains: the Three Sisters (Faith, Hope and Charity), Broken Top, and Mount Bachelor are the five most prominent peaks nearby, and offer activities galore

  • Climbing: world class rock climbing is just 25 minutes north of Bend at Smith Rock

  • On the River: the Deschutes River flows right through the middle of town - people use it for kayaking, paddle boarding, floating the river, fishing, or simply walking its banks

  • Skiing: Mount Bachelor is just 25 minutes southwest of Bend, and there are other ski resorts nearby offering Alpine and Nordic skiing at all skill levels – snowshoeing, too!

  • Mountain Biking: there are many miles of existing trails for all skill levels, and new trails currently under construction

  • Fishing & Boating: countless lakes, streams, rivers, ponds and reservoirs at your disposal

  • Hiking & Camping: dozens of designated campsites nearby with access to trails

  • Golfing: 20+ courses sit in the surrounding area

  • Whitewater Rafting: there are multiple guiding companies in the surrounding area

  • Hunting: bow or rifle hunting for deer, elk, bear, water fowl, etc.


 In addition to Bend's outdoor recreational ethos, there are now 13 (yes – 13, and counting) craft breweries in town! World-class craft beer is one of the cultural pillars of Bend - after a fun day at the slopes or on the river, a well-deserved beverage is a staple among we Bendites.


 Check out the Official Bend Oregon Video created by VisitBend.com for more information on the area: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=u6zSKJqalug 


Don't take our word for it - take a look at what others are saying:


The Top 10 Best Places to Live Now - Men's Journal - http://www.mensjournal.com/expert-advice/the-10-best-places-to-live-now-20150312/bend-oregon


Can Bend Become the Next Boulder?  This Venture Capitalist Thinks So, and Here's Why - Geekwire -  http://www.geekwire.com/2014/qa-venture-capitalist-dino-vendetti/ 


Bend, Ore., A Brewer's Town - New York Times - http://www.nytimes.com/2012/04/22/travel/in-bend-ore-craft-brewing-is-booming.html?_r=0 


Bend, Ore., The City You'll Love to Hate - Washington Post - http://www.washingtonpost.com/lifestyle/travel/bend-ore-the-city-youll-love-to-hate/2012/10/04/9a7e2f10-042e-11e2-91e7-2962c74e7738_story.html

item.title: Data Architect at Idea Couture (Toronto, ON, Canada)
item.description:
Idea Couture is looking for a senior backend systems architect to join our technology group and build systems and solutions that help shape the future.

We operate in collaborative, cross-functional teams, working on problems from multiple perspectives until we get it right. You'll need to be comfortable facilitating discussion, taking feedback, working in a constantly evolving agile environment and motivating yourself and your team.


Responsibilities



  • Design, develop, test and maintain a scalable solution to handle huge amounts of records with minimum processing latency, and building a cost-effective high throughput system

  • Build fault tolerant, highly performant data pipelines that are able to meet scalability and latency targets.

  • Develop proof of concepts that demonstrate data centric analytic services delivering structured and unstructured information.

  • Integrate, via APIs, the following, but not limited to: web-services, custom wrappers, and third party applications.

  • Implement a mixed batch / near-real time architecture to analyze, index, and publish customer-facing data.

  • Bring experience with Hadoop (MapReduce, Sqoop, Hive, HBase, Pig, Oozie, Storm) to augment team’s capability and accelerate the rollout of data features.

  • Draft technical documents and present solution architectures to team- Learn and apply new technologies and share with team.- Writing Clean Code.

item.title: Modeling and Simulation Analyst at Stellar Science (Albuquerque, NM)
item.description:
Stellar Science is a growing Albuquerque-based scientific software development company seeking talented scientists that are interested in helping create and extend exciting scientific and engineering analysis applications. This is a new position at Stellar Science and we are looking for individuals that are interested in helping us define this role and mature our applications. Specifically, we are looking for individuals that are motivated, excited to learn new tools, and willing to help wherever they are needed.

We develop custom software products in domains that include computer vision and image processing, image simulation, high power microwave systems modeling and simulation, laser source generation and effects modeling, computational electromagnetics (CEM), space situational awareness (SSA), high performance computing (HPC), and computer aided design (CAD) tools, among others.

A Stellar Science Modeling and Simulation Analyst will be involved in all aspects of our application software life cycle, from marketing & business development to design, testing, documentation, and the customer interaction along the way. They will be working with management and the development teams to improve our applications and make our customers happy. We are looking for someone that has great verbal and written communication ability and stellar presentation skills. Someone that is eager to learn and excited to explore new domains.

Applicants may range from recent college graduates to experienced software engineers; the main requirements are that candidates be top-notch, responsible, self-motivated, honest, able to work well independently or in small teams, and be able to rapidly learn new tools, and techniques as needed to meet mission requirements.

Minimum Requirements:

B.S. in physics, math, engineering, or a related field
Confident, articulate, and professional speaking abilities
Exceptional computer skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Experience with software testing
Scientific analysis experience in one or more of the following domains:

  • Space Situational Awareness (SSA)
  • Image Simulation and Analysis
  • Computational Electromagnetics (CEM)
  • 3D CAD
  • Image-based Meshing
  • Directed Energy
  • Lasers
  • High Power Microwave (HPM)
  • High Performance Computing (HPC)
  • Modeling & Simulation

U.S. citizen willing to undergo background investigation and perform some work at Kirtland Air Force Base

Desired:

M.S. or Ph.D. in a scientific or engineering field with substantial scientific analysis experience

Stellar Science is a forward-thinking business that allows its employees to work at home on occasion when consistent with job requirements. Standard benefits include ten paid federal holidays (which may be floated as desired), three weeks vacation, a generous fully employer-funded SEP IRA, and fully employer-funded health insurance, as well as dental, disability, and life insurance.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, or national origin, in accordance with CFR 60-1.

item.title: Research Compute Cluster System Administrator at Dartmouth College (Hanover, NH)
item.description: Leads the development and management of the department research compute cluster. Designs, develops, deploys, maintains, supports, and manages mission-critical Computer Science computing infrastructure, including hardware, software, Linux operating systems, Mac operating systems, network file systems, network services, for the faculty, students, and administrative staff of the Computer Science department.

item.title: Senior Manager, Software Engineering - Dallas, Texas at Axxess (Dallas, TX)
item.description:
With growth comes new opportunity!  We are looking to add a dynamic and driven Senior Manager of Software Engineering to lead, mentor and manage multiple agile teams comprised of software engineers, team leads and product managers.  This position will be based out of our Dallas, Texas office.


If you are motivated by the opportunity to create amazing products, delight customers and deliver an outstanding product experience in a fast-paced, forward-thinking company with an extremely bright future - check this out!


Axxess is a technology company providing software for health organizations to efficiently run their business. Axxess empowers health care companies with easy to use, cloud based software integrating all aspects of their operations, so they improve patient outcomes while growing their business. 


Why Axxess?


It’s simple.  We do business differently, by empowering you to build the technology to create mind-blowing, first-to-market, superior products - leading healthcare into the future. We build the best because we only hire the best.


We do culture differently, too. You will quickly see how we approach our business, as we believe our team should work smart, and play harder.  


We are an open, agile environment, where transparent conversation ignites collaboration with a team of great thinkers.  Everyone freely contributes, ideas override egos, and the best idea always wins.  We embrace new technologies and pride ourselves on sustainable and quality code.  In our world, opportunity paired with imagination is limitless and we build what others can only hope to dream.  We’ve created an atmosphere allowing you to produce your best work, by catering to the creative.  Collaborate in a space designed to inspire the sharing of ideas on whiteboards; chill by yourself in the lounge or play a game of Madden or pool.


We are deliberate about our environment; we’ve built it to inspire creativity, where we are excited to come every day to pour our passion into our products.    We Dream. We Build. We Empower.

item.title: Java Software Engineer at Connexta (Phoenix, AZ)
item.description:
Looking to create and contribute amazing open source software? As a Software Developer you will participate in Open Source Software Development working on the Distributed Data Framework (DDF https://github.com/codice/ddf). Using Scrum and applying Object Oriented concepts and design patterns, you will develop prioritized capability within a continuous integration development environment. Connexta is a software company with the software team as the core of the company.


DDF is open source and utilizes many other open source technologies and open standards. Besides continually building new capability into DDF, we work with customers that have distributed enterprises with many diverse data sources. Using DDF we make the data discoverable and accessible addressing aspects relating to search, geospatial, security, and metadata, among many others. Development is primarily in Java and JavaScript.

item.title: Business Intelligence Developer at TravelBird (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Become part of our team


At TravelBird we believe that every day presents a new chance to grow. We challenge our people in a focussed, creative and pleasant environment. TravelBird believes in a positive and responsible way of working, whereby we strive to improve everyday. Our aim is to bring back the joy to travel. This is clearly reflected in our open, social and entrepreneurial environment. Here, we learn from each other and value trust more than focussing on hierarchy. We create joy for the customers and a joy for employees. It’s not just a job. It’s a working experience you will love to wake up for every day.


Your challenge



  • Model a company federated data warehouse with structured and unstructured elements;

  • Design and implement data models and flows to support reporting and analysis;

  • Develop and maintain ETL processes;

  • Manage data quality and consistency in the company data warehouse.

item.title: DevOps Engineer at Treasure Data (Mountain View, CA)
item.description:
If you have implemented and supported a cutting edge public cloud environment, have excellent analytical skills, and a passion for scalable and stable engineering environments, we want to talk with you! Working closely with our engineering team, you will implement and scale our predominantly Ruby and Java-based architecture.


We love the fact that you are a little obsessive about maintaining high availability for all of the services we manage, while also implementing the infrastructure solutions that our teams need to continue building our product. At Treasure Data, you will have opportunities to combine your technical ability, strategic thinking and detail-oriented execution in a fast-paced, dynamic, entrepreneurial environment. Your work will contribute to the design and management of serious infrastructure that is servicing large amounts of data and traffic, while working with a truly world-class engineering team, always employing state-of-the-art tools and techniques.


Things you will do:




    • Manage PostgreSQL/MySQL databases and traditional k-v stores and clusters

    • Manage 100+ cloud servers using automation tools

    • Investigate of system errors and problems

    • Perform bottleneck analysis of the system for scaling

    • Setup monitoring systems and application metrics as well as supervise them for prediction/detection of failures

item.title: Ruby Web Developer at Trimble Navigation (Westminster, CO)
item.description:
About Trimble Data


Trimble Data develops scalable, cloud-based geospatial systems. Our goal is to make geospatial processing simpler and faster for consumers by interfacing many varied geospatial applications into a cohesive whole.


Our primary system is the Trimble Data Marketplace, a storefront for geospatial data. The Marketplace enables customers to find, customize, and download data quickly and easily.



Ruby Web Developer


We are seeking a self-motivated, creative, and enthusiastic full stack developer to join the Trimble Data Web Development team. As a full-stack developer, you will maintain and design applications from top to bottom and work with everything from front-end HTML, CSS and JS to server-side databases, search indexes, and web servers as well as AWS cloud operations.


As a member of the Trimble Data Web Development team you will leverage new technologies, services and best practices to build the best solutions. You will have the opportunity to develop innovative solutions to new problems and will work with a wide variety of technologies to assist in the design of our API-driven front end UI as well as the backend API itself, all within scalable cloud infrastructure. Developers deal with a wide variety of tasks. A typical week may include coding, architecting, debugging, working with databases, and learning new technologies.


Key Responsibilities




  • Software engineering with a healthy dose of performance engineering and DevOps.




  • Develop, design, and support web app (SaaS), with focus on performance and scalability.




  • Maintain existing systems, while investigating and prototyping new technologies.




  • Build user interfaces to make large sets of data and processing operations available to end users.




  • Design APIs and work with consumers to support automated processing goals.




Work within your team and with other teams to ensure the overall vision of the project is being fulfilled.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Priceline.com (Norwalk, CT)
item.description:
Are you a Software Engineer passionate about creating great software?  Is your mantra “Class, Responsibility, Collaboration?”  Do you want to develop products that are very important to the growth and success of the company?  Do you want to work very closely with the business folks?  Are you looking for a company that is not too big, not too small, and has a casual and agile work environment?  If so, then we just might have the perfect job for you!


The Rental Car group at priceline.com is looking for a talented engineer to join our services tier team.  In this software engineering role you will develop services software that supports the searching and booking of rental cars on priceline.com and other company-owned web sites, mobile platforms, as well as through our affiliate API.

We strongly believe that there is real value to the organization in crafting and engineering software beautifully so that it can be easily understood, maintained, and extended. We work directly with the business team and are involved in shaping our product and improving our business.  The Rental Car business is a major contributor to the company’s bottom line and still has significant opportunity for growth.  We work hard at creating software to improve the business and we do so in a casual, fun and flexible work environment.


You will have the opportunity to use your Java skills to craft internal and external Web services; connect to external suppliers via Global Distribution Systems (GDS) and Web services; work with high capacity, multi-threaded systems; create and use various kinds of caches; build interaction points between the Rental Car product and the other Priceline products (e.g. Hotels, Airline); build tools to help manage and control our systems, and much more!

item.title: Software Engineer - Core Java at OptionsCity Software (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
Join us as a Software Engineer - Core Java


At OptionsCity, we partner with financial institutions to streamline their trading operations by providing services and tools including pricing, risk management, execution, and automated trading systems. Our vision is to change the way trading professionals think about and utilize technology.


The OptionsCity development team follows Agile Software Development principles to produce state-of-the-art software designed for the professional trading community. Using OOP/OOD, OptionsCity provides market data and order routing capabilities that power our state-of-the-art market making, trading, and risk applications. As a member of this team you will be a key contributor to maintaining existing applications, improving core technology, and creating new software to expand OptionsCity’s coverage of global asset classes and solutions required to support them.


Other responsibilities including contributing to the existing automated testing frameworks for new and existing implementations as well as assisting support staff in any escalated production cases.


What you’ll be doing:



  • Work on the business-level services provided by our platform, from market making, opportunity identification, pricing, risk management, order and trade management, to exchange connectivity

  • Work on the core services exposed by our platform, like threading, persistence, messaging

  • Contribute to the entire ecosystem: Metro, Freeway, API’s

  • Push the platform forward from a quality and performance point of view through systematic refactoring

  • Actively participate in discussions around design, architecture, and problem solving

  • Work closely with Dev-Ops for configuration, automation and deployment

  • Participate in application testing to ensure high quality software

  • Provide development support to second level support team

  • Participate in agile related meetings to plan, assess and improve the development process


What we’re offering:



  • The opportunity to change the way trading professionals think about and utilize technology 

  • Technology-­driven company, founded by software developers

  • The opportunity to make an immediate impact in an open, merit­-based environment

  • Small tech team of 20 gives you direct access to CTO

  • Agile methodology (Scrum)

  • Work on all aspects of our trading systems including high ­performance, multi-­threading, real­time kernels, etc.

  • Work within a development organization from which you are expected to learn and which expects to learn from you

  • Open-­ended career path

  • Opportunity to learn about the options trading industry

  • Outstanding benefits: health, dental, vision, 401K, life, long term disability and commuter plans, Monday morning breakfasts, and lunch + beverages provided daily

  • Competitive salary + equity incentive

item.title: Java Tech Lead passionné de TDD et clean code (f/h) at AXA Life Invest (Courbevoie, France)
item.description: Imagine une équipe autonome, pluridisciplinaire, et convaincue qu'avec de la bonne data viz, on peut rendre compréhensible et amusant des produits financiers innovants. Imagine qu'en plus, cette équipe reçoive des missions délibérément floues, pour laisser s'exprimer sa créativité collective en conception de produit. Cette équipe existe et elle cherche un coéquipier passionné de TDD/BDD, de clean code et d'applications qui font dire "waouh !" à ses utilisateurs.

item.title: Support Engineer, Contract at AudienceScience (Bellevue, WA)
item.description:
You are a talented future Support Engineer for the ad technology leader AudienceScience.  You solve global campaign issues and you are a “force multiplier” for customer facing teams. You work alongside Campaign Managers, Data Analyst, Development Engineers, Infrastructure Engineers and you are key in delivering a state of the art media buying platform using real-time bidding and behavioral targeting technologies leveraged upon the latest open source technologies.  We are a big data company managing upwards of 25 billion transactions per day. The data is aggregated within large scale, Hadoop clusters providing world class service delivery.You want an opportunity that provides an opportunity to deliver innovative problem solving skills within a fast-paced, high growth and emerging digital ad arena with a tremendous opportunity to lead industry transformation. You know that moving from a manual and unclear digital media environment to a smart, technology-driven and transparent ad system is the future, and you want to join the paradigm shift.


DURATION: approximately 6 months


RESPONSIBILITIES:


* Work with customers to troubleshoot and resolve complex product issues


* Interface with our campaign management, tier one support, engineering teams and external vendors to resolve problems


* Identify and provide requirements for automation or other tools


* Document best practices for troubleshooting issues 


* Act as subject matter expert on how our products and systems work

item.title: MongoDB Engineer at Rally Software (Boulder, CO)
item.description:
Rally is seeking an experienced, self-motivated, and passionate MongoDB Engineer to join our team. As a MongoDB Engineer, you’ll be largely responsible for providing operational database services to the organization. This position includes production as well as development DBA tasks, as such it will require a commitment on your part as well as ours.


About the Team


Here at Rally we try to do things a little differently. Whether it's re-imagining how SaaS is implemented and scaled, blameless postmortems, pushing to production on your very first day, we don't subscribe to the mantra of "Because we've always done it that way".


We believe that small, empowered, self-motivated teams can do big things. We also believe in the right tool for the job, not language-as-religion.


About the Job


As a database and data store administrator, you will be part of a team of highly-skilled engineers that manage all production, test and ancillary data environments.  While there are a number of different systems, Rally is consolidating to MongoDB and Oracle as the primary data systems.  This position will be focused on MongoDB first, and Oracle second, and will be expected to cross-train the other DBAs on MongoDB best practices, management and implementation.  The position requires on-call availability to support our 24x7x365 SaaS operations.  


Responsibilities:




  • Monitoring and administering data systems security in AWS and colo environments.




  • Analyzing data stored in the databases and data stores and making recommendations relating to performance and efficiency of that data storage.




  • Helping application programmers to efficiently utilize the data assets by assisting in database schema design and recommending the best design for scalability and performance.




  • Proactively monitor systems for optimum performance and capacity constraints.




  • Establishing standards and best practices for database backup and recovery.




  • 2+ years of production Oracle DBA experience.




  • 3+ years of production MongoDB management experience.




  • Experience with Oracle RDBMS running on Linux.




  • Experience managing, implementing, monitoring and scaling MongoDB in AWS




  • Strong experience supporting mission critical data infrastructure




  • Some experience and knowledge of an Oracle 11g database for an OLTP application in areas such as best practices, scalability, performance, and reliability.




  • Experience with Oracle and/or MongoDB performance tuning.




  • Experience with Oracle standby databases. Active Data Guard experience a plus.




  • Skilled in scripting and automating repetitive administrative tasks.




  • Experience with backup, recovery, and DR best practices.




About You


You enjoy the challenges and opportunities that come from managing data stores in a large-scale SaaS application environment.  You have a love for automation, predictive analysis, capacity planning and thrive on continuous improvement. You have a strong customer-oriented attitude and collaborate frequently with development teams and the rest of Infrastructure Engineering to solve problems, make recommendations, and help Rally excel.  You’re active in the open source community, understand the power of community and openly share your expertise.  You have experience creating, running and scaling data stores and databases in high-availability environments.


You will be successful in this role if you:




  • Are detail oriented and understand the need for precision working with data infrastructure




  • Have worked extensively with MongoDB and ideally Oracle, or are willing to aggressively ramp up on which of those two you are least familiar with




  • Have strong database and data store administration skills and seek out opportunities to improve and automate everything




  • Enjoy fast-paced, CI/CD environments with lots of collaboration




  • Understand big data at scale




  • Have a passion for learning




  • Understand AWS and deploying data stores to cloud environments as well as Oracle on old skool bare metal




Rally’s global headquarters is in Boulder, Colorado, with 10 additional offices spanning 4 continents. At Rally we believe that we can’t inspire innovation in our customers if we’re not innovative ourselves. We empower our teams by offering them flexibility, autonomy, and a culture founded upon open communication and collaboration. Recently awarded Best for the World: Worker Impact award for the third year in a row by B Labs, Named #8 on the “Best Medium-Sized Workplaces” by Fortune Magazine, a “Best Company to Work For in Colorado” and ranked in the “Top 100 Best Places to Work” in the nation from Outside Magazine, Rally offers a highly collaborative culture and work-life balance that attracts and retains top talent.


Rally is an Equal Opportunity Employer! 


Rally Software Development Corp., a wholly owned subsidiary of CA, Inc.

item.title: Ruby on Rails Developer at Altamira (McLean, VA)
item.description: The selected candidate will provide software engineering support on a web-based administrative support portal.  The application consists of a suite of integrated tools that provides support personnel with key data points by reaching out to a variety of enterprise data sources and consolidating the data into a unified view.  Candidate will be responsible for maintaining the current set of tools which will allow for increased familiarity with the application.  Over time, the selected candidate will be responsible for developing new applications, utilizing enterprise web-services, and building new reports.  The successful candidate will be a member of a dynamic team that is responsible for a rich web application.  The selected candidate must have the ability to work in a mixed technical environment and maintain productivity when switching between multiple tools/applications and technologies.  The candidate must work well in a team environment and have the desire to develop software in an agile fashion.

item.title: Software Developer @ Cloud-Based Behavioral Analytics Software Company at RedOwl (Baltimore, MD)
item.description:
Do you love bringing data to life? We do, too. Our platform does statistical analysis on large datasets, and shows our users the results in beautiful, intuitive ways. We're focused on building the best threat detection application on the market. You'll work with a great team of engineers, data scientists, mathematicians, and product folks. We're good people, we love working together, and want you to feel the same way. If the above sounds like your kind of thing, we'd love to talk with you.


You're a RedOwl Developer if you can:



  1. Write exemplary code;

  2. Display an understanding of our system as a whole;

  3. Contribute to the quality of the platform while holding others to a high standard during code reviews, design meetings, and deliverables;

  4. Serve as a mentor to, and learn from, other RedOwl developers; 

  5. Contribute to the broader technical community via open source projects, writing, or presenting; and

  6. Identify and suggest new technologies that may make sense for our platform.

item.title: Platform Engineer at Umbel (Austin, TX)
item.description:
Umbel is a high-energy, high-tech startup in Austin, Texas that is passionate about helping businesses build thriving, sustainable models powered by their ability to deeply understand and demonstrate the value of their audience.


We are seeking a Platform Engineer that loves to build incredible things. This position will work closely with all members of the product, development and engineering teams in a collaborative environment, which is diverse and open-minded. A successful candidate will obsess over high performance web development and database optimization, as well as feel comfortable in the cloud and know the latest techniques for developing and scaling web applications and distributed systems.

item.title: Analytics Platform Engineer at MuleSoft (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
MuleSoft changes the way the world stays connected through data.  Our award winning engineering team develops integration solutions for fellow engineers around the globe and we’re looking to grow!  Our newest engineers will shape our world-class analytics platform, participate in architectural discussions, and choose development technologies.


MuleSoft has a growing portfolio of highly distributed and reliable connectivity products and our analytics engineers will build a platform which allows end users to analyze and share massive amounts of transactional data. This position also offers daily exposure to influencers within the API, Cloud and Integration markets.

Position details:


Our analytics software engineer will pioneer a big-data analytics platform which provides the back-bone for how we collect, analyze and share transactional data and metrics from tens of thousands of integration and API machines distributed in the cloud. This real-time analytics product will be used for cloud reporting and optimizing the behavior of our customer’s systems at runtime.  You’ll work on a customer facing solution which sits at the center of various distributed architecture stacks across the Fortune 500.The product spans the entire Anypoint platform and your end users will be our customer’s developers, analysts and the C-Suite.


The analytics function of our Anypoint platform is still in architectural phase.  You will participate in architectural discussions, shape the platform, choose technologies, and have a direct impact on the newest part of our product line.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Windsor Circle, Inc (Durham, NC)

Code reviews, guidance to other engineers.

item.title: Linux Software Engineer at INFICON (East Syracuse, NY)
item.description:
Design, develop, and maintain Linux-based software for both embedded and cloud-based servers, in close collaboration with other developers, scientists, engineers, and marketing.

item.title: Data Engineer at Clover Health (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Clover Health is driving down costs and producing improved health outcomes with a unique health insurance plan. We use sophisticated analytics and custom software to direct our own clinical staff to proactively fill in gaps in the care of our members. We have a proven model we're scaling out.


We're focusing on elderly and low-income patients that stand to benefit from our model the most. This puts us in a position to make a major dent in healthcare expense in the United States and reverse an unsustainable, decades-long spending trend.


We are looking for a Data Engineer that embodies our values to join our team revolutionizing healthcare.

item.title: Entwickler Data Warehouse / Informatica und Oracle PL/SQL (m/w) at DekaBank Deutsche Girozentrale (Frankfurt am Main, Deutschland)
item.description:
Die DekaBank ist das Wertpapierhaus der Sparkassen, gemeinsam mit ihren Tochtergesellschaften bildet sie die Deka-Gruppe. Mit unseren vier Geschäftsfeldern – Wertpapiere, Immobilien, Kapitalmarkt und Finanzierungen – sind wir Partner der Sparkassen in der Vermögensanlage und -verwaltung. Dies umfasst nicht nur Produkte wie Investmentfonds und Zertifikate, sondern auch Asset-Management- und Bank-Dienstleistungen rund ums Wertpapier. Dabei werden die Geschäftsfelder vom Sparkassenvertrieb und insgesamt 13 Zentralbereichen unterstützt.


Entwickler Data Warehouse / Informatica und Oracle PL/SQL (m/w)
Ref.-Nr.: 5003 1530, in Frankfurt, Vollzeit- oder Teilzeittätigkeit möglich


Ihre Aufgaben:



  • Entwickler im Rahmen der Anwendungsbetreuung für Data Warehouse, Schnittstellen und ETL-Workflows

  • Erarbeitung von Lösungen sowie deren Implementierung, Test und Deployment auf Basis von Oracle, Informatica und PL / SQL

  • Durchführung laufender Performance-, Optimierungs- und Pflegemaßnahmen

  • Management von internen und externen Datenschnittstellen und Abstimmung mit Schnittstellenpartnern

  • Beratung und Betreuung interner Kunden


Ihr Profil:



  • Fundierte Kenntnisse im Design und in der Entwicklung von komplexen Datenbanken oder Data-Warehouses

  • Expertenkenntnisse in ETL-Tools, vorzugsweise Informatica PowerCenter sowie in PL / SQL

  • Idealerweise Erfahrungen im KAG- oder Wertpapiergeschäft


Sie arbeiten gerne im Team und zeichnen sich durch eine strukturierte und selbstständige Arbeitsweise aus. Neben einer ausgeprägten Kommunikationsstärke besitzen Sie gute analytische und konzeptionelle Fähigkeiten. Dank Ihrer zielorientierten Arbeitsweise sind Sie in der Lage, in einem komplexen Systemumfeld effizient und reibungsfrei zu agieren. Ein hohes Maß an Verantwortung, Flexibilität und Belastbarkeit setzen wir voraus.


Freuen Sie sich auf ein attraktives Umfeld:
Wir bieten Ihnen einen modernen Arbeitsplatz sowie ein leistungsorientiertes Einkommen mit zahlreichen Nebenleistungen. Dazu gehört auch eine Vielzahl von Angeboten, um den vielfältigen Anforderungen von Beruf und Familie gerecht zu werden – vom Deka Health Center bis zur Kinderbetreuung.

Haben wir Ihr Interesse geweckt? Wir freuen uns auf Ihre Onlinebewerbung! Weitere Infos rund um Ihre Karriere bei der Deka-Gruppe finden Sie auf www.dekabank.de/karriere. Bei Rückfragen steht Ihnen unsere Bewerberbetreuung unter (0 69) 71 47 - 39 99 gerne zur Verfügung.


Die Deka-Gruppe strebt eine Erhöhung des Frauenanteils an. Daher werden Frauen
– bei gleichwertiger Qualifikation – für diese Stelle bevorzugt eingestellt.

item.title: Frontend Developer - Meteor / Javascript - FinTech Startup at Ldger Inc. (New York, NY)

item.title: Developer/Project Manager at Personal BlackBox (New York, NY)

Personal BlackBox is looking for a Project Manager who can lead a world-class team in agile development efforts.


A key contributor to our rapidly growing business, the Project Manager will be an integral member of our development team, responsible for full lifecycle execution on products – leading, developing, implementing and supporting enhancements for our applications. item.title: Android Developer at Gravy (Leesburg, VA)
item.description:
Gravy is a four year-old technology company poised to disrupt the world of consumer insights. The company has a unique, proprietary platform that captures and leverages rich data on local events and venues. Through its SDK and API, the company combines this data with mobile consumer behavioral data to drive consumer segmentation and activation. Gravy uses this powerful combination of location and behavioral data to create profiles that our clients use to execute pinpoint targeting of experiences and messaging to drive local store visits and retail sales results. Gravy is currently partnering with leading media, retail, and hospitality companies to increase engagement, activation and sales.







Position Summary






We are seeking a qualified Android developer to join our mobile development team. This developer will work on new features for existing apps as well as entirely new apps as part of a capable and fun team spanning many technologies.


The successful candidate will have a teamwork orientation and commitment to developing high-quality code. You will be a self-starter capable of breaking down complex tasks on your own and asking good questions when you encounter ambiguous requirements.

item.title: Development Data Team Lead at Markit (Boulder, CO)

Web Development Culture

item.title: Senior Software Developer C++ - Equity Products at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)

item.title: Senior Software Developer - Government Intelligence Team at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)

Bloomberg R&D's Web Shared Services team is responsible for doing that and more by engineering the world-class services infrastructure powering Bloomberg.com, News & Multimedia mobile apps, and other Bloomberg products.
