item.title: Software Engineer at Revenue Analytics, Inc. (Atlanta, GA)
item.description:
Revenue Analytics has an immediate need to hire a Software Engineer for our Data Engineering Group.  We offer a competitive base salary, 15%-20% bonus incentive, full benefits, 401(k) + match and a defined career path. 


Revenue Analytics is looking for exceptional, motivated Software Engineers to design and develop large scale innovative solutions with sophisticated optimization models for Fortune 500 companies. Collaborate on cross-functional project teams assembled to address some of today’s most pressing business problems. Own project work streams while managing client expectations and strengthening client relationships. 


As a member of the Revenue Analytics Team, you will be part of a dynamic, growth organization dedicated to helping our clients optimize the price and availability of their products. 


 Responsibilities



  • Work with client and project team to write data and technology requirements in client facing documentation on software functionality.

  • Consult directly with clients and project teams to develop solutions to business problems through the design and development of software and database frameworks for forecasting and optimization solutions.

  • Through client interfacing and consulting, perform data transformation and analysis to assist clients in uncovering revenue opportunities.

  • Produce analysis and designs for the creation of analytical software solutions.

  • Work with clients to integrate our software solutions with their systems including providing full lifecycle application development support and consultancy.


Great Benefits


To attract top talent, we provide highly competitive salaries and benefits and offer substantial incentive compensation in the form of variable compensation and bonuses.



  • 100% paid medical, dental, and vision coverage for our employees and their families

  • Life insurance, long and short term disability coverage

  • 401(k) plan with a generous match and you are vested immediately

  • Company issued cell phone and laptop

  • 3 weeks paid vacation, 6 national holidays, 5 days off for Winter Break, and paid sick time

item.title: Software Engineer, Performance Data Analytics at SolarCity (San Mateo, CA)
item.description: The primary goal of the Software Engineer of Performance Data Analytics will be to use SolarCity’s extensive data resources to develop methods and techniques to better integrate widespread solar deployments with the grid.  SolarCity believes that better predictability and optimization of distributed energy systems will provide significant value to grid operators and energy market participants.  The Data Engineer will be responsible for engineering tools for that prediction and optimization.

item.title: Senior Software Designer-Developer at Wiland, Inc. (Niwot, CO)
item.description:
Wiland is seeking dedicated, high caliber professionals who are smart and energetic, have a positive attitude and take pride in their work. Currently, we have an opening for a Senior Software Designer-Developer. This Designer-Developer will work closely with the Architecture Team, Development Team, and Product Management to design and develop software for Wiland. The Senior Designer-Developer is responsible for performing a variety of technical activities for assigned projects and maintenance requests as dictated by business priorities. The activities include creating design plans, writing detailed design documents, conducting design reviews, communicating specifications to the development team, developing software, preparing integration test plans, and providing technical leadership to the development team. The primary responsibilities of the Senior Software Designer-Developer position include:



  1. Reviewing and contributing to project Requirements Documents as necessary.

  2. Assisting in the conceptualization and development of solutions for approved projects.

  3. Collaborating with the assigned architect(s) to create design plans, data flow and data models.

  4. Independently preparing detail design documents (process flows, process specifications, and pseudo-code) suitable for use by developers.

  5. Conducting review sessions of completed designs, test plans, and release plans.

  6. Providing technical leadership to members of the development team participating in the project; mentor developers, ensure adherence to development standards, conduct code reviews, etc.

item.title: Back-end developer in fast growing Start-up at Energimolnet by Playback Energy AB (Gothenburg, Sweden)
item.description:
Come help us save the environment and disrupt a whole industry while doing it!


Energimolnet is built to boost the energy sector by making it fun, easy and truly scalable to develop energy related services that improve efficiency and save the environment. We manage billions of data points and provide the world’s most comprehensive infrastructure for collecting and distributing energy data. Our users save energy by using services they already love -- while we automatically extract data from energy bills, utility web-sites and smart-meters.


Grow with us


We are now expanding in Europe and looking for a back-end developer to join our growing team in Gothenburg. Your main responsibility will be to improve our data collection capabilities and implement new features that will help us grow globally. Our stack is highly distributed and we focus on what we do best and let Heroku, MongoLab, Iron, Papertrail, Mailgun, AWS, etcetera do the rest.


Your responsibilities



  • Lead the back-end development for data collection and monitoring as we enter new geographical markets

  • Be part of general planning and architecture decisions regarding cloud infrastructure and API-design.

  • Help our customers with support questions about the API and data collection

  • Pet-projects: Play around with the API and IFTTT to demonstrate and inspire how Energimolnet can be connected to smart lights and web services

item.title: Software Engineer, Data at HookLogic, Inc. (New York, NY)
item.description:
Job Description



HookLogic Engineers develop proprietary software platforms used by the world’s largest e-commerce retailers. Our engineering team consists of talented, team-oriented individuals who are empowered to take advantage of the latest cloud and distributed technologies to deliver reliable, high-throughput applications. Our core languages are Java and C# and we commonly utilize technologies and platforms such as RESTful services, jQuery, SQL Server, Hadoop, Hive, HBase, Storm, Spark, and AWS Services such as Kinesis, DynamoDB, Redshift, Lamda, and SQS. 


As a Data Engineer, you’ll employ your skills on a daily basis to design and build data processing and storage applications to handle millions of transactions per day. You will analyze business requirements and consult with the broader team to ensure successful processing, storage and reporting of our Big Data. You’ll have a wide variety of languages and technologies at your disposal that you can use to solve problems. Your work will directly shape and create our data architecture to ultimately deliver systems that stand up to unpredictable environments at massive scale.

item.title: Software Developer - Data and Intelligence at Optiver US LLC (Chicago, IL)
item.description: Our data and intelligence developers create software which drives Optiver's strategic planning. We face a variety of problems with high degrees of difficulty focused primarily on data: processing and storing information coming in at extremely high bandwidth, cleaning and organizing data from vastly disparate sources in a query-able fashion, and building flexible tools which allow employees in every role to make sense of this mountain of information. If you love dealing with massive amounts of data and want to build the software which drives the strategic decisions which have allowed Optiver to be a pillar of the options market for nearly thirty years, we have a spot for you.

item.title: Senior Data Engineer at New Relic (Portland, OR)
item.description:
We are seeking a Senior Software Engineer to help build and maintain the high-performance, high-volume services that receive, process, and store the tidal wave of incoming real-time data from thousands of customers and enables our entire line of products.

Researching storage solutions, developing low-latency fault-tolerant architectures, and implementing state-of-the-art distributed query algorithms is our bread-and-butter. We also dabble in the dark arts of high-throughput data pipelines and streaming data processing.


We’re interested in having a diverse team with a broad set of skills and viewpoints. If this seems like your dream job, but you’re not sure if you qualify, apply anyway!

item.title: Forensisch software engineer big data at Rijksoverheid (The Hague, Netherlands)
item.description:
Forensisch software engineer big data


Nederlands Forensisch Instituut



Functieomschrijving



Ben jij een ervaren Java-ontwikkelaar?



Binnen het Nederlands Forensisch Instituut (NFI) werkt een team gedreven softwareontwikkelaars aan vooruitstrevende forensische software. Je draagt in hoge mate bij aan de doorontwikkeling van het forensisch big data-platform Hansken.



Hansken wordt binnen en buiten het NFI gebruikt voor opsporing en bewijsvoering van ernstige misdrijven als kindermisbruik, moord, grootschalige fraude en andere delicten met grote maatschappelijke impact. Het platform draait op een gedistribueerde omgeving en verwerkt vele terabytes aan data per uur. Het analyseren van deze data kan miljoenen relevante sporen opleveren. Denk aan e-mails, chatberichten, GPS-coördinaten en dergelijke.



Door nieuwe technologische ontwikkelingen blijft het een uitdaging om steeds nieuwe typen forensische sporen doorzoekbaar te maken of slimme analyses toe te voegen, zoals entiteitextractie voor herkenning van kentekens, IBAN-nummers of adressen. Naast het dienen van een belangrijk maatschappelijk belang is Hansken ook een technisch zeer uitdagend project waar je telkens met nieuwe technieken in aanraking komt. Bij dit R&D-project wordt gewerkt volgens een agile ontwikkelproces, met moderne ontwikkeltools die goed op elkaar aansluiten.



Als forensisch software engineer big data ontwikkel je samen met een team van ongeveer 8 collega’s het platform Hansken verder om onder meer de performance, schaalbaarheid en functionaliteit te verbeteren. Aan het systeem worden hoge eisen aan de kwaliteit en betrouwbaarheid gesteld. Daarom ben je kritisch over het functioneren ervan, durf je vragen te stellen en sta je open voor feedback. Naast je werk aan het systeem denk je mee over het continu verbeteren van het ontwikkelproces, waarbij de forensische kennis zo goed mogelijk geborgd wordt.

item.title: Senior tester forensische big data at Rijksoverheid (The Hague, Netherlands)
item.description:
Senior tester forensische big data


Nederlands Forensisch Instituut



Functieomschrijving



Ben jij een ervaren tester met kennis van big dataoplossingen?



Je bewaakt bij de groep Software Engineering van het Nederlands Forensisch Instituut (NFI) de kwaliteit van het forensisch big data platform Hansken. Hiervoor ontwikkel je testen en voert ze uit.



Hansken wordt binnen en buiten het NFI gebruikt voor opsporing en bewijsvoering van ernstige misdrijven als kindermisbruik, moord, grootschalige fraude en andere delicten met grote maatschappelijke impact. Het platform draait op een gedistribueerde omgeving en verwerkt vele terabytes aan data per uur. Het analyseren van deze data kan miljoenen relevante sporen opleveren. Denk aan e-mails, chatberichten, GPS-coördinaten en dergelijke.



Door nieuwe technologische ontwikkelingen blijft het een uitdaging om steeds nieuwe typen forensische sporen doorzoekbaar te maken of slimme analyses toe te voegen, zoals entiteitextractie voor herkenning van kentekens, IBAN-nummers of adressen. Als senior tester forensische big data geef jij invulling aan al het benodigde testwerk, waarbij je de functionaliteit van Hansken en de forensische integriteit van de resultaten waarborgt.



Bij Hansken wordt gewerkt volgens een agile ontwikkelproces, met moderne ontwikkeltools die goed op elkaar aansluiten. Hierbij geef jij op testgebied concrete invulling aan de sprintplanning. Je denkt daarbij fundamenteel na over het testen van deze complexe software en volgt de nieuwste ontwikkelingen op testgebied. Je zoekt de ontwikkelaars op om in een vroeg stadium testplannen te ontwikkelen en verwerkt deze tot uitvoerbare tests. Daarnaast zet jij het proces op voor het uitvoeren van acceptatietests, coördineer je de testactiviteiten en voert deze ook zelf uit. Je rapporteert de testresultaten aan het team en benadrukt pijnpunten.



Om Hansken continu te kunnen blijven verbeteren, zorg jij er met de ontwikkelaars voor dat testplannen worden omgezet in geautomatiseerde tests. Voor het geautomatiseerd testen van onze applicaties gebruiken wij op dit moment het test framework JBehave in combinatie met de Selenium web driver. Deze tests maken onderdeel uit van een continuous delivery proces, waarbij we vanuit onze issue tracker met 1 druk op de knop Hansken kunnen bouwen, testen en uitrollen.

item.title: Senior Developer / Manager with Java and SQL for Telco Big Data Pioneer at mCentric (Las Rozas, Spain) (allows remote)
item.description:
Senior Developer / Manager with Java and SQL for Telco Big Data Pioneer


We are looking for a Senior Developer ready to confidently apply a solid technical and managerial skillset to create new or upgrade current solutions, proposing and defending innovations.


You will be using your experience as a Senior Developer to create and upgrade solutions which interact with the mobile telecommunications core network, familiarising yourself with a multitude of mobile telecommunications protocols, standards and infrastructure variations of those standards. mCentric solutions range from Data Plan Management, xDR Navigation, SIM Registration, Voucher Services, and other basic mobile network solutions which in turn are feeding its data into a dynamic and intelligent promotions platform allowing for precise Microsegmentation applied to intelligent and interactive promotions and reporting. Our solutions are responsible for dealing with billions of events processed per day, millions of concurrent user sessions, and are expected to deliver results in real time. To handle the demand, several of the solutions are built over a Big Data structure. In fact, mCentric solutions are running over the first BDA installed in Africa.

item.title: Software Engineer - Cloud Services at Vena Solutions Inc. (Toronto, ON, Canada)
item.description:
Our engineering culture is incredibly important to us.  We write great software, care deeply about code quality, and expect the people who join us to do the same. We're looking for innovative and detail-oriented engineers to help us create one of the most sophisticated SaaS cloud platforms in Canada.  


Engineering Responsibilities



  • Think in terms of 10x improvements

  • Write clean and elegant code

  • Create robust, speedy production components and develop prototypes quickly

  • Refactor, simplify and optimize code

  • Collaborate with the team on features, design and implementation and work cohesively to find solutions

  • Contribute to building our environment, which embraces continuous integration through the use of automated testing

  • Champion the latest software technologies while developing innovative functionality to improve software performance and usability

  • Tell us what we need to be doing rather than expect to be told what to do

item.title: Field Service Engineer at The Intellisis Corporation (Washington, DC)
item.description:
Intellisis is seeking a Field Service Engineer to support our voice biometrics platform. This position will be based in Virginia with a focus on customers in the surrounding DC-metro area.


The Field Service Engineer will provide service to customers including installation, maintenance, and troubleshooting of product installations, as well as training customers on how to use our products.

item.title: Sr. DevOps Engineer - User Data at Twilio (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Twilio operates a cloud communications service that is distributed with points of presence throughout the globe at a scale of thousands of servers. Because we are mission critical infrastructure for our customers, operational excellence is a key objective and that’s where DevOps comes in as a core competency.


About the job:

Twilio engineers own and run their products and services from conception to continuous operation. DevOps engineers play a key role and are embedded within teams to focus on the operational aspects of our services. 

Responsibilities:

Twilio's User Data engineers develop services to implement RESTful data services, MySQL & DynamoDB databases and power ETL through Kinesis-powered data pipelines. Some operational concerns are availability, throughput, latency as well as data consistency guarantees. Our DevOps engineers are focused on 24x7 availability, performance and manageability concerns of these services. 

You will collaborate with Architects and Engineering leaders to define and develop operational features, tools and processes including:



  • Tools and processes for configuration management of large numbers of databases and services. This includes participating in technology selection and architecture review to ensure zero downtime releases and maintenance as well as enable auto-scaling. 

  • Instrumentation for monitoring the health and availability of services including fault detection, alerting, triage and recovery (automated and manual).

  • Performance management, including benchmarking and monitoring of vital metrics, capacity planning, and resolution of performance problems affecting service levels. 

  • Custom diagnostic and troubleshooting tools. 

  • Developer facing support tools made available via our developer portal and to our customer support organization.

item.title: Trading Solutions - Enterprise Messaging Software Developer (C#/Java/C++) at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:

The Enterprise Connectivity and Integration team is looking for skilled developers to work on its message processing workflow engine and delivery platform. The system balances numerous requirements while merging ETL design, real-time processing, systems programming, web delivery and human computer interaction for graph-based message transformation.
The team is building new functionality and features as we extend our capability with a generic messaging framework that includes routing and processing heavy traffic loads across an array of circumstances. Developers can expect to contribute immediately and will be working on:
-High performance distributed system to support asynchronous workflows, faster fault-recovery.
-Parallel data processing, message enrichment, data transformation and delivery mechanisms all within a high throughput, low latency, secure server environment.
-Open source technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, Storm and more.
-Streamlined user interface.

item.title: Software Architect - 803 at Cambridge Consultants (Cambridge, UK)
item.description:
Have you delivered Software as a Service that truly scaled and experienced first-hand the challenges of rolling out new services? Would you like to do it again, working with “Big Data” and the “Internet of Things” to shape a new initiative within a true world class leader?


Cambridge Consultants is a fantastic place to work and is home to some of the most talented engineers and scientists active in connected devices and data analytics across a wide range of sectors.


Main purpose of the job


To be the lead software and technical architect for cloud based platforms that connect devices and deliver digital services, with particular focus on secure and scalable systems that deliver flexible Software as a Service business models.


Work within multi-disciplinary teams of highly talented people from around the globe that drive changes in technology to deliver novel solutions to the everyday needs of individuals and corporations alike.


About Digital Services


Digital Services is an exciting area within Cambridge Consultants; one that builds on the extensive range of work by the company in connected devices, data analytics and integrated systems across many sectors and with clients from around the world. Working closely with other groups in Cambridge Consultants we seek to deliver exciting new services in medical, consumer and industrial sectors as well as to drive forward the servitization of the company’s own IP.


We combine excellent technical and commercial skills with robust service design and evaluation methods and a broad base of industry experience to form a powerful development team. Our work ranges from undertaking complete service platform development and operations from concept, pilots and commercial launch, through to providing consulting services for our clients on their technology, product offering and future strategy.


Specific responsibilities


Develop solutions for connected devices where scalable, flexible and secure software platforms, service availability and security of personal data are vital.


Technically guide multi-disciplinary project teams of Engineers, Consultants and Designers to realise your design.


To liaise with clients to understand their technical needs and use your strong technical expertise to prepare proposals which capture and structure these requirements clearly.


Apply your knowledge of the state-of-the-art software tools and techniques to ensure standards-compliant design that takes advantage of the latest thinking in database systems, open innovation and federated identity management.


Use your development experience to drive a robust and agile approach to software development, testing, documentation and deployment of live commercial services.

item.title: Tradebook Low-Latency And Algorithmic Trading - Senior C++ Developer at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:

Bloomberg Tradebook is a leading agency broker, a US ECN, and a technology provider ofcross-asset electronic trading platform, supporting Equities/Futures/Options/FX trading.

Tradebook is building the next generation, ultra-low latency trading platform, which supports multi asset trading, exchange routing and order matching. With high capacity and sub-microsecond latency, the new system will be the foundation for Tradebook's future and propel it into more markets and grab new opportunities.

Our focus is on developing low latency & real-time black box trading systems, algorithmic trading systems, providing connectivity/FIX solutions and providing direct market connectivity solutions.

R&D Tradebook is looking for a motivated and talented C++ developer to join this effort. You will be working a small group of technologists passionate about pushing the boundaries of technology and delivering innovative product solutions. The role involves implementing a high performance technology stack from ground up, designing efficient data structures and services for business functionality, and building a highly available system with throughput of millions of messages per second. Candidates should exhibit an aggressive drive, bias towards action, and a proven aptitude for engineering quality software solutions.

This candidate will also work closely with Sales, Products and Trading Desk from idea generation to implementing and delivering cutting-edge technologies and trading solutions to the market.

Tradebook is seeking developers with project experience in creating systems for:
- Algorithmic Trading
- Black Box Trading
- Market Making
- Risk Management
- Quantitative Analysis
- Event Based Trading
- Solutions for Hedge Funds
- Solutions for Proprietary Trading firms (Prop shops)
- High frequency trading applications
- Low latency trading applications

item.title: Java Developers transforming data into elegant solutions at Landmark Information Group (Exeter, UK)
item.description:
Landmark Solutions developers work on a range of projects, typically for government or public body customers.  Our speciality is transforming data into elegant solutions that deliver insight and value.  We do this mainly by implementing authenticated web services that consume, retrieve, query and modify structured data.  We implement syntactic and semantic validation and business logic and persist the data to relational, data-warehouse and object stores.  Many projects also contain web site user-interfaces.  Our core technology is Java 8 and we utilise many web modern frameworks including Spring 4, Hibernate 4, Google Guice, JDBI, Dropwizard, Jersey and JAX/RS.  We apply an agile development process where possible, centred around Jira, using Bitbucket, git, feature-branches and peer-reviews where possible.



You will be part of a vibrant and ambitious team who are making a real difference to our business by designing and delivering first class software in an environment of dynamic and outcome focused delivery. Our objectives are technically challenging and we deliver products which generate a key part of the business’ revenue. Are you looking for a challenge that will push your boundaries in terms of your personal development, and help contribute to business success through developing innovative solutions for our customers? If so, we’d love to hear from you.


Our developers have an important voice in how our solutions are constructed, so an open and collaborative approach to change is essential. Our teams have great opportunities for personal development and therefore the role would benefit a self-motivated learner.

item.title: Rails Developer at Connexity (Camarillo, CA)
item.description:
Connexity is looking for a talented, highly motivated Rails Web Developer / Software Engineer.  The candidate will be responsible for both minor and major functional enhancements to our UI.  Used by outside customers, our internal business team, and our developer team, the UI is our fastest and cleanest view into highly complex, multidimensional data.  As a core member of our UI team, the candidate will be the cornerstone of making our rich data accessible and visible, and by doing so will provide other groups in the company with the insights necessary to grow revenue.  With close to 200,000 streamed transactions per second and database tables with over a billion rows, we need a creative problem solver to provide windows of insight into our data.
 
We are not a LAMP stack shop, but rather a NoSQL, Big Data, Real-Time stream processing shop. Our architecture is unique and our software stack purposefully diverse. We are searching for an engineer that likes a challenge, wants an opportunity to work with cutting edge technologies, and thrives in small teams. We are looking for a developer that wants to "own" key aspects of the client interface and take pride in its evolution. Your contributions will be immediate and will be felt through out the company. Connexity is fun, fast-paced, and open-ended with a strong entrepreneurial spirit and with emphasis on being innovative.

We also provide ample opportunity for our engineers to grow their skillset beyond web development, offering a chance to design around several NoSQL platforms including Hadoop.

YOU WILL BE ACCOUNTABLE FOR



  • Building Ruby/Rails interfaces that make it easy to understand and control complex, multi-dimensional data

  • Creatively leveraging AJAX to pull from Redis and Hbase in order to provide real-time views of large datasets

  • Identifying reports that can be offloaded to helper applications for faster rendering

  • Helping with the schema design for NoSQL databases

  • Optimizing ORM queries to maintain good performance across large datasets

item.title: Web Application Developer - modern front-end / finance+trading at Extremely Heavy Industries (Greenwich, CT) (allows remote)
item.description:
Extremely Heavy Industries is searching for an experienced front-end software developer to help build sophisticated, data-rich web and mobile applications using modern web/Javascript frameworks and data visualization libraries.


We create highly polished web apps for private financial clients. We specialize in tools to track and visualize portfolio performance, risk, and trading activity across a wide range of asset classes, countries, and strategies.


This posting includes an extended onsite engagement with one of our clients - a major hedge fund based in Greenwich, CT. This will involve direct collaboration with high-level developers and trading desks to build out an internal UI framework and collection of apps for research and analysis across the firm. Regular (often daily) onsite presence for this project is essential.


-------------------------------------


Location: Greenwich, CT + ongoing options for NYC/Westchester County/remote.


Job Type: Both salaried and independent contractor arrangements can be considered.


Compensation: Highly competitive, commensurate with experience.

item.title: JS Engineer, London office based at Monetate, Ltd. (London, UK)

We're actively searching for Javascript Engineers to join our growing technical team in London office.This is a full time, permanent position, based in our London office. You will work with Monetate's delivery team side by side to use Javascript to build experiences for on page experiments for our many significant E-commerce clients. Your content will run on high-traffic web pages and test marketers ideas in real time.

We're looking for self-starters with a deep understanding of data structures and algorithms to tackle tough new challenges and to contribute to the growth of our business and our customers' success. If you're a problem-solver who is passionate about rich web applications, scaling Internet applications to billions of page views, and working with big data, then you're a perfect fit for our close-knit and agile team.



We offer full package of benefits, flexible hours, free lunches and monthly socials with the whole team.


Apply today!  


Please note: this is a London, UK office based position- local applicants only.

item.title: Windows Client C++/C# Software Engineer at eFolder (Littleton, CO)
item.description: We are looking for a strong candidate with experience and deep knowledge of windows system development. The right candidate would have a vast level of knowledge and experience working in C++/C# building Windows services in a multi-threaded and safe manner. The candidate should be able to demonstrate a confident ability to not "code by coincidence". They should be comfortable with basic unit testing concepts and be able to program in a OOP paradigm. A strong understanding of design patterns, data structures, and systems architecture is a must.

item.title: Smart Glass / AR / Android / OpenGL ES developer at Aero Glass (Budapest, Hungary)
item.description: Take your skills to the skies - literally. Help us give AR vision to Aircraft Pilots using Smart Glasses (aka. Head-Mounted Displays). It can’t really get cooler than this.

item.title: Frontend developer at Wiremind (Paris, France)
item.description:
About Us:


We are a young start-up based in Paris and dedicated to the field of Revenue Management for the transportation sector. We believe in tools that mix business intelligence, applied mathematics, ergonomics and software intelligence to make sense of very large amount of data. We aim to remove unnecessary complexity to our users while allowing them to focus on high-value actions to improve the overall margin of their business.


Our main solution is a saas software for transport companies that let them do their yield and pricing just right.


We are looking for a talented frontend engineer who is ready to work in close relation with the CTO to tackle challenges met by a young technological startup. 


Responsibilities:


You will be in charge of developping new features for the front-end part of our solution.


The back-end part is responsible for extracting data from our client's reservation system, transforming it by applying several steps (standardization, forecasting, pricing algorithms...) and loading it in our managed datastores.


The frontend is a single-page application on which clients can freely modify their pricing position according to realtime adjusted metrics like competitor's prices, daily sale's speed, suggest optimal price... 


Our technological stack is as follow:



  • Backend: Python, SQLAlchemy, Scrapy, Celery, Flask

  • Frontend: AngularJS, D3js

  • Data-store: Postgresql, Elasticsearch


Requirements:



  • Strong Knowledge of Javascript, CSS, HTML

  • Rigourous, autonomous and hard-working


Bonus Points:



  • Working experience with AngularJS or D3js

  • Experience in working in a technological start-up


Other details:


This is a fulltime position located in Paris. 
Please include a brief personalized cover letter (in english or french) with your application.
Salary: Negotiable depending on the profile and degree / training / experience.

item.title: Senior Computational Scientist at European Molecular Biology Laboratory (EMBL) (Hamburg, Germany)
item.description:
We are looking for a Senior Computational Scientist to join the BioSAXS group of the EMBL.



The successful applicant will be responsible for the design, coordination, implementation and deployment
of software and method developments, ranging from integration of biophysical devices and methods at
the BioSAXS beamline to data collection strategies and subsequent analysis methods. He/she will also
be involved in the user support at a dedicated biological SAXS beamline P12 on PETRA 3 ring utilized by
over a hundred groups per year. All beamline specific developments are to be coordinated with the MX beamline responsibles, as well as Computer and Instrumentation groups.



Methods development requires collaborative maintenance of the existing code base with the other
members of the group with specific emphasis on the development of novel statistical and machine
learning approaches for data analysis and validation.

item.title: Front-end Engineer at Likelihood (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
The front-end team at Likelihood is responsible for building an advanced, yet simple interface for our machine learning platform. With it, non-technical users at our customers are able to easily create experiments that power beautiful, data-driven website and mobile experiences. We seek talented JavaScript engineers with strong design sensibilities and a desire to create interfaces that are a pleasure to use. 


You'll be working from the ground-up with a small team to guide the architecture and implementation of our web applications. We'll want you to build upon your ideas about what other applications we can create that enable companies to provide personalized experiences for each of their individual customers.

item.title: Core Financial Applications C++ Developer at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role: 

The Core Financial Applications (CFA) department designs and builds business-critical solutions for a diverse set of customers in the financial industry. Our products include analytical and research applications for equities, fixed income, mortgages, commodities, economics, foreign exchange and financial derivatives. The products we build help traders, investment bankers, corporate treasurers, research analysts and portfolio managers solve complex business problems.

As a software engineer in CFA, you will be responsible for the full development life cycle of key projects. You will learn about finance from our subject matter experts and through Bloomberg University courses. Your ingenuity and enterprise will help improve and progress our products in a highly competitive and challenging marketplace.

Our software engineers are quick, resourceful, flexible and collaborative. They combine their technical skills and product knowledge to craft unsurpassed solutions for our customers.

>> More information on individual groups and their products can be found below. When you apply, you will have the ability to select your preferred group.

Derivatives & Cross Asset

The Derivatives & Cross Asset group is one of the fastest growing in both CFA and Bloomberg. We deal with analytics required by a variety of trading, risk management and regulatory reporting applications. The front, middle and back offices of major financial institutions involved in the USD 700 trillion derivatives industry use our products to make sense of the complexity, risks, pitfalls and regulations surrounding these financial instruments. Our derivatives teams meet these challenges by offering a one-stop solution that brings transparency, efficiency and excellence to market professionals.

Fixed Income Pricing

The Fixed Income (FI) Pricing group builds a product that is the market standard for pricing and provides up to date and accurate information to the global financial community. We are focused on building low latency, high throughput systems that employ advanced statistical techniques for generating real-time and accurate pricing information. FI Pricing also builds analytics products that revolutionize the fixed income market place. Our application suite includes high precision pricing algorithms, accurate end-of-day price generation systems, liquidity hubs for storing and retrieving pricing information, sophisticated user interfaces and big data analytics platforms. These products are extensively used by various market players such as portfolio managers, risk officers, analysts and traders.

Foreign Exchange

The Foreign Exchange (FX) group provides market leading analytic functionality and award-winning currency pricing and data. Because FX trades are over the counter (bank to bank; not traded in exchanges), it is important for traders to have transparency into market prices. Our tools provide this service in real-time and allow users to perform FX forwards analytics on them. We develop high visibility applications for FX valuation, idea generation and price discovery workflows, as well as high volume real-time pricing engines.

Commodities

The Commodities group builds products that offer transparency in supply, demand, and pricing of oil, power, natural gas, metals and agricultural goods. We build systems and functionality to house everything from hourly power transmission rates to 15-minute updates on ship movements. Technical opportunities run the gamut from architecting systems to designing databases to UI development. Another aspect of this group is to track and manage the lifecycle of millions of futures and options securities across 100+ exchanges around the world. Our futures and options product makes discoverability of such securities easy, which proves to be a very important for our clients in a dynamic environment.

Economics

The Economics group puts the fundamentals of our economy in front of hundreds of thousands of clients every day. We develop the tools that manage real-time releases of economic statistics coming from governments around the world. We also develop analytics and visualizations of economic data to help users better understand the underpinnings of our financial system.

Equity

The Equity group's product is used by over 100,000 financial professionals worldwide to make investment decisions aimed at increasing alpha. This functionality is among the most used across the Bloomberg terminal and is invaluable to clients. The product allows for clear understanding of vast global data sets spanning 30+ years, big data analytics, real-time alerting and complex financial data. We build applications for discovering and analyzing market trends, aggregating and evaluating analyst predictions, and screening and back-testing investment ideas. The group is made up of fast-paced teams passionate about time-to-market, performance and visual design.

Fixed Income Core

The Fixed Income Core group develops software to support analytics and data that move global fixed income markets. We cover government, corporate, money market, municipal and preferred instruments. Our clients depend on our pricing algorithms, high performance calculation libraries, trading applications and real-time big data analysis to make informed decisions. Our applications are used a million times a day and our APIs are invoked billions of times a day.

item.title: Data Processing Engineer at Criteo (Paris, France)
item.description:
Your Mission:


Build the appropriate infrastructure to store more than tens of TB of additional data every day, and offer both batch and nearline processing capabilities, at a rate of 300,000 messages per second per datacenter, across six datacenters.


Fully automate the administration of thousands of servers with a fully open source approach using Chef.


Datacenter as a computer: efficient usage of all hardware with a common storage and computation platform using Yarn / Mesos.


High stakes, high rewards: 1% increase in performance may yield millions for the company.


Develop open source projects. Because we are working at the forefront of technology, we are dealing with problems that few have faced. We’re big users of open source, and we’d like to give back to the community.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Datto Inc (Boston, MA)
item.description: Overview: Datto is seeking an experienced software engineer with strong leadership and mentoring skills who desires “hands on” development as an ongoing part of their role. The role requires an engineer well-grounded in software-engineering fundamentals, experienced in Agile development, and able to make practical business tradeoffs to deliver maintainable, well-constructed and crazy-useful software for our end-users. About the Company: We are the fastest growing technology company in Connecticut, with an established development office in Boston (formerly Backupify). We specialize in backup and disaster recovery solutions, and we are the leader in our space. Our offerings include backups of cloud applications and this role is focused on continued development of those cloud-to-cloud backup products. Datto is trusted by thousands of organizations and millions of end-users to securely and reliably backup their business data. With over 100 petabytes of data under management and a fast-growing customer base, we continually challenge ourselves and our architecture to reach new levels of scalability. With our agile methodologies, small-team organization, fast-paced development and innovation-focused values we offer the benefits of a startup culture within a profitable company of 400+ employees. About the Role: Day to day work includes coding from the position of team lead, participating and leading design and code reviews, and actively mentoring more junior team members in both software-design and implementation. You’ll participate in architectural direction and have the opportunity to own and lead the design and implementation of new features and improvements. We’re continually re-evaluating our architectural needs, so an experienced engineer is needed to help make informed decisions about new technologies that can scale and how to transition legacy systems.

item.title: Senior Software Developer - Enterprise Evaluated Pricing at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:

Data License (DL) is Bloomberg's market-leading enterprise reference data product. We build and maintain high-performance systems that process & deliver billions of data points per day. Our customers are key financial players that use our products to power their trading applications, settlement, risk management, corporate action processing, and much more. As a result, they require our system to be ultra-reliable and our data to be of the highest quality. Our product lines offer a variety of programmatic interfaces to a wide range of information on nearly all types of financial instruments including fixed income, CDS, currencies, equities, and futures & options. We interact closely with our business and sales teams and have many opportunities to design and develop innovative solutions to satisfy customer demands.

The Bloomberg Valuations (BVAL) product calculates pricing for over 2 million liquid and illiquid fixed income securities at several snapshots throughout the day. DL delivers this premium evaluated pricing data with related regulatory information to enterprise customers in order to meet requirements such as Net Asset Valuation calculations. We build solutions which calculate, validate, QC and deliver millions of data points in very short amount of time to fulfill client needs throughout the day. This rapidly growing product requires a highly efficient, scalable, and fault-tolerant architecture. To address the scalability needs of this product, we are working on a proof of concept using Hadoop. We are looking to dramatically increase our regulatory statistical offering by adding a suite of new products. These new offerings will allow our clients to evaluate their portfolio risks and help them meet the many new regulatory requirements that have been introduced and are currently being legislated.

In order to help us continue expanding our market share & reach, we are looking for a software developer to help us design and implement flexible, usable, and performant systems. We need a candidate who is detail oriented, has strong communication & problem solving skills, and has the desire to work in a close-knit team environment. Our work atmosphere is fast paced, spirited, and friendly. You will have the opportunity to work with a wide variety of different technologies - C++, Python, Perl, Java, Javascript, Hadoop - whatever it takes to get the job done.

item.title: Sr. Software Engineer at Logi Analytics (McLean, VA)

Sr. Software Engineer



COMPANY OVERVIEW



Founded in 2000, Logi Analytics provides businesses the fastest and easiest way to deliver business analytics, dashboards, and reports to a broad range of users, as well as to embed them into existing applications – all for a fraction of the cost of other solutions. Unlike traditional Business Intelligence platforms that are complex and costly, Logi Analytics’ agile technology allows organizations to rapidly develop, deploy, and adapt BI applications that serve any number of users on any platform all without extensive development or professional services. Logi Analytics is headquartered in McLean, Virginia, with sales and support offices in the UK and Europe.  Logi Analytics is a privately held, venture-backed firm with investments from Updata Partners, GroTech Ventures, Summit Partners and LLR Partners. For more information, visit LogiAnalytics.com.



SUMMARY



This position will work closely with Development, QA, and Product Management to design and implement features and capabilities for Logi Analytics’ product line.



General:

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

item.title: Java Devops Engineer at Spinn3r (San Francisco, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Ideal Candidate


We are looking for candidates outside of the U.S. and Canada to maximize our time zone distribution. Ideally there should be least a 4 hour overlap with the Pacific Standard Time Zone (PST / UTC-8). We're based out of San Francisco but are migrating to the international level. If you don't have a natural time overlap with UTC-8 you should be willing to work evenings to be able to communicate easily with the rest of the team.


We're interested in someone comfortable with a generalist and devops role. You should be knowledgeable of standard system administration tasks and have a firm understanding of the role of load balancers and cluster architecture. It's 100x harder to write code if you don't know how the underlying operating system works.


We are also looking for someone with a legitimate passion for technology, big data, and analyzing vast amounts of content.


Culturally, we're a remote company and want to embrace it as a way to reward our employees. We are fine with you working in remote locations as long as you're generally available for communication and are productive.


We want someone to come in full time as a contractor role. I suspect we will need about 40 hours from you per week.  


Job Responsibilities:



  • Understanding our crawler infrastructure and ensuring top quality metadata for our customers. There's a significant batch job component to analyze the output from the crawl to ensure top quality data.

  • Making sure our infrastructure is fast, reliable, fault tolerant, etc. At times this may involve diving into the source of tools like ActiveMQ, Cassandra and understand how the internals work. We contribute a LOT to Open Source development if our changes need to be given back to the community.

  • Building out new products and technology that will directly interface with customers. This includes cool features like full text search, analytics, etc. It's extremely rewarding to build something from ground up and push it to customers directly. 


Architecture:


Our infrastructure consists of Java on Linux (Debian/Ubuntu) with the stack running on ActiveMQ, Cassandra, Zookeeper, and Jetty. We use Ansible to manage our boxes. We have a full-text search engine based on Elasticsearch and store our firehose API data within Cassandra.


We have a totally new stack and infrastructure at this point. We recently did a full-stack rewrite and moved all the old code to our new infrastructure. This means we have very little legacy cruft to deal with.


Here's all the cool stuff you get to play with:



  • Large Linux / Ubuntu cluster running with the OS versioned using both Ansible and our own debian packages for software distribution.

  • Massive amount of data indexed from the web and social media.  We index from 5-20TB of data per month and want to expand to 100TB of data per month.

  • Large Cassandra install on SSD.  

  • SOLR / Elastic Search migration / install.  We’re experimenting with bringing this up now so it would be valuable to get your feedback.


Compensation:



  • Salary based on experience. We're willing to be competitive and a great company to work for.

  • Ability to work remotely at home. Live work balance is a must.

item.title: SQL DBA - use your SQL expertise to help us keep London moving! at Transport for London (London, UK)

We work in an agile, fast-paced environment. There’s a real buzz about the team. We’re constantly innovating our processes and technologies to deliver fresh solutions. And as we’re using one of the only data stores of its kind in the country – a 150-terabyte data warehouse on the Microsoft Analytics Platform – we’re always learning new ways we can push it.

item.title: Communication, News, And Realtime Applications And Services Developer (C++) at Bloomberg LP (London, UK)
item.description:
We develop key applications that the financial community relies on to interact with one another and to keep abreast of key news and market moving information. Our responsibilities include communication tools such as Bloomberg's proprietary Email and Instant Message products, Notes and Contact Management systems, News, Market Alerts and Monitoring applications. These are delivered across both desktop and mobile platforms. Our products are built to handle high volume, low latency and high availability. In addition, we build the core systems that form the foundation of applications built by other software groups within Bloomberg.

We have a deep understanding of our product areas and work closely with our business counterparts and UX design teams to deliver the experience desired by our customers. As the speed of change is rapid we need people who are agile and eager to learn and develop new skills. The ability to collaborate across multiple teams and learn a depth and breadth of technical and domain knowledge is critical.

We frequently work with open source software and encourage interaction with the wider technology community by contributing changes and taking part in related meet-ups and conferences.

Teams in Communication, News, and Realtime Applications and Services:

Bloomberg Chat

Bloomberg Chat is Bloomberg's instant messaging system. It is used by the entire Bloomberg community for real-time communication to exchange quotes, trade ideas, news and other financial information. The Bloomberg Chat team in London is responsible for ensuring the fast and efficient distribution of content through our data centers to the client application running on our customers' desktops.

Message and Collaboration

Internet Message - The Bloomberg Message system delivers over 300 million messages every day. The Internet Message system converts messages between email and Bloomberg's proprietary Message format. Software written by the team must be scalable, fault tolerant and secure. Our work also includes evolving and extending our solutions for detecting spam, malware and phishing.

Contact Management - Bloomberg's most popular functions are its communication tools (Message and Chat). Users of these systems need a fast, secure and reliable way to store their contact information. The Bloomberg contact management system contains data on over 50 million contacts, all of which can be queried in under a millisecond. In the last 12 months, we developed a brand new interface, which we continue to evolve. Our focus this year is our backend systems as we work on improving performance and scalability.

Notes - Notes is an exciting new product being developed to further improve the collaboration capabilities of the Bloomberg system. It will enable users to annotate and curate Bloomberg content for quick retrieval and organization, providing insightful ways to analyze user-generated content.

Mobile

The Mobile team has the charge to take Bloomberg's key financial and foundational applications and deliver them to all major mobile platforms. We are a mix of both client side iOS and Android specialists, and other backend developers focused on infrastructure who use their platform native skills mixed with C++ to deliver an immersive mobile experience. Developers are involved in full end to end development of native UI components and the required client and server infrastructure that connects devices to Bloomberg data services. Security and usability concerns are also a major focus for our team.

News Editing & Workflow

The News Editing and Workflow team is responsible for the tools used by the Bloomberg News organization for the timely release of accurate, market moving news. The team also develops the Bloomberg News Automation suite, which generates thousands of news stories per day with minimal latency, which is triggered by realtime Bloomberg market data and events.

News Search

The News Search team owns the search and alerting backend behind the news functionality across Bloomberg. This is one of the most widely used functions on the Bloomberg Terminal. It serves timely, accurate and market moving news to our customers by sifting through hundreds of millions of news stories. Our customers can search, analyze and set alerts for the news that matters to them in milliseconds. Developers work on scalable, low-latency solutions by making use of search and information retrieval technologies, and working with distributed systems running on dedicated farms of machines.

Realtime Applications

Alerts - The Alert product lets market participants monitor the markets. It exposes nearly every tick in the world, along with a broad range of non-pricing data from corporate actions to social media sentiment and even power station outages. The system is available 24/7 and is used by tens of thousands of traders and investors helping them respond quickly to changing market conditions. Alerts are a major strategic focus for the company and we are scaling our infrastructure and extending our feature set significantly.

Monitors - The Monitors team is responsible for providing industry-leading, comprehensive, fully custom cross-asset quote sheet applications. 200,000 of our clients rely on these applications every day. The team deploys Bloomberg's latest proprietary technologies and UI framework by making further UX improvements, while maintaining a strong focus on performance and reliability.

Trade Ideas - The Trade Ideas application allows users to exchange investment research and recommendations in order to demonstrate their skills. The Trade Ideas Platform comprises high-performance distributed multi-threaded services, real-time publishing, both SQL and NoSQL databases, with desktop, web and mobile clients.

item.title: C++ Developer for Low Latency Trading at Arbillon Capital AG (Wollerau, Switzerland)
item.description: Arbillon Capital AG (www.arbillon.com) is looking to add a software engineer to its low latency algorithmic trading group. The candidate will focus on further development, maintenance and improving the real-time performance of the trading system across software, network and hardware components.

item.title: Senior Full Stack Engineer- Building a new cutting edge platform!!!!! at Zipcar (Boston, MA)
item.description:
Zipcar, the world’s largest car-sharing company, is looking to add new senior talent to our Engineering team.


Today, Zipcar provides hundreds of thousands of people with a viable alternative to traditional car ownership, saving them money, time and headaches. Around the world—from coast to coast, across Canada, the UK, and college campuses in between—people are making the decision to live car free and enjoying the convenience and environmental benefits of having “wheels when you want them”.



We’re working to transform Zipcar from its ‘startup roots’ into ‘a world-class engineering organization’. The new platform we’re building is going to take Zipcar all over the world. We’re building a global platform to take car-sharing everywhere.


From an organizational standpoint, we’re going ‘deep into Agile’. We’ve launched a bunch of Agile teams and they are essentially self-directed. We’re pushing technical decision making and freedom to choose approaches down to the team level. We’re empowering engineers and teams to make decisions. Even our Leadership Team (including the President) does a ‘daily standup’.


The technology choices we’re standardizing on are:



  • Native Mobile applications on Android and iOS. Our goal is to launch new functionality on ‘mobile first’ wherever it makes sense.

  • Big Data technologies like Hadoop, Cassandra, Apache Spark, Clojure, Haskel, machine learning, etc are going to be core to what we do.

  • All back-end services are going to be written in Ruby, Scala or Java. Mobile apps are all native.



Responsibilities:



  • Senior member of an agile team focused on delivering components of the next generation Zipcar technology platform.

  • Work to achieve engineering quality standards that our members will love and that you and your team will be proud of.

  • Responsible for the delivery a series of small, discrete applications leveraging Ruby, Java and/or Scala in a fast-paced, team-focused environment

  • Lead the development of applications leveraging traditional and non-traditional data stores, such as Hadoop, Cassandra and others.


Requirements:



  • The desire to work as part of an agile team

  • 5+ years of experience in Scala/Play, Java, or Ruby development for the web

  • Must have experience using non-traditional data stores such as Hadoop, Cassandra or MongoDB.

  • The skill and desire to create well-tested software using current tools.

  • Experience with SOA, microservice and/or RESTful design patterns

  • Experience with applications having 100s to 1000s or more concurrent users.

  • Experience building web applications using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript


The Ideal Candidate Has:



  • A solid understanding of Kanban, Scrum and other agile concepts

  • Experience with multiple programming languages, with at least one being JVM-based, such as Java, JRuby or Scala.

  • An understanding of Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery

  • Experience in deploying applications using tools such as AWS, Docker, or Cloud Foundry

  • Experience using JavaScript frameworks such as Backbone, Ember or Angular

  • Experience using data with predictive and other analytic approaches

  • Experience deploying and tuning large-scale applications built on top of the JVM

  • Exposure to mobile development on iOS or Android

  • Experience interfacing with telematics infrastructure and geospatial data

  • A commitment to Zipcar’s ideals of sustainable resource sharing and urban mobility


As a member of the Zipcar Team you will receive:



  • Competitive Compensation

  • Competitive Benefits Package

  • Free Membership

  • Discounts on services, products and much more


While we appreciate every applicant’s interest, only those under consideration will be contacted. We regret that phone calls will not be accepted.


Zipcar is an EEO Employer - Minorities / Females / Protected Veterans / Disabled


To all recruitment agencies: Zipcar does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Zipcar employees or any other company location. Zipcar is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

item.title: Web Developer at AlchemyAPI, an IBM Watson Company (Denver, CO)
item.description:
You’re a developer who loves to optimize process flows and leverage data to build automations. You pride yourself on the ability to move up and down the stack and enjoy tasks like setting up the database schema as much as building out the front-end. If this sounds like you, we’d love to sync up.

In this role, you will work with different types of data and develop process efficiencies that generate a positive impact on the business. The right candidate sees the value that data represents and has a strong desire to utilize this asset to derive insights that improve decision making and enhance customer relationships.

item.title: Systems Architect at Wiland, Inc. (Niwot, CO)
item.description:
Wiland is seeking dedicated, high caliber professionals who are smart and energetic, have a positive attitude and take pride in their work. Currently, we have an opening for a Systems Architect. The Systems Architect will collaborate with the Architecture Team and software designers to engineer a secure, scalable, and extensible application infrastructure for Wiland Products. This individual guides the software design process to ensure the project objectives and requirements are met with an effective solution compatible with the existing architecture. This Architect performs a variety of technical activities for assigned projects and maintenance requests as dictated by business priorities. The primary responsibilities of the Systems Architect include:




  1. Collaborate with Architects, Design Leads, Software Development Directors, and DBAs on high-level design, data modeling, and process flows as defined by the Wiland development methodology.

  2. Review detail designs (process flows, process specifications, pseudo-code) for assigned development projects.

  3. Assist in writing and publishing the Development Standards and Best Practices for use by the software development teams.

  4. Ensure adherence to established software development standards and guidelines.

  5. Evaluate and recommend tools and technologies for development of enterprise software.

item.title: Web Developer at Merck & Company Inc. (Branchburg, NJ)
item.description:
Merck is a global health care leader with a diversified portfolio of prescription medicines, vaccines and consumer health products, as well as animal health products. Today, we are building a new kind of healthcare company - one that is ready to help create a healthier future for all of us.

Our ability to excel depends on the integrity, knowledge, imagination, skill, diversity and teamwork of people like you. To this end, we strive to create an environment of mutual respect, encouragement and teamwork. As part of our global team, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate with talented and dedicated colleagues while developing and expanding your career.

Applied Technology is working to better understand new and emerging technologies, particularly those concerned with data discovery, natural language processing, search, and data provenance. As the research and understanding of the tools and techniques becomes wider, Merck can leverage them to bring efficiencies into its operations, deliver better education to patients, and make data more easily accessible.


This position will require the candidate to write code, model and experiment with new technologies in the realm of search, natural language processing, and machine learning. The team will provide specific recommendations on an approach to move forward with a more robust "search by example" pilot.


The candidate will gain exposure to bleeding edge technologies and focus areas such as data provenance, inference, recommendation, index, and visualization. The candidate will also work closely with industry leading technologists and think tanks. Some of the technologies the candidate will work on include:



  • MEAN Stack - MongoDB, Express, Angular, NodeJS

  • LAMP Stack - Unix/Linux, Apache, MongoDB, PHP, Python

  • Graph databases (NEO4J, Google Cayley)

  • Data visualization tools (D3.js)

  • API design and implementation

  • Search engines (Elasticsearch, Solr, etc.)

  • Languages (Erlang, Go, etc.)

item.title: Automation Engineer at Logentries (Dublin, Ireland)
item.description: The Automation  Engineer will be part of a growing team focused on building an industry leading cloud based infrastructure. Come join a dynamic startup while learning the latest technology, Big Data, Cloud based platforms, and business analytics. You will work with other team members to build testing frameworks, insure quality of our products and develop methodology around best practices for performance and integration. item.title: Infrastructure Production Developer at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
Bloomberg Careers - Infrastructure Production Developer 


The Role:


Bloomberg's Infrastructure Production group in R&D delivers a wide range of technologies for the Bloomberg environment. The team builds out common services that every Bloomberg team can use and consume to monitor, visualize and diagnose their applications and infrastructure. We also are the forefront in implementing modern technology ideology within the organization and assist all of the teams with implementation, automation and design. The Production Engineering team is a new team inside of the Bloomberg environment and is one of the most fast paced and soon to be widely used across the entire company. You will have the ability to be apart of a large cultural shift within the Bloomberg organization. If you like large scale systems, billions of data points a day, automating all of the things, hacking on opensource software and making a cultural impact, ask us where to sign up.


What You'll Do:



  • Design, architect, automate and deliver large scale production ready services for Bloomberg Employees to consume.

  • Build internal tools to monitor, visualize and diagnose all aspects of applications & hardware in the Bloomberg stack.

  • Work closely with our product and platform teams with architecture, design and scaling challenges they may have.

  • Help teams replace legacy software and design patterns with modern technologies.

  • Develop and maintain documentation, training and SLAs for managed infrastructure

item.title: Software Engineer in Test - Data.com at Salesforce (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Salesforce is transforming the data industry with its Data.com cloud by bringing together the rich set of business contacts and company profiles. With this high quality data, professionals from sales, marketing, service, recruiting, etc, can use it and be more productive and effective in their business. Data.com includes over 30 million accurate community sourced business contacts and over 200 million accurate company profiles from Dun & Bradstreet. The combination of contact and account data along with social insight is exactly what businesses need to succeed in today’s mobile, social and open world. 


You will be working with world-class talented technical team and in the fast-paced, innovative environment to deliver a high traffic, high performance enterprise application & platform. As a fast growing company, our goal is to build an organization of smart and ambitious people, committed to our mission of building a billion dollar data business.

 Responsibilities:



  •  Create test plans and test case using test case management system

  •  Plan, design and enhance automation test framework

  •  Perform both manual and automation tests

  •  Automation test cases

  •  Validate code changes against existing test suites

  •  Investigate test and production failures, perform root-cause analysis and

  •  Create detailed, high-quality error reports

  •  Participate in product and feature design with developers
