item.title: System Engineer, Platform & Big Data Services at Peak Games (Istanbul, Turkey)
item.description:
System Engineer, Platform & Big Data Services


Peak Games' Technical Operations team (TechOps) is responsible for building, scaling and maintaining highly available systems, and is also the first line of defense against all outages. TechOps detects and solves the issues in a proactive manner. Because of being a service department, TechOps engineers have limitless exposure to all technologies used in the infrastructure of all games, including numerous bleeding edge technologies. We are looking for system engineers that want to automate just about everything you can think of and build a development and deployment pipeline and set of tools that can effectively deliver our games and services. Our team is responsible for automating the entire stack of high performance, large scale, geographically dispersed resources throughout its life-cycle. We have an app stack that will challenge you and diversify your skills. Ideal candidates will have experience of AWS and/or other cloud tech. You will be building our infrastructure in AWS, EC2 or our own private hardware and software resources. You will work side by side with our engineering teams and architects to design and implement a scalable and robust cloud delivery infrastructure.


Major Responsibilities/Activities



  • Work closely with the engineering teams to design, deliver and manage our services with high uptime

  • Participate in failure, load and performance tests to ensure applications are production ready

  • Ensure security of the production infrastructure, systems and applications

  • Engage in the development of continuous integration strategy. Define, develop and maintain CI processes and systems

  • Automate, implement, administer, and maintain our databases, local and cloud-based servers including provisioning, backups and restores, upgrades, and monitoring

item.title: Senior DevOps Engineer at LiveRamp (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
ABOUT LIVERAMP


LiveRamp is the leading data onboarder, enabling marketers to unify their customer database across disparate online marketing applications and leverage it for analytics, targeting, measurement, content optimization, and more.


ABOUT THIS JOB


Join our team and help us operate and optimize an environment with hundreds of machines and a four petabyte (and growing) Hadoop cluster. We write code to make administering that hardware a breeze, and work on projects alongside the rest of the LiveRamp engineering team. Your responsibility will be to do whatever it takes to get the job done -- one day it could be installing racks of hardware, the next day it could be scripting the deployment of a heterogenous environment of dozens of virtual machines.


We run a hybrid colo/EC2 environment with over 400 physical servers and at least as many virtual servers. We are responsible for ensuring high availability and low latency for the billions of HTTP requests we receive every day.


RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Maintain and grow our existing hardware/software infrastructure. Create tools for managing our massive hardware resources; fight to make our server:sysadmin ratio ridiculously high.

  • Optimize like crazy; squeeze every bit of performance out of our servers.

  • Work closely with developers to solve systems problems. Blur the line between ops and dev.

  • Code, script, and change hardware (disks, laptops, servers, etc.); support network, desktop, and security.

  • Help build a great company.

  • Automate everything! Especially in Amazon where instances appear and disappear constantly.


QUALIFICATIONS



  • B.S. degree in C.S, I.S., Mathematics, or comparable.

  • 3+ years of work experience in DevOps in Linux SysAdmin role, preferably in a fast-paced web application environment.

  • Smart, friendly, gets stuff done.

  • Loves hardware. Probably owns a soldering iron.

  • Lives at the command line.

  • Likes to code. Our ops team is unique; we are part of the development team. Seeking someone with at least two languages, such as Ruby, Bash, Java, Python, Perl.

  • Experience and interest in hardware and systems; you like the nitty-gritty of Linux.

  • Working knowledge of TCP/IP, ICMP, SSH, LDAP, DNS, and other low-level network things.

  • Working knowledge of storage, NAS, clustered file systems, RAID.

  • Virtualization experience (Xen, KVM, VMware or OpenVZ).

  • AWS or other Cloud management experience.

  • Intensely driven and proactive.

  • Ability to learn quickly.

  • Great team and business communication skills; project management communication ability.


Desired Additional skills:



    Puppet or other configuration management system experience highly desired, such as Ansible, CFEngine, or Chef. 
    Hadoop, MapReduce.
    Experience with petabytes of data

EMPLOYEE BENEFITS:



  • Stock. Every employee is a stakeholder in our future. 

  • Food. Enjoy catered meals, boundless snacks, and the occasional food truck.

  • Fun. We host events such as game nights, happy hours, camping trips, and sports leagues. 

  • People. Work with talented, collaborative, and friendly people who love what they do.

  • Health and Saving. Receive the benefits of comprehensive health, dental, vision and disability insurance along with a 401k matching plan.

  • Location. Work in the heart of San Francisco – the best city in the world, and take advantage of our commuter benefits.

item.title: VP of Engineering at Crisis Text Line (New York, NY)
item.description:
Overview: Crisis Text Line is a data and tech driven not-for-profit. We've built our own online platform for engaging with people in crisis (think: suicide, self-harm, domestic violence, etc) over SMS using standard, open web technologies.


How we work:



  • Fail intelligently. We're always do our absolute best work, but we're ready to fail at any moment so we build with redundancy and fault-tolerance.

  • Pick the right tool. Technology is a means, not an end. We try to see where the bleeding edge is, but live in the realm of reality and practicality.

  • Hack this site. Seriously. We're the type of people who think hackthissite.org is one of the coolest places on the internet, so everything we build has an eye to keeping things safe.

  • Access control. Alice and Bob are our best friends, but we know that Alice and Bob are inherently untrustworthy. We write your code to make sure Alice and Bob can’t conspire against us or our users.

  • Speed. People expect a response to a text message in under 14 minutes. We’re shooting for no more than 5. That means the platform needs to run fast, and crisis counselors need to be able to use it efficiently and effectively.

  • Testing. Testing isn’t just clicking buttons. Testing means optimizing user experience and listening to your users rather than your gut. And of course, running automated tests too. You would never deploy untested code into production. Duh.

  • Cloud. We think scale. The cloud isn’t a solution, it’s an assumption.


Our team:



  • Custom, home-grown Symfony2 app for SMS-web interaction

  • Drupal 7 installation for managing remote volunteers

  • Slack chat bots because `@robot animate me <kittens>` is important

  • 1 CTO, 3 engineers, and we're hiring at least 3 more engineers in the coming months

item.title: Experienced Front-End Engineer at Geckoboard (London, UK)
item.description:
Geckoboard is a successful and growing 25-person B2B SaaS startup based in East London. Our elegant, real-time dashboards solve a difficult but valuable problem for thousands of paying subscribers, by taking the complexity out of connecting to their data and making that data simple for anyone to interpret at a glance. As a result, our customers unlock data they didn't know they had, connect people and join up projects, and make better decisions faster.


We are looking for a full-time senior front-end engineer who has built rich JavaScript clients. You’ll be opinionated, but contemplative. You won’t immediately reach for your favourite framework or library when approaching a problem. You'll be comfortable liaising with our product designer on design and implementation. You’ll relish the opportunity to continually improve an existing product through refactoring and the removal/addition of features.


Displaying complicated data to our customers so they can easily understand what’s going on and make actionable decisions is a big challenge. We're constantly tweaking and improving how we visualise data on Geckoboard, whether through adding more visualizations or updating what we have.


At Geckoboard you will:



  • Write clean, modular, test driven code

  • Implement visual design from prototypes

  • Test compatibility with various browsers

  • Pick the best library for the job

  • Care about web performance 


More than anything, we value candidates who are excited about picking up new skills and sharing what they’ve learned with the rest of the team - for example, none of us knew Go or React a short time ago, but now both are key parts of our stack. We love people with a keen attention to detail and the willingness to apply it in shaping all aspects of our product.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - Bloomberg Mail Infrastructure at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
Bloomberg Mail is a cloud-based platform used for Internet email, bond announcements and pricing, financial research distribution and many other types of communication on the Bloomberg Terminal. Our users rely on Bloomberg Mail because of its real-time performance, massive scale, ironclad security, tight integration with financial data and applications on the Bloomberg Terminal, unique features like message retraction and "your message was read!" notification, machine learning-based message classification and, most importantly, singular access to the Bloomberg network of 350,000 financial professionals. We are looking for exceptional Senior Software Engineers who are interested in designing and building the next generation of this unparalleled product.

Our system is built on top of Open Source, commercial and proprietary technologies. This highly available, large-scale distributed system includes a comprehensive storage and search infrastructure, real-time email transport and delivery pipeline, real-time classification engine for user-based and machine learning-based tagging, APIs for integration with other applications and systems, as well as a feature-rich and powerful user-interface optimized for our specialized customers.

The Mail team is looking for C/C++ experts who are interested in working on high-performance infrastructure. A developer in this role will work in a highly distributed, multi-threaded environment on problems including indexing and retrieval of mail and files for both core databases and Search, APIs to that data for internal clients, and ensuring stability and scalability of a system that has increased its traffic 20% year over year for the last five years.

item.title: Software Developer: Casual Data-Driven Firm at TFS Capital (West Chester, PA)
item.description:
TFS Capital LLC is a boutique asset management firm in West Chester, PA. We are seeking a well-rounded software developer to join our development team. This developer will help maintain and expand our proprietary automated data-driven trading systems. As a key member of a small development team, you will be an integral part of all aspects of our mission-critical trading infrastructure. In addition to working with existing systems, you will be assisting with making and implementing design decisions for new and improved data and software architecture. The position is full-time in our West Chester, PA office.


Technology is at the heart of our business. At TFS, you and the rest of the technology team will work directly with traders, quants, and portfolio managers to solve interesting and challenging problems using technology. Your actions will directly impact the success of our business.


TFS Capital will not consider applicants who require H1-B Visa sponsorship for this position.


Key responsibilities



  • Work with the rest of the development team to expand and maintain the firm’s proprietary software systems

  • Work directly with the trading desk, analysis team, portfolio managers, and other business groups to support existing systems and implement new ideas

  • Onboard new, diverse, large datasets and create appropriate ETL processes


About the IT Team
We are a small team of developers and operations admins who work together to develop, maintain, and expand our in-house trading software. In addition to our code, we integrate and assist with development of code from other teams, including the traders and analysts. We work directly with traders and analysts daily, and most of the TFS team on a regular basis.


We’re primarily a Windows shop, but use Linux where it fits best. The bulk of our software is written in Java, but we also have a ton of Perl and MATLAB, and some Python and C#. We use Microsoft SQL Server for relational data storage.

item.title: Lead/Senior Software Engineer - Data Infrastructure Engineering at Udemy (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Lets Go.

Lets go inspire 100 million people learn anything they can imagine. Lets go inspire 100,000 instructors to share their knowledge with the world. Lets go help 10,000 businesses to change the way their employees learn.

Learn. Empathize. Take Ownership. nnovate. Show Passion.

Get Stuff Done. Open Up.

ABOUT UDEMY

Udemy is an online marketplace where anyone in the world can take or teach a course on virtually anything, whenever and wherever they want. Our mission is to empower on-demand learning thats accessible to all by offering instruction in a way thats affordable, simple, and flexible, so individuals can fulfill their limitless potential on their own terms.

Our more than 7 million students can gain skills to launch a new career, advance in their current field, or try something new for their own personal development by choosing from more than 30,000 courses in 80+ languages. Our instructors are passionate experts who want to share their knowledge with a broad audience. Udemy also works with companies to help them develop more effective and engaging skills-based training for their employees.

Founded in 2010, Udemy is privately owned and funded by Stripes Group, Norwest Venture Partners, Insight Venture Partners, Lightbank, MHS Capital, Learn Capital, and 500 Startups, among others. Udemy is headquartered in San Franciscos SOMA neighborhood and has offices in Dublin, Ireland, and Ankara, Turkey. Compensation includes full time salary, equity compensation plan, and competitive benefits (including healthcare, commuter benefits and an unlimited vacation policy).  

Job Description:

  • Build robust and scalable data infrastructure (both offline and real-time) to support needs from different teams around the company.

  • Manage the data infrastructure and do necessary capacity planning.

  • May get involved in various projects/tasks as needed. This may involve some project planning, resource planning, and deployment planning in additional to his/her current software engineering responsibilities

  • May require mentoring  junior engineers to become proficient developers using best software development practices and processes

  • Lead by example and contribute to a team culture that values quality, robustness, and scalability while fostering initiatives and innovation.

  • Continue to research and evaluate new technologies (such as Spark) that may improve performance and elegance of our data infrastructure.

  • We practice agile development methodologies with two week sprints.

Technologies currently in use or will be in use:

  • Hadoop, Hive, Pig

  • AWS, Elastic MapReduce, Redshift, Kinesis, S3

  • Cassandra, HBase

  • Spark

  • Kafka, Storm

  • Python, Django (experience with Python/Django a big plus)

  • Github

  • MySQL, PostgreSQL

Qualifications:

  • Shown success as an individual contributor. Have consistently demonstrated ability and commitment to deliver major initiatives from beginning to full deployment in a timely manner.

  • Embrace good development practices including design specification, coding standards, unit testing, and code reviews.

  • Exhibited passion for delivering high quality products that meet business requirements

  • Demonstrated knowledge of well known software technologies and services and curiosity to continue to evaluate new technologies to strengthen our platform.

  • Demonstrated ability to work effectively within a team and with cross-functional technical and business teams.

  • Demonstrated ability to solve time-critical problems

  • Have contributed to the development of others through code reviews, tech talks, or personal coaching.

  • Willingness to "go the extra mile" when needed.

Udemy in the News:

TechCrunch: Udemy Raises Another $65 Million To Help Anyone Learn Anything

Wall Street Journal: Udemy Raises $65 Million to Become Netflix for Education

Bloomberg: Why LinkedIn Is Tapping Into Online Education

Forbes: Closing The Skills Gap: How Udemy Is Helping Anyone Learn Anything

SFGate: Company culture, collaboration is focus at Udemy

item.title: Platform Engineer at Keen IO (San Francisco, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Keen IO is seeking engineers to join our Platform team. We build and nurture an Analytics API that processes user data and queries around the clock, across diverse industries. Whether it’s gaming, e-commerce, advertising, publishing, or IoT, our platform aims to make Analytics so easy for developers that they can focus entirely on their product. Every day, every week, every month our challenge is to scale with a constantly growing data deluge and evolve along with our user’s needs.


About the Platform Team


We work together in a pretty novel fashion - servant leaders are elected from the team, by the team. Responsibilities normally held by a single manager are separated across multiple roles. We have very open discussions about our shared priorities.


We’re always iterating on how we work and what we build. We’re growing fast and we know that what worked a year ago won’t necessarily work a year from now. This applies both to the technology and the organizations of our teams. We want to provide the best analytics experience for developers and co-create the best work environment for each other - willingness to evolve is essential.


About the Job


By centralizing a data pipeline for hundreds of companies, we operate at a scale that none of them have to worry about. Looking to the horizon, we need to look at every piece of our infrastructure with a critical eye. We need to stay ahead of the curve. You will help us be thoughtful and deliberate about tackling the right bottlenecks at the right time. You’ll help make working on the platform easier and easier. You’ll have the opportunity to gain deep understanding of distributed systems and teach others! Most importantly, you’ll collaborate with some pretty amazing humans.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer ASP.NET C# at Frontiers (Lausanne, Switzerland)
item.description:
We are looking for a senior software engineer ASP.NET to join our Software Engineering team and take responsibility for one remote development team.
Your primary responsibilities include:



  • Lead the offshore development team to implement technical and functional improvements to our website and the integration of third party products.

  • Identify opportunities to improve and accelerate the Frontiers platform, both technically and functionally, and coach the team in new technologies.

  • Deep dive in performance and quality improvements.

  • Focus on delivering and maintaining an excellent user experience.

item.title: Cyber and Technology Specialists at DSTL (Porton Down, UK)
item.description:
Serve your country. Help save lives.


In the rapidly evolving world of cyber, it’s never easy to predict the future.  Yet there’s one thing we can guarantee – joining Dstl will give you a valued role in protecting the UK and its citizens, while advancing the cyber-capability our military commanders can use alongside conventional weapons.  



We have a range of positions on offer in our growing cyber team. These are not stereotypical ‘computer hacker’ roles. It takes an incredible range of people to achieve our goals – you may not even consider yourself a ‘cyber’ professional. What you do need is expertise in:



Electronics, Systems Engineering, RF Communications, Networks /Communications/Protocols or Software

item.title: Senior Full Stack Developer - $50/hr at Crossover (Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam) (allows remote)
item.description:
Senior Full Stack Developer - $50/hr



We are mobi. And we’re looking for some more awesome senior developers to help us grow our team. Here’s a little about our team, if you think you’d be a good fit, apply using the link below!



The Company:


mobi is not only headquartered in the fastest growing technology center in the United States, but also literally at the center of it all in Austin, Texas at 7th and Congress.



We code systems that crunch large streams of real-time GPS data by wielding complex geo-location algorithms. Some call it big data, we call it Monday. Our front-end code serves up this data in an easy-as-pie, business-friendly view. We crunch it, and we serve it. mobi provides an end-to-end solution that helps companies plan work, optimize routes, visualize GPS data and analyze the results. We’re innovating here – but we can’t tell you about it, until at least our second date.



The Role:


Our team is all about getting s#!t done. We are pragmatic problem solvers who pull from a diverse technology tool set.




  • Write killer code in many languages – solid and robust




  • Test before, during, and after – TDD on steroids




  • Core tech stack is JVM/Java/Groovy, JS/AngularJS and SQL




  • Thirst and passion for raising the bar and making it better than it is now




  • Social team players in a real open space environment with music and significant shenanigans






  • Have a large tool box: Clojure (functional paradigms), Ruby/Chef/DevOps, Sinatra/Rails, hardcore shell scripting, high performance C++ engines, SQL datamarts, sproc-ing and data pumping; you must have enough tools to use the right one for the job




  • We are real-deal Agile: good design, heavy testing, continuous delivery, pair programming in an open space environment, and lots of communication




  • Have an optimization platform that uses genetic algorithms and economic modeling to create optimal solutions to the ‘Traveling Salesman’ problem




  • Embrace the inner, twisted technologist – hackathons, side projects, open source




  • Enjoy ping pong, nerf bullets, and long walks on the beach ;)

item.title: Full Stack Developer - $30/hr at Crossover (Bucharest, Romania) (allows remote)
item.description:
Full Stack Developer - $30/hr



We are mobi. And we’re looking for some more awesome devs to help us grow our team. Here’s a little about our team, if you think you’d be a good fit, apply using the link below!



The Company:


mobi is not only headquartered in the fastest growing technology center in the United States, but also literally at the center of it all in Austin, Texas at 7th and Congress.

item.title: Linux Operations Engineer at Spinn3r (San Francisco, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Job Responsibilities



  • Make sure our infrastructure stays up and running 24/7.

  • Repair nodes as they fail and deploy new hardware as we scale our infrastructure.

  • Perform task related to deploying new software, managing DNS, maintaining OS security patches, etc.

  • We have an existing infrastructure that you will be managing for the next 90 days as we transition to our new stack.  

  • Deploy new systems and scale our infrastructure as we expand our capacity for more content and customers.


Ideal Candidate


We are looking for people outside of the U.S. and Canada to maximize our time zone distribution. Ideally there should be least a 4 hour overlap with the Pacific Standard Time Zone (PST / UTC-8). We're based out of San Francisco but are migrating to the international level. If you don't have a natural time overlap with UTC-8 you should be willing to work evenings to be able to communicate easily with the rest of the team.


Culturally, we’re a remote company and want to embrace it as a way to reward our employees. We are fine with you working in remote locations as long as you’re generally available for communication and are productive.


The plan is to transfer all operations management to you, including being on call for outages, and knowing our operations tasks including bringing up new machines, dealing with failures, etc.


We want someone to come in full time as a contractor role. I suspect we will need about 40 hours from you per week.  


Architecture:


Our infrastructure consists of Java on Linux (Debian/Ubuntu) with the stack running on ActiveMQ, Cassandra, Zookeeper, and Jetty. We use Ansible to manage our boxes. We have a full-text search engine based on Elasticsearch and store our firehose API data within Cassandra.


We have a totally new stack and infrastructure at this point. We recently did a full-stack rewrite and moved all the old code to our new infrastructure. This means we have very little legacy cruft to deal with.


Here's all the cool stuff you get to play with:



  • Large Linux / Ubuntu cluster running with the OS versioned using both Ansible and our own debian packages for software distribution.

  • Massive amount of data indexed from the web and social media.  We index from 5-20TB of data per month and want to expand to 100TB of data per month.

  • Large Cassandra install on SSD.  

  • SOLR / Elastic Search migration / install.  We’re experimenting with bringing this up now so it would be valuable to get your feedback.


Compensation:



  • Salary based on experience. We're willing to be competitive and a great company to work for.

  • Ability to work remotely at home. Live work balance is a must.

item.title: Newsroom Developer (Front-end Interactive) at Financial Times (London, UK)
item.description:
The Financial Times technology department is hiring a developer to join Interactive News, a joint Technology & Editorial team, working in the newsroom.


We are a cross-functional team of data- visual- and coder-journalists. We work with other reporters and editors from across the FT to develop engaging forms of digital journalism. This includes data visualisation, infographics, maps, multimedia long form articles, microsites, news apps, video graphics and experimentation with audio. We also create tools for the newsroom.


Much of our code is public on Github. Take a look:



  • github.com/financial-times

  • github.com/ft-interactive

item.title: Principal Platform Architect at Coupang (Palo Alto, CA)
item.description:
The Principal Platform Architect is responsible for the design and implementation of Coupang’s backend platform.  Successful candidate will work in a collaborative environment with Coupang’s architecture committee to recommend improvements to our platform.  The candidate will also work closely with strategic agile teams developing new components to enhance the services provided to Coupang’s customers.


Joining the Coupang USA team will give you an opportunity to work with a world-class development team on disruptive technologies and applications including:



  • Highly Scalable and Reliable services oriented architecture

  • Big Data Analytics supporting data collection, modeling, and optimization

  • Strategic domains such as mobile payments, pricing, search, personalization, and supply chain management

  • Consumer driven web and native mobile interfaces and APIs

item.title: Senior C++ Software Engineer at Bloomberg LP (London, UK)
item.description:
The nX Systems R&D team, based in Lugano - Switzerland, is seeking an experienced software engineer with an in-depth knowledge of C++.

You will build resilient, scalable, high-performance back-ends for critical client-facing financial applications.

You will be responsible for the full process of software delivery, starting from feature definition through scoping, implementation, debugging, rollout, monitoring, and maintenance. This includes software development and engineering tasks, as well as coordination and communication.

item.title: Data Scientist (HF) - CDI/Paris at Mosaïc Finance (Paris, France)
item.description:
Nous recherchons un(e) Data Scientist pour travailler au sein de l’équipe de recherche quantitative, en collaboration avec nos équipes informatique (notamment BigData) et de trading. Votre mission principale sera l’exploration des données de marchés et de nos données propriétaires afin de mener des analyses permettant de répondre à nos problématiques fonctionnelles.

Vous participerez entre autres à nos projets de modélisation de la liquidité de marché et de son impact sur le P&L, ou encore à l’optimisation dynamique de nos limites de risque.


Pour cela, vous aurez à :



  • Construire et produire des indicateurs liés à nos activités,

  • Utiliser notre cluster Hadoop afin d’explorer les données stockées en base,

  • Réaliser des analyses pertinentes (de risques, de liquidité, du P&L, de latence…),

  • Créer des modèles de nos données à partir de vos analyses,

  • Intégrer ces modèles/produits dans nos process internes à l’aide de visualisations et d’interfaces utilisateurs.

item.title: Application Developer For IB - Instant Messaging Product at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:

Instant Bloomberg (IB) is Bloomberg's instant messaging system, which is used by the Bloomberg community for real-time communication including exchanging quotes, trade ideas, news and other financial information. We have a user-base unlike any other in the company and handle close to 250 million post events per day. This usage is expected to grow even more in the future.

The IB Application team is responsible for developing/maintaining new client facing features to keep our product competitive and also cater to the growing demands of our clients. We work very closely with our clients and business representatives to seek requirements and implement creative solutions. This position also requires collaborating closely with our core infrastructure teams for UI development thereby providing great opportunities for learning and networking.

item.title: Senior Front-End Developer at Luminus Networks (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
You are an expert front-end developer with at least 6 years of experience and you are deeply familiar with Javascript, HTML and CSS. You live and breathe responsive, API-driven web development and have experience with one or more Javascript MVC frameworks. You have used created striking data visualizations using the D3 framework or similar. You love working with visual designers and realizing their cutting-edge UI/UX in a modern browser environment.


Responsibilities:


-          Develop new user-facing features


-          Invent ways to present very large amounts of data in a concise manner


-          Build reusable code and libraries for future use


-          Ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs


-          Optimize application for maximum speed and scalability


-          Assure that all user input is validated before submitting to back-end


-          Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders

item.title: Web Crawling Frontend Developer at Bloomberg LP (Princeton, NJ)
item.description:
The Role:

Data Technologies R&D in our Princeton, NJ office is seeking a talented, motivated UI programmer to assist in re-imagining and development of our Web Crawler creation application suite. Bloomberg's web crawling technologies are some of the most advanced web scraping capabilities in the world. Candidate must be experienced in designing and coding applications, possess strong object-oriented analysis and design skills, and have experience with web technologies (html, xml, xslt, http). Candidate should have significant experience in the areas of multi-threading and design patterns.

item.title: Software Engineer at Prometheus Research (Atlanta, GA)
item.description:
• Plan, document, build and test Facebook’s React (Javascript Toolkit) enhanced components for our template-driven web application



  • Work with business process analysts to refine user requirements and translate them into a technical plan

  • Engage directly with clients onsite, on customization projects using open-source RexDB framework



  • Participate in design discussions about overall functionality and architecture

  • Report on progress to relevant stakeholders; keep JIRA issue tracker accurate with progress



  • Assist with delivery of semi-custom applications to customers, which may involve developing prototype functionality not yet available in the main product stack

item.title: Systems Engineer at Qadium (San Francisco, CA)
item.description: Qadium is looking for a full-stack Software Engineer with a systems background.  We're looking for people driven to intimately understand the software they create and work with. Do you enjoy building complex systems? Are you always thinking about what would happen if your software had to handle 10X more data? Do you want to work in an environment where you will be able to make an immediate impact writing software that scales? We are looking for an independent, imaginative thinker who can design scalable, reliable solutions to complex problems.

item.title: Team Lead Platform at Watty AB (Stockholm, Sweden)
item.description:
Watty is connecting and making sense of the world's energy data in order to help consumers and companies use energy in smarter way. Our platform already handles 20 million data points per day - and it will be your your job to continue improving our platform to handle a 1000 times more. You will be involved in the whole development cycle from planning to coding and testing to deployment. You would make sure that the development processes flows smoothly to ensure our continuous deployment. You will lead the backend team that currently has two developers and you will report to Watty’s CTO.


Without a strong passion for what we do, and for developing your own skills, you'll find the work here too difficult.


The role offers a unique opportunity to take ownership over Watty's entire platform that may well handle a significant portion of the world's energy data within the next 10 years. You'll work alongside a passionate team that has built the market leading technology in the field of disaggregation. As the Platform Team Lead you will not only be part of the team but also of the company through equity compensation. Read more on watty.io.

item.title: iOS Developer at Toptal (San Francisco, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
We are looking for a Swift and/or Objective-C developer responsible for the development and maintenance of applications aimed at iPhone, iPad, and Apple Watch. Your primary focus will be the development of iOS applications and their integration with back-end services, although some projects may require you to handle all technical aspects, including leveraging BaaS solutions such as Parse. You will be working alongside other engineers and developers working on different layers of the infrastructure. Therefore, a commitment to collaborative problem solving, sophisticated design, and the creation of quality products is essential.


By joining the Toptal network, you’ll have the opportunity to work on many client projects ranging from start-ups to Fortune 500s with teams of highly skilled experts from around the world.


This is a remote position that can be done from anywhere.


Responsibilities



  • Design and build applications for the iOS platform.

  • Ensure the best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications.

  • Collaborate with a team to define, design, and ship new features.

  • Identify bottlenecks and bugs, and devise solutions to these problems.

  • Help maintain code quality, organization, and automation.

  • Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders.

  • Take smart risks and champion new ideas.

item.title: Online Forecasting & Optimisation Analyst at Sainsbury's (London, UK)
item.description:
There’s never been a more exciting time for Online at Sainsbury’s. We’re investing heavily in digital innovation, building a centre of excellence here in Holborn to craft industry-leading methodologies that will produce world-class apps and services. The team is growing rapidly and we’re now looking for an Online Forecasting & Optimisation Analyst to join us.


Responsible for using big data to deliver a real step change in how we understand customers and operational metrics across our Online business. It’s about applying statistical methodology expertise to provide insights and forecasts that will enable us to achieve double-digit sales growth. That means developing demand forecasting systems and figuring out how our customers interact with the Online channel.


As an Online Forecasting & Optimisation Analyst, you’ll:
• Build reusable, mathematical models promoting insight and understanding
• Forecast Online growth
• Use your understanding of complex business problems to analyse and combine large datasets
• Advise on just how detailed our data used to inform business decisions should be
• Communicate complex models to a non-technical audience

item.title: iOS Developer at Fling (London, UK)
item.description:
We’re looking for a product-focused iOS Developer who feels just as comfortable thinking through how a feature feels to a user as they do thinking about the most efficient ways to store and present information. Fling is a quick paced environment where we are always looking to push ourselves to deliver the best experience possible for our end users. This means that anyone who joins our team will have the opportunity to have real impact, where your voice and opinions really count and you're not just building someone else's ideas.


As an iOS developer you will:



  • Have a voice in the way we structure our team and what processes we follow.

  • Work closely with our Design team to help to produce a cutting edge, engaging experience for our users.

  • Participate in tight, collaborative conversations with our Backend team on how to structure our RESTful API endpoints to ensure that the app can get the data it needs in the most efficient manner.


What we need from you:



  • Team player.

  • A passion for iOS, having built and maintained multiple substantial apps from end to end.

  • Experience building consumer products with a wide install base and keeping that base happy through regular updates.

  • Extreme comfort with everything from Core Data and keeping this in sync with the data on the server to building a beautiful interface.

  • A real desire to improve the team by sharing your knowledge through whiteboard sessions, share meetings and everyday interactions.

  • A pragmatic approach to investigating any new tools that could be useful to the team.


Interesting technologies coming up in the pipeline:



  • Unit testing because we need to move quickly and maintain a quality product.

  • AVFoundation because we are really pushing the limits of the camera.

  • OpenGL because the little touches count.

  • XMPP because allowing people to interact is what drives us.

  • Swift because Apple said.

item.title: Senior PHP Backend Developer to work with Real-Time Sports Data at Visca Web (Barcelona, Spain)
item.description:
As we continue our efforts to build and improve the best multi-provider sports database which serves millions of sports fans around the world every year, we are looking for talented and passionate developers who share our objective of producing clean and quality code to join us in this ambitious and challenging project.


Your role: As Senior Backend Developer in Visca Web, you will be part of the team responsible for the core system of the project. You will read, analyze and match voluminous amounts of sports data (match, competitions, teams and players statistics) from several providers, process them and ensure real-time delivery to our users thanks to the latest technologies available.


Beyond programming, you will be expected to solve a variety of technical and logical challenges in a creative and efficient way.

item.title: Senior Java Developer at Eyefreight - Utrecht Area (Bunnik, Netherlands)
item.description:
Working in one of the SCRUM based product teams (10 developers, two architects, three testers, two product owners and a product manager), the Senior Java Developer will be responsible for maintaining, designing and developing the core product’s new functionality, as well as for extending existing functionality - maintaining Eyefreight’s quality and robustness.

In collaboration with the client team, the Senior Java Developer will also extend standard functionality to suit customer needs. Typically, this results in a product configuration containing a bundle of customized screens, actions and system interfaces.

Upcoming projects:



  • Merging the current JSF UI framework to a JavaScript client-side UI framework;

  • B2B integration of customer data concerning sales and transport order data and shipment information, using web services (SOAP and REST) with JAXB and batch processing;

  • Integration of a search engine for efficient querying of data, reducing database load;

  • Dependency injection within the OSGi context using OSGi Blueprint Service specification.

item.title: Solution Architect to Design Global Retail Technology at Footlocker.com / Eastbay (Wausau, WI)
item.description:
Footlocker.com / Eastbay is on the cutting edge of on-line retail technology. Our evolution has led us to improve our systems and strengthen our teams. We are searching for an ambitious, tech-savvy and forward thinking Solution Architect to drive the Strategic Solution roadmap. This is a rare opportunity to serve on a digital systems team of architects and high-level developers to design our future ecommerce platform. In this highly burstable environment, you will be challenged to integrate systems to create a single solution.


Footlocker.com / Eastbay operates the direct to consumer business for Foot Locker, Inc. - the world's leading retailer of athletically inspired footwear and apparel. Our brands include Footlocker, Eastbay, Champs Sports, Footaction, Kids Footlocker, Lady Footlocker and SIX:02. In fact we manage 16 of the largest sport inspired web and mobile sites on the net, which enjoy over 250 million visits per year.


At Footlocker.com / Eastbay, the Solution Architect is a key role in our ability to exceed customer expectations in an efficient manner. You will design and develop effective solutions that continue to keep our teams and organization moving forward through:



  • Satisfying our customers, product owners and stakeholders through technical excellence and unsurpassed service.

  • Capitalizing on the elastic environment

  • Delivering innovative solutions that increase customer value and embrace simplicity, speed, adaptability and sustainability.

  • Identifying when to use an existing pattern or differentiate for efficiency and competitive advantage.

  • Designing solutions that empower our team and our next generation to succeed.

  • Acting as a subject matter expert across one or more core solutions.

  • Facilitating solution reviews.

  • Serving as a mentor to other team members.

  • Acting as a key participant in high-level estimation for prioritization.

  • Leading a delivery team in a way that aligns with the expectations of a scrum master.

item.title: Discovery Software Engineer (m/f) at Rocket Internet SE (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
About the Role


Rocket Internet’s discovery team is a fast-growing interdisciplinary team of engineers that design, build and maintain a real-time data platform that is at the heart of the search and recommendation experience of our e-commerce and marketplace ventures. We are looking for engineers who don’t like to be pigeon-holed into one role, but look beyond the platform’s current direction and are able to anticipate what needs to be in place in six months to support future platform development and growth. The day-to-day tasks of the infrastructure and relevance engineers on the team range from building a global infrastructure that handles millions of requests per second to development of powerful ranking algorithms based on statistical models derived from large data sets as much as intuition.

item.title: Software Engineer (learning golang!) at Permission Data (New York, NY)
item.description:
@Permission Data we are in the process of completely overhauling our tech stack. We've chosen Go as our primary implementation language, and are creating a scale-able microservice architecture.


Have you heard all about go but not had a chance to try it out? Have you played around with it on side projects but not been able to use it at your work?

This is your opportunity. We are a small team who is using go for our next generation platform and we are looking for interested, talented developers from mid to senior level.


Work will encompass the full stack. For the front end we are using aurelia.io. On the database side we use what is most appropriate for the service. Currently that means we have postgres, mysql, and redis, with cassandra soon to follow.

We are automating our pipeline with saltstack, DCOS, Marathon, and Drone.


The team is small (9 people), so you have the ability to make a big impact. We do a lunch and learn every other Wednesday, but are constantly pushing each other to learn more in our slack channels. 

We believe in a healthy work-life balance, and use agile practices to facilitate that.


We believe in contributing to open source.


We are unable to sponsor any visas at this time.

item.title: Full Stack Web Developer at Sensoria Inc. (Redmond, WA)
item.description:
We are looking for a passionate, hard-working, talented, and experienced full-stack web developer, who has a strong interest in building innovative products.


You are a smart developer, and a great team player. You write elegant code in a variety of languages. You thrive designing for scalability, You like to learn new frameworks and languages.


You will be part of a small, highly skilled development team, to extend our platform and services to support Sensoria ecosystem, including client apps, web UX, API, data storage and data crunching (Azure Storage, SQL Server, ElasticSearch, ApacheSpark, etc.).


We have big dreams and need you now!

item.title: Mobile iOS Developer (f/m) at UBIMET GmbH (Wien, Österreich)
item.description:
UBIMET has its headquarters in Vienna, Austria and ranks among the leading weather service providers in Europe. International experts in the fields of meteorology, physics, biology and geography issue customized, individual and precise weather forecasts for several millions private and industrial customers in many countries. The company founders and the shareholder (Red Bull) pursue the goal to be the weather service with the world's best quality forecasts. In order to deal with a rapidly growing number of potential clients, we are looking for highly skilled, exceptional people to reinforce our team in the position of


Mobile iOS Developer (f/m)


(iOS, Full-time)


As part of the Mobile Development team you will develop the latest and greatest mobile weather apps. This is an amazing opportunity to be involved in every step of the development process, from brainstorming product ideas, to pushing apps outside the door.


Key Responsibilities



  • Development of intricate and innovative native weather apps

  • Participation and contribution in all phases of the product development lifecycle, including requirements definition, specifications, development, testing, product release and maintenance

  • Contribution to the existing mobile app portfolio for B2C markets

  • Maintainance and development of new features for existing apps

  • Implementation of Proof of Concepts for internal projects

  • Close intra-departmental collaboration with User Experience Designers and the Meteorological Development team

  • Evaluation of new technologies


We offer



  • International working environment

  • Excellent career opportunities

  • Workplace with a focus on Free / Open Source Software

  • Comprehensive training within a friendly atmosphere

  • Incentive pay

item.title: VP Software Development at CoheroHealth (New York, NY)
item.description: We are seeking an organized, hard-working individual to lead our software development team to build products across Android, iOS and our back end server.  You will help architect design of our software, lead an agile release process, drive product and feature prioritization, and oversee development.  You will manage our external team of software engineers to set the technical vision, guide code architecture, ensure quality of work and make sure deadlines are met.  The applicant must have strong technical abilities to be able to evaluate code, along with project management skills to develop and stick to development timelines.

item.title: Sr. Engineer- UI at AudienceScience (Bellevue, WA)
item.description:
AudienceScience is seeking a talented Senior Software Development Engineer with focus on UI to join our team.  You’ll work on an agile team in the SAAS arena, building the JavaScript infrastructure to support AudienceScience Gateway, a global media buying platform using real-time bidding and behavioral targeting technologies. We currently handle upwards of 9 billion requests per day, aggregating all of this data on our Hadoop clusters. Experience in Objected Oriented JavaScript is required and Ampersand/Backbone experience a big plus.


Essential functions:



  • Design and implement pages for Buyer UI using HTML, CSS, jQuery/Backbone/Ampersand JavaScript frameworks, working closely with back-end Java developers to integrate with Spring MVC web application.

item.title: DevOps Engineer at Lasso Data Systems Inc. (Richmond, BC, Canada) (allows remote)
item.description:
Position: DevOps Engineer


Day to Day


We work in a Kanban-Scrum hybrid environment. A typical day starts off with a daily developer update posted to Slack, the rest is spent on the software. Weekly, we have a team retrospective, and a meeting with business to discuss direction (not everyone need attend).


Work Environment


We take our software very seriously while fostering a relaxed, fun(ny), and supportive environment. Here is a list of things we like about Lasso:



  • Monday Lunch and Learns and free lunch on Thursdays

  • Excellent coffee, free pop, and fresh fruit

  • Gym and a napping couch

  • Our work stations (typically: four monitors, mechanical keyboards, and 32GB of RAM)

  • Run whatever OS, we really don’t care

  • No code in production without a review (GitHub pull-requests)

  • Work from home day once a week

  • Internal reading group because we care about training

  • The developers got to write this posting

item.title: Java / Python Integration Developer - Multiple roles at different levels at BAE Systems Applied Intelligence (Guildford, UK)
item.description:
You will join a vibrant and experienced team of software engineers. You will focus on the implementation/integration of cutting edge technologies with the aim of improving end user experience and information exchange capabilities within a heterogeneous data landscape.


Working within a dedicated team, you will be responsible for integration and configuration of technical solutions with support from some of the best innovators in the business as well as maintaining up-to-date technical design documents and test plans. You will be instrumental in helping to maintain the technical superiority of the Managed Security Service as well as contributing towards the technological and business goals of the Cyber Security business unit.


You will work across a diverse range of tools, technologies and infrastructure which includes Hadoop (HortonWorks), ElasticSearch, Accumulo, HP ArcSight, CA Service Desk, LifeRay and CA Site Minder in terms of configuration and integration to achieve greater automation and efficiency.


You will be driven by getting the best out of tools and technology and wish to improve integration and interoperability between toolsets favouring configuration and integration over new product development. You will have a sound knowledge of software engineering practices and the development lifecycle.

item.title: User Interface Designer (Bootstrap, CSS3, HTML5) at DataFinch Technologies (Atlanta, GA)
item.description:
DataFinch Technologies is looking for a hands-on UI/UX developer to design and improve the user interface of our rapidly evolving, data collection platform for Autism. This designer will work with both mobile and web based designs for iOS, Android and desktop environments.

DataFinch has developed a web and mobile data collection system that is used by more than 20,000 kids with Autism in 14+ countries.

In this role the Front-end Developer will maintain and improve the platforms existing user interface as well as collaborate directly with the product manager, operations team and developers to design and implement UI for new features being added to the application (design, test, prototype, implement).

The product is a web-based business application and the interface must balance aesthetics, simplicity and functionality. There is room for innovative design, but with a bias towards efficiency and fundamental usability.

Our company culture is entrepreneurial and practical; our working style is agile and collaborative. Its an environment that demands a personality that can take initiative and lead and rewards a good team player. If you're not afraid to roll up your sleeves and get your hands dirty you'll fit right in.


Benefits



  • Health, Vision, Dental, 401(k)

  • Catered Lunch every Friday

  • One click build & deployments

  • Flex hours

  • Conference reimbursement

  • Choice of hardware & software tools

  • 25 days PTO

  • Laid back, enjoyable environment

  • Soft drinks & snacks

  • Video games/Cable TV and other Toys

  • Bean bags

item.title: Software Development Engineer - Machine Learning at Workday (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Please Note: 
- This position requires existing work-authorization in the United States.
- If you don't already have U.S. work authorization, please don't submit your resume.


About the Team:
SYMAN is the agile data-engineering team within Workday. We build predictive analytics into Workday’s applications to help the world’s largest companies make strategic decisions about their people and finances. We are the former Identified team recently acquired by Workday.


This is an opportunity to contribute to the technology behind data normalization, search relevance, recommendation systems, and machine learning. And you’ll need to accomplish all this while achieving horizontal scalability and high availability.


We have retained our startup culture and are continuing to apply our agile principles within the larger organization. We don’t believe in QA for the kind of work we do, so the burden of quality falls on the developers. We practice scrum, pair programming, extensive automated testing, and continuous deployment. We expect that you have 3-5 years’ experience and a CS related degree.


Does this describe you working on a new generation data development team in a fast pace environment? If yes, please apply!

item.title: SAP HANA Test Cloud (Senior) Developer Job at SAP SE (Walldorf, Deutschland)
item.description:
COMPANY DESCRIPTION

SAP is the global market leader for business software and thus contributes a considerable part of the world's economic power grid. At SAP you get your chance to put your ideas into action with maximum impact.As a member of the SAP HANA Infrastructure team you are equally in charge for preparing the playgrounds for new innovative development tasks as well as for constructing and operating a stable productive environment to support our fully automated development process. Backed by a data center full of high end servers we do more than just Continuous Integration. We do state-of-the-art C++ development based on Open Source components like Linux, Jenkins, Bugzilla, Gerrit, Git, CMake and Python that have proven to be a solid base for large scale development. Be excited about all the impressive things we do in addition to produce great software.

EXPECTATIONS AND TASKS

As a (Senior) Developer in the SAP HANA Database team you will be working with a group of exceptionally talented and motivated colleagues. You will need to:
- Develop and improve the HANA build- & test infrastructure
- Debug complex SAP HANA infrastructure issues
- Administrate, monitor and maintain SAP HANA infrastructure components and test servers Your tasks will also include:
- Close cooperation with the SAP HANA Database development, enabling core developers to provide new coding in quality as fast as possible
- Continuously improve the quality of the SAP HANA Database by implementing new quality measures

WORK EXPERIENCE

- 3+ years of relevant work experience

EDUCATION AND QUALIFICATION / SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES

Required skills We require that you meet the core competencies and skills listed below:
- Advanced skills & experience with Linux/ Unix, network & storage system
- Very good analytical skills, familiarity with root cause analysis, debugging and analyzing complex problems
- Knowledge of cutting-edge approaches in software quality assurance
- Basic knowledge of data base architectures
- Ability to work well in close teamwork in an distributed team over several international locations
- German and English both spoken and written Programming knowledge:
- Good knowledge of software architecture and object-oriented design
- Python and Shell-Scripting Preferred skills A plus will be skills in:
- Using Git, Gerrit, Jenkins & Bugzilla APIs
- Perl & C++
- Parallel programming/distribution strategies for data or tasks
- Code profilers & code checkers like CPP checker or address sanitizer
- GNU Make, CMake, Ninja
- Cluster file systems (GPFS, OCFS)101014132

item.title: Senior Software Engineer-Java/Scala at HERE, a Nokia company (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
Do you wish to work on technologies like Java, Scala, Git, Linux, Bash, Splunk, AWS EC2?


If yes, keep reading…


We are hiring a Senior Software Engineer-Java/Scala for our HERE Places team.



About the Team


The HERE Places API team is a part of the HERE Search and Places group. We work with an agile process and every team member gets the opportunity to analyse, develop and test software. The team supports the analysis of usage data, monitoring of production systems as well as supporting clients of the API.


The API layer is implemented in Scala and we are committed to test-driven development and pervasive automation of everyday tasks. 


We run extensive functional and performance test suites upon every commit. We also make extensive use of Java in the search backend as well as JavaScript for our playground and demo UIs.



Key Responsibilities



  • End-to-end delivery of new features of the HERE Places API  


         -Work with Product Management to analyse requirements


         -Plan and implement new features in cooperation with other teams


         -Ensure quality of software and documentation


         -Click the Release Button



  • Evolve the existing automated testing and deployment architecture as needed to fulfill new requirements

item.title: Software Engineer, Compute Infrastructure at Salesforce (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Salesforce.com hosts web services and applications written by thousands of internal developers and tens of thousands of customers to provide the largest business automation cloud on the planet.  The compute infrastructure that enables this innovation and value is evolving to fully embrace lights-out operations, single-click deploy to tens of thousands of nodes, and services that self-heal and self-optimize.


Salesforce is building out our compute infrastructure team to reinvigorate the way we deliver, deploy, operate, secure, monitor, and repair our data centers and the code that runs across them - at consumer web scale.  We are looking to add experienced distributed systems engineers who can step up and own big chunks of that vision.


What’s In It For You




  • Eat, sleep, and breathe services.  You have experience balancing live-site management, feature delivery, and retirement of technical debt,




  • Have strong, heartfelt opinions on CAP theorem, can sketch out four different consistency models on a single napkin and defend each of them, and understand Paxos and Zookeeper at an implementation level.




  • Familiarity with crash-only and recovery-oriented software design.




  • Excited by building reliable, self-healing services on unreliable hardware.




  • Experience designing, developing, debugging, and operating resilient distributed systems that run across thousands of compute nodes in multiple datacenters.




  • Agilista capable of delivering thin slices of end-to-end functionality on a regular cadence

item.title: Experienced Front End Developer at Adyen (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Adyen is currently looking for a full-time, front-end developer for our growing team in Amsterdam. The candidate must be experienced in HTML, CSS and know JavaScript at a sufficient level be involved with code frameworks and architecture.


Responsibilities



  • Primarily you will be involved in projects related to the development of data visualisations and the maintenance & improvement of our data visualisation library. You will be implementing and monitoring your projects on our live platform.

  • You will also be involved with the development of interactive components and user interfaces for internal and external system users.

item.title: Write Code, Learn from the Best, Change the World! at Literacy Bridge (Seattle, WA) (allows remote)
item.description:
If you want to learn and apply a broad range of technologies while helping the world’s poorest people avoid hunger and deadly diseases, then this unique opportunity may be for you. Through partnerships with organizations like UNICEF, Literacy Bridge uses technology to help people in some of the world’s most remote villages, often without electricity, learn to grow more food and stay healthy.  We do this today for 175,000 people; with your help, we will reach millions more.


You will be Literacy Bridge’s first full-time software engineer, working in a startup-like environment with the mentorship of volunteer senior engineers from places like Twitter, BMW, Zillow, Groupon, Tableau Software, and the Apache Software Foundation. You will work on a broad range of projects such as our:



  • Java-based audio content management system to allow people around the world to contribute local-language audio recordings of health and agriculture knowledge


  • Java-based usage statistics data gathering system integrated with visual data analysis and reporting


  • C-based firmware of our Talking Book audio computer, a battery-operated device with an innovative audio-based interface and the ability to conduct and track quizzes on knowledge retention


Note about working remotely: To work remotely, we would require an initial 3-6 months in Seattle, U.S., and ongoing semi-annual visits for one or two weeks.


You would also have the opportunity to travel to Ghana to meet with our users, partners, and local staff.

item.title: Computer Systems Support Administrator at Institute for Defense Analyses (Alexandria, VA)
item.description:
Overview


This position, under general supervision, provides technical support, Help Desk, and administration for IDA’s endpoint systems and client based services. Responsibilities can include the preparation, configuration, installation, maintenance, troubleshooting, or disposal of all end point systems. Duties can also include the coordination, maintenance, troubleshooting, resolution, and follow-up of Help Desk tickets, Change Requests, and administrative duties. Due to the nature of this position, and the requirement for extended coverage, this position may be required to work hours outside of a regular schedule.


Responsibilities


1.Assembles, configures, delivers, implements, maintains, and provides technical support and user assistance for a variety of multiplatform endpoint systems, telecommunications, conference support (audio-visual) equipment, and client based services. Ensures component compatibility with existing baseline and network architectures, compliance with corporate IT policy, and staff member requirements though a consultation process.
2.Processes, coordinates, troubleshoots, resolves and provides technical assistance in support of Help Desk tickets and Change requests. Maintains the customer support service areas and provides customer assistance with portable endpoint systems.
3.Performs a range of administrative tasks to include warranty and license maintenance, records management, configuration management, office administration, scripting problem resolutions, conference support schedules, and maintaining the tape/disk library and media libraries for offsite storage,
4.Assists in the development, design, and architecture of new technological solutions; participates in systems research, testing, and software command scripting.
5.Performs other duties as assigned.


Qualifications


•Bachelor of Science degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or similar science or engineering discipline or equivalent work experience in related field.
•One year minimum experience, 2 to 3 years preferred, supporting microcomputer software, hardware, associated peripherals, networks, and computer user support.
•Experience with Microsoft Windows operating systems; experience with Mac, UNIX and Linux desired.
•Working knowledge of Ethernet, TCP/IP, network cabling, wireless, and remote access methodologies.
•Must be self-motivated and able to work with general to no supervision.
•Must be willing to work hours outside of a regular schedule.
•Ability to communicate effectively in both written and verbal form and with all levels of employees; possess good interpersonal skills.
•Ability to obtain and maintain appropriate Security Clearances.
•Possess or able to obtain DoD 8570 IAT certification within six months of hire strongly preferred.


IDA is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing a working environment that is free from discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy and gender identity), sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, status as a protected veteran, marital status, genetic characteristic or any other legally protected condition or characteristic.

item.title: Software Engineer (C++) at Granta Design Limited (Cambridge, UK)
item.description:
We are seeking a Software Engineer to join our talented development team working on innovative applications for our flagship GRANTA MI: Materials Gateway product, which links the CAD, CAE & PLM systems used by thousands of designers and analysts to GRANTA MI, the leading system for materials information management.


What you will be doing:



  • Developing clean maintainable software, mainly with C++, but also in a range of other languages, including C#, Java, Python, and others.

  • You will be involved in all stages of the development lifecycle, from design and specification through development and quality.

  • You will be responsible for ensuring that the Gateway platform products are developed and maintained to a high standard, working closely within the team and with the Product Manager.

  • You will be proactive, bringing your ideas and creativity to bear on our product development process.


Some special attractions of the job:



  • The opportunity to work within a talented team using the latest technologies.

  • Developing solutions for world leading companies.

  • The chance to make a real contribution, focus on your areas of interest and broaden your skills.

  • The opportunity to be actively involved in development.

  • May be particularly exciting to those with an interest in science or engineering, especially materials.


Career development


We value our people and work hard to create an environment which rewards positivity and supports personal and professional development. As part of this commitment we provide a tailored induction plan, regular reviews and excellent opportunities for progression.


This role offers excellent development potential, with the opportunity to improve your development skills across a broad range of technologies and practices. You could progress to a technical or team lead role in the future.


What we can offer you:



  • Competitive salary.

  • A 12.5% non-contributory pension scheme.

  • Share Options.

  • Healthcare or gym membership.

  • Flexible working hours.

item.title: Senior Backend Engineer at Falcon Social (Copenhagen, Denmark)
item.description:
Falcon Social is a Software-as-a-Service provider in the Social Media Management space. We provide a unified approach for marketers, customer service specialists and hr personnel of big international brands to manage their social media presence. That means plenty of challenging engineering tasks, complex UIs to simplify and data, loads of data.


We are looking for senior members for our engineering team. You are joining an ambitious team of experts who keep pushing the limit in product delivery and experiment furiously while striving for technical excellence.


We are agile, organized ourselves into cross-functional, autonomous teams, focusing on one product with a clear mission. We intend to be flat, with everyone equal and with each member's role respected. Day-to-day you will work together with people of different trades: frontend, backend engineers, ui/ux designers, cloud operation engineers, and product owners.


We are a maturing startup with an engineering headcount of 20. We are not small anymore, and still growing rapidly. Working at a startup is the most rewarding choice that one can make, but it requires a certain personality as well. That being said, we value open people who take initiative more than lone rockstars.


Falcon Social’s frontend is a single page web application built with AngularJs, Bower, Grunt, D3.js on top of a REST flavored HTTP+JSON api served by a lightweight Java8 backend running on DropWizard, PostgreSQL, ElasticSearch, AWS, Apache Spark and Python.


This job requires extensive Java programming language experience and also the knowledge of how modern Java is done. We favor lightweight frameworks like DropWizard, we value a good domain model (DDD), we think in single responsibility (micro)services, we prefer good refactoring skills, pragmatism and craftsmanship.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Advidi (Amsterdam, Nederland)
item.description:
If you would like to be involved in shaping the future of internet advertising (innovation), develop features which will be exposed to hundreds of millions of users every day (big data), go off the beaten path to design and develop high performance and high availability web applications (challenges), then you will be pleased with what Advidi has to offer. The Advidi SOA is composed of multiple critical components which are handling large amounts of live traffic and is the backbone of our business workflow. Thus, high availability, zero-downtime and minimum response times are critical.


We like to organize ourselves in small, focused, autonomous teams (4 or 5 developers and a product owner). You will have a say in architecture, planning, and how new product features are designed. During the trimester planning, you’ll also have the opportunity to bring your ideas to the table and take part in planning new features and initiatives.


As a Senior Software Engineer you will be responsible for the development of exciting new features for the company’s core software products and for extending and maintaining our SOA. We are looking for people who love clean code, work in a test-driven manner, would like to work on projects that add value to business and would enjoy working within an inspirational environment.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer Java/Big Data at Criteo (Grenoble, France)
item.description:
CRITEO is looking to recruit senior software developers who turn it up to eleven for its R&D Center in Grenoble (South-East from France). Your main missions will be to :


- Build systems that make the best decision in 50ms, half a million times per second. Across three continents and six datacenters, 24/7.


- Find the signal hidden in tens of TB of data, in one hour, using over a thousand nodes on our Hadoop cluster. And constantly keep getting better at it while measuring the impact on our business.


- Get stuff done. A problem partially solved today is better than a perfect solution next year. Have an idea during the night ? Code it in the morning, push it at noon, test it in the afternoon and deploy it the next morning.


- High stakes, high rewards: 1% increase in performance may yield millions for the company. But if a single bug goes through, the Internet goes down (we’re only half joking).


- Develop open source projects. Because we are working at the forefront of technology, we are dealing with problems that few have faced. We’re big users of open source, and we’d like to give back to the community.

item.title: Lead Engineer, Metrics Aggregation Pipeline at New Relic (Portland, OR)
item.description:
At New Relic, we build amazing tools that provide deep insight into web apps and services. We make sense of billions of metrics about millions of applications, all in real time. Our comprehensive SaaS-based solution for web and mobile applications consolidates performance-monitoring data into a single, powerful interface.


We’re looking for an extraordinary engineer to play a key role in designing and implementing the backend server systems that power the New Relic platform. In this role, you’ll work with a wickedly smart team to create the next generation of our data pipeline that receives, aggregates, stores and queries more bytes per second than Twitter.

Roka Security is a growing team of security, Linux, and network engineers, looking for the next member of our team. We work on incredible projects, including; securing complex networks, system and network performance tuning, physical server deployments at data centers around the world, disaster recovery, and working with customer teams to design highly scalable network architectures.


Our customers have the highest security and availability requirements. As a result, Roka Security strives to constantly improve our knowledge, technology and processes. There is always room for improvement, which is why we need you!


Security Engineers and Analysts


Roka Security is seeking Computer Security Engineers and Analysts of all experience levels (including management) to be part of our growing team.  We are looking for out of the box thinkers who will help expand our capabilities and deliver high value solutions to our customers.  The primary areas of focus for this position will be :



  • Incident Response support

  • Log Analysis

  • IDS / IPS - design, deployment, management, and analysis

  • Centralized logging systems - design, deployment, management and client usability

Benefits
