item.title: (Associate) Developer for SAP HANA Database Development Infrastructure Job at SAP SE (Walldorf, Deutschland)
item.description:
COMPANY DESCRIPTION

SAP is the global market leader for business software and thus contributes a considerable part of the world's economic power grid. At SAP you get your chance to put your ideas into action with maximum impact.The SAP HANA Database is the basis for new, ground-breaking SAP applications and is widely agreed to be a highly valuable asset in the SAP software portfolio. In-memory computing is made possible through recent technology advances in main memory, multi-core processing, and data management. It leverages technology innovation to establish real-time analysis of business data and combines both transactions and analytics to improve existing business processes with a dramatic increase in performance. The SAP HANA Database as basis for the in-memory computing shows enormous promise as a key driver for the SAP market of the future. The SAP HANA Database Infrastructure team develops the infrastructure for the SAP HANA Database developers. It supports continuous integration of C++ coding into the SAP HANA Database core engine, featuring state-of-the-art bug & patch tracking, code review, sophisticated automated testing facilities and advanced release management systems. Major components are Git, Gerrit, Jenkins and Bugzilla with custom-tailored extensions in conjunction with in-house developed software. We seek graduates to extend our SAP HANA Infrastructure team.

EXPECTATIONS AND TASKS

As an (Associate) Developer in the SAP HANA Database team you will be working with a group of exceptionally talented and motivated colleagues. You will need to:
- Develop and improve the HANA build- & test infrastructure
- Debug complex SAP HANA infrastructure issues
- Administrate, monitor and maintain SAP HANA infrastructure components and test servers Your tasks will also include:
- Close cooperation with the SAP HANA Database development, enabling core developers to provide new coding in quality as fast as possible
- Continuously improve the quality of the SAP HANA Database by implementing new quality measures
- Work closely together with the SAP HANA Build team and the SAP HANA Delivery team

WORK EXPERIENCE

We seek an (Associate) Developer (0-2 years work experience). We are looking for candidates who are committed to a technology career path. Your set of application documents should contain a cover letter and tabular CV, copies of the obtained degrees and references (if available).

EDUCATION AND QUALIFICATION / SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES

We require that you meet the core competencies and skills listed below:
- Programming knowledge: - Good knowledge of software architecture and object-oriented design - Python and Shell-Scripting
- Advanced skills & experience with Linux/ Unix, network & storage system
- Very good analytical skills, familiarity with root cause analysis, debugging and analyzing complex problems
- Knowledge of cutting-edge approaches in software quality assurance
- Eagerness to improve quality of the continuous integration process for software written in C++
- Basic knowledge of data base architectures
- Ability to work well in close teamwork in an distributed team over several international locations
- German and English both spoken and written A plus will be skills in:
- Using Git, Gerrit, Jenkins & Bugzilla APIs
- Perl & C++
- Parallel programming/distribution strategies for data or tasks
- Code profilers & code checkers like CPP checker or address sanitizer
- GNU Make, CMake, Ninja
- Cluster file systems (GPFS, OCFS)101014132

item.title: Senior Backend Developer / Sys Admin at Greenhouse Innovation (Amsterdam, Netherlands)

Greenhouse Innovation is looking for an ambitious, entrepreneurial back-end developer with System & Database Administrator experience, that helps us pave the way forward. You've been around the block in Back-end Land, but good is not yet good enough for you. Your view is broad: you don't hesitate to show your skills in other disciplines and enjoy bringing a team to a higher level.

You can help us streamline our database storage and retrieval for working on a globally scalable level, and maintain and improve our servers and toolsets both for internal and external use through the application of good tools and smart technologies.

item.title: Senior DevOps Engineer at ICFLIX (Dubai, United Arab Emirates)
item.description:
As a Senior DevOps Engineer, you will be a part of a small, geographically distributed, cross-functional DevOps team that is massively scaling icflix Solutions cutting edge streaming platform infrastructure. This team is committed to delivering the highest systems uptime and operations transparency. The global team provides a matrix approach to 24x7 infrastructure engineering and support services.


Do you crave the adrenaline rush of supporting the production infrastructure that powers MENA’s first online streaming platforms offering thousands of hours of Arabic, Hollywood, Bollywood content to over 400 million people?  Are you a fanatic when it comes to quashing operational inefficiencies in web infrastructure?  Do you get a kick out of automating routine tasks with a few lines of code? Do you exemplify the ethic of, “If you have to do something more than once, automate it”?

item.title: Developer Advocate (Evangelist)- Hot Open Source Software Company at Elasticsearch (Mountain View, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Want to work for one of the Coolest and Hottest Open Source Software Companies In The World


The Developer Relations program at Elastic focuses on increasing adoption of our technology and ensuring user success. In this role, you will serve as an advocate for Elastic's product line to Developer and Operations Professionals. Your primary role will be to engage with our user community through creating ops-oriented technical artifacts for our product stack, participating in user groups, representing the company at developer events and giving presentations on our technology.


Previous experience as a developer advocate or community manager very much preferred, but not required. Hands-on systems administration or DevOps experience strongly preferred. Excellent presentation skills required. Fluent business English is required, familiarity with other languages is a plus.


This role requires extensive travel; you should be comfortable with 50% time on the road, with peaks and troughs dependent upon the technical conference season.


Job Duties



  • Present about the Elastic product line and related topics at conferences (e.g. DevOps Days, Monitorama, and OSCON) and meetups, including technical demos

  • Keep finger on the pulse of tech trends, particularly in the DevOps world, and report back to the organization

  • Work with community to create configuration management artifacts (e.g. Ansible playbooks, Chef cookbooks, and Puppet modules) for our product stack as well as logstash plugins

  • Create programs to share the Elastic product story with our community, such as podcasts, community hangouts and/or office hours

  • Author content on our technology and ecosystem products for our blog and technical media outlets

  • Interact and build relationships with community members virtually and in person

  • Recruit user group organizers and speakers

  • Identify and amplify user success stories

  • Bring these stories to our community through technical editing, etc.

item.title: Software Architect - Web Application at Advertising Specialty Institute (ASI) (Feasterville-Trevose, PA)
item.description:
Advertising Specialty Institute (ASI) is seeking a talented architect to join our enterprise architecture team. A software architect at ASI will define, develop, and support the core services that help move our vision forward. The team works on critical backend components like messaging, search, and security that require maximum scalability, low-latency, and high availability.


Our product development team is composed of full-stack engineers with expertise in technologies like Microsoft.Net, AngularJS, Java, PHP, and Ruby. You will work directly with product development on multiple projects to provide technical leadership and guidance. Strong candidates will have development and operational experience at large scale, and bring both deep technical understanding and sound judgment to the role.


Responsibilities



  • Act as principal designer of critical systems including application, data, and technology infrastructure architectures

  • Identify scaling bottlenecks and propose solutions

  • Research, test, benchmark and evaluate new technology

  • Solve the types of mysteries which only occur at high scale

  • Drive best practices for web application architecture and implementation

  • Work with project teams to guide the implementation and delivery of solutions both in customer-facing and internal deployment environments

item.title: Forensisch software architect at Rijksoverheid (The Hague, Netherlands)
item.description:
Forensisch software architect


Nederlands Forensisch Instituut



Functieomschrijving



Word jij enthousiast van cutting edge frameworks en nieuwe technologieën?



Je vertaalt bij het Nederlands Forensisch Instituut (NFI) de wensen van stakeholders naar concrete oplossingen. Dit doe je bij de groep Software Engineering, in het bijzonder voor het forensisch big data-platform Hansken.



Hansken wordt binnen en buiten het NFI gebruikt voor opsporing en bewijsvoering van ernstige misdrijven als kindermisbruik, moord, grootschalige fraude en andere delicten met grote maatschappelijke impact. Hansken draait op een gedistribueerde omgeving en verwerkt vele terabytes aan data per uur. Het analyseren van deze data kan miljoenen relevante sporen opleveren, denk  aan e-mails, chatberichten en GPS-coördinaten. Door nieuwe technologische ontwikkelingen blijft het een uitdaging om steeds nieuwe typen forensische sporen doorzoekbaar te maken of slimme analyses toe te voegen, zoals entiteitextractie voor herkenning van kentekens, IBAN-nummers of adressen. Naast het dienen van een belangrijk maatschappelijk belang is Hansken ook een technisch zeer uitdagend project waar je telkens met nieuwe technieken in aanraking komt.



Als forensisch software architect ben jij voor Hansken de persoon die de wensen van stakeholders vertaalt naar concrete oplossingen. Je bent communicatief sterk en kunt Hansken uiteenzetten aan klanten en het management. Samen met ontwikkelaars beoordeel je nieuwe technologieën en frameworks op toepasbaarheid in de huidige architectuur. Vervolgens zorg je dat deze gebruikt worden. Je trekt de kar bij het besluitvormingsproces over gebruikte technologie en (technische) ontwerpbeslissingen op abstract niveau. Hierbij neem je onderbouwd besluiten en verdedig je deze. Bovendien leg je de architectuur vast en bewaak je deze.



Daarnaast ben je verantwoordelijk voor de kwaliteit van Hansken. Je bewaakt de afgesproken principes en kwaliteitsrichtlijnen. Tot slot zul je zelf weinig ontwikkelen, maar beoordeel je wel kritisch de ontwikkelde code en zorg je dat deze voldoet aan de afgesproken architectuur.

item.title: Engineering Manager - Billing & Payments Infrastructure at Twilio (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Twilio is seeking an Engineering Manager for our Billing & Payments Infrastructure team. This is a leadership role, reporting to the Sr. Engineering Manager of Billing & User Data, focused on nurturing and expanding a team of engineers, providing people management, and driving projects to successful, on-time delivery through our agile process.


About the job:


Twilio is a company built by developers for developers. You must not only have the professional expertise to understand your team’s engineering and business challenges, but also the technical acumen to build great software.


Responsibilities:



  • Partner with the Technical Lead to make long-term architectural decisions about Twilio's micro-transaction platform.

  • Take personal responsibility as the delivery manager and set clear expectations for Finance and R&D billing integrations.

  • Work directly with Technical Lead and Product Manager to track velocity and plan sprints for the engineering team.

  • Manage & grow a world-class team of engineers that think about the customer experience.

  • Own quarterly deliverables with highly-visible and effective communications with Senior Management in R&D and Finance departments.

  • Manage your direct reports in an empathetic, high-touch way, including weekly/bi-weekly 1:1s. Coach and unblock them on a daily basis. Encourage and teach them to drive to complete key objectives. Assist in their longer term career and skills development. Excite them with new challenges and opportunities.

item.title: APPLICATION DEVELOPER JR/SR at Wharton School (Philadelphia, PA)
item.description:
Design, develop, maintain, and document programs to populate research databases from a variety of data sources, and manage / query those databases. Learn, understand, and support a set of diverse financial databases. Devise ways to improve workflows to support an ever increasing number of databases and data update frequency. Work with WRDS research and web teams to develop analytics and extract files for statistical analysis. Determine functional requirements for client business processes and may organize, plan and manage projects. Perform technical and functional analysis of information, processing and management systems. Ensure adherence to departmental technical, quality assurance and security standards. Provide first/second tier data and technical support to external WRDS users.

Senior Application Developer’s responsibilities will also include:

Develop or modify procedures to solve complex problems, taking into consideration computer equipment capacity and limitations. Review the work of colleagues and provide feedback on efficiency, security, and other best practices. Oversee project goals, timelines, and create specifications to assure that projects are completed on time and within budget. Coordinate multiple projects while meeting deadlines.

item.title: Senior Symfony2 Developer at LeaseWeb Technologies (Amsterdam Zuid-Oost, Netherlands)
item.description:
As a PHP developer you design, construct and support our systems written in PHP. Your responsibilities can vary from simple maintenance to very complex tasks in one of our innovative (Research and Implementation) projects. Automation and software development is an integral part of our business, we expect you to be able to give assistance to non-technical colleagues and collaborate with other departments as well.


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dr2xso8CUTQ


Work for LeaseWeb and help make the internet’s heart beat. The LeaseWeb Network is one of the largest networks in the world, moving data around at colossal speeds. It connects the state-of-the-art data centers in Europe, North America and Asia which are operated by various international LeaseWeb companies. Innovation is in our DNA. Our ground-breaking new products help all kinds of business get the most from the internet. And their success is our success which drives growth.


Come and be part of it. The future’s in your hands.

item.title: Software Engineer II at Mishimoto Automotive (New Castle, DE)
item.description:
The Software Engineer is responsible for overseeing all database activity, project coordination, and report development. They are responsible for planning, processing and performing all jobs in an efficient manner with no assistance from the supervisor. They will be working closely with senior management to carry out strategic goals.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities:



  • Analyzes, coordinates and supervises the development and implementation of third party software solutions by studying information needs; conferring with users; studying systems flow, data usage, and work processes; investigating problem areas; following the software development lifecycle.

  • Creates reports from data stored in SQL Databases, as requested by Management.

  • Responsible for analysis of current programs including performance, diagnosis and troubleshooting of problem programs, and designing solutions to problematic programming. In addition, carries out enhancements and additional system requests to current programs.

  • Documents and demonstrates solutions by developing documentation, flowcharts, layouts, diagrams, charts, code comments and clear code.

  • Prepares and installs solutions by determining and designing system specifications, standards, and programming.

  • Maintains current systems by ensuring that all software and hardware is up to date, as well as backs-up all systems to ensure that data is never lost.

  • Responsible for communicating with manufacturer's technical support staff regarding programming needs and performance.

  • Documents code consistently throughout the development process by listing a description of the program, special instructions, and any changes made in database tables on procedural, modular and database level.

  • Researches and recommends software tools to management.

  • Protects operations by keeping information confidential.

item.title: Software Engineer .Net at Canada's Motorcycle (Montréal, QC, Canada)
item.description:
Canada's Motorcycle is looking for an experienced software developer to join our team. In this position, you will be responsible for building applications that will have a major impact on the operations of the company.


The applications you develop will automate processes across every department including:



  • order management (payment processing, fraud detection, purchasing)

  • warehouse management (logistics, pick & pack tools)

  • marketing (who knows what these guys really do...)

  • data management (we have LOTS of data)

  • reporting (are we making money??? ;)


You will work on everything from architecting the application, to creating the frontend and developing the backend (basically the full stack). 


So, if you enjoy working on a wide set of problems, having a big influence on the direction of the product you are building, working with a group of smart people (it's hard to be modest :), and are obsessed with writing clean/scalable/maintainable code, then we totally want you.

item.title: Senior Back-End Engineer at LiveRamp (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
ABOUT LIVERAMP


LiveRamp is the leading data onboarder, enabling marketers to unify their customer database across disparate online marketing applications and leverage it for analytics, targeting, measurement, content optimization, and more.


ABOUT THIS JOB


Do you thirst to design, build, operate, debug, and optimize sophisticated distributed systems? Are you thrilled to creatively discover new ways to leverage 5 petabytes of data and 100 billion requests per month at lightning fast speeds? Do you love working collaboratively with intelligent, energetic, no-nonsense colleagues? Are you as nice as you are brilliant? Consider joining us.


RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Build, operate, and optimize large distributed systems.

  • Design and implement algorithms to efficiently process, analyze, and serve massive datasets on a 300+ node Hadoop cluster.

  • Be at the forefront of technology innovation. Keep LiveRamp on the cutting edge of industry tools and best practices.

  • Push your teammates to become stronger engineers. They will do the same for you.

  • Work on your own great ideas during Hackweeks (5 times per year!).

  • Contribute towards building a great company.


QUALIFICATIONS



  • 3+ years experience building scalabe and reliable products.

  • Comfort writing large-scale, high performance object-oriented code (bonus points for functional programming experience).

  • MapReduce or Java/C++ expertise or the brains and brawn to become an expert.

  • Good diagnostic and debugging sense, the ability to find a needle in a haystack or a bug in a program stack.

  • Type S(tartup) personality: smart, ethical, friendly, hard-working and proactive (no exceptions).

  • Desire to work in San Francisco. We will relocate you if necessary


EMPLOYEE BENEFITS



  • Work with talented, collaborative, and friendly people who love what they do.

  • Participate in a thriving culture. We host events such as weekly yoga, game nights, happy hour, and a two night camping trip.

  • Leverage our health insurance, dental insurance, vision insurance, 401K, and pre-tax commuter benefit.

  • Work in the heart of San Francisco - the best city in the world.

item.title: Consultants / Developer (m/w), deutschlandweit at codecentric AG (Düsseldorf, Germany)

item.title: UI/UX Developer at Qadium (San Francisco, CA)

item.title: Mobile Engineer at Appboy (New York, NY)

item.title: Backend developer at Benchmarking Alliance Nordic AB (Stockholm, Sweden)
item.description:
Benchmarking Alliance is the leading provider of web based tools for gathering, crunching and distribution of hospitality market statistics in the Nordic and Baltic countries. We are now looking for a talented and passionate developer to help us exploit the full potential of our business and at the same time meet the challenges of a growing IT startup. You will be working on and learning about all parts of our systems; frontend, backend, database and system architecture.


Formal education is not a requirement, most importantly we value your programming skills and passion for solving advanced technical problems. We offer a permanent contract with a competitive salary and benefits.


Why work at Benchmarking Alliance?


Benchmarking Alliance offers an exciting and fun work environment with challenging technical problems related to quantitative data ("big data"). We work according to a lean model where your code changes almost immediately will be used by thousands of customers. Since Benchmarking Alliance is a young and small company you also have a great opportunity to grow in the organisation. Even though we are small we have very close collaborations with a number of tech teams of the highest calibre, and you will have plenty of opportunities to discuss programming challenges.

item.title: C# Software Engineer Contractors needed at Abide Financial Ltd (Bristol, UK)

item.title: ASP.NET Developer (C#, SQL Server) at Aperia Solutions (Dallas, TX)

Join Aperia Solutions, a leader in data management and business intelligence processing. Aperia has been providing business intelligence solutions for more than a decade. The company's management has extensive experience in finance, business consulting, rapid growth and governance as well as business intelligence, the company's core function.

item.title: Algorithm and Software Developers for Computational Biochemistry at D. E. Shaw Research (New York, NY)
item.description:
Extraordinarily gifted computational scientists and engineers are sought to join a New York–based interdisciplinary research group pursuing an ambitious, long-term project aimed at achieving major scientific advances in the field of biochemistry and fundamentally transforming the process of drug discovery. 


Candidates should have a demonstrated track record of academic, industrial, and/or open-source accomplishments.  Relevant areas of expertise might include parallel computing on high performance computing systems employing multi-core, GPU, or special-purpose architectures, numerical analysis, C/C++, or Python programming, data-intensive computing, compilers, operating systems, or distributed systems, but specific knowledge of and level of experience in any of these areas is less critical than exceptional intellectual ability.  We are prepared to reward exceptionally well-qualified individuals with above-market compensation. 


Among the group’s current research activities is the development of new algorithms and software for molecular dynamics simulation and data analysis both on commodity clusters and on Anton, a massively parallel special-purpose supercomputer of our group’s design.  Successful candidates will have the opportunity to work closely with a number of the world’s leading computational chemists and biologists, and to make fundamental contributions within the fields of biology, chemistry, and medicine.


To submit an application, please use the link provided below:
http://www.deshawresearch.com/recruit/jobs/Ads/StackOverflow/CS


D. E. Shaw Research does not discriminate in employment matters on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, pregnancy, national origin, age, military service eligibility, veteran status, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, or any other protected class.

item.title: Full Stack (Python) Developer at Hearst Corporation (New York, NY)
item.description:
We’re creating a game-changing modern content technology stack - built from the ground up to give our users, editors, and advertisers tools that enable them to tell these amazing stories. We’re using modern web technologies to do this, like Python, PHP and memcached. We’re building an open, service-oriented platform driven by APIs, and believe passionately in crafting simple, elegant solutions to complex technological and product problems. We are working with Big Data scientists to build a modern information pipeline for building intelligent and optimized media applications.

We’re hiring talented and passionate Software Engineers to solve problems as we build out our new platform. The ideal candidate has extensive experience working with distributed, service oriented architecture (SOA) systems, writing clean object-oriented code, building and working with RESTful APIs and has worked in cloud based environments like AWS.

item.title: Trading, Analytics And Execution Developer (C++) at Bloomberg LP (London, UK)
item.description:
The Role:

The Trading, Analytics, and Execution teams at Bloomberg develop technology that ensures that the global financial markets run smoothly. The applications and infrastructure built by our teams connect supply and demand, across all asset classes, on worldwide exchanges. Trillions of dollars of capital move through our systems daily; and as a result, market leaders rely on us to flawlessly and seamlessly manage their positions and execute their orders.

We help our clients navigate an increasingly complex business with best-in-class tools to manage risk and regulation. Using the latest technology in our enterprise analytic tools, we provide unique insights that enable our clients to make better investment decisions.


Teams in Trading, Analytics and Execution:

Asset and Investment Manager (AIM) Trading Solutions

AIM is a large-scale, high-performance, distributed software system that is fully hosted and managed. AIM delivers unparalleled, multi-asset, hosted solutions for Order Management, Electronic Trading and Execution, Portfolio Management and Back Office activities. Derivatives are a growing area of focus for Bloomberg & the AIM business. The AIM Derivatives team is responsible for the maintenance and development of multiple existing applications covering Foreign Exchange (FX), Credit Default Swaps (CDS) and Interest Rate Swaps (IRS) derivatives trading. Our software is also closely involved with global regulations and our customers rely on AIM to ensure their compliance with the complex and evolving regulatory landscape.

Enterprise Connectivity and Integration

The Enterprise Connectivity and Integration team moves data between Bloomberg's Enterprise products and client systems. Our user interface provides the user with a single place to configure and monitor all of their data traffic across the Bloomberg system. The data we transmit is critical to our clients' operations so our systems must be reliable, resilient and fast.

Equity Trader

The primary focus of the Equity Trader group is to provide real-time analytics based on market and order-related data to clients in the financial industry. We develop highly resilient and efficient applications to monitor, enrich and display market activity as well as order flow. These services are performance sensitive and at peak capacity process hundreds of thousands of orders or trades in a single second. We architect solutions to distribute and integrate our data in several client-facing applications that are part of the Bloomberg Terminal and leverage these services within non-terminal enterprise products. Our role also involves building compelling and interactive user interfaces to expose our data and help build an intuitive workflow. As a result our products are business critical for thousands of clients who access them millions of times a day.

Fixed Income Electronic Trading (FIT)

The FIT team has a strong foothold in the fixed income space with over 90% market share in asset classes such as Credit Default Swaps and Interest Rate Swaps. This is an exciting time to join the team as we look to increase our product offering, while consolidating the considerable gains made in the changing and challenging trading environments. Projects will include building new trading platforms and enhancements to our existing offering. Our team members are involved in all aspects from product design to release, working on a mix of ticketing, server infrastructure and connectivity.

Foreign Exchange Electronic Trading (FXGO)

With over $5 trillion traded every day, the FX market is the world's largest market, and we are building our Bloomberg FXGO Trading Platform to be a premier multi-counterparty platform. You will be part of a rapidly growing team and immediately responsible for key new projects and initiatives. Our team owns various parts of the Bloomberg FX Trading Platform, which includes a 24 hour low latency multi-bank streaming trade application, post trade delivery system, confirmation and settlement centre and integrations with sell-side and buy-side clients.

Institutional Sales

The Institutional Sales Applications group develops multi-asset applications for Sales, Traders and Research Sales professionals. Our goal is to provide tools that empower salespeople and their managers to provide world-class service to their institutional clients. These tools leverage sophisticated algorithms to present simple answers to common questions that a salesperson faces throughout the day. Successful members of the team have a strong interest in finding solutions that manage and distill large volumes of disparate data to produce clear and powerful insights, and they are excited by the prospect of working in this important and rapidly evolving business.

Portfolio and Risk Analytics

The Portfolio and Risk Analytics team develops applications that provide transparency and insight to asset managers and analysts, empowering them to make smart financial decisions. The team develops an integrated access layer to multi-asset risk, return attribution, characteristics, intra-day P&L monitoring and portfolio optimization. Our London team focuses on delivering a comprehensive, high-throughput, distributed access layer that provides complex, multi-dimensional portfolio and risk analytics to various on-screen applications, professional reporting platforms, data visualization workflows, alerts, and others. We offer ample opportunity to contribute towards the design and implementation of core portfolio technologies as well as financial products.

Sell Side Equity Order Management Systems (SSEOMS)

SSEOMS is becoming a global enterprise-wide order management system. We are a fast growing business within Bloomberg, and on our way to becoming the leader in the industry. Developers will gain valuable equity trading and order management expertise in a very fast paced, real-time, mission critical environment. We are developing low-latency, high capacity sub-systems that handle orders, trades, risk, position, commissions, middle office, compliance and connectivity to the major exchanges around the globe.

Trade Order Management (TOMS & ETOMS) Trading Solutions

The TOMS product is used by financial professionals all over the world to support their trading, offering, pricing, risk and portfolio management needs. Our London TOMS team is responsible for the ever-growing Foreign Exchange functionality within the product. This involves connecting to other internal systems as well as building low-latency, high-volume processing systems to manage the large portfolios that our clients maintain. TOMS delivers a global, multi-asset, solution for trade capture, inventory management, and middle office operations. Our team provides powerful tools that allow traders to manage positions, make markets, and manage their risk and P&L, all in a streamlined, customized straight-through-processing workflow.

ETOMS is an industry-leading, multi-asset class electronic workflow solution for the sell-side community. The team develops low-latency connectivity solutions to European exchanges, as well as trading tools and workflows.

Tradebook

Bloomberg Tradebook is a leading agency broker, a US Electronic Communication Network, and a technology provider of a cross-asset electronic trading platform, supporting Equities, Futures, Options and FX trading.
Providing market access to 120+ liquidity venues globally, our focus is on developing low latency & real-time black box trading systems, algorithmic trading systems, connectivity/FIX solutions and providing direct market connectivity solutions.

item.title: Senior Solution Architect (Europe) at Hazelcast (Istanbul, Turkey) (allows remote)
item.description:
Europe (remote various cities)


As a Senior Solutions Architect, you will work directly with customers and users to help them understand how they can use Hazelcast to achieve better performance and reliability.  In addition to supporting a Regional Sales Manager in Europe the Senior Solutions Architect is a Hazelcast advocate who loves to conduct training sessions, talking at conferences, being active in the community and consulting on distributed computing problems. 


It is a big plus, if you have worked on Hazelcast, or other IMDG and/or NoSQL solutions.

item.title: Software Engineer- Search at Sonian, Inc. (Dedham, MA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Job Profile


This position is with the core platform team at Sonian. We have one of the largest installations of Elasticsearch in the world and we’re looking for somebody who can help us manage all our data.



What You’ll Do




    Help design and develop this platform and its component services, using technologies like Clojure, Elasticsearch, PostgreSQL, Pedestal, and Datomic




    Spearhead new indexing designs and approaches for greater speed and efficiency of searches, lower cost, and greater ability to meet customer demand for new archive capabilities




    Contribute features and bug fixes to Elasticsearch and plugins, or to other software systems




    Work closely with developers who build the applications that turn our platform into powerful tools for users and partners, and with the support organization that keeps it humming



    Be on a team that values code quality, good communication tools, a carefully polished remote pairing experience, sound testing practices and diverse opportunities for mentoring

item.title: Generalist Software Engineer (New Grad/Junior Role) at LiveRamp (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
ABOUT LIVERAMP


LiveRamp is the leading data onboarder, enabling marketers to unify their customer database across disparate online marketing applications and leverage it for analytics, targeting, measurement, content optimization, and more.


ABOUT THIS JOB


Can't be tied down to a single specialty? This is the job for you. It's hard to say what tomorrow's challenge will be, but you'll be happy to hack away at it, whether it's a Ruby on Rails web UI, a distributed analysis Hadoop application in Java, or something completely new.


RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Design and build sophisticated systems to process and visualize massive amounts of data.

  • Make mistakes. Fix them; learn from them; make different ones next time.

  • Be at the forefront of technology innovation. Keep LiveRamp on the cutting edge of industry tools and best practices.

  • Push your teammates to become better engineers. They will do the same for you.

  • Work on your own great ideas for our company during Hackweeks.

  • Contribute towards building a great company


QUALIFICATIONS



  • Excited by the idea of building scalable and reliable products.

  • Comfort in multiple languages, frameworks, and environments.

  • Type S(tartup) personality: smart, ethical, friendly, hard-working and proactive (no exceptions).

  • Desire to work in San Francisco. We will relocate you if necessary.


EMPLOYEE BENEFITS



  • Own equity in the company. Every employee is a stakeholder in our future.

  • Work with talented, collaborative, and friendly people who love what they do.

  • Participate in a thriving culture. We host events such as weekly yoga, game nights, happy hour, and a two night camping trip.

  • Leverage our health insurance, dental insurance, vision insurance, 401K, and pre-tax commuter benefit.

  • Work in the heart of San Francisco - the best city in the world.

item.title: Informatics Support Engineer at Apervita, Inc. (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
The Informatics Support Engineer will be responsible for working with informatics author partners to support them in developing algorithms and insights on the Apervita platform. The ISE will train, coach, and provide support to informatics authors during their algorithm development and testing.


The primary language within the Apervita Author Editor will be Python, but the ISE will also be exposed to various data formats, ontologies, and other information related to the medical informatics used in the industry.


Additionally, the ISE will help create and maintain the public knowledgebase and documentation for the Apervita Author environment and will engage with the Development and QA teams in the improvement and testing of the platform.


Apervita strives to enable developers to spend as much time as possible on design collaboration and development, running a low-overhead methodology based on Agile and Continuous Integration principles. We want developers to do what they do best, rising to meet technology challenges and working together as a team to build a world class platform.

item.title: Lead Engineer at Pomello (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Lead Engineer -- You will take the technical lead on Pomello. You have experience engineering enterprise applications, and are ready to build a product from the ground up without the bureaucracy of a large company. Initially, you will be a full-stack engineer with a lot of hands-on building. As the team grows, you will have the opportunity to build a team. You will influence every aspect of the product from ideation to execution. We value team members who are able to make strategic decisions quickly balancing development speed with risk. We are looking for consistent progress towards long-term goals, and the ability to get comfortable with rapidly changing priorities. As our first full-time software engineer, you will have the chance work with the founding team to build our platform from scratch and grow a product/engineering team.


CURRENT PROJECTS:
API Integrations with other HR saas companies to develop additional sources of data, and to facilitate broader distribution of our product.


Enhanced Analytics/Data Visualization--Make predictive analytics easily understandable and actionable.


Mid-term Product Roadmap--Brainstorm ideas and incorporate customer feedback into new features to test with existing and potential customers

item.title: Software Engineer at Colony American Homes (Scottsdale, AZ)
item.description:
Job Summary


The primary purpose of this position is to developi and building web and mobile applications using some or all of the following technologies: JavaScript, Node.JS, Angular.JS, Python, PHP, Objective-C etc.


Essential Functions



  • Develop and direct software system testing and validation procedures, programming, and documentation

  • Write Code primarily using Javascript/NodeJS

  • Continuously design, develop and deploy backend services with focus on high availability, low latency and scalability

  • Measure and evaluate features and system metrics to continuously improve user experience and service performance

  • Work closely with Product Owners, Quality Assurance and other teams in an agile environment about software system design and maintenance.

  • Design, develop and modify software systems, using scientific analysis and mathematical models to predict and measure outcome and consequences of design.


Minimum Requirements



  • Bachelor's Degree

  • Experienced working in a Agile development environment

  • Proficient in Javascript or other programming languages.

  • Experienced in NodeJS and asynchronous programming

  • Experienced in Linux-Unix systems, particularly on AWS Extensive experience building applications with PostgresSQL

  • Skilled at processing and analyzing large data sets

  • Experience working with distributed and scalable systems and high-volume transaction applications

  • Good understanding of system design, data structures and algorithms

  • You’re literate in contemporary web API design such as REST, hypermedia, profiles, and relations.

  • Ability to write unit tests


Working Conditions



  • Office environment with no exposures.

  • Computer, keyboard, telephone, fax machine and copier

  • Occasional overtime.

item.title: Salesforce Developer / Administator at Pearl Capital Business Funding (New York, NY)
item.description:
We are seeking a talented full-time Salesforce developer / administrator to maintain and build out our current Salesforce instance. Aside from supporting our internal business processes, we have funded initiatives to build entire new applications to support our customers’ businesses.


As we are presently a small team, we are looking for ambitious self-starters who will help define and guide the company’s technological vision.


Responsibilities



  • Maintain our current Salesforce application, supporting our internal business users, including Sales, Underwriting, and Support

  • Use Salesforce best practices to design and build out solutions to fulfill business needs

  • Improve the existing application to meet Salesforce design standards

  • Build out new applications to support our customers and white-label initiatives

  • Work with back-end developers to integrate Salesforce data into other internal systems

item.title: iOS Engineer at VTS (New York, NY)
item.description:
https://twitter.com/BuildingVTS


http://building.vts.com/


https://www.vts.com/


As a VTS iOS engineer you’ll be working on all ends of our product, whether it be building out a new backend service to consume or polishing up a UITableView interface to match a mock. We’re always trying new technologies to fit the appropriate situation, and at VTS you'll definitely pick up a few skills you haven’t learned elsewhere.


We are looking for talented engineers who:


-Embrace solid software engineering and OO design practices


-Are passionate about writing clean, testable iOS code


-Are excited to work with & stay on top of the latest and greatest with Swift. We have embraced Swift fully since day one and the majority of our application is now written in it.


-Strong desire to learn and be a part of building the API’s (Ruby on Rails, Heroku, Sidekiq) the mobile apps consume


-Have a good sense for iOS UI/UX design


-Can take responsibility of & own their work through the entire development process


-Love collaborating in a team and occasionally pairing with other engineers

item.title: AWS Engineer at ActivTrak (Dallas, TX)
item.description:
Dallas-based startup www.activtrak.com has an opening for a AWS DevOps Engineer. ActivTrak is used by 70,000 businesees worldwide.   We have a great product, clients, and are building a team to help take things to the next level.


As an AWS DevOps Engineer, you will spend your day responsible for the continuous operation and maintenance of the companies web service infrastructure %100 hosted on the Amazon AWS Cloud. 


Benefits



  • Highly competitive salary

  • Equity options after qualifying period and vesting schedule.

  • Annual training budget

  • High-end choice of personal computer

  • Flexible working hours

item.title: Mid-Level Backend Developer at Onno Media Ltd (Bath, UK)
item.description:
Are you looking for a new role in a dynamic start-up environment where you have freedom of technology choices and play a major role in technical direction?


We are on the lookout for a predominantly (but not exclusively) backend focused developer with minimum 3 years experience for an exciting opportunity to lead two projects at our creative offices in the centre of Bath.


Project One


An existing project based on a Python/Django web application which has grown significantly over the past few years. It now needs a new technical strategy (including a possible rebuild) for the next 3-5 years and your role would be to formulate and execute the project.


Project Two


An exciting start-up venture involving blending prospect/customer data with Google Adwords & Analytics API data to build intelligent bid management systems and dashboards. Choice of technology yet to be decided.


Some of the things we currently have (but are not set-in-stone) ..



  • Python/Django

  • HTML/CSS/Bootstrap

  • Javascript/Jquery/Ajax

  • Amazon AWS


    • Linux EC2/Debian

    • PostgreSQL

    • Cloudwatch


  • GitHub



Some other things we enjoy here ..



  • Central Bath City Location

  • Office based inside shared space with 130 tech members

  • Hack events - http://www.bathhacked.org/

  • Cake on Wednesdays. Every week!

  • Desk beers on Friday. Every week!

  • Some flexibility on hours / location
